text:
My husband and I had our anniversary dinner here and it was amazing! The service from the time we walked in was incredible. They sat us immediately and the waiter was very prompt. The chef, Jeff, greeted us personally and even presented our dessert for us!
My husband had the chicken, which was flavorful and juicy. I had pasta with shrimp, which I recommend highly! We had the pear bruschetta appetizer and I would also highly recommend it!
It was a very enjoyable evening and plan to go back again!

Celebrated my wife‚Äôs birthday and she loved it!  Garlic bread is delicious. Smoked Manhattan is seductive.  Salads were perfect.  I had gnocchi for the first time and it was wonderful!  Salmon was superb.  Chocolate torte was very rich.  Service be Dani was attentive and great!   Great first visit.  We will be back!
Fresh and well seasoned! I like the aesthetic of the restaurant as well. It‚Äôs very cool and modern, also wasn‚Äôt crowded when I went on a Saturday. It is pricey, but worth trying.
Very beautiful atmosphere and impeccable service. We came on a busy Saturday night and were able to find seating at the bar. Delicious appetizers and cocktails
The entire staff was attentive and so friendly. I‚Äôve never experienced such outstanding customer service. Will definitely be returning!
Really enjoyed the food and the nice atmosphere.

The food is delicious. For appetizers you cannot go wrong with the calamari or the toasted ravioli. I get them every time. Every pasta dish I have had has been great - fettuccine, pasta with clams, salmon‚Ä¶ you name it. YUM. It‚Äôs also very affordable - and free bread! Haha. I‚Äôm glad I live close. The area is so cute.

My hubby surprised me with a little "staycation" getaway for my birthday. We spent the night at an Airbnb in Parkville, MO & we were so surprised to learn that the little Italian place on the corner called Frank's served breakfast! We were intrigued, so we gave it a shot. It was delicious. I had the Chicken Alfredo Omelette, my husband had the Tuscany Frittata, and we split a side of French toast. It is a charming little restaurant. Friendly staff, and a lovely atmosphere. We will definitely be back! I'm excited to try it for dinner as well!

Frank's of Parkville is thr best Brunch and Mimosa destination, in North Kansas City. Wide variety menu, including eggs Benedict,  French toast, breakfast sandwich and more. With options to sit cozy and cool on the inside, or enjoy the beautiful scenery unfolding outside, on their patio deck. EXCELLENT service, GREAT food, AFFORDABLE- Open on the weekends, brunch until noon.
This is by far my favorite Italian restaurant ever. Great service, kind people, fast, delicious, reasonably priced, all around a great experience.

I had a really great experience here. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our waitress was very attentive but not overwhelmingly so. Food was delicious! Really cute and tiny, perfect atmosphere. It‚Äôs casual for Italian, but I enjoyed the local feel.

We just tried Frank's for the first time and it won't be our last.  The calimari was fresh, tender and cooked to perfection.  Our entrees were hot, delicious and served with a loaf of hot bread and a lovely dinner salad.  The customer service was remarkable.  Frank's is a real throwback to restaurants back before corporations started mass producing factory prepped food.  A real treat!!
Nice Lil Italian restaurant .Good portion size,good food! Suggest you eat outside on their patio and watch Parkville stroll by. Nice and relaxing.
This is a hidden gem in Parkville! The food was amazing. Everything is freshly made, and the flavors were amazing.  The Calamari was a great appetizer to start with.
Great outside seating had some sangrias before a nice walk in english landing park.  Great place to sit outside and have some drinks and watch some people
The Italian Steak looks really good. Tilapia was good. Pasta with the dish was awesome. Chicken Spedini was the best. Risotto was different
The Coffee is good and the Cannolis are amazing.
Really loved the food and the serviceüôÇ‚ú®üíñ
The food was good.  The inside and finishings are outdated. My toast arrived 10 minutes before my breakfast did. Weird.
Great breakfast. Frank's bowl is where it's at!
Small Town vibe, great food, nice views and super quick!
Great Italian restaurant!  I recommend the chicken cacciotore!
Love that spicy shrimp pasta
Great location, great breakfast...

Best EVER garlic bread!!!!  Literally made my day! Ha! That pesto garlic dipping sauce was divine with that perfectly cooked bread. I got a yummy delicious HUGE plate of bowtie chicken, enough for lunch tomorrow as well. One son got Sicilian pizza, good (not really spicy as listed) but also plenty for leftovers. Other son got lasagna, also good and husband got a beef pasta.... deburgo, very spicy, perfect for his taste. Nice that the calamari came with both warm marinara and cool lemon aioli, as my family was split on preference, but stealing garlic bread almost resulted in a fork in the hand! Only disappointment was that sweet tea came as tea with sugar packets, which any tea lover knows doesn't dissolve well when tea is cold and... my husband was asked if he wanted parmesan cheese and pepper on his meal but when server came back she said that the parmesan "hadn't been taken out yet," asking if just black pepper was okay? What? An odd comment...as if he wasn't worthy of getting the cheese out after he was asked. Otherwise, we were overall pleased with our experience.

1st visit. Food was great - hot and fresh. Prices very reasonable. Environment and atmosphere was family oriented and tables spacious. Ample parking. Service was so-so with water glasses not kept filled (minus one star).

Came with a group of 12 for an early holiday celebration. They were ready for our reservation.  A lovely bunch with lots of questions and demands.  Polite and professional servers.  Great food. Great service.
Amazing eggs Benedict with crab cakes! Ask for a side of sriracha cream sauce for the potatoes. üî•üî•üî•
The food was delicious, sauces perfect and our waitress was a delight.

The food was good and there restaurant did a good job with social distancing. I was only just a little disheartened that our waiter only stopped at the table 3 times; take our order quick stop just as our food was brought out then again to give us the bill. She never checked on our drinks or asked if everything tasted ok.

She was friendly and we still tipped over 25% but  considering the reduced capacity of the restaurant I would have thought she could have been a little more attentive.
Excellent food and service.  All the servers were very knowledgeable and friendly. I had the lunch combo plate of Lasagne and Spinach Salad then Italian Cream for dessert

We went for a brunch date and really enjoyed our experience.  We ordered the brunch board for two and added brunch potatoes and ham. The food was great,  service was great.  Only thing was they suggested making a reservation next time because it can get busy. We will definitely go back!!

I had the wheat pasta, feta, basil, pesto, and added salmon. It was delicious but was swimming in oil. My sweetheart had the big steak, it was cooked right, Med Rare, but wasn't hot. Still enjoyed our evening and would return.

Paulo and Bill is a fantastic restaurant! My boyfriend and I made eating here our anniversary dinner tradition several years ago, and it does not disappoint. The bow tie pasta is incredible, and the chicken alfredo pasta is great, too. I've never had food here I didn't like. However, the real star of the show is the phyllo brownie - you just can't come here without getting one!! You can come to Paulo and Bill dressed up for a special occasion, and students sometimes come in dressed up for proms or homecoming, and yet if you are wearing a t-shirt and jeans, you won't feel too out of place, either. It's versatile and the perfect restaurant for any occasion. Great food, great service. Thanks, Paulo and Bill!
Lasagna and chicken salad with triple layer chocolate cake. Good food, great service and ambience!
Good food a little on the higher end than I'm used too. I had a Trio sampler with Beef Chicken and Swordfish. It was all really good.
A great place to sit down and have coffee and dessert. Peter was an excellent server and made sure we were taken care of. If you order the chocolate cake prepare yourself, it is enormous!
Best place in town.   Best food, best service, freshest fish, best drinks and wine service, it's crazy good!

Great care of customers. Wine, cocktails and great Dinner Specials...
Genuinely want to make your visit pleasurable...

PUMP is a great place to have brunch. I came here for my birthday and absolutely loved it the second I walked in. I heard about this place when I went to Vegas. They have a pump in Vegas at the Caesars Palace, and I fell in love with that place, so I was excited to hear that there was one closer in West Hollywood. When you first walk in, it‚Äôs like you‚Äôre entering a secret garden. We were seated right away in their beautiful outside area. I highly recommend eating outside to get the whole experience; instead of eating inside, it literally felt like you‚Äôre eating in a garden. Our waiter was super nice, super friendly, and was efficient. My husband and I ordered drinks and appetizers. Then we ordered our food, and everything was delicious and yummy. It was a really great romantic experience. The only thing that could‚Äôve been better was their dessert menu. Also, I was confused about the parking situation. We didn‚Äôt see a valet or a parking lot. We found street meter parking across the street. With this, make sure to give yourself enough time to find parking and to make your reservation.

This place is so edgy and fun. The outdoor patio area was beautiful and so aesthetically pleasing. We went there for dinner.  Had appetizers and drinks then ended our night with the most delicious chocolate cake.

The service was great - they definitely have a great staff. The hostess was a bit standoffish but the server and busser were attentive and nice.
$12 well drinks are normal but still slightly overpriced.
The chicken was much too dry and the lettuce not as thinly chopped for delicate fork portions. Also, a bit over salted.
Still, great ambiance and the 4 stars are for the service.
Offer maybe grilled salmon or a nice summer salad with cherry tomatoes and raspberry vinaigrette. That would be so nice especially during summer to have an arugula/romaine summer salad.

Amazing, fun restaurant in the heart of Weho bars. Very good drinks and the food tastes so good. They offer happy hour from 5-7 daily on their cocktails and appetizers. I only went once and just had the drinks and appetizers before hitting the bars. I recommend getting the sliders, tuna tartare and the shrimp tempura!

My cousin invited me to this place for my bday and I have to say it's a chill place the vide and everything was amazing. The food was so delicious I will come on another event here. Service was good they're very attentive.

Ambience is 10/10 but the food and drinks are extremely overpriced and small portioned. I‚Äôve been twice - once for brunch and once for dinner and had the same experience both times. I expected dinner to maybe have bigger portions. I‚Äôd come here for drinks and to take a peak in the garden. I really love the garden but I don‚Äôt think the food is worth coming for. I‚Äôm a Vanderpump rules super fan so that‚Äôs why I came but now that I‚Äôve been twice I can say I tried. There‚Äôs so many other places I‚Äôve had way better experiences at in LA so it‚Äôs hard for me to want to return here, especially because it‚Äôs so experience. It‚Äôs more of a tourist attraction now which is sad because it‚Äôs such a gorgeous restaurant.

The location is great, the restaurant is elegant; I loved the design, the trees, the lights, the music...
The food was very good and the staff very nice.
Will go back!

Trendy restaurant that‚Äôs part of the Vanderbilt empire. Come here for the pretty decor and to say that you‚Äôve been here. The food is mediocre, but the photo ops are plentiful. Wear something cute!

Metered street parking (2 hour limit). It‚Äôll be tough to find any free parking close to the restaurant (it‚Äôs right in the heart of WeHo). Credit cards accepted. Reservations available and there‚Äôs a 90 min limit for the dining experience. Gender neutral restrooms. Outdoor dining available.

Food-wise, everything is overpriced for what it is. The burrata appetizer came with 4 slices of toast and tomatoes, but only a small portion of burrata. I got the lox benedict, which came with four small potatoes, but a surprisingly good amount of salad. The avocado toast was a bit soggy, but it‚Äôs a good vegetarian option. We didn‚Äôt do drinks because we were recovering from the night before, but note that the sparkling water is ~$12. Service was nice but slow. In short, it‚Äôs a popular tourist spot where you can take fun photos and try to see if you‚Äôll spot anyone vaguely famous, but don‚Äôt come here expecting particularly good food.

Okay wooooow! I was not expecting this to be what it was. Well, food wise anyhow I was pleasantly surprised. Anything on the West Hollywood strip, I‚Äôm expecting to be a tacky, but in the spirit of location, a super fun experience. It is decked out, very Hollywood. I don‚Äôt watch whatever show they have, but for those who do and are coming for a visit, I say hit this place. The folks I sat next too at the bar were super excited to be there. In short, good food, drinkable drinks, and beautiful atmosphere.
I‚Äôve only been here once and sat at the bar, so I cannot speak to the full dining experience, but the bar was very mediocre, they have the look but not the talent which made it disappear (or maybe just not the resources to make good drinks). If I ever return I‚Äôm drinkin wine. Full menu is available at the bar, it is open seating. Prices are a little high, but your paying for location so forget about it.

THE FOOD: nothing salty, some items may need salt. Low on the crazy flavor scale. Pretty presentation.

Fish and Chips: for the win! Fish was lightly seasoned, cooked to perfection, and the fries were goody good good. Appreciate and liked the tarter sauce and malt!

Burger: basic and boring, but the fries again, good good.

Popcorn Shrimp: for the win!

Potato Salad: 100% a joke. I the chef made this so be funny. Like, just to see who would eat it or return it. We returned it. They didn‚Äôt remove it from our bill‚Ä¶speaks volumes.

The wife just had to eat at Pump. She's been a longtime fan. But getting to meet Lisa was more than we expected. It was a cherry on top of the amazing food and drinks. The prices weren't outrageous like you might think. And again, the food was amazing. I would go again just for the food.
Absolutely delightful setting that feels upscale but also laid back and casual. Garden is so nice and food is delicious

We were expecting Cali portions... and we're happily surprised that we wernt going to leave starving! The service was amazing (we had Adam), the ambiance was superb, and the food was actually top notch. Definitely check it out if you are in the area!
What an amazing experience so far. The food is amazing, the staff super cool (Ben was super) and the restaurant is very cozy. Love it.
Wonderful atmosphere. Cozy. I imagine it looks amazing St night. Lots of trees and shade for brunch or early dinner.  Lots of wonderful evenig lighting. Ask for Nick amazing waiter.
Really cute spot...food was good, drinks were great and customer service was excellent .
Great service. Nice place for a date night. The pasta was beyond my expectations.

Came here for brunch. I love the drinks! They‚Äôre delicious! The food is alright. Not memorable. It‚Äôs a beautiful restaurant & I‚Äôm lisa vanderpump fan :) overall, it‚Äôs a great restaurant to visit in West Hollywood
Gorgeous space. Attentive service. Great food.
Loud sounds and a bit mediocre food combined with high prices. On the plus side: Lisa Vanderpump was there

We absolutely loved it! I was really surprised about the quality of the foods. I thought it might be mediocre because they probably don't have to worry about getting guests because of the TV show. The food was outstanding and I'm super high maintenance about quality! We came for the happy hour and got 4 different appetizers. Best fries I have ever had with a great dip. The wontons had quite a bit raw tuna and they were also paying attention to the presentation. The taste was really divine and rounded with balsamic reduction, pomegranate and avocado. The shrimp was garnished with mango. They had quite a few people who were serving so you didn't have to wait and they were super friendly,   and everyone was quite attractive.

The only 2 things that could be improved are: 1. They only serve happy hour items in the garden, on 2 tables and then those tables didn't have a server (but one guy was willing to serve us). 2. It was my birthday and when I got the reservation it asked for occasion and I wrote birthday and I kinda thought someone would at least say "Happy Birthday" to me. It's ok, but it just would have been nice.

I absolutely LOVED the dining experience, decor & atmosphere of PUMP! Went on a whim with some friends and got a table right away. The server was fantastic. I adored the smell of the entire restaurant. The bar and entrance had a wonderful floral scent! The shrimp appetizer & chicken main dish I had was delicious! The background music and look of the restaurant was amazing! Highly recommend this place to anyone in the area.

Pump is an excellent restaurant!  My friends and I had our mini Christmas party and we had a great time!  We made reservations a month early, so when we got there, we were seated right away.  The restaurant is really pretty and the decorations are beautiful too! I personally had the shrimp and lobster salad!  O M G!  The best shrimp and lobster salad that I‚Äôve ever had!!! I will definitely go back many times for that amazing salad!!!! ‚ô•Ô∏è

Another great private party/event my company and other vendors throw for our clients involved in Property Management. We rent out the front bar area. This was our 3rd event we held! AMAZING each time! The staff is outstanding and customer service is on point! Chase assisted us with the event and our kick ass bartenders Kyle & Kevin were the best and made the best cocktails, which allowed our clients to unwind and have a great Happy Hour after a long day of work! We‚Äôll be back for another event and we can‚Äôt wait!
Thank you Pump! I highly recommend anyone to host your event at Pump! It‚Äôs classy, impressive and a great place to meet people, network and just unwind. üçæü•Ç

I expect much more from such a venue. The decor is gorgeous. Service is less then desirable. I actually think they are racist towards us as being Middle Eastern and not WASPs. Got attitude from every member of the staff except the bartender. Food was okay but any penny more then the happy hour price would be extortion for the offerings. Bad service, and not to mention found a giant cockroach run across my foot. I realize its hot and outside as the manager was too insistent to mention but still this is a 5 stat restaurant. Get it together Vanderpump.

Loved this place, food is delicious and service is great. Drinks were a little bit too strong though. We had reservations and we were little more than 30 minutes late, when we arrived they took us in and we were seated right away so we didn't had to wait at all. Restrooms need a little more attention,  they were dirty and stinky no ac no air circulating in there so it was kind off stuffy in there.
Great experience and drinks. Okay food but nothing amazing. That being said, I highly recommend it for the weekend. The best was rock shrimp tempura - so good. Fantastic Sunday funday location
This restaurant was great and our server, Logan, was amazing. I had the skirt steak with the potato salad and asparagus. I highly recommend. The atmosphere was wonderful.

Beautiful ambience and spectacular attention to detail.  Fresh rose petals on the table, glass ornaments hang from the trees, create a sort if decadent yet whimsical feel. I especially love that each table has it's own intimacy in its own space. Food was superb. I was surprised actually, expecting the cuisine to be lacking in full flavor as it does with most restaurants that primarily cater to a predominantly caucasian palette. Being latin myself loving full bodied cuisine, I was blown away with presentation and quality of the individual items on the plate. And say enough how potent the flavor was. Amazing experience.

Giving 5 stars only because our bartender Kevin was the best! He was polite and curteous. Very attentive to our needs and made the whole experience that much better.  It was our first time here.  Manager on duty some blond guy was not very polite or even once smiled. We wanted to order the filet mignon but couldn't do it because it was a dinner item and it was 4 o'clock. He came by to tell us we had to wait until 5pm but wasn't very friendly he just told us and walked away. Besides that, the food was really good. I order the mimosa pitcher which was a very good deal and added some remy martin to it to give it that extra kick. Had a very nice time here. Will try to come back soon.

My cousin flew into town to visit me. One of her bucket list items was to eat at this restaurant. So she made the reservation and my first impression was disastrous. The greeter at the door was so condescending and talked to me as if I was a homeless person off the street or poor black trash. I moved forward and was seated trying to pull my emotions together for my cousins sake. However, the thought of someone talking down to me enraged me and I completely lost it. I stud up and confronted both the greeter and management regarding my degrading greeting experience. I STRONGLY SUGGEST ALL AFRICAN AMERICANS AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST. Horrible horrible horrible experience as a black woman.
Valet wasn't available and they made my wife stand out in the cold until I found a carparking space. Other than that food and service was good.
This is my place for Sunday brunch. Chic, good food and excellent service. And Lisa Vanderpump does pop in so keep your eyes peeled if you're a fan.

The outer garden and bar decor was beautiful. I stopped there for drinks. I thought about order food, but the service was very slow for an uncrowded place. After seeing the unclean restrooms, I really did not wish to order anything else. I finished my drink and left to go elsewhere. Very disappointed.
I love the ambiance, the experience was lovely, our waiter was nice and attentive. The mimosas i ordered were so good. We got the chicken and waffle so delicious.
Beautiful setting. Great menu, delicious food and friendly fun staff!
Good services and lovely drink. I enjoy food and places.
Food was delicious, very expensive, decor amazing. Servers were friendly

My better half wanted to eat at LVP‚Äôs restaurant so we ate here last weekend. This burger is to die for. Absolutely the best burger I‚Äôve had in years. Honestly don‚Äôt know if I will try other menu options because it was so mouthwatering delicious! Definitely eating here again!!

We ordered tomatoes and burrata for an appetizer which was really good. I had the salmon scramble and my friend had the smoked salmon Benedict ( talk about food envy). The outdoor seating is beautiful but I believe you need a reservation.  The service was decent.
Omg the service was great and the environment was super Chic! I would definitely suggest this place for a business meeting or a go to if you want to impress your friends or lover!!!!!

Loved going here! Took my fiance here before our concert at the Hollywood Bowl and it was great. Amazing food and awesome atmosphere. The staff was great as well, very attentive and fun. We'll be back and will be definitely trying out other LVP restaurants.

Went here for a 3rd, 4th, & now a 5th time and each encounter seems to be better than the last. The servers are lovely presentations and complement the atmospheric beauty that the decor of Pump offers! The food comes out within excellent timing, is art to the eyes, and tastes just as good as the "vibes" you feel just from being there.

Note: If you're getting food at a sit-down table please get seated and wait for your server, don't go to the bar for beverages. I was a server once upon a time and this to me is dining etiquette 101.

Overall, I love this place and as a new "local" to the area, I would one day love to meet the owners to thank them for the experience and for creating a place for memories to be made.

Best,

Cory!

- I shot the photos on my anniversary dinner a week ago. Enjoy!!
Great venue for drinks and dinner. Food was good and better than expected. Cocktails were great. Service was average, our waiter lacked any personality

Interesting..... Lobster & Asparagus Fiori has NO ASPARAGUS or Fiori pasta in it ü¶û!! This is my third time eating at Pump and it seems every time I order the same dish I get something different. I don't like onions and I don't ever remember picking out onions out of my food except for this third time. Although, this time I got a lot more lobster than I've ever had before so maybe they are making up for no asparagus.....hahahaaa!
My guest really enjoyed the pan seared Pacific soul. üêü
Great atmosphere,  food, and service were outstanding

I ordered the Mykonos Salad with grilled chicken tossed in the signature citrus lemon vinaigrette üî•üî•üî•üî•
I was in love from the first bite!
Its loaded with sweet cherry tomatoes, red onions, crunchy cucumbers feta cheese, and garnished with fresh avocado!
You really have to try it!

Such such a cute setting! The food is sooooo delicious. Portions are just right. The service is immaculate. Ben was our waiter and he was so charming and charismatic. You might end up bumping into Lisa vanderpump herself üòä

It Was Amazing! The location is Magical:
the background music, white tablecloth, fresh roses, candles and lights made the atmosfere unique and perfect for our celebration! Very friendly and professional staff help us to fulfill every single wish! The food was simple delicious!!

Thank you so much!

Yevgeniya

This place is a must visit if you are in West Hollywood! The service is awesome, the servers are great and the ambiance is my favorite! It is like hanging out in the enchanted garden or something! My new fiance and I went in after I proposed to her at the sister restaurant Sur just down the block and the management bought us a bottle of champagne to celebrate because they were so excited for us! My fiance and love to visit this place anytime we are in the area, it is our favorite, they make us feel like we are right where we should be. The cocktails are amazing and the appetizers are #1 but the service exceeds all! Please visit if you are near Hollywood! It's a must, as is anything Lisa Vanderpump touches!

What a beautiful space! It truly is oh so sexy..... Definitely suggest getting a pitcher and really settling in for brunch. The atmosphere is so fun and energetic, our server was on point, and the food was well executed. Definitely a place to bring friends and out-of-towners for a fun brunch!

Food and atmosphere was excellent. I think it's reservations only and there is valet parking which was amazing.  Most of the dinning area is outside surrounded by gorgeous old trees. I ordered a pan seared tuna salad. üòã soooo good!! When I come back to LA I will eat here again.

Oh my gosh! Big Vanderpump Rules and LVP fans and went on a girls trip to visit all the restaurants! They were all beautiful but we went to brunch at pump and it takes the cake!!!!! Unbelievable ambience and decor. The place is absolutely stunning. The food was delicious and the drinks  by the pitcher... not only affordable but AMAXINF üòõüòõüòõ
Loved the people and the service was awesome.  Food was great also.

The cocktails were good and the setting is lovely. The outdoor seating was comically dark. We couldn‚Äôt see much but things tasted fine. Very middle of the road ‚Äî not bad, not good ‚Äî just not memorable.
I sat at a table in the garden- the waiter was super attentive & drinks were good.

Please take the  Jidori chicken off your restaurant‚Äôs menus.  The conditions these animals endure are horrific and your restaurant is well aware and ignores these conditions and the suffering involved.

The food was delicious, the dessert not so much.
Service was great and I loved the vibe of the restaurant.
What an experience from the ambiance to the service and great food. I've been to Vanderpump in Las Vegas and both are unique in its own way and amazing drinks üç∏

OK.  I went here since my wife is a fan of RHOBH and Vanderpump Rules

Was pretty dead on a weeknight post-pride, so had my pick of a seat.  Went to the bar and had a couple of drinks .. They weren't bad, honestly better than I thought they would be, and the bartender was fun to speak with.

Got the better half a tee shirt, which was $40 but not surprising given the location and the celebrity.

I wouldn't have gone if not for my wife's fandom, but glad I did.  A fun experience.
This place is absolutely solid. From the exceptional ravioli, to a professional solid staff, amazing Rose and the trees... Must see in West Hollywood. Highly recommend.
Great service good food. A bit pricey, but good. The space is cramped but nice atmosphere.
Stunning Design.  Great Atmosphere. Fantastic food and drinks. Reasonable peices. I loved it.
Absolutely beautiful atmosphere with delicious food and great cocktails. Can't wait to back for the friendly staff too.
Max was our waiter. He was wonderful. Very attentive and friendly. The bar area was more quiet then I expected and you saw some "stars" Tom S, James K, and Billie
The seating options here are great. So many fun little corners to explore. Very friendly staff and great apps. Perfect spot for a girls night out or happy hour! And the Pumptini is fantastic!
Food was really good but the lady that was seating people had an attitude and they mixed up reservations.
Nice decor and loved the patio area, the restroom however did not meet the same standard. The drinks were good and the server was nice.

One of the most beautiful and romantic restaurants in L.A. You are transported to Italy in an instant. The staff are wonderful, handsome and attentive. The menu is not large but creative. Pump is a must.

The vibe here is amazing! Perfect background music, the vibe was perfect for anyone who is looking for a relaxed afternoon, the temperature was comfortable, cocktails by the pitcher were amazing, the food was exceptional, and the servers were outstanding!
Pump was cool. We stopped here while doing our tour of the Vanderpump restaurants. They had lots of outdoor fire pits and cool scenery

Dissapointed.. starters Was good.. main.. not at all..

The parmesan was like eating a rubber band. And was unchewable. Bolognaise was so Borring.. and the beef in the burger overcooked.

Im sad to be making this review .. Maybe we were unlucky.. but the entres was not good..

Server was rude .. and Said i dont know Where your from but this is parmesan in America.. sorry sir.. ive har amazing parmesan.. Just the other night.. Also in the us.. and im Pretty sure...good parmesan can be found Worldwide
Amazing atmosphere, it's a very pretty place. Great steaks, and great drinks.
Awesome ambience! Love all of the trees! Bar and drinks were great. I didn't have a chance to try the food though.
Very pretty. Good service and drinks.
Love Pumps happy hour! Such a great deal and such a BEAUTIFUL place!
Our local go-to for an elegant and tasty dining experience.
Beautiful restaurant, great cocktails, and friendly staff.

Best bar in the area

Staff is nice and service is good

Whatever your orientation definently recommend

Lisa did a great job with pump
Worst food i ever! No Words for god bad the service was, the waiter was so rude! Only the decorations and food was amazing.
LA and PUMP restaurant made me feel so in an episode O The real housewifes of Beverly Hills they got Hooch and we got a free cocktail üíúüíúüíúüíú
Oke bar, Just had some drinks. Uncomfortable terrace furniture, Staff should clean tablets.
Whenever I'm in West Hollywood I make sure to dine at Pump!
Beautiful atmosphere! Brunch pitchers were a great deal and oh so good!
Ive been coming here for years. Love this place! And I got engaged here tonight!

This place is so cute! Came on a Saturday night at 915pm. We had to wait a little bit because we showed up just after our reservation but getting a drink at the bar was no problem. We sat down on the covered patio and ordered a variety of entrees and appetizers from the kitchen, all of which were amazing! Only downside is that the tables are very close together so we definitely bumped into the table next to us when trying to get out and back in again. That night we got a special treat of seeing Lisa Vanderpump, Ken and their pups as they stopped by. Lisa was kind enough to agree to take a picture with us outside. We spotted Tom Sandoval that night too. Had so much fun visiting!

I come to LA for the Vanderpump experience.  I visit all of her restaurants, TomTom, SUR, and of course PUMP.   PUMP is by far, my favorite, though they are all great.   It's the ambiance of the large olive trees and lighting designed by Lisa herself.   It's the music which is at just the right level so you can have a great connection with everyone you are with, and even make a new friend.  The food never disappoints.  It's also the staff.  We had exceptional service from servers and server assistants, but the one person, other than getting to see and chat with LVP herself, that makes this special for me is Logan, who is a server here.   He's warm and genuine.  You feel like you have known him forever.   He makes me feel like special VIP, and then I look around and he is treating everyone this way!  Now I might be slightly jealous of this ;) but he is just that amazing and is an all around good guy.    He is not just my Server, but I consider him my friend.  I always ask for his section when I visit if possible.    Go enjoy the PUMP experience, and I hope you get to see Lisa and Logan and enjoy the fabulous atmosphere and food.   Lisa and Logan, you are both stars!   I'll see you soon!  Thank you!
Great service and warm hospitality went for birthday dinner and enjoyedüòçüòç
Beautiful bar with open garden. Great drinks and overall atmosphere
The food was good and I was able to take a picture with Peter and Scheana
Really cool place, great service, food and drinks too.
This Restaurant has impeccable design, food was very delicious,. Atmosphere.......
Always a pleasure. Very elegant but relaxed atmosphere

The atmosphere was magical and the food was amazing.  Fish and chips outstanding.  Thank you for a wonderful evening.  I am here from Florida visiting my daughter and her partner.  I just had to bring them to a place I see on t.v. (vanderpump rules).
Ordered the lightly breaded chicken and it was really good. Reminded me of chicken schnitzel.
Beautiful restaurant, drove 70 miles for a 30 year anniversary dinner.  Excellent service, delicious dinner & the romantic atmosphere was a perfect backdrop to share with my beautiful Sweetheart üåπ
Vince is the Best, the food was awesome!
We had a waiter named Sky!  Who was so friendly and awesome!
Lovely food,  very reasonably priced. Just needs some new silk flowers and a bit of a dust for the whole 5 stars. Gorgeous potato salad Lisa!
Kind of cool spot. Champagne is good!
Great restaurant, very high class, great location for dates.
Excellent service and food. Nice interior.
Another 'must do' place to visit for cocktails in Beverly Hills

This is my favorite place to help with my ADD... can always just pop in get food hear great music get a great drink from Nate without dealing with reservations. The place is stunning inside such an enchanting place and great for peopl√© watching.
Had a great time! Love the way it looks.. Nice atmosphere!
Beautiful atmosphere if you're in WEHO stop in!
Loved it. Food and service amazing!!!
How can you not love Pump? I wish I could go everyday. The service is excellent, the food is amazing. Can't wait to go back!
Loved it üíú
I love the ambience of The Pump.  You feel like you are outside when really you are inside.  The food is delicious--my favorite is the seared Ahi.  Five pumps for The Pump.
Mango shrimp tempura was fantastic as usual, the cocktail didn't hurt any either!üíÉüèºüç∏
Where is Lisa?  Food was great, as are the martinis
Very cute setting and vibe. The food was amazing. Perfect spot for a cute brunch in LA.
Great service and food!
Amazing atmosphere! Beautiful people...
Food was delicious!!
Lovely outside garden courtyard with nice drinks and a decent happy hour.
The food was on the money
Always a great time at Pump
Delicious food
Loved it!
TOTALLY  GREAT 100+
I ordered a gorgeous chicken with Lisa‚Äôs potatoesallad.  Lovely meal and beautiful surroundings.  Loved it!!

A beautiful homey sit down restaurant. A true family ran establishment. The foods pretty good too. Starting off this place has two different salsas options, that‚Äôs a huge quality change. You can get mild or hot, most places only have a singular option. Service was golden, waitress was timely, attentive and efficient.
I have been going to this restaurant for my whole life. The family is amazing and the food is constantly the best American Mexican around. Best hand pinned tacos in town!!!

The waitstaff is amazing!! Angela is fantastic! And I'll admit the hand pinched taco was tasty! (Beef with parm)  The house frozen margarita was incredibly sweet. Which I like, but the alcohol is very light. And from here on out, just NO.

The waitstaff and busser is the only reason they got 2 stars!

Do not walk, run!  The salsa was interesting. It was okay and had carrot bits in it. Odd, but I like to try new things. I got the spinach dip. The large. The most disgusting dip I've ever had. It tastes like the cheese was the cheapest they could find and I couldn't tell if the spinach was from a can or a cheap frozen brick. Other than that it was beyond bland. There was an odd taste I've had before but I couldn't even eat 1/8 without the margarita. (And sadly I will gorge on cheese dip.) So, no to the salsa, no to the spinach cheese dip, and the chips are eh. The frozen margarita, was really weak, definitely not worth $6, but sweet if that's how you like it. I do. üòä The pinched taco... okay, I really enjoyed that! The waitstaff - someone needs to poach them!!! This place doesn't deserve them.

Edit:
The frozen margarita,  I still stand by that it is sweet, but I have more of a buzz than I realized. So the alcohol's just kind of hidden.  I will say I would indulge in another frozen Margarita here.

The "busser" I referred to, come to find out, is the manager. Not expected, but he was a hard worker, great personality, friendly, and very welcoming.

I will admit, he said several people commented on the dip saying it tasted weird and took it off no issues or real questions.

I personally don't plan on coming back. But if they were slow and I was bored and wanted to chat with the staff, I would eat a taco and have a margarita. If you live close by, and love to support Mom and Pop places as I do, I say give it a try and leave your experience on here. Maybe I just caught them on a really off day. Or maybe I'm a little spoiled. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Arrived for an early dinner and had hot fresh chips right out of the fryer with white queso and when they say large they mean large. Ordered the tacos and they did not disappoint, sometimes considered puffy tacos. These were deep-fried shells with your choice of cheese shredded cheddar or parmesan or both if you like.

Amazing food. Amazing service. This is my new breakfast spot. Chips and hot sauce before breakfast get me going for the day. And Larry is one of the nicest people ever. He's has such a great spirit. You can't go wrong eating the food here.

I haven't eaten here in over 20 years. But I grew up in the northland & decided to get some take out tonight for the nostalgia. I just picked it up 10 minutes ago & look at it! Have you ever seen a more disgusting box of food? Burnt beans, burnt rice & stadium nacho cheese? That's supposed to be a burrito, an enchilada, a tostada, beans & rice. Online ordering was fine, staff was nice at pickup, but the food is completely inedible. I'm not the type to go back & ask for a refund, but I will never go anywhere near this place ever again. I honestly can't believe they would serve this to people.

Great food and extremely friendly staff.

This place is a Northland treasure that has been around for as long as I can remember.
There is a reason the locals still love it and love going there.

I didn't hate it, I just felt bad.  It's unfair to compare to Arizona's Mexican food authenticity. At least offer carne asada and corona and don't use nacho cheese to top off  flautas. One more thing,  use sour cream and guacamole as toppings.
Love the decor brings me back to my childhood, late 70s early 80s friendly staff good food reasonable price for the amount,
small family restaurant. delicious food. great service. love it.

My family has been going here for 40 years!  Wonderful little hole in the wall Mexican restaurant. Building is very simple but the food is spectacular!   Their crunchy tacos and burritos with Mexican spread is a must try!  They also have the best fried ice cream in town!  Give this place a shot!
Super busy on Tuesday love the servers great tacos enchiladas burritos drinks etc
Larry, we missed you! Had a nice early dinner, and I'll catch you next time.
It was OK but I found  A tooth pick in my flautas
Great service and great food!
It's a nostalgia place for me my son and I go here I used to go here when I was his age 40 years ago
Best Mexican food in KC
You must try!! Simply amazing

Excellent food and service! The portions are large. The food was hot and fresh! Free chips, salsa, and cheese dip made it an easy wait for our food. We will definitely go back to try other items on the menu!

First impression...The host at the door that seated us was rude. The girl that brought our salsa and chips was also unpleasant. The food was ok however I think the menu is misleading. Tacos say it comes with guacamole but when asked was told it was an extra charge. My husband and daughter thought the shrimp tasted like Walmart brand frozen from a bag. The espinaca and salsa were a bit bland. We did enjoy the 5.99 margaritas.

Walked right in and was seated right away. They immediately brought us out chips, salsa and queso. The queso was great and the salsa had a different texture but was good. It‚Äôs rare to find places that start you off with free queso. They honestly have the best horchata I‚Äôve had. The food had great flavor and the portions were perfect. The rice was a little dry for my liking, but I typically never eat the rice anyways. Service was great and they had refills ready to go. The pricing was around $10-12 per person, which was well worth it.

Plenty of parking and located right behind Kelly‚Äôs, next to the car wash.
Great people, good prices. We had a large group they handled us well. Chips, sala and queso are great. Rice and beans are ok. Looking forward to returning.

We loved this out of the way Mexican restaurant. It's worth a trip to Basehor, Kansas. In fact, it is why we came! We had been told it was a family owned restaurant with lots of regional specialities we wouldn't find elsewhere, and that was exactly right! I had the Shrimp Romero and my husband had the Presidente combo, which he couldn't finish, it was so generous. The salsas for the chips seemed homemade. The creamy green salsa was especially good. We will definitely make the 40-minute trip again!

Serving size is large. I like large servings. Fills me up. Taste is good but not amazing but definitely fills me up. The cost doesn't require a full wallet which is good since the amount of food does fill you up. Overall, it is quite filling.
One OF THE BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANTS WE BEEN TOO. GREAT HELPüê†ü•≥üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüö£‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§†
Terrific food and service, and really lovely saddles on display
Great food and very good service. Will be back.
This spot had great service and good food . The prices and good as well. This is a nice spot.
Food was suberb and service was amazing. I've never had a stuffed, deep fried, whole avocado!
Great food very friendly service. Clean place
Great food, with lots of choices, friendly staff and darn good drinks!!
I looooove their stuffed avocados. üòç
The absolute best I've ever had! Very authentic Mexican food and fantastic service! Large portions and great, affordable prices.
I've eaten here twice now both times they were fast and delicious..

The service was outstanding! Very attentive server, the food was good, the restaurant is small but I'm certain it's absolutely a wonderful place in the summer. We will definitely return when we can sit outside. The fact that it's a byob makes it super affordable.  But be advised,  it's cash only.

Our server was attentive and an absolute sweetheart. Food was absolutely delicious. I got the Best of the Wurst platter and they were all delicious. My favorites were the Kielbasa, old world, and Bratwurst. The pierogis were the best I‚Äôve had in a very long time, absolutely outstanding. The pretzel appetizer was delicious and made to order.

I am somewhat of a snob when it comes to German food.  Spending a lot of time over there, I have had some wonderful experiences, and have struggled to find food made the right way.  This place nailed it.  Everything is perfect, from the Schnitzel to the Wursts to the spaetzle.  The sauerkraut, and the kartoffelsalat were wonderful as well.  At first glance the menu is pricey but well worth it once you receive your meal. I think the Jaeger Schnitzel sandwich is an absolute winner.  They do good job with Polish food as wel--the pierogies, and the stuffed cabbage were wonderful.  This place is an absolute hidden treasure with a lovely river view.

Awesome! Dined on the deck beside the Rancocas Creek, but it was all about the food! My son's(18 & 21) and I started with pierogi and kartoffelpuffer that were delicious and then moved on to the main course. Two of us had the Best of the Wurst Platter, which I included a picture of, that had 6 different kinds of sausages, with sauerkraut and spaetzle. Neither of us finished it all. He came closer by eating 5 of 6. I ate the major part of all 6. Of course we brought our leftovers home. Will be going back and taking beer. They are BYOB. CASH ONLY!
Always a wonderful and authentic meal that you can count on. Joe and Chef Wilhelm always stop by to say hello and chat. BoTW never disappoints! A real hidden gem here in Riverside.
Such a lovely place. Service was outstanding and food was delicious.
Great food and service!!

The ambiance was very romantic for our wedding anniversary. The server was also very nice and helpful with the menu. I got the fillet 4oz combo with 3 bourbon maple shrimp. I was underwhelmed when I saw how small the steak looked and it was well done not medium. It was also dry and needed a sauce. The shrimp was flavorful and tasty. The sides were good but nothing to rave about. My husband got the cajan spiced pan roasted fillet which was seasoned nicely but was very clean..small portions all around. The au gratin was lukewarm and the mushroom was on top of the steak and not really a side. The dessert of the 7 layer coconut cake was very moist and good but I don't care for the passion fruit coulis.

Late lunch for me so it was not crowded and food was served pretty quick. The steak sandwich was good. I wish baby back ribs could be more smoky instead. The portion was definitely huge, no kidding. They used to have a special lunch that came with kebab and rice but it wasn‚Äôt available that day.

Shrimp appetizer was perfectly fried and came with 2 great Sauces. Salad was pretty average. Swordfish was cooked absolutely great, sauce was spicy but good. The cake was super overwhelming but had lots of flavor

Great all the way around. You would not want to go here if you are on a budget but the food and service provided is well worth the money.
Great for a date night as the ambiance is perfect. It got a little loud after 6:00 PM but still enjoyable experience.

First time dining here and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, ensuring we had everything in a timely manner. The food was delicious and well prepared. Planning on dining here again.

Such a great atmosphere for a "business casual" dining experience. The beef filet was cooked medium rare as ordered. The side salad was fresh and much larger than expected. The home made blue cheese dressing was delicious with plenty of large bites of blue cheese crumbles.
Try the home made Key Lime Pie. It is perfect!

We came from Wichita to the KC area and Stopped in after shopping at the plaza and in overland park.  I check reviews for steak houses and discovered they had Steak Maui on the menu. I had been searching for something comparable to the Hawaiian Ribeye that Houstons in the plaza had. I found my new go to steakhouse when in the KC.
MY Steak Maui was perfectly cooked to the medium I ordered.  I subbed the smashed potatoes for a loaded baked potato.  My wife ordered one of their special steaks with blue cheese. My daughters got a pork tenderloin and a veggie burger. All were good. We will definitely be back.

An hour wait on Sunday, 2 wks ago, so book ahead. Love the salmon dip, wife like her filet minon, i didnt like mine, it was too sweet for me, i should have stuck with my normal steak, I ordered the Maui one, our server was very attentive, we celebrated my wife birthday so we also shared the big piece of famous carrot cake, it was very moist, very good.

I wish I loved this meal, but honestly I could have had better in Boston and that's not saying much.

The baked potato was delicious and very flavorful, but the strip steak with blue cheese crust was all panko breadcrumbs and very little blue cheese. The steak was also a bit tough for the $39 price tab.

Service was also very slow. 40 minute wait for a table that never came so I sat at the bar instead and then waited another 10 minutes to have my drink request taken.

The glass of red wine I chose was out of stock, so I had to choose something different and waited another 10 minutes for someone to ask if I wanted a drink. Surprisingly, the meal came out quickly, in about 15 minutes, but having to wait nearly 1.5 hours for an okay steak and a delicious baked potato was disappointing.

The restaurant was busy, but the two bartenders (and one additional bartender / waitress that kept floating in and out of the bar) with a devoted barback should be able to handle a dinner crowd.

We decided to give J Alexander's a try and oh wow!  The hostess was a little standoffish to us.  We were not dressed up for a Sunday, so I am assuming she didn't think we could afford to eat there.  Our waitress more than made up for the hostesses snotty attitude.   The food was hot, smelled amazing, and the flavor!  Perfect,  just perfect.   We will definitely be back.
Environment was nice little dark, but sat by the window. Food was amazing! Will be back! Waiter was knowledgeable and friendly.
Very good lunch. I had the special, cod with mashed potatoes, and broccoli. The broccoli was very tasty - buttered with garlic.
I was very impressed with my first visit to J Alexander‚Äôs! Our server alone was five stars.  So polite and funny.  The food was great as well.

Wow, I have never in my life had the service I had, and the steak was to die for, and the mac and cheese, wow. My tongue was beating my brains out, trying to eat it.
Most of all though the 5th star was for the service I got. I sat at the bar solo and I think it was Ally who took care of me and was very informative about the menu, and she was just amazing. She is on her game with customer service. Lovely establishment. It is a little pricey. It was a great treat, though. Highly recommend.

Hands down their Prime Rib Sandwich is the best! Their Salmon Dip or Deviled Eggs are great appetizers...and their Carrot Cake is always a favorite dessert! Excellent selection of drinks & cocktails. A great place to celebrate special occasions!
The Steak Burger was delicious.  Ambiance was great. Service was good.
Was my first time and was a great experience from start to finish! The prime rib was absolutely amazing would recommend this place ,it's a great place for a romantic dinner

Been a long time since I've been here, but this place is certainly worth treating yourself to for special occasions. Are they pricy? yeah, but if their target is for folks to come here to celebrate anniversaries and good news they fill the role perfectly.

I usually order the exact same thing over and over at restaurants. I'm a little picky and I like what I like.. J Alexanders is a different story. I could order at random and experience some amazing flavors anywhere on the menu. Carrot cake has never sounded appealing to me.. I tried theirs and I'm in love. Cilantro lime shrimp was incredible. Exceptional lasagna.

I would have gone with a bread that wasn't completely dehydrated for the salmon dip but it was really great anyway.

The servers, hostess, cooks, managers, everyone at this joint is working hard to deliver a good experience and it pays off.

Best ribeye I have ever had. If I had a plastic butter knife, I could probably cut through this thing without even sawing at it good god.. and instead of a regular ol‚Äô baked potato.. I chose to get the Mac and cheese which was honestly the best Mac and cheese I have EVER had. The price is high af for dinner but it‚Äôs amazing

What a great first impression.Ladies pull out those amazing pair of shoes, gentleman get a fresh cut & go experience amazing food. But don't forget the absolute must have Carrot cake. You will not be disappointed. You may even another piece to take home. üòâ Steak Maui w/ smashed potatoes. Grilled Salmon w/smashed potatoes & Carrot Cake. üòã

Always great service, but I was disappointed with a couple things.  1st, the rattlesnake pasta was not as flavorful as it usually is and 2nd, we only came tonight because on Facebook the J. Alexander page posted it was national creme brulee day with a beautiful picture of their creme brulee, yet this location was not serving creme brulee.

Servers are all paying attention to you.  Not just one but sometimes 3 per table.  Had fish tacos with macaroni and veggie burger with salad and fries.  Dessert chocolate bunt cake and pumpkin pie.

House made lemonade is sour-ly delicious

Fish tacos are perfectly fried and the sauce they have in the tacos really makes it taste better.

Salad is good, but the fried croutons with it is just yum!

Veggie burger is pretty thick, has flavor but isn't too dry.  The fries are like drugs.  Once you start you can't stop.

Dessert
Chocolate bunt cake is lovely.  Perfectly moist and sweet that it doesn't overpower the vanilla ice cream.  Sweet but not super sweet.  If that makes sense.
Pumpkin pie, is really simply done without added surger.  The pie crust is wonderfully done where you can't tell where it ends and the pumpkin moose begins.  The whipped cream on top is airy and goes great with the pumpkin flavor.
Everything was great. We had smoked salmon deep as a starter it was delicious. Baked potatoes, grilled salmon and the must th√© chocolat cake dessert. Must go to place if you are around the area

Food is very yummy! We enjoyed our meals. Expect high class steak house prices. The distancing protocols were not handled as well as they could be, but we still felt safe and had a nice celebratory dinner. The chocolate cake is really quite delicious

It was phenomenal!! It was hubby bday as well as the love day, so he was like I set a reservation! I was so excited and couldn't wait. They did not disappoint! Service was fast and very professional the food was exceptional, my taste buds had a party ü§ó
It's so worth the price!!!

This place is great! Friendly and efficient staff. Great place to make a reservation and go out for a special night. My wife and I came here for a date night, made reservations on their website which was easy. Was seated promptly and just had a great experience with our waiter. I ordered the KC Strip with a side of Mac and Cheese. Their Mac and Cheese is amazing. Steak was cooked to order but was still a little tough. Either way I enjoyed the meal with my Bourbons and my wife enjoyed her kabobs and chocolate martinis. Drinks were really good! Will be coming back for another fancy meal type date with my wife.
The service was excellent our server was Ashley B., Y‚Äôall need to go see her!! And the food is far the best I‚Äôve ever tasted, worth the 3 hour drive üôÇ can‚Äôt wait to come back
I can't think of nothing bad to say about this place. Excellent service, food and atmosphere. Our waiter Brandon great job

Ohhh boy!! I haven't been here in awhile but I decided to go and celebrate my birthday last nite. What a excellent decision!! J. Alexander's is always on point and last nite was no exception. I had their delicious lemonade which is always a must. I had the Steak Maui, a house salad, loaded mashed potatoes and the Mac and cheese. Sooooo damn fire....every single bite...then I had a lemon drop martini...yumm..another must have... the sweet manager came by and wished me a happy birthday along with a delicious slice of ice cream cake...yummmmtastic... Best nite of fine dining I've had in a long time.
One of....if not the best place to get a great steak.... service is above and beyond....Nancy, Ke'moni and the entire staff are most excellent! Great food, wonderful drinks.....well worth it!!

Service was great. Good atmosphere and the Prime Rib was pretty solid. However I ordered chicken tenders to go for a later meal and those were absolutely the best chicken strips I have ever had in my life. Just unreal. Excellent bbq sauce as well.
The food was amazing.  Not even exaggerating. Best meal I've had in a long time.

Never disappointing.  Didn‚Äôt have reservations but found seats at the bar- Savanna who is a three year veteran took amazing care of us!  Had the steak special and salad soooo good and the martinis were perfect.

I am so disappointed in how little food I received for $43.00. I ordered the filet mignon for curbside pickup. I ordered online and expected to receive two sides - one being a loaded baked potato, according to their ordering app. I received my to-go order and realized the baked potato was missing. After a call back in to the manager, he explained that the app was not working properly and that the steak only came with one side. I got home and everything was cold. I picked up my order when they said it would be ready and I actually had to wait on them to bring it out. I live 3 miles away from the restaurant, so it should not have been cold when I returned home. Needless to say we will not be returning.
Fantastic birthday dinner.  Great food and drinks.  Birthday carrot cake was a bonus.  Staff were attentive and considerate, giving good suggestions when asked.  Can't wait to go back!
Has not changed much over the past 20 years. Menu has been fairly static but quality that is consistant.
Swordfish special w prepared gluten free for me, and it was excellent! Great service, friendly and attentive staff.
Great place. Definite place to be in JOCO. Great atmosphere great selections. Food is off the chart. Steak and seafood options top notch. Cocktails endless. Staff amazing and helpful.
We went here for my wife's birthday and kind of re-discovered a local gem.  There's a reason why this restaurant has been here so long.  Our food was delicious and service was extraordinary.

Beautiful restaurant, attentive and incredibly friendly staff, very delicious food and drinks. My Wife and I went for our anniversary and we're not let down. I called ahead and made a reservation which I would recommend because wait time was only around 2 minutes to be seated. About the price I would expect for an upscale steakhouse, they offer great menu choices, I ordered a KC strip (which was huge) my fiance ordered the Crab Cakes which were apparently very good.

Really great place! Was quite amazing to learn that they marinate their steak for a week before they serve it! The wait in between courses was decent, the rest of the food was super yummy, & the staff super friendly! I'd try it again.
This was my boyfriend and my first time here and we really enjoyed ourselves. Mary was our server and she was on it! I had the veggie burger and it was REALLY good.

While it's a little expensive for lunch it is always busy. The menu is pretty large with salads, sandwiches, burgers, pizzas etc. Staff was very nice and helpful answering some questions about menu items. If I had more time for lunch I'd certainly visit more
Excellent food., excellent service. Fully emjoyed sharing my moms birthday here
Great service and delicious food...a friend celebrated her birthday dinner a few more guest came and they was very accommodating...
At first I took over 30 minutes to seat us for our reservation, but they made up for it with amazing service. I've always loved this place, the closest you'll getting Houston's in town

Reserved a table for myself with opentable.  Great service without any issues.  Medium rare steak Maui (ribeye) was properly grilled and juicy with a salad (huge portion).  A glass of merlot wraps the meal just perfectly.

We just had a great dinner after a day of house-hunting in Overland Park. So happy we walked in, as the staff was so friendly and knowledgeable, about not only the food, but the questions we had about the area. (Thanks, Isaac and Josh!)

We ordered the chicken tenders as an appetizer, with the delicious plum BBQ sauce, made in-house.  As much as I wanted prime rib, I settled for steak tacos and my partner ordered crabcakes.  We watched the food going out to the tables, every item seemed to be on a large plate and looked amazing.

Our service was paced perfectly, and we were happy with all items. So much flavor, very tender, and plenty of it.  Even the lemonade was fresh and delish.

We will be back. Loved it!  Although we are staying at a hotel, I included a pic of the foil wrapped taco and bag of ice from the hotel, since we are in a room without a fridge. When it's that good, it's worth saving and talking about it here.

It's always a treat going to J Alexander's Overland Park Grill! We have a favorite booth, a favorite waiter (Stephen), incredible hostesses, efficient management, and a delicious array of appetizing meal selections: Raffaele's Lasagna, Rotisserie Chicken, and BBQ Baby Back Ribs are a few of our preferences.  Last night there was an extra perk: Stephen had our booth fully prepped and ready to rock when we arrived!
Good food, nice waiter, good atmosphere! Just more expensive than I would usually eat at. But if money's not a problem make it one of your regulars.
Really enjoy going to this place. The food is pretty good. a bit overpriced but good. Very nice interior and the waiting service is great!! can‚Äôt wait to go back

We've eaten here numerous times and decided to have a small family dinner a few nights ago to celebrate by step-daughter's graduation from KU. Our dinner was fabulous and the service was perfect! What a marvelous evening!
Had a really good experience here for dinner. The prime rib was very good. Staff was very friendly and courteous. It's a solid steakhouse and worth a visit.
My husband and I went to dinner at j Alexander's food was great atmosphere was amazing service was exceptional a go to place
Great selection on the menu.  Attentive waitstaff.  Reasonably priced for this type of restaurant.  The lasagna was very, very good!
Stephen was our waiter was great.The best place in Kansas . Will be back and food was Great a must come in . Great time Great Atmosphere
My son and I had a great dinner. Steaks were cooked perfectly.
Awesome will definitely go back, The (NYO) Macaroni  is a MUST!!  Smoked salmon dip is sumptuous!!
Love when they have artichokes!! Really good consistent food and service. Yes, more expensive but they deliver the goods!
Was nice.family wasnt sitting close bcause of the covid-19 ddnt feel like a bday celebration,but the food was fire
Good service, good meal. Everything is done right and I would go back.
One of the best place to eat! I definitely recommend it.

We have been going to The Overland Park Grill by J'Alexanders for over 20 years and disappointed is never a word we would use to describe our dining experience.  The food and service is always on point and that is something that is hard to do on a consistent basis over so many years.
Amazing smoked salmon appetizer. Salad was delicious and fresh. Never disappointed‚Äã with J!

Our favorite restaurant! Only thing missing is Chef Gordon Ramsey at the pass, cussin and screaming at the other chef's to "get it together man!" HAHAHA
Seriously though, a SERIOUSLY GREAT RESTAURANT!
Great meal. Delicious dessert. Awesome service!
For my birthday!!You must get the carrot cake. Best I've ever had...
Friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere, and upscale food.
Jack's Crispy Chicken dinner. My friends favorite and now mine! Get the rice warmed, so yummy!!

2 words, "Always great".

J. Alexanders and Capital Grille are my two favorite upscale chain restaurants.  Ambience is amazing with subtle fire torches and dark brick interior facade.  I usually sit at the bar and no matter the tender , great service and great horseradish sauce!
Had a great dinner here. Service was fantastic.
Nice place.  First visit.  Nice selection.  Reasonably priced, considering the type of restaurant it is.  Food was very good and portions were reasonable.  I ordered the lasagna, as pictured.
My favorite drinks and food.... They never disappoint....
Great service from Mindy.
Good food, nice atmosphere!!
Awesome... Jacob is the best waiter I believe I have ever had... And the food is awesome.  Well worth the trip...

Best steak sandwich in KC and
Great atmosphere
It's to expensive for me oh my
Absolutely wonderful everything!!!
Excellent food and service!!!

Love this place! Haven‚Äôt been back since I last visited Atlanta 10 years ago. It‚Äôs still amazing! The comfy biscuit with fried chicken covered in gravy is fantastic, as are the fried green tomatoes. I haven‚Äôt yet enjoyed the chicken fried sandwich this trip, but will later on the plane. Come hungry, leave satisfied and smiling!

Homegrown GA: where hospitality meets quality

This bustling Atlanta suburb diner has been a staple in the community for generations it seems. From the moment you pull up, you can see what to expect. Old school restaurant, friendly staff and a small but thorough menu.

Breakfast is served all day, and to be honest it‚Äôs substantial enough to carry you all day. Ask for the house special and you‚Äôll be offered ‚ÄúThe Comfy‚Äù. An open faced chicken biscuit with fresh sausage gravy on top. Add a side of potatoes if you like, but by no means is it necessary.

Don‚Äôt be discouraged by a wait, it moves quick and won‚Äôt leave you disappointed. Enjoy some coffee, the nostalgic signs and art that fill the walls, the friendly conversation with staff and the amazing smells coming out of the kitchen.

In short, this is a must go when in Atlanta.

Worth the wait. We waited outside for around 20 minutes as it drizzled. The picnic tables were shared by multiple families. The atmosphere was upbeat and friendly. Our names were announced via speaker when our table was ready. Inside is an amazing experience of Atlanta culture, that was a mix between hippie chic and yard hoarder fancy. The coffee was served piping hot so be careful! I mixed with chocolate syrup to make a mocha coffee. We enjoyed a skinny chicken plate that was served with fresh spinach which was absolutely wonderful. I favored the turkey round sausage over the chicken link sausage. My highlights are the grits and home fries which I opted to add the peppers and onions, and the pancake was big enough for the 3 of us to enjoy and tasted like heaven. Despite me not trying to eat at the same restaurant twice, this one will be revisited by me OVER and OVER again! Atlantalicious

New to Atlanta and had a friend visiting from DC this weekend so we wanted to find a good spot for breakfast and this place did not disappoint.  It‚Äôs a cute little eclectic spot with a great brunch menu.  We did have to wait 20-30 minutes for a seat but it was well worth it.  We started with fried green tomatoes which were delicious.  I had the fried chicken and waffles, the portion size was perfect and both items were very tasty.  The others with me had the biscuits and gravy, basic breakfast and fried chicken biscuit.  The only thing I wouldn‚Äôt recommend was the pancake, it was huge and looked good but tasted a little spongy.  Someone‚Äôs French toast that went by looked amazing so I will try that next time for sure.

Sat at the bar and the service was great and the waiters were super attentive! The menu has something for everyone including vegetarians and vegans. I got the vegetarian biscuits and gravy and it was fantastic! The portion is actually pretty large for how cheap it is. Definitely going to come back and try some of the other options.

Came here Saturday to grab a late breakfast before heading out of Atlanta and I'm glad I did. The place had a long wait but since I was by myself I was able to sit at the bar.

Staff were friendly and took my order and I was surprised how quickly they got it out that's usually a bad sign but definitely not here. I got the Comfy biscuit and it was super good.

Can't wait to return here!
Really good food. Great atmosphere. I definitely enjoy the fact they have veggie options. Today I tried the cinnamon waffle with cream cheese icing!  #winning

The food was great with large portions. Lots of things to choose from. I got the comfy chicken biscuit and it was delicious. They had breakfast all day and brunch while we were there. Also got the ruffles and onion dip which I've never seen at a restaurant. Had to get it just because. It was really good too. My son ate most of it before I could take a pic.

I am obsessed. I stopped in Atlanta for the night while driving through and after looking online for breakfast spots this is what we decided on. I was expecting a classic diner with old guys sitting at a counter giving me weird looks for my tattoos but it ended up being an alternative style diner. There were amazing art pieces for sale, which I definitely bought, and the food was amazing. The waffle tasted like funnel cake which was different but so good. The syrup was the best I've ever had and the biscuits and gravy were top notch. I normally have to salt and pepper it but theirs had so much flavor. I hope I get a chance to go back because it was so good. The staff was also super nice.

Ok first this restaurant is a grower not a shower! From the outside it looks small af but when you go inside it's amazing! Our waiter was so sweet and funny and the owner was cool too! The food was good and service was quick. I'd definitely be back again and tell a friend!  Check my social media for videos! @allhustlenofear

Our service was great and wishing we could remember her name. The wait didn‚Äôt take long at all and it was busy! The food was absolutely delicious. We got the French toast, pancakes, and the BEST sandwich. All were so good. We will definitely recommend and be back!

I was in the mood for breakfast for lunch and decided to come to Home Grown. The wait wasn't that long, May be 20 mins and our waiter was very quick. The food came out quick as well. I ordered the steak hash and to my surprise it was seasoned well. I LOVE potatoes and the potatoes that came with my meal was so good. The only reason why I'm giving 4 stars is because my friends ordered scrambled eggs with their meal and it came out cold. They brought new orders out quickly but my friends think that the eggs were powered eggs. Idk because my eggs were over easy and perfect üëåüèΩ.
There were so many other things I wanted to try so I will definitely be back.

Enjoyed a great meal that was both filling and pleasing to the eye. Colorful dishes, full of flavor and well-prepared.

Parking worked out well (on-site), but space
may be less available during their peak hours.

Great choice!

Great food! Chicken cooked perfectly and crispy. However, the service need to keep up with the food standard. It was not busy when we were there, but the front guy seemed rushed and annoyed to assign people sit.

Good thing we didn't leave based on the first interaction with the host (who was a complete and total jerk!), because we would have missed out on a really good breakfast. The wait for an outside table was minimal and worth the time. Our waiter was great! The food was really tasty, albeit a little pricey.

Suuuuper fire. Got the comfy chicken biscuit and their fried green tomatoes which were both incredible, especially the tomatoes. Usually a bit of a wait but got seated at the bar right away with a 20 minute wait for a table when I got there. Awesome interior vibes as well
The service was quick. The food was delicious. The lemonade was a bit too sweet. Overall, It was a great dining experience in a quirky environment.

Literally one of my fav brunch places in the city! Anytime I‚Äôm in Atlanta, this is a MUST HAVE! Probably one of the last authentic hole in the wall spots left.. Oh, and they‚Äôre typically packed out. The salmon patties are deliciously amazing and the veggie patties are great. Customer service is always top-tier. The best southern cheese grits you‚Äôll have. Just go!!

LOVE LOVE LOVED this place! Was in town from Birmingham, decided to hit a brunch spot before heading back, and was so glad we chose Homegrown. The coolest atmosphere, friendly and upbeat staff, and literally everything that came out of that kitchen looked amazing. I chose the Comfy Chicken Biscuit, highly recommend!

Home grown is wonderful! What a charming place right off the Beltline. The service is impeccable and the food really hits the spot. I hadn't been back in years and was pleasantly surprised that it's no longer a cash only establishment and we didn't need to pay at the counter.

Met our son here for breakfast on a Sunday morning around 10 a.m. Busy but not too crowded. Service was prompt. The Comfy Chicken was good. The gravy was seasoned well and the chicken was fried nice and crispy. My husband enjoyed this treat very much. My son had the Poncho Breakfast Bowl with Vegan Eggs and as a side, a pancake. He enjoyed them both. The pancake was the size of the plate!
What a fantastic place! The food is delicious, the setting is excellent, and the service superb. Highly recommend this place.

The French toast sandwich, eggs and cheesy grits were all great. Service was quick given how packed and busy this place was for a weekend morning. Parking is absolutely atrocious here so prepare for some close quarters driving.

The food here is nothing short of amazing. Servings are plentiful, food is flavorful, and the staff was hospitable as well as attentive. We were well aware that we would wait awhile to be seated so we opted for the 1st available table. No biggie. 45 minutes later we were sat outside swarmed by flies and while other waiting patrons crowded around our seating area under the canopy for shade. Still delicious and good enough to go back. Next time I won‚Äôt mind waiting a bit longer to sit inside.

I had a great father daughter brunch date with my oldest.  Very good meal the chicken was seasoned good but too thin on the chicken n waffles. She said the salmon cake was better than my mom's. Close maybe. Go early especially on Sunday and hope for luck on parking. Service is really good

I ordered the chicken and waffles. The service was great! The chicken was seasoned okay but it was a bit dry. The waffle was very basic. No wow factor. Not the best chicken and waffles I‚Äôve had in Atlanta.
This is a interesting restaurant in Atlanta. Great reviews, unique items on the menu and excellent customer service. Parking is usually the problem when dining downtown Atlanta.

Home grown is a staple in the Atlanta brunch scene. It is small and cozy, with a warm diner vibe. The food is solid and there are a lot of menu options. This is a good place to take anybody for brunch.

Their signature dish is the comfy chicken biscuit. It is an open-face biscuit with chicken and sausage gravy. This is always my go-to menu item. It is definitely comfort food.

The item my husband ordered was the standard two egg breakfast plate with eggs over easy, cheese grits, a biscuit, and bacon. The eggs, grits, and biscuit were great. The bacon was a little rubbery. We would have preferred it more well done.

Overall, the food may not be the most amazing food, but it is solid, and it is comfort food. The staff is very friendly, and have all been there for years. They also have their own garden, and a cute thrift shop.
Good food. Nice and hot. The wait is long, but the food is worth it. I just wish the portion of grits was larger.

Great food, great service, great crowd. Destination resturant. Same comment one year later!

Here's an update - order To Go an hour ahead and eat a great brunch on the patio.

We drove from Covington Georgia and I am so glad we did. We used to eat at this spot years ago when it was under a different name and we lived in Atlanta.  The customer service was outstanding  from the time we entered the building and the food was delicious. I ordered Donnie‚Äôs breakfast and a chocolate chip pancake. My husband ordered waffles with bacon and sausage. The prices are good and the portions are too. Everything we ordered was on point. We will be back soon. I definitely recommend visiting this restaurant.

This was a nice kind of hole in the wall place. Food wise I think that the food is probably about a 3/5 for the price and level. It's a little saltier than I'd like, but I'm not a huge fan of salt. The presentation is okay as you can see in the pictures but not fantastic. But I don't remove points for that because I don't expect a restaurant of this caliber to have fantastic presentation.

The reason that I'm removing an extra point is because they only provide plastic cutlery, styrofoam cups for water and drinks, and even the plates are paper. That's very unusual for a sit down restaurant and it looks like they're trying to cut costs on a dishwasher or dishwashing stuff, but also being very non environmentally friendly. I think that's wrong and I think that really brings quality of the establishment down.

I also noticed that the Table we were seated at didn't have clean floors and still had crumbs on the chairs  Very strange and it felt kind of nasty to sit there.

The service was good and I have no significant issues with that. The price was also reasonable.

I read about this place on a blog entitled, "Best Sandwiches for each State". I like chicken, love pimento cheese and garden to table always sells me, so I had to try this place out.
