The diner was decorated like in the 60s sandwich shop fashion and our waiter was friendly.

I had the chicken and pimento cheese sandwich. The cheese was more of a sauce than a pimento cheese spread. Very cheddary and creamy. It was really good.

They serve on paper plates with plastic utensils. Problem is the plastic knife was made of such thin plastic it bend when trying to cut the chicken. It wouldn't cut so I had to pull the meat apart with my fingers.. The store owner really needs to purchase better cutlery.

They make folks wear mask (even if you are vaccinated) until you arrive at your table where you can take the mask off. However they don't space tables out. People were sitting back to back in booths.. I guess germs don't get on you if you are sitting at your table, but will jump on you if you get up without a mask on. I rather have distancing than wearing a mask.

Over all it was an ok place to eat.
Usually a wait in the mornings but they have a ton of seating so it never takes as long as they say it will. Simple southern food that is ‚ÄúUnequivocally BUSSIN‚Äô ‚Äú

Absolute BEST Brunch We've Had!!

Overall: after a visit in the ATL, we had a choice of many great options for brunch and we settled on HomeGrown. It was fantastic!! They have such an eclectic and unique menu that it's difficult to choose. Customer service is super friendly and helpful and the food is amazing. Good bit of space inside and patio. Definitely gets busy, but they keep service throughout. Parking on site is a very needed bonus.

Food: creative and unique menu that's tough to choose. Tempted many times by other items , but went with the comfy chicken sandwich. It is an open faced fried chicken on a biscuit with pork gravy. I know this is a BIG statement, but it is the BEST chicken sandwich with gravy I've ever had! It was seasoned perfectly and pro gravy was fantastic. The biscuit was awesome as well. No need for salt, pepper, or hot sauce at all. B got the hot steak biscuit, complete with hot sauce and a pickle on a tasty biscuit. Also had to get the home fries with onions, chilli, cheese and carrots. Amazing!! Coffee could use a little work, but I'm reaching here.

Interior/Exterior/Scene: awesome deco with city vibe including stickers of local places, music, and abound with unique paintings and overall decor. Large counter space if you want to skip the wait, which we did. Large patio with outside eating and large amount of parking for an in-city spot.

Service: was great, friendly, and super attentive. Our waiter at the counter was awesome!!

Summary: with tons of options of breakfast/brunch in the ATL, put this at the very top of your list!!!

Cute little hometown eatery!! We came here last year and oh my god it was amazing!! I don‚Äôt usually like breakfast food but this place was heavenly!! Loved the potatoes and French toast was so yummy! Service was very good too!! Also you HAVE to try the carrot cake! Please save room for it, you‚Äôre gonna wanna try it!!

The best southern brunch! Their comfy chicken biscuit is one of my favorites. Very affordable too given the portion sizes. Ordering online makes takeout super easy too. Friendly servers and I wish I lived closer!

I love great food and this is great food. Came here as a recommendation from a friend. They did not let down. The portions are more than sufficient. Prices are reasonable. Atmosphere is very family-oriented. They have pieces all over the walls that you can buy. they have a clothes rack vinyl records and all types of knickknacks all through the establishment.

I am a lover of breakfast and specifically French toast. They give you three for slices cut in half and one side. I did eggs and I added a side of bacon. my wife got the comfy chicken biscuit with gravy and a pancake on the side. Which was HUGE.  We both had to take to go plates. Now off to take a nap
Wait might be a little long on weekends but well worth it, staff is super friendly and great breakfast food.

Not sure what is so good about this place. Plastic utensils, paper plates and styrofoam cups? The grits and eggs were too salty. The pancakes were great but $3 for 1 cake? The hippie look didn't work for me. Won't be back on next trip to Atlanta.

Delicious food. The fried stuff is super crunchy!  Very noisy during peak hours; don't plan to chat much without some effort. Parking is tight.  Very friendly and patient staff.  Cute decor. There's a little .5 & Dime in the back with used items. Looks as though there is sometimes live music back there; not sure.  Pay at the register on the way out and there can be a long line to pay.  Food came out promptly despite the large crowd. Lots of variety in the menu. We loved everything that came to the table.  Super tasty desserts!  Love the place!

Either someone in the kitchen loves me! or love what they do and since this is my 1st time it can't be me can it?  Brought the wife here for bday breakfast and it was a fantastic start to the day and weekend...if you have been and love breakfast its a must!!

Man.... great food the menu is freaking awesome I had a French toast sandwich and the bacon was cooked perfect not too hard and not under cook chewy. Daisy was our server and she had great recommendations. Even my drink Arnold Palmer was a perfect balance. The tomatoes was super fresh and real. Great hipster progressive environment.  I'd say a must try and you tell me.

Disappointed. I went for the country fried steak but after a couple of bites I couldn't finish it. It was too chewy. I understand it is not a prime cut but it was way too tough. The mashed potatoes seemed to have been under a heat lamp for a while and not freshly scooped. The overall cleanliness was not impressive. BUT, the staff were amazing and very nice. The place is quaint and like a "greasy spoon" should look. Lots of character. I didn't finish my meal. It has a strong following so maybe my personal experience was an exception.

THIS PLACE IS A MUST
There's usually a 45 minute wait and parking can be complicated so keep that in mind but it's worth it! I live in the neighborhood and always pass this place and see how packed it is so I decided to come for brunch with my girlfriends.

The service is amazing! This place really makes you feel like home, great energy from staff as well as patrons. We were waiting for two people in our party to come and I was nervous that they wouldn't seat us but the staff did not have a problem with it at all and did not make us feel pressured to order when we were waiting probably 30 minutes for our other friend to show up. Thank you! Because a lot of other places would not do that

Best biscuits in Atlanta hands down! There are a few pictures attached of our food as well! I ordered the Lynn special and it doesn't look that great in my picture but WOW it was amazing. Two hearty salmon cakes over fried green tomatoes, topped with pimento cheese, all over a bed of spinach and tomatoes. The green tomatoes were fried to perfection! I was very impressed with the texture. I smiled the entire time through this meal, it was that good! Prices are reasonable too. My meal was $14

COMFORT

Enjoyable lunch. Portions in the large size but not too bad.

The biscuits with fried chicken seams to be a classic.

Overall, great service.

This local restaurant it‚Äôs a little bit unique. It‚Äôs decoration is a little bit eclectic with some nice points and some not so nice ones. The ambient is lousy (loud rock music) but I didn‚Äôt feel overwhelmed. Their staff is friendly and courteous. And now with the good stuff. Their food selection is wide and the few things that I‚Äôve tried they were delicious. The service was really quick all the way through, from sitting on the table to get our order served. I‚Äôll definitely come back!!
Their thrift store in the back is a normal tiny shop that sell few ‚Äúhippie‚Äù items.

The food was southern comfort food. The Chef‚Äôs omelette was delicious. The ingredients were so fresh. The pancakes were huge. They serve it with yummy hot syrup. Overall taste was very good and would definitely recommend this place. The ambience and the service are very good. The place is crowded on weekends. There is a small parking lot so no guarantee you will find parking. You can park on the street.

Breakfast was pretty good here! I was a bit disappointed in my pancake on this visit, but I‚Äôve had better here so I‚Äôll let it slide. This place is great if you‚Äôre a blogger or traveler looking for an affordable hearty plate with a family feel. The artwork for sale and the store provides great gifts and souvenirs to remember your visit.

This restaurant serves a very delicious breakfast. It deserves 5 stars but I gave it only 2 stars because of the rude treatment from the receptionist. My family and I were sitting on the last table which is close to the chimney, it was very cold so I asked nicely to move to another table, the waitress said yes. Right after we moved, the receptionist came yelling and saying why did we move? the tables are the same! my kids were terrified of his action.

This place is such a throwback to a nostalgic diner. Our party was greeted right away with southern hospitality. The servers were attentive and amazing. Food was equally delicious. Definitely a must go to when your looking for breakfast in Atlanta.
The chicken options are pretty good here! The comfy chicken was peppery. The dish sizes vary in size.

Good luck parking! The wait and the effort is so worth it! Food was absolutely amazing. Had high expectations and the food exceeded my expectations.

Originally thought homegrown meant country cooking, based on the art on the wall, it might mean more than that!

Not a brunch for your grandmother and her pearls unless she is sporting a nose ring and a sleeve of tattoos.  The place is vibrant with counter-culture, classic rock and funk.   The vibe is great and alive with chatter unless you have a plate in front of you, and then the focus is on the food.  I can‚Äôt praise the fried chicken and biscuit enough.  Come for the biscuits and rock out to the stereo.

Such a family like atmosphere with great food. The aesthetics are fun and engaging as well. I had the French toast and it‚Äôs always perfect morning or afternoon meal. The grilled chicken is to perfection as well. Parking can be tricky yet doable.

A group of friends and I had brunch here during our first morning in Atlanta. There's not much that needs to be said other than the fact that our visit was the best way to start our vacation.

We were quickly seated and had friendly, amazing server. The environment had a very artsy feel to it (almost like a brunch spot fused with an antiques shop, but there were no antique items). Our server made us feel welcomed and even made suggestions for us during our Atlanta visit.

The food was the best of the best. I ordered the Skinny Chicken with a pancake on the side. The entree came with grilled chicken, spinach, and egg whites. Healthy as can be and it didn't taste overly salty. The pancake was phenomenal and the best part of it all.  It came with powdered sugar and was basically a homemade pancake.

I will definitely be visiting this place again in the future and strongly suggest a visit for their brunch!

Love the atmosphere! I can honestly say that when we pulled up I had no idea what to expect.  At all. There were a lot of cars outside..I thought a long wait was ahead of us. We walked in and we're immediately seated in the back part of the rather large dining room. The ambiance of this place is amazing!  For the first five minutes I sat, looking around in awe. A very diverse staff as well as customer base. I love that literally everyone approaches you as if they have known you forever. Southern hospitality at its best. On the walls the art work of local artists hang with the price tags ready for purchase.  We sat in the back where there is what looks to be a small thrift store. A really cool addition to the place. This restaurant is suitable for families, just a couple of friends out to eat, or a couple looking for a nice chill place.

The menu literally has something for everyone. There are so many things that I wanted to try so I just randomly picked one today! Everything is reasonably priced with the taxes included in the price that is listed. You definitely get your money's worth as the portions are pretty big. Almost 2 servings per order. Did I mention they sell breakfast all day! SCORE!

As for my food, I ordered the chef's omelet  with veggie sausage added and a pancake for my side.  My food was pretty good. The goat cheese probably threw it off a little for me though. In sticking to southern food traditions my omelet was also pretty heavy with butter or oil.  The spinach, tomatoes,  and mushrooms were sauteed perfectly. The pancake was as big as the plate.  I seriously only ate half of it and asked for a to go box for the other half. It was thick and fluffy. Very good. My boyfriend got a simple breakfast with scrambled eggs , cheese grits, bacon, Turkey sausage, and a biscuit. His food looked really good as well.

Overall...I loved it! I'll definitely go back here often! The only thing I HATED....I left my to go pancake box on the table. By the time I got to the register and realized it was too late. I went right back and our table had already been turned and was clean. Can't say that's the worse thing ever though... but I was reallllllly looking forward to that pancake later!

Quick and easy with outdoor seating. Waitress wore mask the entire time. It was 4 of us. The construction across the street made for conversation. Didn't get to see the inside. Orders were quick and lady was very friendly.

Try the fried green tomatoes. My wife recommended I tried it. It comes in a batch of 3. Very good.

Will return.

How did I find it? I was looking online for a good place that served breakfast when I was blessed...yes blessed to to have Home Grown pop up as a suggested restaurant.
The food? So of course I was beyond ecstatic to go and try the place and I was NOT disappointed at all! I ordered the chicken biscuit with a side of potatoes  (they were kind enough to saute me some onions with the potatoes) my little niece ordered one pancake, an order of eggs, bacon, and fruit. The chicken was absolutely divine, the pancake was unbelievably huge yet delish, the bacon was fried perfectly and perfectly flavored.

Now to the reason I did not give five stars...my biscuit was dry, bland, and burnt at the bottom. The onions that were served with my potatoes were extremely overcooked and mushy. The potatoes were like rocks...will not order any of those things again however the good news is the bad DID NOT out weight the good.

The food was decent, service was fast though. The temperature of the food left a lot to be desired. The flavor of the food lacked a bit. More specifically the burger. The French toast was alright. However, the syrup was surprisingly very delicious. I loved the art hanging up around the restaurant. Some art is even on sale created by local artists.

Our favorite go-to place for breakfast. Over the top homemade food with huge portions. Go early because it gets crowded fast.

Order The ‚ÄúComfy Chicken biscuit‚Äù... you can thank me later.üòâüëç

First off, if I could give more than 5 stars I would. We are visiting Atlanta for the weekend so I just googled for breakfast places in the area. We lucked into finding Home Grown! We went in a little after 8am, and got seated immediately on a Friday morning. It was delicious and the service was awesome.
I had the comfy chicken, which was very good and filling. The wife had a turkey sausage biscuit with eggs that she says were ‚Äúperfectly done.‚Äù
I would definitely recommend Home Grown for breakfast, and we will probably visit again before we head home.

Wow, wow, wow I am shook! The comfy chicken should have all other biscuit and gravy combos shaking in their boots! Sooooo delicious!!! Definitely a place to come back to. The service was great and the ambiance was chill and it definitely feels like a safe space. Daisy was great and prompt! Overall amazing experience!

(11/21/20 visit) Got the salmon patty biscuit, side of eggs with vegetables, French toast and fresh squeezed grapefruit juice. The only non- great item was the biscuit. It's not that it tasted bad but it was HEAVY. Like dense. The salmon patties were flavored great and the breading gave it the perfect crunch. The eggs were well cooked and fluffy. The French toast was amazing. Perfect amount of sweety and savory. The fresh squeezed grapefruit juice was refreshing. Tasted natural and fresh. Customer service was excellent. No complaints, at all.

Best breakfast in town. Kevin has created a uniquely southern eating experience with a high quality but affordable menu.  The staff are professional and diverse.  The customers come from all over the city.  Kevin's Breakfast and the Basic Breakfast is our favorite.  We sometimes get it with a stack of pancakes. They also make the best fried green tomatoes.

Worth the wait, but also good for off-peak hours. The signature dish (chicken biscuit with gravy) is really special to Atlanta, even if grits aren't the best. Eclectic art - appropriately weird for the east side. Going to get even busier by 2019 with new nearby developments. Diverse crowds reference the widespread appeal.

One of my favorite spots to have brunch in Atlanta. The wait will most likely be long and the food is not the healthiest, but it is absolutely delicious and unapologetically southern. The atmosphere here is fantastic the restaurant is full of art made by local artists and every so often there will be live music.
Everyone at my table had chicken and waffle or a chicken biscuit with gravy and everyone left happy. Very fun decor inside since you can look around at different things on the wall the entire time.

In a quest of finding some local food we ended up in this place. The number of cars parked out n the waiting line itself speaks about this place. We ordered their Riverview Farms Breakfast Burger for that price the amount of meat is really good.

Our server was very lousy and he just wasn‚Äôt interested in helping us out, I initially thought it was only us(maybe he dint like us) but He was the same to every table he was serving.
I love the decor of this small place.
Apart for the server i loved the place and the food.

Fantastic place! Busy, but sat down within 15 minutes. In town for the weekend and Google recommend Home Grown GA and thank you Google, because this place is AMAZING!!!
Though the Comfy Chicken Biscuit was flavorful, filling and delicious, the plate presentation made me feel like something was missing. If I ever come back to the area, this is a definite place I WILL come back to, again and again!

One of my favorite brunch places in ATL! Don't be fooled by the restaurant's appearance; it's not much to look at but the food is so worth it. The pancakes are HUGE, literally the size of your head and they're so fluffy. The comfy chicken biscuit is also fantastic and probably my favorite thing on the menu. The vegan sloppy joe is also really good. Be ready for long waits during peak hours and make sure you don't have important personal belongings in plain sight in your car. The area is a bit sketchy.
Both our meals were very yummy! Super nice server and quick service! 10/10

Eating a comfy chicken biscuit at home grown is a spiritual experience. The atmosphere of the restaurant is perfectly eclectic and authentic while the food is delicious and cheap. I dined on my own and sitting at the counter provided entertainment in the form of looking at the decor and people watching and once my food came I gave it all my attention because it earned it. After your meal, don't forget to hit the mini thrift store in the back, perfect way to end a meal.
Even with a 2 hour wait Homegrown is always worth it!! Delicious food and great service every time. The BEST breakfast in all of metro Atlanta.
Great food and awesome atmosphere! There is art on the walls and cool $hit to buy inside! Don't let the exterior fool you! Plus a slice of pie is only $3.50 - Go for the key lime!!

The Staff is really nice.  There is food is okay.. I got a pancake and it was very tough so I sent it back with no issues. Also I got a omelette and I did not think it was going to be so BIG lol alot of eggs.
I ordered a bowl of grits and this is what I got. Paid $3.50 Highway Robbery!!!!! THIEVES

Stopped by for lunch with the wife after hearing about this place for a couple of years and boy does it not disappoint. Your first decision to be made is whether you‚Äôre going enjoy the all day breakfast menu or go for the other side which is just as equally good. I decided to go with the hamburgers and yes that is plural. Two patties come on a wheat bun that is spot on. I chose to have mine with the pimento cheese which was a great choice. It also came with a side of spinach, tomatoes and some delicious pickles. The wife had the bruschetta with a side of green beans and you can see by the photos this did not disappoint either. Can‚Äôt wait to go back and try some of the breakfast items.
A great place, great food, amazing vibe. Pretty homely.

Yes for a Brunch Date, Yes it's My Favorite breakfast spot in Atlanta. First time I went I got my regular ihop style breakfast: , French toast, eggs, and bacon. The very next time, I tried something out of the usual when I asked the friendly server for a chicken biscuit covered in gravy.

That may have been the best choice of my entire life. It was delicious and I feel like I can still taste it.

I'm looking at the photo now and it really doesn't do it justice.

A local favorite. A large variety of southern comfort food. It‚Äôs very popular so expect a wait if you come after 10:00am. Service was fast and friendly and food is great.  The restaurant, not a stand out from the outside appearance, is eclectic and has a welcoming atmosphere with several dining areas and a counter. We had chicken and gravy, an omelet with pancake , a breakfast sandwich and a eggs-bacon-grits with a pancake and beverages. All great for $10-12 per person.
The entire place is a mood u gotta treat urself to the experience. U will love it. So mad i been in atl 12yrs and jus found this spot. üíúüíúüíú #mrcakemehappy #jdotbrwn

So delicious! Huge portions and definitely shareable. Love going on weekdays as the wait is not usually too long. This place is always busy though. And for good reason. Breakfast is so quick and so good! Variety of options for vegetarians and other dietary restrictions. A great cup of coffee and awesome, friendly service. What‚Äôs not to love? One of my favorite breakfast spots in the city. Pancakes were my fav you must try!

This place definitely lives up to the hype!!! First, let me start by saying the place is reminiscent of your grandmothers kitchen or a small town diner. I absolutely loved it. The food was so delicious and the prices were around $10-$12 an entree (average)! The food portions were ridiculously large, so worth every penny that you pay. You will definitely leave there full and satisfied. Last but not least, the "young" man playing the xylophone....what an awesome and original touch.

Side note.....Don't go there if you're in a rush, because this place stays packed. However, it is definitely worth the wait!
This place was hyped up and for good reason.  The food, vibe are amazing. Love this place
I enjoyed this cute little hipster spot. They offered quick service and hot food. The food tasted good and the service was great. I‚Äôd go back and try different dishes.

Seriously the BEST fried green tomatoes I have ever had! The owner of this joint is beyond rad and incredibly personal. He made our meal an experience. The staff are super sweet and all the food we had was tasty. Couldn't give this place enough accolades!
The food is pretty much always delicious the customer service was friendly and efficient! I had some friends meet me here this was there 1st time but the loved it also!

Food was really good. Service time was pretty good. Only complaint i had was the cleanliness, the staff weren‚Äôt wearing gloves and they were handling good, drinks and more. The dishes weren‚Äôt very clean to eat off of.

Omg, I enjoyed every single bite of my food. For some strange reason I order pancakes and was very surprised at there gigantic-ness. The pimento cheese was the best on my eggs served scrambled of course. I will forever recommend this azz food joint. Go enjoy like I did.
P.s. not much parking
Food was great . A real home cooking experience. Staff was awesome. Our waiter named Austin she was great . Our first meal in GA when we got there from Florida.

Homegrown is a popular restaurant in Atlanta. I felt that the food was good but not great, especially for the price. The server was friendly and helpful picking out menu items for my friend on a vegan diet. The restaurant has the atmosphere of a cafe with artwork decorating the walls.

They served me egg beaters not real eggs and were warm.
The bacon was dried out and didn't serve any fresh bacon.
The grits were beyond salty I could not eat them.
The chocolate chip pancakes were the only decent item I had.

This fried chicken sandwich was my last meal in the South, and was amazing. Chicken was juicy, breading was crispy, and the bread was soft and delicate. The biscuit I had on the side was so soft and comforting. The jalapeno cole slaw was alright I think it was a little dry for me, but it did have a nice little spice. Most of the stars I'm giving are for the quirky ambiance of this place. There was so much local art everywhere and a cute little thrift shop area in the back to peruse while you wait for your food.
I always get the comfy chicken biscuit with their homemade pork sausage gravy, this time I ordered from the lunch menu and it was solid.

Ordered the skinny chicken with grapefruit juice. The juice was very refreshing, with a little bit bitterness. The skinny chicken was very good, with rich seasonings. However, the spinach was a little too oily and salty for me. Didn‚Äôt enjoy it that much.
Perhaps I should order their comfy chicken, which seems to be their signature dish, instead of the skinny version.
The service was good and this place was really crowded. We managed to grab two bar seats and got our food promptly. No complaints on that.

Been in Atlanta for a few days for vacation, and this is easily the best restaurant we've been to. A mix of breakfast classics and unique dishes allowed my kids to have a yummy waffle and biscuit sandwich, while I had the AA's breakfast bruschetta (can't recall the actual name), and it was a perfect mesh of flavor. One of the few restaurants observing all Covid protocols while still providing fantastic service. Really cool decor topped it all off. You should definitely check this place out!
Breakfast dog, southern comfy, and chocolate chip pancake. All very good - only negative is the coffee is very hot and I could not enjoy it until I had finished my meal and it cooled off.

Cool, eclectic, home feeling restaurant with EXCEPTIONAL customer service!  I dont think I chose the best first time item on the menu, for my personal taste, but I could tell by the tables and around me, the chicken and biscuits might be the sweet spot so I will definitely be back!  The breakfast Sammy is pretty good, but slightly overpowering for my taste buds.  There is a a strong onion spread on it, coupled with the Everything Bagel seasonings, and it's a tad too much for my preference.  I think it would be amazing with just adding melted cheese and plain cream cheese vs the onion spread.  Nonetheless, very fresh and if you like strong items, you would probably love it!  The customer service from the moment you step in, to the moment you check out, is top notch!  I will be back to find my 5 star meal!
The food, the atmosphere, the staff was all amazing. My husband and I are always looking for a new restaurants and we have found one in Home Grown. We will be back.

Food was terrific. They have a lot of seating space in between tables. But to to it all off,  our waiter was "over the top awesome". When coming here,  ask for him. And definitely try the "Cage Fighter".

I love this place and go here a lot. I've tried several different menu options but my favorite is probably the Lynn stack. Love the atmosphere and the staff too, it's always a positive experience! They have a cute little thrift shop in the back that you should check out if you have time. It's adorable!
This place is definitely over rated. The hot chocolate was nasty. The chorizo quesadilla was ok.  The pan cakes were just ok

Home Grown is consistently one of the best breakfast experiences in Atlanta.  Of course there is a wait, it's hugely popular,  but not for long. The food was great,  the staff was attentive,  the live music is a bonus and since it was Superbowl Sunday,  I even got the Atlanta Falcon's logo on my pancakes.  Cute touch.

There are plenty of breakfast options, obviously, but this one takes the cake. If you can survive the ridiculously surely hosts then you are in for a treat. Ask for Miss Kris. Her impeccable service and warm hearted nature made our entire visit. My food could have been hotter, but the service won us overall and will bring us back, hence the 5 stars.

Food and service were both the great! When about a quarter till noon and everything flowed smoothly. There wasn't even a wait. I had the fried green tomatoes and salmon croquettes with a pimento cheese the dressing on the side. It was scrumptious

This was sincerely one of the highlights of our trip to Atlanta! We came here for breakfast on the first morning of the trip and ended up having breakfast here everyday because the food is just that amazing. The portions are HUGE so you can live all day on that breakfast. The flavors are great,  the quality is high, they have a grill outside the restaurant, they have a boutique with fun and vintage stuff, the staff is so friendly and helpful and the decoration is lovely. I mean, I dream about having breakfast there at least once a week and I live so far away it isn't fair! A must go if you are in Atlanta.
Any place that has a jazz pianist at 9am on Friday morning has to be great. It doesn't look like much from the outside. Varied menu, great breakfast spot.
Great atmosphere, great service, great food. I'm only traveling through town for a few days and I've already eaten there 3 times.

I loved this restaurant! The staff are friendly, the service is quick, the wait was short despite the line, and the food was to die for! I‚Äôm so glad I came here during my trip to Atlanta. I would highly recommend the Comfy Chicken and Biscuits, for which they‚Äôre famous and their fried pork chop and gravy üòä

Always a great experience!
The staff are super wonderful and do their best to fit the millions of people that want to eat here everyday morning. The food is awesome which explains the wait time if you arrive after 8:30am. The wait is honestly not so bad, especially because you can start sipping your coffee right when you enter and it will just be added to your tab.
There is art for sale hanging all throughout the restaurant from local artists and it changes constantly which provides a fun vibe and a good I Spy game.
This is the first place that I have ever enjoyed Fried Green Tomatoes despite my mother making me try them every year since birth so be sure to order that, you won‚Äôt be sorry.
I try to order something different each time I go and I have liked everything! A few of my favorites include the GIANT chocolate chip pancake, the chorizo tacos, the enchilada, and now the Breakfast Dog which was super satisfying with its fresh Pico de Gallo.

Final fantasy music? Check.
Cool, funky decor? Check.
Delicious smoky gravy, piled atop juicy fried chicken? Check.

This hole in the wall offers funky vibes and good service, with prices ranging around $10-15. Beware of parking, as the lot can fill up pretty quick.

ADA accessible and plenty of seating for children as well.
The staff at this neighborhood joint are so friendly and attentive. Plus the veggie options are off the hook good. Makes going out to breakfast actually worth it!!

Great breakfast spot which we were directed by various locals in our search for outstanding fried chicken in Atlanta. The d√©cor and staff are fun and they have pretty fantastic coffee. My only regret was that we were only able to eat here once during our brief stay. Would definitely go back!
Fun atmosphere, great service and delicious food. I got the best french toast sandwich and it was very good.
Easily some of the best breakfast in East Atlanta!  Southern fried pork chops are amazing!
Very good, spot! My girlfriend and I were in town while on Spring break and our Air Bnb hosts recommended this place! I'm glad they did, great down home food! I'll definitely be back!

Amazing!  I was looking for a great place to eat breakfast and I found it this morning.  After reading the reviews I was determined to ‚úî the place out.  The place was packed when we arrived, but we were seated within 10 minutes.  Our service was excellent and very informative.  The restaurant is definitely eclectic but I am a foodie so I could care less what the place looks like as long as the food is delish.  The Chef's Omelette was awesome and my honey had the basic breakfast.  Took home a slice of üéÇ and pecan pie for dessert later.  Will definitely be back sooner than later!!!

Expect to wait 45 minutes for a table on the weekends but don't worry. The food is worth it. Large portions abound, this classic diner has loads of options for everyone. You pay at the counter after you're done and there's a store in the rear you can browse while you wait. Coffee is $2.00 and is also available while you wait.

This is the best breakfast porkchop I've ever had, besides my mom's. Yes, I said that. I was licking thr bone. The pancakes are entirely too big, but utterly fluffy and delicious and their cheese grits, which I don't like, rocked! The egg was just an egg, but I ordered it over hard and few places ever take the time to give those personality.

The coffee is just good old fashioned blah and poured, but you'll drink it anyway. Besides, you came for the food.

Parking sucks, but it's worth it. If you don't get a tight, cramped, "scared you'll hit or get hit by a car" spot in the parking lot, just drive up a ways, park and walk. You'll appreciate the movement after you try, yet fail, to finish your delicious food.

You should go if you've never been!

This place is so cool and the food is super good as well as extremely filling! They have amazing artwork throughout the store and really funny trinkets too. Good luck trying to finish a plate on your own! They come super large.
I had the vegetarian biscuit and gravy with extra spinach hold the mushrooms, I added veggie sausage. If you are vegetarian, this is hands down the best dish to buy üëèüèæüëèüèæ

Food was outstanding! Can't go wrong with the comfy chicken biscuit or spice country fried steak. All 4 of us really enjoyed our meals and if you order pancakes, make sure you are hungry!üòâ don't be fooled with the wait time....they say 25 mins for a table but it was a lot sooner!
Worth the wait! You can help yourself to coffee while you wait too. Would definitely recommend their chicken biscuit speciality - they even track how many they‚Äôve sold on a huge sign on the wall.
Breakfast was delicious üòãlove the interior of the restaurant we sat at the bar & enjoyed the whole experience
If you want a place where you determine the sodium content of your food and wait time is negligible. This is your spot!

This place is awesome & the service was great. The food was delicious & way more than I could eat! Country diner feel to it with art work & a small shop in the back. Really great experience! Lock your car & bring your valuables in with you. Someone robbed our car while we were eatting here today.
I miss this place so much! Great atmosphere, great food and they really showed appreciation to military and first responders.
Really cool eclectic spot. Out-going staff, friendly service, service was prompt enough, tight parking, seemingly always busy than normal dining. A bit pricey but worth the dine... Will return.

Really great place. Had the spicy steak biscuit that was freaking delicious. If I lived closer I'd probably spend every dollar I ever had there! Quick, polite service, and basically everything you could want from a diner/restaurant

Good place for brunch. Place was busy and we had to wait to be seated but great service from their end. I liked the chicken fingers and their cheese gritts. Did not like their egg biscuit but maybe I ordered the wrong one.
The best biscuits and gravy. Next to my momma's, of course.
What amazing food!!! Loved it. Service is good. WiFi is available. Love the vibe.

Great,great, GREAT biscuits of all sorts.  Very reasonable pricing.

Try the fried chicken biscuit and tell them to add hot sauce.  Their hot sauce is more of a spicy BBQ.  Damnfine!

Kaleb had great fast customer service. I ordered the basic breakfast with 2 eggs, French toast & bacon. It was really tasty. My daughter ordered the breakfast tacos with three chorizo tacos and eggs. All was very tasty. Fresh limonade was great also. It's not "Stacks" or "Bills Cafe" but a great place for basic breakfast. They do need to add option for fruit topping to the French toast or pancakes though.
Great food and great service. And because it's that good, you're gonna have to wait for it. But that's cool with me..
My meal was tasty and flavorful. Meal came out quickly. Staff was friendly and attentive. Really enjoyable experience. Will be back.

The food is excellent and service is quick! I love the quirky little hole in the wall vibe. Only 4 stars because the parking is inconvenient most times and on the street parking can be risky in that area of town.
This place is lovely! Pancakes are enormous so you definitely can share them!
Location, Food choice are very Atlanta feeling. Service is excellent.
I ordered chicken livers and cabbage. The livers we're great, the cabbage just needed to be cooked a little bit more and a lot less salty. The service was A+.
Still my favorite breakfast joint in Atlanta. Comfy Chicken Biscuit is consistently delicious and filling. You'll want to take a nap after eating it.
The most delicious breakfast I've ever had! Worth the wait! Absolutely loved the service! Great ambiance too!
Great food, we loved the staff. Will definitely go back whenever I come back.
Loved this special little treat in Atlanta. Good food, great people. Thanks for the incredible experience!
I love Southern food. I usually come here a little before 7:00am to avoid the long wait. Comfy Chicken Biscuit and Fried Green Tomatoes are my favorites.

This is a quaint little diner where all of the locals know to go. It does not have ample seating so if you are coming with a few people just prepared to have a small wait. It's worth it!

The food is plentiful, the prices are great, the service is extremely friendly, and the quality of food is outstanding!

I've never had quite a down south experience like the one Home Grown offered me and I enjoyed every last bit of it. Down from the atmosphere to the extremely pleasant staff that put a smile on your face with ease. Food was out of this world and cannot be compared even if I tried! Definitely stop by, and you'll probably be likely to return!
I‚Äôve lived in Atlanta forever, and I just made it here. Great, simple food. Quirky, no frills decor. The service was great. The chicken strips were seasoned perfectly!
The restaurant did a great job with social distancing. I had the crab hash and it was delicious. It was just enough.
Omg so freaking good!! Food portions out of control and flavor out of this world.
Long wait, but the food was quite tasty!
$13.00 for the breakfast enchiladas.. it was ok, definitely not worth the price and they don‚Äôt keep it warm for people ordering takeout.
Yum! So good! Will be back on our next ATL visit
Great food. Better than expected!
The food is absolutely amazing! Large portions and melt in your mouth biscuts
Legit breakfast and love that they have Mike‚Äôs hot honey.

Wow! What a lucky find. In town for the day and searched for greasy spoon. Found so much more!

Great service from hostest to buser. Best chicken and biscuts I've ever had (it better have been Atlanta! üòâ)

The place is a thrift shop, art show, museum and restaurant all stired into a wonderful hipster, hippy culturally/racially/orientation friendly greasy spoon extrodinare.

Why wouldn't there be a cool old dude jamming out on an electronic piano to set the mood of eclectic cool blues?

Well done Home Grown. I'll be headed straight here every time I'm in Atlanta from now on.
Breakfast Enchiladas and deep fried brussel sprouts . Enough said....
Great place food came quick also fun and friendly
Food was delicious and plentiful for my first time having an open face chicken with gravy it was delicious
Favorite breakfast spot hands down. Great atmosphere, outside seating, wonderful humans working.
Really good breakfast. 1st time here. Enjoyed it.
They know how to prepare grits!
We got a table for 7 in about twenty minutes. Great variety available, and everyone had tasty food. Service was fast and friendly. A great breakfast!!!
Excellent food,great customer service..will eat here again in the future.

Awesome awesome awesome!!! The breakfast enchiladas were amazing, but the chicken and biscuits with gravy was SUBLIME!

BEST BREAKFAST IN ATLANTA!
Best breakfast pork chop bar none. Everything else was excellent. Service was also friendly and helpful.
Delicious food! Great service
The best breakfast that I had n long time I mean every thing was delicious üòãüòãüòã
Always a great breakfast stop when I visit Atlanta. Comfy chicken is so good I can't ever get a picture before I dive in head first. This is the best I can get :-)
Good Restaurant without all the baggage! Lol... plenty of parking and a menu with something for everyone. Saw several things on the menu i wanted to try but i was sad that i could only try a few.
Best breakfast I've had since moving to Atlanta.  My highest recommendation... I ordered grits and did not have to add anything.
It's really good. Kinda expensive but if you want that southern breakfast.... Pull up...I got the Donnie's scramble
I come for the chicken and biscuits and stay for the lovely art! A no frills eclectic Atlanta southern breakfast restaurant.
I come here every time I'm in ATL. Southern comfort chicken and biscuit is to die for!!
French toast sandwich with bacon, eggs, spinach and tomatoes, with a side of cheese grits. Literally the b.e.s.t.
So much food, super delicious, great service! Had a wonderful brunch!
Love this place!! Anytime I visit Atlanta, I make sure to stop by and fill up on the delicious home cooked food! My favorite is the comfy biscuit!!
I have never had BBQ Shrimp and Grits. YUM! I LOVE THE SERVICE EVEN MORE!
a must visit everytime we come to ATL...must have fried pork chop breakfast and coconut cake for dessert...yummy
Long lines but worth it. Great breakfast and waiter.
Food and service was amazing a bit small but worth the wait.
Best little hole in the wall breakfast place I've ever been to! Food - great! Service - great!
Great service and food. The line was outside but that's how you know you are in a great place! It was worth the wait.

Fantastic breakfast plate!! Expect to wait but also expect the wait to be worth it! The fresh squeezed orange juice is a must. The grits are so creamy! I didn't order a pancake but saw them come out and they are HUGE! I wish I would have gotten one! Great spot for friends to catch up over a really tasty home cooked meal! Loved it and will definitely be going back!
Great food, excellent service, cozy place.
Great food and service. Definitely will be back!
Everything was FANTASTIC!!!! Food was delicious, service fast friendly, and did I mention the food was Absolutely DELICIOUS üòã I really enjoyed it!
Sometimes there's a little wait, but it's usually worth it. My steak was delicious!üòã
The pimento cheese sauce was the best I have ever had.  The chicken biscuit was fantastic too.
Great place 2 eat at! Nice environment! You must try the fried okra!
Food and atmosphere was awesome. Staff is very friendly and polite.
Their Fried Chicken Livers, and I feel guilty all over again,  are EVERYTHING! Service was great too!
I love this place.  the biscuits are amazing here, and basically anything else is good too.
One of my favorites places
I enjoyed my meal. Evan was a nice waiter/server.
Very big portions of Very tasty food
Great food and they support local artists
Pork and egg breakfast, super delicious and our server Jason was amazing....prices not bad, food is good , and love the atmosphere.
Sooooo good. You have to try the fried pickles. The French toast sandwich is basically their take on a BLT.
Best parts were the live music and the comfy chicken!
It's been years since I visited. Good to know that the quality remains consistent!
Always good. Cozy spot with cozy southern cooking.
Always a great spot for a great southern breakfast!
Top notch spot for a quick, delicious breakfast
Very hearty breakfast. Too full to walk.
One of my new favorite breakfast spots.
This is amazing. I had the grand stack!!! Fried green tomatoes, pimento and bacon sandwich!
A hipster restaurant   in regard to the look [inside] and arts on the wall-  buy the food is with it order the comfort chicken won't be disappointed.
Really good spot for breakfast lovers.  I recommend the vegan biscuits and gravy, which comes with spinich and mushrooms, and is delicious.   Decor is cool, there's live music (semi) on the weekends.
I want to tell you to stay away...let's keep this place a secret.... awesome at every level

It is worth the wait!
Great
Food was outstanding üòãüëåüèæ
We waited for about 25 minutes, but I tell you it was definitely worth the wait. The food was so amazing.  This will definitely be one of my favorites spots to eat eat at.
The food was great . This place was amazing
Outstanding breakfast. Fast cooking the meal as well.
Good food fast
Atlanta's version of a "hole in the wall." Good food, cool vibe.
Awesome home cooked food and great vibes
Groovy ambience and tasty dishes
The food was delicious and the staff was incredibly accommodating! Thanks for the great brunch!
Amazing atmosphere. Fantastic southern food.
Best Southern Breakfast In Atlanta
Place is amazing! Must eat in ATL
Great down-home cooking with a beltline influence.
Good Meal and not to bad on the $$$$
Just simply delicious always!
Great food and people
Really, Really, Really great food and service.
Great food
great place great food
Great food... great service
Nice area and the food was good. The sweet tea was to die for.
Great food and service! Cool place with a second-hand items store at the back.
Home style southern kitchen in a laid back atmosphere.  Breakfast and lunch. Overrated!!!
Food was awesome.
Home Grown da bomb
Great food... fresh vegetables...  the tomatoes are soo good ....
Food was delicious üòãüòãüòä
2nd time of many more trips to come
It was delicious!
Food was delicious!!! I had the fried chops!
Great food!!!!
You must visit this wonderful establishment!!!!!
The pancakes here are insane!!!
Amazing place for breakfast üòã
The plate says it all.
Never had anything less than 5 stars here
Always delicious.
Delicious.
Delicious and cool vibe
Been waiting to come here for a while. By chance found them on Instagram. They did not disappoint. Biscuits and gravy (vegetarian & non) unbelievably tasty. We will be back again and again.

AmaaaaZing!!!!! The flavors and portions were on point! Customer service was great! The wrong plate was brought to us (accidents happen) they quickly fixed it without blinking an eye. The owner came around and chatted with us.the waitress was able answer our questions and suggest very good options for us. It was really nice. They made us feel like we were guest in their home. DEF coming back. Thank you Lalibela restaurant!

After A day of trying New Haven pizza, I needed some vegetables. Lalibela supplied them and supplied them well. I got the vegetarian combo and it was great. Get the Ethiopian hummus; it‚Äôs slightly spicy and creamy. Extraordinarily nice people run this place, so it‚Äôs great all the way around.

It's a very nice place. It's a little short-staffed, but a good eatery nonetheless. I'd recommend it, although I will caution that there is no silverware, which may need a bit of getting used to for those who are unfamiliar with the concept.

There is a good reason why this Ethiopian place has high ratings, awesome Ethiopian injera and other dishes. I didn't try the coffee or tea, but I will try them next time. In other words, I will be back for more.
Such great authentic food! The owners are extremely friend. Took the time to come out and talk with us. Will definitely be coming back.
Great food! Love the service! Patient, lively waiters! Never had a bad experience. It's in the heart of New Haven, right next to the Green!

I had the taster platter with 4 different dishes and all were delicious! The food is very flavorful and well-spiced. The staff is also very friendly, but unfortunately someone forgot to put in our phone order. Upon arrival, our food was not ready and we had to wait almost 20 minutes at the restaurant while our order was being prepared.

Walking around downtown we popped in and were greeted by very friendly staff who were engaging as we wanted to learn about the cuisine being prepared here. We shared the "lentils" (not sure exactly which menu item). BBQ-esque lentils, green lentils, and sweet potate/green beans served with a generous helping of Injera (Ethiopian crepe-like bread) which was absolutely life changing. Enjoyed a crisp Ethiopian lager and we left fat & happy.
Was so excited to find an Ethiopian restaurant when I loved back to CT. Food was so good. Highly recommend!

I think it's great when a restaurant can make up for a long, initial wait. This particular Lalibela location is ran and owned by a very sweet husband and wife. The establishment was clean and neatly decorated with Ethiopian based art. It was nicely lit for small group/small family style dining. They even have a bar. There were only 2 other dine-in parties seated when our group arrived. They were seated completely separate from each other and by the time we got our meals, we were the only diners there. Our service was kind and they answered any questions that we had. The food was delicious, especially the beef tibs, the shrimp dish, and the curried lentils! We got so full off of the injerra that the portions seemed almost endless. More importantly, the bathroom was spotless. I highly recommend, especially, if you want to try something new.

Excellent place with amazing service, amazing food and drinks. Our food was excellent and our server was really great and such a nice person to talk to and get recommendations from. Highly recommended if you want some comfort and healthy food!!

The food was was so delicious
I have had Ethiopian and mini restaurants before how many years this was the best of restaurants in New York New Jersey or Connecticut
Super tasty
Very delicious. Ordered the vegan combo platter and enjoyed the spinach and potatoes the most. Zucchini and carrots were also very good. Would def recommend and come back

Delicious food! It has a good variety of food options for all food preferences. A few of the options were more spicy than I expected, so make sure to ask if you don‚Äôt enjoy spicy things. Nice atmosphere, not too noisy, and a nice section of wines from different countries.

If you‚Äôre in New Haven and craving a filling, homemade dinner, look no further than Lalibela. Delicious authentic Ethiopian cuisine served by the kindest staff. We came here in COVID times- the restaurant was spotless and we got to dine outside, enjoying the breezy summer evening.
The food is absolutely delicious!! The attention in the restaurant is great and the place is perfect for having a different lunch or dinner.

Perfect food, and like all the dish platter.

I tried vegetarian food as I am veggie

You can do combo and it will save you some money.
Beautiful place and amazing food. Right in the heart of city. Affordable price and great taste
high quality, delicious, great service, all around amazing
Delightful experience and wonderful food and atmosphere!

If you looking for a authentic Ethiopian restaurant you find it. Lalibela is the best Ethiopian food in town. If never had this is the place to try. Vegan options and buffet at launch time. 5 star from me :)
Food was delicious and very reasonably priced.
Great food and service. Highly recommend
So good we struggle to save room for seconds
Definitely a to go place! Wonderful people and amazing food!
Great tibs, had a strong rosemary flavor that I really enjoyed.
Food was delicious!
Yes, yes, and amen!

It was our first time trying Ethiopian food. Very delicious, the dishes come with either their tradition bread or rice. They also offer different levels of spicy. The service was good, clear menu with details of ingredients and clean environment.

The food I think is the breadwinner as the service wasn‚Äôt the best we got waited by 2 separate people but none came back asking how the food was in between or at the end we waited for a good solid ~15 minutes after we all stopped eating one person didn‚Äôt come out until another party came in to the restaurant to get seated and I had to ask for the check before she disappeared it was pretty empty not going to lie on a Wednesday afternoon and when we left it looked like the server had been siting at the bar on her phone and laptop which made sense on the poor service but the food itself was really good and filling we had a good assortment from beef, chicken, and, potatoes as well as some appetizers which were also delicious the prices are a little high but for the quality that‚Äôs given I think it‚Äôs fair enough if they can fix their staff to be more attentive then I wouldn‚Äôt be shocked it would have over 5 stars
