Was missing this place for years from living in FL and just googled locations and found 1 in Houston and went crazy. Taste the exact same unbelievably delicious üòãüòãüòã

Didn‚Äôt take good pictures because the food came out quickly and went into my belly just as fastüòÇ. This spot is definitely top tier sushi bar, had a good work environment, the staff was friendly and the food came out Lightning fast. The food was delicious the only thing stopping this meal/ sushi bar from being a 5 star is I‚Äôve had better sushi elsewhere. Other than that this place was delicious. recommended and good luck parking

Really love the concept! Some of the dishes were tasty while others were okay nothing too fancy,
If you are super hungry this type of style restaurant would be best bet as when you get seated you can start eating your food if you see anything you like on the conveyor belt.

We had appetizers and some decent sushi.
Some of the faves were:
Golden Sushi Roll
Tiger Roll
Texan Roll
Spicy Popcorn Roll
Shrimp Avocado Roll
CHEESECAKE

Inari was a little different but not too bold or sweet (neutral)
I gave it 3 stars because:
Cleanliness of the restaurant, it was a little smelly (outside of the raw food), even outside the restaurant.
We weren‚Äôt treated as a new customer, we were so lost until we had to flag down a waiter to help us understand and even then, we had to read over the instructions which are on the belt of how to order and how to take off plates on conveyor belt. We did eventually figure it out.
Lastly, their drinks options are very limited-  their tea (green) was not your typical tea it was not great - so we stuck with water.
Also, the place could use some updating.

Such a cute dining experience! Love the addition of the robots that bring your drinks to you!
The sushi is great too! If you don't want to wait for the plate you want to come back around on the conveyor, you can order it from the tablet and they will send it down to you.
The wait time for getting a seat goes by really fast, and it's on a nice block for you to stroll around.

Great quality for what it is.
Service is done exclusively through the belt or a little robot that comes to the table.

Quick food. Yummy sushi. Place is clean.

I think the prices got raised. Either way, I‚Äôll be back.

This was my first time here. Great service, even the cart that brings your drinks!! It was nice with the revolving üç£.  They had some nice selections if sushi is not your thing. Will most def be back!

Super-fun experience. Fantastic for introverts like myself, with the conveyor system and cute little drink robot, I only had to interact with one person. The variety and section was great, and delicious.

Very disappointing for a place with so much potential. Unfortunately, I have to give this place one star. The Asian gentleman at the front was pretty rude but most importantly, the food was sub par at best. Even the edamame was cold to the touch. You also don‚Äôt know how much most of the plates cost before you grab them off the conveyor belt (which got stuck and pushed plates onto our table).
This was super fun! Totally a must try! The sushi was good, and the robot that brought our drinks was cute and fun! We also got a free prize after we ate 15 plates!

It was a decent experience. However, you should definitely be strategic when picking your seats. We didn‚Äôt think about that before sitting down. Sit as close as you can to the beginning of the belt so you can have first pick of the fresh items.

Food was good.
I know they are moving to a more automated no server thing but there weren‚Äôt enough options on the menu to not need a server.
Example, coke refills‚Ä¶ no option.

Other than that it was a good experience. Robot brings your drinks.

A little pricy in my opinion but not too crazy.

Came in for lunch and we were honestly super surprised with the service and quality of the food for the price. The staff was friendly, and provided excellent service, seating us promptly, answering questions and explaining how to order and take sushi off the trays. During lunch it was a little packed so we did have to wait a couple rotations for some of the sushi but they have a great selection available and you have an express belt option where you can order straight to your table. We ate our fill of sushi, donuts and dumplings. They do have a pretty awesome reward system that you can get through their app and we even won some prizes! Would highly recommend for sushi lovers and those who just like to try something new.

Such a fun little place! Very friendly staff. It was our first time so they showed us how to take the plates off the belt and wbere to dispose them. It's such an amazing experience and great prices. Can try new stuff for a couple bucks. Can't beat that. Will definitely be back!

They demonstrated how to grab food off the conveyor belt and every plate was around $3 and we had about 10 plates together which came out to $35, so $15 each if you‚Äôre sharing with someone else. Every single plate was delicious including the Aburi salmon w/ miso cream cheese, Inari, Crunchy roll, Philadelphia roll, black bean & strawberry mochi, much more. Didn‚Äôt taste anything I didn‚Äôt like and the experience was so pleasant! They let u check out digitally at your table too.

Service is hit or miss here. We were sat right next to the kitchen swing door and no one bothered to check on us, food is mediocre. Soft shell crab was soggy. It was disgusting. Too much breading and it was all wet inside. Ramen however is good, masago is ok

***Update 2023***
Food is good. Sad they never brought the banana tempura back. My issue is the rise in price over the years. I remember when the plates were a little over $2 each. Now, its almost $4. The ramen used to be about $5, now it's $10. Ridiculous price for a little bowl! We used to spend around $50, but now our total is $80, for less food! It's just not worth eating here anymore.

(2020)
Staff is friendly and the food is good. The tempura udon and tonkotsu ramen were delicious. Love the ponzu salmon and taiyaki with ice cream. Always coming back for more!
This is a fun place.   Take from the conveyor belt for quickness, order a la carte for freshness and get drinks for robot fun.   Prices are great and is a fun vibe here.

This place is a 5/5 for me it was so good the ramen was delicious and the sushi too the service is so good and I get good vibes from here and the strawberry mochi was so good I really like the little robots they are adorable üòä

This was such a cool place to eat. I'm not a huge fan of sushi, but went because the others in my group picked the place. Oh my gosh, it was such a fun place to eat! I've been to other conveyer belt sushi restaurants, but this one was unique because you could order specific things and a separate conveyor belt would bring it right to your table. So cool! And you send your little plates back via a shoot on the side of the table. The food was really good and very well priced. Can't wait to go back!

I was very pleased with the idea of having multiple small plates that you can choose from and have a variety to try. This is a great place to go if you‚Äôre trying sushi for the first time as there is so much variety. Be careful with the revolving plates as the total adds up. Overall I loved my experience here.

This place is great, great price for a variety of Japanese dishes and sushi. It may not have the best quality sushi, but there items are delicious. Also our son loves the videos and prize you get when he inserts the empty plates.

It‚Äôs a great experience to try. And Alot of variety with sushi and hot plates. The Texas Roll is the best and the seared beef sushi. Even though I like ramen with thinner noodles these were still very good. Everything is reasonable price!!! I live right by the restaurant, so I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll be walking here often.

So freaking good!!!!! Well worth the trip.  Took my daughter after going to the one in Plano,  and this one did not disappoint.  Fantastic sushi,  ramen,  and appetizers for a really good price,  and in a neat atmosphere.  If you haven't been,  you really need to try it!

I love coming here when I crave sushi. The revolving machine with different sushi is an experience itself. Everytime you finish your sushi you can put your plate inside the area they have next to you table and a video will play. Because of COVID19 they are not doing that at the moment but you can order the sushi you want and they'll send it to you on a conveyor. They practice social distancing and seating on every other table.

Love this place. The sushi üç£ always tastes fresh AF. You can sit down and immediately start grabbing food off the rotating belt or order off the touch screen above you. If you order food of the touch screen it always arrives quickly, the dishes are consistently very tasty and always presented well. There's only been one dish I didn't like in the ten+ times I've been here... it was the fried squid or calamari dish. It was way over cooked and very rubbery. My favorite dishes are the rainbow and caterpillar rolls. I also really enjoy the hand rolls... They are probably the best deals in my opinion. The desserts are also really good, my favorite is the Fried banana üçå. A must try if you're a fan of bananas. The fried donuts to me is a little over rated and not very impressive but still 'aight. The cheese cake is yummy and if the mochi wasn't frozen solid as a rock when I tried it I'd probably have enjoyed it more. The staff is always very friendly and there's always employees around to help if you have questions. I just hope they get a beer and wine license soon!

Returned during COVID-19 and had a pleasant experience. Conveyor service is stopped ‚Äî definitely the right move for everyone‚Äôs safety. All plates are made to order, and honestly i think the quality is fresher (you can already tell i loved ordering fresh‚Äî see below). The prep time can be longer than just grabbing from the conveyor belt, but for the safety and the freshness, i can take it!!
Menu-wise, i prefer all the belly (toro?) sushi to regular sushi. Their tamago is COLD - didn‚Äôt expect that... you should ask for wasabi and soysauce. Udon was decently good - i think better value than miso soup. Oh, i like mackerel as well, but it might be too fishy(?) for some people.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Fresh sushi if you order fresh :)

Kura offers an intuitive way to be served.  Food items make their rounds by each table on a conveyor.  You grab and lift plates of your choosing then once you're done, you'll place your empty plate into a slot.  Each plate from the line is $2.35 and the majority come with two pieces of sushi.  There are special items too such as snow crab legs (one piece), sushi bowls, desserts, and sea urchin (an acquired taste).  Once you deposit 15 plates, you get a prize like a lanyard, stickers, small figurines.

If it is your first time there, the server will ask you then inform you briefly how to get your meal.  Speaking of the servers...  I know this isn't your ritzy 5 star restaurant, but they could use a little more time with their uniform.  I noticed some whose uniforms were untucked, wrinkled, and sloppy overall.  At an authentic Japanese restaurant, they take pride in the way they present themselves.  In their culture it is a show of respect for their patrons.

Overall, the experience was okay because I went on a Monday.  By the time I got there much of the plates on the line were empty.  Oh, you can place separate orders for hot items like soups, ramen, tempura, desserts, etc.  Those arrive at your table on a different line.  Once they get to you, please pick up your order.  If you don't, it will stop the line.  One group wasn't aware and they didn't pick up their order.  So my guest had to walk over to that table to let them know.  Pretty sure that is the server's job to ensure the line doesn't get held up.  But, sometimes you gotta do what you gotta do.

My daughter took me for father's day. Between the two of us we had to force ourselves to get that 30th plate so my daughter could win a prize.
I loved everything about the place. Small portions so if you did not like something you were not wasting food. With the rice you fill up fast.
Perfect for anyone who has always wanted to try sushi but is afraid of the price for something you may not like. 30 plates, 2 drinks, cost us $77 and that's cheap for good tasting sushi.
For those who carry a firearm openly they do not have any signs, although you may be asked to sit toward the back. That's okay because it's more private for conversation and you won't be forgotten. If you need something just hit a button to call a server.
We will make this a monthly visit.

Great food, great price, great location, great fun! Loved this place. I recommend the ramen and the seared tuna sushi.

The concept is really cool. You arrive and you can order a table on their entrance screen or wait for a host to seat you. At the table, you can use the screen to order anything from the menu and have it arrive to you table via conveyer belt or you can grab anything from the bottom conveyer belt for $2.25. If you return 15 green plates (anything that was $2.25) you get a small prize. We received decorative tape. Also for drinks we used the screen to call over the waiter.

This is a great place for a date or if you have a group of 4.
Inexpensive and pretty legit nigiri for pickup. I approve! Cant speak for the rolls, hand rolls, noodles or desserts. The toy is a fun bonus. :) Use the app to order to go to earn loyalty points.

Great sushi train restaurant! The fatty salmon picture I took makes me hungry and longing for more whenever I see it.
Apparently these poor guys have had a hard time to get a liquor license ‚Ä¶ due to the church across the street. The logic evades me. This is where the state of Texas draws the line? A dozen people get gunned down every day in the city but god forbid you have a drink with your meal. Get outta here!!

Btw, the only thing I don‚Äôt like is that we always end up getting the fiber cloth as reward >_<

This is a great place to go when you want great food fast. The food is great and fish is fresh. Crab meat is real. Staff is a bit rushed but really nice. I strongly recommend downloading app which lets you hop in line remotely.

Good food and fun experience picking from sushi trays moving past your table or order something specific and the belt slides it right to you.

Update! They now have robots to serve your drinks. Pretty cool to watch.
Pretty fun place. You can grab what you want from the built or order from the screen above you and the belt will bring it right in front of your seat when it's ready.

The concept of this place is amazing! I love the set up, the futuristic design and feel of the place but the food was lacking. I love sushi and eat it quite often, the salmon on the Spicy salmon was on the lines of potted meat. There was little to no cream cheese and it was salty. The crunchy Philadelphia was only tasty because of the fried outer layer. The green tea had no flavor. Looked greenish but tasted like water. It really missed the mark. There are tablets at each table asking how things were. I put that I was dissatisfied and no one even bothered to find out why. Not sure if I'd even giving this place another try.

This place was a lot of fun. They have tablets you can order from if there's something in particular that you want. Every 5 plates you put in the receptacle triggers a little cartoon. At 15, you get a little toy that dispenses from over your table. Will definitely come back again.

This place is super unique. Not only is it a revolving conveyor belt sushi spot (which reminds me of Japan), but it has made to order foods on a self-service kiosk! You also insert your plate in a slot to keep track of your bill and total. You win a little toy prize if you get 15 (probably not worth it, but it's fun!) My only gripe is that this place does not serve very fresh ingredients... the fish quality is mediocre, and I DON'T recommend the Uni on ANY of the rolls. Please don't get it because I had it multiple times, and it definitely should not taste super bitter and rancid. I would not eat here more than once a month. But it is cheap though! $2.75 a plate I believe (for the most part). The Takoyaki octopus balls were amazing. The Taiyaki desert was also amazing.

Pure genius! Rotating sushi bar. Every plate is the same price, see it grab it. When you get to certain number of plates, a fun video plays. The Tonkotsu Raman was 3 stars with thick noodles and broth but the sushi was main attraction.  Mochi green tea/ mango was good. Clean, fun environment. Fair price for quality üç£ sushi
First time here not busy at all due to the pandemic, but great food atmosphere was awesome, enjoyed the experience will be back.
Really good sushi, I love the drink robot.  Don't forget the Wasabi

The tuna handrolls and the Wasabi are the best here. Rice is not done right, sushi falls apart when you pick it up instead of holding together. Skip the miso soup.. half a cup for 4$ and had a strange flavor. Hardly any sushi is replenished on the conveyor belt. System is flawed several sushi rolls we didn't order arrived on our side. Waited over 25 minutes for scallops to arrive. One server shook his head when asked for more Wasabi and green tea. Only 3 servers for an entire lunch rush.  It's too bad this place doesn't have its service and execution in order else it would be a fun concept. Unfortunately the hour and a half it took for us to have lunch was a little much. As I type it has been  over 30 minutes for the scallop. The girl server was nice here and deserves the help from other servers. I would definitely come back if they had more staff but unfortunately they are not capacitated for a large amount of guest. üòï

Idk what the hype about but the food not that good nor fresh. Sear urchin and beef kinda taste fishy/rot  whatever you call. The belt bar is cool but overall food not great. For 2 people, 15 plates + ice teas + tip + parking fee over $50, not worthy.  Save your money for somewhere else. I have tried  many sushi restaurants by far this is the worst. 2 stars for the technology & smile of the waiter.

I didn‚Äôt even know where to start.. that was the whole issue. Soooo we ordered one of everything. ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 22 plates and $100 later, it was great. Took some rolls to go. Whoever came up with this idea is a genius. It was so fun dropping the plates into the slot, it was like a coin operated video game machine. Maybe that was why we kept ordering food, just to drop the plates and have the total amount go up, for the ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù egg that drops after 15 plates. Highly recommend.
I'm not a sushi person but this changed my mind. The concept was so neat. The food comes directly to your table. My fav was the crispy rice with crab mayo.

Cool place. Yummy sushi. They dont serve alcohol. Good customer service. The conveyor belt concept is a neat way of trying different foods and makes for a unique dining expereience. We definitely plan to go back.
I was excited to try this place but overall it was just ok. I‚Äôve had better sushi but it was a neat experience.

Always here the experience is incredible
The concept for me is awesome
Great flavor, variety and good prices
My favorites:
Shrimp avocado roll 5-5
Negitoro 5-5
Philadelphia roll 5-5

We came here expected gimmicky boat running on rail for kids, but to our surprise the sushi is very good at decent price.  My wife love the fact that they come two or one piece(s) on tiny plates so that she can choose from many types.  You can also order fresh from the touchscreen.  Tips: Go at busy time or order from the touchscreen so you won't have old sushi.  I love the Kisune udon.

This place was super fun! Pick up the sushi you want and discard it down the shoot when you‚Äôre done. Highly recommend, and good sushi too. If there is something you want custom made, well they do that too!! I want to go back soon!!

Download the Kura app to skip the long wait time! I check into the line before I leave my house and then I only have to wait 10ish minutes during peak hours if I time it right!! Amazing and fresh food every time. Will update with 5 stars once they get their liquor license!

Really good sushi and friendly servers, but we walked in and there many tables open, yet we had to sit and wait for 10 minutes. We then were seated at one of the open tables, so it's not like they needed to wait for anyone to leave.

Great food and fun delivery system. You can choose a dish from the conveyor or order from a touch menu and arrives on another conveyor.

It took another 10 minutes to get our tab nearly making my friend late for work.  I also disliked having to pay $5 to park.

Prices are a decent value.  My friend had 7 plates for around $20 (plas parking) and I had 3 for $10. If there were another location or if they validated parking I would love to go back.
The staff was nice and attentive, always happy to help. The food was great surprisingly passed 3 hours here just eating chatting and thinking what item to grab/order next.
My girlfriend and I loved it! I definitely would recommend their eel sushi and the ramen and the taiyaki. It's affordable, delicious, and cozy. Would definitely go again next time.

great value sushi. quick revolving belt sushi. cool and fun interior.

you get a little toy every 15 plates.
Great service! Whenever I needed something, it was brought out in less than a minute and my drink was refilled before asking for more.

Wandered down here on a Tuesday evening thanks to sushi cravings. We walked in with no wait (but I have passed by this place on the weekends and see people in their waiting area). Once in a booth, the waitress came over and explained to us how it works. It‚Äôs actually a really cool concept - almost all the sushi comes on black plates. There are 2-3 pieces (depending on what you get - you get to see it as it comes around) and are $2.50. There are some special dishes which are more than $2.50 but they have an iPad menu which shows all the prices. There is a slot you can put your plates away and will count how many black plates you have. Also, if you order the more expensive plates, the iPad keeps track of that too. You can order anything though on the iPad (even if it is on the revolving convey) and it comes out within 2-5 minutes. They have some great options of fish, beef and a few vegetarian (very few though). My favorite was the Kura roll, garlic salmon ponzu and shrimp avocado. The quality was good but it was a little frustrating if you go in a group more than 2-3, you would have to get multiples of dishes and they do add up. Overall though, for the price, it was pretty good.

The food is great. Downside is we went when it wasn't really busy yet there was barely any food. We ended up just ordering directly because we waited for 15mins with everything passing by was completely empty.
Good sushi! Each plate is relatively $2.50-3 each. Very big selection and very fun to visit!

Super fun restaurant. Great atmosphere with very quick service. There is so much food. $2.25 for 3-4 sushi roll pieces or 2 nigiri. Awesome pricing. Definitely a place to check out, but I can see the novelty wearing off after a few visits.

First time going to a restaurant like this. The conveyor belt sushi make it easy to pick and choose exactly what you want to eat. There is also a menu to order from if you want more of a certain type of dish.

I've come to Kura more times than I can count on the past few months. Every time it has been clean, fun, cheap and welcoming. It is not the best sushi you can get, but it is amazing for the price and the experience. I'd recommend coming with friends and family and having a good old time. No surprises in pricing, ever!

Sushi was good, the ramen was TOP notch, was a really interesting experience, service was friendly. It's about $2 a plate if my estimate was right, might be wrong though. Get whatever ramen I put with this picture.
Had never been to one like this before. A great experience all around and the kid loved it!

Such a cool concept. Got the job done, I could tell it was the final hour...staff and environment was struggling from the full day...but hey closing time isn't one hour before closing. Sushi options are pretty basic, LOTS of interesting fish options, and my husband loved the ramen made to order. Will definitely go again if we're in the area.
I was very surprised at how fresh and high quality the food was. Super clean and easy to operate.
I must say the customer service was very world class and the food was so delicious
Oh my gosh the sushi was delicious üòã.
Food was great ordered Togo, but the wait time was way too long. Next time I'll dine in for sure.
You get what you pay for! The only thing I would come back for is the sesame red bean ball.. other than that count me outtieeee!
Delicious! Everything was awesome üôåüèº flavor, freshness, service and atmosphere. We loved the tonkotsu ramen and the seared mayo salmon nigiri üç£üíï

What they sell is not bad but
Bad customer service.
Little ingenuity in the preparation of new recipes.
little variety of food.
Parking next to the restaurant.

Such an amazing sushi bar to have in downtown. The prices are cheap, the sushi is great for the price, and I've never left hungry nor felt like I was breaking the bank. There is no alcohol yet, but they have an application pending.
First time eating and I love it. Will definitely be back.
Very nice, and great selection. Staff very friendly and ready to help.
Good place for sushi. Dont let the little game tempt you to keep buying the final prize is a dissapointment after spending 40$ lol.

When you're really hungry,  all you have to do is sit, pick a plate up and start eating.

My favorite here is their seared scallops and seared salmon. When you finish your 16th plate, you get a surprise ball, automatically! (Kinda like a toy from Dave and Busters you get after getting enough tickets)

If you notice that your favorite plate gets picked up so quickly or doesn't reach you, you have the option to choose and make a special order on their touch screen.

PRO TIP: pick a seat where the conveyor belt begins, so you have early pickings on the popular plates.
Great food. Awesome selection. Fun experience. Love seeing the the revolving sushi bar in action. Great prices. Will visit again.
As usual, great food and great service. Devoured around 40 plates of sushi, plus ramen. Both Houston and Austin locations are amazing.

Very fun conveyor belt sushi restaurant. There are several other Japanese dishes in the menu as well. No alcohol served here. Not the best sushi in town but still good plus it's a fun experience you don't get elsewhere.
One of my favorite places to go with friends.  The food is good, the prices are normally 2.50 and if you need a drink refill you can flag down a waiter easily from the touch screen machine
Delicious! Lost a star because they didn't have crispy Squid or ice cream for the fish-shaped dessert

Great first time experience!
Eat here! You won't be disappointed!üëçüëç
The place i been in a while!!!  take your family, friends or yourself its just great
It was good! The miso soup was a little salty but not too overpowering üëåüèº delicious
Delicious sushi, tons of fun with friends!

For my husband‚Äôs birthday , our nephew took us to this restaurant and we felt in love with it. My son was obsessed with the service and my husband was ordering all kind of new dishes. We had a good time . I highly recommend the desserts . The sushi by the way was amazing. Can‚Äôt wait to go visit again!
1st time here was amazing. Staff is very helpful and it was all reasonably priced. Will definitely be back.
My favorite place to go whenever I visit friends/family in Houston. I'm never disappointed!

Very tasty buffet. A very nice and bright restaurant. It reminded me of Big Marina in Columbia Heights. Except they had the absolutely best gyro meat I ever tasted?! I just couldn't get enough. They also had a nice dessert selection and I got baklava. The parking lot is tiny and is shared with a halal market, so be prepared to park on the street if needed. Everyone was very friendly. I look forward to going back again!

Wonderful place and people. The service was down to earth but friendly. Aromatic pilafs of every kind graces the buffet. Sambusas, falafels, even steamed and fried fish for the pescatarians. Lots of ribs and grilled chicken for the carnivore. The dessert was uncannily good - creamy, gooey kunefe and baklava looking things hit the spot after a sumptuous buffet lunch.

There was also a cold plates table with tabouleh, salads, melons, dolmas, etc. i didn‚Äôt try it bc I need room for the pilaf and meat.

Everything seemed and tasted fresh. This is an incredible lunch deal and I am happy I discovered this place! A humble but confident venue that knows what it is doing.

PS - also western foods like spaghetti and meatballs and Mac cheese for the kids.

Oh boy, I am sad that I found this place so late in life.

Probably one the best buffet deals you can find in MN. Piles of aromatic rice pilafs. Really fresh and tasty desserts. Not quite traditional pistachio baklava, but baklava-shaped with creamy gooey ness inside.

There were tons of stews but I really like okra so I downed the okra stew. Also the giant potatoes with sauce was great.

Service was great - down to earth and friendly. The decor is as it should be: diner-like without the fru fru extras. Mostly tables and standard stackable chairs.

Also there are western dishes like spaghetti and meatballs and Mac and cheese for the kids. I didn‚Äôt try them bc I got to get my fill of middle eastern foods.

Don‚Äôt miss out on this unassuming but diamond in the rough!

Very good restaurant with clean interior and halal foods. Delicious foods with reasonable buffet  price. They have a lot of food items in the buffet. Stuffs were also welcoming. I will highly recommend üëå.
Definitely didn't eat $20 worth of food.  Food was mediocre.  Would be helpful if it was labeled.  Dessert was awesome.  Probably wouldn't recommend.

Great food, helpful staff with excellent customer service. There were many kind of food, from multiple types of rice, meat, salad bar. and dessert. They also had ice scream in cubs or if you want on cone.
This play has different options. You may order your food, or use self-service buffet. I just recommend them to manage loud noises from the kitchen.
All you can eat, lots of different dishes, tasty food, good price less than twenty dollars, fantastic.

Drove by and wanted to try. Didnt realize it was a buffet. I like the chance to try a variety with one price. Lots of great options, I like the Sriracha at each table too. It went well with all the food. They had this giant bone, I think lamb; it was very tender. Lots of flavors rice options to go with the side dishes. I like that they had seafood option. Definitely give this place a try, I liked it, but only 4 stars.

Exceptional. We started out for Glam Doll Donuts, saw a Mexican bakery (Marissa's) down the street and got distracted. By the time we bought our Mexican pastries, it was lunchtime and Marhaba was across the intersection.

Understand one thing about Marhaba and you will fare much better there: don't expect much from their "American" food (looking at you, fried chicken wings). Everything else is very, very good. They do a Mediterranean buffet better than The Marina a few miles north. I didn't think that was possible and here I sit full an so very much corrected.

Things I needed seconds of (some of which I had, some of which I was too full to do again): baklava, catfish, lamb Kafka, tabouleh, gyro meat, meat samosa.

$42 for 2 adults and 2 preschoolers on some mysterious pay per year of the child's age system. So probably somewhere around $15/person with a soda. If the quality of the Mediterranean food wasn't so high, I would have dropped a star for the price. In this case , however, I have nothing to complain about: I feel I received an excellent value food:cost. I would repeat here on a date night without kids as the food is lost on their mac n cheese and chicken fingers minds.

I have known the proprietor, Mohammed, since he was the head chef at Big Marina on 49th and Central Northeast. He's a good kind and generous father, excellent chef, and you people Uptown are extremely lucky to have this place here end capping eat Street. This place is known for its Mediterranean fare, hummus, baba ganoush, tabouli, Gyros, sambusas, grilled chicken, roast chicken, Kafka, pot roast, BBQ rib tips, arguably some of the best mashed potatoes, three kinds of seasoned rice, countless other dishes. You need to bring an appetite, and expect to overeat if you plan on going with the all-you-can-eat buffet option. A more practical and dietary way, is to make your selections ala carte to go, even if you just sit down and eat. That way you take a measured amount, it controls the overeating, and it's more frugal. Mohammed doesn't mind either way, DIY card method means you're less likely to waste food, and as a Muslim, wasting food is considered a sign of disrespect for the gift of the meal, from Allah. I usually get a decent size lunch, for less than $10, ala carte. But enough with words let your eyes be the judge.
Buffet was so good, EVERYTHING delicious. The baklava is some of the best I've tasted ü•∞

I was passing by and the store was closing. He gave me free food anyways in lieu of Ramadan. May Allah bless the owner, and in terms of the food, it was definitely one of the best arab foods i have had and tasted very authentic. Highly recommended this to anyone!

I went here on valentines with my partner for a date!! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was really enjoyable. It was our first time coming here and we both had a nice experience. It's a very cozy feel inside. We had reservations and got there about 3 mins early, they seated us quickly and gave us our menus and some bread. The customer service was really great. When walking to the restroom there's a big door to open into the hallway and a waiter nearby actually opened it for me, which I found very polite. The only complaint I have is that me and my bf both got steaks but our waitress didn't ask us how we wanted them cooked, my partner quicky told her how he wanted his cooked before she walked off after taking our order. Sadly, I didn't get to tell her how I wanted mine prepared since she walked off so quickly so overall my steak was cooked well done, which I didn't enjoy but it didn't ruin the taste of the steak too much for me. Regardless of the steak not being prepared to my liking, I would definitely come back to this restaurant!! The food was good.

It was my birthday so my choice of restaurant for a good steak. We had a party of 8 adults and 3 children,  and 1 baby. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meal. 6 of us had the Pat's 16 oz Rib eye cooked perfect at medium rare.  The other two adults had salads that looked good.

Our family got exciting news and reason to celebrate! My husband decided to try a steakhouse in the area we've never visited before to relax and enjoy the evening.  This place was perfect! Loved the atmosphere,  the service was outstanding, and the food was great! My husband enjoyed his T-bone steak,  and I found the grilled chicken salad to be delicious! The chicken was so juicy and flavorful! Perfect way to end the night!
The steak melted in my mouth.  I ordered it blackened and medium.  The green beans were excellent.  The service was fantastic.  The carrot cake is the best I have ever had, moist and flavorful.

The waitress was very unfriendly,  I was celebrating my daughter's  birthday,  she didn't even acknowledge it.  Her meal came out wrong, was missing sides and they were very unapologetic.   It was our first time visiting as I traveled from AZ to visit her, abd she just moved out last month.  Definitely  do not recommend  due to staff.  Food was good.

First time dining in for lunch. My wife and I ordered steak and they were great! Mac and cheese was delicious as well. ‚ÄúQueso fresco‚Äù, was our chips and queso appetizer. We enjoyed it all very much! Lunch specials were very reasonably priced. Very nice atmosphere and clean. No masks required as of 9/20/21

Food was good. But to me a little over priced for the quality of food & all 4 guest agreed. Thats that we went early and we all had different dishes. Warm atmosphere zhe waitress was excellent. Miss the brisket in the queso tho.
Everything was ok but the ribs were very dry, I don't recomend them, but the steak was amazing. Also the waitress forgot to  bring us water but overall it was a nice experience.

I've been to 4 different locations and for the most part you can look to Salt Grass Steak House to give you a consistently good meal at a reasonable price for a steak house. This location keeps up the brands consistency of quality and is a great place to visit.

Review based on two visits: service was always unfriendly, personnel not attentive or professional (including management). Food below average. A star for the sweet potato fries only. Not worth $70+ per visit. Being a loyal Landry‚Äôs select club member of many years I can say this place is way below company‚Äôs standards (pictures worth a thousand words - ugly ‚Äústeaks‚Äù and dirty plates).

I love Saltgrass their food is tasty and fresh and service is good. Love their Caesar salad and soups. Yesterday, the Queso was salty and chips weren't heated enough, so they were hard but it didn't put a damper on my meal. Plus, my waitress was quick to get me new hot fresh chips.

Edit: Went for restaurant week and the menu is fantastic and well priced. Loved! I hope to stop by again before restaurant week is over.

Ordered food to go.  I received a plain potato, no butter, sour cream, cheese, or bacon.  And no napkins or utensils.  The drink we ordered was missing.  I called the restaurant to get things resolved, there was no apology, no suggestion, and no resolution.  Very poor service.

The food taste great! I had blackened red fish topped with grilled shrimp and a side of green beans. The manager (Joe) came to our table to make sure everything was tasting great. Lisa our server was attentive and friendly. She anticipated our needs. Great service and excellent food!!!
This is our absolute favorite restaurant.  The steaks, wedge salads and perfect patron margarita is our idea of perfection!! We go as often as we can to celebrate our favorite days.

I have been anticipating going to eat at this restaurant for a long time now. I am not from San Antonio, but have visited a few times and see many of the Salt Grass restaurants in the area. There was great parking, and then we were warmly greeted when we walked in. The staff was overly friendly, and very helpful when trying to make a decision on what to order off the menu. Prices are pretty common for a good steak or pork dinner in the area. However, you can also find some seafood on this menu. Me establishment was clean and we were served and helped by more than one waiter or waitress. All of them were quite friendly. I ordered a ribeye and it was cooked perfectly as I had ordered it. This is a great place to enjoy dinner, and I would eat here again.

The shear amount of food you will get for $33 is breathtaking. I feel like I'm going to explode. I ordered the Surf N' Turf cooked medium rare+. The ribeye was absolutely delicious and the shrimp was delicious. I also got the French fried onions and a Caesar salad. I also guzzled down about 36 ounces of Miller Lite. The wait staff was extremely friendly, as well. I would recommend.

Very clean and well designed steakhouse! The service was quick and very kind. We were seated at an alright table as we were next to some big parties, though there was other open tables away from them. The food was incredible though! I had the brisket burger and that topped off the night for me. Overall a great experience and great restaurant.

Although I wasn't very familiar with Ethiopian cuisine, I had a great time at this restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, and the price was very fair, especially considering that we ordered a platter for four people and couldn't even finish it! My friend really enjoyed the mango smoothie, but I found it a bit too sweet and heavy. The one downside was that the restaurant was very busy, and they occasionally forgot to bring our additional orders. Also, they charged us the wrong amount, so it's important to double-check your tab during checkout. However, despite these minor issues, the food was superb and definitely worth a visit for anyone in the area looking to try something new.

My girlfriend and I love it here! We love to take the trip to Addis. The 30 minute drive is never too far away. The staff and service are exceptional as always and we feel so welcome. The drinks are all fresh and delicious, I'd go there if they only thing they sold was smoothies. As a chef, I love trying new foods and this place opened my eyes to a cuisine that I didn't know existed and I'm so glad I was introduced to Ethiopian cuisine. There NEEDS to be more Ethiopian places around. Will definitely go again. 10/10 :D

Addis has a cozy atmosphere and the food is delicious, especially if you like spicy! Bring your friends and come prepared to enjoy a wide array of flavors and ingredients. Super full, workers aren't paying attention to the games so you can't play since they don't take turns and it's musty, and the fans are dirty and it's small and has no stuff to do l, volleyball is aggressive and it's boring  and there's holes where kids can get hurt and stuck I don't recommend and it's Dirtys

Fun place, yes.  Perfect for holding kids birthday party, yes.  But I'm getting more and more concerned about the hygiene condition in and out of the various courts.  Plus the place doesn't seem to invest in improving its air conditioning system, for years there are just fans blowing when it is crowded, almost all kids and adults running around in soaking sweat, which increases the risk of spreading germs...

Sky Zone is a very fun place to take your kids,  BUT when you have young people working there it can get a little unprofessional. I get having a good time with coworkers to have time go by faster...BUT yelling at kids is very unprofessional. Announcing rap battles and all employees yelling, very unprofessional. And then they have ants crawling all over the place. That place is dirty.

My family loves SkyZone. It's well kept, the service is good and the staff is good at enforcing safety rules. We've also been to birthdays here and they are well done. The bathrooms have been pretty clean even on busy days.
It‚Äôs a nice place for the family. It was hot but there was fans set up that helped a lot. My family enjoyed it.
This place is great for family's and date night. And great source of exercise! Me and my family really enjoy coming here.

Great place for the kids to get a good workout ‚ò∫Ô∏è this sky zone is mainly run by young men and women so everything is in slow moving pace but they eventually get around to sweeping, cleaning, Ect. Great pizza üçï you could buy a whole pizza too. My boys love sky zone and so do their friends.‚ù§Ô∏èü§ô
It's lot's of fun for all the Famelly all ages can have lots of fun.I love this place.üòÄ
Very very fun for adults and kids, gotta be in shape thoüòÇüòÇ
Good customer service, had a great time with the family.
Fun place for kids. Jumping on trampoline.  It get hot in the summer time no ac
It was a blast no complaints at all
Lord We Love Skyzone. My kids dont get enough. It allows the a time to practice skills, socialize, and release a lot of energyüòçüòçüòç

Don't like the pizza üòí
A small bag of chips is $2.50ü§ë
Other than that it was a fun timeü§ó
Such an amazing place to take the family and kids love it!
Cool spot for kids and young teens on a Saturday night for Glow. The DJ had me grooving...
It was nice and friendly place. Short wait if any for the activities. Will visit soon again.
Lots of bouncy fun, kids get plenty of exercise and burn off some energy. Pizza isn't too good.
I tried to use Groupon tickets.. which I had previously paid for.. but the site was down
Great place to have a fun family time with kids and family members.
Keeps the kids busy, you can kill time ,& at the end of the day kids are soooo worn out that they'll sleep like babies
Wonderful outing for the family, think I had as much fun as the little guy.
My daughter was so happy
More crazy Zone than sky zone - Super extramly crowded - otherwise fun
It was okay ... No AC... they only had one space for kids 6 and under
My grandson had his birthday party there!
Fully enjoyed my stay here at Sky Zone.
We had a lot of fun great time
My son loves this place
Fun place to take the kids. You can even jump yourself. Great way to exercise.
My kids absolutely had fun.
Has no AC and is very small...
Divertido pero no tienen aire acondicionado es mucho calor y con lo de el covid deber√≠an tener eso. Funny but they don't have air conditioning it's very hot and with the covid they should have it.

The staff were super friendly and service was great. Food is pretty standard concession food, didn‚Äôt go for the food and certainly not staying for the food. Played great music, lanes and seating area were tidy. Plenty of balls to choose from. I‚Äôm super annoyed at their pricing structure tho. I probably won‚Äôt go back because it was so expensive to make a reservation and the wait is so long for just a walk in.

One of my favorite places to bowl in metro Denver!  Brandon is always a pleasant guy, and the chicken fingers are restaurant quality.  If you‚Äôre looking to bowl for fun or competitively this is a great spot!  Thanks to everyone at the lanes!

Hip place! Nice lanes, almost too slippery though. Great arcade games for what they have. Decent prices! And nothing better than pub food. You can tell they were in need of staff, but patience can be had.

Came for the Tuesday deal. Was told it would be 20-30min wait for leagues and parties to end. However, league doesn‚Äôt end until 9pm and about 3/4 of the lanes are dedicated to league games. We ended up waiting over and hour to bowl. Our issue is they knew league wouldn‚Äôt end until 9 and they gave us a complete unrealistic waiting time. Also multiple lanes (many next to each other) were completely open but they wouldn‚Äôt allow anyone to bowl next to league games. This is incredibly frustrating for local patrons who want to take advantage of their weekly deals. So disappointing. Also if you plan to have a night with a lot of people at the bar it would be nice to have more then one bartender to serve drinks took forever to get anything

Came back with a Groupon, just a heads up if you use a Groupon you have restrictions on your lane that are not listed.

Nice Bowling Alley, they recently did a remodel, added some new features and it graded the bathroom. I like the upgrades, arcade, bar, atm, pro shop, nice retro look. They have a lot of open space, video games spread out all  throughout the space it makes it feel like fun everywhere even if you‚Äôre not bowling. They added a food section called food truck it‚Äôs inside, the food is American fare, pretzels, hot dogs, pizza, etc. They also have a full bar, wide screen TVs and neon everywhere.

Lots of Menu choices... We LOVED the PIZZA, it was the best we have ever had!! It had lots of cheese and pep. The nachos were very well portioned for the price, they had cheese Sauce on them the ingredients were fresh tasting! Also the bacon cheese fries were very tasty, even though the grill closes at 10:30 they still cooked us fresh bacon for our fries very good customer service!! Good Job AMC we were very pleased to bring our family here for a late night  dinner ;)

Busy bowling alley with mini arcade and basic food and a full bar. Nights and weekend can get a little spendy. Sat at 5pm and there was no server available which was a little annoying but not a huge deal.

Old lanes, no action. Ridiculous prices. Total and complete rip off on food. Haven't bowled in 25 years and will never bowl again !
Forced tipping for god awful food and service !
Had to send the burger back for false advertising !

It's been around 20 years since I've been bowling but this was my birthday so I decide to go with some family. Bowling hasn't changed, it's still really fun even if you can barely break 100. They have updated the decor though, looks much more modern. Only reaaso  I fave 4 stars instead of 5 is because of how much pricing has changed. Ok, I know 20 is a long time but its $10 a game now and just under $7 for shoes, per player. But I guess if I want to advertise money I could bowl after 9 at greatly reduced prices, but I'm old.

Shawn Lee of the TenBack pro shop is exactly what you dream about for a coach and owner. He runs his shop with knowledgeable employees and passion. He remembers customers by name and takes pride in his work. Monaco takes care of their lanes and their employees. Clean, spacious, and great service.
Visiting from Texas. Had a blast. Definitely two thumbs up üëçüëç

This is my favorite lanes here in Denver. The specials they have are decently priced and there are a lot of days where you can bowl for pretty cheap. They also have a variety of leagues to choose from. I'm joining my first league this summer and pretty excited about it. I love the Sunday morning 10am to Noon games because it's only $2 a game which is really nice, my roommate almost bowled a 300 last Sunday. The only issue I have is that the lanes are extremely dry if you go for a late night special, if you are throwing house balls it's fine but if you have your own professional balls then it can be frustrating.

Great authentic bowling alley, but with better food, big screens and good music!  A bit on the pricey side though, for the lane rentals. We had to go through sales reps that are most likely commission based.  However, the staff is amazing and friendly though.

Straightforward quality bowling lanes. I especially like this location because all the bowling balls were very organized and easy to find according to weight. They are also color coded by weight which is really awesome. They have massive TV screens at the end of the lanes which usually have whatever the biggest sports game is. Really wallet friendly prices too. Highly recommended, comfortable spot to go bowling with friends or significant other.
We had a great time and the staff was courteous and fast.  We will do this again.  So fun!
Enjoyed my visit but the bowling is way overpriced. Paid $50 for two people to bowl three games. The table was dirty but a staff member came and cleaned it up for us.
Every week I see how amazing the staff are and on Saturdays they facilitate a special needs session that we love attending.
Showed up and was told maybe 20 min to wait. A ton of open lanes but never used. Waited and hour and left. Woke up this morning, nothing, then 2 hours later my lane is ready? REALLY? üòî
This place has it all. A myriad of lanes? Check. Cool music and lighting? Check. Great French fries? Big check. Highly recommend.
Go see Sean in the store to get a ball that fit your needs. He is the man and will set you up with the right size and fit.
I love this bowling alley.  The location is nice and the lanes are well taken care of.
Older lanes, but good bowling.  The staff is  helpful and friendly.  We've bowled several times at this center and it's been fun each time.
It was a GREAT FAMILY & FUN atmoshere. I was first time there with my BACK ON MY FEET MEMBERS!!!
company bowling party.  treated us very well.  polite!
Very friendly staff, clean fun facility
Amazing lanes and a staff that is friendly and attentive.
Cool bowling alley in Cherry Creek
$2.22 tacos & Long Islands best thing to happen on a Tuesday in a long time. All games $2.22 as well!!
Much has improved
Clean fun and reasonable bowling packages
Great Time!!

The Denver Zoo is one of the best zoos I've been to. I would give it third place - behind only San Diego & the National Zoo. It's a very big zoo for being right in the city,  with easy access from downtown and 25. Admission is incredibly reasonable and is a better deal than the aquarium.  The enclosures are great and the animals seem very well cared for.  We did a "behind the scenes" with birds of pretty and it was excellent! Tons of great information the keepers were amazing and clearly loved the animals they work with.

100% recommend it!

our first time experiencing the Denver Zoo light show. the glasses at check in are fun! optional spiked drink options also fun! there are zoo employees on the path & they're quite helpful & friendly. there are buildings you can go in to warm up. so many interesting zoo creatures that you can see while the others are resting. we will go again! do yourself a favor & go w fun young friends we did :)

We had a great time here. This zoo is much better than the Birmingham Zoo. I would rate the zoo five star, but several exhibits are closed for renovations. The elephant show was great. We were able to see one tiger. The other one was sleeping on a platform and only partially visible. We saw some lions, seals and sea lions. Our time was limited, so we did not see much else. If you need to leave and return the same day, then you can get your hand stamped and not have to pay to come back in on the same day.

It was hot but the animals were still out and about. There was a queue at the ticket kiosk so buy your ticket in advance. Wear comfortable clothing and shoes. There are lots of benches to rest along the way. Also, they have water fountains and misters. It's great for both adults and kids. The animals look like they are in good care.

First time doing the Denver Zoo light spectacular and it was absolutely remarkable. I love how they spread out different themes throughout the park ie: makes it look like you're walking through the ocean and another part like you're walking through the jungle. Over 1 million lights! Getting the glow pass and the zoo it all pass are great additions! The glow pass gives you 3-D glasses that are VERY fun & unique to view all the lights! That pass also gives you a nice insulated souvenir cup.  The Zoo it all pass gives you unlimited rides on the train,  carousel and 4-D show which is perfect for families of all ages. Perfect seasonal fun for the entire family.

This was my first visit to the zoo other than Zoo Lights. It was easy to move around and it looks like they have some great improvements coming.  We had an entry time in the morning so a lot of the animals were just lying around but as the day went on, they were more active.  The hospital was so impressive.  The prices were reasonable.  My only complaint was we wanted to just get some drinks with ice but had to wait in the long line.  It would be nice if they had a beverage line only since there was a place with a cash register and beverage machine that were not being used.   Otherwise, everything was amazing.

Cooler weather seemed to have many of the animals inside. It also seemed to keep lost visitors from coming to the Zoo. Bird flu concerns had all the birds segregated. Despite all this, we were glad we came. It was a really nice visit with a variety of different animals. There was inside exhibits as well as outside ones. Staff were all nice and friendly and were more than happy to explain the characteristics and history of the different animals. That was awesome to hear and glad they have that option. I‚Äôd highly recommend going and I‚Äôd look forward to returning during warmer weather.

I've been a zoo member for six years and a zoo volunteer for two years. I always enjoy my time at the zoo, even on snowy and cool days. You may not see every animal every time, but it's amazing the different animals and behaviors you do see depending on the time and temperature.

I highly recommend a zoo membership and timed tickets before the zoo opens to the general public. The cool mornings are great for the animals, especially Nikita the Amur tiger.

My daughter is too young to enjoy the animals but loves people watching every time we go.

We went late in the day so many animals seemed to have gone out of their habitat and in to...well, where ever they go at night.  It was a bummer that the birds were all quarantined,  but we are 100% understanding of that.  It was laid out nicely and the habitats were very nice, clean, and there were plenty of stimulating activities for the animals to enjoy.

This is my first time here and they are working on upgrading the zoo but it was still overall a good experience. The only closed exhibits were the birds because of the bird flu risk. I recommend bringing extra cold water as it is hot and there are very few shaded areas. You can bring food and drinks as long as you don‚Äôt bring glass. Also, download the free zoo app and you will have a map that you can reference throughout your visit.

This was by far one of my favorite zoos I have been to because the layout just makes sense. Very walkable and everything is close. Our visit was on the afternoon of 07/17/21.  The staff was friendly.  We stopped at a covered area to rest.  Bring snacks and water bottles to refill to save money for the family.  The walking baths were clean and the animals appeared to be well taken care of.

Great zoo with a very considerable amount of zoo worker and animal interaction which was so enjoyable. There were also several workers (or volunteers) around to help you get a better look at an animal. We rode the train and the carousel and bought all of our tickets online before we went. Waited in quick lines for both. Bathrooms seemed to be a bit spread out so keep that in mind and there was some mild construction that did not impact us at all.

The zoo is a great spot to visit. Not only are the exhibits amazing and the animals entertaining, there is also good people watching. üòâ It is amazing how easy it is to log a couple of miles of walking while here. In the winter it is less crowded and some of the animals are more active, especially during the late afternoon feeding times.

The Denver Zoo is large with many different exhibits and animals. Any animal you want to see can be seen here for the most part. There is a lot of activities to do here for all age ranges including train rides, typical zoo food, a large area to walk around in nice weather, and beer. The gift shop is well stocked as well. The zoo is also a quick drive away from downtown as well which is convenient for going out afterwards. During the winter time, they also do an event called Zoo Lights where they hang lights all around the zoo to give a unique experience. Overall, I think this is a well-run zoo that is a fun time every time I visit.

Zoo was really cool and well maintained. Volunteers loved their jobs and cared for the animals and sharing info. Lots of variety and a decent flow of exhibits. Only negatives I had were that the cafeteria food had small portions and the cashier charged me the wrong amount and didn't seem to care for their job. Really sad that the water loving Otter exhibit barely had enough water for him to get his toes wet but the neighboring Cat exhibit had enough to allow a full adult to swim. Besides that, all animals (except the Otter and Leopard) were active and looked happy.

I have been to this zoo since I was a child. I love the changing habitats, but there are still originals that keep the memories alive. Their conservation efforts don't go unnoticed. I love the beer garden and all the special events they hold to raise awareness. We have a membership every year, Zoo Lights and the Halloween events are the best around.

This was an interesting experience! A visitor can tell that a great deal of love went into the design of this zoo.  There is even a pet hospital that you can visit. Abby was there to assist with answering questions and providing information about animals who needed medical attention. She was so knowledgeable and willing to share stories with us about every animal me asked about. To be honest each person we stopped and asked foe help was extremely helpful! I will definitely be back during  warmer months!

The zoo is nice, but I've been to better ones. We enjoyed the tropical area and seeing the animals. The food options are very limited and bad value with super slow lines. The animal demonstration included just feeding the elephants. That said we spent the whole day there and overall had a nice time.

Really enjoyed this zoo. It was compact, walkable and had a wide range of species. Staff was friendly, ticket rates were reasonable ($15 for adults).

Located near Denver city park, it‚Äôs a short 5 min walk from the interesting musuem of science and nature which is yet another worthwhile attraction in this area. There‚Äôs ample parking here if you are renting a car, otherwise it‚Äôs pretty accessible via ride-based apps as well.

They have a number of lions and penguins greeting you as you enter and then a plenitude of primates likes orangutans, chimpanzees and gorillas waving at you from their large enclosures. Animals are well looked after here like in other zoos in LA, Oakland and San Diego and have a good amount of space to wander about so let your conscience not bother you for indulging at their price. They have a fascinating selection of reptiles (snakes) and fish in their indoor aquarium. Definitely recommend it.

We haven't been here in about a year and so much has changed! It was a great zoo before, but even better now. Plan to spend quite some time there. My daughter and I were just there for two hours and didn't get to see everything! It got too close to closing time lol. Will go earlier next time (went at 230 on a Saturday). The exhibits the animals are staying in are amazing. I was especially impressed with the elephant and giraffe houses. The way the place is set up and designed is awesome. And you can tell the care takers are really great and take loving care of their animals.

Random tips: We took our own water bottles. There are water bottle filling stations throughout the zoo so you don't have to purchase drinks if you don't want to. There is a water spray station for the kiddos if they get too hot. Some of the indoors exhibits are also air conditioned. Lots of places to rest or just observe the animals. I will say parking is tight when it's busy, so if you make a reservation, give yourself plenty of time to find parking. The garage is free and has four levels, elevators take a minute, walk the stairs if you're trying to get to the entrance for a reservation. City Park is also right next to the zoo and has an awesome play ground and places to picnic. Masks are not required, but some guests do wear them. I wore one because I'm high risk and was fine. Can't wait to go back! Hope the avian bird flu passes soon so the birds can come out, but gotta keep all the animals safe ‚ù§Ô∏è.

*Our passes were free through Denver Public Library. You have to make the reservations ahead of time online. I believe the prices are $20 for adults and $15 for kids 3 - 11, otherwise. It's worth it!

The zoo was really nice! I went on a day when the weather wasn't that great (which is my fault) so a lot of the animals were kind of hiding and what not. They have a good selection of animals which for the most part look super content. They have some parts under construction and the birds were all taken in for their own safety, so I feel like I didn't get the full experience, but I would love to go back and a day where everything is normal and it's nice out.

Beautiful creatures at this zoo. Lots of great exhibits to check out. It may be because I went on a Sunday, but I didn‚Äôt see many staff members around and I would have liked to ask them some questions about the animals. I went in February, so some of the enclosures/exhibits were vacant; probably because it was too chilly for some of them. I‚Äôd like to come back again in the spring.

You'll enjoy your time in the zoo. It is great but not the best in Colorado in my opinion. The one in Colorado Springs are better organized. Spare a minimum of two hours to enjoy the zoo sections.

Buy your tickets online in advance to avoid the wait. It costs $20 per an adult.

This is a wonderful Zoo and well worth the price. Lots of space, lots of animals, lots of fun ü§© Free parking, plenty of food fenders, fun for the kids. Wide variety of souvenirs and gifts. So happy I finally got a chance to visit üòÉ

We had a great time at the Denver Zoo. We've lived here for more than five years, and this was our first time going. The zoo is much bigger than we had originally thought. They have a lot of animals, and it was pretty clean. There was a good amount of parking when we arrived at 10 in the morning, and parking was free. I recommend buying tickets in advance, so they can scan them at the entrance, and I recommend downloading the app. We didn't find out about the app until it was fairly late in our visit, and we may have missed some animals. We spent somewhere between two and three hours in the zoo (but could have been there longer if it wasn't so hot out); it was a fun day!

Really enjoyed the zoo lights at night event.  Easy access to the park and not terribly crowded so it's easy to move around and see all the lights.  Don't go expecting to see the zoo animals as most of them are sleeping, but there are still a few great displays to see, especially the reptile display.  The glasses you can get make all the lights look like stars.

This place was cool. You can bring in your own food and drink which I highly suggest doing. The animals looked like they were taken care of. It was hot the day we went and they had misters misting to cool people down. Great family experience. It can take a few hours too see everything so plan an entire day.

The Denver Zoo is always awesome! Family friendly, educational, & you can see how much the animals are cared for. I also love that they also work with CO SNAP so that the whole community has access regardless of financial circumstances.

Zoo lights is easily one of my favorite events & is a great show. The animal shows are super cool too! If you have the time, Denver Zoo is a must see.

I liked my visit to the Zoo on my birthday February 19th. and had a good time but there were way too many people there after the city dropped the mask mandate that didn't wear masks in fully crowded indoor areas and I felt uncomfortable in those spaces even with a mask so I didn't stay inside more than a few minutes. I did however see a few people and some children with masks. I didn't get to see any gorillas just 2 orangutan youngsters and no adults which seemed a bit odd to me as it hit 60 degrees. All in all it was a good day at the Zoo.

I believe I picked a bad time of the day to go. Many of the animals were inactive or asleep. I felt the cost to get in was very good and the variety of animals was pretty good though I did kind of expect it to be a bit more spectacular since it is a zoo in a major city. The signage around was very helpful and informative, many of the enclosures were quite impressive but due to the bird flu concerns we didn't get to see any avians so I was pretty bummed about that. I really enjoyed their selection of fish and snakes.

Fun zoo to take the kids too. All my boys enjoyed it despite the weather being cold, snow on the ground and most of the animals not being out. But we were fortunate to get the free tickets in the free day lottery so we felt like we didn‚Äôt waste a trip up to Denver. But we will definitely be back again in the summer when it‚Äôs warmer out and hopefully more animals are out.

We went to the Zoo Lights at night.  It was a great time!  The lights were great and they had a lot of fun setups.  There had hot cocoa and hot cider, both could be spiked for some added fun.   They did have a variety of animals and exhibits open as well so you definitely got to see some animals.  To us about an hour and a half to walk (relatively slowly) through the whole zoo.  Definitely would recommend.

Went to see Zoo lights which is a beautiful experience this time of year. Especially a special place to spend time with the family and peer at artistically placed bright colorful light displays. It started at about 6:30 and we stayed for 2 hours even though it was a little chilly. I got to see some Malaysian Horses outside being fed some treats by the zoo staff. Went to warm up inside the "tropical discovery". Of course all those animals were out and about because most reptiles and amphibians are nocturnal. Afterwards we visited the gift shop where we were greeted by a very sweet young lady named Luna. She was not only helpful with all of our shopping needs but was able to find our sizes and ring us up in a timely manner. Overall great customer service in that gift shop with an employee named Luna! Highly recommend Zoo lights for anyone visiting the Denver Zoo during the month of December and I think the beginning of January.

Our one year old loved this zoo. It's small enough that we were able to walk through most exhibits in an afternoon.

The parking is free and the tickets are quite inexpensive, especially if during winter pricing.

It was quite busy on a Sunday afternoon, full of families.

We enjoyed this moderate sized zoo. They had animals from Africa and are building new areas for Asia. Give yourself about 2 -3 hours. The best part was the Golden Lion Tamarind baby monkey which is a newborn that clings to its mother as she swings and hops around. ‚ÄºÔ∏è‚ÄºÔ∏è

We love the Denver Zoo and go a couple of times or more each year.  Seems as though things are always growing and evolving which makes each experience different!  They have a wide variety of food and nice little pop up snack and beer stands, all the conveniences and a nicely appointed gift shop.  Nothing beats and ice cold beer in the shadow of the Rockies on a beautiful day at the zoo!

Denver Zoo is awesome place to visit and one of the attraction covered in city pass.. They have community days where you can get the free pass to the zoo, checkout their website for more details.. all the birds were off the display because of bird flu risk.. Zoo has their own app for map and shows, I would recommend to install the app elephant show and sea lion shows are must watch.. all the animals need to be covered on foot, so wear comfy shoes.. keep water and ready to go snacks items with you.. enjoy carousel ride and toy train.. there are multiple eateries available inside.. parking is available..

We love the Denver Zoo! The animals were so active and the kids loved watching and learning about each animal. Even know it was chilly when we visited the kids still wanted to walk the whole zoo and see all the animals since they were all up moving and making their sounds. They were all definitely spunky when we visited about 11:30am.

Beautiful zoo with interactive activities for the kids. We were able to carry in a picnic lunch and the grounds had many lovely places to sit and rest. Our group especially liked the new elephant enclosure and the sting ray touch pool.

They labeled the enclosures well plus added many warning signs to protect the public. There were many areas to sit down and rest as well as to eat and refresh yourself. The animals were entertaining especially the Gibbons monkeys and Silverback Gorilla.  The cost of a 2-12oz bottle of Coca-Cola and 2-soft pretzels cost us $23.82. It was ridiculously expensive and I hope some of that goes to take care of the animals. We bought five rides each on the train because we thought it goes all around the zoo (the website did not state it was a very short circle) and ended up wasting time and money.  We gave the other 8 rides to a family that we came upon. Overall, I would recommend the zoo to any family looking for an outing. It is quaint but very nice.

This is a very large zoo with a great variety of animals. I recommend making it a full day or several hour visit. The pathways are fairly level and it's easy to get around. Look for "shows" and special presentations.

Very nice zoo. Last zoo we were at was in Bronx, NYC right before covid shut it down in 2020.

Unfortunately for humans, but good for animals, the birds d/t avian flu circulating were out of main display.

Several exhibits were closed for renovations.

The ticketing online did give a heads-up though. On that note, the timed entry thing is a bit annoying. I don‚Äôt know how it prevents covid spreading 2.5 years into this when people still crowd each other at the exhibits anyway. Also, it looked like you could actually buy a ticket at the zoo on the kiosk but not sure if they were really working.

I found the concession stands to be surprisingly fresh although typical high-priced zoo.

The plants here deserve some special recognition. Pretty amazing considering the CO climate

This is my favorite zoo that I have been to, even more so then San Diego!!!

I love the way the exhibit are setup, you feel like you are right there with the animals.

The tiger exhibit is especially cool as there a cat walk, no pun intended, right over your head. It's so cool, to see these beautiful animals so close.

Currently there a light show you can go to after 5pm. I didn't experience that, but just seeing the display during the day, I can imagine it's a cool experience.

Was a great experience getting to see all the animals with my little ones. We got our tickets online and it was super quick and easy. We also are food stamp recipients and we're able to get in for just a dollar per adult. There are a lot of animals to see and places to stop and get water and snacks.

Variety of exotic animals! The elephants was from China and Love to swim! We've never seen a elephant floating and having fun in a body of water before ! Very cool experience! The 4D movie was so great! The whole family had an awesome time!!

We went for Zoo Lights on a chilly night and had a great time. The lights themselves were great, and we enjoyed some close-up time with the giraffes, elephants, and the indoor reptile/amphibian/fish exhibits. The spiked hot chocolate and apple cider were a bit watered down and overpriced, but the experience was good. Looking to go back in warmer weather!
We love the Denver Zoo! My kindergartner just had his first field trip there on 4/22. Even with all of the construction on the new exhibits coming up he still had a blast.

We came on a calm weekday. I like that it was quick to get in and really a chill vibe. I like that they sell alcohol. What I didn't like was that it is not wheel chair or stroller friendly. The doors on the inside animal exhibits do not have a wheelchair button or anything. We had 3 babies so it was a pain. Also, there were not many animals and a lot of construction going on.

My grandkids and I had a wonderful time at the zoo.  Loved the exhibits, Dippin Dots,  and carousel ride! Kids loved seeing how far they could jump, and what animal was similar. Not very crowded except for the gift shop. Super nice employees!

We've been to alot of Zoos across the US and I was really impressed with the Denver zoo.

They use their space perfectly. The enclosures don't feel like cages by any means. And each section seamlessly flows into the next.

What we were most impressed with was the reptile house. It felt like we were in the jungle peering into each creatures national habitat. Don't forget to look up for the SLOTH!

The Denver Zoo was wonderful. Temperature was in the high 90's in Denver also but we still enjoyed this beautiful zoo. They have multiple areas for the elephants which is good since they need to move so much.

My husband definitely surprised me with this zoo trip! Being from South Dakota, we don't have but maybe 1 or 2 zoos. I've been to both, but this one was my favorite so far! Also, I got a surprise by getting to feed the giraffes!!! Will definitely be returning with my kids!!

I went to the zoo with a couple of friends and it was amazing. The property grounds are beautiful and there are things for everyone to enjoy of all ages. Its very affordable to go to and there are so many different types of animals to look at. Highly recommend.

No joke. This is best zoo ever. Denver Zoo is a world class facility with thoughtful planning and layout. The staff were all awesome, very professional and well trained but the real attraction here is the design. They really go over the top to provide a realistic and immersive experience. Everything is up close and accessible for even the littlest ones. You can really feel the attention to detail and visitor experience. Thing

Always love going to the zoo. Get your tickets in advance to save time and hassle. BRING A WATER BOTTLE, they have filling stations all over and it will save you from spending too much on park drinks. Lots of food options. Wear sunscreen- I mean it, and even a sun hat would be a good idea. Most animals are more active in late afternoon then they are when the park opens but also it's less hot early in the day so pick your poison. Definitely recommend stopping by the hospital to see if they have any cool procedures or surgeries going on that you can watch- and even if they dont, the staff there have so many videos and etc. of cool things to show you!
We always have a great time at the zoo! We always get the season pass, and never regret it! The animals look very happy and healthy. The kids love the train!!
Great attraction, it's like a zoo+aquarium, amazing staff! Loved the sloth, komodo dragon, 4D theater! Affordable snack: ice cream, popcorn, ...really enjoyed our ~ 2 hrs there.

Zoo lights was amazing and well worth it! We could only get tickets for 7:30 and it closed at 9:00, but we didn't actually leave the park until 9:30 and could've stayed longer! Beautiful displays and cool animal viewings, like the elephant playing with a treat box and the snuggling otters.

Grew up with the Cincinnati zoo, another top rated zoo in the nation and I gotta say. We love the Denver zoo! It's a great place to go for a walk. We spend about an hour every other week or so walking around the exhibits. Can't beat it!

Excited for the light show!

This zoo will get you 10000 steps! Better to buy a year pass and come back multiple times to walk different loops. We were lucky to see three animal talks for the lion, elephants and sea lions, such a great Saturday!
Love coming here! The animals always seem well taken care of and healthy. There are also frequently zoo babies to be seen! My favorite part is the tropical discovery center.

We LOVE going to zoos. The lemurs we're our favorite here and I was so excited to get dip'n'dots. The food was good and the train ride was cute. I wish they told us more animal facts or puns on the train ride.

Nice visit on a warm Denver day. We kept as much as possible to the shady side of the paths. Park staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely a great place to visit with small children.
One issue we had - The mobility scooters are not completely suitable for someone who is completely wheelchair bound because of the size of the scooter (bulky) making it difficult to maneuver in some of the zoo's tight spaces and various trail surfaces. We ended up having to return the one we rented because the limited mobility user in our party (cannot walk at all) was not at all comfortable trying to manage it.
