We had to go back to her manual wheelchair and swap out pushing around the park.

Had a lot more fun than I thought I would. Most of the animals were hot and hiding til it rained. Then everyone started coming out as the zoo was closing, lol. Still had an amazing time with my love ‚ù§
See you next time Denver!

Amazing Zoo! Very well organized and maintained. We went there on a very mild fall day and all animals were very active. Spaces are well though giving comfort to animals and also great views for visitors.

We went to the denver zoo today it was very good seeing the animals they had lions hyenas and much more.we didn't get to do stingray cove because you have to pay to do it to feed them its 2$and to touch them it's 3$for nonmembers and 2$ for members. It was a good zoo and the cheyenne mountain zoo was great and the giraffes were way better.

Benson (age 10)

Wonderful exhibits and outstanding staff. Saw so many animals up close, definitely one of the best zoos in the country. Considering Denver has such outstanding food, I think dining is one area they could improve!

It‚Äôs a good city zoo as compared to other city zoos. Has a lot of variety but some exhibits can be a little sad with only one or two animals. Lots of food options so you never miss out on the ice cream or snacks, even had a pretty good Turkey burger!

The Denver Zoo was a wonderful experience! It is very interactive. The staff were so nice and helpful. Some of the animals like to show off for the attention! We also experienced the Zoo after dark. It was like walking through many wonderlands! The lights were intricately wound around the trees. This was a day well spent!

Christmas light show! Was super nice, there's Christmas Light everywhere, in the entrance they didn't tell us about the 3D Glasses, so we saw some people using it and so we found a place to buy, the experience is complete different, I definitely recommend, what wasn't clean to me was if we could see the Animals or not, we could see just some, but barely could see them well. So like this you already now.

Doing a lot of construction, which is fine and will probably result in an even better experience, but is a slight nuisance for the time being. Good array of animals. Food is priced as expected, $10-$20 for an entree not including beverage. Snacks (popcorn, slice of pizza, a large pretzel, etc.) are about $5 to $10.
If you love elephants, this is a great zoo for you- a spiritual, Asia-themed area of the park is devoted to the elephants. Huge reptile area. So many adorable monkeys. Great for kids and adults.

Lots of exhibits closed and animals off exhibit.  A lot of the other animals were avoiding the heat and not visible but I don't blame them.  It was warm today.  Gift shop is reasonable but drinks were expensive.

A beautiful day at the zoo today with our homeschool co-op - even with the avian flu Breakout and the construction we filled 5 hours with fun on our scavenger hunt based off our group read aloud!

We have always loved the zo land we are so happy to be back again after all the covid restrictions! We were able to get tickets ahead of time and ran into a lot of helpful staff!

We can't wait to come back to see the birds and bears soon.

What a splendid place to spend the day. To see everything they have to offer, make a point to set aside the ENTIRE day. Really loved the number of indoor viewing areas, especially with the heat, and especially appreciated this zoo‚Äôs commitment to keeping animal welfare as the main priority. We‚Äôll be back!

Went to see the Zoo Lights for just general admission. It was my first time and it was lovely! The lights are amazingly set up and it's a lovely holiday event. The elephant and giraffes were indoors and we gave them a visit too!

Loved the sting ray exhibit and really enjoyed how close up the elepants were. Gets crowded quickly, I suggest going early. Plenty to see here, I don't think we actually saw all the exhibits because we were limited on time. Plan to stat at least a couple hours.

Seems like there's a lot of construction going on there right now. Most of the birds aren't on display due to the possibility of spreading bird flu. Loved watching the elephants play in the water and the giraffes eat. If you want a treat the dole whip is very good.

Lots of fun! The best elephant exhibit that I‚Äôve seen and I‚Äôve gone to a lot of zoos! If you have EBT it‚Äôs only a 1$ you just have to preplan the ticket online. I Do wish they had better food. And the train was unfortunately closed

I love going to the Denver Zoo. The animals always look very healthy, happy, and well fed. A great way to spend the day with a friend or even by yourself. Highly recommend. Oh! And the new penguin exhibit is phenomenal!
Decent zoo. Worth checking out if in the area to kill some time. Entry was 20. Free parking. Animals were entertaining. Decent amount of exhibits
So fun & exciting! The new tiger exhibit that's right overhead let's you see them pretty up close! üòÅ And I saw all kinds of different animals, got beer, wine, and delicious food! üòã + gift shop!

Our family loved the Denver zoo. It's a nice zoo that's laid out really well. We were able to walk around and visit the different animals and the crowd was light that day which made it even better. As most train rides at Zoo, it's way too short without much to see. However, on this trip we had a big foot sighting! So cool to see Bigfoot walking around in the background. Huge props for this attraction on the train ride!!

Really awesome experience. The highlight for my son was seeing so many snakes and lizards in the tropical discovery building. We also enjoyed all of the other animals and practically saw every animal that was out.

Always enjoy seeing the various animals.
Bummer, the birds were off site due to bird flu. The rhinos were running! Majestic to see such a large creature move so quickly

This is an excellent zoo. I'd say somewhere around #10 in the nation. There is quite a lot under construction right now in February 2023, which means some of the paths are rerouted and some of the exhibits are either temporary or under new construction. The daily elephant performances are a hit. While most of the animals have quite a bit of space, you can get up pretty close to most of them, as well. It can get quite busy on weekends, but there is enough space inside to not feel cramped together. We find enough here to come back for multiple repeat visits.

Omg it's been 15 years since I have been to the zoo and I forgot how much fun it was!!! Took my 6 month old son for the first time which he really wasn't as excited as he would be if he was a bit older but it was still a truly lovely memory to have!!! We went around 130 on Wednesday which is literally the only time I'll go from now on! No crazy school they were all leaving when we were coming in! Literally got a front row parking spot no cost! And while there was totally people it wasn't anything like I've seen in the past and the weather was absolutely perfect!!!!! Such a fun time!! And the hippo playing with his ball in the pool omg adorable!!!!!

It was an experience that I will never forget... It was amazing a beautiful day the weather was perfect the sun was shining.... My husband mind you never ever been to the zoo my little ones either so it was an adventure for them.... Perfect timing we got to see it all....
We always have a great time at the Denver zoo.  I love that they are doing adult bev crawls at night, can‚Äôt wait to go to one.  For now it is a kid treat.

What a great zoo! We visit the Phoenix Zoo often and decided to check this one out and it will not disappoint! There was a lot of stuff under construction while we were there but they did an amazing job at hiding it so that you never really felt as if it was interfering with anything. Bring your walking shoes and sunblock and enjoy‚Ä¶.We sure did!
Love the zoo, have been a member forever. Always a fun time. My kids love getting pretzels and ice cream and the souvenir cup is a must for parents. Carousel üé† is always fun.

We really enjoyed walking around this zoo. All the animals were out and almost posed for their pictures.  The staff were very friendly and the zoo was very clean and well maintained.  Excited to return!

We had a 1:30 reservation. That does not seem to be a good time to go because most of the animals were sleeping. There aren't any bird exhibits because of the Avian Flu. I thought it was a little hard to navigate around the zoo but they have maps posted often enough you can figure it out.

I went to see the baby sloth, but he wasn't out. His Dad was mostly sleeping up in the exhibit, but did move around once. Could not see his face. I guess you need a lot of time to observe a sloth since they lay around so much and they may not be in good position to see them at all! I enjoyed the other animals.

Amazing experience. My friends' child has never saw an exotic animal before. When first time she saw a leopard in that zoo, she was crying out of happiness. We loved it. It looks like the animals are happy out there, and taken care of.

One of My Favorite Places, it's a Tradition, Spent twice as long this time because there was many new things to see, it was a very pleasant day with just the right amount of visitors..
New babies to see, New Exhibits and lots of Florals...I took more pictures and videos than I've ever taken...had a Wonderful Time ..Always A Pleasure

Great family place. Kept clean, plenty of animals. Lots of information and staff around. Restaurants inside and outside food is allowed. Only down side is there has been construction going on for a few years and a lot of the animals are not in their exhibit. Pricey gift shop. They do serve beers. (Zoo lights was a blast)
Zoo lights is a great time at the holidays! Lots of light displays and sometimes there is an animal to see as well! Mask mandate indoors only as of 12/22/21.

This is our favorite zoo we've visited as a family, and we've been to a few. The park is clean and the animals look to be healthy and active. The carousel and train are hits with the little ones, and the staff are very friendly. The park in clean and has good bathrooms and food offerings. We joined as members, as we intend to come back often. You also get free ride vouchers and food discounts with membership.

Its been a very long time since ive been and i don't remember it being so confined. We went on a saturday during spring break because my cousin wanted to go.i don't reccommend going on a weekend from now until september even with timed entrance.
We walked from e colfax and steele across the park and accidentally went all the way around the outside of the zoo and they were kind enough to let us in even though were a half hour late. The denver zoo has instilled an advanced ticket, timed entrance process and it does say to be on time in their plan your visit section. You can also add their caroseul ride and their train to your ticket order and animal encounters to your tickets. That being said we still enjoyed our time.

Some construction going on. All birds are off exhibit to protect them from bird flu. Thus new penguin exhibit closed. Still doing timed entries. Place was really crowded with school kids which is good for the zoo. Things should be better this summer.
Great place to go with the family. When we went we didn't see many animals, must have been the heat of the day that they were sleeping or something.  Excellent zoo to go to frequently!
Terrific zoo. I was able to enjoy it in under 2 hours and it is reasonably priced. They have an excellent elephant exhibit and lots of major animals.

Fun place to visit with the kids! We enjoyed the presentations. It was really fun to see the animals outside! They have 5 elephants!! Lots of cool different animals. Concessions are spending as usual. Wish the 4d theatre was playing something more entertaining than happy feet. Kind of old so we skipped it, not worth the money.

Went to the Denver zoo on my anniversary to take a look at our favorite animals and was happy to find that the great apes were out and about. The apes were active and seemed to be enjoying themself on this beautiful day.

The zoo is still undergoing renovations but it's different from when I went four years ago which speaks to the effort the zoo puts in to give their animals the space they need.
Always a great place to visit.  They're doing a lot of conservation work and consistently upgrading their facilities to be able to provide the best care possible for the animals.

Great experience watching all the animals it's so fun and takes you away from all the stress. Got here at 11 am and got out at 4.30 so be prepared to spend lot's of hours with the family.
Food they sell a lot of food here.

Great zoo, some remodeling /construction going on that is confusing for someone new to this zoo.
They have beautiful exhibits and great variety. The habitats for their animals seem well kept and the animals are happy and loved.
The sloths ü¶• are hanging around.  If you are a sloth lover I suggest checking the times the zoo wil have them out in action, I belive at the front entrance area.  I didn't catch it, but I'm sure it's great and worth it!
LOVE ALL THE ELEPHANTS!!
I thoroughly enjoyed Denver Zoo. There was a large variety of animals. The animals appeared well kept and happy. There was however limited options to purchase water.
We always really enjoy the Zoo lights. They were beautiful. We also had no idea the grumpiest clownfish in the US called the Denver Zoo his home, but indeed, he does, lol.

They have a good number of animals that were pretty active. We got turned around at times and weren't sure if we had seen everything so had to do some back tracking so it could have been layed out a little better but really a minor issue.
Great time and a great place for kids. Takes about 3 to 4 hours to walk and see everything. All the employees are super friendly and helpful if you get lost which is very easy to do

Beautiful zoo. Thought some of the larger animal exhibits seemed a bit bare and lacking enrichment, but maybe I just wasn't aware of the enrichment opportunities they have. Loved the elephant exhibit, simply stunning

The Denver Zoo is one of our favorites! Membership is worth it but they also have several discounted ways to visit. Lots of animals and to see. Always fun exhibits like Lego animals. Definitely worth visiting.

We decided to treat the kids to a family fun Sunday. It was a little chilly but not unbearable.  Staff was very helpful and gave my daughter some Birthday coupons , there was employees all over the park who was telling us about the animals. Due to the cold weather and a few enclosures that are being built some animals weren't around to be seen like the gorillas, birds, and sting ray cove which is some of our favorite places to visit . We love to feed the stingrays and the birds. But we did get to get pretty close to some beautiful giraffes with their long necks they were passing the barrier and we could almost reach out to them. Tons of great animals to see and to learn about . One of our new favorite things to do is walking through their animal hospital if you get to the zoo early enough you might see some Vet tech going on in the viewing windows. We got to see the lemurs getting fed .  Defiantly will be going back when it's a little warmer to see the bears and gorillas out.
Make sure to take advantage of their reduced fee tickets for : Ebt , military,  seniors and students. They also have free days you can enter to win tickets.

We visited the Denver Zoo this past July and enjoyed the experience. This is not a large zoo, which is nice, and the walking paths were clearly defined. We had lunch in the caf√© and even though it is expensive, it was good. This is a nice zoo to visit if you're in the area.

So much animals to view. From reptiles to mammals... The place is huge and packed with animals. Buy tickets in advance to skip the line. Your kids or even adults would enjoy if you love animals. For toddles i suggest to bring strollers just in case they get tired of all the walking.

Absolutely beautiful.You can easily spend half of the day in Denver Zoo.I like that food stands are redistributed through the zoo just in case you need to grab something to eat or drink.We really enjoyed our day.
Great place to visit with the kiddos but do expect crowds. Parking is always hard to find & admission can get up there. The new additions are amazing.

I've been to two zoos in the U.S. Washington D.C. zoo and the Denver zoo. Here are the reasons why I think Denver zoo is superior.

The zoo has a pretty well planned layout that makes sense. I like the decision to keep the animals from the same regions together in the same pans as you might find them in nature which I didn't see in DC zoo. Denver zoo has more rides than D.C. and as a full grown adult, I still wished I could ride the cool train. The number of empty/unavailable exhibits are also fewer, most had animals in them while D.C. one had a lot of empty exhibits for different reasons. Themes and vibes created for the areas through building styles and music are also quite incredible around the zoo.

Why do I rate 4 stars?

D.C. zoo is free and Denver zoo is $20 for general admission. In value comparison, it's probably even, if D.C. zoo isn't better. $20 would price out a lot of families. $5 ~ $10 range would totally push it to 5 starts imo.

If you're fine with the entry fee, I'd 100% recommend it as a must-visit place for families visiting/living in Denver.

Very beautiful zoo.  Lots up nice upgrades, lots of food choices, and drink and snack carts everywhere.  Water fountains and drink coolers to refill drinks.  Staff is very kind, very helpful and always willing to talk about the animals.  The enclosures have been upgraded in recent years and it is fun to see the animals have more room to play and interact.  The famous monkey island is still there and always fun to watch the monkeys play and swing from tree branches.  The addition of the aquarium area is a great idea.  I love that we can experience sea and river creatures as well.  One of my very favorite zoos!

The zoo is very nice but it is under construction in a lot of areas. Further the birds are all put away due to the avian flu. If known ahead of time probably would have chosen a different experience for the day.
Nice zoo! Had time to kill before our flight - mid week no lines - toured to the whole zoo in 1hr 45mins 2 adults no Kids - just leisurely walking.

It was a chilly,  gray, weekday afternoon, so there were hardly any other people at the zoo...we even had a "private" train ride!  We sat and enjoyed watching the baby orangutan agitate his parents for 30 minutes.  We will definitely be back!
Great time as usual. Lots of animals out for beginning March. Was a beautiful day.  Friendly staff and fun shows.
Awesome time! We went in March and the weather was perfect. Animals were out and the 4D show was AWESOME! Highly recommend

Very nice Zoo and habitats, many different species. Free parking, located in the Denver city park area. Very kind staff and volunteers. I highly recommend it to anyone especially families. So many interesting animals and picnic areas.

The zoo has some rides but the prices went up, I think it is very expensive for families with multiple children.

Bathrooms can be cleaner.

The largest zoo I've ever been in! So many fun activities, I could spend around 4 hours here trying to discover all of the animals! The food options were pretty good as well for some burgers and ice cream. An absolutely fantastic place for kids and adults :)
Beautiful and wonderful zoo, very stroller accessable and very informative. Great for all ages. I'd come around 11 or later so more animals are out, awake, and active :)

My brothers and I enjoyed our day here. My only complaint is that the food/ gift shop items were very pricey, but otherwise pretty nice experience. I was slightly confused about the ticket process, as it says to get the timed tickets online, but then there is a kiosk at the entrance you can also use. We waited about 30 mins because it said you had to wait for a certain time slot, but I'm not sure if that was actually correct? Regardless, we had fun and I'd recommend this as a nice way for anyone to spend the day!

This was hands down the worst zoo I‚Äôve ever been to. 1/3 the animals were visible, so much construction and closed exhibits, no where is open for drinks. When we picked a zoo we have never visited for my sons 7th birthday, I would have never purchased tickets if the website accurately represented the state of the zoo exhibits and what could even be seen. What a sad, boring, disappointing day for our out of town family.

A great place and fun for all ages. A great variety of animals and care takers around who you can tell really care for them. We really enjoyed the new animal hospital the last time we were there! Very cool to get a sneak peek in to the veterinary care.
Absolutely love the Denver Zoo! Always a great place to be. I love that they are changing things around a bit. Excited to see the renovations finished
Best day ever we didn't get to see most of the animals but it was sunny warm and the zoo was awesome I will be back for my birthday may 2 !

Great exhibits and healthy animals!
Loed our first visit here. A little tough to navigate thru the park but besides that all the shows, educational stations, and exhibits were amazing.
*you can bring your own food and beverages with I love! *

I‚Äôve been going to the Denver Zoo my entire life and before I wouldn‚Äôt have given such a high review. The enclosures use to be so small and crowded but they have been working really hard recently to update and expand all enclosures. The service over the year has improved. The biggest downside right now is with COVID you have to select a time slot to go and there aren‚Äôt as many zookeepers walking around or have as many stations set up where you can learn more about the different animals. They also use to have a lot more variety of animals which was really cool but now that I have grown up I think it‚Äôs great because it has given them more space for the animals that they do have

I love the Denver Zoo. The staff are wonderful and they take great strides in their efforts to rehabilitate animals and provide a good home for them. Despite current construction it was still a full day event. Will always come back.

The zoo is always great but a lot of the exhibits were closed and the train was not operating. I definitely would not recommend visiting first thing in the morning. We were disappointed at the lack of things we could do.

My wife and I had traveled to Denver because it houses The Children's Hospital Colorado, and we got free passes since we stayed at the Ronald McDonald House of Denver, so we went! And may I just say, the Zoo itself was extremely clean, well-maintained, and full of people excited to see the wonderful animals there! We spent about a total of 4 hours just walking around, looking at the entirety of various animals that they had there. The day we went, it was a little cold, so they had most of the animals inside their habitats that were shielded from the cold, but were still able to roam freely. Which I thought was awesome because I wouldn't have wanted these cute little animals to freeze in the cold. Make sure you bring your walking shoes! And be sure to take your camera! Lots of amazing creatures to see! 10/10!

The Denver Zoo is a pretty nice zoo. It is a long day if you are going to go through the whole thing to see all of the animals. Food is pretty expensive so if you want to save a little money I would suggest bringing a water bottle and some snacks. The exhibits are pretty nice for the most part and they have zoo personnel around some of the bigger exhibits to give information about the animals.

Denver Zoo is an 80 acre zoological garden in City Park of Denver, Colorado. Founded in 1896, it is the most popular paid attraction in the Denver metropolitan area.

Denver Zoo was started with the donation of an orphaned American black bear. With the construction of Bear Mountain, it became the first zoo in the United States to use naturalistic zoo enclosures rather than cages with bars. It expanded on this concept with Primate Panorama, featuring huge mesh tents and open areas for apes and monkeys, and with Predator Ridge, which has three separate areas through which animals are rotated so that their overlapping scents provide environmental enrichment. Toyota Elephant Passage, which opened on June 1, 2012, is divided into five areas for rotating the various species.

The zoo achieved ISO 14001 certification in 2009, was given the first AZA Green Award in 2011, and was named the "Greenest Zoo in the Country" at the World Renewable Energy Forum in 2012. In 2015, it was re-certified for ISO 14001 and achieved OHSAS 18001 certification, becoming only the fourth zoo in the world to get both certifications.

Denver Zoo houses species from all over the world, including hoofed mammals, carnivorous mammals, primates, pachyderms, birds, reptiles, and fish. The zoo's animal collection contains 3,500 specimens representing 550 unique species. The zoo is laid out in a large loop, with exhibits both inside and outside the loop

Thoroughly enjoyed this zoo. All exhibits available to see were amazing. The sea lions were the most active. Quite a few snakes were active as well which was great to see. The kids rest and play area is very neat to experience. My kids loved it! Will definitely be back
Always a fun time at the zoo. Some days the animals are entertaining and active some days they are not, oh well great regardless!

The zoo itself is really big!! It will take you a couple hours to go through everything. We missed a whole section & had to backtrack. Some shows going on, not many but that could be Covid related. Felt like there were several exhibits without animals in them, which was unfortunate. Loved that they rotate animals into different enclosures to help them get a new feel every day. Elephant & Sea lion enclosure was my favorite! We don‚Äôt participate in any extra amenities, but they had sting rays to pet, ice cream, beer, drinks, etc.
We love the zoo. The sting ray exhibit is our new favorite!!! The baby stingray is adorable and super playful!! It was super hot the last day we went so we cooled off on the little splash area!!
Amazing! I‚Äôve heard great things about this zoo but my gosh! I couldn‚Äôt believe how big the actual zoo is. My husband and I got lost a few times üòÖ

We went on a Saturday, October 23rd at 1:45 pm and parking lot was full. The zoo was a also packed.  There was quite a bit of animals to see, kids had fun and that was all that mattered.  If you‚Äôre visiting Denver, you should go.  I live here so I will definitely go again in a 3 years.

Had a great time taking my daughter for her first time to this zoo. It was my first time coming to the one in Denver and it was great, will be checking out the glow nights mentioned all throughout the park sometime soon
Super fun family friendly zoo! I highly recommend getting some ice cream while you're there!

Haven't been in a few years, but some ups and downs. Hotest part of the day so tough to see the animals and seemed a bit desolate for the first 30 minutes, but again, not going to knock them seeking shade. Quite a bit of the zoo was closed, but the new exhibits were were awesome. Could use some misters or something like I have seen at other zoos, but still a fun time. The stingray cove was perfect with slushies in a sand bar next to it!
A must if you have kids or love a great animals outdoor experience, the staff cares a lot about animals, and you can tell they are happy in a safe environment.
Had a blast here, the animals looked very happy, and there was a large variety of them to see.

Very nice Zoo! We had a good time. Parking was easy, bought tickets online, no waiting to get in. Wish there were more places to buy water and snacks, it was really hot the day we were there. Other than that it was a good visit!

Love the Denver Zoo!! Still makes me feel like a little kid every time I go!! Animals are well taken care of and very visible to guests. The different kinds of vegetation that grows is awesome!! Love making memories here!!

Zoo lights was so fun!  Really cool lights, and COLD weather.  they should do this in the summer when the weather is more enjoyable .  They gave special glasses with family deal.  All the lights looked like snowflakes!  They did have Marshmallow stands and fire pits and lots of places to refill coffee and hot chocolate throughout the whole zoo.  Still too cold for me. ü•∂üòå
Amazing place. A lot of beautiful animals. Attentive staff. The park is huge. 2,5 hrs wasn‚Äôt enough to see everything and everyone. We will be back
My kids loved it! Staff is always friendly and patient!!! We rented this stroller and it was perfect for our needs. Highly recommend visiting the zoo.
My 2 year old and wife loved our day at the Denver Zoo. The animal exhibits were nice and the food was delicious.
loved it! first time here visiting from Miami and so thoroughly enjoyed spending an afternoon here. We saw so many animals and learned just a little more about them.  Great place to bring the kids!
Probably the best zoo I've ever been to. They really care about the animals and give them tons of enrichment activities.

My wife and I had a wonderful afternoon walking the zoo and observing the critters.  Outside temperature ranged from upper 70‚Äôs dropping down at the end of the day as rain approached.

There was an even mix or critters indoor and out and many of animals had yearlings and babies.  The zoo was not crowed and and we appreciated the natural beauty of the landscaping and many of the exhibits.  Between the landscaping, winding walkways, exhibits and critters it was a great way to bond and share quality time with my wife.

Towards closing tome dark clouds moved creating a nice blend between sun and dark backdrops.  Light rain started about 8 minutes before closing time and gifted us with a rainbow.  The Denver Zoo is wonderful place to visit often. The annual pass is a bargain.
So many animals and well designed pathways! Easy to see everything they offer and great elephant enclosure.

Had so much fun! I love how they have the open enclosures and how the zoo is laid out. They make it very easy to see all the exhibits and have some interaction with animals.
They also have water bottle refill stations throughout the zoo. Watching the elephants play in the water was definitely my favorite part!
Company party at the Zoo Lights. Had one of the pavilions. Great time.  The lights never fail to entertain. It was cold and my knees hurt from it but that's a December night in Denver...

Didn‚Äôt realize that a lot of the exhibits were closed for maintenance. The zoo was pretty clean, and the bathrooms were also clean and well stocked. We got dippin dots from the cart near the bird exhibits and the young man working there was very nice and helpful.

We bought a zoo pass for the last two years and it is worth every penny. My daughter absolutely loves going and every time we get a slightly different experience. The Denver zoo does a fantastic job with their exhibits and keeping the animals comfortable while still allowing people to see them. Covid-19 has actually benefited the experience since there is a designated route, it keeps traffic down and everyone moving along really well. We usually pack our own lunch but the food is pretty good there.
This was a nice zoo. There were a lot of people there, but it didn't seem overcrowded.

Very very entertaining zoo. All the enclosures were visibly
made well. Most of the animals were very lively (considering it was very hot and all the smoke from California wildfires) . Great place to walk and observe.

Had a great time!
My whole family came to the zoo with me.
7/16/2022

We went to the Zoo lights in the park.  It was beautiful üòç.    Soooo many lights and so much to look at.  Some of the "inside" exhibits were open but of course being dark it was hard to see them.  They are there and you can defn hear them.  The ambience with the lights and the beautiful Colorado weather will make a nice night out.  Lots of families there.  The reason I gave 4 stars is ONLY because I wish more food/snack vendors were there.  The lines were really long on the few that were open.
We love the zoo. The membership is such a great option for families with kids of all ages. The Zoo Lights are also one off our family's favorite traditions!
Great exercise, family fun, great food, and service. They also have some rides for kiddos plus the amazing animals.

Had a great time great family trip location fun for pretty much any age even though we had went in the evening because of a company function my parents jobs were hosting there for Halloween, it was also open to public & a good amt of animals were still easily seen! Lots to see and lots of walking so def make sure all going are prepared and wearing comfy & good walking shoes!!
The zoo is my happy place its never to packed staff is always friendly and helpful when I have had a question my family loves coming here we pack a picnic and make a day of it.
Very nice Zoo. Easy to walkthrough. Sadly most animals were sleeping when I went. Other than that, great time.

Always so great to spend a few hours walking around. Denver zoo is always making improvements to the park and it shows! The new hospital also looks pretty amazing. Especially grateful to the helpful and friendly volunteers and staff who really enhance the experience. One of my favorite places to spend an afternoon.

We had a great time except the meal we got at the pizza place by the sea lions was expensive and also awful (especially the sandwich, do not get that!). We really enjoyed the reptile/rain forest exhibit!

This is a pretty awesome Zoo. There are plenty of animals to see and most of them were active when I was visiting.

The coolest thing that they have is the animal hospital. If you can stomach watching surgery, you can actually watch operations happening. For $20 you will absolutely get your money‚Äôs worth.

Adulting at the zoo was awesome! The beer floats were amazing and we got lucky enough to get there right when they were feeding the lions so we got to see them really up close. Going through everything is an easy walk and there's a lot of shady areas to sit and take a rest. Good parking and the gift shop was also really nice. The enclosures were well kept and good sizes, animals looked very well cared for.
Went on a free day and it was great. More animals out than we though. Really enjoyed ourselves.
Great zoo lots of animals. Kid and adult friendly. The first zoo that I have seen where you can get beer.
Zoo lights was Beautiful. The staff is so welcoming and nice. We go every year. It‚Äôs our tradition. We love the Denver zoo

This is a nice sized zoo. If going in the summer, please get there in the early hours as it can be hot and the drinks are very expensive. There are water fountains throughout the park. I really enjoyed the flaming section.

One of the best zoos in the U.S.  Newly renovated and currently renovating habitats for most of the animals.  A wonderful day to spend a few hours of quality time with anyone and the family pass price makes it an easy once a week option for fun and exercise.

Always awesome. Amazing zoo for a small market city. I love most of the exhibits. My kids especially loved Tropical Discovery. Met a zookeeper named Tom that we saw walking through. Had stopped him to ask a question. He not only stopped what he was doing, Id say he is now a hero to my kids and the others whom he gave his time to. Got to see Dart fish spit and he spent a solid several minutes answering the kids questions. No doubt everyone loved talking to a real zookeeper who seems to also be an awesome human. He represents ehat we feel about the zoo. Awesome place, awesome people.

I was super excited to win FREE tickets in the zoo lottery for the month of November (this happens once per month).  This zoo is amazing!   So much to see and do, kids will LOVE it!   Thank you to all that care for the animals that call Denver their home.
Best for both kids and young at heart adults :) a recommended place to visit in Denver. All personnel are very approachable and kind. :)

We chose to visit the zoo because it was my daughter's bday and needed an outdoor setting to celebrate. They did the best they could with there being a ton of people there. They have a timed, staggered entrance because of covid and there is hand sanitizer available at various locations throughout the park. The rides were still open. We were able to see a lot of the beautiful animals and the kids had fun!

Paid $9 extra for premium pass that gave is a train or carousel ride, a 4D movie,  and petting the rays. Train ride is pretty pointless. Shark movie was interesting and provided a cool break from the hot day. Highlight was petting the rays. Many other animals were not active. I think they need a few more signs around the place. We seem to have missed the sloth exhibit. There are shady spots to sit around, but many viewing areas are in full sun. Bring a water bottle.

Really great little zoo, prices for food and souvenirs completely reasonable. We really enjoyed ourselves and got to capture some great photos! Animals all looked healthy, exhibits clean and the volumteere and employees polite and helpful. Plenty of shade when walking around.
Was respecting a nice big zoo it was pretty small most animals we didnt see not sure why they werent out but in total about 3 hours including stops an snacking so not much boring
Beautiful zoo, full of amazing animals. We spent hours walking around watching the animal. There were gluten options for lunch. The gift shop and restaurant staff were very nice.

All the exhibits where open except a couple. All animals look healthy. The exhibits where put together very well and easy to access. I will suggest to buy the lunch deal with the admission ticket online as it is the best deal and you can pick from many of the vendors where to to get each part of the meal.
Love this zoo, if you have kids are looking for something to do for 3 or 4 hours this is the place to take them
One Day you have to take out your family to this Zoo, it is good too see hoy good made all the animals

Great fun, weather had cooled just a bit. Lots of animals were out.
Lots of improvements, construction going for new flamingo home.

Nice zoo with a good layout that holds a large number of zoo-goers with out feeling crowded. Ample parking though some will require a walk in to the entrance. High marks for a lot of viewable, active wildlife. That is not always the case at municipal zoos. Worth a visit if you are in the Denver area especially if you have kids.
Had a great time. Lots to see but a lot of the animals were not in their enclosures. Plan for an all day visit. Bottle drinks were $5 so I'd bring your own.

Definately one of the top zoo's I've been to. I took my little guy. He thoroughly enjoyed it. I went on a went one a wednesday there was a light crowd which was great. I was able to see everything in under 1.5 hours. The layout of the zoo is well organized. The stingray pool was a good experience its definately something you would want to do... its $3 to enter but worth it.
Love visiting Denver Zoo! I do wish there was a line just for members like they once had bc the lines can be long. The food at elephant passage is our favorite and is the best quality in our opinion.
This was a special excursion for us during the holiday lights at the zoo. Amazing displays, amazing funnel cakes plus other treats, and amazing adult beverages.
Using annual pass we were able to enter at 830am! No crowds. Animals were more active than later in the day. We enjoyed the elephant talk, clouded leopard, and gibbons.
Great exhibits but could use some more signage with directions, like actual intersection signposts to diffrent exhibits.
Definitely love the Denver Zoo during the winter. The ZooLights are an amazing experience. They do an amazing job with the lighting.
The zoo was really nice. Great to walk around and enjoy the amazing Denver weather. Lots of animals that were clearly well taken care of with really nice exhibits.

Always a blast at the zoo. Wish the stingrays were included in admission. Lots of exhibits did look closed and it was hot so a lot of the animals were hiding out of site. Nothing new with the animals hiding though. Overall lots of fun.

Haven't visited since I was a kid in the 90s and they have done alot of work to improve the environment as a whole. My son had a boat and lived learning new things about the animals. The new sloths are ADORABLE. ‚ù§
Perfect Zoo! Very walkable and active animals! We come every time we are in Denver and it's always been a great experience! The kids love it so much.

I am only giving this zoo 4 stars because they really should have cooling stations. I get that most days it is not as hot as it was today, but having just come from the Colorado Springs Zoo where there are plenty of cooling stations, it would have been nice. We would have stayed longer and for sure have sat down for a meal but it was way too hot. Lovely though and lots to see. Kris in the elephant area was extremely informative and was very pleasant to talk to. She also had great style!
Amazing experience and one of the best zoo's I've ever visited! Great, friendly and knowledgeable staff and volunteers. Worth every minute!

I have gone to the Denver zoo for 25 years and am always impressed. The animals get good space and are well cared for. It‚Äôs so nice to see the Zoo constantly get upgraded and invested in. Very impressive zoo with covered underground parking and a ton of shade through out. I always feel like I got a good opportunity to see animals and learn something new each time. I also enjoy that they are incorporating more interactive animal experiences.
I love visiting the Denver Zoo on my off days. I'm a truck driver from Alabama working in Denver and I enjoy the experience as well as the exercise. Sure beats sitting in a truck all day!

The animals were glorious with nice thematic enclosures. But, the map is very hard to interpret and it's hard to find one's way around without many signs or directional arrows - that was frustrating.  The tiger exhibit was one of the coolest and we loved the animated orangutans!

Who doesn't like the zoo! It's a great place for when I was a kid and continues to be for my kid. I was sad that some of the animals where not on display due to exhibits changing but just means that they will have another great thing in the near future to check out.

We always have a great time at the zoo. We like to arrive early when the animals are active and being feed. During the summer the food carts are great and the space for the animals to roam around the zoo is adequate. The zoo is clean and the keepers and animals seem relaxed!

So much to see! Plenty of places in between to sit and enjoy refreshments. Overall great place for every walk of life. Take a map because you may get lost with so many different paths to take. Can't wait for our next visit.
Fun way to spend an afternoon! Denver zoo is small enough to walk the whole thing in a couple hours, but big enough to have all the animals you hope to see at the zoo
Wonderful zoo and the animals all seem really well cared for. Staff is knowledgeable and helpful.

Denver Zoo is pretty sizeable. They have pretty much any animal you want to see even komodo dragons and elephants. Enclosures looks well kept and most of the animals were out and visible. The zoo app helped immensely with navigating around the park.

Fantastic free parking and very reasonable admission prices.  Some exhibits were closed for a private dinner event and about 3/4 of the outdoor animals were already sheltered for a cold evening. About 80% of the vendors were closed. But no worries, gotta make the donors happy and gotta keep the animals warm. We were the patrons who chose to come on a Tuesday afternoon before a snowy night. Overall I would recommend this zoo, the elephant exhibits were top notch and the best we have ever seen. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Would definitely go back during the warmer seasons to see the difference!

We LOVE the Denver Zoo.
I‚Äôm an Aupair, in Colorado since October 2020 and take care of two kids, ages 1,5 & 5 years old.
We come here every week, the staff is super friendly, they have programs, shows, volunteers introducing animals to the kids, there is a carousel & a train & around Halloween there are even people walking around, dressed in super cool costumes.

Also if I actually don‚Äôt like Zoo‚Äôs, bc it‚Äôs kind of animal abuse, but Denver Zoo does their best & I appreciate it as an opportunity to spend a nice day with my kids & as an opportunity to talk to my kids about the differences of animals in freedom and in a Zoo‚Ä¶
Nice zoo. We didn't have a lot of time, so had to skip a few things. I'd recommend at least 4 hours to see it all.
We just love coming to the Zoo. My kids have a great time and always see something new. Having the reservation system so nice. Since it's not over crowded you can actually see the animals.

Great experience.  It was sad to see that the bald eagle had such a small cage tho.  Also there are so many additional fees inside as well.  They weren't outrageous but you esn't to experience everything be prepared to pay extra inside.
Fun Zoo not too crowded. Cute stuffy and very clean. The water spray is so good and helpful to combat heat.
Really awesome zoo!  The elephants were cool and the monkeys were funny. I'd absolutely go back!

This zoo was a great experience you gotta see and have closed personal view of the animals and there was a lot of animals to choose from to see. I suggest going early in the morning and beating the heat and the crowd here

The TIME IS NOW We go every Year bring your Walking shoes snacks and food get a little pricey so eat before you go also bring snacks for the kids save a little $$ for the shops. Bathroom is not that convenient when in middle of zoo so I suggest using it before going to far there are some a front when you enter! Items suggested sun screen,visor, sun glasses, good walking shoes, snacks, hard candy works great! GUM is a big NO NO can make animals sick or stick to your shoes! Most of the animals come out mid afternoon we like to watch them after they eat or right before Denver ZOO Closes! Buy the yearly pass helped us go more often, also get your tickets online if you're interested in the weekend it gets a little crowded!

Was a nice experience...staff friendly and knowledgeable of all animals! Wish more animals were out...lots of exhibits were empty. Very nice Zoo but can easily miss some areas if not paying attention.
Great zoo! Big variety of animals, huge enclosures for the bigger animals, and lots of passionate, informative zookeepers/employees. Would recommend!
What a great Zoo! Price point, too! Not a lot hills as other ones we have gone to.

The Denver zoo is a very nice Zoo with plenty of great views of the animal residents.  We spent almost 3 hours exploring everything. The collection of venomous snakes is impressive and you can actually see them unlike some zoos. There were several young animals to look at, too cute! We never got to see any gorillas but I imagine it was too warm for them. I would recommend this zoo. I did find the food prices pretty high, but it's the same at every zoo I've been to.

Always purchase tickets in advance. They no longer have a ticket window but just have kiosks. However, since tickets are timed entry and limited to a certain number of people, there have been days where they sell out all together.
The food selections are pretty standard for a place like this (hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken fingers, fries, soft serve ice cream including the Dole Whip like they have at the Disney Parks, and stands for pretzels, beer, Dippin' Dots, popcorn (extremely salty), and cotton candy to name a few).
The long standing staple at the zoo, The Bird House, is closed and looks to be slated for demolition or huge renovation. I will miss that place. The old "Cat House" has been closed for a couple years now and it's not obvious what they're going to do with it. But there are many changes coming in the future. I just hope it's not too seriously delayed from Covid-19.
My new favorites are the Painted Wild Dogs. They are very interested in the people and what they want. One growled at my husband because it was challenging the direct eye contact. I love so many of the animals there but I deeply miss the Red Pandas. I hope they bring some in soon.
Another favorite thing about the Denver Zoo is the beautiful gardens. The cacti are gorgeous and the seasonal switch of flowers throughout the park is so well done.
My husband and I are members of the zoo and visit regularly. It's still one of our top 5 zoos we've visited across the country.
We had a blast at the Denver Zoo. Very very hot but we managed to find places with shade. Some animals were sleeping or hiding in their cubbies. The moneys were pretty active in the heat.
Christmas lights were amazing didn't even see many animals still had a wonderful time.

Ever since I was a little kid I loved our zoo in Colorado,  it has done great over the years how ever we don't have polar bears there anymore  I really wanted to show my kids , they need to have more motorized scooters and maybe for 20 like it was instead of 30 , I really wish the bird place was open.
It's a pretty amazing experience but I wish it had more mist stations or just shaded places in general.
Fun place to spend a few hours. Geared towards families, but my wife and I enjoyed ourselves as 30 year olds. Good beers to be had. Animals were active. I'd say it feels a bit dated though.
Beautiful zoo and lots of great exhibits. Kids love it!

Great variety of animals, many ways to see them inside and outside depending on the weather. Multiple viewing angles so easy to see for all ages and sizes. Definitely an all day event for a full loop but easy to only do half with the paths they've made. Only issue is very limited bathroom points throughout so make sure you stop when you can because my kids almost didn't make it to the next one. Staff isn't as friendly since restrictions but definitely worth a visit and membership!
I was selected to receive tickets through their community days program. I love it. Animals are blessing on this earth and just watching how majestic they are is a delight.
Very nice zoo! Decent ticket price, lots of animals, and free parking!!

2022 update:
Still super cool. They had zoo lights going (just came down today) and so many awesome animals.
2019: It‚Äôs like being transported to different parts of the world. Such a cool zoo!

My second time here (May 2021). My first trip to the Denver Zoo was 2017. I didn't get to see many of the animals I'd hope to see, but there overall layout and consideration to the habitats was impressive, aside from the construction. Decent snack options but not much variety. Expensive beverages. The gift shop is cute. We went on a weekend which wasn't ideal, so it was a little crowded. Tip: buy your tickets online to avoid the ticket line, which doesn't move as quickly as it should. Was hoping for more primates.
Highly  recommend  going if you haven't  been there in awhile, It's  been  upgraded everything is new or different lots of fun.

Beautiful zoo, really loved all exhibits. Its a decent size and all animal enclosures look good, clean and full of enrichment toys. Keepers look to really care for the animals and they answer questions. One of my top 5 zoos definitely dont want to miss if you're in town.
Me and my wife love going to the zoo its nice to to just walk and talk and see the new animal's and the baby's there so cool can't wait for boo at the zoo.
We went on a Monday morning and had the place to ourselves. If you go early enough, all the animals are fairly active and you don't have to fight crowds to see.
Great place for the kids. Tons of animals and we got to be hands on with a box turtle. The zoo is clean and there is some quality food if you know where to look.
Beautiful and thoughtful zoo. Don't miss the pollinator trail. The Elephant bridge is spectacular! It took us about 4 hours to see all the animals. Bring your own food and have a picnic.

It was a nice change from Cheyenne Mountain Zoo where we normally go.  A lot of construction going on and that made getting from one place to another difficult. Some exhibits were unavailable and was a disappointment,  but there was still plenty to see and shade was easy to find. I loved seeing the otters and lions.
Love the zoo! Lots of animals,it's of upgrades, and lots of fun! Always a great time for family with or without children.  Adult beverages and kid fun foods.
Awesome experienceüëå clean and well-maintained. Staff are nice. Kid and adult-friendly place. A must visit when going to Denver ar nearby places in Colorado for the young and young at heart.‚ù§

All the staff is so nice and they really treat you great as well as having some wonderful animals. My fiance and I spent the day there and had such a great time! I always love seeing animals we wouldn't be able to normally see unless you travel great distances.
Had a great time at the zoo with family, and our 18 month great nephew. He had a blast

I‚Äôm from Texas and this was my first time going to the Denver zoo with my family and I really enjoyed it. They had a wide selection of animals and the enclosures look a lot like the animals natural habitats. The zoo overall felt real jungle like which made it feel extremely natural. I especially enjoyed the baby Komodo dragon they had.

Love coming here to see the animals with my nephews (2 and 4). The keepers are patient and love explaining things and answering questions, and the animals have good spaces, healthy food, and active training. Love the Toyota Elephant Passage, a special habitat for male elephants. We visit often!

Updated 5/30/22
Nephews are now 8 and almost 6 and still love it here. Keepers and docents are so knowledgeable and I love the conservation work being done here and around the world!

The animal selection is impressive. I will say that the variety of being able to see different animals from most zoos we're nice.

Customer service solid.

BUTT

The lack of a playroom for some of these animals is a hit alarming. Just don't see a whole lot of space to let these animals be themselves within the guidelines of safety, that is.

Made the trip in different more than happy

It was a pleasant experience there was new attractions the most of all the staff over there at the zoo was really awesome the concierge staff has great customer service i
Love it looking forward to going backüôÇ
Beautiful zoo. Wonderful animal exhibits . Family loves coming here. Always such a pleasure watching these beautiful animals. They seem very well cared for. We enjoy coming as frequently as we can.
Went for zoo lights. They never disappoint.  The beignets were perfect!

This is such a fun experience. You need to schedule a time online and buy tickets. which is really nice because it seems to limit the huge crowds. If you have a Snap card I believe it is a dollar a person. The zoo does close at 5pm so make sure you leave yourself enough time to discover everything.  The animals seems alot more mobil and active without the huge crowds but I could be wrong. What I loved is the geese just had all of there babies so there are tons of little goslings running around.
There are tons of snacks like popcorn, cotton candy, beer and if you have children there is a food court.
The only reason I took off a star is because it's a little dirty and I felt an urgency to wash my hands.

It's been quite a few years since my family visited this zoo. We enjoyed it. We had an appointment and used the app (instead of a zoo map) to get around. You can also follow the arrows painted on the ground. It was the beginning of summer break, but wasn't too crowded. Still there were enough people that 6' social distancing wasn't possible. There was comfortable distancing.

Hadn't been to the zoo in a while, but was pleasantly surprised at my first post-Pandemic visit. The workers were attentive, most of the exhibits were populated, and the animals were the most active that I've ever seen them. It seemed like some of the more intelligent animals were somewhat afraid of the crowds, but I'm sure they are still adjusting to the larger numbers of guests coming to visit.

Great day trip take own picnic or there are food stands. Train and carousel rides. Lots has change, some things are gone, like the one animal theater. They did add new interactive exhibit for people but does have an additional price. Food displayed in photo was way too expensive. We could have gone to a nice restaurant for lunch for about 20 more dollars this cost over 45.00 for those small samples. Burgers were over 12 dollars each. Lots of construction and detours no birds on display because of bird flu concerns

Absolutely beautiful place and love that there is more to come! Spent a good couple hours here which is nice compared to other events. I also enjoyed the variety of options for guest, such as little for adults and kids. I also loved how there was signage for high touch zones plus lots of sanitizer stations. Would definitely come again!
We experienced alot of fun stuff, but due to construction it felt quite empty.
Go at 10am in the summer when it opens to catch the lions and elephants.. They're back in their house by 11am , because of the warm temperatures.
This place was one of the best zoos we gone to as a family.

It was our first time visiting, and we had such a lovely time, my family was delighted. The gift shop has more than plenty of options, great for buying souvenirs that match everyone's needs. Would definitely visit again!
Love this zoo. Pretty sure we were able to see everyone except sting rays

I got to admit at first I thought the entrance fee was a little high ($20 adult) but it was totally worth it. They have lots of animals that other zoos don‚Äôt have, many African and Australian animals.
Do bring sunscreen in the summer months and do bring a backpack with water and snacks to complete your journey.

Very nice. The grounds were clean. Viewing areas were easy to see into. Friendly and informative staff. The special stingray exhibit was especially awesome, as we got to feed them. Quite the experience!
Zoo lights are beautiful, and we had a great experience.
The zoo is always fun and always something new to see

EDIT 12/5/22 This zoomeber disappointments. 8/2020 It's a crazy year and the zoo is managing to keep us entertained. Lots of zoo babies and Lego animals. I love this place.
Always a treat. Denver Zoo never fails to have something amazing happen. Today we got a treat from the hippo. Some say the animals don't have enough room. The zoo is over 80 acres and practices animal conservation. Not saying there isn't room for improvement there is always room for improvement. This is a great zoo. They serve great food too. Reasonably priced food. I renewed my yearly membership and have started doing the animal experiences. Wow. I will be doing them all. Not only do you get special experiences with the animals you get to support the zoo even more. EDIT: I'm looking forward to the new Australian Exhibit.
Very nice zoo. I recommend visiting it if you‚Äôre in Denver.
The Denver Zoo lights are awesome! Didn‚Äôt have a ton of time to walk through so make sure to get there early!
We had a great day at the zoo. We wished more animals were out but the weather was changing.
I love coming to this zoo! Been coming here since I was a kid, a lot to see! Kiddos had a blast!
Here for our annual favorite, Zoo Lights! Always a great time with plenty to see all year
Great place to spend the day with the kids! They have so many different animals and a big area to walk around to help make the kids tired! We always love a good zoo day!!
Always a good day/time for a walk. My kiddos are always excited everytime we're going. That's why i recommend to everyone to get a annual pass for the family.
Awesome zoo!! Great exhibits with fairly active animals. It's a pretty large zoo, so be sure to leave yourself a few hours to see everything.
The zoo was great! The had traffic routed to be only one way and encouraged social distancing with mask! The elephants and orangutans put on shows and kept us entertained.

This is the first time visiting here since 2008. I love that the zoo is now set up for social distancing. We got to see some amazing animals and it was quite a nice walk. Love that there are places to sit and bathrooms conveniently located throughout the whole trail. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Only recommendation for guests is to bring a water bottle. We didn't and the drinks are super pricey.

I've only been there three time.
the first two times I went with my family

The third time I Went on a field trip with the Arc thrift stores  the zoo made it a little easier to navigate since they marked all marked the pathways and trail with arrows indicating which direction to go. this insure that you can get to almost all exhibits.  except a lot of places are under construction

However I really enjoy the train ride on a 2ft Narrow gauge railroad
Went to zoo lights and it was so neat, great way to get in the holiday spirit.

This was the most beautiful Christmas set up I have ever been to! Everything was covered in lights! It was amazing. Some of the animals were out too which was super cool. We saw elephants, lions, seals, llamas, and we even got to see them feed the penguins! It was a great experience and well worth the ticket price. I think it took us over an hour to walk through the whole thing.
Kids loved it, wasn't too crowded, and they serve beer and other canned cocktails.

Always a wonderful place for the family! New animals coming soon. Gloomy days are not the greatest, but less crowded. Very accommodating for the current situations. Still able to bring your own food and food places are still available through mobile ordering.
Old zoo but I still had a good time
Spacious exhibits compared to some other larger zoos. Well maintained grounds. Staff, especially the volunteers, were helpful and insightful.

Update: plenty of sanitizing stations and the facilities are cleaned regularly.
Stingray Cove is a must see and not over priced to enter or feed the animals.
Fun little cabana next to it with tacos and margaritas.
No one under 16 can feed or enter the stingray exhibit without an adult present.
Always recommend getting a year pass if your a local. Save yourself some money and keep this wonderful zoo well funded. (7/17/21)

Beautiful exhibits, staff is very friendly and helpful with answering questions.

Recommend getting a year pass-%10 off food and drinks, %20 off souvenir shops.

At the brewery stands purchase the souvenir glass and that combined with your year pass gets your drink cheaper and it‚Äôs worth it! It‚Äôs pricey the first time because you are purchasing the glass, but when you bring it with you for your next beer it‚Äôs cheaper.

Purchase the souvenir soda cup for around $5 and then your refills are around $1.50.

You can pack in lunches and find plenty of places to sit and eat.

Parking is a little snug since it is next to the museum and if the museum is packed unfortunately some people come and park at the zoo and walk over to the museum. Taking spots away from people trying to go to the zoo.
Sadly it happens a lot and I‚Äôve seen it all to often. Frustrating!
Come at opening time and you will have easy parking. Come at lunch time and it‚Äôs much harder to find parking.
We had a great time walking and exploring animals, spent 2 hours here, big bonus parking was free and unlimited. If u have kids definitely recommend this place.

You can't go wrong with this zoo. Just need less construction! 1/4 of it has been closed for 2 years! Lots a great stuff. The tiger and elephant exhibits are amazing! Lots of animals and easy to get around. Beer is served at some vendors!  Only bad thing is it gets crazy busy in the summer months on the weekends. Parking is tough. I try taking the family early to avoid most of it. Lots of new and updated stuff. It's not the biggest zoo out there but located in the heart of Denver. Otherwise it's a good zoo.
I love the Denver Zoo. They have improved all exhibits. Today was perfect. We caught 3 shows and learned so much. Highly recommended
We love the zoo and all the stuff to climb on!

It was a great Zoo to visit, prices may be a little steep for all they offer but it‚Äôs all for good cause. We bought tickets to ride the railway & it was nice. The conductor has a stand to set my beer down for the ride. He was friendly & my boys really enjoyed the monkeys there & I enjoyed the pretty flamingos.

The zoo was very nice. All the animals were out. The reason I'm giving three stars is because we had a giraffe feeding that I paid extra for and they said that we missed it when I know I scheduled it for two o'clock. So they don't do refunds they offered us to feed the camels. I have to say that was not very exciting and anyway shape or form. I know they do their best to take care of their animals with the animals were very dirty. At first they weren't letting us feed the camels. The worker was just feeding and talking. I'm like do we get to feed them she's like well no and I'm like okay that's what we paid for. So I think me and my two friends were able to give them each two snacks. It's not worth it don't pay for it. So extremely disappointed..
Our family enjoyed the zoo. Everyone was courteous. We had a nice picnic in a field of daffodils. We didn't get to see bear or tigers though.

The Denver Zoo is fun for the whole family. It's laid out very well and easy to get around. Food and drink prices were a little high. Would suggest to bring your own food and snacks. Over all its a well keep place.
Very nice zoo. Big variety of animals and good amenities around the park. I wish the animals could have more room in their exhibits though :(
Beautiful zoo right in the heart of Denver! Great place to bring the kids.
We went for my daughter's birthday. It's an annual event. She loves feeding the bird's.

This is a nice zoo.  The exhibits are designed in a way to provide visitors with a minimally obstructed view of the animals.  Very few fences used relative to most other zoos.  For traffic was very light in the middle of the week, making social distancing very easy to achieve.

I've been coming to this zoo for years and the changes they have been making to the exhibits are beautiful. The elephant pavilion in particular feels like you're transported to a different place and the landscaping throughout the zoo is next level and worth a visit alone with beautiful flowers and plants and art installations everywhere.

The food offerings are so incredibly threadbare, however. With covid you can only walk in one direction through the zoo and it literally took us an hour to get to a restaurant that served something other than greasy beer fries or nachos or grilled cheese. I don't think there's a single green salad for sale in the entire zoo. In addition, online ordering was down so there was a very slow "one family at the indoor register at a time" process in place which could be improved by allowing orders through the app. The food we did have tasted good however.

Finally stingray cove feels super out of place. It's basically a petting zoo with a huge merchandise kiosk and loud music blasting. It feels like such a stressful situation for those animals at a zoo that seems to otherwise care deeply about animal welfare and conservation.

What a great place to bring your family, the employees really care about the animals here.  I would suggest this place to anyone the enclosures were very clean, the elephant show was a lot of fun and educational.  This place is huge make sure you bring a good set of walking shoes, sunglasses and sunscreen trust me, you'll be glad you did.

You can‚Äôt beat a Denver Zoo one of the best zoos in the United States I love the reptile house and they have done so much expanding the last few years this is very good to see. It was a little bit cold on the day that we went so there wasn‚Äôt as many animals out. If you were going to go I suggest going on a warmer day so you will get to see all the animals. I know the Denver zoo does a lot for conservation and it is a great place to support.

Great zoo. The animals have a good space to move around in and the grounds seem to be well maintained. They also have placed directional arrows to encourage flow of traffic and social distancing. Overall its a great place for both children and adults.

For the positives, the place is open and have maps everywhere, indoor and outdoor exhibits, food, and some other buildings
For the not so great stuff, most animals don't move much, the food is incredibly expensive and some areas require another ticket like the stingray exhibit
Overall I'd say it's worth going to but I wouldn't but any extra stuff

Trip to the zoo was fun! We were pleasantly surprised that more exhibits were open than we thought there would be.  The amphibian house was open with a very short line and the primates buildings were open as well. The primate buildings though were packed with a long line so we passed it up but were still able to see the gorillas from outside.  There were quite a few exhibits though with no animals. It was a hot day so there were probably inside. The baby rhino was adorable! We didn't see the baby lion Cubs though unfortunately. All in all the zoo was well prepared for the covid restrictions and staff were placed around the park to help with directions.
Wonderful zoo .. if you're in Denver.. make this a need to see.
We had a good time  the animals were out and jumping around. We had fun

My first time her. Excellent service to all my family and friends. Very safe and family friendly.  The animals are very happy üòÅ. I recommend it to everyone that wants to üôà it. The staff are very helpful and nice üëç. Thanks again for your service. üêï‚Äçü¶∫

Visited 10/26
First time visit, the zoo is beautiful. We visited right after a big snow a lot of the animals were moved and a lot of the park was closed due to COVID. We still had a great time walking around and seeing those animals that were out. The lego build of animals were also pretty cool. They did have the gift shop and some food places open. There was not many people at all and felt like we had the zoo to ourselves. We will for sure be back hopefully to see all the beautiful animals we missed.

Today was mom son day to celebrate completion of 6th grade!!!!! We took short cut. Played with the stingrays, but was too scared to feed them so we dropped food for them!!! Had the BEST DAY WITH ANIMALS, PICNIC AND MY SON!!! There is lots of construction going on...penguins üêß are getting new exhibit spot, at front gate where dik diks and meerkat were. They still have them just ask where to find them. Polar bears are unfortunately no longer apart of Denver as the weather here is not good for them. Bird world getting complete overhaul...which is great news...can't wait to see new exhibits. Friendly staff..  so excited to spend more summer hours at 'our' (Denver) zoo!!! Got tickets week before online...downloaded app...ready to go back tomorrow!!!!

I really wanted to give them 5 stars but they had a pretty ridiculous amount of the park still closed due to ‚ÄúCOVID‚Äù. We still managed to have a pretty amazing time here and spent a good amount of time looking at each animal.

It‚Äôs hard to compare to our KC Zoo which is cheaper and more than double the size of this one. I felt like some of the enclosures were a bit small for their respective animals too which I didn‚Äôt like.

This zoo is awesome! So many great animals to see and the staff is wonderful! The only thing missing that my kids would have liked to have included is a petting zoo. However,  the incorporation of a playground makes up for it to an extent.  We walked around for 3 hours and still didn't get to see everything.  Can't wait to go back!

Love the Denver Zoo. It's been a while since I went to the zoo, however it never disappoints. Lots of ongoing construction, but always worth the price of admission. Seems like there are exhibits that are closed, but enough other exhibits are open to enjoy the experience. Manage expectations. I wanted to see polar bears and the reptiles but the bears were still hibernating üò¥ and the reptile exhibit was closed (or gone) for construction.  I dont think they're doing up close with the animal opportunities with covid restrictions.  Denver Zoo manages covid very well. Limited visitors and open paths. Being mindful, avoiding confined spaces and wearing my mask to help prevent infections and help everyone got me through. Other guests at the zoo were pretty mindful of my personal space. Overall worth the trip. Be mindful I have no kids and ate before I went. I did buy some water there, but this was a cheap excursion for me. WEAR CONFORTABLE WALKING SHOES. You'll be on your feet a couple of hours.

Kudos to the Denver Zoo for creating the best possible experience with the pandemic. Tickets are timed in order to limit the number of people, the entire Zoo experience is a one-way-follow-the-arrows-on-the-path walk to limit exposure to people, high-touch surfaces were noted (where even allowed), very few people  were in the gift shop, and people were very good about wearing masks and social distancing. I was pleasantly surprised and felt as though we were safe and healthy during our visit.

I have grown up with this Zoo and I am super grateful they have been able to figure out how to operate regardless of the current conditions. Contact less tickets online, guaranteeing you a time slot to enter the park and also a low stress parking experience when you arrive. They have one way easy arrows that help you navigate through the park, and you have the option to take the full trip or half trip. It's lovely to have the option, especially since they give you estimated times for each route. Even though there are still closed exhibits, they have a new stingray exhibit where you can touch them!! Today was a very hot day (literally almost hit 100¬∞) so just keep in mind that's not comfortable for the animals either. Regardless of the animals seeking shelter and relief, there was still plenty to see. Definitely recommend, and thank you for continuing to provide us with great memories no matter what!

It was a very good time. Families out there who are considering on going more than once a year I would consider buying a membership because it's very worth it. Just pick a time and day and go! One thing I would definitely say is pack your own lunch and drinks! Its alot easier. But other than that such a great experience.  Love it so much.

Had a great time! It was really nice to see all the different animals. Wish certain things weren't closed within the zoo, so that my spouse and I could've enjoyed the whole Denver Zoo experience! Overall, We loved it. We always stop at the zoo of the cities we visit üíû
Always a great place to get away with the family and if you go during the week it‚Äôs not busy at all

Come one and all to the Zoo. It is a lot bigger than I really expected when looking at the map. The coolest is seeing the monkeys and how they swing around and go from place to place. The Elephants are really cute and they have quite a few. The Hippo was very big and smelly. Some cool rhino's as well. Lots of awesome really cool places that will be even better once COVID restrictions are over.
So much to see and so easily accessible within the city!!

We love the Denver Zoo. The facility is very nice and 5he animals are clearly well treated and happy. It's a beautiful place and a very fun and educational adventure for families with kids of all ages.

Zoo lights 2020! Even with the pandemic and snow it‚Äôs was a very magical and bright experience. Staff was very friendly and easy to find. Kid and adult friendly. Bring your own water bottle and snacks if needed they have water bottle filling stations around the zoo. Great touch to help save the environment

Awesome experiance, everything is 1 way right now so it keeps the flow going and people separated. Any staff we saw and had questions about animals they were able to help. Being a member is a big bonus if you would go a lot. Im in town visiting family who are members and free entry +discounts was excellent.

The Denver Zoo is always a delightful place to visit. You need to make a reservation online in advance, which was no problem. There are currently quite a few babies and the animals were all pretty active because of the cooler weather. It was my first time visiting since they constructed the Toyota Elephant Passage, which allows the elephants to access different parts of their enclosure. All staff follow the Covid guidelines and everyone in the zoo is required to wear masks and social distance.

Under construction. Lot of animals up close. Not as big as ours. The set up for distancing was good. My favorite was the fishing cat! It came right up to glass! Almost wanted to pet it...and loose a hand ü§£. The viewing  glass areas were awwssooommmee. You could see the sealions swimming.  He popped out to keep posing. I could of went around a few times. Visit and expand your knowledge! Support the ongoing preservation. Take a walk on the wild side

Not as many animals as i thought would be there...
(Compared this zoo with the Omaha zoo)
Lots of displays empty.
Spread out a lot. With no maps available.   Wandered around trying to get out...

Poor animals (elephants, giraffe, etc) living in an environment of dirt with little shade. üò¢
(Just returned from an African safari...  most animals live in a green environment with grass and trees to eat... and shade to rest in.)

My husband and I were disappointed.  But our 15 month old grandson loved it!

I had the best day at the zoo yesterday with a friend. Yes, just two adults and no kids! Give yourself at least 3 hours here! We saw a lion cub and a baby monkey (see the pics). The babies were soooo cute and playful. I was quite impressed with this zoo. They have several yummy food and beer options with food huts in various places throughout the zoo. There was food ranging from Korean - Mexican - American. We got bison tacos from a food truck that was parked inside the zoo! It was delicious! Will try the Korean food next time.

The animals looked very well taken care of. We watched penguins hop about and swim. There were even an elephant and sea lion presentation. The elephant was free to roam in and out during the informational presentation, but he stayed the whole time and even gave the crowd a few poses without prompting. We couldn't stay for the sea lion presentation, so will have to do that next time. This zoo was very clean and the smells were not bad at all. I'm sensitive to odors and was able to handle the whole zoo. There was an area where some monkeys could swing on ropes right above us as they cross from one area to another.
