Although I didn't see any do this, I thought this was amazing! The care takers at this zoo were happy and good with the animals. We were so pleased to see this. The zoo itself was pretty and well laid out.
Didn't have as many animals as I imagined but it was nice, clean, and not too crowded. The employees are knowledgeable and informative.
Zoo lights is always incredible,  this year was spectacular

The zoo has opened and is working on a lot of new exhibit areas for the animals. It's been about 6 months since I last visited and I couldn't believe how different everything looks. They're making great progress and you can tell they think about all of the needs of the animals. Plus there are a lot of babies right now, so this month is a good month to go!

All of the animals look healthy and well cared for. They have a wide variety of species and a lot of beautiful and unique art and plants as well. There's quite a bit of shade in many areas, and they have plenty of snack and drink stops along the way. Our favorite critters are the red River hogs, the entire reptile house, and the orangutans. Wish I could just live here, lol.

This place is really awesome. Thus is the one of the best zoo I have ever visited. This place have good environment.
This is more popular for kids. This zoo have many animals. They have around 4000 animals. This is more popular for travellers. The ticket price is not that high. It is around $15 for adults.
You should visit this place. I promise you will not regret. You will enjoy looking at the animals. This zoo have friendly animals.

Love the zoo! We have been members for 6 years.  If you have a family of four or more (we have 6), the membership is the best way to go.  The new stingray feeding pool is amazing! They swim right up to you and are very tame.  Super cool.

I love this zoo! I went here as a child and I loved coming back. It was just just as beautiful as is was in the 90s. The animals were amazing! I went with my boyfriend and we had a blast! I love the the peacocks still roam around and are so interactive. Make sure you stop here when you‚Äôre in Denver!

The animals were phenomenal and I loved the cleanliness and quality of the exhibits.  The missing stars are for the lack of food and beverages offered to the public before the light festival! All of the little stores only open at night? Or maybe on that day only but I almost passed out trying to find water to drink. All of the fountains water was dirty and was not clear. I paid almost 100 on tickets and had a near death experience. Lol  bring your own food and drinks!! The animals look very happy.  The location is weird to me but I got there early and parked close to the entrance. Park rangers let us touch real fur and a paw of a tiger.  My son loved it! Too many favorites to mention but the gorillas and giraffes stand out for me‚ù§‚ù§ü¶çü¶èüêßü¶áü¶í üê´‚ù§‚ù§ love Texas

A great little zoo, in the neighborhood with lots of exhibits for the kids. Right now are Lego animals which is super fun for my son. They made a one way path throughout the park with appropriate signage letting you know closest restrooms and exits due to Covid.  Kids can still have fun and so can adults.

Recently went with my family and father-in-law and had a great time. It was more fun watching the amazement in the eyes of my children (12, 5, and 14-months) as they experienced seeing the many animals present.

Pro: Many fun sites to see and there are a few shows to watch.

Con: Lots of walking, stay hydrated.

Overall Experience: Great for all ages. You will not be disappointed.
I was amazed by the variety of animals here! We spent 3 hours in total at this zoo and loved every moment :)

I love going to this zoo. It's a bit smaller than the one I grew up with, but that makes it a great day trip for the family! The layout is great to spend a whole day seeing all the animals. There is a good variety, and a number of exhibits have been updated to be 1) more animal friendly but also 2) better viewing. The shows have been entertaining but also very educational. I just keep coming back again and again.

Loved the Denver zoo. So much to see and the animals always seem so well taken care of. Staff was awesome as well! Going in the winter time is my favorite because there are little to no crowds and most of the animals are still able to be seen

We went to the zoo in the dead of winter with a balmy high of 25. Sadly, we were unable to see many of the animals because of that. Nevertheless, quite a few were out, including the kangaroos. (What's that about?) We enjoyed the giraffes (inside), the seals, penguins, lion, and flamingos the best. Even in winter, it was well worth the trip!

Very nice zoo, we really enjoyed all the animals.  Easy one way flow to get through the park.  Free parking!
Loved the elephant bridge.

Pretty good zoo overall, only $15 for an adult ticket. I'd say a good 90% of the exhibits were good for viewing the animals. However I do not advise going until it is actually summer, a lot of the animals were not available or were unable to be seen do to wheather/temperatures (48¬∞f). Which of course is understandable just don't go and pay to not see them. Otherwise very pleasant experience and definitely child/family friendly.

The zoo is a lot of fun! For people with medicaid or foodstamps in the later part of the season, you can get in for 1$ if you show them your card :) you can get up to 10 people in that way for only a 1$ each so its very affordable that way. There are so many amazing animals to see and lots of fun for families.

Great zoo. Not too big but packs a punch delivering plenty of very interesting things to see. Great place to go for an afternoon stroll and ask questions to the volunteer staff. Would absolutely recommend for children and adults alike. They also have free days so keep an eye out for them.
Wonderful! The draft and pretzel package was fun to walk around with. Absolutely worth a trip. The porcupine had an awesome happy birthday set up!

We went when the Zoo was "closed" making it free on Monday. It is not closed closed because ppl are still selling stuffed animals and you can go in and see animals but I guess there is no shows. Staff is still there to help with maps and security and even to serve you soda and what not. We went later in the day and it was cold meaning 40¬∞ or so and there was not many animals out but still saw a few. There was a marry go round it was nice.

Absolutely amazing, while some exhibits have been closing down without much warning, we know that they will continue to fill those spaces with more beautiful and fantastic animals. Plus, their developing a new nursery that I am incredibly excited to see.

We love the Denver Zoo! They have amazing protocol in place during the pandemic so everyone still has fun and remains safe. My girls love the sea lions, giraffes, and lion cubs the most. The elephants are my personal favorite. They have a seasonal exhibit where you can feed and pet stingrays, which was fantastic. We have a great day everytime we go!

Beautiful zoo! The zoo is doing an excellent job with handling the covid restrictions. We enjoyed our day at the zoo and felt safe. The hands on n sting ray exhibit was worth the extra fee. Feeding the sting rays was a fun experience.

We went to the zoo during the week to kill some time before a late flight with our family. While it wasn‚Äôt huge, on a weekday in February, there were no crowds and many friendly staff and volunteers. In fact, that was the most impressive thing. We easily had all of our questions about animals eagerly answered. We had a great time exploring. A couple exhibits were closed, but we didn‚Äôt mind. Great family time.

Very nice zoo overall

We went at 9 am on a cold Sunday morning during covid.  Reservations required!  Overall it was pretty smooth.  Everything is one way with some attempts to keep people distanced.

The amount of people was such that it was pretty much impossible to actually stay 6 ft from everyone.  However, mask compliance was very high.  I only saw the occasional kid without.

A few of the indoor attractions are closed or had lines due to capacity limits.

Overall a good trip.
Food was stupid expensive.  Like 50 bucks for 3 small drinks, 2 cheese burgers.  But the animals were pretty unique and super cute!

Right now the Denver Zoo is undergoing a wonderful transformation. They're adding new buildings, upgrading facilities for the animals and making this an overall better place to visit. Make sure you put on your walking shoes. I've been coming to the zoo for 20 years and it's always a wonderful Adventure every time I go. Check out their classes and special events all year such as Zoo lights.

Pretty good zoo, although I don't know that it differentiated itself that much from most of the other ones I've been to. Unfortunately, the bear exhibit wasn't available when we were there due to renovations. We also went during a free day, which meant that the crowds and parking were insane.

Perty cool design on buildings and animal enclosures. Due to covid 19 they have made a giant path you have to follow and stay on around the park and alot of things are closed. You have to use their website to get tix and QR barcodes to order any food but the gift shop is open with a path to follow inside as well. You have to keep masks on the whole time. They do have hand sanitizer all around as well.
There is only a certain amount of tix sold for each time slot throughout the day. They are supposed to let each group through in 15 min increments but this was not followef when we went and there were big clusters of people not following the 6ft rule anywhere or keeping masks on or on their kids as well. Giving 4 stars out of 5 due to the closures and lack of animals out and about at 5pm when i went. I feel in the evenings the zoo should be discounted since animals are sleeping or away. Also the whole zoo should be discounted due to the closures etc. The lego structures were awesome as well.
Good zoo. Overpriced drinks but that was to be expected. We went around 145 and a lot of the exhibits were empty.

There was a lot of empty exibits. If it wasn't  renovations, they moved cages, blocked off without a reason or just plain not there, and not just talking about in the back.

Overall it was pretty good still, but I don't feel like the four and a half hours I spent there was worthwhile, I could have went to a smaller zoo that was cheaper as well as closer and gotten the same experience in a fraction of the time.

This is my favorite zoo. The animals are clearly well taken care of, and they‚Äôre constantly updating enclosures and exhibits to make it more animal friendly!

They have lots of barricades up to protect us and the animals from catching COVID-19.

The staff is always friendly, and it‚Äôs awesome to see that in the 10 years I‚Äôve been visiting how they keep evolving to make the zoo more enriching for the animals.

I highly recommend visiting the Denver zoo for everyone!

Such a lovely place filled with incredible animals! Plenty of hand sanitizer after being around high touch areas. The one-way traffic definitely helped the place from becoming congested. Be sure to bring your own water!
Love how the zoo has expanded the animals habitats. So much better!!

This zoo is MASSIVE! We spent the greater part of a day here and still barely saw everything. We did manage to see two animal exhibit shows while we were there which is nice. If it is a warm day like it was for us, I recommend taking turns with the cooler indoor exhibits to stay cool during the day! Pack some snacks, water and lots of sunscreen and get ready for a close up experience with TONS of animals!

4/1/21 - We were let down by our visit to the zoo today. It felt like at least half of the exhibits and buildings were closed. The exhibits that were open had very little animals. The things that were very accessible were things that required additional payment - restaurants, beer stands, train, gift shop, etc.The grounds were fenced off and we were guided (with arrows) from start to finish. In many areas, we were funneled together to follow the path and waited in long lines without staff assistance. We were required to make a time reservation to follow limited capacity regulations, but it really felt like a normal day. It was packed! It was really difficult to social distance, even with masks on. Parking was typical with spots available being few and far between.

Always but especially during the pandemic zoo employees are going out of their way to ensure safety for guests. We had great, positive interactions with employees at the front, the main entrance gift shop, the carousel, Tropical Discovery, and concessions. Everyone was so friendly, upbeat and helpful. Great visit!

The Zoo is not to big but defenitely have a lot of things to see. The highlight of the zoo is elephants and it‚Äôs playings in water. It‚Äôs something to be watched. Went during Covid times. We have to really appreciate the amount of effort the maintenance people and workers are taking in order to keep the place clean spraying disinfectant and stuffs. All the places especially they are cleaning thoroughly and I am impressed by that. Almost all place they have sanitizers as well. Great job team.

Great place to take the family.  Great for out of state visitors and a awesome Zoo Membership  that work for many different levels.  The food has improved in the last 4 yrs.  Many different places to eat along the way while enjoying the Zoo.  I do recommend getting there early to fight the crowds in the summer.  Great bonus for adults who like to drink a beer while walking the Zoo, they have a few beer stations along the way.   One of the greenest Zoos in the world with there recycling.  Yeah, go green.  Another plus is their animal encounters.  Worth every penny.

Hands down one of the best zoos in the states. Not only is this zoo constructed in an easy to navigate style but the looping trails ensure that no animal will go unseen. With an impressive collection of species and exhibits it is easy to spend an afternoon or evening here. There are plenty of places to stop for a bite to eat or snack throughout the park, and fun interactive points for children and adults alike.

I would wait until everything is back to normal. There are no shows or demonstrations. If you are taking kids many if the shortcuts of the park are not available and it's one way. This means you're walking the entire zoo. Oddly the petting sting ray exhibit is open but if your kids want to do it, you will be charged for yourself as well even if you have to help kids the whole time. If you're a member it's difficult to get in. Only way to get in is buy tickets. It's still the zoo -  wonderful volunteers and lots of animals. This is why it gets the OK rating!

My family and I had a chance to visit the zoo while we were in the Denver area.  So glad we could go.  It was awesome seeing another city's zoo.  The rides were nothing to go on about.  The train ride is actually pretty short, the carousel was just that (better of the 2 rides.) But the ELEPHANT SHOW!!!! Holy moly! That was something I have never seen before. My 2 kids watched but the sea lion and the elephant shows and they were entranced by the elephants and all that Groucho was able to do! Heck so was I! We went when it was particularly hot, so drink lots and lots of liquids.  The BBQ place in the zoo was more than happy to refill our bottles with ice water for free. It was a good hike and only part we missed out on was the primate area.  Most excellent way to spend the day.

We randomly decided to go to Denver Zoo to check out some animals, and I'm so glad we did! I've been to a few zoos, but this was on a differently level. The animals all seemed active and healthy, the staff was young but friendly, and the food selection was pretty good for a Monday! The zoo overall was very clean and well decorated with florals that made you feel like you were in a natural habitat. Definitely worth checking out!
Great zoo with an extensive array of animals and the ability to see a lot of them up close too.  I took a 3yo and he loved it.  We spent 4.5hrs there.  He also loved the temporary dinosaur exhibit.
So great!!! There wasn't an extremely large crowd, and the staff have done a really good job making sure there is not a lot of crowding. Go support the zoo, and see a bunch of beloved animals.

A beautiful park! Smaller than I imagined but they definitely take very good care of the animals. The viewing enclosures are misleading to some people. They look small but they expand towards the back and the animals have a quite large area to roam.

Lovely zoo.  Beautiful animal habitats.  Wish it were a little more family friendly.  We approached the bird house and were told, rather snappishly, by an employee that strollers were not allowed inside.  When my husband went in there was plenty of space, and no explanation as to why we had to leave the strollers outside (maybe provide a stroller parking area with an employee to keep an eye on it) and schlep our children and all our possessions through while hoping that our stroller didn't get stolen while we weren't out there.  It's a bummer.  I think my toddler would have loved to see the birds.
Denver Zoo has some of the best enclosures I've seen in a zoo. Most exhibits are very enriching for the animals. You can tell the staff really care about the animals and visitor experiences.

The zoo was great. The paths were mark so folks could maintain our distance. The employees were scattered throughout the zoo and gave us some animal, zoo and Denver history facts. It was very well organized. The restaurants were very well organized too. We had a very enjoyable time with our family.

We went the friday after Thanksgiving and even though it was cold and snowy, they still had the pool heated for the seals so they were out and about.
The giraffes and elephants were always a fun area to be since they were inside.
The best though was their inside enclosure for the snakes, frogs, fish and other animals. It was a fun experience.
Also, peacocks roam everywhere so that was cool too. ü§£

A wonderful zoo with a ton to see, great staff to help you learn more, and constantly upgrading habitats. The new bear habitat looks great, watching the elephants splash around is a blast and the great apes like to say hi. The only reason this isn't a 5 star review is parking. Parking is just plain awful at the zoo, prepare to circle the lots for 20-45 minutes most times of day. Take a bus or Uber if you want to save the pain.

There were hardly any animals on through out the entire zoo on a Wednesday afternoon when families like to go to avoid the weekend crowds. I was very disappointed most of it was under construction I understand it's to better the experience in the long run but having so much construction at once was almost overwhelming and confusing

This zoo is phenomenal! The animals are very close and there are various demonstrations with the zoo keepers and the animals throughout the day. I loved being able to go see the animals and having them be so close to me! It's definitely not something you get at every zoo you go to.  I would definitely go again!

This zoo has been around since my grandpa was a child. I grew up going to it on a regular basis since childhood and now I am taking my kid there. This zoo is great in their visionary abilities to adapt to the times, and crowds that flood it on a daily basis. They have improved so many exhibits and continue to do so. Every animal looks healthy and maintained in a natural habitat. The staff do an excellent job in handling every animal with care.

My son said to be generous so were giving this zoo a 4 star. I thought about a three star mostly because nothing really made me go wow that's cool. Though I did enjoy the layout of many of their exibits. I've been to lesser zoo's and this one isn't bad by any stretch. A good time with the family and friends

We spent 5 wonderful hours here strolling and looking at the animals.  There is a lot of space for animals and their rooms are clean. We haven't seen bears and tigers as they were sleeping at noon. Finding a parking place was a really difficult task. We were driving circles for 15 minutes until the moment when one family decided to leave the zoo. I'd recommend coming early in the morning. They open at 9 AM.
Beautiful, very well prepared for a safe experience for patrons visiting during Covid 19. The one way traffic pattern is a great idea, pandemic or not. A lovely zoo.

Denver Zoo for me had some animals I have never seen before in any other zoo. Pairs of Elephants, Polar Bears and Black Bears, with many many other varieties of animals to see as well. The park is very large and will take an entire day to walk around at a steady pace. Make sure to take sun-cream if it is hot as there isn't a large amount of shade around half the park. Its a great day out and season passes equals many awesome days out.

Great experience visiting this Zoo. Highly recommended when you visit Denver. Lots of animals. I saw giraffes and elephants for the first time. I also enjoyed the penguins. It was so nice to be able to see all of these animals. If you are in Denver you should visit this place. You can get the Citypass which help you go to the attractions cheaper. We would love to have more time. But we didn't have a lot of time there. We also visit the aquarium and the Museum of Nature and Science. Enjoy the pictures.
Fantastic zoo! They did a phenomenal job keeping social distance enforced during the pandemic. We were able to see every exhibit while staying safe.

Loved the zoo
The staff were super friendly, and it was fun to follow a path through the entire zoo. Pretty much got to see everything.

I love this zoo. I feel like I see something new every time we go. This time it was for zoo lights, which wasn't my first time, but it's always a good time to spend with good people. Food and drink are way too over-priced, but you don't go to the zoo for the refreshments. I'll keep coming back, time and time again.

I love this zoo. I have been going here my entire life and it never gets old. The zoo has done a great job of modernizing throughout the years and have definitely expanded as well. There are a large amounts of animals to see as well a lot of great activities throughout for kids. The zoo lights are very good as well around Christmas time. One big plus here is you're able to bring in your own food and drink, but the concession options are very diverse and of quality, maybe a little pricey. Make sure you arrive early parking is awful during peak hours.
Such a wonderful Zoo day! Fun for adults just as much as the kiddos. I‚Äôve also been here for Denver zoo lights which is wonderful! I love that they serve beer throughout the park too üòâ

Great zoo, lots of history and some really well made enclosures. The Sea lions were my favourite as they swam around and played with one another. Took about 6 hours to see the whole thing, but we meandered and took a lot of photos. Probably 4 hours if you wanted to see everything with less photo breaks.

We went towards the end of the free day which is an amazing offer to get to go for no admission price, but we also didn't get to see many animals, in fact, the most animals that were around were inside the tropical discovery building meaning we mostly saw fish, reptiles, and amphibians. Don't get me wrong, the tropical discovery is a cool area, but we didn't get to see any elephants, lions, hippos, or the rhino. The hyenas, giraffes, zebras, and the tiger we're about the only mammals we saw. Oh, and the seals who didn't seem to mind the cold. It was awesome but honestly I'm glad we didn't make a whole day of it like we had planned, we saw all the animals that were outside in the hour, hour and a half we were there. My girlfriend was really disappointed not to see any elephants since that's her favorite animal, maybe we went too late? Not sure the reason, but there wasn't much activity. We'll try again on another free day, definitely not worth paying the normal pricey admission fee in my own opinion. As you can see from the photos, the zebras looked like sad horses in a pen (while I know they are essentially just horses, it would've been nice to see them in more of a natural setting not a farm setting eating grass out of metal horse feeders; that just looks very farm-y to me). All the other photos are from the tropical discovery which as I said was an area of the most activity (also meaning the building was very packed inside).

We came to the Denver zoo last week while on vacation from Texas. We went on a Friday, which was probably not the best idea. The parking wasn't the best. We had to park by the science museum and it was quite the walk to the entrance. The lines to purchase tickets were really long, but we didn't seem to be in line that long, it went fairly quick. The zoo itself was very big. It helped space out the large crowds so it didn't feel so crowded. There were quite a few exhibits with nothing in them, so that was a disappointment. We got to see a larger selection of animals that we don't have in the Fort Worth Zoo, so that was nice. Overall, a very nice experience. FYI, they have water bottle filling stations. I haven't seen these before in a zoo. It was so much better than purchasing water.

Wow. I‚Äôm used to the Saint Louis zoo but you can tell this place REALLY do care about the animals that they take care of. Not only that but they are very into waste management with their recycling, and also in to educating the public about the animals they house. It was very very obvious of their mission and that was just from me walking around reading the signs and viewing their staff while they worked. Also seeing how their exhibits allow the animals more freedom than anything I‚Äôve ever seen before. Which is absolutely amazing. What a great thing for the animals. Again I am comparing this to the St. Louis zoo which has been beat completely.

Great zoo with many interesting animals and activities. Free parking in the garage or adjacent surface lot. The line to purchase tickets was a bit long but we were able to just buy tickets online and skip the wait. They have some great season pass options that if you are local and plan to visit regularly would definitely be worthwhile.

A Beautiful Zoo with a wide array of animals & beautiful grounds. Loved the geese and their families walking about all thru The Park. The entrance fee is reasonable & if you look online you can get coupons for addition money off. It will take approx 4 hours to get thru the whole park. There are food stands that are reasonable & quite good in lunch or dinner. Ice cold beer for sale with ID. Highly recommend if in the Denver area.
First time experience and was pretty amazing. Was able to get up close and personal with some of the animals. Just an amazing family day.

Visited the day after a good snow fall and found the animals were suprisingly active for the weather. Never been to the zoo in winter so it was a great new and different experience. Could imagine this zoo would be a great experience in warmer months. Enclosures and zoo seemed great and well kept!
Because it's a zoo. No really great staff, great keepers. Everyone is so friendly to assist. Always making improvements but not in the way.  They serve beer. Animal enclosure are beautiful!
Try to hit the Denver Zoo lights every year.

This zoo is awesome!  My fiance and I are from Texas and we love this zoo better than ours at home. This place Is huge though, so if you have never been be prepared to walk. Lots of exhibits and the animals seem happily content. They have little feeding schedules that the public can watch and enjoy so be sure to check those out. The business hours we thought we odd.. the close earlier then other places in our opinion. So plan accordingly,  we cant wait to go back next time.

Probably would have liked this trip better if it hadn't been hot. There are quite a few neat animals. They landscaping is well done. Each of the restroom have handicap access. There is also a family restroom and many baby changing  stations. Water from the fountains tasted alright but was not very cool. We weren't too impressed with the bears. I have seen zoos with better polar bear and penguin exhibits. In all its a nice zoo. Expect parking to be a hassle. But isn't it everwhere in Denver. We parked over by the rental boats at the city park and walked in. They have places to pick up a bite to eat all seemed to have reasonable prices.

Loved showing my son animals from his picture books for the first time. Great atmosphere, great learning opportunity, never a miss on events like the Zoo lights. Food is pricy but the portions are a good size.

Went to the Denver Zoo with my son on an 18 hour layover to Arizona, the zoo allowed us to check our backpacks in a secure area in the Welcome Center so we didn't have to lug them around all day. The staff were extremely nice and helpful when needed, they immediately directed to hurry and see the new cub as we got there late in the day and they wanted us to see it. The exhibits were pretty and the animals were more than taken care of (have been to a few zoo's where the animals and exhibits looked as though they weren't being taken care of). I wish we didn't get there so late in the day so we could have taken our time a little more, but it was still a good day spent with plenty to see! This zoo made for a good time on our layover in Denver.

Also, make sure you get some of the strawberry ice cream... I told my son no at first, but am glad we got it on the way out as it was DELICIOUS! Perfect after a nice warm day walking the zoo!

The Denver Zoo has been an amazing place to visit lately. They have times entry so crowds are low, it is one way, and so clean! They strictly enforce the facemask policy and they are just amazing and friendly! Plus they just added Lego animal's! So fun!

Zoo lights January 2021!

Okay so usally when we have gone there isn't much going on (we still have fun tho) but today to our surprise so much was happening we didn't know where to start! The lions were feeding and fighting over it (not aggressively) the elephant got really up close and the anaconda was actually moving and hissing sticking it's tongue out plus so much more! The kids and I enjoyed it and as usual the staff is always very friendly and ready to help. I would recommend anyone to come kids or no kids the zoo is always a fun place!

This was a pretty neat park, but with Vivid and the cool days it felt like some pizzazz or something was missing from the experience.

I did enjoy the Lego exhibits, though.

Such a fun zoo with a variety of indoor and outdoor attractions. Love the Toyota Elephant Passage and if you're able to catch a slow, the zookeepers have such wonderful information to share. Download the app for a map, schedule, and to see each animal and even know their names and ages!
We enjoyed our afternoon at the Denver Zoo. Until 11/1/2020 they have a special presentation of Legos. We did not find all of them. We were told there are 20.

I love the zoo! It's where you walk around and see all the animals. Their food is a little overpriced though so you might want to pack a lunch. I was their to see the zoo all lite up with Christmas decorations. It was pretty cool however not many of the animals would come out like that so you could see them.
Beautiful zoo and such a variety of animals. The coolest exhibit was walking into the bird arbitrary and having the zookeeper talk about the birds as she fed them.

Even with covid the zoo is pretty amazing and the largest one I think I have been too. It was annoying to wear the mask the entire time especially being outside but it was still fun and lots of animals to see!

This place is great! The bird area is one of my favorites along with the aquarium area. Great place to go for a stroll. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

Lots of hand sanitizer and precautions taken.

I haven't been to the Denver Zoo in at least a decade. Had a amazing time. Seeing the joy on everyone's face from Seniors to children and adults. Parking is a little challenging so plan to arrive a little early. Wear comfortable shoes plenty of walking. would definitely recommend The Denver Zoo!

The staff were all very knowledgeable and happy to share information on the animals. It was clean and even with a bunch of school field trips going on, the zoo was spacious enough that we never felt crowded.

This was our first time here and I was pretty disappointed. My son had a great time so I have to give a couple of stars. We came on a snow but sunny day. Half the exhibits were closed but no one mentioned anything about the closures when we bought tickets. The inside exhibits we pretty great. There was so much potential here and I really wanted to love this zoo. Food was awful, so eat before coming to the zoo.

Love this place and so do my kids! Better bang for your buck to get a membership and continue to come all year. Every time we go something new is popping up. Waiting for the new tiger exhibit. You can tell they care about the animals as they are always trying to give them plenty of space and better accommodations. It's good they use the money towards the betterment of the zoo. Heard there is a new baby giraffe that we just missed by a couple days... will be going back to see it.
Summer time parking is insane. We had to leave once cuz we could not find anything for 30 mins. They really need to only allow zoo guests to park there. You should pay before going into the parking for the zoo, only way to control it. People park there and then go to the park in the back for the entire day. It is not fair.
Since we have gone back, there are new baby animals everywhere!! So cute :) saw the new tiger exhibit which is much bigger than before. Jurassic park dinosaurs are featured all over the park! So much fun.

We love the zoo! Due to the current conditions in which we live, there is a different set up at the zoo. You gotta have a mask. There's guided arrows to keep foot traffic going the same direction all around the zoo, the indoor exhibits and buildings are closed for the time being. Most of the animals spend there time outdoors in the nice weather anyway, so you still get to see them. There's hand sanitizers everywhere but with the littles it's helpful to have some wipes handy! You can order food ahead online which was nice, and you do have to reserve tickets for times entry in advance.

Easily one of the coolest zoos I've ever been to. Really really cool and nature filled straws throughout, surprisingly amazing food, and a massive selection of really really cool animals always with something excellent to see at every turn.

The barbecue brisket was probably the best zoo food I've ever had anywhere. But my favorite part of all was the vast variety of awesome animals and how active they were.

The monkey and ape and gorilla exhibits were by far the coolest in the entire place, but some of the indoor areas with sea life and reptiles were really cool also.

Highly highly recommend and will definitely return again soon.

Who doesn't enjoy at the zoo?? The Denver zoo is a great place to take the family and spend the day! They have multiple Free Days throughout the year and virtual tours now during COVID19.
You can become a zoo member and receive nice perks. (Free entry, early entry, discounts and more!!)

Zoo lights are amazing! Definitely a must do every year. The zoo employees are very friendly and knowledgeable. Seeing the elephant cross the bridge has to be one of the best experience I've ever had!

Great place to take the kids, family, or with friends. The Denver Zoo has a large variety of cats, monkeys, shows, birds, & the rest of the animals that will catch your eye. They sell popcorn, snacks, icecream, and restaurants if you care to sit. You can also enjoy a cold beer while you stroll through the park/zoo. They are open 7 days a week from 9am till 4pm. You will enjoy it.

In-laws choice for a different activities that my nephew's really enjoyed. They enjoyed it and so did I surprisingly!

The animals cooperated with being viewable and the zoo had food stations throughout the park...
They even had beer!

I did get to see a lot of staff that was very knowledgeable.

Even got to see a gorilla break some glass in an exhibit... forgot to take pictures however.

Overall a great experience.

Well worth it.

Respectfully,
Bryan,
Oklahoma City

Great Zoo, it‚Äôs a large 80 acres. Has a lot of animals to see plus a 4D theater that was a lot of fun. The theater is a separate cost, $6 each. There is also a railroad that is also a separate cost to ride. The enclosures are a little small but the zoo was built in 1896 so keep that in mind, they are doing a lot of renovations to make them larger. There are a lot of things for kids to do and the employees are very friendly. There is an elephant show as well. All in all it was an amazing time, it took us about 4 hours to see everything only stopping for 30 minutes for a break. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone!
The zoo is so nice.  Free parking helped.  The people working were magnificent.  Everyone practiced wearing masks and as much as able social distancing.

Clean, affordable, great layout. They have been improving many parts of the Zoo over the years such as the newer Tiger and Elephant exhibits. Currently it looks like they're improving other areas such as the Lions, Cats and Bear areas!

The layout and exhibits are really cool. They have food and drink available throughout and the staff and volunteers are really friendly (aside from this one "security guard" who thinks it's ok to take a tone with people. How he got the job I'll never know because he looks like a strong breeze could knock him down, let alone any high school athlete. A tallish white guy who looks to be about 40 with a mustache who probably knows he's a loser and can only feel like he's any type of someone by putting on that uniform.) But any way, it's definitely a good way to spend the day. The elephant and seal shows are fun to watch. They seem to keep the habitats as conducive to the animals as possible, and it's all pretty clean. If once you're done, you're not ready to go home, the Nature and Science Museum and Civic Park is right there. The only reason I give it 4 stars is that it's pretty expensive. The price of admission is now $20 per adult. The 2 of us ate a bbq sandwich each (which was good,) shared 1 large soda and a large bottled water for $35, so it was a $75 three hour event for 2 adults. They take American Express except at the ticket window.

Not vastly different than most zoos I've been to, but still a great zoo by most standards. They seem to be doing a lot of unique conservation work, which I greatly appreciate and want to encourage. We got lucky and were able to see their new two month old lion cub. He was active and playful and adorable. They have a VERY impressive elephant exhibit as well.

This is a beautiful zoo. I will say I did get lost and walked in a few circles while their but other than that they have large layout and great selection of happy animals. The peacock was wondering freely around the zoo, which was pretty neat.

The Denver zoo is great. I will admit that a large part of my appreciation stems from the enjoyment my daughter had during our visit, so I may be biased. Great animals to see, with slightly expensive food and beverages.
If you're planning to go I recommend that the earlier you can get there the better. In general is much easier to find parking, and the first few hours of the day aren't as crowded.
GREAT ZOO! Highly recommend to bring your family here. The animals were really silly and cute! There were some animals not out, but there food and there animals were really good and cool!

The Denver zoo is always so much fun. We have already gone several times this year. I would definitely recommend. There is a lot of educational information.
On our last visit we learned about grizzly bears and their new exhibit, Harmony Hill.

Well kept zoo! Animals feel as happy as they can be for being in a zoo. Bring a water bottle!
They were awesome about educating everyone about the dangers if unethically sourced Palm Oil during the Elephant show. Then about Recycling in seal show, recyclling/compost boxes everywhere.
Reuse, water fill stations. Tofu!!

This zoo is right in Denver.  Busy on memorial day weekend but still able to see all animals.  They have several view points for sight seeing.  I liked that everyone wasn't crowded to see. The elephant passage and giraffes were my favorite.  They do have food and shows onsite. Free parking cost about $20 per person to enter.
One of the best zoos I've been to. The lion exhibit is incredible. There are 4 male lions from the same family. The new bear exhibit is great too!

Great place to bring the family and spend a few hours. You can bring your own snacks or grab food in the park. There is a pretty wide variety of animals amd they have been making improvements to the habitats and educational elements throughout the zoo. Consider buying an annual pass - well worth the cost for a family.

What a great place! I however for whatever reason did not think it would have been that busy on a wednesday but it was fairly busy.  It is long so if you have kids who can fit in a stroller or wagon bring them! It is long walk.  I wish on some we didn't feel so rushed to look and keep going but had to give others a chance to look as well. But I would highly recommend it!

The lights!!!! This was my first time seeing the Christmas lights at the Denver Zoo and it was AWESOME! Don't wait to get your tickets because they sell fast. Walk in, get your hot chocolate or hot cider, get the glasses and enjoy the walk!! Absolutely beautiful! Can't wait to see them again!

This is a small zoo for such a large city. Maybe you will see animals, most likely you wont. Now you have all of the indoor viewing areas closed as if this was to prevent the spread of COVID. If you are going to restrict viewing then reduce the price. After all this is Denver, CO and this is what you offer people who stop in this city from around the world! I think I would rather go to Omaha, NB to see a zoo. I took only 5 pics that day. Nothing else picture worthy.

You and your family will enjoy the Denver Zoo. It is great for the young and the old. You can bring your stroller or a wheel chair. There is access for both. I even saw a large wagon also. This is a great day trip. If you go early in the morning the anamals are likely to be out and lively.  They also feed the animal's at certain times of the day. You get a map of the zoo with your ticket purchase. You can spend all day with nature and the animals. There is also rides for the young and old.

Large zoo lots of animals. Under construction a lot in the past year or two so many of the enclosures are closed off . Parking is a nightmare. Plan to drive around to find parking a while. Lines move fairly quick especially if you have a memebership. Gift shop will break the bank . Food and drink prices are high. Bring your own food and drink . Nice that they rent wagons when available.
Great experience while visiting Denver, this was a good attraction via the ‚ÄúCity Pass‚Äù My son really enjoyed his trip here to the Zoo! Great Pineapple Blonde Craft beer here as well!

Buy your tickets online, save money! Crazy busy during Spring Break! Nearly run over by strollers multiple times and parents not minding their young. (Keep an eye on your path at all times.) Exhibits were a little messier than expected, but animals seem in good health. Be prepared to wait in line for everything: entrance, food, restroom, looking at an animal, etc... Typical overpriced zoo food and drinks. Some cute shirts and hats in the gift shop by the entrance, very nice employees. Overall a nice place to be outside with friends and family, but be prepared to be crowded and run over.

One of the larger zoos I've been to. There are several different species of animals in what seem to be very well kept enclosures. Unfortunately a lot of them were hiding due to the cold winter but it was still worth the visit!

It was covid time (6/30/2020 @345p) and the staff was friendly and making sure social distancing was in place. Everything had signage of high touch areas (meaning you probably DON'T wanna touch) and sanitizer for your hands. You are kinda corralled through the park. My advice would be go earlier than later. The baby lions ect are going to go to 'bed' at 230pm. So many times i quoted the line from Jurassic park about the lack of animals on the tour. I got some good shots and it was better than I expected. I just wish they didn't put the baby animals to bed so soon. #LetThemStayUpLate

This zoo was fabulous.  Visiting from Chicago this was my favorite part of our trip to Denver.  We are members of the Brookfield Zoo in Chicago and we have the Lincoln Park zoo as well, but the Denver Zoo had a lovely layout.  The animals were all out and present.  You have Elephants ‚ù§üêò‚ù§ my favorite!!!  We happened to be in for free day and it was still manageable with the people in attendance.   If we are in the area again we will visit again.

First time hear and had a blast. Great procedures regarding mask usage and social distancing. One way arrows throughout the entire zoo which also made it easier, for a first-timer like myself, to navigate without seeing repeat attractions.

Honestly even in the off season there's a lot to enjoy here. If you're here around the new year the lights are some of the best, and it brings in all kinds of people, which is a very fun and exciting vibe.

All of the new areas are looking really nice and modern (big fan of the tiger), while also stylistically working with the rest of the zoo. Can't wait to see the ones they're building now.

Food is a little expensive but there's not much escaping that now a days it seems. But there are water bottle refilling stations all over, very convenient.

They're also big supporters of conservation, and fair treatment of animals.

One of the best zoos in the US in my opinion.

Who knew but even in the winter the Denver Zoo is a great pace to take the family. I really thought the animals would inside and not moving but it was the complete opposite. A lot of the animals were out enjoying the sun.
Great Zoo the tiger exhibit is one of the best I have ever seen.  Went in the colder months but still got to see most of the amazing animals plan on coming back in the summer months for sure.

Beautiful!! The zoo lights were amazing and the crew is fantastic with covid procedures! Satatization stations were all over and outdoor dining and pick up avaliable and they have an interactive app that was really useful! Such an awesome experience!

I've been going here since I was little and the new tiger and elephant exhibits make it even more magical. I feel bad for the elephants though, they only have Male elephants and they keep them segregated. Elephants are rarely alone in the wild they are very social, I understand if it was for their rut or something but otherwise it just looks depressing as they rock to comfort themselves.

Great zoo! Zookeepers were very interactive and nice. Great exhibits both indoor and outdoor. Very eco friendly zoo. The food options were delicious  (they do have vegan options) a great zoo to spend the day at.

We love the Denver zoo. Have only gone once this year unfortunately, due to covid. We usually carry a membership and will once again when we feel safer about being in public again.
Zoo lights was fantastic as always. Very courteous staff all night, animals seem to enjoy themselves.

Recently went, if you've been here before you are no longer allowed to free roam. There is a set path that you have to follow due to the pandemic. This doesn't take away from you enjoying the exhibits. Our daughter still had a fun time.

The Denver Zoo is one of the best zoos in the U.S.!
The exhibits are clean, the seal show is very entertaining and they have an interactive feeding session with giraffes! The kids love the reptile house the best! This is only based on viewing the animals! I have not been to any of the eateries inside the zoo.
So many great improvements! The elephants and apes are much improved from when I remember going. Wonderful to just take a stroll and caught a lot of animals talks and feedings. Love the zoo!

Absolutely love this zoo! All of the animals have wonderful enclosures and Can be seen up close and personal. I could easily spend a whole day here and still want more. The only issue I encountered on my visit was a VERY long wait time at the ticket counter. I would recommend purchasing tickets online ahead of time.

This zoo, although set in the middle of the city is not bad as far as size. It is not a huge sprawling layout, so you will not be walking as far, but still is a decent sized setup for where it sits. They continue to make improvements and add/modify exhibits to make them more animal and viewer friendly. You do get to be quite close to some of the animals, which is great for kids. Depending on when you go, it can be very crowded, although at the time of writing this, that is not an issue because of Covid restrictions. Also at the time of writing, many of the food places were closed, so be aware of that if you plan to eat in the zoo.

This is a great zoo!!! A great variety of animals that aren‚Äôt available at our ‚Äúhome‚Äù zoo (Minnesota Zoo). They have a lot about conserving energy and what not too‚Äî compostable items, recycling, etc. They also have a lot of shows, but didn‚Äôt get a chance to attend any. Price is $20 for adult and $13 for kids 3+, they do not participate in reciprocity discounts. Parking is free.

Great family fun place, so many animals. I'd suggest bringing in your own snacks and also water, little pricey.  Staff is very friendly and very knowledgeable about everything from the animals to where is the closes bathroom.

We live here and are going to got back again.

I'd also say you'd want to make this an all day event if you want to see all what it all has to offer.
Of course it's fun, it's the zoo! They serve beer now, and the food has gotten a lot better. You can spend hours here, be sure to ask for directions to see the animals you want to see.

Who doesn't love the zoo?? Of course with everything that's going on in the world this visit a little different. The staff was awesome if you had any questions about which direction to go if you wanted to see something specific.

We all had a blast! Don't know who enjoyed it more me and hubby or the kids lol they even let you leave the park if you want and stamp your hand so you can return. I thought that was neat bc you may want to take a break for lunch and have something outside the zoo. They we're also informative about exhibits and what times they were doing shows...tigers dolphins and such.

Denver zoo is very nice.  Most of the animals seem happy and it has a nice layout.  However there seems to always be construction going on and on the weekends the parking lots get pretty packed.

I feel bad for the hippo.  It‚Äôs pool is the size of him and he doesn‚Äôt have room to swim around.  Hopefully they realize this and fix it.  Also the polar bears look pretty sad most days.

The Denver Zoo is an awesome place. They've made many improvements and looks like there's more coming. I went on a weekday, still parking was pretty full. I've never used the underground parking so not sure of capacity. Large trees, lots of plants too throughout the zoo. Most animals have it pretty good with space, shelter, toys, decent environment, shade, misters when hot. They have shows about animals, very interesting. Today first time going into Lorakeet enclosure, colorful, intelligent birds. For $2.00 you can buy a mini papercup with some kind of nectar to entice them, they love it. Some will try to grab the cup. I think that was my favorite part of the zoo this time. I do notice some enclosures on the outskirts have overgrown plants making it hard to see the animals, they need a little trimming. Totally an awesome good time at the zoo!

We are first time visitors to the Denver Zoo, coming from San Antonio, TX. We really enjoyed the mix of animals, especially the Great Apes.  On our day, many of the animals were active and in view. Be sure to check out the lions and the African wild dogs, whose exhibits are across from each other.

Also, the food options were plentiful and reasonable. The zoo staff and docents were friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a great time. Enjoy.

As a full-time destination event photographer, I have the honor of photographing all kinds of fun conferences all over the country.  After a recent conference in downtown Denver, the organization celebrating a successful meeting at the Denver Zoo.  The staff there was so helpful and nice to work with.  The food was delicious.  But having the zoo all to ourselves for the evening was simply MAGICAL!!!
Well minus the weather changing on us it was absolutely fun! Celebrating turning 2 at the zoo, up close with animals you watch every day on TV!

Family friendly and a great way to spend the day. With food trucks and beer sold on site this is for the whole family. Super cool new tiger exhibit and I have never seen elephants swim. The elephants put on a great show another must see.
Amazing animals, beautiful grounds and friendly staff. Somehow feels like I was able to get closer to these animals than any other Zoo I've been too. Highly recommend.

What a great zoo. Though the map and layout is a little confusing but the quality of exhibits are great. You really feel like the animals are being well cared for and enriched. The food was fantastic! Far better quality than I would have expected from a zoo. And the most photogenic bear I have ever seen in my life was a nice bonus.

Had to spend a day with family and figured out this zoo would be our best option. Went for the penguins, which we spent a good amount of time at. Maybe we just didn't get the lay out but it seemed like a very small zoo. Either way the Pandas were worth it.

Great zoo, but still under construction for new bigger exhibits for the animals. Some animals were not in the enclosures... couldn't see the snow leopard. Also dogs not see the larger primates, not sure if they aren't there or if we just didn't find them.
Zoo Lights 2018 was a must see. Well done.  We had a great time going thru the walk.  Took fun pics and enjoyed our time despite the cold temps.

Such a great zoo! People had said it wasn‚Äôt as up close and personal as Cheyenne mountain zoo, but I felt we were able to get up close to all the animals, even during Covid! There‚Äôs tons to do and even a little grass area to take a mask break. We had an excellent experience!

Personally, the best zoo I have been to. Was impressed with some of the animal habitats as well as the variety of animals. The animals were also out and playful during my visit, so I may be biased. Also talked with a few of the zookeepers, and was very fond of them. As a conservationist and animal lover, Im glad such good people were caring for the animals.
Loved it! Definitely a place to visit while in Colorado. I had such a wonderful experience feeding the giraffes.

An incredible zoo. Well worth setting aside a couple hours to come here. All the exhibits are laid out to give the best view of animals and the animals look very happy. It was the perfect place to take our two year old toddler who loves running around and seeing animals. DO NOT SKIP THE BIRD SECTION!!! It is so easy to pass by, but is so incredibly immersive and so many different birds flying around you. We all left extremely blown away at the dedication to each section of the park and knowledgable staff with tons of information.

I thought that the zoo was ok. Before the update I would have gave it 5 stars but they REMOVED the polar bears!! The bear enclosed was bigger but it was a little hard to see because the bears where still get used to the new enclosure. I loved the sea lion show though. Even though I did not see all of the zoo, of what I did see was about 3 stars.
Went at the end of January. A few displays were closed but still got to see quite a few animals. The penguins were gone - they shut down the penguin section - so fast was a little disappointing.

Best zoo I have ever been too! Definitely worth the price. So many different animals and exhibits to see! Plan on spending at least 2 hours there especially if you want to see everything and get pictures. There's animals you see at other zoos and then there is some I haven't seen at other zoos.

By far my favorite city zoo that I've been to so far, the Denver Zoo has a lot to offer. From selection of animals to knowledgeable staff and interactive demonstrations, the annual membership is well worth a purchase. I want to go again soon!
Great zoo! Fun for kids and adults. Bring you walking shoes and get there early. Only comment they need a bigger parking lot.

I've been going to this zoo since I was 5. It's always changing for the better, and I love coming back to see the improvements. The food at Northern Shores was surprisingly good. Care clearly went into it,  even though the selections were very basic. It's great that the educators are right there ready to answer questions. The Elephant Passage area is really spectacular, I loved the atmosphere. The only thing I wish they had more of is shade! A few shade structures would be super nice, especially as summers are just getting hotter and hotter. Bleh.

This is typically a great zoo! The day we went it was rarher hot outside and some of the animals were indoors. The lions, tigers, leopards, hippos and a few others we were not able to see. Kind of a big let down since those are the animals we went to see. Maybe next time! We loved the tropical indoors exhibits. Lots of fish,snakes and reptiles!
On a good note, we were pleasantly surprised with the pineapple Dole whip! Great price too!

This zoo is very clean and is usually always renovating to keep the park new and exciting. There are many different attractions and animal exhibits, indoor and outdoor. Most times there are animals in all of the enclosure but some days there won‚Äôt be a couple. We are season pass holders and always get to come back when we don‚Äôt get to finish walking through. They also do zoo lights in the winter which is always fun and different. A bad experience we had about a year ago was when we went and we were in an encloser that was large and a walk through, we were about half way through when we were 4-5 park employees that were shoving everyone out of the encloser. They said we had to leave because they were closing within the hour. They were extremely rude and careless in the way they went about it. I was also given a hot chocolate with fireball in it because of their careless employees, I was underage at the time and we had our whole family with us and the drink could‚Äôve been given to my 4 year old brother, 8 year old brother or 10 year old sister. Things could be handled differently and more effectively to keep paying customers happy.

It's a good zoo. It isn't the best zoo ever but if you go at the right times, you can see cool things like penguin and hippo feedings. They also have presentations the zoo keepers give where you can learn more about certain animals (today we learned about the condors) and can even ask them questions. There are some exhibits that are empty, sometimes unexpectedly. We visited the pachyderm area and it was empty today. There's no real order to the exhibits so a map is helpful which they give at the gates. They have a carousel and train rides which are free for kids 2 and under, $2 for members and $3 for non members. There are plenty of bathrooms throughout along with signs so they aren't hard to find. Fun visit and worth a trip overall

*many of the exhibits aren't very wheelchair accessible which makes it hard for strollers as well. The doors aren't automated (no button) in most

The Zoo is one of my favorite places to go. They have friendly staff and genuinely care for each animal. Always doing cool new exciting things. Boo at the zoo is great for kids and don't forget about zoo lights. Think about becoming a member. Zoo for two is only $95.00 and then if you renew early $80.00. If you go 3 or more it's worth it and then some. Also get a reusable zoo cup refills are $1.50 and you can bring it back next time. Also check a list of days that are free days on the website.
Came here on a class field trip. Despite the cold, snow, and construction we still saw some neat animals. The staff was very helpful in directing us to exhibits that were open.

Lots of animals to see. Make sure you get there early because by noon the animals are either asleep or off display. The gift shop is not worth it but the 4d movie experience and other attractions are.

They have a wide variety of animals. I enjoy learning something about the animals when I go to zoos. It wasn't overly crowded. Some of the exhibits seem a bit small and we didn't get to see many bears. We got to contribute a vote for a new baby coming soon. Hopefully, they get the construction done soon.

I loved the play and splash area!  I wish I had known about it sooner. There is a Denver Zoo App with a map to help ease but it lacks a logo to specify children interactive areas such as the sand play area, jump like an animal etc. They have a whole play area for children, toddlers and up. The new Dinosaur exhibits are awesome and we hope they're here to stay, or at least come back next summer!! They have a dig for bones activity and a dinosaur to climb on by the carousel. They also have a whole parakeet section where you can go in and feed the birds. I wish they had a place you could feed the giraffes.

Boo at the Zoo is always a hit, we love the chapstick (only Toyota was handing out the chapstick this year). The light at the Zoo has severely improved since the last time I attended in 2011. There are so many more lights and fun events etc.

FYI you cannot bring balloons into the zoo, but you can bring food, snacks, juice boxes, and water. Food isn‚Äôt too expensive nor disgusting if you have to buy here too. Beer and BBQ is sold at the Zoo if you need that as a selling point to get the hubby to go.

This is a great zoo and it keeps getting better. From the Asian experience to the new tiger enclosure, the permanent animal exhibits are great. Then the changing featured attractions give people a whole new reason to visit, such as Lego animals and anamatronic dinosaurs. If you live in the area the family pass is the way to go! My family and I love the Denver Zoo.

Awesome place, my party and myself had a wonderful time at the Denver Zoo. We arrived early about 10 minutes in order to get parking (I've heard horror stories about event parking at the zoo). Group tickets are n the phone and BAM!!! we're in. It was a blast visiting all of the animals and reading about them, their natural habitats, and the occasional born in captivity baby name
Overall, I recommend the Denver Zoo.
Love the zoo. Only issue was the fact that some of the exhibits were closed. The service was excellent. There was a hilarious peacock begging at the food court. Made my day!

A lion was inches away from me. That's what happened late yesterday afternoon when I visited the Denver Zoo. The great-bodied, long-maned lion, with his large yellow eyes and massive paws, was only inches away... although, luckily, he was behind strong glass.  There was no one else around. I heard the faint voices of children calling from afar, but I was by myself. The lion, however, was not alone. He lay on a large rock near a brother, with another a bit farther off. They were still with a mysterious feline stillness. Twice, the nearest lion turned slowly his head slowly to look in my eyes, and then turned back again. I sat watching for a long time. A few flakes of snow drifted down, and the  breeze began to rise, but these changes were ignored by the big cats. They remained still, like monuments, like myths.

I think they were waiting for supper. Perhaps they were simply waiting for a door to be opened to allow them inside. I felt lucky to be able to wait with them, for a time. And to be able to be so close, near enough to mark their breathing.

Zoos are complicated and paradoxical. They certainly offer preservation and education, but they participate in captivity, one of the worst of human behaviors. The frequently garish displays of commercialism are also quite bothersome. Of course, I'm personally just as conflicted. I can feel immensely sad during some zoo visits, but it's also deeply meaningful to be able to approach animals that I would otherwise never see in real life.

In this review, I've given the zoo three stars, despite my wonderful experience with the lions, because the rest of my visit was marred by the awful holiday music blaring near most (but not all) of the exhibits. This was an afternoon visit, remember. The zoo would close at 5:00 and then reopen a half hour later for the annual Zoo Lights event. During my afternoon at the zoo, Christmas music was continuous, and continuously distracting. Holiday music has its place - during the evening Zoo Lights event, presumably - but otherwise please let me hear the call of the peacocks, or the sound an elephant's foot makes as it slides along the path.

Animals share habitats in some places. It is big enough that even with a lot of people it doesn't feel crowded. Plus, in October they have boo at the zoo with lights for two weekends. If you become a member you can get discounts for special events. There is also a carousel and train which you can ride.

My wife and I came here while visiting family. Had a blast! I even saw the new baby lion! Almost got to feed a giraffe and talked to a penguin like, I squaked it squawked back then I flapped my arms it flapped its "wings?" They should be called flippers. And ya tried riding a hippo then fell off... it's harder than it looks. I'll add a photo as proof.

Loved the experience, I come here yearly!
It's a family and school tradition!
I kinda wish they had more animals like wolves, owls, sea turtles, tortoise, Ox, bull, but still wonderful!! And very surprised it barely stinks!!
Shows are cool! Parking is a pain in the neck, but it's worth it! If you want easy to find parking spaces, come March-May or August-October on Tuesdays, Wednesday, Monday, or Thursday, possibly come 10-11am

U know it's the ZOO Its always cool but at night with lights even better except I wish there was some kind of ambient type lighting in the animals enclosures so that you could see them even if it was green let's say to match the holiday lights? But omg it's a really cool light display they put together it's absolutely beautiful I must say they did a really good job...and thanks to ACE HARDWARE fit the super good deal on the tickets and sponsorship they have with the zoo. GREAT JOB!
Great times here. Bring water and picnic food. We brought a wagon to tote around. The train rides are a bit to short. Under 5 minutes. Enjoyed all the animals especially the Tiger feedings.

The Denver Zoo has changed so much. I have children from 23 down to 4 years of age. From the time I used to take my older children to now,it's like a whole new zoo. A complete different zoo. I  didn't even see the whole zoo this time but there are very few things that remain the same.
There is also a peacock that fights his own reflection named Narcissus. He can't find a mate because he is too busy looking at his own reflection. We thought he was pretty funny.
The giraffe exhibit is pretty much the same and the women who work in there are very knowledgeable.

Some friends of ours were visiting from outside the US and we thought it would be fun to show them the Zoo Lights at the Denver Zoo! We went after the New Year to avoid the crowds and it was perfect timing! The lights were amazing, lots of cute little booths to get something warm to drink or eat, and even saw some of the animals (a great way to skip out of the cold weather to get warm too). Another bonus was the cute 4D movie - only 15 minutes and fun with all of the ‚Äúeffects‚Äù!

It's always nice to visit the zoo and spend time enjoying the animals. The keepers and volunteers are amazing people. Between the stories of the animals there and their backgrounds and the information they teach, I'm always glad to stop and chat with them and that they're willing to stop and chat with us. The zoo lights are great as well! I've been twice and it's something I look forward to.

A cool experience. The tigers were active and something to behold. Lions were also in clear view. My only critique is the conditions seemed too cold for some of the animals. There was snow in a lot of the exhibits, and the animals are from warmer climates.

The Denver Zoo never disappoints! You can rent a stroller for your children, eat just about any type of food from Pizza to Burgers to amazing BBQ, the park is always extremely clean and decorated for each season!
We had a great experience, even on a cold day in December. Most of the food stalls were closed, but the animals seemed well taken care of. We loved the lorikeet experience!

Although a little expensive, great experience! Great conservation efforts and shows. They are working hard to use less plastic, most silverware is compostable, and most containers are recyclable. Primate exhibit is fun, and elephant show is awesome!
Fabulous zoo. Most people were wearing a mask and practicing social distance. It takes two hours to three to finish the whole zoo.

Great place to take kids or even go yourself ! Lots of cool things to explore ! The Toyota elephant passage is all new and very cool ! You can bring in your own food and that's a very big plus ! Love that you can rent a wagon also ! Many good options as well for snacks and other larger food items

Always a beautiful place to spend the morning or late afternoon... Not a 11-2 pm place to be it's generally hot and the animals are not very active, if you come early and bring a picnic to eat at the zoo or city park, about noon take a couple hour break to eat then return to finish the tour it's a perfect day!
Saw the Christmas lights at the zoo.  It was so pretty!  Being outdoors it made social distancing easy.  The giraffe, penguin, rhino, tiger and hippopotamus exhibits were pretty cool!

Have been to Denver many, many times but never visited the Zoo.  Why on earth did I wait so long???  The Denver Zoo is FABULOUS!  Multi-generational trip with Grandma, Mommy's, teens and little ones, and everybody had the best time!  Don't wait as long as I did to experience it!
Really good zoo, good layout, and good ambiance. Drinks, food, and souvenirs are pricey, but what do you expect it's the zoo. The exhibits are nicely laid out and tickets were reasonable. Worth it.

Really impressive exhibits and layout. It will not do justice to the zoo and staff to simply talk about how great it is there. I would highly recommend giving the zoo a visit and let it impress you first hand. If you enjoy Cheyenne Mountain, this will bring a sense of deja Vu.

A fun place for all ages. The exhibits are nice, with friendly staff and volunteers available to answer questions or give additional information about the animals. The size of the zoo makes it easy to see in one day or with an annual pass you can visit often to enjoy the many shows. I like the play areas for the little ones and large grassy areas for picnic lunches. You can bring your own food and drink or enjoy eating at one the restaurants. There are a lot of shade trees and areas to sit. Overall the zoo is well kept, the only reason I don't give five stars is the cleanliness of the water features and glass at many exhibits.
Animals are awesome. Please donate they are so cute! Also gift shop had good deals and plenty to chose from.

We are members of the Denver zoo, so going into the zoo is as easy as exiting it. We enjoy the animals and watching them as they build new exhibits, as they‚Äôve built more on each visit. I wish there was more security or zoo staff on hand on their busy days as most parents do not stop their toddler-7 year olds from climbing on my sons wheelchair to see an animal. They do provide wagons and electric wheelchairs at low cost. The food is good if you choose to eat at the park. I do wish they gave access to water, cheaper that $5.00 a bottle (demotes 1 star for that). The vending machines have been busted and took our money the last two times we were there, use at your own risk. Otherwise this is my top places to waste a day away, we love it and hope you do too :)
The Denver Zoo is a wonderful place!!!

Not an amazing zoo, but impressive.
I was surprised by size of zoo. Think it took me, like 3 hours to walk around and see everything.
Only thing I didn't like, is how some of animals looked unhealthy, even depressed.
Amazing place to spend a day.  Low cost of admission with so much to see and do.  The Zoo is well maintained, clean and has very friendly staff.

We went in the winter and not for Zoo Lights. It was interesting to see a good amount of the animals out and active. The Zoo was not slammed and we got to ask a lot of questions to the staff that worked directly with the animals in that section. From the pachyderms in musk, to the amazing young man named Troy at the Amazon that gave us a cool glimpse as to what it's like to be a herper (herpetologist) at the Zoo.

Great zoo to visit, even during a pandemic. Everything is as touch free as possible. Tickets for admission have to be purchased online. Gate admissions run about every 15 minutes to prevent over crowding. Lots of sanitizing stations, as well as high touch point signs.
The animals are well cared for and the zoo provides a lot of enrichment. I plan on visiting again when I come back to Denver!

We had a great outing at the zoo today. First time I‚Äôd been, it was a sizeable establishment and we walked about 3 miles total with all the little side trails( you could cut it in Half if you wanted/needed).  We were there about 3 hours with a toddler and stroller, there also seemed to be a good amount of people but it really didn‚Äôt feel overcrowded or like people were pushing to the front to see the animals. The exhibits were set up nicely with multiple viewing locations, many also had indoor/covered viewing as well as outside. It was nice to see the animals seemed to have a lot of space and weren‚Äôt forced on display. There were quite a few animals we did not see (it may have been a seasonal thing with the exhibit closed) or maybe they were taking a nap somewhere- but we didn‚Äôt feel like we missed out because there were plenty of other animals.  Once the trees bloom it will be even more beautiful just as a nice walk too. You also can rent wagons if you have kids that want to be in and out of the strollers.  Facility was well kept, restrooms and water throughout.  There were a few places to eat, and some small vendors set up throughout.  Fun elephant/water show twice a day.  I was actually quite surprised that I only can recall one child meltdown the entire time. I didn‚Äôt notice unhappy children - or even adults, all ages seemed to really enjoy the day.  My family will likely get passes to go many more times. Definitely go!

I went to see the zoo lights this year on 27th dec 2018. It was cold at that day. So make sure you pack every single thing while visiting the zoo. Even for kids, i kept warmer  packets so I can put these inside gloves and socks. The lighting was amazing. The animations for different zoo animals was done beautifully thorgh lights. The ice sculpture for snow man and penguin was good. Here are some pictures. You can visit zoo till 6th jan.
Everything has changed since COVID but I honestly like how it is. It makes the experience amazing and people move more quickly. It's not over crowded and the lines aren't long to see the habitats.

Surprisingly big, close experience. Every year they revamp another section and it's a big walkthrough experience. During COVID they've designed a one-way path that takes you through the exhibits (with a shorter route if necessary), "high touch" areas are identified and hand sanitizer is everywhere. Food and drink prices are still high, but now you can bring in your item as well. 3/4 through is a park that you can drop mask at and picnic if you'd like.

Fun place to take kids. They have a lot of protective measures now. In some ways I like how directed it is now, I frequently got lost or didn't know where to start/go when it was open in the usual way.
Exhibits are well kept and clean, good amount of sun and shade. You need at least 2 hrs+ to get through the whole zoo. Great kids area and picnic spots throughout!

I had a fantastic time at this zoo! I went with two friends and we got there about 11, we're there until almost closing, and we could of spent more time there. There is a lot to see and learn about with at this zoo. If I lived in Denver I would of got the yearly membership to visit a lot because my innerchild loved it here. I will be back for sure the next time I'm in town
Really cool zoo with lots of animals. Definitely worth walking through the bird exhibit and feeding them! Our whole group had a great time!

This was our first visit and it did not disappoint...though there are several exhibits under construction. Some animals are not currently there either but it was still a great experience. I would highly recommend going and taking the whole family.

The Denver Zoo holds a special place in my heart. When my son was a toddler, I'd take him almost once a week because we loved being here together.

We'd ride the carousel and train. We'd catch the sea lion show. We'd feed nectar to the lorikeets. We'd hunt for the peacocks that wander freely through the zoo. We'd visit Monkey Island,  Elephant Passage, Bear Mountain, and our absolute favorite, Tropical Discovery. It's so beautifully and thoughtfully designed; full of wondrous animals and creatures you'd never imagine getting to encounter at a zoo.

We also love Zoo Lights and Boo at the Zoo. There's not much to dislike about a place that genuinely seems to care for its animals and the guests that visit them. One year Denver Zoo was also awarded the greenest zoo in the country.

Getting a membership here is worth every penny and we plan on being members for life.

Visited with family in mid-July 2018.    It was a good experience.   Drop-off and parking were easy.    There were plenty of displays to interest our 2 1/2 year old granddaughter.    Zoo is quite large but seemed to be easy to see nearly all in about 4 hours.   Plenty of viewing and resting areas.    Shows were not very crowded.    Prices in shops were reasonable.

Went for Holiday Zoolights.  This is a yearly tradition.  The lights were beautiful and festive as always.  Saw very few animals, which is to be expected since it was dark.  Noticed a few new things in the lighting display and a couple of old favorites missing.  It's possible they just got moved to a new location and we just missed it.  Overall a great experience, one of the highlights of the holiday season.
