Fantastic place to take my nephew. We totally party with the animals!  I love it at the Denver Zoo, the staff is friendly and just thinking about it makes me want to dance!  Enjoy your time at the Denver Zoo!!!
Love the zoo so much cool stuff going on you will spend the whole day there so make sure you go early.  Animals are very clean like washed and well taken care of .

Great spot to view exciting animals and pass some time while in Denver. Pretty empty during the winter, most outdoor exhibits empty but there's lots to see within the buildings. Lots of construction winter 2019.

Best ZOO EVER !!!!!!!!!! I've been to so many and this trumps all! Worth the money!  The animals seem happy and energetic compared to a lot of other Zoos I visited where they seem stressed, ignored and unhappy. Well done Denver, thanks for a great experience.

P.s. I've been to zoos in New York, Tennessee, Georgia, Texas, Michigan, Long Island, north and South Carolina, Virginia, Maryland..this is the best! Go here!
The zoo is the most wonderful place to take your kids. Especially babies can listen to animals sounds. I also loved the new stingray  Exhibit.
Great Zoo over all friendly staff. With wide veritie of animals to see. Many food and beer options throughout the zoo. Many interactive  activities for both kids and adults.
Even though some exibhits were closed, there were a decent amount of animals to see. Zookeeper's were very nice and knowledgeable about their furry friends.

Stopped in at 9 am on a Sunday and it was already pretty busy. Decently priced at $20 per adult.

Zoo is laid out weird. It has a circular path but there are a lot of meandering mini paths and dead ends.

Something that really bothered me was how many empty exhibits they had. Seriously at least 10 to 12 empty exhibits. Not complaining about animals being shy either, I mean nothing there.

Staff was uninvolved. Most stalls for food and drink and items didnt open until 10 or 11am either.

Elephant enclosure was awesome and worth every penny.
One of the best zoos I have ever been too. Great exhibits Kid friendly . The zoo keepers were super nice and answered all are questions.
Went on a free day. All aviary is off site.currently due to bird flu.

It was a amazing zoo had so much to see. Didnt get to see everything cuz the zoo closed. But they could have let us know that a few exhibits where closed for renovations. But overall it was great. My 3 yr old loved ot.
Huge zoo, great for older kids for a full day trip.  My kids loved the Lorikeet Adventure feeding the birds.  So many interactive opportunities, we try to go every time we are in Denver.
Zoo lights was great! Cold but there were plenty of warm up stations and plenty of cocoa! Parking wasn't bad either. Stay warm!

Make sure if you visit Denver you should go to the Denver Zoo. Their staff is amazing is very informative you learn a lot. It's fun for the kids. You can see the animals very close the shows are very informative and very fun to see.

Always love seeing different animals, especially ones that are being protected from endangerment and extinction through the care of zoos. Prices for interactions seem very high (compared to other zoos I have been to). Habitats also seem small for sdome if the animals but it looks as though the zoo is working on improving that as they can.

I am so proud of the Denver Zoo for the tireless work they do around the world to save habitats and endangered species. The zoo is beautiful, the grounds are gorgeous. Most of the animal enclosures are very nice. Of course it's a shame that the residents are captive but for most all of them it's their only chance to survive and hopefully the endangered species can survive and thrive. The zoo staff is so friendly and knowledgeable. Opportunities to learn about the animals and their unique situations are limitless because the zoo staff is always educating the public. I am a proud member of the Denver Zoo and have been for many years.

A very nice Zoo with a great variety of species. The Lorikeet feeding is an awesome experience. In general, the food inside is not that great and could use more vegetarian options. It would take a while day to see everything; So come when it opens itself and plan to bring food to beat the lines in the eateries.

I don't know if it was the time of day we went, but we didn't see half of the animals, a lot of the areas were empty, wish they would've told us before we went in. Other than that, it was pretty cool, staff in the park was friendly.

Great experience with an Asian or Colorado theme throughout.
I know we were lucky, but to see the elephants running and sparring was a treat. I had never seen a fishing cat either that was fun.
The winter is a great time to visit the zoo! Go for it.
Love the zoo. Clean and a great family friendly place to take the kids. Lots of areas under construction but still some great exhibitions. PARKING IS TERRIBLE!

Key exhibits include the new Asian Tropics, Predator Ridge, and Bird World. There is so much to see and to learn. You could plan an entire day spent here and to be educated on everything if you really take the time to do so.
There is an onsite Animal Hospital being built at the Denver Zoo along with other amazing updates and additions to the park. The big cat houses are under construction for expansion and remodel.
The pedestrian landscape is gorgeous and very Colorado. Original, updated, or brand new the exhibits display much of the animal and it's habitat. With plenty of new projects going on at the Denver Zoo right now it is an exciting time when you see all the work getting done. It's an amazing feeling.
Enjoy your time here in Denver, Colorado and since while you're in City Park visit the Denver Museum of Nature and Science. The museum's atrium views of the Central Platte Valley are breathtaking with the backdrop of the front range.

-Isaac, a Denver native

We had a lot of fun and the reptile house was amazing. A few complaints would be: it could use more trail signs that point to exhibits as we got lost a few times, and the food I paid nearly $40 was terrible. I recommend not eating at the cafeteria by the sea lion exhibit or at least don't get a sandwich from there. The soft serve ice cream I got by the entrance was great though. It was a hot day and the abundance of water refill and misting stations was much appreciated!

Denver zoo lights was amazing! The hyenas and lions and hippos were out and the lights were expertly done! It was our first time going and I would definitely go again. Takes about 30-60 minutes to go through the line depending on how late you get there. Takes a couple of hours to see everything so very warm clothes are recommended.

Fantastic talks and demonstrations for guests. They provide choice and control for all of the animals under their care, allowing them to choose where they would like to spend their day. This includes being out of guest view. They rotate environmental enrichment and even habitats for some species.
We had a great time at the Denver Zoo. Very well laid out and easy to navigate . Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. The cost was reasonable it was not too big or small.

Such an amazing zoo! There are so many exhibits to visit with many unique animals. If you are ever in the Denver area, I would consider this a must visit. If you do plan to visit, allow a good portion of the day, as it is a larger zoo with menay animals (as mentioned previously) it can take a long time to see everything. You won't be disappointed.

This is a fun zoo. It's no St. Louis Zoo which is what I'm used to, we're completely spoiled here in stl by our zoo. It was very fun though and my son had a great time! My kiddo loved the reptile house. There was a komodo dragon and he lost his mind over it! He was so excited!

On a Sunday Sunny Day on January 23d 2022 the Denver Zoo was The Place to go to have a Family Outing.  The elephants Did Not disappoint their fans at the 1:45 afternoon performance.   All the animals were as HaPpY as all the animal lovers with their wagons to get out and see each other.  The Denver Zoo was a popular place to be on this day.
Great family experience, all the animals are fun and seem to be happy and well taken care of!

Took my girls here for the day it was a pretty amazing zoo can't wait to go back.They had a train and a merry-go-round..... I like how each animal was put into sections very organized and it was a laid-back Zoo which I loved
I wish I would of went during the day to see all the animals. I did go to the zoo lights and definitely recommend visiting if you're ever here during the holidays.  Absolutely loved it.ü•∞
School trip with my daughter we had a blast enjoyed seeing the animals on our list, We shared a Burger from The C food truck. Delicious
The zoo was fantastic, even during a pandemic. Everyone was friendly and the animals are always fun to see.

A great place to spend a day. They have a wide variety of animals and the staff are friendly.  The volunteers werw awesome, freindly and extremely informative. If your travels bring you to Denver for any period of time, it's worth a visit. Great for the kids.
Amazing Zoo and it's huge! Love the selection of animals! Daughter's love it! One of the best Zoo's we've been too!!

I have been coming here for over 20 years now and still love it.
The best part is you're allowed to bring in your own food/drinks and have a picnic mid-day. We usually have our picnic on the Southside of the giraffes in the grass area.
They have my favorite animal as well- poisonous dart frogs.

Wow, very neat zoo! I learned so much on my visit, like who knew elephants had 2 trunks? They even incorporated the smell of the gorilla exhibit in one of their chicken tender sauces. Tasted awful, but 5 stars for effort!

Its the zoo come on people, its amazing animals, love going on week days. And they are building and expanding currently as we speak for a new bear enclosure. Love animals, DONT JUMP THE FENCES, enjoy the zoo

Such a fun place to go.
Obviously it's a zoo so it has some down falls like smell and costs but overall it's a great place to go for a walk with the family. Halloween was great too! It was an adventure finding all the mythical creatures.  My favorite was Sasquach!

This zoo was amazing! Traveling through Denver and stopped at this gem. Their elephant exhibit was incredible. I love how knowledge all of the zoo keepers and staff are. The animals had amazing enclosures and excellent care plans that the keepers would explain at request. See the elephants!!

Zoo lights is excellent! You can tell they took time making it all perfect. Made it a girl's night, and we had a blast!

Tip: Folks, take your photos and step aside so others get a chance. Thank you.
Had a great time with my girls. Alot of construction and all the birds were put away due to bird flu. Well be back
Pretty solid zoo that has so many great exhibits, education sessions, food, and even beer üç∫
Lovely zoo that seems to care about conservation more than some smaller town zoos.
Doing a great job with Covid precautions. My husband son and I had a great time. They have some new babies and we saw the zebra!

Overall a really wonderful Zoo. Appreciated how the zookeepers educated people about dangers facing elephants and the devastating deforestation threatening habitats. As usual, one wishes the animals had more space, but overall the zoo is well designed.

Enjoyed viewing the animals! Many varieties, lots to see and experience! Very recommended for the family! Can't wait to book an animal experience for the next go around! Thanks Denver Zoo, we'll be back!

Amazing zoo, especially during the lights in the holiday season! Also, I've never seen elephants so active. Great place to spend time with friends or on a date. Food and drink there is very expensive though, eat before you go!
Great location! Easily walked and also accessible for those who need it. Plenty of shaded areas to escape the mile high sun.
Such a fun experience! I love how they respect their animals and give them options to be in side or out. I also love the layout and all the baby animals they have this year!

Normally I love the zoo. And I was really looking forward to this visit, since I had not been to the zoo in years. But,  I had many issues with my visit. So I have to give 3 stars instead of 5...#1 I was having mobility issues, there should be a check in line for people with mobility issues. Along those lines there were several exhibits(Rain forest building, Tropical Discovery and at least one other building) that were unavailable to me because of my scooter. I missed out on seeing many unique animals. #2 None of the bathroom entrances were big enough for a wheelchair or scooter to enter. This is not good for people who have trouble walking. And 3# most of the animals I wanted to see, just weren't out. No Bears, no Fennec Foxes, no Pandas (Asian or red), no Rhinos...and no Tigers! I was really looking forward to the tiger exhibit "The Edge", we stopped by multiple times, and no tigers. Also, much of the exhibits were under construction. So, a lack of animals to see and a lack of handicapped accessible buildings and bathrooms. Made for an OK visit. The weather was great & the staff was all very friendly and helpful. Maybe I will see more animals next year.
We had so much fun yesterday and all the animals were out except the birds!

Amazing light show for the holidays, very impressive!! Very nice grounds and easy to drift along at your own pace to enjoy the animals and lights. My goddaughter is 3 and we've been coming since she was a baby but this is our first light show. She loved it! Perfect for all ages! Have "holiday spirits" and cider and cocoa for sale! Great gift shops.
Lots of fun, really great time with my grandson, strongly suggest you take your kids to the zoo üôÇ
Traveled from so far to come see a zoo that was basically a concrete jungle... Nothing amazing about this location. If you're only here for a few days, I would skip out on this experience.

I don‚Äôt usually expect to have a great experience at a zoo, but this one was amazing. They have a few shows that get you really close to the animals. Definitely recommended as one of the top spots to visit if you are near the area.
I LOVE this place! The new enclosures for a lot of the animals are wonderful. There is still lots of construction going on, but that simply means progress and improvement.
The place was great but very large. A lot of renovations but a fun place to go on vacation. This is a great place but be prepared to spend 2 to 4 hours if you plan on seeing the full place.

Great Zoo. Parking is free and wraps around the zoo, City Park and Denver Natural Science Museum. Lots of exhibits to see, could do all in one day if you are ambitious. There are free days for everyone just check ahead with website. We came during October, so they have 3 after hours events. Boo at the Zoo which is for kids under 8, Enchanted Zoo which is for older kids to adults, and Taps and Tails for 21 and over. Very cute
We love this zoo! The layout is awesome, the animals look happy, and the kiddos always have a blast.
Wonderful zoo! Had a fantastic time. So big definitely give yourself a couple hours to experience.

One of our favorite places in Denver! It's easy to spend a couple hours checking out the animals and the learning from the zoo keepers. You can bring in your own food, so feel free to pack a little picnic.
Seems more animals are gone and alot of enclosures are gone and or out of service best thing is the walking and getting in steps the elephants üêò were playing and being loud today was fun to watch

The exhibits were great. We were here for 4 hours and ran out of time to see everything. Only complaint is that the directional signage could use some help. We kept getting confused as to which direction we were supposed to go.

Glad to see the zoo is open and that they have taken measures to ensure the safety of it's visitors by having two-way walking lanes and specific times for entry. Zoo is not completely open however. Mostly the indoor stuff is closed. Social distancing is posted all over with a face mask required. You'll probably feel a little rush at viewing areas. 2 reasons. 1st, you try to maintain 6 feet away from everyone so you try to get your pictures quick and let others take their turn. 2nd, other folks don't do the 6 feet so they are all in your bubble so you have to move. Other than that's, it was awesome.

There is lots to see at this zoo. Such a variety of wildlife and fish to explore. You must get your tickets online prior to visiting, as they are doing timed entry due to COVID. Prices are somewhat high in my opinion at $20 a person, but I understand there are animals to feed and exhibits to maintain. All exhibits were open except the bird exhibit. To top it off they've added LEGO built animals along the path of the zoo, which were amazing. The zoo is also one direction to keep the flow of traffic, and masks are required. There is a new interactive exhibit called stingray bay, but it costs an addition $5 per person to enter. Overall, lovely zoo, clean with nice staff. Would recommend to others coming to Denver, kid and adult friendly.

Unfortunately when I brought my wife and son to this Zoo it was during the afternoon and very hot, so though it was disappointing, understandably many of the animals were no where to be seen.

It was still a great time and a very nice Zoo. We loved seeing the giraffe and elephant.

A nice cold Beer ! Crispy Orange chicken! And happy kiddos ! Yeap the Zoo is great !
Happy bday Baby Boy couldn‚Äôt be happier spending it at the @DenverZoo

My husband and I visited this zoo during the last day of our honeymoon and we are so happy we went. First of all, the bear exhibit? Yes please. Beary much enjoyed it. Second of all, two craft beers and a huge soft pretzel for under $20? Also yes please. Our zoo back home is unbearably lame compared to the Denver zoo. All of the animals were beary active, there we no bare exhibits (all animals were in their respective homes), and the staff were so nice. To say the bear minimum, this is the beary best zoo in the nation.

This beautiful and clean, I did not have the opportunity to see all the animals because I was a little late so if you want to go early and very prepared to walk, enlist water or bottles there are places to fill them for free. What I liked the most was to feed the giraffes and see the little baby gorilla. There is a lot of variety of animals, very recommendable to spend as a family.
Such a nice zoo. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Animal shows are informative and seem to honor the animals by giving choice to perform only if they want to.
It's a big zoo best to bring water  it is well worth the money my wife and I loved it there
A lot of enclosures were closed for construction. But still fun for the kiddos.

Very large zoo with lots of animals to see. Food and drinks are a little pricey but you can bring carry-ins. The exhibits are clean and well maintained. The animal shows are great but the seating fills up fast. If you are in Denver, this is a good place for families to visit.
First year attending Zoo lights and it was a great experience. At the Brown Bear food court there was an employee named ‚ÄúQ‚Äù who really helped our night be magnificent . Thank you again.
Did the zoo lights and had an amazing time. They did great at decorating the place. There's a lot of fun to see a few of the animals in their night habitat.

Beautiful zoo! Amazing staff and excellent exhibits. I loved seeing the animals in larger natural habitat. There is a new baby orangutan as well as gorilla!! You don't want to miss either. They are so cute! Great family friendly time. Whether you are in town for work or exploring your home town, the Denver Zoo is the place to go!

Wonderful place for families to see a wide variety of animals in very creative habitats.  Pack a lunch,  bring the wagon, spend the day.   The best days to visit are usually the least favorable weather days as it keeps the crowds down,  but the animal activity up!

Spent a great Sunday touring the zoo with friends and family.  Some wonderful improvements here over the years...my first visit was over 35 years ago,  and the zoo continues to evolve and grow.  If you enjoy the zoo experience,  you don't be disappointed.

lovely zoo, nice walk. I don't like zoos in general cause animals in cages in environments they don't belong is a bit colonial 1800, but this zoo does a lot of great work to care and rehabilitate. the gorilla was a whole mood.

Wow!!! I have to say I was really impressed by the layout and the way the enclosures were set up. In some areas your just right in the middle of the action. I highly recommend spending an afternoon here!!!

Nothing much to see, half of the Zoo is empty. No exotic birds/animals. Zoo itself very confusing, the map and actual display of animals don‚Äôt match. We spent half of the time in Zoo watching empty cages and look for animals.
Amazing zoo, well maintained, nicely organized, quite large, you can keep coming back again and again.
First time to Zoo Lights!! Just beautiful! Some animals were awake, but many sleeping or blocked off. Def bring your camera!! Dress warm!
Very nice zoo...there are lots of animals..I really liked the setup..you'll need one full day to see each and every animal üòä you'll see peacocks and peahens walking around freely ! !

Been to a lot of Zoos and this is probably in my top two or three. There's a wide array of animals, the walkways are wide and it's easy to find your way around. Many of the exhibits were well kept or recently updated, I greatly recommend the tiger exhibit and the elephant exhibit! I was lucky enough to get to hear one of the tigers roaring - much like a cat that wanted attention! Food and souvenirs were expensive but they always are at Zoos, so try to bring your own food!

It's been quite a few years since I visited the Denver Zoo.  The visit was really a nice experience.   Beside the zoological  collection, walking the grounds is a nine experience.  It feels like a nice park, not just a sterile, institutional collection of animals.  Watching one of the elephants swim completely under water was a blast.  Admission is a bit pricey,  but parking is fee.  Kids under three are free.

I've been visiting this zoo for 30 years, and their absolute passion for the wellbeing of their animals and our world is evident in every aspect.

The Lorikeet volunteers this last week were so wonderful, we got there right at opening and got to meet everyone by name! Thank you so much for your knowledge, kindness, and enthusiasm!
Absolutely a wonderful Zoo. I have been around and seen many zoo's, but this one is close to the best. Lots of food options, clean bathrooms and happy animals.

Awesome place to go, literally in the middle of the city! The day was hot but the zoo was a great time! It‚Äôs bigger than you might think. Plan for at least a half-day, as there‚Äôs plenty to see and do. Fist time I‚Äôve ever seen Cape Buffalo and a Cassowary! This zoo has animal shows daily as well as a decent aquarium! Go and enjoy. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. Did I mention they have Dole Whips? Oh yes....

I love visiting Denver Zoo! Their new covid setup is actually really nice and effective with minimal wait times. The exhibits are great and all the updates they have done and the ones still in progress look amazing. Lots of security presence as well makes for a safe environment for the whole family.
I loved seeing the animals. I loved the hard working employees. They even dressed up as characters.
Good mix of indoor and outdoor, with periodic shade. Even on a warm day, we found ways to stay cool.
Beautiful zoo, but a lot of exhibitions were not available, no monkeys this time

We love visiting the Denver Zoo and have been members for several years.   The tiger and elephant exhibit have both been renovated recently and they are constantly working toward updating other exhibits.

Even on a busy day the zoo doesn‚Äôt feel overcrowded which is one of the reason we would recommend this over some of the other family friendly attractions in Denver.

Also the kettle corn is fantastic.

A nice collection of animals mainly from Africa and Asia. Their bird collection is extra good. I went early on a Wednesday and it wasn't very crowded until 11 a.m. when it got pretty busy. I didn't have any kids with me and It took me about 3 hours to see everything. You can save $5 by buying your ticket online. For a major metropolitan zoo it is a little old and not as animal-friendly as I would have expected it to be. I think a city as large and diverse is Denver could do a better job with their zoo. However there seems to be a lot of construction going on so maybe that's what they're working on. (Please upvote if you find this review useful)
Great zoo. Went on one of the free days. (awesome they do this) Not the greatest in the winter, but still a fun place.
Some animals weren't out because of renovations but it was still a great time. Beautiful zoo and I loved all the flowers too. Love to see feeding times
Just went to the Denver Zoo lights. Absolutely beautiful, serene, peaceful. I loved it! Totally worth the trip. Denver Zoo is definitely one of the best I've ever been to!
Great experience! Loved all the exhibits... The kids and wife did too! üòÇ

Food is great and all souvenirs too. My two year old really enjoyed everything she got to see today. Every animal that she saw, her face just lit up with excitement. I'm very happy that we all got to experience this as a family.

Had fun while there.. entry is $$. A few animal exhibit were being cleaned so didnt see most interesting ones. with the time of day 1p-close animals were relaxing because of heat. Food prices were ok.. would eat before coming. I believe you can bring a water bottle. Map is a little confusing but got through all of it.
Love all the new exhibits.  Great place

They promote good care of animals, eating the right food to prevent extinction of sea life, they have demonstrations every 30 minutes. Hot, bring water and snacks. Everything is expensive. The lion feeding was the cutest thing
We had a great visit to Denver Zoo! It was very clean and beautiful from the habits to the flowers. If I lived in the area I would absolutely have a membership.
The layout is great, made it hard to realize it wasn't a very big zoo. Walked through it by myself in 2 1/2 hours & that included me reading most of the info plaques about the animals.
80 acres of amazing! You need 8 hours to see every thing!! Carousel and train available! Food toys .. we enjoyed it
Great zoo with tons to look at around every corner. There's even komodo dragons. The food was also very good there, I mean, when they have bulgogi fries, what more could you ask for?

The last few times we have been here, there seem to be several animals missing from their enclosures at the same time. Specifically we have not seen any big cats the last 3 times. Otherwise, this is a great experience. The elephant enclosure is very impressive and I'm excited to see the new penguin habitat when it is finished.

It was my first visit to the Denver Zoo. It was a nice afternoon seeing the animals with my family. If you are looking for a nice afternoon out with the kids, I would encourage you to check out the Denver Zoo.
It was OK. Didn't see much as the temperature fell so most of the animals weren't out. I'll probably revisit one Summer & do an update.
Every time we‚Äôve gone it has been a great experience. We‚Äôve seen a lot of active animals. The park is easy to navigate.
Super depressing unnatural environment for a tiger who seemed stressed high up in a cage

We didnt have time to get through the whole zoo, but the aquarium was great! Much bigger than we thought since the website only mentions stingrays, (which are a whole other thing, they arent in the regular aquarium part)
Didnt see any foxes or wolves with as far as we got, not sure if they dont have them or if we missed them. Disappointing cause theyre my boyfriends favorite. They did have some big cats though which I liked. The animal enclosures are pretty small compared to other zoos ive been to, and watching the elephants broke my heart a little.

I think if you have time, its a fun way to spend your day. But I wouldnt struggle to fit it into your schedule especially if youre travelling

Great Zoo with a lot of animals. It was pretty hot and sunny out so a lot of the animals were napping when we got there around noon but later they seemed more active so that was nice. My favorites were "the Edge" tiger habitat, there was one big beautiful tiger out on the walkway and I just love tigers, and the Tropical forest! Lots to see and do and plenty of stops for food and drinks, with free water fill up stations throughout!
Great place but not as good as it could be. You're not allowed to go into the buildings where you can see the graffs or elephants. The workers do a good job!
Very nice and clean zoo animals looked well taken care of.
The zoo has changed so much since I was there 4 years ago.  It was like rediscovering it was over again.
Was so impressed with the care and stimulation of the animals. The app is amazing because you can click on which animal you're viewing and learn their names and backstories.
Friendly staff, great dining options, easy parking, numerous indoor exhibits to warm up in.
I come here about every week. I love this place. Some of the animals recognize me and the cone up to the front to see me when I call out to them.
Absolutely wonderful again! No masks required at all. Make sure you reserve tickets online, membership or EBT program also reserve online. Loved it!
Very nice e and well laid out! Lots of food and snacks along the way.
The zoo is always awesome. There is always something new to see.

Beautiful and relaxing. We got to hang with a flamingo with a cute celebrity name. We sat and watched the elephants wrestling in the water for a good while. Going a little later in the day seems like the animals are more awake.
Plenty to see and space to spread out. Loved the apes in particular. There is also a great collection of vultures and condors. Can't wait to see the smaller big cats get a new home though.
Came here when I was traveling to Denver & was pleased to do so. Nice vibes & amazing scenery definitely a go back while in town!
Denver Zoo was a great time! The kids loved it, I highly recommend visiting it while in Denver.
Very nice, clean and friendly staff. The animals were neat to see!
I love this zoo! Clean, friendly, staff is very knowledgeable.

Big huge zoo, the family loved it. The only bad experience I had was the super expensive soda machine that I used my credit card on that charged my card but didn't work so I then bought a soda from the vender near by, basically cost me $15 for one 20oz soda...lol.
Awsome zoo, possibly to big to see in one day however the exhibits are well spaced well configured for  viewing and helpful staff absouly everywhere.
Make in memories love the zoo fantastic visiting from Florida high recommend a good visit along visit a long visit good day trip Day Trip yeah recommend for everybody
My husband and I are members, and we can't get enough! We go at least once a month to check up on our favorite animals. We learn something new with each visit!
A lot of enriched exhibits full of information and a big variety of animals.
Awesome place to take your family partner or lover. Had a wonderful time definitely will be back!
We loved the docents and all the helpful people who explained animal behavior. The enclosures and ground were clean and maintained. It was a good destination

It was the first time I had been there since the 90s,and it was nice. I was there as part of an after hours party, and there weren't any screaming kids. The lions, tigers, and bears (oh my!) were awesome, and they had very nice and respectful enclosures.
Great place, zoo is big and animals look healthy. They have huge enclosure for animals and rotate them.

Honestly, the parking is a nightmare, half of the exhibits are closed for 1 reason or another, and there's construction all around. 3 stars for the staff and the very few animals we saw, plus the price wasn't terrible. I've seen more expensive zoos.

Fun little city zoo. Lots of animals to see and it was pretty much layed out so if you followed the path you would see all of the animals without having to take detours (bravo architect). Lots of water refilling stations and the concession stands even sold alcohol.

The zoo continues to be a beloved place in the city to visit, smile, run, play and learn! Our family has loved support the zoo with an annual membership for the past few years.
We learn and see something new every time we visit!

Beautiful in May with flowers and nature overflowing.  The paths are a bit confusing so get a map.  I was able to walk the zoo in a couple hours.   The exhibits are impressive and the animals look happy.  There were many staff members available to handle questions about the animals.
Love this place! Easily accessible for averyone, nice walkways,and everything is taken care of well. EBT gets you tickets for $1. Its amazing.
Disappointed. I have seen better.  Recommend The Milwaukee Zoo Not sure of the cost. Someone else paid.
My first trip to a zoo! I had a great time, I need to go back when it's not so hot outside.
Always love the Denver Zoo. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Miss the polar bears, but love the elephants and giraffes.
Nice place, not a lot of shade though the animals were pretty typical for your normal zoo had a fun time.

Visited on a Tuesday, AD (After Distancing) and had a great time. Staggered 15 min entry, so get those tickets early! Two weeks out, all morning time slots were already sold. Indoor exhibits were closed, but we are grateful they are working hard to make it work. Staff is friendly and helpful.

It just gets better and BETTER!
can't wait to get back there
A FANTASTIC time
ALWAYS !
They have done a excellent job in making the zoo comfortable to visit during  the covid 19 pandemic.  Thank you Denver Zoo team  and volunteers
We went again recently for Zoo lights. It was very well put together. The displays were beautiful, as usual.
Fun time to go during the animals' lunch. They really need to clean the windows to view the sea lions though. Tons of algae? on the glass. Also, most bathrooms are a mess.
Though it was winter and not great animal viewing, I could tell the exhibits were pretty nice and appreciated they were moving toward improvement. The elephant exhibit was especially impressive.

Nice exhibits of a variety of animals. It‚Äôs some what sad to see them caged but some are injured and wound not survive in the wild on there own. Some are endangered and safer in their artificial world. Overall great place for kids and adults to learn.

Relaxing!!! The zoo has done a fabulous job creating a safe and effective environment for visiting the zoo during the Covid19 situation.   The kiddos had a great time and were great troopers wearing their masks in the hot weather.

It's been great to watch the Denver Zoo grow and evolve over the years. They really have transformed themselves into a world-class zoo. We get a family pass every year and it is absolutely worth the expense. We look forward to continuing to watch it expand further.
It's nice to spend some time with your family, and what better than the zoo!ü¶íüêòüêÜü¶ìü¶çüêÖü¶åüêäü¶≠ü¶úü¶•ü¶©ü¶¢üëåüèº
Love this zoo so much we got a family pass. We have gone several times & our pass has paid for itself. Worth every penny.
Place is great for all ages.

The animals that were out, were amazing. Clean place, lots of neat sights to see at a fair price. A lot of animals are either under construction because the zoo is renovating or not out because of the cold. Which are both understandable but the price seems a bit high when half of the zoo is unavailable, but I understand needing funding so I‚Äôll 4 star it.

I am only giving 2 stars because there was so much construction it was a mess, the food was disgusting,  The chicken tender and fries that I had gotten tasted disclose the chicken tenders tasted like fishy it was horrible and it was the worst experience I've had in such a long time.
Huge place, kids loved animals at the zoo. Couldn't ride train due to weather.
Great place for all ages. They had a lot of new construction going on. Lots of interactions for all ages.
All the animals were out and posing for pictures!  Perfect time to visit the Zoo; not crowded at all.  Kids enjoyed the animal show.
My daughter had a blast, she enjoyed the animals for being her first time see animals in person. We will be going back to see the new exhibits.

First time here. Beautiful Zoo and an all day thing to do.
There's so much to see. We loved it!
Really nice zoo, the animals are well taken care of and it‚Äôs a nice full day.  There are quite a few enclosures that are under construction at the moment but the final product will be really nice
Zoo was a lot of fun. So cool to see the animals in more natural habitats. Our little one loved the elephants
Very nice zoo was pretty large
This is a great zoo! They have some rotating exhibits so it might be worth it to check beforehand if you're planning a visit. I'm a little sad we missed the Lions, but everything else was wonderful!
We always have a great time at the zoo.  It is large enough it doesn't get too crowded - although I would recommend going in the morning when it's cooler and the animals are more active.
Great collection of animals, exhibitions are very close to each other.
Perfect day for the zoo. Zoo is well laid out and does not disappoint. Animals were out and about. Great day all around
Itbwas a very beautiful day to enjoy the denver zoo. Although all the animals were not active it was a very hapy enjoyable day with the family. We will definitely be visiting again later in the year.

We are amazed by the way are zoo  in Denver...
Very nice and clean facility, the employees is very kind and helpful.
Great experience with our last visit.
the kids love it.
Awesome exhibits! Friendly staff and so much to see and do. We have been here twice in the short time we have lived in Denver and just bought a membership. This is a must see.

It was an excellent zoo!! All the the big animals you go to a zoo for. Only thing is it was super hot the day we went and I wish there was more drinking fountain or mist fans to help. We could of stayed longer but it was just too hot. But most animals were active
Family time was amazing.  The kids had a fabulous time. As my greatgrand of 3 says, GiGi this is amazing made it all worthwhile.

Wow!! This zoo is super cool! Our family bought the year pass, so we can go as often as we like! One of my favorite things about this place is they let the peacocks wander around. Last time we went must have been mating season, because two peacocks were cawing and flashing their feathers at each other. It was awesome! Also there was a funny fish that looks like it has buck teeth. There‚Äôs tons of variety of animals here, and they all look like they have great habitats. You should definitely go here if you‚Äôre looking for a fun, new thing to do!
What a great zoo! We had so much fun and there were so many different kinds of animals.
My husband and youngest son had their first visit to a zoo it was awesome just wish they had more open to view ‚ù§Ô∏è
Timed tickets are the best! I would gladly pay extra to keep the crowds down once covid19 dies down. Makes the experience much more pleasant.
Used EBT discount paid $3 for me my husband and son

Great Zoo! The layout helps disperse the crowd so that you're rarely feeling overwhelmed. Animal enclosures seem large and well maintained. It will be exciting to see the new veterinarian centre once it is completed!! Definitely recommend!!

Pro: Online discount for tickets is great since you also can skip the line. It's a full $5 per adult!

Con: Parking is now extremely limited with the ongoing construction. There is parking down the hill in the city park but can add a mile or so onto your walking (you can't cut through the city green houses or tennis courts, back to the main road is your only bet)
I haven't been here in years. The zoo seemed so much bigger with awesome attractions. The staff were all friendly and offered an insight as to what the Denver zoo's mission is. Love this place.

Meh, this place is decent. It really depends what level of zoo you‚Äôre accustomed to, or what your other options are. If you come in the winter, there are not as many animals out. But if you don‚Äôt have much else to do, hit this place up.

I have the impression the cage are small and old. This zoo would need a biiiiiig refresh !
Edit : denver have been doing a lot of remodeling lately and this place is getting better every time we go ! KEEP going !!!

Enjoyed our school field trip today! Lots of blooming flowers this time of the year. Kiddos for  landscaping! The field of daffodils near the giraffe / tiger exhibits is stunning! It was just an open space where peacocks used to hang out.. Some animals are "temporarily relocated" (bears). Highlight of the day was to watch a young hippo playing with ball in the pool. Zoo got crowded fast. Wonder if they have stats on how much attendance grew since 2005. I don't remember seeing such crowds back then. Heard people complaining how long it now takes to stay in line to buy ticket. Couple things the zoo administration should improve: 1) parking situation, 2) train/carousel ticket booth. Please keep parking free and think of ways to expand it. Line for train/carousel token booth gets too long, please find ways of selling them online or install another booth next to these attractions. Overall, these days it's best to take a day off during the week for a visit.
Extremely nice zoo.  The tropical exploration area has lots of tropical wildlife, and can be enjoyed in all kinds of weather.  The Elephant enclosure really takes the cake though.

Such an amazing zoo! So many unique animals to see with very naturalistic exhibits. The elephant talk was very educational and fun to see! A lot of the animals were very active and moving, even though it was a hot day. The zoo staff was very professional, knowledgeable, and provided lots of educational facts. This is a must see if your in the area.
Zoo lights is a must see.

So the zoo in the summer time is great! (The only thing was they separated the gorilla from the baby and his mother, and he was quite mad. I‚Äôm sure there was a reason, but that was sad to see him so upset) Most of the animals are out, but in the winter, zoo lights is a personal favorite. They go above and beyond for the zoo lights. It‚Äôs always absolutely beautiful and the kids (10, 3 and a 1 year old) enjoyed the lights. Just make sure you pack extra blankets!!
Rather small zoo, and the indoor exhibits kind of suck, but my kids loved the merry go round and the elephant show was really cool. Food is expensive, as expected. Can get a good view of the animals.
Loved the 4D show. The whole thing was so real. Birds exhibit was my favorite animal.
Very nice zoo. You can tell that a lot of time, money, and effort went into each of the exhibits. $20 well spent.
Visiting Denver for the first time and thought we would check out the zoo since it was a nice day out. We thoroughly enjoyed and would definitely recommend.
The zoo is clean with plenty to do for the whole family. Food is ok to bring and they have water bottle filling stations in different locations.

The Denver Zoo does a great job! I really missed it! They did awesome with the COVID precautions. One way arrows, hand sanitizer stations and masks required. It felt very safe and we had so much fun! You can tell they really care about the animals too.
We actually went on a hot day so lots of animals in den and trying to stay cool but who would blame them. Great place to get family out and enjoy the animals
What a great family friendly place. A happy-go-lucky feel.  A place where memories are created one generation to the next. Our favorite on this trip were the awesome flamingo birds.

Boo at the zoo at night  is so much more spectacular than boo at the zoo during the day.  I know you pay for it at all but it is way more fun for the kids and exhilarating with all the pumpkin's an other carvings and spectacular stuff that the staff at the Denver zoo do.

A really great zoo. A wide variety of animals, many that are rarely seen at other zoos. The elephant exhibit is very impressive, and other exhibits include both indoor and outdoor viewing and rotating habitats to meet animals' needs. This zoo also had several very knowledgeable volunteers who made the experience more interesting with stories about the animals. A highlight for our family was a keeper who spent more than 20 minutes visiting with our children. We'll be back!

The Denver Zoo is the epitome of a family fun filled morning and early afternoon. Every exhibit had something unique and plenty of entertainment. My advice to the out of towners like me? Buy your tickets online so you can avoid waiting an hour to buy some in person at the ticket booth. If you buy them online, you can go straight to the entrance and get your phone scanned. And try to arrive early, we got a free top level parking lot right next to the zoo at no additional costs. The shrubbery and greenery with city park guiding the entrance is lovely eye candy as well.

I've been coming to this Zoo since I was a child.  I'm very excited to share this place with our daughter now!   Our last trip was excellent and not as busy as I anticipated.  The most disappointing thing was that the lions were not out when we were there.   We look forward to getting the full use out of our family pass this year.
I‚Äôve never been to a better zoo! You get to be so close up to the animals, and the staff members are amazing and super nice.

Denver Zoo Lights never fails to surprise.  On a cold windy night, we were perfectly happy walking around the zoo seeing all of the beautiful light displays.  I love to go here every year and look forward to seeing what they have in store for us!
i loved it there! it's a typical zoo, you can't go wrong here! üêØ

Really great zoo, we have been to the San Diego many times and loved this one much more.
It wasn't crouded and lots of animal presentations and knowledgeable staff/volenteers.
Such a wonderful zoo. Beautiful scenery and lots of amazing animals.  Be sure to check out orangutan, gorilla and giraffe babies.
This place was so cool! We spent about 4 hours here and enjoyed seeing all the animals especially the lions. The zoo is well laid out and its well worth the trip if you are in Denver.
Loved it was happy to see all the animals out ...they were amazing me and the fam bam loved it
We went on a free day. Finding somewhere to park was a nightmare but it was good once we got in the zoo. It was a little crowded but a good time!

We have been members at the Denver Zoo for several years now and we will continue to be, they do an excellent job of putting the babies out on display and walking people through the different options that all the animals need when it comes to health and eating. Overall we love going there and seeing all the new exhibits and all the animals and if you're looking for a great Zoo to visit while you're in the area or if you live here this zoo is awesome!
Went on free day. Knowledgeable and friendly staff. A lot of the animals were inside because of the snow, so they had viewing areas really close to the pens. Clean and well kept park.
One of the best zoo's I have visited! The bird exhibits and the elephant Pathway were wonderful!

The zoo is gorgeous! There's so much to see and making sure to view it all will likely take you from the beginning to the end of the day. The zoo staff were all friendly and loved to talk about the animals they were caring for and everyone had a lesson to teach. I wish I could stay here longer and just soak in the atmosphere, but at the very least I'll be coming back!

We have had a membership since our first son was one. He is almost 6 now and our second son is 4. We love it here. We love the animals and all of the improvements. The staff is great. So much to see and learn. But we tend to pack lunches now. We just never really feel too great after eating there.
I love the Denver zoo! Nice place to walk around and the staff was sweet.   Love the little marmosets and tamarins. Plenty of walking to all the exhibits and sights to see. ‚ô°

One of the best places to take your kids, bar none! This zoo is very easy to navigate through. The animals appear well taken care of and the staff is beyond friendly. Best go in Fall or Spring to avoid the heat; the best time if you're looking at spending the day there. All in all, a fun landmark of Denver, CO!
Very large zoo with active animals. Awesome for all ages, especially with the holiday attractions and events Denver Zoo offers.
I always get my exercise going to the zoo! It's just so much fun to watch the kids enjoy seeing all of the animals and it tuckera them out too.
Very nice zoo, with a variety of animals. Plenty of additional things to do, such as sting ray exhibit, train, and carousel for little ones.
Always a fun place to take family and friends. They just opened more up can't wait for all the shows to start back up!
Very happy with my visit today! This zoo is well maintained. The animals seem to be quite happy. It was a great day out!

The zoo was great,   it good to see proper Covid protocols  being followed,   not to crowded today (Wednesday 10AM)   fantastic to have a few more exhibits open to enjoy.. friendly staff and delicious lunch!

We came from a smaller city and this zoo seemed huge to us. We only got through about one third. The afternoons are so hot and the animals are less active so I'd definitely agree that it's best to get out there as early as possible.

I like that many of the exhibits have an indoor and an outdoor component, so if the animals are inside or sleeping, you can still see them.

I also like reading the back stories of the animals whom many were hurt or rescued from captivity. Otherwise it's a little sad to see large cats or big animals in small enclosures.

I really appreciated also how many zoo staff were around with educational materials and answers to questions. Far more than I've seen at any other zoo.

I didn't buy any food or drinks so can't comment on those.

Denver Zoo was large with lots of exhibits.  The animals all looked pretty healthy and wall cared-for, though it was a hot day and you could tell they were feeling it.  There was a baby sloth!!  Also, two frogs recreating their favorite scene from Lady and the Tramp with an earthworm.
Great as always. They added dinosaur exibit. Parking is free. You can feed the giraffes, birds. Interactive and fun. They have wagon rentals

Zoo lights were so much fun. Great for a date night or a family adventure. The monkey exhibit was my favorite! Ample bars with hot chocolate and other winter libations. Plenty of bathrooms but if you can't locate them just ask their very helpful staff.

Awesome place to spend an afternoon. Educational and fun. We‚Äôve kept a membership since the kids were infants, they are all teens now and the opportunities for hands on educational experiences are just in readable. I recommend going once a season as they are constantly changing things up.

I had fun. Lost track of time there and totally get why the reviews are so high. Cool things: rhinos and the giraffes. Like I was only a few feet away from the large giraffes and it was so surreal. Bring walking shoes. Great activity on a warm, sunny day üíì
Even in Winter this zoo is worth visiting. The tigers, giraffes, hippos, seals, and elephants were all able to be spotted.

As a Denver native this has always been one of my favorite places to go to with my family and now that I have my own I have the joy of experiencing it a new way! The Tropical Discovery center is one of my favorite exhibits and the staff is always friendly/helpful. Hoping to continue visiting this Zoo for many more years to come!

No maps available, few are posted, and the one on the app is weak. So we felt lost the whole time. Beautiful facility, but animal population seemed pretty low. But it was a hot afternoon so they may have been hiding.

Combined with the rest of the attractions in the Mile High City Culture Pass, the zoo was a great value attraction. I haven't been to a zoo that had as many attractions as the Denver Zoo. Super clean, staff was friendly, and the animals seemed happy. The main cafe had a good salad and hummus plate as well!
Such a convenient and clean zoo.
Nicest Zoo I have been too. Animals once and up close. Went at opening and they were very active.

Always love the experiences at the Denver Zoo. Is never the same from one visit to the next. Baby orangutan and baby gorilla are so cute. Also, the Sea Eagle has a baby in the nest. Also watched the elephant training. We love the zoo!!
Amazing!!!! Beautiful place and such AWESOME animals!!!!! But they need to make their signs more clear. But overall extraordinary!!
We have been members at the zoo for 7 years! The kids love coming all year round. We like to meet up with friends and take family from out of town here too.
A very good zoo. We visit one on each of our vacations and this one was one of the better ones. We spent about 4 hours here.
This was the perfect spot for prom this year.  We all had a wonderful time and seeing the animals was great!
A great day at the zoo. Most people were following the suggested circulation path, and masking up inside spaces.

Very nice zoo. It takes about 4 hours to visit every captivating animals. Awsome tropical animals, bird building and aquatic buildings. It's like walking into tropical forest in the middle of the March.
Lots of fun! Kids loved it. Only cons- TONS of walking and a little confusing even with the map! My favorite is the golden monkey and the hippo!
Love being able attend different events. My favorite time of year is definitely boo at the zoo. Love seeing all the babies.

I typically go with someone who has a zoo pass. It's overall a fun experience with a good layout and good variety of animals, though I wouldn't rate it as a must-do for someone briefly visiting Denver.
I've always loved this zoo and they keep getting better. Even through covid struggles, all the employees are great and the animals happy. The flow is great and the exhibits are amazing!

A really amazing zoo.  It was so large we didnt even make it through the whole place before they closed.  Make sure to get their early if you want to see all the animals.  Very well maintained facilities for the animals and the guests.  The elephant area is massive and truly a great place to view elephants.  The zoo has tons of primates that all interact in areas where visits can view them.  Top notch place!

HUGE. We underestimated how big this zoo was and didn't give ourselves enough time but wow. So many animals and the Giraffe cracked us up. He wanted the leaves SO BAD and couldn't get it. He gave up after 30 minutes. We got a selfie though!
Love the Zoo! Family friendly and lots of activities for everyone. Including a new 4D Theater, as well as the train and carousel-

Awesome day with my wife!!  Saw the babies and they were so cute. The tiger roaring was cool. The tiger went up to the balcony was looking over us was awesome. Great job guys can't wait to come back in a couple months!!!!!
Great spot but due to covid a lot of the exhibits were closed. But I spent over 2 hours there and was still unable to see everything. Great place for families.
Love the zoo! The elephant exhibit is the best! Lots of moneys and big cats. You can also feed the tropical birds.

The Denver zoo is great.  There are so many fantastic exhibits you can spend a whole day there and never get bored.  The elephants enclosure is so vast and wonderful. You can watch them come into an area where they get check-ups for everyone to see and learn.  It's really nice that it is so close to the large parks and the museum as well.  The food in the are is wonderful as well.

So sad to see these animals habitats reduced to barely livable sizes. Every animal with a remarkably high running speed doesn't even have the room to do so. Saddest was the bald eagle, THE symbol for freedom, trapped in an enclosure so small it can't even fly.

Great zoo with many options for young and old. We had friends in town from Dallas and they commented on how great the zoo was compared to theirs.  Love having a membership so we can go for a couple hours and not worry about seeing everything in one trip. Don't miss the baby gorilla!
Awesome place, organized, clean, many information booths and great variety of animals. Good place to spend a day

The Denver Zoo is wonderful! You can spend an entire day there or just an hour. They have wonderful special events for holidays. A particular favorite of ours is Zoo lights in November and December. It is magical. They have programs going on all day throughout the zoo. They are constantly improving. We are sad they closed Bird World, but I know they will replace it with something extraordinary. My 3 year old loves the carousel and the train, of course. My 6 year old is obsessed with the snakes and spiders in Tropical Discovery. I'm partial the the elephant show. There are small play areas strewn about, like sandboxes, fake tree stumps, and statues intended to climb on and in. There are concessions everywhere. We never leave without Dip'n Dots or popcorn. And the gift shop is great!
The peacocks running around loose are awesome! They just walk around the park. Beautiful creatures.
Amazing. Lots of places to visit and a sit down and eat place with benches midway. One can take in their own lunch and have a picnic. Took about 3 hours to see everything.

The zoo is a fun place to come. It was pretty busy. I'd advise showing up when they open and prepay for tickets online. 1. You avoid the lines and find decent parking. (Which there are quite a few parking spots, even a parking garage with 4 levels.) 2. You can check out most of the shows and educational programs they have running throughout the day. Food and drinks are fairly pricey but that goes with any attractions. Pictures are of people feeding Llamas! One of the many shows they have running.

Zoo, I hadn‚Äôt been to you since, you know, 12, so when you have a 2 year old, what better place to go, right? And Zoo, you‚Äôve changed! I don‚Äôt remember the Beer Carts, the sushi, the kids on a leash (no joke!), the Zoo Lights in the winter, the massive Lego sets, the surprisingly complete list of animal exhibits - there‚Äôs seriously just about everything you could ever want to see! I‚Äôd never been to the Zoo in the winter time, and I always wondered what happened to all of the Animals. Welp.. they‚Äôre still there and there‚Äôs still a ton to see! My son LOVES the Carousel. Yep, that hasn‚Äôt changed. But now that I can stroll the park with a beer in hand...it‚Äôs well worth a few repeat visits. Cheers!
Awesome zoo to visit while on vacation. I definitely recommend the elephant show and spending most of your day here. Loved it!

One of the best zoos I've ever been to. Initially I was bummed I didn't see certain animals but it was because animals aren't forced to be an attraction. I can respect that. It was super clean, staff was friendly, lots of exhibits. The Discovery house was amazing. We were very impressed.
Kind staff, knowledgeable in the aspect of discussing the animals, good park layout, beautiful animals to see. It's really nice going in the cold because of the lack of a crowd.
Beautiful large and clean zoo. Love all the info that's around and the helpful staff.
Went to Zoo lights and it was awesome.. Hot cocoa and funnel cakes were fantastic as well. Also even on a cold night the beer was great.

Another great trip to the zoo.  Was a little crowded this time being sporting break,  but we all had a great time.  We suicidal distanced to the best of our abilities and for the most part others did a well.  Plenty to set and do and we never get tired of going.
This zoo is amazing.  Very big, and so much to see and do. There are lots of live shows many times a day. Plenty of places to eat and lots of souvenirs shops throughout this zoo!
The animals didn't want to come out lol it was too hot
Huge and so much fun. Love this zoo, the animal inclosen are a great size compared to the zoo in Brownsville.
Always a great time and a wide selection of creatures! Their new elephant exhibit is awesome!
Loved seeing the animals but I was really surprised by how people were acting now that masks aren't required. There seemed to be no regard for social distancing whatsoever.
Denver zoo is awesome. They have upgraded and built new exhibits. Animals look happy and is just a fun and  Exciting place to visit.
All the animals here looked happy and the staff here seemed to be very in loved with the animals, they even named them. I'm very happy with this zoo. Totally recommended to go.
A few exhibitions were out temporarily but overall my grandson enjoyed the visit today.
It's an ok zoo, one good walk around is all you need. Took about and hour & half walk through entire place.
Lots of animals to see, they also have birds, fish, and reptiles! Fun for the whole family. Little bit on the pricey side at 20$ a person though..
Fall is definitely a better time to visit the zoo.
Elephant show was great!! Chuck was being a showoff!

This is a wonderfully peaceful place to come and enjoy many of the animals nature has to offer in a safe and clean environment. There is many educational shows where the handlers educate you about the animals in the exhibits and also answer questions.

Denver Zoo isnt only a great place to have fun and be with your loved ones but it is a place that truly puts animals first and focuses on Conservation reaching out into the real world. Love to see all the changes they have made and excited to see what the future holds!
While a small area, this zoo has one of the best animal collections of any zoo I've ever visited. Also free parking!  Woot!
This zoo is beautiful very big so its an all day thing so get there early and parking is a little hard but the zoo is nice clean and fun exhibits cant wait to visit again

I LOVE OUR ZOO!!!  Today we had breakfast with the bachelors and we love the elephants!!!!  We go every chance we get!!

2019 Free Days Thursday, January 10 Friday, January 18 Saturday, January 19 Sunday, February 3 Monday, February 4 Monday, November 4 Friday, November 8.
I love the Denver Zoo. It is especially fun to go after dark for their special events. The animals seem to be more active than during the day.

As Zoos go this is one of the better ones, some can be horribly depressing if not downright inhumane.  Pretty decent array of wildlife. Komodo Dragons are cool, can't seem to find all of the animals they list though. Seems there is always construction going on here, became members during the summer. Biggest drawback is rude tourist families, seriously the real animals are the ones visiting the zoo, and no tranquilizer seems to do the trick. Uneducated parents telling the kids the wrong names to animals. Hyena is not a Wolf/Tiger. Gorillas are not monkeys. üôÑ
This zoo is surprisingly large. Super fun, and the animals seemed happy and well cared for.
We went for Zoo Lights and we had a great time. We bought a membership so we can take our grandchildren all summer. Highly recommend this for a day outing.
We were able to see a good amount of animals even though it was December. My kids were disappointed that the polar bear exhibit was closed.
Great Zoo. All of the animals were out and very entertaining.
This is a great experience for adults and children! I loved the aquariums and the gift shop where you can buy stuff, like small animals for kids!
The zoo is a great place to take the kidos.  Very few hills so it's easy for little ones to walk.  The new primate area is really amazing. And the new elephant area is so huge.

My visit was both very sad and very beautiful.  An hour before my visit I received a call about the death of my father.  I was meeting my niece for a fun zoo day. She is my parents one and only grandchild and it feel to me to inform her of this tragic news. She feel apart, but thanks to her boyfriend and the zoos staff we consoled each other by visiting the zoo.  From the ticket sales person, security, and other members of the Denver Zoos staff we were able to celebrate a father and. grandfather's life in a most loving and caring way!!! THANK YOU DENVER ZOO!!!

Though I'm sad that the Denver Zoo no longer has polar bears, which were a huge draw, it still offers a wonderful variety of wildlife experiences, and I appreciate that they are focused on animal welfare and conservation! They seem to be constantly trying to improve the facilities for both the animals and visitors alike. It's a great place to spend a day with the littles!!
üêªü¶ÅüêØüêµü¶°ü¶äüêóü¶ìüê¢ü¶éüêèüêòü¶èü¶òü¶íüê¶üê†

Way over priced for a small zoo! Half the animals were gone! No money's! Pay $50 for my kids to not see their fav animals. They provide strollers or little car buggies for kids though ! They were about $7 -9.
Has always been one of my favorite places to go. They love their animals and try to provide them the best life they could.

It was good would've been great but it poured rain lol

UPDATE
I feel like you need to be more clear that you need to rent a wheelchair online and have a reservation when you go to this ticket check out it should say something specific to the disabled people I ended up wasting a good amount of time and coming from all over an hour away just to have to return to get my self-propelled wheelchair
This really was a nice visit,  friendly employees,  so area's and services were not open, because of Civil, but overall, it was a very enjoyable visit!

We went on a free day and it was not as crowded as you would expect. They‚Äôve done an amazing job updating the park over the years. Right away in the morning the animals are pretty active. The new tiger exhibit and elephant exhibit are definitely highlights. The sea lions were also pretty active. The rhino looks like it‚Äôs from a movie. And as always the giraffes! The only downfall is the geese are like scary confident. I‚Äôm scared they‚Äôre gonna attack my 18 month old.

Great day for the zoo! The animals were active and most could be seen in each exhibit! Friendly and helpful staff and volunteers. The zookeepers giving the educational sessions were so energetic and willing to share their knowledge.

Nice selection of animals, and you can walk around with a beer or some canned wine (actually not too bad). Personally, I'd rather go to the Cheyenne Mountain Zoo, but The Denver zoo is a fine establishment, and fun was had by all.
We had a great experience at the denver zoo! There is plenty of options for food and the walk isnt too strenious. We will for sure visit again!
Visited during covid so quite a bit of stuff is closed. Overall a good experience. Need to come back when it's not so hot kids started to get over heated
We love this zoo! Our toddler never gets tired of going which is often as we have had a membership since he was a baby. Speaking of babies, come see the newborn mandrill Kesi üêí ‚ô•Ô∏è
Was great except they took out the indoor bird place which is one of the main reasons I went there. I hope they bring it back soon

Just had a great time here, there's so many animals and it's such a big zoo but it's so easy to navigate. And I got to take some great photos, you definitely need to come with some time to see everything but it's worth it.
Had a great time the lights were beautiful

Zoo lights are amazing! Totally worth the cost and the experience is priceless. Suggest getting the glasses and hot chocolate to complete the experience. I would get there early for parking since there is some back up from people leaving and coming.

Friendly helpful staff. A smallish to medium sized zoo with a limited amount of space. It has a good variety of animals and is trying to incrementally become more humane from a framework that dates from setup at the turn of the century.

It was a Free Day when I visited. The docents were sharing interesting facts with visitors throughout the exhibits. We spent the most time in Tropical Discovery and watching the otters in Toyota Elephant Passage.
Not often I think a zoo is almost too big.
Great zoo! Perfect for a date or with a family. Good exibits. Healthy animals. Very fun.

On dino night it was a great view the only thing that was sad was that my children and myself and my husband had to deal with the racial comments tonight and every time I have came to the Zoo I have never dealt with nothing like this and I have been in Denver Colorado all of my life and this is the first time I had to deal with the racial comments but the people who worked at the Zoo were all Respectful and The zoo was very clean and hopefully when I go back there my children do not have to witness that again but other than that it was a Great place to visit
Do NOT miss out on the Denver Zoo if you are in Colorado. Amazing to see animals out in the open walking around outside of crates!
Great variety of animals. It was cold and end of day so they weren't super active but I still had a blast.
Zoo lights are my absolute favorite holiday tradition. They never disappoint. They're phenomenal!
Great place to bring your family or significant other for a fun day they have all sorts of animals from penguins to elephants it's a lot of fun cant wait to come back during the summer!
Had a chance to see various animals but by the time I'm almost finished seeing zoo and it wasn't closing time they had closed the 'Giraffe' section.
It was actually a lot bigger than I had anticipated! Some of the exhibits seemed too tiny for the animals inside, so that was a bit concerning, but other than that it was a pleasant experience.

Just moved to Denver & had a great time at the Zoo! I love that parking is free and definitely recommend the membership. You will get your money's worth after a few visits! It was a gorgeous zoo to walk around, can't wait to go back!

Great zoo. Attended the Boo at the zoo and was amazed at the level of attention to detail that was taken to decorate for the event. They also had truck or treat stations all over the zoo. I also appreciate hope the try to educate visitors on animal conservation.
This was one of our favorite places to take our family. Now there are fewer animals there. We did not see the gorillas or polar bear.
This Zoo was great.  So fun and lots to do.   Parking was a little rough. So you might want to show up early.   But other than that. It was great

I love the Denver zoo.  As a member we go frequently, but never run out of stuff to do.  This visit we got to see the tiger talk.  I recommend checking the schedule on the app or site to see what talks are going on.  I also recommend the elephant talk at 11:30.  Perfect time to sit down and eat lunch.
Very clean and very friendly. This zoo is huge, to see it all go from open to close. Best bird sanctuary I have seen. The only down side is the cost of food, $13 for a grilled cheese. Why???

Granddaughters 1st yime to the zoo...
Had a great time! New exhibits are available and some are coming soon

It's beautiful, everything is very well kept the animals love the attention most of the time and if you don't mind smells this place is amazing. This fall the trees were changing and it was beautiful to be around.
The Zoo Lights were phenomenal this year and well-organized! Loved the Whirley Cup souvenir cups this year!

Lots of fun during Zoo Lights.   The timed entry helps to reduce crowds, making it easy to socially distance.  There were random heaters and firepits set up around the zoo which were nice for a quick warmup.   Being dark out we didn't see many animals though we did see a few elephants and wild horses.   The lights were great and well done with the styles changing as you went around the zoo which kept things from getting stale.
I go to the zoo way more than any adult has a right to. I love just wandering the loops and the sting rays are so much fun!!
This zoo was a bit disappointing for the price. Some exhibits were very well done while others were way to small and uninteresting. The free roaming peacock was the best part.
Went to zoo lights. The 4D theater option is worth the experience. Enjoyed the carousel and the train. The display this year was by far the best yet.

There's a lot of construction going on right on now. The weather isnt the best *not the zoo's fault* but it wasn't crowded and the people that work there were nice. Lastly, we got to hear the lions roar and the new elephant trumpet
Very pretty, we love this place, lots of entertainment. I spwnd around 4 hours üíóüíñ
Love this zoo! They have a great system in place to help keep people socially distanced and they have well marked walkways as well! Loved seeing the animals and all the baby animals!
Very fun expensive food and drinks though wish they had cheaper options for kids
Loved the orangutans!  So funny playing in the trees.  My kiddo says "look grandma they walk like humans."  Thank you Denver Zoo

Loved the Denver Zoo, my family and I have been to many zoos and this is one of the better ones. The exhibits get you really close to some amazing well taken care of animals. I liked also that the zoo keepers we're working with the animals during business hours, that kind of interaction with the animals I've rarely seen before. My wife is also a Disney fan and she was stoked that she was able to get her dole whips here.
A few neat animals, but only took 2 hours to see everything the zoo had to offer.
Excellent place to bring the hole family. Great variety of animals and  shows. Friendly staff.

The zoo literally always has something going on that is fun for families. I've seen all the shows and all are worth it. All staff does an amazing job. If you live remotely near here, you should probably be a member because being one helps animals here and far away. They are a cutting-edge zoo with many conservation projects and green initiatives. Support them!
Have been a member for many years and can see that they are co instantly improving the animal habitats and visitor experience.

Absolutely loved this zoo! It's got a ton of animals of all shapes and sizes. It's a photographers dream! They dont have those enclosures with 5 fences so you can never get a good shot lol. They have the best areas for viewing and taking photos. It was 36 degrees when I went so most of the animals weren't out, sadly,  but I was still able to have an amazing time. Great for all ages! Would definitely recommend!
My fiance and I took the kids to Zoo lights and everyone had a blast. Hot chocolate, lights, and carousel ridesade for some very happy little girls.

This was my 5th year in a row visiting and we are always very happy with our visit! The animals always look very healthy and well taken care of! Denver is always updating the zoo as well, which is great! We love coming!!
Just such an excellent light show. A worthwhile way to spend an evening! Smuggled-in chocolate Ovaltine with peppermint schnapps makes it a complete experience.
Great zoo!! Lots to do. They have gluten free pizza options!! Gift shop is a bit expensive tho
Zoo lights! Spectacular display!! üòç And you're never too old to ride the carousel!! üé†
This place is awesome. It's really well laid out and is a nice easy walk to hit all the animals.
I've never been in the day time but I go to zoo lights every year. This year was even more beautiful than I remembered. The only issue was people pushing into us during this pandemic.
Animals were active and staff that we encountered was friendly. Even told us where to find discounted tickets online while standing in line.
Had a great visit with my 4 year old grandson who really lovesüòç elephants and tigers.  Go early to beat crowds.
Had an absolute great time! The Zoo was clean, the animals were great.. people were nice
Had some unique animals but many enclosures were empty which was a little disappointing.
A great place for people of all ages but it is particularly fun for kids. There are several updated enclosures, an animal hospital, sting ray cove and an tropical discovery.
I've been going to the Denver zoo sense I was a kid and it just get's better and better. Only downside is Colorado is growing and at times its hard to get in.

Super fun experience! The staff was fantastic about answering questions, the interactions with the animals were fun, and the exhibits were placed well and for the large animals you could walk around the entire exhibit and see the animals from different angles. They had animals that were open in the park like peacocks and geese.
For animal lovers you will love the zoo !! Perfect to spend with family and kids, the elephant show is soooo cool

Such a great habitat for both the elephants and the gorillas! 10 acres that they can move the Asian rhinos and elephants around on. And a nice elephant presentation by the trainers. Lovely grounds, wandering docents that provide bits of info on various animals AND a brand new bear habitat. A few new animals for us that we have not seen elsewhere (the fishing cat and many African deer).
So many zoo babies too! Baby oranguatan, sloth and mandrill sighted. So fun!
A beautiful set of grounds, an obvious effort to compost and recycle (so much cleaner than other zoos).
Great zoo. Nice variety of animals. Fairly large zoo. Lots of open space. Favorite animal was the hippopotamus which i managed to snap a photo of with it's mouth wide open. Very neat!
Love visiting every time I come into town the animals are usually active and its a great experience seeing the variety on display
Nice selection of animals and exhibits to see.

Great zoo, my daughter loved watching the elephants playing in the water because they were so close (at least it seemed that way). The only complaint would be the parking....my husband ended up dropping us off and coming back later because we drove around for 30 min with no luck. My advise would be to go before they open and get a spot!
Absolutely fantastic!!! One of the best Christmas light experiences that I have had!!!
It was a great day was able to see all the animals and had a great time.
Zoo lights was amazing this year.  We even got to see some animals, besides penguins.
This zoo was huge!  It had an amazing elephant habitat among other things.  Well worth the time to explore if you're in the area!

The Denver Zoo is always a great place to visit, They have opened the new bear habitat, the tropical wildlife and fish exhibit was great with cleaned tanks and a new population expansion, didn't get to see the baby lion, the line was too long. But nevertheless it was a great visit and great weather
Had a great time at the zoo it was clean as always and they had it mapped for single way in and out.
There were a few exhibits under construction which was a little disappointing but still worth the visit.
The exhibits are really nice and the layout is easy to follow
The animals here seemed to be a little more free than in any Other zoo...Truly recommended
Small zoo but we had a great time!
