If you live in the Denver metro and have kids, then I recommend a zoo pass and frequent visits! It's a great place for kids to use up energy, learn, and be inspired. It is a wonderful stroll for adults as well. It has wonderful new updates.
Awesome adventure  an awesome walk loved the animals it was amazing they had a baby rino too so adorable
Fantastic zoo. This place is big, and we didn't get to see everything on our visit, but we received a Membership as a gift, so we'll definitely be back.

After watching the virtual safaris online, I was more eager than ever to revisit my favorite zoo. Seeing the new baby rhino Joona was among the highlights of the day! Looking forward to next time and seeing how much she has grown.
It was a great day! Still plenty of open exhibits and the animals are amazing!

This is a very large zoo with a great variety of animals, but it does not allow you to feed the giraffes like the Cheyenne mountain zoo does. I really enjoyed my time here with all the amazing creatures.
Everytime i go its been amazing. Thank you for sharing the animals and the experience. We will always come back.
Nice new exhibit with the tigers and elephants very pretty with all the flowers and space for banquets and company parties
Hey üëãüèæ I really had a nice day today at the Denver Colorado Zoo üëçüèæ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Great time at the Denver Zoo! Great idea to have water stations around the zoo due to these hot days! Thank you!

Super fun. Soooo much to do and so little time to do it. We picked a few things we wanted to do and made sure we get those first. Definitely feed the birds. Pay the 2 dollars for the cup of nectar and really get in there.  It was great, and the birds were very gentle and will sit on your hands.

Great place to visit but its super expensive so don't plan to spend less than $250 for a family of 4 and that's no souvenirs.

Animals seemed happy and it was very clean.

The best way to spend a couple hours. I love the Denver zoo, it‚Äôs always lovely to walk around and clean. They‚Äôve really put some $$$ into the facilities and it shows. They also have dip n dot and food stands so you got to grab something when you‚Äôre here!
Excellent zoo. Bigger than I expected. Very clean and animals look well cared for.
Fun place to go with your family and friends and it was amazing too look at and experience all the animals.
Dropped by for the zoo lights and they were absolutely beautiful. Definitely bundle up before heading out because it gets very cold after the sun goes down.
Was not impressed. Lions and tigers were not out. A lot of different animals were not in their areas of said places.  They will move them to different areas.

My favorite thing about this zoo is the care they give their animals. Early morning visits allow you to see that their animals aren't just for conservation awareness. Carcass feeding the carnivores, introducing new elephants to their herd and such, visiting early is definitely the way to go! A funny note, the penguins near the monkeys are from South Africa and hate the cold, they rarely come out if it's below 60*F.

We went to the Denver zoo situated inside the denver park.  A beautiful stroll where one can walk and wag .

The zoo looked very cool except we heard lota of whiny and stinky cats.  Cats are dumb dogs are pawsome
Wonderful place to be with the family, everyone is always so amazing. Great customer service, the food is delicious. Well prepared, restrooms are always clean and stocked.
So many elephants! You can get pretty close to the animals. It was a great time

This place made my girlfriends day. This was one of the big stops we had to make and we werent disappointed. She even made a couple friends! (Yes we know youre not supposed to touch, but she was landed on, so she was chosen!)
Tons of Halloween decorations the only bad part was the line For the corn maze. But other than that best place I have been for family fun.
Cool zoo some of animals wasn't out the play was still really nice had a great time
They have a lot of animals, they take good care of them. My grandkids had a lot of fun.
Went to the Denver Zoo lights. They were absolutely wonderful! It snowed while we were there and added a special something to the night. Fantastic job!
Absolutely love this place took my son for his first birthday today and he loved seeing all the animals üòä if you haven't gone before it's a great way to kill a couple good hrs
every animal they advertised we actually saw.best part is the park is not overwhelmingly huge.

We did not get to see the big cats. Perhaps it was too warm for them to come out of the shade. So that is one thing to keep in mind. They have a lot of elephants. I was hoping they could introduce elephant rides. I was also hoping for a petting zoo. The lorikeet habitat was the highlight of my trip to the zoo. I liked and enjoyed the OKC more than the denver zoo. More exhibits and more animals
If you're visiting Denver, I wouldn't recommend here if time is limited. It's a good zoo, but nothing special.
A very nice zoo, always a good time. I'm in love with the elephant exhibit!
Nice zoo. Great place to take your family or go by yourself
I took my 2.5 year old and she had a blast! We were there for 4 hours but she loves animals so I'm sure she could have stayed all day.
The Denver Zoo lights was a very impressive display! tickets online were easy to purchase, it was easy to get through the line at the entrance. The very imaginative light displays were fun to watch.
Fun place to learn about animals as long as you don't mind children running everywhere. Loved the exhibit with the Upcycled Trash in shapes of animals.
Our first time here and I didn't think it would be that much fun in the winter time but honestly it was great!
Excellent layout. Good shade spots. Animals look well kept and facility is clean. Employees are very friendly.

HaHad a great day. Don't know if it was just luck, or people have this experience all the time. Temp was in the high 70¬∞ - low 80¬∞. Only was able to see 1/4 of the zoo in 4 hrs, due to having such a good time @ each exhibit.
Dont know about cost of food/drink, smelled good though.
Can't wait to come back!
I haven't been here in 20 years! Still the same. Wonderful. Great place for kids!!!
Some indoor exhibits were closed but the zoo is comfortable and the animals.are nicely presented
Visited Zoo Lights again, and it was beautiful. So many lights, quite a few animals out, and a beautiful place to spend an evening wandering around in awe.
Not as many animals on display for the $ they are asking. But it was good enough considering the Covid-19 regulations.

Zoo lights is a fantasy adventure. All the trees and bushes and anything else they could put lights on was decorated!  If you buy the 3D glasses then you can see stars or penguins around the lights. And there are several led animal scenes. Loved the train ride. We had a wonderful time!

We went for zoolights after new years. The christmas lights were beautiful the only thing that was slightly disappointing was that the Christmas music didn't have the classic animal noise Christmas music.
I love love love bringing the kids here! Even with the COVID restrictions, the kids had a blast!
One of the best zoos in the USA. A must see for any tourist!

Went in January and still saw several animals. I could not find the lions even after asking two workers. They both sent us to the front exhibit which actually rotates between hyenas, wild dogs, and lions and today was hyenas. So I still don't know where the lions were. However, the elephant exhibit is one of the best I've seen and I liked how close you could get to the giraffes in the giraffe house. It was fun and pretty cheap for a zoo ($15). Groucho, the elephant, appeared to be dancing before the elephant show. It was hilarious to watch.
Once again the Denver Zoo and it's majestic beasts, did not disappoint!
Great to come mid morning. Not crowded.
The Denver zoo is huge, with great exhibits. We went to see the shows, which were informative and entertaining!
Always a great time at the Denver zoo! Highly recommend getting the membership, it‚Äôs such a great deal and you can go to the zoo year round.
Enjoyed the Lights festival the weekend of 11/29 the lights were beautiful with libations and snacks all along the light route.
Always getting yelled at by staff in the park to put my mask over my nose even though I have asthma. I guess they want me to die.

I highly suggest getting a zoo membership if you plan on going more than once in the year. You get discounts for at the restaurants, gift shops, and for special events. My family always has a wonderful time when we go.
Huge zoo with many types of animals rarely seen. Great for family trip.
I've only visited during the winter for the zoo lights, and it's definitely a good walk for the kids and for a group of friends to hang.
The animals have multiple enclosures they can travel between-so they have lots of room to move around.
Nice place to visit but not all animals were out too hot for them but loved it
Great. Zoo.  (Than I have been to) Second only to the San Diego zoo.  Great flow and awesome staff.

I love the Denver Zoo and as their Master plan starts to really get underway the future is very bright. I will say that the big cat house is currently closed but all the Lions, Tigers and Cheetah have newer exhibits and are still on display. The zoo once famous for Polar Bears now has none and Northern Shores is also part of the big overhaul that is in the works. If you live in the area the memberships are such a great deal with discounts on almost everything sold in the park. If you are visiting it is a great way to spend a day.
This is a very nice zoo! Its very clean! The price for admission isn't bad either!

Love that the peacocks are running around freely and it has great exhibits overall. Don't miss the grizzly and polar bears!

Only complaint would be that the zoo is laid out in an awkward manner and can be confusing to navigate at times, even with a map.

We have been going since I was little and they have really made a lot of great changes. It's beautiful and great place to take your kids. They have water activities for kids now and my 4 year old loved it!!!

Woman working at Kamala cafe was racist and lied to our faces. Half the exhibits were closed. Tiger exhibit was newly open, but only for members. Small enclosures for animals. Will not be supporting this zoo and will be actively advocating for better treatment of its animals.

Went for Zoo lights absolutely loved all the lights and they have Zoo Staff posted at some of the exhibits like the tigers to answer questions. The food and drinks were pricey but they always are. I'm a zoo member so my tickets were only $9 per adult to get in, I believe it's cheaper for seniors and kids.
We had a really good time at the Denver Zoo.  It was a little disappointing that some of the attractions were closed, but overall a fun way to spend a day!
Such a fun zoo. My kids had a blast. We saw all sorts of animals like the Hippo, Giraffe, Elephants and many many more. Can't wait to come back.
Really good place and can't wait to go again (hopefully they have African penguin exhibit done by then
Great time with the kids. It was hot, but they gave away water and had misters.

What can you say, it's the zoo. Spectacular place to spend with family. It's clean it's safe. It might be a little crowded.  But it justifies the  five star rating is warranted.  May I recommend becoming a member of the zoo. The rewards are great.
I was amazed at the size of the exhibits for the animals. You can tell they are well cared for.

The zoo was under heavy remodel/ construction and after walking the entire thing from 12-4, there were very few animals out in the 45¬∞ weather. We were able to see the Seal, 3 Lions, Elephant, 4 kangaroos, eagle, condor, african penguins(demonstration). That is the complete outdoor list. of course we were able to see the snakes/ fish and monkey in the indoor exhibit. they should drop their price in the winter. We went a years ago in the spring, and it was great, so maybe it was an off day but for 3 adults and 3 kids it was not worth the $80 to see 11 animals. Very disappointed.
it wz alot of fun.. my kids enjoyed it alot.. didn't get to see the bears or tigers only bad thing
Always love the Zoo. We are members! Come down sometimes just for lunch. Other days we are here all day from open to close.
The zoo was fantastic. They keep it so very clean. The little ones enjoyed the popcorn. And the zoo keepers were so very nice showing off the new baby sloth.
Awesome. Worth it more if you have the zoo pass! You don't have to see everything in one day. Just keep coming back. Pays itself off after a couple visits.

Always a good time at City Park and the Zoo! It has been more and more crowded as Denver grows, but still a favorite.  Zoo is clean and taken care of.  Finally started serving beer a few years ago.  Brilliant.
Always wonderful seeing the zoo and so glad that they have reopened and are doing their social distancing well during covid
Nice zoo, even after snow when some animals weren't on view.
My family and I love coming to the zoo. Seeing and learning about all the animals. Perfect for a family outing!
Best place to go . Felt so good and was amazed at the elephants.ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞
They have a very nice set up here. Lots of fun. Great way to spend the day. Parking is not great

The Denver zoo never disappoints!  My kids love going there.  We were fortunate to have great weather on spring break and a lot of the animals were out.  Dobby the baby giraffe was adorable!  Tamale the baby cape buffalo and the baby gorilla were also adorable!  I would give 5 stars if they had better parking but other than that it's a great place to go with the family!
The Denver Zoo is so much fun! Our son is only 16 months old and he just loves going here! I suggest getting annual pass if you have little ones. It's a much better value!

I always love the zoo and hos you can really see the animals up close. The animal ambassadors are so knowledgeable about every animal.  Great social distancing and felt it wasnt crowded and everyone was respectful in giving you space.

FANTASTICAL "Zoo Lights" as our 1st visit to Denver Zoo. Incredible facility.  Awesome staff and fun/funny experience!
Will be back!!!

Live taking the kids to the zoo!!!
Always have suck a good time
Good zoo to enjoy with familly and children, a lot of areas and animals,but in winter is dificult to see all the animals.
Had a wonderful time as always.  Tge zoo keeps getting better and better
Always fun and after years of going first thing in the morning I found that the best time to go is after 130pm. A must for anyone visiting Denver.
We went on a free day and wow, lots of people yet still we were able to see all the animals. They have a great group of healthy looking animals.  The Red Panda babies were very cute.
Enclosures overall seem a bit small, but the zoo lights are beautiful

Went for the first time to Denver Zoo Lights right before the New Year. Busy, had to park out in left field so long walk to entrance.  Also one of the coldest nights to go....but bought tickets online ahead of time so no wait.  Had a good time being mesmerized by all of the displays and different uses of lights.  Worth going once if you are a native and have never gone.  Since animals are not out, price of admission should include day hours entry/admittance.  Must buy separate tickets if you want to go to see the animals.  Also went same year end of October for Boo at the Zoo. Either time, not able to see the animals since there is no lighting other than the lights used for the displays.
Best zoo ever.  We got to see the Tigers pee on somebody from their bridge the other day!

Great family and school outing in Denver's beautiful City Park. Very diverse zoo with excellent exhibits. Top choices include the Primate Panorama, Elephant Passage, Northern Shores, Tropical Discovery and The Edge. Be sure to check out the baby gorilla and baby orangutan.
Great variety of animals. Loved seeing red panda, zebras, giraffes, and lions close up. The indoor tropics is beautiful environment.  Membership totally worth it.
Beautiful new tiger exhibit, The EDGE. A well kept and environmentally conscious zoo
Love it, love coming here, my kids love it even more. I am a membership holder and have been since my children were born and will continue to be as long as I can.
Good place to go with kids. My kids love this place.
The Denver Zoo is always a great experience!  The park is taking great care to keep guests safe during covid.  Thank you Denver Zoo!

Great place to bring the family and customer service is very nice. You can bring your own food and drinks, no alcohol of course. Skip the line and buy tickets online, they can scan the QR code in your email.
Check the website to see what new babies are there.  Today, we saw the new giraffe and a bitty baby Golden Tamarin.  The lions are usually out at closing time.
Get new additions and thankful for the SNAP entry discount!
Lots of fun at the zoo. Come see the new renovations.

Have always loved the zoo, longtime member. Zoolights is awesome, and if you get the chance to visit on date night, it is incredibly fun. Worth a membership if you visit more than once a year, and the membership perks are awesome.
Great zoo experience. Many of the animals were up close.
Remodeled a few times since our last visit. Social distancing rules in place and reservations required, contactless ticketing
I came from out of town and this was a pleasant trip. The animals seemed cared for and the enclosures were awesome. Great gift shop and
Great time for hanging out with the granddaughter.  Easy and plenty of parking.  Clean and well maintained.
Fun, Educational, time well spend with family. Exciting to see all different animals, area maintained clean and great staff, all helpful in general.
We love the Denver Zoo and visit as often as we can. The animals can be quite entertaining at times. üôÇ

I loved this zoo!! I've been to quite a few but really enjoyed this experience. Also, there was a rhino just born and should be ready for viewing in 6-8 weeks from what I've read! Also, they have Tapirs which i was really excited for, but didnt get a chance to see unfortunately.
The Denver zoo is a must see place for families. If you visit over December, they have really nice Christmas lights and it is simply beautiful!
The guy that was working here was very helpful he was really great
This was a nicely laid out zoo and the Zoo Talks helped to keep us moving through the park fairly quickly and helped make sure we saw all the animals there.
What a great Soo! My kids loved it. Social distance markers keep people aware of distance. Staff is friendly and caring!
It's a zoo. Went on a free day, decided to sign up for a membership. Just love animals.
Not too many animals to see but that's understandable considering the weather. Beautiful place non the less.
Sometimes the lines are very long, not a lot of animals out for such a nice day and expensive food. Definitely will plan accordingly in the future. But love the Mike's camera exhibit today.
Been to this zoo my whole life, and I've always loved it. The passion of the keepers and their dedication to the preservation of the animals there is apparent in every part of the zoo.
I always enjoy coming to the zoo. It's beautiful. You can always see up grades being done for all the animals.
Fun experience everytime. We always try to go during the week in the Summer but it's pretty crowded anytime or day. Good beer to drink while you walk around and dip n dots for the kids.
We love going to the zoo and spending the day looking at the animals!

Was great especially if you get a membership and can enter when they first open! Was nice and cool and not as many people early in the morning... Was a very clean environment and the staff was super helpful and friendly!

Can't say enough good things about this zoo. The layout of the walkways is very involved with the habitats and you can tell they have a true passion for the animals and plant here. I've never been able to get so close to an elephant or tiger ü•∞

You could make a whole day out of seeing this zoo. Scheduled shows of Sea Lions, Elephants, Llamas, Tigers and Exotic Birds etc... happen every half hour. You have to see the reptile house, the newer tiger and elephant enclosures. Fun Carosel and train rides near monkey island for the kids. Just read the map beforehand so you know where the restrooms are.
Took a group of 20 people here for our daughter's second birthday party and everyone had a great time!
I did the zoo lights and was there earlier to take pictures of the animals and lights. The lights were beautiful this year.
Wonderful experience in Denver Zoo! It is HUGE! We spent all day there, enjoyed every bit of the visit. Animals look happy and spoiled üòâ they have a nice space and it's great.
Denver as always hosted great boo at the zoo! It was our third year taking our daughter there and she just loves that.  Seeing animals and trick or treating what fun!

I'm not gonna pretend I know everything. I barely will pretend I know anything. So here's what I do know. It smells strong at the zoo. It's very hot or cold at the zoo. There are more strollers than you've ever seen in your life at the zoo. Everything is expensive at the zoo. Parking is a zoo at the zoo. My feet hurt from walking at the zoo. But a lot of people seem to enjoy the zoo. So, Zamboomafoo.

Great family event! Busy today, but still so much room to not feel too crowded! Restrooms everywhere, just make sure tou bring lots of water and food snacks to sace money from buying vendor foods! They allow wagons, strollers ect in along with coolers! So it's really nice! We did the train ride, we didn't wait long at all maybe 10- 15 min in line and train ride is abouy 5 min. Long. Carousel was fun for the kids as well! Again line super quick and that's nice! A few slight upward walks so keep that in mind and remember to wear comfy shoes, bring umbrella to block sun!
Lots of areas were closed when we visited in December. This may have been due to the Zoo Lights set-up or planned construction work.  Still, the visit was great.
A vast place for a zoo and the animals are well fed and looked healthy. Will definitely be back again if only my place is near hehehe!
First time there, place was alot of fun!!! Long walk but freaking awesome!!!
Great place to bring kids but price of food and drinks are not worth buying here.
What a fantastic zoo! Large, sprawling place with so many fantastic displays, exhibits and interactions. Oh, and local beer on draught throughout the park too!
It was a pretty good zoo. I feel like a lot of animals were missing. Maybe it‚Äôs because it was hot for Denver.
Good place to spent time with family. Clean restrooms, amazing animals.
I went with my daughter and we had a blast

Busy.
Kids running around without supervision. Loud and obnoxious. Was hoping to go on a non-busy, school day, a Tuesday. But, there were bus loads of kids.

Animals were amazing. Lots of exhibits. Lots going on.

Some of the eateries did not open on time and took a while to have food ready.
Nice variety of animals. Love the elephant exhibit and seal show.
Love the zoo, I've been a bunch and it never gets old.
I went with a school trip and was so fun. Good shows, great and knowledgeable staff! Not too crowded (although it was a weekday). Fun.
The Zoo Lights were amazing & we also got to feed the giraffes! We highly recommend both.
I always love the Denver Zoo.
Such a big, beautiful zoo with tons of animals who look happy.
Had a great time. Got to see lots of animals in spite of the houses being closed due to the current social climate. Love the layout that is down to help navigate the zoo.
Went to Zoo Lights.  Just beautiful.  A must see if you haven't been or it's been a few years.  Support the zoo and have a great night.
Love the Denver Zoo! So many amazing animals. They're always adding new and updated thing. Highly reccomend.
I love this zoo!  except the only problem is that it closes early.. So get there early
We went even though it was cold and empty. Honestly it was refreshing and nice to have the place to ourselves.

Nice place to take kids and family to. Lots of different kinds of animals for kids to see and then want to learn more about. Some of it is older, and some of it is a lot newer, but both are fun to see the animals that are there.
The Zoo is always fun and you never have the same experience twice. Whether you spend an hour or a day you'll have a great time.
We got the family plus pass so we can go again and again. We always have a blast at the Denver Zoo.
There is construction going on but we had a nice experience
Never fails to make me smile. Always something new to learn or see.  The Denver zoo seems to always be working hard to make improvements.
Zoo lights are always fun. Parking was busy but the zoo itself wasn't as crowded as we've seen on prior visits to the lights.  Weekend crowds are probably bigger.
Lots of exhibits closed and animals do not like coming out before the afternoon.
It's springtime at the Zoo meaning they have tulips, Dole whips (if you're a Disney fan) and baby geese.
The Okapi Encounter was a fun family activity. The zookeeper was knowledgeable and friendly. We got to  feed Romakari. His fur is like chocolatey velvet!

Had lots of fun. The staff was friendly and very informative and the Covid precautions were set up well. It was never too crowded.
Reasonably priced, wheelchair friendly, and the animals were all healthy and clean pens.
It was a beautiful and lengthy walk . My children and grandchild loved seeing all different animals
Kept clean, friendly staff, lots of different exotic animals, tons of family fun!
Had a great time out with family, always enjoy a sunny warm day walking around seeing all the animals. And enjoyed the swirl ice cream cone
Always love going here and a lot of new exhibits
got hot wearing a mask outside the whole time.  Animals were out and was a nice place to go.

The Zoo has been going through some major changes I'm happy to say that they are adding a better selection of activities to do with your kids they are a little over price on the food . We had a great time
Lots of giraffes, elephants and penguins. I love penguins. Lots of exhibits. A pleasant way to spend the day.
Always love the Zoo lights. I like that they limit the number of tickets sold so that it's not over crowded. Wonderful to bring the kids and have a great time.
Best zoo I had ever visited. The animals seem very well taken care of.
Great zoo! Many of the animals could be viewed up close
Our kids love it there, although It can get very busy and crowded sometimes. I also wish they had some healthy snack options.
I am very proud and pleased with our Denver Zoo, always top notch. Currently enjoying Zoo Lights for the holidays.

I wanted to thank the folks at the Denver Zoo for the Free Admission Day today, what a treat! I hadn't been to the Zoo in ages, it really took me back to my childhood. The animals seemed in good spirits. üêÖüôâüêê
I especially enjoyed the giraffe enclosure, the three giraffe who were present couldn't figure out why they couldn't access the part of the enclosure the human - who was there cleaning - was in.  They looked at me and then looked at the human and looked back at me, like I was supposed to do something about it.  I told them they could probably take care of that pesky human who was in the way of a full basket elevated above the floor full of fresh hay, if they really wanted to.  I also tried to reassure them that they probably should just be cool, the human would undoubtedly be giving them food tomorrow, too.  They calmed down, no need to worry. üòú

Breakout KC is the best escape rooms in Kansas City.  They are really fun, well thought out puzzles and the props and secret rooms are very well crafted.

We loved our experience with Room 213!
Alex was great giving us clues when we asked!  Quinn checked us in and was very welcoming to our group!

We did it as a team building exercise. We all had a great time and it really stretched our problem solving skills. Everyone made significant contributions that resulted in us solving the challenge and escaping the room successfully. I would highly recommend it for a great time and a solid group challenge.
great experience! was a surprise b-day activity... fun and challenging. well done... we failed but learned a lot about each other and ourselves.

We had our office Christmas party here for 2016 and did the Hamilton room! It was my first time doing a breakout room and i had a completely blast!! Totally one of the coolest group outings to do in KC! Really great people that work here, they make it even more fun!!

Our second escape room was very fun.  We went for a more difficult level and had to ask for a clue; also, our youngest found it harder to participate in this room (Room 213) than in the previous.  Nevertheless, we all had a great time and will likely do another room in the future.

LOVED this room!  It was extremely different from anything we have done before.  Shawn was so helpful, more than we've had before.  Sometimes we didn't even ask.  I really liked the feedback he gave US at the end and how we worked together!  The air quality was accommodating as was everything else.  Just can't say enough about the room, the fee (much better/lower than other places), the explanation of what to do, etc.  The only suggestion, if possible, is to have the sound a little louder on the TVs when we have to watch vids.  That's it!  You guys are one of the best! :)  Thanks Shawn!  You take great pics too :)
We had a party of 7. Our dinner was running late and they rescheduled for us with out hesitation.  Alex was an excellent host and we had an amazing experience. We can't wait to go again.

The breakout KC proved for a great girls trip bonding experience.  We loved the built in clues and thought that went into the gambler and would recommend it, while there are many steps it is a rewarding quest and a fun one to work together to break. I would recommend this escape room.

Had a great time today. My coworkers and completed The Hero as a chance to hang out outside of work. The staff was amazing and our guide Dani was above and beyond helpful when it came to clues that we were doing correctly but not able to open locks (she reminded us to be a bit more forceful on the padlocks). Our group had only two others who had done escape rooms but everyone pulled their own weight well.

It was a good time. I'd do it again.  I think it's best to start out with an easier room your first time. The room holds up to 8. So, keep in mind if you don't have a party of 8, you may have strangers added to your room.
We did the Gambler room. It was an 8/10 for toughness. It was tough. We did not breakout but were minutes away from doing so.
The clues are great! The staff is helpful.
I feel it's hard for everyone to have a chance at solving when there are that many. It kind of ends up being a few solving everything while the rest stand back feeling like they are in the way.
By the way, 5 year olds can attend but there is no price reduction. They are $30 just like everyone else.

We went here for a team building exercise and had a blast! We did the Truman room and we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience! Our Game Master, Susan was fantastic and lovely! What a fun way to spend an hour.
This was all of our first experience doing a escape room! AMAZING experience. Employees are super nice and help make the experience amazing! We cannot wait to go back!
Had a lot of fun at the room 213 escape room.  I will not spoil it but we finished with 26 seconds to spare! Overall a lot of fun would recommend!

This place is a blast! While I didn't get to actually break out of the room I was in, it still was a ton of fun to participate in a brain busting activity. I love the varieties of rooms, as well as the difficulty, so that really any group of people can enjoy themselves. The attention to detail in the rooms is wonderful - it is almost like a piece of art! The staff is funny and engaging.

PS. Any legitimate knowledge of Harry Truman's life will not help you escape any quicker ü§£
The staff is always so fun and friendly! We have escaped 3/5 rooms that we have done. Fun and challenging!

We were 15 minutes late due to unforeseen circumstances. I did call to let them know and they were super nice and explained they‚Äôd have to start the clock on time and we‚Äôd have less time, which is understandable, however, once we arrived they gave us the full time since it was for my daughter‚Äôs 13th birthday.

I've only done a few escape rooms at this point, but Breakout KC provided an awesome experience. The theme was attractive, the set was well-constructed, props were functional and cleverly designed, the puzzle was certainly challenging, and the staff was welcoming and helpful when needed. It's still the only escape room our team didn't complete!

Update: Breakout KC to the Rescue. After sharing the rough experience, Breakout KC stepped up to make sure our group had the quality experience they are known for offering. My group came together and did Room 13. We enjoyed the entire puzzle and the great teamwork. The puzzle was fun and well put together. Most of all I enjoyed seeing all my friends work together for our last outing before we move.
Update: Recently I visited Breakout KC again, I had a less than stellar experience. My group was paired with a few ladies that made the evening not as much fun. They stole the puzzle experience from our group.
Oldest: We went as a team building event and they provided a great experience for us. The puzzle was well thought out with cool ideas. I really liked the physical portion of the puzzle. We did hero and saved the world. I will come back with my family and friends.

I had so much fun!  Never wanted to do an escape room before, in fact... I was pretty adamant about not wanting to be locked in a room but... I'm hooked!
Breakout KC was a well organized, clean and creatively fun environment.
We went for a birthday surprise and the host rented two rooms; Room 13 and Szechuan Secret.  Our group had Room 13 and happy to say we figured out the puzzles with :46 seconds left.  Great fun, fantastic team work and excellent bonding time with friends!
Can't wait for my next visit!  Stay well and keep up the great work and creativity Breakout KC!
Xoxo Nichole Raab
Always a fun time!!  Nicely laid out and challenging rooms!  Friendly and fun staff, as well!
My first breakout experience was a blast! Highly recommended
So much fun! Highly recommend this experience with family and friends! A fun team experience!
Great team building event. Went there with my Catholic young adults dodgeball team the last 2 years!
This place was amazing. We did it as a date night and honestly went in expecting not to escape...but Shawn was super helpful! Will 100% be coming back!
Staff was friendly, room was fun, plenty of parking right across the street.
Tons of fun, clever, unexpected puzzles. Will definitely return!
First time to a Breakout and had a blast! We were in the Truman room. If you are looking for a great team building experience, I suggest Breakout KC!
Took my daughter & her friends to the Patient 57 Room, and it was a total blast, they all loved it!

Fun! Intense! Pro! They have multiple arenas, indoor and outdoor + laser tag with combos. If indoor, you will have a high level of humidity and a fogging issue with the masks. Bring anti-fog spray, paper towels, drinks (non-alcoholic), and cans for the food drive to get a discount.

They supply gloves, neck gaiters, and helmets for your convenience and protection.

We had a blast at Jaegers paintball complex celebrating a surprise birthday present! Nestled inside of a cave, you can run around and hide behind obstacles while trying to take down your targets. There‚Äôs an area that you can sit and watch through the plexiglass once you get hit. You can buy a jumpsuit there for extra padding if you‚Äôd like to play it safe. Go with a group of friends or family‚Ä¶very fun!

Very fun. Had my bachelorette party here. Staff had scissors, lockers, took pictures of us in our oversized dresses. It was a blast! Definitely would do again. Word of advice: dont walk to the top field, it's a HIKE! There's parking up there, so definitely drive!

Holy God. If you havent been here your life will never be complete. This is one of the funniest things on earth. The staff is sure and helpful. The atmosphere is incredibly fun and friendly. Pricing is very cheap. Groups are always welcome last min time changes don't bother them.
Nice place good price and big store just the cave need a little more light and probably some air purifier.

Fun place to get some paintball action with multiple courses available there is one for everyone. There are inside and outside areas to battle amongst teams. I would recommend a bandana or a low profile dust mask if you play the cave courses. Also later up, close range shots sting! Thumbs up please if this was helpful.
Had so much fun. Justice, the girl working the front, was so helpful and sweet. This was my first time playing here but I'll definitely be back.
Fantastic place to play paintball or lazer tag! The service is great! The ref was really awesome and very fair. We will deffinetly be back!
It is so much fun for a good price! And if you want to buy your own paintball gun buy it there. You will get a 120 day field pass! That's what gun I recommend for new or beginning players.

Aquarium was fairly small but decent for the price. Thought they would be a lot more to see. It was a lot of children activities to do. Very child friendly.
They gave us a stamp booklet at the end once you fill it you get a sticker saying you completed the stamp booklet. It‚Äôs a great idea for little kids to stay informed and to read about the different type of sea life.

Decided to take a family adventure. Haven‚Äôt been here for a couple of years. I really enjoyed myself and the child did as well. The time was perfect. Parking was easy to find (under the garage, free on weekends) WOW.

Upon entering the Sea Life KC, the customer service was TOO RELAXED. Step Up the Customer Service. Sea Life and Lego Land.

The aquarium was very clean and didn‚Äôt smell of Ocean. The tour was only 1hr or so. Can‚Äôt wait to Return.

This was a fun little spot! Wide range of fish! Even some fresh water! Educational yet super fun. Enjoyable for adults as well. It was smaller than we thought it would be and pricey for the size but it really was packed with relatively well kept animals in clean aquariums. Most of them seemed comfortable.

Although a smaller aquarium, well done and nicely outfitted. Reasonably priced as well. Interesting digital information pads at each station to learn more about the sea life. A relaxed environment as well. Great parking too.

Good aquarium for smaller kids, a lot of tanks and a lot of fish.  We spent about 2.5 hours there and the kids and adults had a lot of fun.  The walk through big aquarium was really cool.  The big stingray tank the the kids' favorite. Military discount available.

Sea life is an amazing place to hang out and get a wonderful experience watching sea lives. A lot of people don't know there are beautiful animals living inside the oceans, and you don't have to go into the ocean to see them. This is a great opportunity to explore sea lives  and see how different species live their life into the ocean gether, happily.
Although its very small it was a nice place. Lots of sea life and has lots of interactive displays to keep you busy learning about each creature. It's definitely worth a visit.

Such a great place to go and see some amazing sea life. The long tunnel where you can see multiple angles of the sharks, rays, fish, turtles, and more swimming above you has spoiled me. It‚Äôs so peaceful.

This aquarium is very kid friendly. There are a variety of sea creatures and you can tell that they are dedicated to keeping our oceans clean. To be fair I have visited larger aquariums in the past but this was fun for the price. The only two things that were a bit of a bummer were the sea turtles were off display and barely any of drawing digital tablets where you could color your own sea creature worked.

Very nice yet small in size for an aquarium facility. The location, price, options for middle school to elementary age children or smaller is a perfect attraction. I would absolutely recommend it. It is a wonderful place to visit just for an adventure or date out on the town.

Wasn't the biggest aquarium I've been to, but for the price I'm happy with my visit! I was really impressed with the attention to each areas theme. The props and decorations were very nicely done and each aquarium seemed to be very well kept.

This is a wonderful place to visit if you like animals! There is a touch pool and animal facts for the kids to read. A piece of your admission price goes to sea conservation. They often have events. I highly recommend this aquarium no matter what your age is.
Was amazing. We loved it. There‚Äôs shark, stingrays and jellyfish . Really fun in the tubes.  I was surprised that the fish were so big. I would love to go again

As much as I struggle seeing animals outside of their natural habitat, it was really great seeing what Sea Life is doing for the ocean animals that live in their care. Really a gorgeous experience and one of a kind, I highly recommend!
Great family activity. Kid friendly. Clean. Purchase tickets in advance for a better deal. So many great sights! Staff is knowledgeable and friendly!

Single adult, no kids, it's 30mins of content
Go with kids? Probably 1-2hrs depending on how long they spend at the touch pools and other activities. There are a lot of things specifically for kids that are pretty cool including two small exhibits with domes underneath that kids can look up through, a few interactive games, and a big took where kids can color in sea creatures on ipads.

I just went by myself, and I was surprised by all of the creatures I had never seen before. I live in Maryland so I've gone to the national aquarium several times and sea life has a few they don't like lion fish for example. Very cool to see.

I went with family - we brought children ages 5, 6, 7 & 10. The kids all enjoyed the experience.

Information: Park in the Crown Plaza and have your parking validated. Plan to spend 1-1.5 hours there. We were there just over an hour and saw everything. We purchased combo Legoland/Sea Life tickets.

Pros: They have a handout for the kids and ‚Äúpunch stations‚Äù throughout that encourage kids to read and learn about the animals and exhibits. There is a variety of sea life to look at, some very beautiful exhibits and the information is easy to read and understand - very age appropriate. There is a ‚Äútouch‚Äù station and the kids enjoyed seeing what different creatures felt like.

Cons: I expected to need to spend more time here, it was actually quite small. One of the punch stations for the kids‚Äô activity was out of order. The entire sea turtle display was closed. The final station had iPads available and about 5/15 of the iPads were on and working.

Final Thoughts: This was a neat experience, but once was enough. If you‚Äôre looking for an amazing aquarium and zoo experience, consider checking out the Henry Doorly Zoo in Omaha, Nebraska. You very well might want to plan 2 days (not hours) & you still won‚Äôt see everything!

Great experience! I loved that it had stuff for all ages! Frankly, my 3 year old got really bored when we took him to an aquarium a year ago but Sea Life had interactive things for little ones which was really nice! They even had one of their touch pools open- we were so excited! Unfortunately, the shark feeding didn‚Äôt happen the day we went due to being short staffed but that‚Äôs definitely understandable. Totally recommend!

I loved the behind the scenes add on, and would definitely recommend that. The rest of this aquarium was a little underwhelming. It was very crowded, which wasn't my favorite thing at all. It felt like it caused everyone to rush through and there were so many children. I feel like the STL and Springfield aquarium have more fish variety, but for the cost, this one is decent.
My 2 year old granddaughter loved the experience! The aquarium is designed so that children can view the exhibits easily.
The Kids and I enjoyed it here. Larger than I expected. We also liked petting the sea urchin and starfish. Jellyfish are cool and stingrays are Huge!
The kids loved it. We had my 10 year old‚Äôs birthday outing here and all the kids were very interested and entertained. Just a gem to have in KC.

Fantastic aquarium! It's not the biggest you'll ever see, but it is absolutely beautiful.  You feel like you're under the water with the sea life when you're walking through the place. Definitely worth stopping in if you're in Kansas City.
The staff were friendly and helpful.  The facility was clean and well kept.  The interactive activities were great for all ages.  This is a great place to visit with families of all ages.

Great aquarium! Worth the visit. The price seems a little high, but it‚Äôs well done. There‚Äôs a small ‚Äúpetting‚Äù area too (but the zoo‚Äôs is better). My son had a good time. Takes about an hour to get through. I loved the style/decor inside. 4.5 stars if I could.

We had a lot of fun. Not the biggest, but that's ok. They had a lot to see. Prices are fair and it was a great time, especially for kids. They validate parking across the street at the mall. Easy in and out. Yup....I took those photos.
This aquarium was awesome I just wish it was a little bigger especially for the price. They had it decorated nice for the holidays and I LOVED the jellyfish tank!

I took my 15 year old daughter and we really really enjoyed this. I have been to Shedd Aquarium in Chicago. But that place was so overcrowded that it was hard to enjoy it all. SEA LIFE had far more than I expected. You will be pleasantly surprised. Fun for all ages. Even adults.
This small aquarium is a great half-day attraction. Pair a visit with the LEGO center or the ice rink or the shopping center and enjoy some family time. There are games and hands on exhibits.
It was amazing I highly recommend going. Went with my Mom, Aunt and little cousins and we all enjoyed ourselves.
Always a fun experience! Make sure to get the combo tickets, Legoland is great too! My kids love it! I recommend going early in the morning it gets pretty busy as the day goes by.
Beautiful aquarium! A little pricy- $21 per adult. My husband and I walked through the whole thing in about an hour and twenty minutes.
A great little aquarium to see some amazing creatures. Plus, if you have kiddos you can go through Legoland too.
This place is simply amazing we will definitely be back and bring our children to see this aquarium.
Always fun and clean...I guess you can also say it smells fishy.  Awesome exhibits and even a touch pool!!!

Had a very enjoyable day. The aquarium is very nice. A really good overall experience of sea creatures in the wild. Was hoping for a larger tank with larger sharks, but after visiting one of the biggest aquariums in Las Vegas, I was a little disappointed, until I put it in perspective. Don't hesitate to come and have an enjoyable afternoon with it without the kids.

This is a rather small aquarium and it's very much set up to not allow guests to easily go back to a previous area. The hallways are very narrow and only allow about two people standing side by side. This creates bottlenecks of people waiting to advance which also prevents going back to a previous exhibit area. I was expecting it to take 2-3 hours to get through depending on stoppage and got through it in under an hour. There are nice little touchscreen information pads near each exhibit but they don't actually have much information. It's limited to showing where the animal is from, the scientific name, endangered status and a one sentence fact. I was stopping to read and learn but there really wasn't much information which is probably by design to push people through quickly.
The big attraction is the weedy sea dragons. They have their own room and a very large tank (I found out it's because of the space they need for their mating dance). A lot of people surprisingly just walked past thinking this was an empty room so maybe the aquarium should do something to better draw people in? While there were two interactive games, there wasn't an information pad like in other areas which was disappointing. There was a chalk wall with information on it. The space was very open and could have benefited from some benches along the walls to sit and enjoy the area. Anyways, I timed my visit for the 3:30 weedy sea dragon talk. I got there early (about 3:10) and caught a keeper feeding them. This was the highlight of my visit. The keeper was very friendly and answered a ton of questions I had like why weedy over leafy sea dragons. I learned a lot about their conservation efforts and the animals. I stuck around until about 3:40 expecting there to be the scheduled talk and no one else showed. That was a bit disappointing because I forgot to ask if there was a way to tell the males from females and the talk was what I was most looking forward to. I'm very glad then I caught the keeper.
Other highlights included the tank with the rays. It had a second story so you could observe them from above which was really cool. Aside from the weedy sea dragons, this is where I spent most of my time. It also was about the only part of the aquarium with benches and it's towards the end of the path.
The gift shop is about as expected. For the aquarium being so proud of the weedy sea dragons, there was zero merch for these guys. Shedd has a small leafy sea dragon exhibit but they have leafy sea dragon merch in the gift shop. So I was disappointed I couldn't buy any weedy sea dragon merch. They did have a variety of stuffed animals including things like rays and starfish. There were plenty of small items like sea turtle magnets for an easy souvenir. Prices seemed pretty reasonable too.
Overall, I think this aquarium is worth a visit if you love aquariums. The price could be a bit lower for what you get but it's not absurd. I feel like it's a solid 3.5 star aquarium.

So happy my granddaughter had the chance to enjoy herself while visiting here from Ohio. We truly had a blast & thank you so much SEA LIFE for allowing us to make memories with her. The accommodations for wheelchairs are awesome. All you guys were wonderful. I‚Äôm sorry I forgot the older lady‚Äôs name at check out, but she has the best customer service hands down! Thank you again!
Really cool place! Our favorite was the 2 rescue sea turtles! They come right up to you and I got some really cool close up shots of them!
This was an absolute pleasure for me to visit, I love the sea life and it's a great little place that gives you great view and amazing variety of things to shop from.
Smaller than I expected. Some of the tanks seemed small for how many fish were in them but I'm not the expert
Had a wonderful time. Loved how well everything was decorated for Halloween.

Lovely little place to visit but not for the admission price. If you can, find a good deal and then enjoy! There is quite a bit to see and learn from here both for children and adults. Just be mindful of the fact that, if you have kids that absolutely LOVE Legos, at the end of your tour you'll end up in the gift store... which is directly connected to Legos, Legos and more expensive Legos that your child can't unsee and may not settle for a "maybe next time." Now that you know, plan accordingly! üòÅüëçüèæ

Reason for 4 stars was the price per time spent there. I've been to the Atlanta aquarium and you can spend all day there, wander around as much as you'd like, but this one was like a one way maze and not very big so it only took us an hour to get through which was disappointing and once you get to the end it's an exit to the gift shop. I would've given 3 stars if we paid full price but we had a discount coupon. There was a touch pool where the kids can touch a star fish and the Shark tank was cool but small. If you are trying to decide between here and Legoland I say do Legos, it's a little cheaper and you can spend as much time there as you want (you can at the aquarium too but you have to go back through the maze against the flow of traffic and once you've seen it you've seen it).  The coolest part was getting to design your own fish at the end and setting it Free and the kids can watch it swim away on the wall.

As I've seen other people say, it is small. It is all one way traffic, not enough space to really enjoy it with out getting ran over by over excited, under parented, children. It is almost a maze and at the end your left wondering if it was really worth the price. Luckily, we bought the combo ticket for LegoLand as well for $35 but honestly, I think it is still over priced.
Nice place for the kids. You need 45 minutes to visit it at least. Recommended to buy your tickets a head of time because it will sold out quickly

1st time here! I added Sea Life on when I bought Legoland tickets, for a little bit extra money. We spent about an hour here. Our 3 year liked it but also was rushing through it to get done, lol. I don't know if I would visit again but it was cool to see once.

First time ever going to an aquarium. I enjoyed it. It is a little small and only takes about an hour. Definitely a good place to take kids too. Prices are affordable as my family of 6 went for around $150.

Enjoyed the different aquariums,.  And walking through them,.  Would have liked to have seen octopus,.   More different jellyfish,. And more  fresh water.

We all had a good time
Very knowledgeable staff. Good place to visit. You can also add Lego land to the package.

Pretty cool aquarium! Decent price for getting to spend a couple hours seeing sting rays and sharks up close. Petting the starfish was pretty cool. Rescued sea turtles, seahorses, sea dragons...all a must see!

We love sea dragons. My 7 y/o cousin didn't believe me they were real but they are! Apparently, we learned that Sealife has been the only place that has successfully mated sea dragons in captivity! Very cool fact from very knowledgeable staff. Conservation is a theme throughout the exhibit which was cool to see.

My cousin is from the pacific coast (literally an island) and so we were worried she wouldn't see much. There were so many different fish and creatures than what is in the aquarium near her home and she loved it. She loved getting her passport stamped even though we made her find the answers first. She was the absolute perfect age to absolutely love everything. :)
Wonderful time. My Daughter loved meeting the mermaids

Amazing aquarium for kids .
They have a big variety of species .
They have the aquarium decorated for kids so you can find so many cool things to show tot he kids while they are learning about the sea Life .

They were opened on time .
Staff was so nice .
Lots of fun fish to see, a little stamp book helps keep the kids entertained.  My oldest is 9 and he was barely interested, it's definitely geared more towards a younger crowd.
Educational and positively stimulating even for adults!!!!! Children friendly as well as wheelchair accessible ü•∞

Its pretty cool for what it is. The staff was very professional but the other patrons were terrible (Not the businesses fault i know this) The whole experience in itself was really short maybe  forty five minutes and that includes standing in line ü§∑

An awesome little aquarium. Located in the crown center shopping area and joined with Legoland, this aquarium is loads of family fun. The aquarium has mostly saltwater fishes, with a couple of tanks of freshwater fishes towards the beginning of the experience. That said, this aquarium does a wonderful job of having family friendly interactions. I go several times a year and always have a blast for at least 2 hours a trip, though the busier days make you feel like you should go through faster. That said, take your time and enjoy all the fish!!!
A little small but cohesive with unique sea creatures.

First time going easter weekend and they did a great job of enforcing mask wearing as well as social distancing. There were always staff members walking around making sure everyone was doing the right things. There were hand sanitizing stations all over as well. There were a limited amount of people allowed in at a time bc you have to reserve a time slot to go in when buying tickets online. Also, the sea life was beautiful and everything was clean. We all had a great time, and will definitely visit again.

We had a great experience, however I‚Äôm not sure it‚Äôs really worth the price for what you get. We took 5 kids ages 11, 9, 8, 3, and 10 months. There were several activities that piqued their interest, but we didn‚Äôt spend more than 1.5 hours there after paying so much. Our favorite part was where you could color a fish on the tablet and then see it appear on the screen. The kids all enjoyed the hurricane simulator. The gift shop was pretty reasonably priced!

Great exhibits with lots of fun activities. Fish/animals were active allowing you to see many if not most of them. Cool facts throughout with info screens about the fish in each exhibit. The rays in the ocean area were super active and one sat on top of the tunnel which is amazing! There was a sea turtle named Gertrude, which is the name of my cat and therefore she is a wonderful sea turtle. Lots of conservation emphasis which was cool to see as well!

Took our boys, 5 & 7 here for a short day trip.  Had a great time.  We got the kids in free and paid for 2 adults, you can pick up these coupons in local stores and restaurants, I would go without the coupons personally.  Great exhibits, my wife and I would definitely have spent more time if our kids hadn't been running from one thing to another.  I really enjoy the layout of the aquarium, one area where the aquarium viewing area is above your head.  Sharks, eels, many tropical fish, jellyfish, many stingrays, a touch pool where you can touch sea stars and other sea creatures.  They have a rescue sea turtle area but it was closed while we were there, this would be my only negative.  You have to enter at specific times since only so many people can be in the aquarium at once.

One visit here is enough.  There are lots of tanks with various sea life to see and some interactive areas but honestly this didn't excite my kiddos.  We only spent about 30 minutes here, making it pretty pricey for a family of 5.  Everything was clean and well kept and staff was friendly.  Some areas are open and roomy, others were tight little walk ways making it a tight squeeze for folks with strollers.  I'm glad we went to say we've been here but I wouldn't spend the money on a future visit.

Was a fun experience, although the aquarium is tailored as an educational experience for children. We went in expecting an any age experience as it is at Bass Pro Shop's Wonders of Wildlife Aquarium in Springfield, MO. We still had a great time and they apparently have discounted rates on Tuesdays if you have the flexibility to go then. Our two year old son had plenty to do and really enjoyed all of the various exhibits, we will have to get back when he is a bit older and has the ability to learn more about what he is looking at.
A great aquarium.  Very immersive.  A great place to visit with kids and families.  It's attached to the Lego Land as well.  There is a nice courtyard with a waterfall and a very nice mall as well.
I took my daughter here on a Monday morning. We both loved it. It's interactive, which is pretty cool. All in all, I enjoyed visiting.

This was cute but was in no way worth the $80 we paid ( two adults and one child) for the one hour visit. Had some neat exhibits but won‚Äôt be back...not worth it for the money. Next time we‚Äôll stick with union station or go the the Henry Doorley zoo in Omaha. Very disappointed.

Tucked inside Crown Center area is a cool little place, Sea Life! From sharks to jellyfish and everything in between, Sea Life has amazing visual aquatic entertainment that will be sure to captivate your adventure side as you explore the depths of the sea without even getting wet. You can touch the stingrays and climb through tunnels while interacting with the sea life. After the tour we strolled through the gift shop. One side was Sea Life, the other side Lego Land. We picked a couple items and headed up to one of the four cashiers who checked us out with ease and pleasantries. Surely a memory not to be to soon forgotten. A great family place, education, and enjoyment.

Fun and educational way to spend an hour or 2 with the kids. Fun for adults too. Get a year pass and it pays for itself after only a few visits. The tide pool os neat - they allow guests to touch star fish in a manner safe for the creatures.

Amazing aquarium. I visited this place with my mom. We both loved this place. There were so many kinds of species of aquatic animals. It was a huge place to see. We took pictures of each and every species. I just loved this place and its bluey ambiance. Must visit this tourist attraction.

Fun experience. The kids enjoyed it and thought it worth a second visit. The parents felt that other experiences warranted revisits moreso than Legoland. The Chattanooga Aquarium, Shelby Farms in Memphis, Ozone Falls in Ozone, TN, the City Museum in St. Louis, and others.

This was a great little aquarium, you can get through it and enjoy it in about 1 1/2 hours! Not overly big but not tiny. We enjoyed it and so did our boys! They had a touch tank and a very cool tunnel you can walk under and see all the fishy‚Äôs. We bought the ranger pack for $5 it‚Äôs a scavenger hunt and comes with collecting cards and a mini magnifying glass which works when you hold it up to the tank! Great experience!

This was a fun place to visit. There were only a handful of people visiting when we did and it took about 30 minutes to wander through for 2 adults. Definitely order tickets on their website instead of at the desk.. you'll save some money! We bought them via our phones next door and did will-call for pickup. Lots of curious sea life that were fun to check out and get up-close views of!

This aquarium is perfect for little kids. It isn't too large, so we are able to make it through before my little one starts losing interest. My kid loves the Lego "sand castle," and we always enjoy designing our own sea creature before leaving.
Had an awesome time at SEA LIFE Kansas City with family! The kids loved it (Adults too) Staff was knowledgeable and helpful. Easy to navigate and a wealth of knowledge to be gained, while you do!

Great place to visit at the Crown Center in Kansas City. Plan on spending about an hour as adults, 1.5-3 if with children. Educational information about all the creatures and on conservation yo preserve their habitats.
Although you can see everything in an hour, there were a lot to see. My kids enjoyed this aquarium very much and the activity at the end.

An educational and beautiful aquarium. Has a variety of different types of aquatic creatures and also provides so much knowledge about sea life conservation and the importance of protecting the ocean and animals within. Spent about two hours here. Enjoyed the experience very much.

Beautiful aquariums but my 4 year old was not interested in stopping to listen to me read about anything and kinda ran excitedly from one tank to the next. Only one person working there engaged with us to show him the teeth on a shark jaw bone. The person standing at the tank where you can touch starfish didn't say anything except "if you've rinsed your hands you can touch them gently with one finger." We spent $55+ for 30 minutes (not counting exiting through the gift shop $$ lol). Might be better for kids who can read and like learning about how to help sea turtles etc.

We had such a great day! So much to learn and it was so easy to find out what type of fish you were looking at cause they have it posted so we could search for the fish! Thank you what a great day! I got to touch a star fish, how amazing is that!
Great place to visit with the family. Take your time and enjoy each stop.
Pretty neat for a smaller aquarium! Took 2 kids, ages 2 and 5. They loved touching the starfish! Wish there were more interactive areas for toddlers though.

Being from Chicago, I'm used to the Shedd Aquarium layout, where there's no certain order to see stuff. But here, the exhibits are more laid out in a path. So something you might want to see could be at the very end.

Now, knowing Shedd in Chicago is its own building, it's understandable that maybe there wasn't as much room. From the looks of it, there's no place to eat, but there is Crown Center across the street.

Wonderful and animal life and very Educational. My kids loved the learning stations and earned a badge! The touch pools held my kids attention for ages and the staff was very friendly. We went during the week and the facility was not crowded at all. For a deal, buy combination ticket with Legoland.
This place was awesome! My children had so much fun!!
Awesome üòé Fair price! This place well educate adults and kids!!! It‚Äôs fascinating üßê for every age‚Ä¶
Great place for the kids and family we really enjoyed our visit.

I always have a wonderful time here ‚ù§Ô∏è I love the conservation message and the bright, beautiful tanks. It's always clean and the staff is SO friendly. My annual pass is up for renewal this month and I'll definitely be keeping it üòÅ
Absolutely beautiful display, great for all ages, especially for children! I highly recommend! Priced reasonably!
Smaller aquarium but friendly staff and kids had fun!

Compared to other Aquariums in larger metros/cities Sealife is mediocre.  The fish are beautiful and look healthy.  However it appear that one fish may have been to large for his display! (What do i know about fish).   Was a bit disappointed the military discount was $2off especially around the 4th of July.   However it was pretty cool to utilize the parking garage free!
Fun aquarium! Not too big and not too small. Love the new additions of sea turtles. Our 1yr old twins love it here.

If you go to Legoland Discovery first, you have to exit the facility to enter SeaLife. In the recent cold that was incredibly annoying and I wish we'd been told that beforehand. Aquarium is fine, a little small for the price but lots to do. Probably good for the 10 and under crowd

Our 1 year old loved watching fishies and since we went on a tuesday afternoon, he was able to run pretty much rampant. The staff was very informative and helped us enjoy our time there. The sea dragons are crazy looking, make sure you find them!
Great exhibits with super cool sealife. My kids had loads of fun. BTW did have fun too.

It‚Äôs a smaller aquarium but it‚Äôs very kid friendly AND SPECIAL NEEDS FRIENDLY (so hard to find special needs activities). We only did the aquarium side with included photos upon entry and you can take as many as you want. Definitely recommend if you‚Äôre sitting at home bored looking for something to do with the kids. The gift at the end of the dive hunt is only a sticker so don‚Äôt get the kids hopes too high on the ‚Äúfree gift‚Äù lol.

After reading the other reviews I almost didn't go, but I'm glad I did! It's not enormous, but I definitely wouldn't call it small. It's in the middle of the country. Why would you expect it to be the size of a coastal aquarium...? I found it to have a lot of interactive exhibits for kids. Only 1 exhibit I saw that you got to touch animals, but... water creatures don't want people touching them, so that seems fine to me. It's located right next to many other family friendly activities, meaning you could probably park and walk to a lot of other things while you were down there.
My only complaint would be the front desk staff didn't have very welcoming attitudes, but I didn't come to hang out with them anyways.

lots of learning points thoughout for the kids. tanks are extremely kid friendly! its a little pricy but considering how much it would cost to keep a saltwater tank in good health its worth it! will be taking the family back!!!
Cool place to check out. Cheap entertainment. Well worth the price for a visit.

I was a little sad that it wasn't more interactive.. they did have one room with starfish you could touch but that was it. My favorite was the aquarium with the sharks and Ray's that swim over your head.. they also had an aquarium you could walk on with clear glass for viewing under your feet but the glass was so cloudy you really couldn't see much
Went with my kids and grandkids.  Everyone loved it.  There are many interactive things to do! It was definitely one of the highlights of my trip to KC. You wont regret it.

Blown away by how it's set up and how many sea life critters they have. Wish it was lil bigger for the price but we all know why. The rays are the best in my opinion. There are stamping stations for the kids to stamp their packet thing. If all stamped, they get a tiny prize at the end. There is a cool coloring deal as the end. Digitally color in one of the critters, send It and it goes up on the projection on the wall with the rest in a VR under sea setting to "come to life". It is worth at least a one time visit.
I took my 6 year old daughter there and we had a blast the staff was very friendly and very helpful the sea animals were awesome.

Fun times there with my son over spring break. It wasn't busy at all but we were there right when it opened. The stamp activity was a lot of fun, my son really liked finding all the stampers to complete the sheet. A good amount of animals and the way it's laid out makes for a pretty smooth walkthrough.

We had a wonderful time exploring Sea Life Kansas City for family fun day. The exhibits are great and the whole experience was a big hit with the kiddo, especially being able to touch the starfish, as well as the ocean tunnel.

The place was so user friendly for families and parents. Lots of benches on the journey through "Sea Life", lol.  I liked the interactive touch screens for information on the fish. My 3yr old was engaged non stop! The gift shop was reasonably priced. And lots of photo opps along the way as well!
Very fun and lots of interactive stuff for my girls. The mission pack with extra activities was worth the extra $5.
It was a fun, but rather short exhibit. I did enjoy it, and staff was super nice. Loved the sea life.

The fun facts were very interesting.  There were online tickets for a reduced rate, and the exhibits had really cool fish. My mom and I did the hurricane booth at the end and it was so much fun! And with it being next to Crown Center, will definitely  be back with my niece.
Great place to bring my mini to see. Loved all the fish and the tunnel under the sharks was her favorite place in it.
Amazing trip! Not as large as many other aquariums but it was still neat to see, and close to other attractions like Union Station and Crown Center.
Kinda small for the price, but they have a good variety. My kid loved all the tunnels to crawl in, the touchscreen information panels and color your own fish that swims onto a big screen activity.
Very cool aquarium to visit, especially for a family. Has some neat fish of many different varieties.

What a fun aquarium! Definitely a must-see in Kansas City. A much better value than its neighbor, Legoland and more fun. The combined gift shop is really nice, but may have to wait in the photo line for awhile. Don't wear green, or your pictures won't turn out!
Great price, especially if you pre purchase tickets. Kids 7, 11 and 14 all enjoyed it. It only took us about an hour and a half to go through the whole aquarium.

Great place for the kids to have fun and play. Highly recommend to do legoland first cause kids will already be worn out after that (in a good way) they have close encounters for the kids as well so AMAZING fun for them.
The fish were beautiful. Wish there were more different kinds like bigger sharks or other marine life to make the experience even better!
It was real nice. Our older kids loved Sea Life. And the younger kids loved Leggo Land. Good family time.
Pretty neat place! It's great for many ages, lots of interaction opportunities and quite a few unique exhibits I haven't seen elsewhere. Don't just blow through it. Take your time.

Fun for the kids, doesn't take long to walk through unless it's crowded. On weekends it can be very crowded. My little guy is obsessed with fish so this was like heaven on Earth for him. Sometimes I wonder if the kids think they are looking at giant TV's rather than fish tanks though. Make sure you wash your hands after touching the searays!

Sea life is just great, the kids absolutely love the place. You can bundle in tickets for Lego land but I would only recommend this if your kids are older. Any kid under 5 might have a hard time there, my 3 year old wasn't quite old enough and hated that part. But she absolutely loved sea life.
Great experience! Staff is very friendly and you actually get to touch a starfish! Our 2 year old loved it.
Very nice aquarium! Fun for kids and adults! Great gift shop
This is a beautiful field trip for the less fortunate and they let you touch animals. The sea turtle exhibit is great information on how we can help save our sea animals.
Small but very fun place! My 2yo really enjoyed it.
I loved the stamp brochure for the kids to do while walking through. The bubble glass for the kids and adults to look through was amazing. We had a great time doing that.
Very cool place nice clean tanks and big variety of sea animals. Reasonable prices. Free parking on the weekends. Fountain shows every half hour and lots of tables with metal umbrellas for shade.
Cleanest Aquarium we've been to yet!  Lots of displays & interactive play for kids of all ages!  Loved it!
I loved this one great for kids and lots of fun facts and fish of all kind
Must see! Self-guided tour, leisurely meander through. Stop and enjoy all there is to offer! Will definitely be back!
A little bit too expensive for what it was it didn't have that much. It was a little bit disorganized the gift shop wasn't set up very crowded. But what it was there was good not awesome but good.
Kind of expensive for what amounts to about an hour of fun. But you can save money by buying tickets online. Overall it was really cool though. I‚Äôll probably go back at some point.
Highly recommend you try this! The kids loved the lights and fish. I loved seeing the turtles and hubby enjoyed the sharks. SO cool!
Better than expected. My older teen kids enjoyed it as well.  I enjoyed the variety and the well designed habitats. I would go again.
It was crowded, but overall a nice gander. Worth stopping by, but wouldn't make it a trip or a whole trip at least.
Our whole family loved it. Beautiful sea life and a chance to see the very rare and endangered Sea dragons.

A wonderful day to bring my children and granddaughter there! Many different things like the tidal pool, there was also a petting pool (just don't pick the animals up). No flash photography because it disturbs the fish. The male octopus was a very intelligent fella! My granddaughter loved the seahorses display.
Pretty neat! The prize at the end is a sticker if you stamp all of the stations :) pretty exciting for a toddler but not for an adult. Size is good for a little one, not in there too long.

Not a very large place, but for being in a city it's not bad for a indoor aquarium. Kids will like it, and parents can easily keep an eye on their children. I would say visit at least once if you get the chance.
Wonderful afternoon attraction. Good integration of technology. Not busy on vetereans day. Cool creatures as well as as hands on activites. Great for the whole family!
Great learning experience for kids and adults. Very informative and a lot of fun too.

Fantastic exhibit for young kids. Great hands on sea life display and great large walk through tank for such a small space. If you have Friends of the Zoo card from the KC Zoo you get 50% off your tickets. Well worth going.

I loved exploring the sea life here. They had an amazing display. They breed sea horses and nurse sea turtles back to life. I loved that you could create your own fish and they would display it in a projected tank on the walk. They give you a guide book in the beginning, which helps make the experience even more interactive. This is a MUST see when you visit KC.

Very nice staff. For an attraction during covid-19 I was happy to see the requirement of masks and distancing. The young man working at 1pm 8/1/20 in the starfish area was very friendly and knowledgeable!!
Nice aquarium! Loved all of the sea life. The kids loved it!
Such an awesome aquarium. Got into town early just to have time to go here.  Great for my 14 year old and toddler.
They had a great variety of different sea creatures. The tanks were decorated nicely to compliment the fish. However the aquarium in general was small so make sure to take your time.
Fantastic place to visit!
I could spend all day at the octopus tank, theyre active, beautiful i love this place! Worth every penny!! A must see in kansas
About 30-45 minutes. Walk around see fish in aquarium. Good to bring kids under 10
Very nice place, not to big and my 6 year old son loved it.

My boyfriend and I were stoked initially to see this place on our vacation. I bought tickets online. However, once there we felt we were about 20 years too old. This is definitely geared towards the smaller kids: toddlers thru maybe 9 years old. I paid $46 and we finished walking through the place in about 30 min. I wasn't expecting Shedd's aquarium but I definitely was left disappointed!

It's small. Only smaller animal exhibits.  Obviously designed with kids in mind.  But over all it's a very pretty little aquarium. Buy tickets online to get the 5 dollars off, you'll be happier about what you get for the price.

Thought sea life was nice but small place. Still a nice experience and nice to see some of the sea life. Not much interaction opportunity for children though. There was 1 tank and the animals were too far for kids to reach and staff wasn't willing to move any of them. Mostly starfish and sea urchins.

But still interesting.
Super fun time to take kiddos and explore the under the sea life. Big variety of ocean animals, and touching starfish was cool.
Really enjoyed my time here. Had fun seeing the sea life. Very beautiful.
My 2 year old loved it. It was slow when we went, but it was a great experience and while a little pricey, definitly worth the money and it goes to a good organization.
a good aquarium. I have been to better but I would still go to this one if I come back in town. It was clean, well paced, and an easy stroll.
Tool my 4 month old and she loved it! All the moving fun colors of fish she couldn't take her eyes off of.

Price is too high for what you get, but it other than price it was a nice aquarium. They have a lot of different sea life but not all the screen worked at all the tanks so you couldn't find out what some of the fish were.

Great family fun for all ages!! Must see if you're in the area!! üêüüê†üê°üêôüêöü¶Ä
