I like the idea of being admitted in specific time slots for when you purchase your ticket in theory. However in practice, it's a mess. There are major lines, no one is six feet apart, and it seems like it self defeats the purpose of what safety they are trying to establish in the first place. No clear signage or division of lines for pre-purchased tickets vs day of purchases. And just one cashier trying to handle so many visitors! She did great, just seemed way understaffed for the visitation level.

The aquarium was underwhelming for the cost of entry. They have beautiful tanks and exhibits, but it only takes about 40 minutes to walk through the whole thing. The tunnel is VERY cool. I wanted there to be far more than what I saw. A very small aquarium, definitely targeted towards young families vs. all age friendly. Best part of the whole place was Dr. Steve, the touch tank guide. Kind, informative, and a joy to talk to.

This is a great place for young and old alike! There is also a touch tank!

Great job!
incredible aquarium.  Amazing walk through aquariums.  It's really expensive but once you are in it, you know why.  I will go back.

I want to give major kudos to the Sea Life staff today.  My youngest daughter is in a wheelchair and we're used to telling her about things that she can't see or do because attractions aren't wheelchair height, but not today!  The staff put two starfish in a bucket and came around so that she could touch them!!!  I can't tell you how much of an impact this had on our day.       Most of the aquarium is great height for wheelchairs.  Thanks sea life for such a great experience for our whole family today!

Certain games, like the ones where you push the coins over the edge, have lower ticket payouts that anywhere else that I have seen those same games. You don't get as many plays for the money you put in either. Strong meh on that front.

Came upon this place walking around Coronado Center as I hadn‚Äôt been there in a couple of years. What a surprise!

I love arcades, and this one blew my mind. A lot of the games are the Japanese versions which is amazing to find, especially in The Land of Enchantment.

I love claw machines(the more challenging the better), and this place has TONS of them.

I purchased a $40 card and after a few arcade tries I went to try a claw.

After about 10 tries my card ran out of money, and I went to go re-load it. While I was gone, the progress that I had made on the item in the machine was re-set by a worker, which led me to a mini-freakout.

Luckily, he saw me and apologized, opened the machine and placed the item back where it was and let me continue. After about six more tries, I won! The key with the Japanese claw machines is PATIENCE.

I hd a wonderful time at this place, and will definitely be back.

My son loves it.

Website was misleading! Drove down just for a family outing, according to the website the unlimited pass was $19.94. I brought 8, and was told this special must be purchased in advance, and used between 5/1 & 6/1/19, no exceptions. The male employee ails started, he'd had a few customers the day before who wanted the discount as well, and he had to figure out how to get to the page that states it's online only! Having a large family, attending these establishments is difficult, not affordable, and discouraging when these discounts are misrepresenting the company without clicking farther into the website. Purchased the packs this time, but will not be doing this again in the future!

I liked Hinkle because of the Go-Karts and the Lazer Tag. Basically, those are the two main attractions. As for price, it is a bit expensive for the limited variety of stuff to do, and the all day ride pass doesn't include any of the arcade games that make up half of each facility. It really peeves me how much they govern the Go-Karts, they are great and full of potential, but nobody is allowed to use that full potential. The track is more than big enough to allow the riders to go a bit faster, and honestly it is kinda boring unless you are in a grouped up few cars and it is a true race. I think it would be good for business if you guys implimented an 8 car race of ungoverned Karts, only for people over 16 with a valid license, every hour or so. It would also be good to have a more competitive style of Lazer Tag, rather than the typical "everyone goes to their team, then when it starts we all basically go to each other's base and destroy it and its pretty much whoever kills it the most wins, very sub par."

However, some of the games were maybe to smart for me.

The food was surprisingly good!
As well as the mixed drinks, when you need a break from the activities.

*Update*   we have been here twice now...food and drinks are awesome!!

Craig "The Viking Bartender: (I named him that) is the best bartender I ever met. Ask him to surprise you...you won't be disappointed

This place is pretty big. There is a lot of room to run and play. The reason I gave 4 stars is because there is not a lot of games but the games that are there have a lot of space to work in. My hope is that the more people go the quicker they can grow. Prices are reasonable for different age groups, I feel. I was not excited that they were out of some food and drinks that we wanted but I guess that is a nation wide issue.

Had an amazing time here attending a show. Security was good everything went fast getting our ids checked and tickets scanned. Inside it was a joy to see so much color and how many rooms were interactive and immersive. My favorite part was the dance floor that made colors when you stepped on it.

Very cool concept!!  Lots of fun for the family.  For some of the games, you really need to be in shape to play!  The only thing that bothered me was that most of the games didn't have designated lines to wait in; people would just stand around it, so you kinda had to know whose turn was next.  And of course this means that some people cut their turn because they're not paying attention to everyone else who is there.

It was fun for about a d hour or so with teens, the games if they changed a little quicker it might keep their attention a little longer. The price was reasonable but not sure we would go back without some kind of discount.  Had too high if expectations

I had a blast! I wanted to attend drag brunch for my birthday and Im so glad I picked this show! The team at electric playhouse was so accommodating when my dad surprised me that weekend and came in town.  They added a seat to my table for him so i got to celebrate with my whole family. Im so grateful for this experience. All the queens were amazing and Vanessa Patricks is such a talented host! I will def be coming back!
It was fun the kids had a blast I definitely  thought it be more for the price the kids enjoyed it tho need an option for the parents who just want to let their kids play
Really enjoyed the Georgia O'Keeffe exhibit.  Love the immersive, interactive presentations.  Such an incredible way to expose people to an artists work.

They need more interactive games that more people can just jump in and play.
Other than that this was a very fun and interactive physical video game activity.

My family visited Electric Playhouse on a Sunday afternoon. Everyone enjoyed the interactive games, especially our 6 year old. It wasn't too crowded, so we didn't feel rushed or have to wait for anything longer than 5 minutes. The cafe is right in the center of all the action. A unique experience in Albuquerque!

This was our first time there and it looks like a pretty interesting venue
We saw the Georgia O'Keeffe experience and it was pretty cool
Amazing! So interactive and entertaining. Will definitely visit again!

So much fun. Birthday parties, casual dinners, happy hour, kid activities. It checks all the boxes. Go. You won't be disappointed.

Update: Went back for a local children's theater production. Such a cool place to do one! Interactive and emersive. They had cute themed drinks (both kids and adults!)
First time there, we had a Blast.

Very interactive and fun. Went to the soft opening and the place is not completely full. Great place for families and friends. There's food and drinks in the vacinity but didn't try it on this visit. Been told that there will be "adult hours" on the weekends after 9pm with live music and DJ's. A bit pricey but worth it

Firstly, they offer a 10% military discount ask for it at the door. It is a digital Meow Wolf style experience with food, bar and live DJ. The space provides an interactive digital entertainment for the whole family, first date, or friends. It can be very fun but I could imagine with a lot of people it could make for a busy experience with lines or frustration attempting to use an exhibit.
Most exhibits are like playing a VR game such as Beat Saber or a VR style Atari Pong while others are interactive or viewable digital art that continuously changes. A very unique experience. I did not try the food or drinks so I cannot speak to their quality or pricing but the main attraction here is the digital environment. Would definitely check out if in the Albuquerque area.
