Attended a birthday party here. It was fun. But it‚Äôs honestly kind of boring here. Not a lot to do. The party was fun because it was with friends not because of the venue. It has a lot of potential. They just need more to do here.
I took my staff of 7 for a team building event. The food, drinks, fun, and hospitality were great! The staff was helpful and pleasant. We will definitely be back‚ù£Ô∏è

It was better than I expected! We had some food and mixed drinks while my son entertained himself then we all joined him and visited all the different rooms and games. It's a great addition to Albuquerque entertainment. I definitely would like to go back sometime.
Fun place for music events and dancing. 4 star because they removed the water stations which is really important when your dancing all night. Needs to serve food for late night shows.

This was a very fun place to visit with our children. We all had a blast as this is a very interactive experience and loved playing all of the games that they have. We did not know that they have the ability to change the games up on the bigger screens until we asked. This would have been nice to know ahead of time so that we could experience them all, but it was still worth it.

Revisited after an almost 18-month hiatus. The place is still awesome with good options to play for all ages. We ordered three large pizzas and each one of them was very high-quality and super fresh, kudos to the chef and staff, who were very friendly.

super fun space!!
the kids loved it.
the wedge salad is soooo fricken good.
went for opening night and it was extra fun with the Dj.

so easy off the freeway.
i was a bit worried when i hear it was on the west side but it's easier than most places in ABQ to get to.
excited to see how their space grows and evolves.

would be a rad spot for pop up spin classes or group fitness classes.....for fund raisers or just fun followed but food and cold beverages.

cool to see fun new stuff in ABQ.

The employees are nice, and they also walk you through how to do the games there. It's super hands on and there's lots of running. They also have courtesy water for when you get thirsty or tired. super pretty too :)
Really fun...kind of wish they had more rooms but what they do have is really fun! Next time we will try the bar/restaurant.
Wonderful lunch experience with interactive graphics and fabulous food

Kids and teens had fun, but everyone was expecting a little bit more to do. The best part was an interactive space invaders game where you threw balls at the monsters. Best for younger kids (grade schoolers, not toddlers) but enjoyable by teens and adults for a shorter amount of time (maybe about an hour).

A review from someone that dose not know the owner. This place has five active areas. Is it for teens, well 50.00 for 10 minutes was not quite what we expected. The areas have no supervision, lots of kids 5-10 just Running around and not letting other kids play. The food was 2 star food and was not inexpensive.
There could be potential for the place, unfortunately we did see most people walking out as fast as we did. I wish them nothing but good luck in Albuquerque.

Quality for the price is. 3/5 star. Recently had the pleasure of visiting the Electric Playhouse for their grand opening and attended the interactive dinner. It was a 5 course, $55 dinner or $75 with wine pairing experience. I got the wine pairing. The main disappointments were (1) the video advertisement for the dinner was much more beautiful than it was in real life. I expected butterflies to be fluttering across the table; at most the animation would vibrate slightly when I held out my hand. (2) The food was inedible, but I may be the only person at the table who thought so as all around me guests WoWed and marveled at their dishes. The first dish was an amuse bouche with salmon and that was a flaky pastry that was at best just okay. The second course was a soggy tamale. However the green-yellow sauce that garnished the dish was delicious. Someone in that kitchen knows how to pair sauces or the tamale was so underwhelming that the sauce stole the show. Next dish was a earthy mushroom and meatballs dish. When they brought it out, it smelled amazing. Like I was in a Siberian forest picking fresh mushrooms. But the meatballs were 2 different types of meat and quite salty. Overall just okay. Then came the steak, I believe, with a biscuit on the side. I could have broken a tooth on that biscuit and the steak had enough sodium content to last me a week. Very salty. Inedible. People next to me, however, raved that it was the best food I ever had! Unbelievable! The desert was fair, it was fruity and light. Thank goodness there was all that wine to drink as I barely touched my $75 dinner. In the future, I would return once the kinks are out, and I'd order the meal vegetarian to get something fresh on my plate.
It's a pretty cool place overall. Came expecting meow wolf but it was more like an arcade with large scale games. Very cool and great for taking pics for insta.
Is a nice place but need more games after 30 minutes i wanna go home. But I liked
Lots of play space for all ages, a restaurant, full bar, and clean restrooms! What more can you want?

Super cool unique space that caters to many different demographics from couples, to groups, to kids birthday parties, to corporate team building. Obviously the game area was a blast to did something different and was surprisingly physical, but the best part was the interactive dinners. Good drinks and wine selections, and fun to be interactive with your table and be apart of the story line.
Cool place. The whole thing is interactive, and you can spend 1 hour or more playing. My kids loved it.
Lots of fun!! Interactive & exciting. Great for everyone.
Such a fun place! Great place for a corporate or organizational event.

My kids wife and I just loved this place. It was are first time here. And the staff was great. They changed games in the rooms so my kids were constantly doing new games. So much fun. I will definitely go back. Worth every penny.

Tons of fun. Myself MY WIFE and my kids had a BLAST!!!
HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Great concept... Immersive Dining Experience has a bit to improve upon.  Descriptions of courses and pairings would be a nice touch.  The way the light show and courses correspond to one another would be interesting.  The actual "theme" of the dinner would be helpful, as it corresponds to the ingredients of the courses.
Otherwise... it's definitely different than anything else in Albuquerque.   Think Meow Wolf meets Vernon's meets an acid trip.  Totally cool and worth the night out, but still very young in the process and can use a little tweaking.
This weekend was my first time here. I loved it! If you love immersive art installations like myself, this is the spot!

Omg I will absolutely 100% recommend to any and everyone. Great fun for literally everyone in the family. At first I was hesitant and thought it might give my older two a sensory overload due to their Asperger's and ADHD but no everybody had such a we had no meltdowns no fits I was actually able to allow all three of my sons to just run and play without any worries. the two-year-old is a-typical and then my oldest too my oldest has Asperger's in my middle son has ADHD and all three of them -(Mommy too üòÇ) had a blast.
Albuquerque needs more family friendly entertainment venues like this. We had a blast playing with the different light games. Hopefully they keep them fresh and updated often.
A small space that packs interactive activities for family enjoyment.   Great for all ages.
Be prepared to drink lots of water! This place is super fun, and it's a work out!
Got sick from the food but it is a cool place to have fun

Review is for soft opening:
The place is amazing, there really is not anything like this except Meow Wolf. The hosts were very kind and understanding.

We went at 7 Pm on a rainy day and it still was uncomfortably hot. Also there were only like 6 interactive experiences at the time we went. This is too few, hopefully they open a lot more for the full opening.
"Best bday party EVER!" -12 year olds and their parents
Very nice place something new for Albuquerque.   Got something to eat out server culan was Awsome
Fun place to take family
This place was SO cool. Really cool interactive experience. Cool meeting rooms for parties or meetings.
Had so much fun! Definitely recommend for all ages!
Had a blast here!

Best $15 for 2 hours I have spent. You would suppose it's not enough time but with all the activities available and the physical activity, it's more than enough. Restaurant and bar available inside, all delicious and well priced. Definitely will be returning.

My first impression walking up was not good. However, not judging a book by its cover, I came in for a birthday party my 8yr old son was invited to. The facility was very crowded but the staff were trying their hardest to accommodate everyone. I don‚Äôt fault staff for that, I would rather them try to help rather than not care.

The pool area is fun for kids of all ages. I saw plenty of every age. The ONLY negative thing I would say is that it is extremely hot and humid inside. There was at least one 6ft tall fan blowing from one side which was nice but it‚Äôs only local air movement.

Overall I am/was impressed and would recommend this place to others. The air circulation or lack of is the only reason I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars.

Very nice clean facility. The front desk was kind and went over the pool rules. The lifeguards watch closely and blow their whistle when needed. It felt like a safe environment. I‚Äôve been looking for a place like this that is close to us. We‚Äôll for sure be coming back.

We all love our retro arcade games and this place keeps them in top shape for everyone to come back again and again!

Whether you want to go to the bar with great local/ regional selections and a chill atmosphere, you want to take the kids someplace affordable to play games (not having to worry about the dreaded prize cabinet) or you just want to take time and REALLY work on your pinball or battle game skills... This place is for you! We love to bring guests or friends here for a night out or just kill some time affordably.

The only things we'd probably improve is the appetizer/ snack offerings to be more kid friendly on weekends, to have an awesome loyalty / membership or 'reserve a machine' type of program (members only early opening or play time would be sweet) and a better window covering near the pinball machines to reduce glare during the day (or move them in the back again/ get a bigger place)...
Otherwise it's STILL one of our favorites!
Love this franchise. I've been to three so far and nothing but awesomeness ensues. Old school as well as some new video games plus pinballs galore, good drinks, and food. Keep it up, FP!

I hosted a grown up party here and it was a huge hit! Gayle was very prompt about answering me with what she needed and what to expect. The staff had the food ready when I asked and it was delicious! The food may sound like ‚Äúarcade‚Äù food, but it was actually really really good and so beautifully presented! I highly recommend hosting events here.

I really like this setup. We went here for our work party and the person that set it up said it was very inexpensive. I don't know the exact price but I thought she said it was around $10 per table and then approx $5 per person and it's unlimited free play. You're given a wristband that will show you paid and then you can go in and out as you please.

The arcade is large and it's mainly games from the 80s. There were even games I'd never seen or heard of. The atmosphere was good and the food they served was very good. You also get 2 tickets for 2 free drinks. This is a good find for large group activities.

Very Fun nostalgic games from 80's & 90's.. If you love older games & remember how to play them , this little arcade is for you.. It is $11 for hours of free fun on every game.  Plus they have a small but affordable option for food & adult beverages..

Best throw back arcade in the metroplex if not the best arcade I've ever visited.  $11 gives you unlimited free game play. All the best games from the 80s and 90s are here and more importantly they were all in great working order.  This place even won two awards from the 2019 Observer - Best Retro Arcade in Dallas AND Best Beer Selection in Dallas!
Fun place for drinks, games, and social times with friends. Bartenders are super polite n respectful and patient haha. The pinball machines might be my favorite!

I took my 17 year old Son and his friends here for his birthday. It was my first time there and it will not be my last! I felt like a kid again. We were there from 3pm until 9pm and had a blast! Friendly staff and great games!

Awesome place, awesome games, great staff, good beers. Also, they have a cabinet called DeathBall that is like 8 bit Rocket League. It's super addicting and after playing I looked it up and there are only 8 cabinets in the world! Try it while you are there!

For $10 you get access to tons of arcade and pinball machines both old and... Newer.

Most of the machines are in very good conditions and often work well. The drink prices are fair and the food is decent enough (though there are lots of cheaper fast food options nearby).

Still, $4 for a bottle of Bluemoon is not bad at all! Go check them out!

My work involves a lot of travel and I‚Äôve been fortunate to visit multiple arcades around the world, including Japan. I‚Äôd easily rank the four Free Play locations in the DFW metro area collectively as the best arcades I‚Äôve visited in the United States. In fact, I think the fact they routinely acquire new games and swap out machines on the floor gives them an advantage over the few remaining retro Japanese arcades.

In short, THIS is how you do an arcade right. I hate the term ‚Äúbarcade‚Äù but I suppose this is one in the sense they have an impressive bar and kitchen on site. That said, unlike almost every other self-styled barcade I‚Äôve visited, the drinks and food complement the games rather than serve as the primary attraction.

What sets Free Play apart is the diversity and rarity of its games. These feature some true gems on original hardware that go well beyond the dime-a-dozen Pac-Man and Centipede cabs found elsewhere. For example, the Richardson location (at the time of this writing) has an ultra-rare Planet Harriers, an Atomiswave running Dolphin Blue, the first Beast Busters, Do Don Pachi, Power Stone 2, and the original Marvel Vs. Capcom‚Ä¶to name just a few. I‚Äôm not really into pinball but there are quite a few of those machines on the floor too.

Whether you‚Äôre a serious arcade enthusiast or just a casual player who wants an afternoon with your kids, I can‚Äôt recommend Free Play enough.

Loved this place from the minute I walked in. Total retro arcade vibes, GREAT service from the staff, and LOVE the games within the games ie Street Fighter tournament, random game challenges throughout the evening. Good times & good vibes all around!
$12 entrance fee and all the games are free to play. Lots of fun and a solid collection of games. Dos Equis were $2 a pop too!

Great fun for an older visitor who remembers these games from their original deployment in the 1980's.  Weekend crowds are much younger and packed more densely. Great for business but not for older parties who want a more relaxed gaming visit.  Advice: go earlier in the day and you'll enjoy it more. Great selection of beers, drinks, and snacks.  Huge assortment of 1st generation arcade hardware often rotated out to put different units on the floor.  Great concept very well executed by the owners.

Suprising good Cuban sandwich. The arcade games are pretty good too ;) Jokes aside, one of the most authentic and well maintained arcade bars in D/FW.

Not as big as their Arlington location. WAY BIGGER than their Denton location. One of my favorite haunts.

Every single time I've been here, it's been a blast! The staff is friendly, the food is delicious, and the games are well maintained! If you haven't been, do yourself a favor and come! Weekdays tend to be less crowded and you'll have your pick of the games. Their selection of craft beer is amazing too.

Tons of great games! Lots of classics including Centipede and PacMan. Fantastic place to go if you want classic fun without kids when they shut it down for minors at night. Careful of the tables, some of them tilt kinda easy and we spilled our drinks. It's got a decent bartender but they dont have a big selection. That's really not so bad though because they do have at least a good local brew list. If you've got 10 bucks and nothing to do, I highly recommend it.
Great beers and great games. Tons of craft beers at great prices $4 to $8! Didn't try the food but it smelled really good. Pretty packed on a Saturday. Limited seating.

Lots of fun, tons of classic arcade games, pinball machines, and sit down games. They rotate in different games every now and then, and have all the old classics. They also have a small snack bar area with craft beers. Highly recommended place for anyone from the 70s, 80s, or early 90s that played games growing up.
This arcade is absolutely a fun Time. I totally recommend it.
Great concept! Excellent selection of beer. I'm making this a regular hangout for myself, co-workers, and friends. My kids also love this place.
Cool place to take the kids & to remember your video game nostalgia as an adult.

We had so much fun at Free Play. The drinks are reasonably priced, lots of food options, and all the retro games we missed playing from when we were kids. Arcade games really are more fun than consoles. This is a great place to spend a few hours and not spend a fortune.
So many arcade games! And a bar for drinkers.
Phenomenal fun and reasonably priced. Beer and cocktails for the adults. Food and soft drinks for everyone. A great time for every arcade enthusiast (and their partner).

My family and I had such a great time! Its affordable and my kids loved playing all the vintage games! All the games were original and in perfect working condition. It was clean and everyone was very friendly!
Such a fun place to spend the afternoon with friends. Great selection of the most popular early video games and a great beer selection at the bar, plus other cocktails.
Been going every Sunday since February,  brought the family and nieces about 3 weeks ago and my dad loves the Qix & marble madness games.

Went there with a training class from my company and had a great time. This place is definitely more for the adults and those feeling nostalgic. Eighties music playing in the background. Amazingly friendly staff even when I was waiting by myself for my ride to get me. May be a date night for myself and the misses.
Such a great atmosphere! Love all the retro arcade games. They sure know how to throw a party!

Everything I thought it would be. All the games are very well kept and while it can be crowded, it actually adds to the environment. Also their drink selection is fantastic. Definitely coming back in the future!

Fantastic place to get together with some buds and play some classic games.

Best part as the name suggests all the games are set to free play and entry to get in is only a mere $10.
Been here twice in as many days, heck of a spot. All the classic games! Staff is awesome, and the beer selection would put most regular bars to shame. A must see!

It's half off if you go during the week in the first hour. That's 5 bucks and you leave and come back as long as you keep the wristband on. The have all old school games visiting here like original super Mario or Micheal Jackson's moonwalker.
Lots of good games, some hilarious Japanese imported games too.
Great deal! Not too expensive and it gives kids something to do.

Been to Free Play at least 10 times.  This time was for a birthday, and it was an awesome venue for our gathering.  We love this place, they have a great selection of craft beer, good food, and tons of great games.
Love it ....$10 and some change to be able to play .....lots of old school games
Great and unique beer selection. Solid games and selection. Great staff.
I love this place! The food is great, the staff is awesome, and the games are kept in incredibly good condition!
Good vibe, love the retro feel.  Good craft beer selection, well mantained machines, plus new ones hidden in for good measure.
I've been twice and both times have been impressed by the variety of games and the friendliness of the folks working. Sometimes a little crowded but then you just make me friends!
Perfect for family time. Lots of original 80's video games, plus food and beer too!
This place has a great selection of classic arcade games. No coins. Flat fee play whatever you want. The kids love it
Cool place with good music. They have a good selection of games.

Great place to hang and play some classics. My son had a great time too. We got there kinda late so we didn't get to stay long due to them moving to 18+ at 9pm. Definitely need to come back and enjoy the bar and snacks.

Beer and broken glass on the floors. The bathrooms were pretty gross. But, they do have an impressive beer/ipa beer list. It was fun walking around seeing all the games they had. The majority of them all functioned as they should. It‚Äôs a cool place to check out.
Love this place. Food and drinks are great, could be cheaper but it's well worth it for the atmosphere and games
Classic games, great beer selection, and delicious food

Just found out about this place and explored it with my girlfriend. Was an awesome place! Great games, friendly staff, and even for it being as busy as it was, next to no wait time for games. We played everything we wanted to with issues. Beers were at an acceptable price. Didnt try the food but will next time. All in all, great place and we will return,  with or without kiddos. XD

My husband and I held our wedding as a private event at FreePlay and we simply can not say how amazing the location is! From the staff to the game variety our day was absolutely perfect. We are fans of their fair prices, amazing beer variety, fun little pizzas and overall atmosphere FreePlay provides. Gayle was so very helpful in answering all of our questions and making our special day just perfect!
We came here originally as a birthday surprise for his 30th and we are addicted!

Great place. Going there again.
Great for work event or date night
Went for my birthday. Everyone stayed entertained, adults as well as kids. Made my day!
They have a great selection of both new and old arcade games.
No place like this. I don't go often, but when i take the kids, the place is always cool for all ages.
Fun! Employees are fun and amazing. We had a great time
Not a bad selection of games and a great selection of beer.
So much fun!  Great place to spend some time playing games. Look forward to my return trip.
Really fun, but can get really crowded.
Great place for vintage arcade games. Takes me back to the 70s, 80s, and 90s. When video games were FUN.
My family loves this place!
Thanks for the great service and all the great games to play! I wish they had zaxxon though üòÜ
What A Great Idea! Adult beverages & Throwback Video Games! I had a blast.
Great arcade and well maintained.  Rare machines there including Funhouse by Williams.
It was great fun got to play many cabinets I haven't seen in years!
Great place to go unwind and just have some classic arcade fun!
Fun and super friendly staff.
Cool spot
I enjoyed myself there
We love this place!
Good time.

Owner should fire this dude. No knowledge of the 80 or the Nostalgia. I had a few questions  about tournaments high score etc. Seemed like his iphone was more important. And look how hard working he is..lol  on his iPhone Other than that this place ROCKS.

The museum was extremely well done. The exhibits were nicely displayed and pretty self-explanatory, but there were employees, including Jerry, one of the original excavators, walking around telling stories, and pointing out details the signage didn't tell.  That was probably my favorite part. It took us about 2 hours to go through the entire museum.  The price is very reasonable, and definitely worth it.  Made a great homeschool field trip.

Absolutely amazing collection! What a lot of work restoring all the items that went down with the ship. A true glimpse of the past way of life. Met Dave who actually found the ship
He is a wealth of info on all the items and back story as well. Very reasonable admission, don't skip this one! A gem!!

HISTORY BROUGHT TO LIFE!!!
üö¢üö¢üö¢üö¢

Incredible collection and beautifully explained history of the Arabia.
If you are visiting or are a local, this is a MUST stop experience.
Restrooms available before you enter and during the tour.
Employees are meandering around to explain bits and stations. They were very welcoming.

Very interesting to learn about the sinking and then re-discovery of this steam ship. Plenty to read and look at. Actual parts of the ship as well as the cargo(and there A LOT)
You can just stroll through at your own pace. This could take several hours depending on how much you want to stop and read the signage. We took a little over an hour but we had to pay for parking so we went through quickly. If you go to the "center lot" parking is free.

This was fantastic, staff are very informative and very friendly. This was a wonderful experience and can‚Äôt wait to watch the next dig live! Great collection can‚Äôt believe the quality of the collection of artifacts! Have to stop and see this when you‚Äôre in Kansas City! Awesome
I love this museum. Lots of history and got to talk with one of the family members that did the excavation. They still have a lot to preserve and put out especially clothes. The videos are great too

This is an absolute gem for Kansas City, rich with both local and national historical significance. Not only does this well preserved collection share incredible insight of American frontier life prior to the Civil War, but guests are treated to an incredible story of how 5 average individuals and their families banded together to accomplish the unbelievable. The gift shop is a little hokey, but the real treasures are in the museum beyond.
What an absolutely amazing experience! This was an incredible museum, thoughtfully laid out and extremely informative. The whole time was just one big WOW! Would definitely recommend!!!!

The museum had many stages with monitors that show clips of a boat wreck story the museum portrays. The walk is about an hour-and-a-half and the tour is said to be the length of a football field (even though it doesn‚Äôt seem like it.) The large water wheel in the entrance is entirely displayed once you go down to the lower level of the museum, which is impressive. The wooden floors will give you the feeling of being inside an old-fashioned steam boat as it creaks and moves in a fragile state. They really did try to make an average boat wreck seem  like the wreck of the century, but I only really just saw average household & local shop items. The engine parts and excavation process was more interesting than the artifacts and that's just my opinion. There are about 2 staff members that are available to answer any questions about the tour and the . It‚Äôs not as lively, they can work on being more involved with the visitors. All-in-all, the museum was detailed and informative, not the most exciting though. They get a 3.5 from me.

So many artifacts from this sunken steamboat! It's a fascinating window into a slice of life in the 1850s. Very cool to see the preservation work continuing. The self-paced tour begins with four stations that each play ~5-minute videos, then there's a longer video in a theater, then free range exploration of the rest of the museum. All of the videos are optional, or you can go back, if you just want to skip ahead to see the exhibits. Our group had some reductant museum-goers, but this offered a little something for everyone in our group: human interest stories, history in context, geology, science and engineering, arts and culture.

The gift shop is the beginning where you can purchase admission and the tour ends there as well. The staff members here were kind and informative. We parked in front of the museum (off Grand) and it was easy to pay for 2-hour parking online ($2.29), and that was just the right amount of time for our group. Worth a visit, especially if you want an outing with out-of-town guests.

I LOVED this museum. There are videos to watch and displays to see. It isn‚Äôt very big but if you‚Äôre a fan of old stuff and getting a glimpse into the life of your ancestors, you‚Äôll enjoy viewing the commodities they used to buy.

I asked dear friends of mine who live in Kansas City what is one place I absolutely don't want to miss seeing here, their answer? - Arabia Steamboat Museum. It was well worth the price of admission ( and they have kids, seniors, and military discounts)! The best part was getting to see one of the men who dug it up and getting to have a conversation with another during our visit!! It was outstanding to see all the materials and supplies carried on just one steamboat. I never thought about the hundreds of steamboats, their passengers, and the amount of goods they supplied in building the frontier settlements. This museum is one of the best that brings life in the mid-1800s to life before your eyes. I want to come back again with my kids and parents!!

Always heard of the Arabia Exibit but never visited. On our recent trip back to Kansas City our friends invited us to go. Wow! I was so impressed and recommend anyone who has never seen this exibit to make plans to do so. Like many have stated meeting Jerry one of original excavators was a highlight. He was such a delight to listen to as he shared his expertise on the ships cargo. We throughly enjoyed our visit!‚Åπ

I would totally go back. I went with family as a birthday outing. The entire family enjoyed the museum.  It is an unbelievable story of  friendship and family all supporting each other to research and find the hidden location of the Arabia Steamboat. I do not want to spoil too much.  Go and take the tour!!!

I was skeptical at first but I decided to give it a try and walked away feeling educated and impressed. The story of the Arabia Steamboat, her search team, their dedication and the time, money and effort they put in to locate the wrecked Arabia Steamboat and then share the valuable history with the public is amazing. This museum makes me want to learn more about steamboats as well as wreckage in the Missouri River. I would definitely recommend you check this place out if you are in the River Market area of KC.

We really enjoyed this museum!  The story of the Arabia and its rediscovery is amazing, and the artifacts are wonderful.  The displays are well done.  Be sure to stop by the lab to see artifact restoration in progress!
Mr Hawley's son was there telling stories. Wonderful preservation of history!!  All of us loved it.
Wonderfully and carefully curated items found on the sunken steamboat Arabia. Very interesting place to spend an hour or two.
Don't miss this if you love history or adventure.  A unique glimpse into what people used, wore in pre-civil war America brought to life.
Very nice museum.  The stop is well worth it the amount of merchandise recovered and restored is utterly amazing.  Great job by the family and team.
Absolutely amazing place! A member of the family that helped dig up the Arabia was there and answered questions and extremely friendly. Highly recommend!
Great museum! Lots of artifacts and a huge steam boat wheel.
Cool museum,  they tell a good detailed story.  Lots of artifacts.

Better than I'd anticipated. You can't get a feel for the size when you walk into the building (you buy tickets at the souvenir shop counter, tickets are I think $15/person for adults) and then proceed downstairs. As you go down, there are videos that depict a pretty interesting story, and then there's more! It just keeps going and going as you go in, until you're seeing a huge collection of actual finds from within the steamboat wreck. Pretty amazing stuff!
Awesome place!  We were driving on a 9 day road trip and were told this place was a must.  Being a history buff, this was a hit!  Incredible story and you can get lost in all the artifacts.
A must see experience!!! Fully details the trip and recovery and the amazing restoration of the items found in the cargo hold.
Absolutely amazing collection! What a lot of work restoring all the items that went down with the ship. A true glimpse of the past way of life.

Next time I come here I am going to carve out about 2 hours to really enjoy this museum. It truly is amazing!! Such a great location for date day and a lovely outing rain or shine!! Thank you staff for running such a wonderful museum, being friendly, and passionate!

Very interesting and informative museum. Good history about the steamboats and about hiw they found the Arabia. Great exhibit of all the items that were found. I was definitely pleasantly surprised how nice it was. I didn't take a lot of pictures but there is a lot to see.

One of the best museums I've ever had the pleasure to visit. This is the fantasy of anyone who's ever dreamed of going after buried treasure. Beautifully displayed, great story, great location and decent price for entry. Now I'm just figuring out how I can marry into the family to help with the next excavation. This is a can't miss in KC.
Fascinating time capsule of the late 1800s, well presented.

A great museum with lots of history. It's family owned and run. This is an absolute must see if you like history and/or antiques. There's a guided start to the tour. Then there's a 14 minute short movie followed with the remainder of the tour being self-guided. Be sure to read the story of the mule (near the large Paddlewheel). Lots of neat leather and rubber items that were preserved perfectly.

I love the history on the Arabia Steamboat. The guide's are well versed in the history. This museum is much larger than I had expected. Check out the store room, all the lovely ladies are ready to assist with smiles! A must see if you are in the area!!!

It's hard to imagine a more thorough and detailed exhibit and museum to showcase this unique historic unearthing. The artifacts are remarkable given the circumstances, our guide was knowledgeable, and the layout is thoughtful and detailed. So much to learn and know about this. Great gem in KC.

This is a must-see! We spent two hours and it was incredible to see how many artifacts had been found from this steamboat. It had a nice family-owned feeling, our tour guide was related to the original excavators and provided incredible insight. Everyone on staff was approachable, friendly, and excellently answered questions.

They have done a good job restoring the artifacts from Steamboat Arabia.  There is a portion of the museum where you can watch the workers restoring & preserving the artifacts found.  The start of the tour is guided with a history lesson of the steam powered boats followed by a short film on the group of men who discovered Steamboat Arabia.  You are then free to look at the rest of the exhibit taking as much time as you need or want to take.  Parking during the week is $1/hour.  The only discount tickets offered are  military or AAA.

This a really nice museum. Love the way history has been preserved through years of  restoration. Unique story of Discovery and recovery of the steamboat makes this Museum unique and wonderful to visit. Going back in time and seeing actual artifacts as they were discovered on the steamboat is interesting for any age level. The city market is an added attraction where you can walk, shop and eat.

This is a fantastic, must visit place for locals and tourists and everyone else! The cost was around $14 for an adult and was the best money ever spent at a museum. And the ticket is good all day, even if you leave and revisit later the same day. Parking is $1 an hour and you will spend just under 2 hours. You will start with a guided tour and learn how the boat was lost, found, and retrieved. To aid in this, a short, 15 minute video will be watched. After which, you will see a ton of the items recovered from the boat, most on display behind glass. It is extremely impressive to see the quantity and variety of items, all displayed perfectly. We were simply overjoyed by this find and glad we took the time to visit on our drive through Kansas City.
Such a great well put together museum.  Our kids are 12 and 8 and both really enjoyed it, as well as the adults.  Amazing what they were able to do.

Great museum. It starts with a guide tour and then they let you wander around. Gift shop sales mainly tourist trap souvenirs. I would recommend that the owners make reproductions of the items they found on the Arabia. Otherwise this museum should be on your must see list for KC.

Loved the tour! This little museum is worth the visit, for sure. So many fascinating artifacts!

The discovery of the boat is a big part of the story, so it's great to hear from the guys who dug it up. I think the video could be updated (cheesy reenactments were distracting)

An exhibit I enjoyed was a detail of one particular passenger, with his pants and personal items telling a story about who he was. I think it would be great to see more of that.

I was excited to see the area where they preserve and analyze the artifacts, but it's a small space, and no one was there to demonstrate. That could be further developed into quite a unique experience - I can't think of one museum that lets you see the process first hand.

What an incredible place!  This has got to be one of the most interesting things I've ever seen.  This collection is truly amazing. I would highly recommend that while in KC visit it. It will give you a perspective on what a 1800 Walmart would stock.  A Gem of a discovery!

This is a hidden jewel! The nearly complete contents of a 220 ton cargo of merchandise guessed to the frontier in 1856 that has been recovered.  Well laid out Museum, definitely worth the time and money.  Expect about two hours unless you're a history geek like me, then it could take a lot longer

Wife and I visited on weekend trip to Kansas City. Wonderful story of the family that got together and dug up the Arabia steamboat, and succeeded where others had failed. The guide was awesome, and you‚Äôll be greeted by one of the original ‚Äúdiggers‚Äù. The items are wonderfully preserved. The story is very complete - it‚Äôs about the time when it went down and the items it contained (as a time capsule of the frontier life), but also of the effort and operation to dig something like this up. The preservation process is still going, today! Totally do it - well worth the $14 entrance fee.

This museum offers a fascinating look at the search for a stream boat that capsized in 1856, and the resulting unearthing of it by everyday guys with incredible curiosity and tenacity. Most of its  cargo was found perfectly preserved by many years being buried in mud. A captivating adventure and the artifacts are amazing to look at. They tell us so much about the lives of the pioneers who were traveling to their future homes and land, and a glimpse of the hardships they faced. Well worth your time!

Certainly NOT what I was expecting! Many artifacts, but unfortunately they're many of the same artifacts....thousands of buttons, hundreds of forks, plates, knives, shoes, keys, many hats, shirts, plates, bowls, etc....you get it. What's there IS beautiful and very amazing that they were able to bring it up and preserve it, however, it just left me wanting to see MORE...

Absolutely amazing display of the Steamboat Arabia and the items that were recovered from the location dug up in the middle of a farmer's field.  A truly must see venue if you visit Kansas City,  Missouri. The museum tried to get a price on the items recovered,  but all anyone could say is "Priceless" !  They are still preserving and restoring items recovered from the dig.

This was an absolutely thrilling experience! The whole family loved it! You will see the largest pre Civil War artifact collection in the world! There is something for all to see!- children, men, and women alike! The curator did a fantastic job bringing us into the age of the steamboat! Fascinating information, as well as self-guided time! Highly recommend this experience in KC.
A really great museum with a really cool story. Spent two hours going through the exhibits. A must see if in the area.

Fun museum with half guided and half on your own.  Knowledgeable staff and a very interesting history of pre civil war culture.  We all get fixated on the civil war but the West was opening up to settlers and the steamboat was the method of transportation.  I was intrigued by the steam plants and engines of the day.  Well worth the visit.

A very interesting museum with steamboat artifacts. Particularly interesting considering the cargo and restoration. It is a bit small taking about an hour but good none the less.   It is also in a neat area of KC so a great location.

I was surprised by all of the information and the vast display of items! We spent a couple hours looking through everything. The staff is knowledgeable and happy to answer all of the questions. I'm not sure small kids will be entertained, but our teens up to grandparents enjoyed it.
What a wonderful and inspiring  story  of treasure  hunting.  Well worth the  visit.  Highly recommend the journey to pre civil war products saved. Great experience.
So cool!!! Just absolutely fascinating. Awesome artifacts, great information from the tour guides. Amazing historyüëçüëè

While walking through the Arabia museum, i met Mr David Hawley, he was a great guy ... we spoke about finding the Arabia and we even touched on his discovery of The Malta among other things. It was nice to meet such a down to earth guy who actually takes the time to talk to people about his museum and his work.
At first I thought It was kinda just a bunch of videos and props.  Then after getting more in I said whow what a find.
This Museum is truly amazing. Not only in terms of all the artifacts recovered but in the manner in which the discovery team had to go through great lengths to find and recover them.

A pre-Civil War time capsule and a successful treasure hunt exposed to the public. My trip was the second time I had visited the museum but with the first being a rushed field trip it felt like it was my first visit.

The museum provides only tours but once you get the introductory speech while being able to  see a section of the stern and a movie about the discovery of the steamboat than you are given a chance to explore the rest of the displays at your own leisure.

The displays are separated mostlg into large rooms in which similar items are displayed such as dishes, hardware, clothing, etc. As a result just the amount of items found, cleaned and given preservative measures is astounding. After leaving this section there is a room that allows you to learn more about life during the time, more exploration about steamboat travel, seeing more parts of the Arabia and getting more details on the recovery of the boat.

The visitor also gets a chance to talk with laboratory techs to discuss the process of cleaning and preserving artifacts as there is still another 1/3 to go.

All in all if you like history this makes for a good stop and one I would suggest for those who can make it in, especially as the future of the museum seems so uncertain right now.

The quality and quantity of artifacts was amazing.  One of the museum owners was also there to greet and talk with us and answer questions.  Definitely worth the time. One could almost imagine what it was like be back in that time period.

Beautiful museum, is not really big but has many interesting things to see. You will start with a small tour, then a movie, after that you will have your own time to explore the museum. If you live or you are visiting kc this is one of the places you should visit. The staff that works in here are very friendly.
Never a bad time. Friendly folks from several different cultures to visit and experience different foods and products.

Great story about treasure hunting and modern technology to recover a boat that was buried under farm land after the river shifted. I had no idea that the people going west brought door knows and door locks.  The display of the things carried as cargo was very interesting.

This is an amazing story of five guys and happenstance. They excavated a sunken treasure and created this museum. It's a fabulous museum and incredible story. Here is one of the men that made it happen. I was so enthralled I failed to take photos. Look it up and real all about it.

Wow. Not to be missed. Imagine digging up a long buried Walmart, 150 years from now. That‚Äôs what this was like. The artifacts! The story! And best of all, David Hawley was greeting folks with stories of the dig. What a treat!
Two hour museum . Very cool lots of information. Also got to meet David one of the original excavators founder and owner.

This place is amazing, like a shopping trip for the prairie. Hard to believe one steamship could carry so many goods. Everything from guns to hardware, household goods, clothing and jewelry. The history stories are also fantastic, so much to learn here!a
I love learning about the technology from years ago. Enjoyed learning how steamed engines works.
What a wonderful discovery. Good bite sized museum. I appreciate the videos and how the artifacts are displayed.

Unbelievable collection from the 1850s. Merchant ship transporting people and goods from around the globe, lost in time until this band of brothers caught the bug for a good treasure hunt. Again, a good reminder of the endurance and perseverance of the frontier people.
Definitely worth a visit. The intro given to the museum is a bit pointless, because the movie explains it all directly afterwards. Cool museum though with literally tons of civil war era artifacts.
Very cool history in this little museum. Worth a trip to see and then enjoy the market and food right in the same area!

An extraordinary and fascinating museum! The story of the discovery of the wreckage of this steamboat in the mud of the Missouri River is fascinating, but above all the museography of the entirety of the cargo found during the excavations is splendid and very intelligent. A must see.
Congratulations to the designers and owners of this museum from a French historian who has fallen in love with your museum.

Very interesting. And totally worth the admission fee! One of the excavation team, David, happened to be here today. So a few people got to ask great questions. Ashlee was a great tour guide. Well come back to bring my family/friends when they finish.
A neat way to travel back in time! We especially enjoyed talking with the gentleman at the restoration area. Very informative and interesting history.
Did not go into the museum portion. Not enough time to do it justice. It looks interesting ..... we will be back.
A gem in KC. I find something new each time i go. Great history.
Interesting museum. Well worth the visit.
One of the best museum experiences of my life. New artifacts arriving often. We will be back.
So incredibly cool... the story and the treasure! Highly recommend for anyone interested in history and treasure hunts!!! Such a beautiful museum, such an amazing experience.
The sheer number of perfectly preserved items here is impressive!
Enjoyed the vist and knowledge that was shared on the visit. Very interesting a walk through time and finding of a treasure of history out here who knewüëçüòä

The whole River Market area is full of history, however this is by far one of the most interesting. I was pleasantly surprised.

The boat sank over 150 years ago and took with a boat load of artifacts. (Pun intended) Discovered, unearthed, and now on display I wish we had had more time to stop at more.

This is most definitely worth a second trip back to to see.

Wonderful museum, their ongoing preservation work is inspiring.  I highly recommend a visit, it takes about 2 hours (or three if you read every word and watch every video). Be sure to smell the replica perfume!
The supplies they recovered that are found in this museum are amazing. What really amazed me was how much the river had shifted in such a short time.
Marvelous museum tells the story of the sinking and eventual recovery of the 19th century steamboat Arabia. Thousands of stunning objects are on display. Don't miss it.
Very neat museum! The preservation lab staff were very friendly and answered a lot of questions.
The tour was really interesting. The objects on display coupled with the experts available to talk to us really made the story come alive. I was surprised that I liked it so much.
Guided tour was very informative but not overly long. Great tour guide. Information was well-presented and items were fascinating. A worthy stop on your trip to Kansas City!
Small but cool artifacts.
Awesome museum and history. Got to meet David Hawley as well!
Great visit. Highly recommend everyone sees it. Great illustration of American history.
This place is awesome to learn the history of steamboats and how they found the Arabia and preserved it's artifacts. I would highly recommend a tour!

Very interesting museum. Large collection of artifacts from the 1850s in almost perfect condition. The Arabia was carrying approximately 200 tons of cargo and almost all of it was recovered.  Amazing.

Probably more of an attraction than a museum, this place houses remarkable remains from the steamship Arabia, which sank in the Mississippi River in 1856. Preserved for 130ish years in mud, before being dug up in the 1980s', the ship's cargo of pre-Civil War goods is in pristine condition. Even the behemoth metal boilers that powered the steamer‚Äôs paddle wheels are perfectly intact. Give the museum props too for its signage, offering little history lessons, such as on the nature of river commerce in the mid-19th century. It's just enough information to put things into context.

Was very interesting. Definitely watch all the videos, that explain all the details that went into the process and how it all started.  Was so amazed at how the dishes were in perfect condition and just how many were recovered.

Wonderful time capsule!
And the history is just amazing !
A must see!
Great little museum, I took a bunch of photos and decided to share a few so you can get an idea of the depth of this collection.
A vast amount of materials from the ship. Also includes viewing of preservation office.

This is a gem of local history and worth every penny. What an incredible collection and the exhibit was very informative. Overall I would highly recommend it and will most likely return in the future with friends!
We loved exploring here. The history and how it was discovered as well as preserved is fascinating. I will go back without small kids.
Great place to step back in time. Have thousands of things to look at.
Amazing museum. Like a window into the past. A must see if you are in KC. Guided tour to start with then wander around yourself. Well worth the entry price.

Great time today with the kids. And we got to meet Jerry, too! Incredible collection of goods from the steamboat. It‚Äôs amazing how they learned and perfected preservation techniques for all the items.

And my favorite: the collection of pocket knives. Beautiful pieces!
What an experience to hear the story behind the steamboat and see the artifacts from that time period.

I first visited the Arabia Steamboat museum in the early 2000s. The museum left such an impression on me as a kid that I actually had my wedding, the first one ever held here, in 2016. We worked with Connor, one of the managers, to coordinate security, food, photography and TOURS for all my guests. One of the men who dug up the boat actually was the docent for my guests during the tour. The steamboat wheel served as a perfect backdrop for our wedding ceremony. The gift shop was open so folks could buy momentos.

Thank you so much, Arabia Steamboat Museum, for showing my loved onws a wonderful time.
Walked through on a whim while getting lunch at the market and fell in love with the story of locating and excavating the Arabia. It‚Äôs a pretty fascinating adventure foe 4 guys.

Great experience and totally worth the value! One of the excavators was there while we were and shared a bunch of insider knowledge with us. It is totally mind-blowing to see all of the artifacts found from the Steamboat!

A steamboat that sank in the 1860s that has been recovered.  Sank on the missouri river the boat carried goods that the settlers out west needed and being cleaned & preserved for viewing. Very informational  and a must see.
Very cool museum! They are still going through the found items and restoring them from the initial dig for display.
Very educational.  Loved all the artifacts - I think the way they displayed it made even more interesting.
This place was so cool! I‚Äôm not a museum lover at all but this one was extremely interesting to me!
Absolutely amazing!  A true step back in time. Must see if your in the area!
Great experience, just sorry I waited so long to visit.
Saw part of this story on the history Channel, Oak Island show. Fabulous displays.
A must visit for the river  market

When visiting KC, this is a MUST! The Steamboat Arabia is a tremendous museum for ALL ages to enjoy! The museum is dedicated to the Steamboat Arabia that sunk in the Missouri River during the 1850's. This boat was stocked and loaded with supplies ready to populate a growing town across the river in Nebraska. After the ship sank, it was lost for more than a hundred years until found by a group of family members and their friends who now run the museum. Today, you can view all unblemished materials of the ship ranging from boots, hats and farm tools to European Jewlry, Perfumes and bottles of whisky that are still drinkable. The museum itself is located at the River market along with many stores and shops including coffee shops, itialian Gelato restarants, clothing stores etc. KC has many great museums, but this museum is easily a top 3 museum along with the WW1 Memorial and the Nelson Adkins.
It's surprising how much they found buried in the river & what a snapshot of history!!
Great museum, huge artifact collection. Our tour met a member of the family who recovered the boat and artifacts.
A place to enjoy a small piece of Kansas Citys history. I would rank the Arabia as being one of the main destinations to KC.
Great place for family fun and insight
Amazing to hear the stories of the sinking, the finding, the recovery, and the cargo of 1854. Great presentation.
Fantastic exhibition and a must see! The story of how it was found alone is wonderful.

An incredible story. Awesome exhibition. An amazing collection, pain-staking restored.

A top quality job by the families involved.

Highly recommend a visit.
Wonderful display of American history. Easy to spend a few hours looking around.
I highly recommend this museum to any history buff. It's fascinating how it was discovered and the condition the artifacts were found in!
Great museum but a bit pricey
Awesome place to go. So much too see.
Very well put together museum and extraordinarily maintained.
A great museum, load of interesting stuff from Arabia boat, highly recommended to visit
So interesting and a fun tour! Best part was meeting someone from the actual dig!!
Good to see how people have discovered so many assets from a sunk boat
An incredible discovery of lost treasure right in the middle of Missouri. Allow about 90 minutes to 2 hours.
This is a great and interesting place to go when you visit Kansas City. Interesting story and you usually get to meet one person from the families that discovered the boat!
Worth stopping in and checking out if you are ever in Kanas City, one of the museum owners (also on the recovery team) came out and spoke to everyone about the entire process.
A lot of interesting history, staff has a lot of knowledge and very helpful. Lots of historical things to see and a nice gift shop!
Decent info, but not really intriguing to me. Store had very friendly associates and nice Knick Knacks.
Very cool and educational!
Wow a really fun place to visit when you‚Äôre at the market.
Amazing museum and a look back in time to the 1850s. It is incredible how well preserved the artifacts are!
Great museum and I was  so impressed at the level of preservation..  of so many different artifacts

Wonderful museum for those beautiful history and artifacts. Was so pleased that the grandson of one of the original founders.   Worth every penny.  Make sure to carve out at least a few hours to see it all!
Had a wonderful time. Very interesting story and lots to see.
An impressive collection of artifacts from early American life! Was on the fence about going but was so glad I did
Loved all the sights. A wonderful place. Needs to have some kid appropriate interactivity.
Very unique one of a kind cool place!!
very beautiful and good to learn American culture
Amazing place to visit and see such an outstanding collection of pre-civil war artifacts.  A time capsle from a historic american historic time.
A must see in Kansas City! Do not miss this one of a kind museum.
Great museum.
The incredible treasures that were unearthed are spectacular to see and amazing to know the survived that disaster.
Had a great time here with a group of 10 adults (ages 50-85).  So much to see and learn about.  I'd come back again.
Also a great place visit if you're in KC
Awesome museum I highly recommend visiting.
Very interesting place. Worth to visit at least once for $15
Never gets old to visit. The City Market and shopping at all the surrounding stores
Very educational. We learned a lot about steamboat travel and the hazards of it. This steamboat was the equivalent of a floating Walmart.
Wow is all I can say... what a treasure trove of historical items they discovered!
It was interesting and super fun.
A very interesting museum with plenty of artifacts from the shipwreck.
Most amazing museum  l have seen here
Great time capsule of transporting merchandise in USA before railroads.
Great museum, the artifacts were amazing.
Wonderful exhibit a step back in time.
Great trip back time. I enjoyed it.
So interesting.  Great displays.
One of the founder's was there. He was awesome to talk to. The story behind everything is incredible.
My family we're at River market to visit all stores
A piece of good work!
Wow what an experience! Must see!!!!
Very interesting. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and give a lot of information about how they preserve all that's been found.
Very interesting and we met famil of the expedition!
Enjoyed the whole museum
Nice museam.
Surprisingly well done.
Loved the tour and if you are lucky enough to get Nancy as a docent you are blessed with a wonderful day!
Amazing experience a must go
Was really interesting
The guide Connor was great. The museum is fantastic. Well worth the visit.
Must see! Loved it!
So interesting!
The guides are very friendly
Joey's experiencing Kansas City;)
Incredible!!!!
Fun glimpse of life in past

We were a party of 8 and we really enjoyed this experience. The line was crazy long but we did have the entertainment of guys on 4 wheelers dirt bikes. Food was found out back of the museum which I feel should be in the parking lot of the line. That would make it feel that you don‚Äôt stand in line for so long. We stood in line for an hourü•µ.
The museum was amazing. The information and display of the art is superb. The bartender could use some help. Has the vibe of a daytime club! Overall it‚Äôs a great outing

The staff was amazing!! Very informative exhibits. I enjoyed the fact that my tickets didn't expire. I had the freedom to choose when I wanted to go. There is an option to skip the line for an additional $20. Parking is $20 as well on site payable by cash or cashapp.

Got there right before they opened on a Friday‚Ä¶was probably the best decision we could have made as we were able to go straight in without having to wait too long. The museum is very thorough and well laid out. Kind of a short tour but that didn‚Äôt take away from the luster at all. Maybe if I go again, I‚Äôll do the trap house escape room.

The Artists that contributed to this museum are crazy talented!  Definitely not the usual- the artwork actually tells the story.

Parking was $20, and they offered skip line access @ $20 per person- both either cash or Cash App.

There are tons of photo ops, and they have a full service bar inside with seating, in case ya wanna grab a cocktail and stay a while!

You definitely don't wanna miss this experience, if you travel to or through ATLüëçüèæ

Awesome display of the story behind the music. I loved the stories in each vignette and as you are bopping along to the new drop in the background you are seeing how the genre got its start. I loved the experience! Eat first because there is a bar on site but food is not guaranteed.

Enjoyed our time at this museum and wished there was more to see. The line was pretty long with close to 45 minutes waiting. Parking $15 and $20 admission.
Definitely a must stop if you're in the area.

l enjoyed but I can't find the pics of Jeezy roomüò≠ Going back again on my next visit. I loved all of the art displayed. Pics do it no justice. I was ready from the first room entered. Super dope experience.

This was a nice experience for my friends and I! The line was long to get in, so I highly recommend that you arrive early to stand in line.

Once we got in, the museum was great, the staff was helpful, and I liked that we were able to take as many photos as we liked.

I will say that the drinks are a little pricey. For example, I ordered the "Marathon" which is the drink named after Nipsey Hustle, which was $15.
I chalk it up to paying for the nostalgia and the trap experience.

Overall, I would say this museum is worth the trip!

My dad and I went to the escape room because museum admission is included. The thought, authenticity and detail is evident in all parts of the building. The escape room is separated, but was so much fun and funny. The hosts played their parts in the escape room.

The entire experience was wonderful!

Great experience. My advice would be to by tickets early online and get there early. It is always a LONG line and only a set number
of patrons are allowed in at one time. Food truck, full bar and merchandise available. Also you have to pay to park.

This was definitely my type of carrying on. The line was long and moving slowly, as to be expected. So my cousin saw online where you can pay $20 and move to VIP, so that's what we did. Upon entering, l was so shocked by the authenticity of everything. I enjoyed every room there, especially the one dedicated to the female MCs. It was very crowded because of the weather, which l respect the fact that they didn't leave guests standing in the rain. We spent almost 2 hrs there and l enjoyed every minute of it!

We been talking about going g for a while so we arrive and had a good time. The only thing they charge you for parking which was $20 then charge us another $30 at the door when the woman stated about drinks or some but we made it all the way to the back and still had to pay for drinks. Please do not go by the website prices bc it's not the same. As we head out the back I got to see T.I. for a sec before he was heading in the car. Other than that i really enjoyed the time there.

We made a visit to the Trap Museum during a very busy holiday weekend. Juneteenth. The line was wrapped around the building and up through the parking lot. New paragraph. You're going to need to pay to park unless you are going to risk it and park on the street. Parking is about $10.

Once you get in line no one let you know that you can pay for a VIP pass and skip the line for $20. Unless you asked about it you want no. We heard another lady asked about it and she was told that she could go to the front of the line for an additional $20 on top of the $20 he already paid.

It was so hot outside we paid the money. It is rather small, which definitely resemble the trap house, but it has great content and material inside. I thoroughly enjoyed our experience there. Lots of information and good artwork. I was just really love how they pay homage to so many different rapper and artist. The staff was very welcoming and hospitable oh, but the drinks at the bar were pretty high! Very potent, but pretty high LOL B Trap House granny was a highlight she was definitely a character walking through the house with her belt passing falls out and talking crazy. Like normal Grammys did back in the day LOL new paragraph. It was a great experience and I'm glad I was able to take my friend so she could enjoy that experience as well.

Awesome experience! I did the trap museum and the escape room and it was worth the $45. The escape room is highly entertaining. The trap room is informative, you'll learn much about the King and other southern artist. My group spent about 2 hours in the escape room and trap museum. It's not very big but great to take pictures, it's s chill environment.
My only suggestion: change the parking lot. It is a very compact parking space, we weren't sure if we were supposed to park there due to lack of signs and how small it was. Attempting to get out was a disaster due to the small space and multiple cars. Overall I highly recommend visiting the Trap Museum and definitely partake in the Escape the Trap room.

The cost of entry is $20 & if you want to expedite entry, an additional $20.  They charge $15 to park which is ridiculous.  I felt like it was more of am art museum with just pictures up of others.  Not from ATL or have alot of knowledge about trap music, the museum did not do enough for me to provide a complete understanding of the music genre.  To each their own, but it simply was not for me.

Great exhibits honoring Trap Music legends.  Nice staff. Cost $20 for admission. No military discount. Thought parking was high, $15.  Signage needs to be better as the main entrance is on the side of building and not in the back or fenced in area.  If you plan to visit Atlanta I'd add to your itinerary.

I will say it's okay to see for the experience, but if im being honest, it's not much to this place. I dont understand why this place always has a line it just so happens that the day I went (Saturday /12 noon), it was a line, but it went quickly, roughly 5-10 min.  They charge $20 to get in this place, not worth it, in my opinion . the tickets you purchase  online never expire (my sister bought 2 tickets in the year 2020 that we used for this day). overall, it is a cool place to check out if you're visiting Atlanta and tryna find something to check out. This place does have a candy store, which I found to be an interesting twist & a bar inside. I give the place 3 stars due to: You get to see real trap house, you get to see some history of some big name Trap stars, you get to take photos with props and the candy store bar was a nice touch.

I have been a residence of GA  for 4 years (grew up in the south).  Had friends come into town and it was my first time going.
My honest opinion: I have an appreciation for all music. Crunk/trap is definitely one that has created the current culture of Atlanta. I also appreciate people who come from these communities have some level of representation. The reasons why I give this a 3 stars is because of the lack of education the museum provided and the overhype. If they provided visitors (who haven‚Äôt experienced this lifestyle) insight/depth knowledge it would have been a much better experience. DEFINITELY NOT KID FRIENDLY! I was surprised at people bringing their young children to this üôÑ. Should be an age limit.
To me, it was just a display of a ‚Äútrap house‚Äù that you can see for free in these same communities lol.
I definitely enjoyed seeing the montage of the different rap eras (80s-current), the studio, and recording booths, artworks, bar, and the staff were friendly. I just recommend providing education to the masses however.

The Trap Museum was the bomb!! If you love Rap (Trap Music) then this is definitely worth paying a visit atleast once. The tickets were only $20 but we had to pay $20 to park (cash only). We went on a Sunday and got there about 30 minutes before they opened and the line had already started to form outside the building. I'd recommend arriving early because when we left the line was pretty intimidating. (You will be patted down fellas and for the ladies they check your purses so leave ya artillery & Everythang else at da hize) BOL ü§£  All of the exhibits were astonishing! I was extremely excited to finally get a chance to visit "The Trap". They have a bar inside, an Escape room that you can purchase tickets for, as well as a shop as you leave out where you can purchase Trap Museum tshirts starting at $25.

It was decent more like an exhibit, not worth the money could be at least $10 or $15 the most to get in, long line 30 mins per person wait so suggest get there early. Drinks are ok not worth $15 to walk around and bring outside when they have an outdoors area (maybe if bars was in front so you can drink and look around then to wait till the end to purchase and retrace your steps because you can‚Äôt take them out even if you aren‚Äôt leaving yet.
Seems more of ‚Äú an believe it or not kinda vibe than a ‚Äútrap museum ‚Äú.
Came all the way from Chicago. Me and my friends had a ball! We enjoyed some drinks at the bar when we were done checking out the museum. I would definitely recommend.

If you would like to experience authentic TRAP culture, this is the place to go.  From parking, to the wait, exhibits, security, bar and smoke house.   You can glimpse TRAP culture's lowest points to its highest and most significant moments.

Best experience ever‚Ä¶. The whole entire staff is very nice and fun to be around‚Ä¶.I Can‚Äôt forget that they‚Äôre funny‚Ä¶ oh make sure u get u some food from the trap shack From LoLa ‚Ä¶. Her New Orleans style is definitely a hitüî•üî•üî•üî• upon purchasing tickets make sure you read the whole entire site‚Ä¶. Don‚Äôt complain to security because you didn‚Äôt read everything they only doing they job can‚Äôt wait to come back üòò

Fun experience! Refreshing to visit a museum different than the traditional ones we‚Äôre accustomed to. We actually purchased tickets to the trap escape room which was very interactive and lots of fun - the crew/performers were awesome. I‚Äôd recommend purchasing tickets to the escape room in advance if you‚Äôre interested - it comes with complimentary access to the music museum which is perfect because it also allows you to skip the line outside, which gets pretty long.
The wait wasn't bad. But $20 for parking is obsurd. There was some nice picture and exhibits. The music played didn't match the theme of the museum.

Found this on TikTok while vacationing. Amazing art work and fun experience. Details are great. However, the wait is very long. They charge $20 per person and an additional $20 to skip the line. $15 to park. A lot of people inside at once so you definitely have to move around/wait to take pictures. Fun experience but be prepared for 1-1.5hr wait on a weekend. Little too pricey for 2 people for a 30ish minute experience.

Nice place to go and view music memorabilia. Went in 2018 and it was a outing with my husband, my sister and brother and their spouses. enjoyed reflecting on music and the different artist, along with culture.

Dope experience! The atmosphere was great, bartender was dope and made great drinks. Grandma was HILARIOUS!!! And I was able to network a little and promote my business and clothing line. All in All, a 10 out of 10 experience. Trap Music Museum + Fishscale By: Giovanni Mcfly. Match made in heaven. Or in Atlanta anyway. üòâ

Beware! Long line at least a 2 hour wait even if you buy the tickets online.  The cost is $20 to get in $20 for parking and if you want to skip the line it's 20 per person. #SnoopNDaCity!!! But if u r in the #ATL area check out the #traphouse....such a cool place with #hiphop #nostalgia to appreciate!!!

This place is a must see...if you love Atlanta rap music....this is the trap...the definition of trap music will be found here.... awesome staff... amazing drinks
This is a new Atlanta landmark

Great Experience! It was worth the money. However, it seemed to go by pretty fast, we got a chance to visit all the rooms. They had an escape room available but we didn‚Äôt try it out, maybe next time!
My family and friends were thoroughly pleased the escape experience was fire!!!! My group of (9)was from 6yrs to 58yrs we had a FABULOUS time the crackhead and the thug kept us engaged

PLEASE try the escape room when you go!! It‚Äôs a very unique experience. ü§£ü§£ They had me laughing from the time we went in until we escaped. This is a one of a kind escape room. Without giving details, it was very entertaining trying to escape the trap house. Thank you @TrapHouseTrina and your nephews! I‚Äôll be bringing my husband back when I return to Atlanta. With much love from Portsmouth, Virginia.
AMAZING and a MUST TO SEE If you visit ATL, everything about the Trap Museum was absolutely amazing üëèüèæ! As you can see we ENJOYED ourselves!

Was not much to see for the price you pay. The museum itself was wall to wall pictures of familiar faces in the rap game along with memorabilia. The lines were extremely long and wait times were similar to an amusement park. Went ahead and paid for the express to shorten the wait time. I was not impressed with what I saw once inside. The atmosphere was nice  full of music and people. But I honestly thought there would be a bit more to it.

It was nice to experience once. Something to see. The line took an hour to get in, they do offer to cut the line for an additional fee. A lot of trap content for photo opps.

This is definitely the spot to visit just because &  travelers when visiting  Atlanta I enjoyed myself kool vibe great music good food  of course drinks on point!! Bring the family Very creative museum

I‚Äôve been to ATL over 8 times and I‚Äôve never been here until this last time which was 10/8/22. The details for the jump the line process was not explained very well.
