I wouldn‚Äôt visit here again!
Cute little experience. Most of the artwork is done by local Atlanta artist. Would be cool to see more music video props. Would I do it again? Probably not but it was great to take pictures at.
Def a must see while in the ATL. Recommend paying the little extra for the escape room, definitely worth it. The eddies was on point too. Staff is amazing. I will def do again when back.
While visiting Atlanta I had to check out the trap museum. I loved all the art, pictures and music. TI did an awesome job putting this exhibit together. A must see if you're rap music enthusiasts!

Cost $20, paid $20 (expect a line) to skip the line, & $10 for parking and had the best time ever!! It was definitely worth it! Take your mask or pay $5 for a mask at the door! But the hostess and staff all very friendly! I drove 12 hours for this experience and it was definitely worth it!
Entry could be a bit more organized. 45min wait despite purchasing tickets in advance. Definitely a unique concept. Drinks were on point.

I love this place! Hands down! I really got a chance to see how deep and important trap music history is! However the lines are always wrapped around the door due to its popularity! Paying an extra $20 for the express line was definitely worth it!

EXTREMELY LONG LINE!!!! The exhibit is way too short but for $20 you can't expect too much. Then they want to charge an extra $20 in addition to the ticket cost for fast pass. It's cool for photos but wouldn't revisit.
Went to the museum and Escape the Trap for my friend's Bachelorette and it was a lot of fun!! The art is very unique and interesting.   Enjoyed it a lot!!!

My friends and I had a great time taking pictures, walking through the museum and doing the escape room. When we purchased the escape room, we didn't have to wait in the long line, and that bad boy was LLOOONNG.

1st impression(HustleGang)place opened at noon, waited in line for an hour (line not moving at all.) Then a guy says you can skip the line for an extra 20.00! Couldn't enjoy any of the exhibits everyone wanted to take pictures.
It's supposed to be a museum, not a club!
NO organization, everyone all over the place. No respect for anyone's personal space.
Other than that, the exhibits were nice and very informational.

The trap museum was a cool and unique experience. Learned a few things about some artist that I actually like so not only was I getting lit at the bar but I learned a few things as well.The artwork was pretty dope as well !

This is my second time here. Brought my cousin down to show her a good time. She enjoyed herself so much that she can't wait to get back down to ATL. Trap Music Museum is a vibe on its own. Dope art and dope cultural experience ‚úäüèø

Our uber driver warned us about the lines at this place and he wasn‚Äôt joking. As soon as we arrived we joined the long line around the building. We walked in and I was immediately unimpressed with the display of drugs and alcohol. Maybe it just wasn‚Äôt for me. It‚Äôs also really small.

This place is fantastic. What a really cool experience. The only thing their missing is Biggie with the Crown üëëüëëüëëüëë. Overall was cool. Staff is peace as well. We came from NYC to visit and it was well worth it.

I battled between 3 and 4 stars but I think my love for T.I. I gave it 4. With that being said, I love the concept‚Ä¶growing up in this environment, this place definitely brought back some memories. A life I‚Äôm glad was in the past. It still seems to be a big crowd which is amazing since they‚Äôve been open a while. You will have to pay for parking which there are two different lots. It‚Äôs like going to club back in the day you have the general admission line and then the cut line where you can pay a little extra. I chose the general line because I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm getting into to pay extra. Those cut lines are reasons I don‚Äôt go out anymore. In line, I like the energy of Trina outside, she let you know hey, you pay a little extra and get in. There was a younger guy who came out bashing the people who decided to stay in the general line..in actuality if we all went over there then the line would be the same anyway. So to be ridiculed and called broke and we need to apply for a PPP loan is pretty tasteless. Yes, I get it, this is kind of a hood like establishment. But don‚Äôt be disrespectful. It went on for sometime and I was really tempted to just leave but I was already in line some time. After getting in the check in ladies were a breath of fresh air (they were nice)and the granny was funny. I would love to go on a not so crowded day and really look around. With the crowd it‚Äôs not that normal museum feel it‚Äôs more of a crowded small club feel and you can‚Äôt really see the exhibits. They have a bar area but it was way too many people to even attempt to get a drink. I may come back for the museum but I do want to try the escape room to see their take on that. Cool concept but it was on the verge of too ratchet for me.
It was the real deal trap spot for the rappers. I enjoyed it. They have a gift shop & smoke shop. You gotta stop thru there.

I enjoyed the trap music museum. Definitely just a one time experience. The parking is $20 and the entrance fee is $30 however you do get a free bottle of champagne. Kids are allowed to enter but it's more geared towards adults.

My son wanted to come to the Trap House Museum for his 21st birthday. This place is overrated and is a rip off. I wasn‚Äôt impressed with it. It was like a haunted house where it takes you like 10 minutes to completely look around and then you‚Äôre done. Parking was close to nonexistent. People here will do about anything to make that quick buck. It was about $20 to get in and it wasn‚Äôt worth the money paid for. I guess it‚Äôs popular because of T.I. I am glad I went so that the hype of going there is something I can tell others about. It was interesting to experience as after you went around there was like an area you can hang out and order drinks. I am in my 40s so maybe it‚Äôs just not my cup of tea. My son took pictures and he said it wasn‚Äôt what he expected it to be like so it might not be an age thing. It was also raining the day we went and the line was super duper long and wasn‚Äôt moving. We waited in line for about 10-15 minutes until we saw a little glimpse of hope to seeing the line move. My bf talked to one of the guys up front and we were able to cut the line. It was worth whatever my bf said as I would‚Äôve been super soaked by the time we got inside. There was also construction around the area when we went so it was muddy and wet. Overall the people were pretty chill but it was crowded and served a younger crowd.
For the price is not worth it. But from what you learn about Trap, it is. So if you love the music definitely go. If you don‚Äôt it is consider is $20 for parking and $20 to enter the museum.

The place was ok. The Artwork was pretty cool. It was $30 for the weekend and $20 weekday. $20 for parking. I parked around the corner to the left at the end of the street and walked over.  Can complete the whole walk thru in about 30minutes.  Mask is not enforced

Inside of the museum was a bit overcrowded and disorganized with respect to the flow of the exhibits. Impossible to get a beverage due to lack of command and control of the bar area. Be prepared to wait in a long line to enter the establishment. However you can skip the line by paying the door man a small fee‚Ä¶ Had a lot of great items to view from some of my favorite artist.

The ‚Äúmuseum‚Äù is just ok. Music is fire‚Ä¶lol. Small on the inside (can walk through and see everything in 15-20 minutes if that) but probably still worth paying $20 to skip the line that is around the corner everyday it is open.

Now the bar, the food, and the hookah spot‚Ä¶AMAZING! The bar is a little pricey if you want to take the drink to go you can for and additional $5.

Lola Trap Food Truck in the back‚Ä¶OMG! Fresh to order and so good I ate it before I could get the cute pictures! Portions are huge! Go hungry, when you don‚Äôt even go to the museum! Just go! She is a 5 by herself!

I‚Äôve been here several times. 4-5. I would say that overall is a cool vibe but I think there should be a price for kids, an early bird/happy hour price because to be honest all your doing is walking around and taking pictures for like 10 minutes. And the parking is $20. So a family of 4 would be paying 120-150 to take pictures or whatever for ten minutes.

I came here in June of 2021 and it was a great experience. I would go back. If you're going to go, go early, either way there will be a line, but the earlier the better. I went on a Saturday and the line wasn't too bad. I got there before they opened. They opened right at 12:00 pm and it took about 30 minutes to get inside. People who paid to skip the line, will be getting in before you. It's $20 to get in, and it was $10 to park. You can pay an extra $20 to skip the line. There was a parking lot right next to the museum, it was very convenient. I believe  there was another parking lot down the street. They have signs out letting you know where to park, which is super convenient. The area where you will be eating in line is not covered, so if it's raining, hot, or cold, you will be in the elements.

You will not be able to bring food or drinks in, and you will be patted at the door if you're a man, and women will have their bags checked.

When you get in, it's small, but there is so much to see and take in. Tons of pictures, displays, album covers, and facts about our favorite trap rappers. They also have a bar. I didn't try the drinks, so I can't speak on how they are. There are plenty of photo opps, so have your phone charged and ready. I was in there for about 40 minutes, maybe an hour. Like I said, so much to see.

The atmosphere is cool. They have music playing, it's a good vibe.

When you leave out, they have a little area for food, and also merch, and also a smokehouse. I bought some merch, it was a bit pricey, but to me it's worth it.

All in all I would say you should definitely visit if you like trap music and you're in the Atlanta area. It's a cool experience. You can check out my video review on my youtube channel. Lovely Lasean
So much fun! The music, the art, the bar..  the drinks  are also kega tasty. (Parking is $20 cash only as a heads up)
Worth the experience if you don't have to wait in a long line.  Parking is expensive and limited when full.
Went to the ATL for the first time loved the visit and the southern hospitality was very nice. Very nice museum, great people working there had a fun time in the escape room.

Not what I expected, it is a smaller space than anticipated. It was very crowded and barely could enjoy it. I would recommend purchasing your tickets ahead of time. Parking is $20 so be prepared to pay cash. Other than that not bad they do have a bar location inside if you want to get additional drinks.

If you're a museum lover, you'll like the Trap Museum. They have some really cool and interesting artwork from today's modern day artists. Something I definitely appreciate. And any rap or hip-hop fan will enjoy the building's aesthetics.
I loved this place trap culture omg if you know  u know

The concept is dope. The art in there is creative. This building is I'll equipped to handle the amount of people that were in there. Parking is non existent and cost $20 or more.

It's overpriced, the "champagne" they gave out tasted like someone poured a 40 in a paper bag squeezed it out and bottled it.

It was full of fruit flies and mosquitoes. It was terribly lit. The exhibits didn't mesh well and they left out a lot. It took 20 minutes tops to go through.

It's not really a museum it's a mini club for those 24 and under.

Great experience. I mean seriously from the time I pulled up into the parking it felt truly like the hood. Folks standing in the cold and like a ghetto triumph trap house Trina came and said express line follow her for a fee of coarse.. upon entrance it was definitely what I had expected.

It was nice to tour the facility but I probably would not go back unless the items inside were changed. I think it's nice to do if you have never done it before. Parking was $10 if you had cash, $15 with Cashapp. They do take cards for the priority line. This line is $20 for a quicker entry.

My experience wasn't what I thought it would be! Idk if it's because of my expectations or not, But baby let me telllllllll you! So I brought tickets online $20 a piece (cool not pricey) then park & pay $10 (not expected but completely ok) then I get in line (which there were two, with zero signage of which was which) & was charged an extra $20 per person for being in the express line  when both lines of ppl were bein escorted in @ the same time.

The there was no set times as to when people could enter. The facility is not that big & people were basically body to body. You couldn't stop & enjoy the art or take photos as much as you would like because of the crowd!

I wish it was a bit more organized üòï but I'm the kind of person that trys to make the best of everything üòä

So I would honestly say still go for the experience

My children and I waited on the line for hours and we were first but I'd never do it again. We saw (self guided tour) the entire museum in 35 minutes. It's a homage to trap music culture comprised of pictures of various artist; no descriptions or explanations which leaves you to have to know what you're looking at. It is not the space to learn and that's cool for me but I can imagine some people do come to learn about the culture. Due to covid-19 you are unable to touch any of the exhibits, leaving you to just take photos of props. The staff was hospitable however; I appreciate that.

It‚Äôs a 5 for me. Hats off to T.I. and his team for offering up an authentic and fun escape room. We had a blast (went during the week and were allowed to tour the museum to take pics before/after our session). The details in the room, staff actors and the clues were challenging but made you think as well as interact with the others in the room with you. Another kudos is they limit the escape room to 10 people, you must wear a mask, hand sanitizer is readily available and there was plenty of room in the escape rooms layout and museum to have fun but keep distance in mind. If you‚Äôre looking for something fun to do then give it a try! Enjoy we did!

Cool lil place to visit and fun for the family. The lady at the bar made the best Trap Punch.  The security guard at the door with the golds wasn't to friendly. When checking my purse he had is hand all in my bag checking Every thing even with covid going on.. my purse has never been search like that before.. Not sure what they thought he would find. The staff was really friendly, up beat and interacted with all the guest. The other thing is the parking.  One spot is $20 and another spit is $10. Try to find the cheaper parking and buy a drink at the bar.

Not worth the money sorry.  It needs to be more. Don't get me wrong it is nice for the idea. But it should be $10. Also the ones they have making the lines are clueless. We paid$40 to go express. A waste. Just get there 2 hours early and wait. I promise you it's not worth what they charge

My first time at the Trap Museum and I enjoyed it and got to see what I came for but I don't ever need to go back. It's not a big place so the walk around didn't take long, even with a lot of people in there.

Just know there is absolutely NO social distance taking place whatsoever even with signs outside, it's just not possible....I had to be in there with about 100 ppl and 100 ppl waiting to getting in....crazy packed.

It was cool but so packed. That‚Äôs a great thing for the museum but I was only in town for a day so I was afraid I may not get it because the line was wrapped. I paid to skip the line and made my flight.

Once you're in, it's definitely more to it than just music. I enjoyed it. Negatives would be the price, skip line price, parking, & line length. $20 admission. Additional $20 for skip the line. $20-25 for parking (cash or cash app). The line was EXTREMELY long. To get through the museum & read & appreciate everything it'll be about maybe 30min, at least.

Beware try to get there like a hour before they open because line gets long very quick,but if you buy your tickets & sign your waiver you get right in with no problem, everybody was cool,especially Trap House Trinaü•∞she was definitely the realest‚ù§plus they sale drinks too n food

It's not worth the $30 entrance fee/$20 parking. And may I suggest not going on the weekends. Because it gets so crowded you really can't enjoy the museum. We went on a Thursday which was perfect we were able to explore the museum at our own pace. We were able to get a table and have a few drinks and explore the museum again before we left.

To have to purchase tickets online in advance & still spend an hour waiting in line to be let in is absurd! My sister had to use the restroom so, we had to pay an additional $40 to jump line just so that she could be allowed to use the bathroon. All that waiting and we were done with the museum in under 30 minutes. This establishment has been open long enough now to where things should run a lot more smoothly. Overall, the exhibits were very well put together.

Visited Atlanta from Chicago for the 1st time ever this past weekend and I must say that I had a Blast. This was one of the places that I really wanted to visit when I went to Atlanta and it was a really great experience. Walking into the trap museum made me feel like I was apart of the hip hop culture there in Atlanta. The entry prices and drinks were reasonable and the workers hospitality was unmatched. The atmosphere was simply amazing. Shout out to Ti and his team on the great experiences, we had a ball in the A and definitely will be back to visit soon.

Expected at least some wax statues. It‚Äôs OK but it gets very busy and there isn‚Äôt that much to look at. Overall it‚Äôs a cool experience because we have seen it so much on TV but it‚Äôs not really of that.

Super dope concept. I first stopped by a few years ago when it was the pink car and pink trap house. Now it‚Äôs a full museum with lots of artifacts from all the popular trap rappers. I‚Äôd highly recommend doing Escape the Trap if you can because that‚Äôs a lot of fun even though the ‚Äútrap auntie‚Äù is yelling at you the whole time üòÇ

Anyone who know the culture will have an appreciation for this museum.  It‚Äôs a must see when visiting Atlanta GA.  They have captivated the journey some of your favorite rappers have gone through to get to where they are today and there is a lot of history in the artwork. It‚Äôs an experience like no other. The staff is very knowledgeable and fun. S/O to Brandon for the tour.

This is such a cute museum! I enjoyed the exhibits that were here, they also play good trap music. Also, the employees are great! They are all in character, as if they were at a trap house. That made the experience extra fun.

However, this is a small museum, and can be completely walked through in about an hour. This is not a bad thing at all, just don‚Äôt expect to spend your entire day here!

I thoroughly enjoyed it the price was reasonable and the mixed drinks are delicious. Drinks are kinda pricey but what you expect üòÇ My favorite room would have to be Gucci's kitchen üî• You can buy merch outside the museum shirts, hoodies, shot glasses, lighters, masks, & then they have a food truck outside too. Overall the visuals are super dope. If you're a fan of trap music it's a must that you visit.

I came to Atlanta to explore the Trap Music Museum.  The staff was friendly from the time we walked up to show our reservations for the Sip N Trap!  The personalities of the personnel at the Trap Music Museum really stood out and left a positive impression on me!   The exhibitions are unlike any other institution! I adore the hand written lyrics, the photographs, artwork and installations!  The DJ kept me dancing all night long!  I enjoyed the complimentary cocktails by Branson Cognac.

We waited in line on a Saturday afternoon for about 25-30 minutes, this museum seems to attract a lot of out of town traffic. There were vehicles from all over the South and beyond. Admission is $10 but you can pay $20 and skip the line. Make sure you potty beforehand, a guest from our party was told they would have to pay to enter just to use the restroom so she had to hold it until we made it through the line. When we made it in we paid and we were on our way. I‚Äôm not sure if guided tours are offered but it was congested as we walked  throughout. The exhibits are very exposed and as much as the signs say don‚Äôt touch or move...people were touching and moving. I imagine things are damaged regularly. The PART that I found most interesting was the journey, TRAP can be very negative (the lifestyle, crime, drugs, and devastation to the black community) but it also shows how opportunities lead to the success of many artists which created new platforms to make positive changes. The Trap museum is more than a photo op, the artwork and mentions throughout give you more insight to that PART of life some black men and black families encountered.

The museum was incredible!!! Lots of cool photo ops, and monuments to the trap /rap greats! The escape room was awesome..staff was very friendly and engaging! Drinks was really good too, paid $15 but it was strong and you got a memorobilia cup. Would 100% recommend to anyone!!

It's best to go on a Sunday. It was less ppl & great vibes. I truly enjoyed myself! It was only $10 to enter & $10 to park. Also there is a bar inside if you decide to have a drink. I highly suggest you check out this museum if you haven't already done so.

Go on a weekday when its less expensive, less crowded, & you get more time to solve the Escape Room (which also means you get a private tour if the Museum). Starting with the Escape Room, its nearly impossible to solve in the 30 minutes of allotted time given on the weekends without the Escape Room rep (who literally sits in the room with you) barking out all the clues that are pretty much dead giveaways. Its annoying & negates the ‚Äúescape‚Äù part of the experience. If it were not for the fact that booking the Escape Room prevents you from standing in the line that quickly wraps around the building, I would probably skip it all together. As for the actual ‚Äúmuseum‚Äù, its not really. What you‚Äôll find are scenes that play to familiarities of the ‚Äútrap‚Äù world plus a lot of mediocre art of trap artists. What this really is is a chance to post for the Gram & have a couple of good laughs. There is no deep dive into the trap culture or the music that was born from it. On the upside, the people-watching is most excellent. Its a cash cow for TI & pretty funny what people (including me) will pay to do for entertainment in the A.

Worth the wait in the queue. A bit Crowe des and hard to explore, I should have chose a better time to get there. Or a lower limited number of people could be allowed to enter the premises to have a better experience going inside. Great staff making good jokes from the beginning of the tour. Great place to see the trap culture represented. I was in the A just for 23 hours and doing this was one of the highlights.
I had a great experience! The trap escape was so fun,!

Small place packed with a bunch of cool stuff to see. It‚Äôs for tourists and locals! $10 cover charge to get in & if you don‚Äôt want to sit outside and bake in the Georgia sun you can pay $10 to skip the line. Totally worth it. Friendly staff.
Awesome experience!! Went from here to Trap Cafe. Will definitely be back!

I had a good time and the art work was great. Lots of photo ops and memorabilia. I don't recommend paying more to jumbo the line. For me it was worth $10.

Drinks are offered which is nice and souvenirs.

So I enjoyed my experience..it is tastefully and well done. There is even room to add more artists as the genre evolves. I like the set up and while it could be bigger I think it works. Line wasn't bad, would be great with a tented area..while the price of parking is not bad, the hill to drive up to park is a little steep. But all in all a great time!
First visit. Not much to the museum. Very small, can be completed with 20 minutes. Add more time if you want to take pictures. The Escape room part was fun.

I love museums so I was excited to see what the hype was all about. Fun to finally go to a museum and they didn't talk about Blacks being slaves. This museum was small but refreshing. Be prepared to pay for parking. I wish the art work about the artist gave a little more background info on the artist or maybe even there social media handle.

Really enjoyed it! TI did a great job on how he build that trap house. A lot of history on trap music. Staff was great very professional and good customer service. I'll be back when it's not so crowded.

If you ever visit Atlanta and love Hip Hop music one must come visit the Trap Museum. We did the Escape room and toured the museum. My first Escape Room and it was interesting. I purchased my tickets in advance which was a good thing. The line for the museum was super long. We didn‚Äôt have to wait in line because you pick a time when you purchase tickets similar to the movie theater. I enjoyed my birthday last week and visiting this establishment was one of my many highlights.
It's everything you expect it to be. Great service. Great employees. FREE cup of Branson cognac br 50 Cent. Informative tour guides. All around great time.
The Escape Room must be experienced to be believed! My friends and I had a blast! The exhibits are an awesome tribute to the artists who originated trap music. I'll definitely visit again!
My only complaint is the damn wait. You‚Äôd think they wild have tints or fans but no! They definitely need to make the museum bigger. It was nice but would I visit again? Maybe not!

I give T.I. 2 üëçüèænot just for the content, but for remembering your target audience all the way down to the entrance price. I highly recommend all music lovers both young and old , and all music genres to come and enjoy the history of Trap Music. If the history isn't interesting enough challenge yourself and your friends in the Trap Escape Room, it's always going down in the trap. On Thursday there's  a more intimate setting with private tours. I highly recommend this a weekend activity.

We went on a Sunday at 12pm when they opened. Love the vibe while in line and inside it was fun and I learned something about trap music, great exhibits. The bar was open and the vibe was great. Please have a mask or u will have to pay $5 for one.

We had a great time at the Trap Museum. The displays were interesting and great conversation starters with my son who is not familiar with this part of the Black experience in the US. I especially enjoyed the Escape Room (18+ only) and will definitely come again.
Be aware tht parking is $15 on gravel! TI y‚Äôall could do a better and your website says parking was $10, but the parking guy charged $15.
Great place and lots of fun. The entire museum itself will take like 30 mins to get through but when you factor in the jokes, pictures and fun you'll be there for hours.

Brooklyn Quan and Trap House Trina had good energy and really made the experience fun! They were so funny, real and into character. Thought I was really in the trap house!  Well done to everyone involved. I came all the way from Jersey definitely going back because of them.
I highly recommend the trap house. Just be aware that parking is $20.  My friend and I had a great time. The line was long but it moved very quickly.

I really enjoyed the museum; it was definitely a trip down memory lane (my dad turned me on to all things trap). The art was absolutely amazing, I loved every bit of it. I also really enjoyed the opportunity to drink, mix and mingle and take pictures. If I had to say one not so good thing, it would be about the parking/parking lot and line to get into the venue. Although I enjoyed this outing, the parking, parking lot, wait to get in and option to pay more to skip the line was not worth it. Also, I think the venue is too small for the amount of people they let in at one time; it was difficult to enjoy the venue while also trying to manage not bumping into others.
Great museum. If you dont want to wait hours they had a skip the line for 20$more  plus your ticket to get in which is worth it

This was such as awesome experience!  My sister and I did the escape room first which was super fun. The people who ran it were great! Definitely recommend to try out the escape room & the TRAP Museum.
A 2 hour wait for a 10min walk through. Very loud. Kind of wish there was something to actually do in here. On the plus it was only 20$ but you have to also pay for parking üòí

Minus one star because our reservation was for 945, it didn‚Äôt start on time and no one told us anything.

We paid 20$ for parking n I felt scammed, not sure how to explain it.

Escape room was short but fun, the ‚Äúexhibits‚Äù are great all the girls took a million pictures for Instagram/TikTok.
Very cool place & great art pieces just think $30 per person is a lil much but I guess they got to make a living, too
This was a nice experience...be prepared for wait.  It will take about 20 minutes to see the museum.  Love the concept and hope they can expand in the future.

It's a cool place to visit if this is your thing. We enjoyed it. There will be a line outside that doesn't move quickly and during your hotter months it's absolutely annoying. You are able to skip the line for $10.00 cash (side eye wonder if T.I knows this). It's really quaint but entertaining. I would go again

It was overall a fun experience. We booked the champagne tour so we could sip and walk through but they just gave us a nasty seltzer. We went on Thursday so it wasn‚Äôt a line and we were able to take our time and get many pics throughout the exhibit. It was realistic and pretty neat.

First time being here with my Sister's, and we had a blast doing the Escape Experience! The Staff was Amazing, and cool with No  Disrespect intended. I would highly recommend if you in ATL to attend, because the whole lay out it's very Cool with great concept of the Name.. Love The Art Work is very Authentic, Very Informative concerning different Artists in the Music industry.

We escaped the Trap‚ÄºÔ∏è ü§£ü§£ the museum is nice and informative...BUT the fun is in the Escape!.. love the experience and my second favorite the Smoke shop lmao of course lol...it's a wait if you have not purchased tickets in advance...Do like we did Escape the Trap then view the museum...
Great times,  we did the trap room escape and I will recommend it to everyone.  The two young men (actors) where wonderful they really make it worth while. Will definitely visit again
Smaller than expected. Not much to see but unique & interesting. They do have a indoor bar. The line was long & we waited maybe 45 min to get in unless you pay double to skip the line which is $40.
If your a hip hop head like me , you are going to enjoy this museum, so much hitstory , into this music I love .

This was a great experience. While walking thru the museum you can tell alot of thought went into the creation of this project. It was amazing to see and my husband and I really enjoyed it!! Very well managed. The staff maintained professional at all times!!

The museum itself is pretty awesome with historic paraphernalia, old school CDs and mixtapes, clothes, and artwork that has captured nearly everyone who has had a contribution to trap music or music in the south. However, the museum is quite small and for people to have to wait outside in a line is honestly a little ridiculous for this compact museum. Escape the Trap was quite an experience. Our group really enjoyed that portion of the experience. There is also tons of backdrops for pictures.  There's also a bar to order adult beverages. And I actually thought that that was catering to the audience that might patronize this type of museum. It is quite unique and still worth the trip to visit the museum. There are even two small rooms where you can make trap beats and your own song where you can sing or rap over a track.  I love the concept of the museum and the ode to rap music, hip-hop music, trap music, and all southern rap artist alike!  Executed well for the culture. Also, the pricing reflects the demographic, so great job on that decision as well.

Parking was a mess. Line was long and we went on a Saturday. When we got in the Trap it was all worth it. Nice flow, lit music and awesome displays. Lots of selfies from the group. Loved the 10 Trap rules at the end above the bar.
Paid extra to avoid the line wait so we only waited about 5 mins to get in. The museum was a real life depiction of the trap environment.  Gave shots out to the music ppl in the culture.
It was a great experience I loved it I will definitely go again if somebody wanted to go for their first time

FYI $5.00 parking $10.00 admission didn't know what I was walking into. I enjoy all the art installation throughout the museum surprised there was a bar in the back to chill and have a few drinks, me and the wife just wanted to get out the word about this place...

A one time experience for sure. The wings were really good. A little crowded and it‚Äôs a small space. They need a better method of handling that line. It was way too hot and we had to wait for almost an hour in that heat.
The Escape Room was a unique fun experience! The museum is included if it you book the escape room. The line can be long if only want to go to the museum.
The art, photos and trap themed rooms are great! Enjoy a drink at the end at the bar. There are several cute photos opps.

Our stop to the Trap Museum was definately a highlight of our ATL trip! Its only $10 to get in which is a steal for the cool experience! The line was long outside but moved pretty fast. Once you're inside you go through a pretty small space filled with tons of music and drug displays. It's unlike any museum you'll ever see! One of the best parts to me was the food truck in the back. I had an order of "trap cheese fries" and oooo man!! Sooooo gooood!!! Would absolutely recommend you stop by and check this out üòäüëçüèº
Thought it would be bigger, but it was ok. Not to mention a shootout was about to occur outside... could've stayed in Chicago for that ü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
This was a great experience. T.I really paid respect to some of the best rappers in the game in his museum. I recommend this for any fan of hip hop.

Interesting concept and well maintained.  Price was reasonable and maybe a 25-40 min wait time. All in all a positive experience.

Side Note: T.I is cleaning up in revenue on this attraction.
Had a nice experience. Definitely worth the visit, took pictures, had some drinks and had a nice time listening to the music.

I gave 4 Stars because 3.5 wasn't an option. While I understand the concept behind the museum,  it is truly a Trap for your money but this visit was on behalf of my teen.
Parking:
There's 2 sets of parking. One behind the gate for $20 and the other in an opened lot for $10.
The Wait:
The hype is definitely behind how many people are standing in line. We visted on a Saturday and waited in line about 45 minutes before the museum opened at 12pm. It was HOT and a cold bottle of water could have been included with entry. If not, someone should have been present before doors opened to sell water to guests. Thankfully we were in line with an entertaining crew to help pass time.
Entry:
I didn't quite get the purpose of purchasing tickets online AND signing a waiver when you could have just walked in/up paid cash or paid with a credit card. COVID Protocols DID NOT EXIST! The young lady handling the foyer area and money crowded everyone into such a small space. There was no organization when it came to ticket holders vs cash payment vs credit card payments.
Inside:
The inside was ok. The only thing missing was the trace of a body on the floor. If you are from the hood and have been exposed to the life some of the exhibits are very familiar. We hung out there for about 30-45 minutes because I purchased one of THE BEST mixed drinks. The price of the drink pouch was a rip off!

$20 to get in.. Then someone came out offer another $20 to cut the line due to HOT ATL temp outside.. 2x attended different & new stuff to see.. Cash bar.. cups & bottle water souvenirs.. Enjoy stay 6ft apart

This museum was a great experience as a tourist. Lots photo ops, has a bar, music, dancing interesting TRAP decor. I would say it‚Äôs more of a fun activity rather than a historical educative museum. Most of the attendees are also dressed up festively so also fun to people watch and make friends.

I really enjoyed it because it was something different. The later it became in the day the more like be the place became. They say it's a museum but try club lbvs. I believe it's time to expand it out more artist baby pictures up, place TI clothes in glass to protect it and and a professional photographer. Great idea I believe all cities should have one with the rappers from there in it

Super small and overrated. We were charged $80 total for two people. It was $20 each (2 people = $40 total) to hop into the express lane in order to skip the long line. We were charged an additional $40.00 once we were inside. Once we entered, we were done looking around in 1 hour. The place is surprisingly small. My partner is a hip-hop head and was underwhelmed. This place is over-rated and not worth the money. I'm pretty sure we got ripped off?

First time at the trap museum Traveling from the west coast. Only rating 4 stars due to being crowded. I suggest that time slots be use so that everyone has a chance to take pictures and enjoy the museum without being on top of each other. Families that bring kids expecially would benefit from it. Overall great experience for the first time.
We came for the sip & trap on Thursdays! We booked for a thursday at 8:30, there was no line outside, parking was $20 right next to the building. It was  busy when we came but we loved the museum!

Luckily we arrived early enough to have a pretty decent spot in line. The inside was nice, a little hectic tho with all the people coming from everywhere. Theirs a bar inside with a pretty good selection of mixed drinks, the experience was cool as hell.. bonus: the guy a/ the end selling shirts and other items was dope af!!

I mean its only 10. 30 if you do the escape room. The escape room is worth it too mad fun and you skip the line.
I mean for an additional 10 you can skip the line but I feel like for that price might as well do the escape room
True, it's pricey, especially for how small it is. Parking truly sucks. That said, I'd go again, and again, and again.
Was a grest experience! Customers were turned up having fun. I wish I wouldve got there earlier. Definitely, doing it again

If you are in Atlanta you have to stop by and check it out. Seeing the props, history and artwork was definitely accurate and brought back many things I have forgotten about growing up. Artwork is so amazing! Definitely doing the Trap Room the next time we are in town! Thanks TIP for doing this!
Great experience! Very unique and worth it. I did it with some family and we enjoyed the whole thing. The pay for parking was the only downside.

Awesome for the culture! Thank you future Lt governor Derrick Jackson, BTheNow, The Stewart Foundation, and Tiger Entertainment for the opportunity to join #BridgingTheTrap and their sponsors, in providing technology to our children after discovering the immediate need during the pandemic.

My kids and I were excited to go. I got mixed responses when inquiring about bringing kids prior to our visit. I would say kids are ok as they probably listen to many of the artist in the exhibits. My kids loved it. It was very crowded and I'm not sure what's the best time to go if you're bringing kids. Its inexpensive and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I applaud what TI has put together in honor of our culture that often goes overlooked for its contributions to music .

Trap Music Museum was everything. Larger than if appears. We waited in line about 20 mins, not bad. However we spent almost a hour and a half on the inside. Theres a bar! It was alot of fun. Lots of people and plenty of photo opps!

Not a big spot...takes about 30 minutes to get through the entire place if you taking a lot of pics. However I did like the place. The music set a good vibe, there were a lot of opportunities for pics, the energy from the other guests were good, and the staff was cool... especially the old lady that stays in character when you first walk in. Definitely worth a trip when in Atlanta. Just be prepared to stand in line or pay to jump to the head of the line.

If you love trap music and the rappers that introduced you to it, you'll love this place. It brought back memories and it showed love for those that wasn't from Atlanta but still made trap music. Good vibes!

Place was nice and very creative !
I thought the place wouldve been a bit bigger but overall the place is somewhere to go at least once when visiting ATL

Very interesting and fun atmosphere! We had so much fun trying to figure out the escape room. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Atlanta. Definitely try to make reservations if you're coming as a group
I was so proud to visit the Trap Museum. This is a huge landmark and is making history for the hip hop culture! Way to Go T.I.! Keep up the great work for our community.

Great experience. We are from Texas and were on a girls trip. We did the escape room and the guys hosting made it interesting and fun. The tour was also included. Lots of great stuff to see. Bar inside. Music was popping. Staff was great. I will definitely be back. I recommend to anyone and everyone who has not been. You will not regret it.
We had a blast. My advice is to also participate in the Escape Room!!! The actors   on the tour were absolutely the best!!!

Had to much fun at the Trap Museum wit my daughter! Great experience & The prices are fair ..not over priced..fun for the whole family..A excellent place for visitors & tourist ...Dope Vibe ...Im weird one my favorites is the SPEAKERS!! look at the speakers in detail üíì
I finally made it!!! My favorite rapper!!! Had a great time!!!

I enjoyed my experience. There's a small entry fee for the museum... $10.00. which isn't bad at all. Be prepared to pay for parking, because there is no street parking. We parked in the regular parking lot and was charged a $10 fee for parking. And we were also told there was VIP parking, for a $20 fee. My girlfriend and I visited the trap museum on a warmSunday. We arrived around 1:30 p.m. and a nice line was already starting to form. If standing in the line is not for you, there is a cut line for $10.00. My girl was tired of the Atlanta sun beaming down on her head so we opted for the cut line. Once you're in you're greeted by a young lady with a very jovial personality. She sets the tone for your journey through the trap museum. there's trap music playing throughout the museum, as well as a bar, even though I didn't see anyone tending to it. Make sure that your camera phone is charged because there's an immense amount of photo opportunities throughout the museum.

We were guests of a VIP so luckily we did not have to wait in line. I had my 3 year old cousin with me so we went during the afternoon when it's kid-friendly. We enjoyed the exhibitso. I think if they were more interactive that would make the experience even better.
I am going back so that we can participate in the Escape Room. We had to catch a flight and ran out of time.

The trap museum was a very amazing experience of the history of trap music. The trap music museum was filled with all of our favorite artist and made just for the culture. The staff were very friendly and allowed us to experience the art and music that we call trap music. We were able to take alot of pictures of everything and sit on the infamous pink trap car. The front of the trap house even spelled like a trap house. It was dingy and smelled like old toes and I loved it. There was a recording studio that you could make a song. We really enjoyed the entire self paced tour. Please visit the trap museum of you can because I had a really good time!

I was reluctant to go because Trap isn't really my thing but my daughter came in from TX and has been wanting to go. I had the best time and met some very nice energetic young folk. I learned so much. It gave me a new perspective on the artist. It is actually a museum of artwork created to memorialize and feature great artist. Go!! No matter your age and music taste.
Very nice experience. It's a must place to go visit. Dirty Sprite & Trap Juice are great drinks to purchase towards the end.
Amazing time! Very interesting concept!

A very good experience. The museum is both educational (for those who don^t know the culture) and nostslgic for those who lived through it and helped shape it. The museum highlights the beginnings and continued growth of Trap Music. It is both a great idea and a wonderful way to control the narrative and making sure we tell our own stories.

The Trap Museum is a beautiful venue that brings "trap music" to life. We played the escape room and it was super fun and exciting. The "crack-head" that was a part of the escape room game made the experience come to life! Everything about this museum is well put together. If you are here visiting Atlanta make sure to stop by, it will be $10 worth it.

This was my 1st time in ATL,but NOT my last. The Trap Museum was Awesome to me and my 15yr old. It was over pack but still good. The staff was open for questions,they made it fun.I will be going again

We went to the Escape the Trap Room. It was a lot of fun. The guide was hilarious. I think that there should be more written clues, to lead to each clue. We escaped, but I think when the time is closing in there should be "fake feds" take us out. I love the idea of actors being interactive with us while trying to escape.

This quick little walk thru.  It's not the most fun place to go... but it's cool.   Keep in mind that there's not an enormous amount to see, so the walk thru won't take much time.  Oh, and there's a $10 cover.   Also,  parking was $10.

Of course a trip to Atlanta is not made without visiting the trap museum its so dope to jus see all the great artist and their stuff in there a lot of throwbacks in there and its jus a great display paying homage to the trap artist i loved it and worth the 10 bucks
I enjoyed this experience. Really put together well and shed plenty of information on each exhibit. So glad to see something like this available in the city of Atlanta

The wait is always long, came early afternoon long lines came late evening long line. We just paid the 10 extra dollars to skip the line. The Artwork is AMAZING! Definitely hope they add a 2nd level. I learned that WOMEN were not apart of the Trap music movement which I found interesting
It has evolved and is a proper museum. Crowd was controlled but still full of energy and it was packed!
Very much enjoyed the experience, especially the escape room component. The various rooms and exhibits are also well curated with good art and personal artifacts.
I loved it! I thought it was going to be a little bigger, but it was still great! Celebrating black culture everyday, all year long!
Something you have to experience. The incarceration statistics in the jail were very interesting. Didn‚Äôt like that we had to stand in line in the hot sun or cash app $10 to jump the line.

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit. The line was incredibly long so I paid the express fee ($10) to skip hr line and went right in. The exhibits were great. Very well thought out and realistic of a ‚Äútrap house‚Äù. It also pays a lot of homage to trap legends as well as ATL rap artists. The space is somewhat small so it gets congested but everyone was courteous when you excused yourself to move around. The space has a full bar inside so you can sip and see which is nice. The exhibits offered great photo ops. The only negative I would say is that there needs to be a bit more crowd control for the exhibits. Due to the small space, an area can easily become overpacked and you may miss out on the little details. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit.

I expected a little more but it was interesting. Lots of props and history behind the different artists and their music. There was some entertainment while we waited outside in the line and there is a bar inside which was cool.

My friend has a lil thug in her and this was somewhere she wanted to go. Im so glad I did lol! I've heard of a trap and knew what it meant, but to SEE a trap was so educational lol. A wonderful job with the entire setup! A must see!
It was a great experience. Especially if you are not from Atlanta.
There was a extremely long line, but it kept moving which made the wait no so bad. Is it worth it? If you're into art and music, definitely. There was a dj and a full bar alsoü§´üòâ

The Trap Music Museum was awesome! My favorite part was the studio. They had headphones with an instrumental to ‚ÄòSo Icey‚Äô playing only of out of one ear of the headphones. You could spit if you wanted to. Lol! His real life Grammy was in there too and the clothes he wore to the VMAs! You can take as many pictures as you want to! The experience really walks you through his life and his grind!

FYI: Never go on a Saturday! The line was wrapped around the building to get in! üôÑ Parking was also $5. üôÅ

Such a cute place! Went here a few days ago for a date while visiting and had a good time. There's nice art, facts about hip hop, and just a place that I feel one should visit if in ATL. I heard the art in there changes. There's a ten dollar cover at the door (or you can buy the tickets online) and you also have to pay 10 dollars to park in the lot (so bring cash or drive around and walk).
Once inside you're greeted by this vivacious cute lady whose name starts with an L, it was like Lailasomething...or something along the lines but she was fun! Once inside you can move at your own pace...which is cool. They have a bar in there but it was closed when I was there...bummer. I heard it be litttyyyy and I missed that.
OBV you gotta take your picture on the pink car or whats the point?! All in all go!!!

Me and my fianc√© visited the trap museum tonight as we had booked the escape room experience for her birthday today! The trap museum itself was cool featuring a sizable amount of info, visuals and few facts regarding trap music and a few various artists. The bar area and host/attendant cld definitely use some work as it was clear the gentleman was a little preoccupied. All in all the trap museum itself we enjoyed and wld recommend to those seeking very minimal exposure to trap.

However..

The escape room experience was by far subpar and disappointing!! This was particularly due to its host Johanna! She‚Äôs highly unprofessional and rude. I understand she was supposed to be immersive within the trap experience however, she was very rude and offensive on a personal tone. Several of the members within my party felt this way and for this reason we will not visit the escape room again. T.I. hats off to you bcs this entire experience was slated to & cldve been cool however, Johanna alone ruined the whole experience.

As a native Atlantan, I am torn about this place. It is certainly our history, especially for those of us who came of age in the late 80s and 90s. I loved seeing the old photographs of a city that I love, one that has changed so much. I also respect some of the signage that educates visitors about the prison pipeline for black boys and men as well as the story behind trap music. But the multiple walls of guns and another wall made of bricks of cocaine was just jarring. Real, I am sure, but also overkill, in my opinion.  The $10 charge is meh but understandable as this museum will never receive public arts funding, I am sure. The escape room, again too much. All in all, it was certainly an experience.

I took my teenage son here on a Saturday evening. I was able to purchase our tickets online before our visit and I appreciated that there was no expiration on the tickets and I could use them on any Friday, Saturday or Sunday that we chose. We really liked the displays and how real they felt.  For those who would like a beverage there is a bar inside and a DJ. There‚Äôs also a food truck located right outside the exit. There were a few things that I had issues with:
1. This place is operated like a night club. There‚Äôs one long line for general admission, but you can pay an extra $20 per ticket to jump the line ($40/person). So while we stood in line for over an hour people were arriving and walking to the front of the line. The line jumpers get priority so the line moves very slowly. The website doesn‚Äôt mention a ‚Äújump the line‚Äù fee, and there‚Äôs no separate line for those who purchased tickets online. So we waited in the long line with everyone purchasing general admission tickets.
2. The museum is really small inside with limited space but there was no control of the amount of people allowed inside at one time - like a night club. Also, the website says masks are required upon entering, but this was not enforced so maybe 5 of 100 people had on masks.
3. Parking is limited and you have to pay. And depending on what person is controlling the lot the price to park will vary. I was not aware of the parking before arriving and I didn‚Äôt see parking mentioned on the website. When We first arrived there was a man controlling the lot and he said the price was $20, cash only. I did not have cash so I set out to find a nearby lot for free. I was unsuccessful so I found an ATM, withdrew cash and returned an hour later. When we returned there was now a woman controlling the lot and her price was $15. And it only took 20 minutes max to go through the entire museum.
3. T.I.‚Äôs son King was there, and while we stood in line he came out of the museum at least twice to pick young ladies from the line that appeared to fans of his and escorted them inside for free - like a night club.
4. There is smoking allowed on the premises. We we literally standing in line behind a couple and the man was smoking weed, and being encouraged by a couple of the employees.
My teenage son enjoyed the visit but for me it felt like a nightclub disguised as a museum. I would not recommend bringing children under 17.
The line formation process wasn't very organized, parking sucks, but the museum was cool. I had a good time.

Really nice place for the family or a date night! It is very clean and spacious. There are a variety of activities from mini golf, rides, arcade games and laser tag. The prices are great too. The concession stand had a good selection. The party areas seem nice as well. Will definitely be back when we visit the Charlotte area.

Great place to hang out with friends and family! We enjoyed bowling here. The food was really good. We got boneless chicken wings, fries, calamari, burgers and pizza. The food was all delicious and freshly prepared. The wait staff gave good service and food was reasonably priced. During weeknights the place isn't as busy so you can really enjoy the games and atmosphere. During the weekend it can get packed from what we were told. They also have outdoor rides like bumper cars and teacup rides but we didn't try those today. We will be going back for more fun and food soon.

Great place for everyone, family,friends or date night (fyi, if your thinking of date night, Saturdays they have a child curfew at 8pm, Anyone under 18 will be ask to leave) We were here on Monday around 2pm and it wasn‚Äôt crazy busy or maybe it was but it‚Äôs a spacious place. Staff were friendly, facility was clean, food delicious at the lounge, they also have a cafe area where they sell snack items. My phone died before I could take more pics, but will be back for more fun.

Great place to go have some fun with family / friends.. whether you like bowling, mini-golf, go-karts, arcade games, laser tag.. they even have some amusement park type rides.. good food n drinks.. good vibes.. lots of entertainment!

Impressed on the size and variety of things to do at Frankie's. Love the fact they have mini golf and 3 cart tracks. The place is spacious and lots of indoor and outdoor seating to eat or just hang out. Lots of arcade games to play and enjoy. They also have lazer tag, indoor bumper cars and virtual reality games.

Cool spot for all ages! They have a plethora of games & several rides. We celebrated my little brother's 6th birthday here & the food was inexpensive. We had a ball!! We also took over the üèÄ games. My family is very competitive ü§£ü§£ prices are reasonable!

Fun, Smiles, Joy, Screams, Excitement, Family Fun, Corporate Team Building, Awesomeness is what you get at Frankie's. I came here for my first time for a team members birthday and they LOVED IT! Then I brought my clients here for fun as an exciting REALTOR¬Æ who knows and cares for their clients. We absolutely LOVED IT. START by getting a card and load it up. 2. Hit the outside adventures and enjoy mini golf or the racing! Oh, don't forget the Slick Track where you can drift. 3. Back inside let the kids play laser tag? While y'all hit the virtual rollercoaster interactive Dark Ride and laugh the whole way. 4. Hit the arcade where you have something for everyone. From Mario Cart, to competition games, to basketball hoops and the "Big Drop" 5. Keep your eyes out for the bumper carts indoors. 6. The bowling is intense with great lanes, shoes and wow music. Sneak to the back to get a drink if you desire. 7. Enjoy more of their food selection around the corner at the cafe. 8. Finally, don't forget to trade in your arcade points for Awesome well valued prizes and candy before you go. Frankie's! TRY IT OUT. P.S. try the "virtual hyper deck" a fun experience!

It was our first time there I took my 6yr old daughter & 1 of her friends and they had a blast! They had everything from go carts, bumper cars, lots of rides, huge arcade & a restaurant & bar. The place was pretty busy but, was lots of fun for the kids. Also, its kind of pricey to eat there so we decided to grab something to eat at Chic Fil A before we went in. We just had an awesome time we spent about 3hrs there & we plan on going back again in a few weeks we just love it that much! We highly recommend this place for familys or really anybody who likes to have fun!

This place is not just a place for children, if you wanted to go on a date, I could see adults going here and really enjoying them selves. It has food, drinks, games and rides. What more can you want for fun!! Oh yeah, my children had a blast!!! FYI. I had six children with me and I spent about $260.00 dollars which cover ever ride and almost all the games. Its a win win place!! After all you get point for playing games and then you  turn your point in for gifts. It's like a Chuck E cheese and amusement park put together.. Enjoyed üòâ

Great time with ladies bowling. Ordered food and drinks which were a little costly, but it's expected on a Saturday night. Make reservations if you are bowling as they are busy, and it makes it easier to get a lane. Our lane kept having issues, but the manager did give us a free game. Great outing for ladies, date or family.

Went out for a play date with some friends! Definitely had fun with the kiddos here we got there at Noon it was the perfect time to arrive. They do get busy fast! This place is enjoyable for all the family. Definitely will be returning. If you have young kids after 5pm
On weekends expect a crowd.

What an amazing place and amazing experience.  My granddaughter and daughter absolutely loved it at Frankie's. They loved the rides, the go carts and Laser tag. So much to do all at one place, you could never get bored.

Wow is all I can say! This place was insane!!! Hugeeeeee game selection! Vr. Immersive VR. 8d movie. Arcade games. Claw machines. Go cart tracks (4) carnival rides (3) tons of stuff to do like you could spend the whole day here an still not do everything!
10/10 we will 100% be coming back!!
Also hugeeee prize selection. Good prizes for good ticket cost.
2 adults and 1 kid playing we spent 100 bucks and was there for 5 hours.

We had an amazing time here this past weekend. My husband and I were on a little weekend getaway and decided to come here. We got here as soon as they opened Saturday morning and had a blast. Our absolute favorite was the virtual reality games! So much so we went and purchased an oculus VR game lol We‚Äôll definitely be back and next time we‚Äôll bring our kids ü§£ü§£ü§£

We had a fun time here. Lots of different games and options. Between arcade style shooters and cranegames there is something for everyone to delight in. A great family place during the day. And more mature crowd in the evening. Rides inside like bumper cars and go karts/mini golf outside. This place was cool. It feels like it was a little steep for the price compared to some places we have gone to. But it was still worth it. Had a small issue when we went to get a prize. They were out of but still had on display. Clara was awesome and helped us out. And I ended up getting the gryphon I set out to win! Food in the Cafe looked alright but we didn't eat.
Would recommend as a place to stop off and bring out your inner child ^.^
We had a good time at Frankie's. We Celebrated my Daughter in law Birthday there.. The staff there was nice and friendly..  We will be came...

We went to frankies back to back after 1st visit. My husband had a great time playing his favorite games while i kept the kids üòÜ. We did go on couple of the rides. The go karts are so much fun i can go on them all day. Down side is you will spend a lot of money if you stay there longer lol.
Amazing. Had a blast. It's like a miniature amusement park, and Chuck E Cheese for adults!
My first time visiting Frankie's with family.  Definitely worth visiting again! Had a great time playing games. The food was ok.
SUPER EXPENSIVE, lackluster staff, lots of the games and machines are broken.  Parking can be non existent on the weekends. It‚Äôs clean though. They keep the floors and bathrooms clean.

The family and I had a blast!!! We made sure to get there right at opening. Enjoyed some bowling, had a good lunch. Highly recommend the cheese pizza and loaded nachos. Then we had some fun on bumper cars and the swings. Finished off with some mini golf. We will definitely be back. Arcade and go carts are definitely next!!!
So much fun love this place.love the 3d theater.

My neighbor took my son here and I picked him up. This was my first time here and I will definitely take him along with his friends. My son had a blast. This place is a mixture of Dave and Buster's and Sport's Connection. It is very upscale for a fun center and there are a few lounges for the adults. I didn't get a chance to go outside but they have attractions outside like race cars. This is a great place for parties and fun with the family or just your friends.

First time here. It's a Dave and Buster's without the mall plus outdoor carnival rides. $8 for unlimited time in the play zone. Games average $2.00 per play. The outdoor rides $10 and less. Bumper cars are $8 per turn. The food was much better than expected. Have to budget accordingly but overall a really good time.

Pretty nice place to have some fun. The games and rides are pricey, but 10 bucks for mini golf is pretty good. Everything is brand new and the have a lot of different choices. Didn't have anything in the cafe, but looked large and clean. Nice bowling alley, have to rent the lanes by the hour, which makes it very expensive to play. Good selection of prizes for the kids to exchange the tickets they won playing the games. Would be a solid 5 stars if the prices where a little more reasonable.

This place is fantastic and has everything you could want to have a wonderful day with your kids. There are games, rides, Putt-Putt, go-karts, bowling, an area for climbing, food drinks and a whole lot of other things to do for kids as well as adults. The games can get expensive quick but there are plenty of ways to have fun without spending a ton of money. Great place for kids in Charlotte!

New place just opened on the 6th of December. It's like a Dave and Buster's. They have bowling, laser tag, bumper cars, putt putt golf, video games etc. The staff are good. The wings were cooked perfect and were good but small, the sliced pizza was not bad but skimpy on the toppings I couldn't tell I had extra cheese. There is 6 multi flavored fountain machines in the cafe lounge. There is a bar lounge also. They have all kinds of game packages and attraction packages for bday parties. Open  S-T til 12am and F&S til 1am. Kids stay til closing as long as they are accompanied by an adult.

I would describe this as an adult fun park. We went here for work summer party. A few hours of bowling and mini-golf. The place looks brand new and has arcade games and go carts. I would say it is a little pricey but a nice new facility.

Visited during pandemic, it was very clean, no crowds, everyone was wearing a mask. We drove the go carts and played later tag. I think mostly everything else was closed due to covid. No gaming at all, but we still had a ball. We will be back!
Alot of fun, great scenery / landscaping. Overall was a great place to visit. I just wish they did discounted bundles, because paying for each attraction individually is VERY expensive.

A great place to bring your family for some fun.  We ended up coming back the next day.  I feel it's better than Dave and Busters & Celebration Station. Only thing is I wish they offered like some type of unlimited pass  because all these games and attractions add up especially when bringing multiple people. But overall you will enjoy yourself!
This place is amazing on the weekdays! Bowling and go cart was fun! Try out sometime! The staff was great too!
We took our grandkids there today. We had an awesome time. A little pricey, but worth it!!
Very clean environment, great customer service, lots of fun activities. Definitely coming back. Highly recommend.

It was a nice surprise to see that this location had a bowling alley and a mini golf course!! Something I have not spotted at the Raleigh location! As always, go karts are a blast. Played me a lot of skee ball too!
Was alot.of fun, prices a little high but its to be expected with a place like this. They should come up with some sort of unlimited passes. Food was also really good here.
Great place everything fun to do. Food is ok. Go cart tracks are so much fun. 3d AR is incredible. Fun for people of all ages. Closes at 8pm for those under 18.

This was my 1st time going to Frankie's in Charlotte and mannn was I blown away. This totally beats Dave & Busters and the old Celebration Station. The place has bowling, Laser Tag, Go Carts, Vr Gaming, and amusement rides on the outside. Not alot of stuff for small children but I highly recommend it for 7 year Olds and up! This place has a nice layout and I also like the fact that it has a Cafe. I highly recommend you go early during the weekdays to avoid those peak hours. I hear it gets crazy. I will definitely be going back though.

Today was an amazing first experience at Frankie's Fun Park. We can't wait for our next visit and look forward to trying new rides, the mini golf courses, and the other race tracks.

We love this place!! FYI they don‚Äôt take cash app cards.

I like to come to this place to enjoy with the family, but today I was quite disappointed, we were in a game next to the basketball court üèÄ, the boy who was playing threw the ball and it bounced, and it hit my sister- in-law's face , he broke her glasses and also scratched her face, he just turned to look but he did nothing to help us, we also know that it is not his fault but the park's for not having proper security for this game, when we went to the counter we asked them for first aid because she was bleeding, but they only gave us a band-aid for her face!!!!, we asked her to call the manager and when he came told us that they couldn' t do anything, we asked him if the park has insurance on this type of cases and said no, only that we had been very unlucky, the lens of the glasses was lost and when we went back to look again we were hit by a ball , it is something that they need to change because it is a place where many children spend  and they can get seriously injured, also the atte ntion of the staff was not kind or adequate in this situation, be careful with your children and family
Good place to hangout with family and kids on a weekend. Good place to hangout with family and kids on a weekend. Can get very crowded. Plan it accordingly earlier in the day.

I loved it you use a card instead of using tickets for the carnival rides bumper cars you can also use your card for the arcade games and it saves the tickets you win into the card when done just go to the prize counter and give them your card to redeem

Great place for the family. You can spend your money very fast here with the family,but a great place for everyone to find something they would like to do. Staff was okay...Young kids working but they are the only reason I would give 4 stars instead of 5

Full of FUN!! Definitely a one stop shop it has so much to keep you entertained from go karts, bumper cars, virtual reality stuff, arcade games, bowling , golf and so much more! Really enjoyed being a big kid again!! Date night was so fun!

I came 2xs in past month 1- to celebrate my nephew's graduation & 2- my colleagues bdays (3 of them). The vibes here are great for all ages!!!

I love how the kids enjoy the games.  I love the bowling area as the atmosphere is great & the music/vids make the space a true vibe. The food is AMAZING like literally can come just for that & be satisfied.  Lol. The drinks are great too.

Not a bad place for a cheap hotel!! Front desk person was very nice and very helpful!! We even cracked a couple of jokes, had to keep it light and happy üòä!!!! Thanks for all your help and patience with us!!!

Smelly already on the hallway, RM. 138 has fire alarm but removed which is a violation. The ceiling on top of bath tub is ready to fall which is also a risk. Rusty tub. Patches of paint on the ceiling.

Badly run down. Smoke detector ripped out of ceiling. Hair dryer ripped out of wall. Sink cracked, tiles missing, no sink plug. Safety latch ripped off door frame. Furniture stained and dirty. Most lights didn't work. Loose outlets in the walls. Air conditioner filthy.
We arrived late - saving graces were clean bedding, clean (if poorly maintained) bathroom and clean terry. We slept and moved on early.

Bad experience! Don't recommend! This place is not like the photos on their web site or Google. A deception since our arrival. When I made my reservation, I made it for two adults and a teenager... no sheets for the sofa bed nor they keep any additional available. The pool was out of service, killed two spiders in my bedroom, breakfast was a joke... coffee, cereal and sweets The reservation guy said they had hot breakfast.. Lie. To top it all off, someone tried to get into my room at night... happens the front guy gave them the same room.

For the price point (a little over $100) it was a very good experience. The mattress was perfect, 4 fluffy clean pillows, blankets and bedding were clean and smelled lovely.
The carpets were also clean and didn't feel gross when you walked on it barefoot. The bathroom was also clean but a star lost for the condition of the tub. It was very oddly shaped and slippery when I was taking a shower, BE CAREFUL!
The general smell of the hotel was clean and pleasant when you walked in, what a nice surprise! There is a decent FREE breakfast bar in the morning but come early to avoid the herds.
Check in was done professionally if not overly friendly. The hotel is located on a dead end but strangely, it's a very peaceful and quiet place. 4 ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ We will def come back to stay when we're in KC.

Paid 75 a night for this place, small tv, not clean. The bathroom was gross, caulk coming undone with mold growing in it. The ceiling part was coming down and glass missing. Outlets were broken and missing. If this is remodeled im shocked. The only thing great was the staff and how pleasant they were and helpful. In addition to that the lock on our door is busted so have to put the chair there just to feel slightly safe.  Wont be staying here again,  for 75 a night i expect at LEAST clean. Ive been in so many hotels and this one was not on the list to revisit.
This place is a dump.  It will keep you warm and out of the elements, but that is about it.  The pitbull that jumped on me in the hall sealed the deal for this review.
Room smelled awful, the toilet handle was falling out of the toilet, and other customers warned us upon entering the hotel to lock our cars because they were getting broken into.
