Eye sore, dirty....not well maintained.. larry moe and curly are the maintenance crew...tiny rooms

This hotel is all hype and no substance. If you like ridiculously tiny overpriced rooms with concrete walls then this place is for you. We walked into an 80 degree room because their AC was on the fritz. Didn‚Äôt cool down till late at night. One entire wall is a floor to ceiling window so by noon you have to use the blackout shade to keep the room cool. So then it feels like you‚Äôre in a prison cell.
Location is great but otherwise too many cons:
- mandatory valet parking at $46/night.
- weak AC and water pressure
- room is so tiny with barely a closet and no dressers so you have no place to put your things. Barely have a place to walk.
- the blackout curtains don‚Äôt work properly and suddenly go up and down on their own.
- hotel is on Wilshire so tons of street noise (windows are not sound proofed)
- construction going on next door
- plumbing is terrible
- gym is tiny in relation to the size of this hotel (as well as their pool).

It‚Äôs just not worth it for what they charge. Definitely not a place you want to stay at for more than a night or two. The tv is so high and can‚Äôt be adjusted to tilt down. They really haven‚Äôt put the guest at the forefront of their design decisions.

Very nice and good looking hotel located in a great central spot for your LA trip with friendly staff. Our room was on the top floor and we enjoyed our view of the Hollywood hills. Totally worth the extra bucks. The Alfred coffee shop located in the hotel lobby is very convinient to start your day off. If you want to park your car by yourself and not use the hotel valet service, you might have a bit of a hard time finding a space in the busy streets around or even a 24/7 parking.

I stayed one night at The LINE Hotel on Wilshire to attend the Blackpink concert at Banc of California stadium on Nov. 20. It was a short visit as I flew in from Honolulu on the 20th and arrived at the hotel around 4:30pm. Whoa, a pretty eclectic place ... very industrial, loft-ish style with bare concrete walls and austere furnishings. My room was on the smallish size with a small, but perfectly adequate bathroom, a very small closet and just enough seating for two. The bed faced the floor-to-ceiling wall of glass overlooking Wilshire Boulevard. There is a wall-mounted TV and power shades for privacy.

The concert was at 8pm and I arranged a ride at 5:30pm so I went to the bar for a drink. It's a nice space but there was a limited selection of gins so I ordered a Hendricks gin and tonic. A perfectly fine drink, albeit at a price. As this is a review of the hotel, I'll omit anything related to the concert.

I returned at midnight and wanted to find a place to have some drinks and dinner but it was too late. So, I had to make do with whatever I had in my duffle bag (cookies) and retired for the night. The bed is comfortable though the noise from the street was somewhat intrusive.

The next morning I went down to the 2nd floor where the Openaire Restaurant is located. It's a bright, airy space with a large bar on one side. I had the LINE breakfast: two eggs, pancakes, chicken sausage and cottage potatoes. The eggs were somewhat underdone but the breakfast was fine; at least for an hour. I spent the remainder of my stay in the bathroom in my room ... something in the breakfast didn't agree with me. I do have a sensitive stomach but the only thing I could think of were the undercooked eggs. Oh well, 2 hours later I felt better and checked out to return to LAX and flew back to Honolulu.

Final thoughts ... I like the hotel and its location but I think at least one of the bars should stay open past 10pm. This is LA, not Honolulu. Would I return? Yes, I would, in spite of my issues with my breakfast.

Nice place, open to the public so if you want a quick look around the restaurant go for it. Not to mention if you want to relax for a bit there they don't mind. Very respectful staff and friendly people around here.
Good WiFi, coffee and a full bar in the lobby. If you manage to get a booth with power outlets you juts might find yourself working here all day.

The interior design is really nice, and the big window makes the room to feel more spacious (or the room is actually quite small for the price).

Slippers are provided in the room, and there are many plugs the room for you to charge whatever devices you have.

Nevertheless, the air conditioner is constantly going on and off; it is not only noisy, but it also keeps changing the room temperature from too hot to too cold.

Sound proof is not great - you can hear a lot of noises from the streets at night.

Overall, it was a nice experience for a one-night stay (because I really do love the big window). But if you‚Äôre not such a big fan of big windows, I suggest somewhere else to stay.

I would give negative stars if something of that sort was there. I would like to show some  pictures before really describing about the service because this is what a ‚Äú4-star‚Äù hotel in  Los Angeles ,USA  can offer.
Are they mocking on themselves or us?
Because I haven‚Äôt  had such a terrible service in my lifetime !!!!!
1)We find this 4-star hotel and see that we need to pay for parking when their website actually shows free parking under amenities.
2)We had a long 9hrs journey and we were relocating so we had lot of stuff as luggage and happen to check in by 10.30pm.We told the front desk that we are really tired and what they offered was a trolley and we had to carry entire luggage ourselves, explanation was ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt have anybody‚Äù when they are supposed to have somebody for customers ‚Äúall the time‚Äù.RIDICULOUS!!!!Clearly shows LACK OF EMPATHY.
Well we carried our own luggage since we were super tired to find another hotel.
3)We got into room and we see our bath shower is worn off and broken.
4)No kettle which is like a very basic thing to make coffee in morning, we asked and receptionist could tell us there is a cafe which will be opened by 6.30am.Clearly shows RUNNING FROM RESPONSIBILITY
5)Now I didn‚Äôt know 4 star hotels started keeping open plastic bucket as waste bins in bathrooms.SERIOUSLY!!!!!
6)And the funniest out of all is they have kept a big basket with snacks chocolates, nuts, water and I was skeptical about it and I just called up to know if they come as complementary. Well it seems it is kept to tempt the people to use it and they will charge for every single thing during checkout .
7)Even 2-star hotels actually have hair dryers, kettle and covered waste bins in bathroom.

I don‚Äôt even know what to say .Can‚Äôt believe I‚Äôm given such a terrible service in a developed country like USA.

OBNOXIOUS TRAUMATISED EXPERIENCE OF LIFETIME
This hotel has great Service and rooms ‚Ä¶also the restaurant there is pretty good, great place to get lunch . I always order the salmon salad

Post modern "apoclyptic" Vibe which amplifies the worst of LA.  I will not be back.  Terrible water pressure in the showers.  Street noise so loud.  Not a good place to rejuvenate from a busy day.  Small room.

We booked this hotel because it was close to where my friend lived. I must say I totally lucked out. From the moment I walked in I could tell it was my kind of place. The  lobby had a great vibe, it almost reminded me of a boutique hotel in New York City. The staff made eye contact with me at the front desk from the second I walked in and were eager to check me in. I stayed in a one bedroom king bed studio overlooking the Hollywood Hills. The room was very clean and I will definitely be going back to this hotel next time I‚Äôm in Los Angeles! I walked down to the pool but I didn‚Äôt go in. There was an awesome restaurant down there and a great vibe in the pool, I wish I had more time to spend there but I just went to check it out.

The suite on 12th floor was grand and amazing. I love the view of the street below. My only complaint was that two of the three elevators broke when we were there so going up and down took a little longer. Overall, the room was nice and clean, service was awesome, and the location is close to downtown LA and LAX was convenient.
Great hotel for your weekend in LA. Close to downtown, freeway. The line hotel has a great coffee shop and on The Weeknd there is a dj in the lobby. Overall great experience

There‚Äôs about four bars to go to at this hotel and that‚Äôs the most I‚Äôve counted for a hotel in the LA area.

The vibe is very chill and the pool looks great.  I‚Äôve heard nothing but good things about the outdoor restaurant.  I‚Äôd definitely stay here in the future.

The worst hotel ever. I would rather stay in a best westin that has proper close and double glazed windows than in a hotel room that had zero insulation which made me felt like I was experiencing the LA desert weather as a homeless.
Since the windows don‚Äôt even close properly, you can hear everything on the streets at all time. I could not fall asleep at ease and was shivering every night while I was there.
The hotel is also not hygienic as a self-proclaimed 4-star hotel.
It also charges resort fees. Was there a beach with towel service I missed?

The manager ghosted me after me emailing him about how cold I was overnight and could not sleep. The front staff did the best they could by switching me to another room that also had a broken windows. At that point, I was too exhausted. I didn‚Äôt book a hotel to be packing and unpacking my suitcase everyday.

If you want proper rest, this hotel is really not it. But if you don‚Äôt need to sleep and don‚Äôt mind the cold desert night weather. This might be your cup of tea.

Very hipster/modern vibe to the entire hotel including the common and private areas. The rooms have concrete walls and automatic open/close blackout and sheer Roman blinds to manage the light from the massive full wall window which is essential if u have a view of the Hollywood sign which I did in my King room.

The room was also fit for tech and the inputs for the tv were located in a panel on the top of the desk. I was able to connect my PlayStation 5 and my laptop easily to display on the TV.

The staff was helpful and helped me thru getting my business trip authorization forms to properly charge my business card and holding my bags for me until checkin as the room took a while to be ready for checkin.

Lots of interesting things to do daily from the happy hours at the hotel bar to an array of bars nearby that cater to hotel guests including a speakeasy(if ur adventurous enuf to find it)

There is a rooftop restaurant that is in a greenhouse near the pool. The food is on par price wise with hotel restaurants. This was scenic during sunrises.

There are a couple of art installations including murals and 3-D art inside and out. Artsy and explorers will want to have a bit of free time to roam around and take pictures.

Not much parking the valet stand is quite monopolizing of most of what should be parking but this is to be expected in this part of the city, koreatown. Avoid the crowd use the side door.

The hotel staff are friendly and the hotel is nice but a bit over priced for the size of the room and for the bathroom not having a proper trash can.  The bathroom was a bit dated and tiny.  As I have been told...it's Koreatown not Beverly Hills.  But it is on Wilshire and a significant part of town.
Very hip place, but rooms are literally falling apart. Also, river view was obstructed by a very ugly machine covered roof.
Amazing view of the Hollywood hills,11 th floor!! Nice pice, enjoyable stay!! Nice lol longe and breakfast was yumm

decent and fun hotel experience! the beds face outward toward the windows, which was a super nice to view to wake up to. overall, the hotel appeals more to contemporary experience and aesthetics, which I had no problem with. only complaint was parking service, as the only option is valet. very nice atmosphere inside the rooms and also on the first floor lobby. the second floor hosts the pool and bar areas, which was unfortunately closed at the time to a private event. slightly over priced but overall a good experience here at LINE hotel.

This hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff are all SUPER FRIENDLY and helpful. The atmosphere is divine. The decor is refreshing and unique. Doesn‚Äôt feel like just any of hotel. Beds are super comfy (I have a bad back.) The way the rooms are laid out, makes such good use of the space. The only thing, and I mean the ONLY THING, I could comment on was the water pressure is a bit soft. But that‚Äôs it.

The pool area is stunning, a nice place to relax and read a book while tanning and having a drink/snack. Good wifi. Haven‚Äôt dined in the greenhouse lounge yet but will do so today. I have one more night here and I am happy we chose this spot! Korea town feels safe at night and has tons of good late night eateries!

Will definitely be staying here in my future trips back to LA. 10/10.

My experience at the LINE LA was okay at best, from the moment I arrived  valet parking was $44 a night +tax to the end when I found a roach in our room. Everything in between was Motel Quality, from the damp rooms to the Carpets and bathroom being dingy and rundown, not the 4 star experience they are claimed to be or what the pictures online depict. The only redeeming parts of the stay were the ice machine actually working (To my surprise) and the staff being friendly and understanding.

I love this hotel. JP at the front desk reception was amazing and so so helpful. Room was gorgeous & cleaner than the Standard. Huge bathtubs which is really hard to find. Cute pool. It is now my go-to in LA.

Beautiful hotel, really nice staff, and the outdoor bar by the pool is super cool. Would have given 5 stars but seems they're understaffed and unable to do breakfast at the restaurant next to the lobby and it took 25 min to get coffee and a danish. Hopefully as things stay open they can get more staff to open up food service more.

This is a great hotel and one of the more affordable ones in LA. The service is great and everyone is super nice and professional. There's a great happy hour starting at 2:30 at the hotel lobby bar. Drinks are strong and well made. I booked a room with the view of the hills. Let me tell you, it's totally worth the extra charge. The room itself was so well decorated.. Excellent use of space, functional, industrial, and a little quirky. The bed was confortable and the sheets and comforter felt like heaven. Got early check-in and was given late check out after requesting it at no extra charge!

Nice hotel. Enjoyed our stay. Good if you want to be in k-town. Although as it pitched itself as this new cool trendy hotel its lacking a few things:
1. the latest style of watching TV. No on demand or netflix etc. The connections to attach you device didn't work and didn't have the ability to connect latest Android devices.
2. Noise insulation from outside and noise between rooms. We were women in the middle of the night by noisy neighbours 2 nights. And the Windows are really thin and let on noise and drafts.
3. Service although friendly in general wasn't up to the standard of say a hotel like The Ace.

What was good was:
The room was comfortable.
The view from the room was great of the Hollywood hills.
Cool room design
The reception staff were good

Great place to stay. Central location and ultra modern design with lovely full wall windows looking out over the city. The staff is friendly and they have a number of unique perks such as delivery, media hubs that connects to the room tv, and power controlled blinds. Valet parking is pricey but you get in and out privileges and parking in this area is minimal and expensive so it's not much more than self parking in a garage down the street.

Great hotel in a great location. We got the room overlooking the hills based on previous reviews of noise. Om the 8th floor it was still.quite loud from the street around 2-3am when the clubs were getting out but overall it was a good experience. If I had to complain about something it would be no breakfast option and not coffee or tea options in the room.

Such an amazing hotel. We stayed for one week exactly here on the 7th floor, king bed(for about $1,900US). Exactly what we needed. Big bed, big roof to floor windows with a great view.

Commissary that's attached to the Line is just okay, I found it to be expensive for what it was, still yummy tho! Pool was amazing, never really busy. Easy to order food to have next to the pool. Ping pong, backyard games.

The service is really kind, everyone is willing to help and everyone seemed so genuine. It was quite refreshing.

I'm not sure why some people complained about the concrete and decor, it's super modern/contemporary. It seems like they're really "green" too by reusing recycled art work and keeping the walls concrete. I thought it was awesome!

Definitely recommend this place!!

I booked this hotel with high hopes as it looked superbly awesome from the photos, and we are very grateful that they upgraded us to a Hollywood view because it's our honeymoon.

The decor in the room is fantastic, great tables and chairs with little interesting items here and there. However there's not much space for us to open our luggage though.

The reason why i consider this a casual and perhaps 3.5* hotel only is because of the way the hardware is maintained.

The light in the main room couldn't really detect the switch so it took us awhile to switch anything on/off.

Toilet on our second day decided to clog itself up and we had to call the maintenance guy but it was solved in a jiffy.

Front desk folks are very nice, always happy to answer your queries.

Beware not to book this room on weekends if you are looking for a good night's sleep, as there's the city's most popular bar below and the music can be heard up to level 9 where we stayed.

There is a Starbucks, fast food and some taco trucks just opposite the hotel so it's convenient. Plus it's in Korean town which means Korean food is everywhere

The best thing about staying in this hotel was the views of the city. I have to say I expected more from this hotel. We have stayed in many different hotels in LA and this was my least favourite. I found the customer service at the reception desk to be lacking. It was impossible to maintain a member of staffs attention for more than 30 seconds before they‚Äôd fob you off to another colleague or simply start another conversation with another guest or even a fellow colleague. I found this to be unprofessional for a 4 star hotel. In regards to the room, don‚Äôt expect any amenities included. You even have to pay if you want to use the bath robe. Whilst we loved the views of DTLA and the aesthetics of the room, we wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.

Very impressed with quality of customer service. We had an issue which was handled very professionally by the hotel manager Bruno. We stayed at a nice King bed room with a beautiful view of Hollywood Hills. Room was equipped with TV, Bluetooth stereo, electric blinds and A/C.

I absolutely loved my stay. I booked at the last minute through Mr. & Mrs. Smith and was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the accommodations.

Everything is designed well. I loved the setup of the room and the thought put into the amenities and where to locate shelves and outlets.

I would stay here again the next time I'm in the area.

The hotel is very modern and stylish. It has a cool trendy vibe to it. The lobby has a bar/lounge that attracts a hip young crowd. There is also a small Poketo ‚Äúgift‚Äù shop near the check in area. The rooms are very comfortable and unique with at least one wall that is a floor to ceiling window ... great views to be had. There is a small slightly cramped area with a pool and lounge chairs. The location is great for K-Town restaurants and nightlife.

This hotel was perfect for my stay in LA.  The staff was extremely helpful and friendly too!  The room was clean with a spectacular view, and even had a homey feel unlike many cookie cutter hotels.  The location was a little out of my element to begin, but I was quickly brought in by friendly people and excellent Korean cuisine.  10/10 would return.

Very stylish hotel in a convenient location. Metro is right across the street. Rooms are small but have a great interior. It‚Äôs very quiet. You have a great view. The pool area and restaurant are awesome.

I love this hotel. It‚Äôs quirky and beautiful and eclectic. The service is great. The gym is a hotel gym, better than some but pretty basic. Also two of the three treadmills are broken as is one of the two ellipticals.  The location is killer. The price is great, especially for LA and for what you get for the price. This will probably be my go to from now on when I‚Äôm in LA.

I don‚Äôt recommend The LINE LA for events. The hotel suffered in 2 main areas:

(1) They didn‚Äôt ‚Äúthink through‚Äù the event for the amount of people we had (170+). They got the initial execution, but didn't think about what happens next. Ex: Yes, they had the food stations put up, but didn‚Äôt think about where people will eat. Where will they put their dirty plates? Etc.
(2) Their general answer to everything was ‚Äúno, sorry.‚Äù Not super helpful.

Below is a very high level insight into our issues of different portions of the event.

COCKTAIL PARTY
We had a 3-day event with a cocktail party the first night. The food came out halfway through the event (everyone was starving). The layout of the food stations (empty most of the event) cut the room in half, which made everything very cramped. They had 4 tiny 2-top tables so when everyone got food, no one knew what to do because one hand had a drink, the other had their food. There were no high tops or areas to rest their drink/plate/etc. Let alone areas to put dirty plates. There were more issues, but I'll move on to the conference.

BREAKFAST
Had to eat in the conference room. Okay- forgiven - perhaps space is limited. But for a conference with networking, having meals at a table where they can talk and not stare at the stage is important. You won't get that here. Also, they bring out one coffee dispenser at a time. For 170+ people, they should bring out a few at least for breakfast. We were out of coffee the first 15 mins and had to find someone each time to refill it. Also, there was no place to put dirty plates. You had to find someone.

CONFERENCE
A good chunk or our tablecloths were stained. Some very stained. Some had smaller stains. And some clean. They didn't have any to spare, so couldn't remove the very stained ones. (They should really throw them out). They also had to resort to food station tablecloths (without leg area open for sitting). So about 1/3 of our guests couldn't tuck their chairs in. In addition, the "WIFI" was a mess. We had gotten a sponsored WIFI for our event and were supposed to have 4 logins for admins. Well, the sponsored WIFI didn't work (so the posters with WIFI PW were pointless). The hotel WIFI was spotty the 1st day and 2nd morning. Thankfully they got their hotel WIFI back up right before our panels began and we had to use instead. (It was being streamed virtually, so WIFI was crucial).

LUNCH
Our lunch was in a separate hall (separate building with tables to sit and eat). Yay! However, the lunch station ran out of food - so many people didn't get tortillas for their tacos, or any of the tamales, etc. The line to get food was slow - they should‚Äôve set up 2 areas, but that was the least of the issues.

HOTEL STAFF
We kept getting told they were understaffed. They knew of our event months in advance, so not sure why they hadn‚Äôt planned better. Too few cleaning crew (so wouldn't extend check out 1 hour). Too few bell hops (had to be my own bellman & took conference gear to the front with their luggage cart). The overall answer was "no" to our requests. "No" they can't cover the exit sign of a blocked door behind our stage. No. No. No. The front desk girl could care less about helping, as well. Mind you, some were incredible to work with‚Ä¶ as long as you didn‚Äôt ask for something. I think the issue is the hotel doesn't empower their employees to help and find solutions. Just to say "no, sorry." Insincere, but the sorry is thrown in there.

ROOM
I think overall the room was okay. It's a tight room, but that wasn't the issue. The room set up was just awkward. Some items mentioned by colleagues: closet was too small to hang all their work clothes, no luggage holder, no easy access to items (like the clock with usb plugs is on the side of the bed with no access to it). No switch for main lights (turned on manually at the lamp). Etc.

Want a room - it'll be fine. Want to host an event. I don‚Äôt recommend them. Again, there were more issues, but these were some of the bigger annoyances.

I really enjoyed this hotel and glad I selected it for my first trip to LA. It's directly across the street from the train station and surrounded by several bus lines. There's also a really nice church next to it that's worth checking out. I believe it's the Oasis church. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, quiet and the beds comfortable. My first time seeing the Hollywood sign was from my room! Exciting! Commissary, the hotel restaurant was pretty decent. It's aesthetically pleasing giving it an overall good vibe. I even received cilantro seeds in a package along with my bill which was a nice touch. One issue was the kitchen eating area setup. Because the kitchen is in the hotel and the eating area is separated, the staff had to walk outside with my food resulting in pieces from trees on my plate. Also, while there, a pool party was given. During this time I attempted to get a non-alcoholic drink and was told to go outside with the party goers to order a drink or go to another restaurant downstairs in the hotel lobby. I was aware of the pool party in advance and planned to relax by the poolside once it was over. I was unable to do this since the party ended later than the time announced. Besides these few annoyances, I would certainly return to the Line and reccomend it to others.

Awesome hotel in the heart of Koreatown.

We stayed here a few nights before a wedding to explore LA. Centrally located in town so you can get around to everything. There is a great coffee shop downstairs called Alfred's üòÅ. The rooms have a really cool look, and you can see the Hollywood sign depending on which side you're on.

The last night we were there we found the Korean themed karaoke speakeasy in the back of the hotel ü§Ø. The morning after, we had a delicious brunch at the open air restaurant.

Definitely worth a stay.

It's in a great location, the staff are super nice, the rooms are clean. The problem is they are tiny and decorated like you are in some high class prison. I am thin and hit my thigh on the corner of the beds over and over. I came home bruised. The views aren't that great either. The good out weighs the bad.

I really enjoyed my stay here. The industrial minimalist design in the rooms felt relaxing to me, and the huge windows are wonderful. The room did not feel too small. The restaurants are very good and koreatown is a food paradise. It‚Äôs directly across the street from the subway with very easy access to downtown. Many other LA neighborhoods are a quick Uber ride away. I took off one star simply because there is a lot of street noise, even for this city dweller. The windows are pretty thin, but this was not enough to ruin my stay by any means. Very nice and helpful staff, too. I‚Äôd stay here again.

Formerly known as the Wilshire Hyatt and more recently the Wilshire Radisson, it seems that neither of the major renovations tackled the obvious but expensive task of replacing 1960s single glazed windows. Thus the windows are drafty and rattle if it‚Äôs windy, and the noise coming from the street is substantial. The curtains help somewhat. But, yanno, ‚Äúindustrial chic‚Äù and stuff, so never mind about the environment and/or guest comfort.

So room, service and location was very good however there are some things that I think a potential guest should be aware of. This is a party hotel geared towards a younger crowd. I was here from a Wednesday to Wednesday and there is a DJ blasting music every night especially on the weekends. This is not necessarily a bad thing however the hotel is not sound proof. I stayed on the 11th floor and could hear cars drive by all night as well as the partying from the pool area. The pool area is ALWAYS crowded so there is no time to take an actual swim or just chill before starting or ending your day. The front desk and valet are great. There is no parking so you must valet but they are very quick. The rooms are very cute however one quick note, the beds are super soft. If you need a former mattress, this may be an issue for you. The hotel has a decent gym with state of the art equipment as well as yoga and running events for guest. The rooms also have a great mini bar with drinks, snacks, and even condoms. They definitely make sure you are prepared for anything. The hotel is about 15 minutes from everything so great location. Overall I likes the hotel.

I absolutely loved this place üòçüòçüòçüòç Rooms are so unique and the "exposed" concrete walls are so cool! The Bar and drinks were PERFECT... I didn't get a chance to go in their nightclub BUT there was a long line and it was probably really live in there! Going back soon!

Stayed here a couple of times and is probably one of my favourite hotels I've ever stayed at. A little pricey for a room looking over the Hollywood Hills but sunsets are great from there!

Staff are attentive and friendly. Convenient with restaurants/bars in the hotel as well.

Fantastic hotel with a great selection of bars and eateries. Really buzzing and good quality to boot. Rooms have everything you need. Shared a Hollywood Hills view twin with a friend and it was great to role the blinds up in a morning

It‚Äôs my first day, already disappointed.
I checked in around 8:30pm. Front desk person is kind.
However, after that!
The room was not fully ready: only 1 pair of sleeper(we are two)/two conditioners instead of a shower gel/ not clean state of bathroom.
The heater/ac is horribly noisy so I complained and they recommended to turn it off and gave me this small heater to use.(photo)/
The biggest problem is the noise from the street. I am changing the room to the hollywood side with additional payment. I hope it is better.

Aesthetics and vibe of this hotel aside (you may love it or hate it; personally, I kind of liked it), the Line is a really poorly designed, built, and maintained hotel. Functionally, this is one of the most poorly designed hotels I've ever stayed in. From the signs in the elevator that show the lower floors at the top, to the metal bird hangings that jab you in back of the head if you lean too far back on the backless desk chairs, to the low bare-cornered beds that find your shins in the dark as you try to find the bathroom, to the nearly complete lack of hooks in the bathroom, this hotel screams of design that tries to be ultra-hip with a glaring disregard for utility. Maintenance is also a massive problem at the Line. We visited the pool deck on Friday afternoon to find it littered with trash and used towels. The middle elevator was out of service for the entire weekend, leaving only 2 over-used elevators (which are frequently used by non-hotel guests to go between floors 1 and 2 for the Openaire restaurant). At one point, it took us ~15 minutes to get from floor 12 down to the lobby. But, the biggest problem with this hotel, and the reason that I will likely never stay there again is the windows. We had a room south-facing room on the highest floor (12) overlooking Wilshire Blvd. Despite the high floor, this was one of the noisiest hotel rooms I‚Äôve ever slept in. All night long, you hear sirens and cars revving their engines as they race down Wilshire. There is absolutely no sound isolation from the windows. To make things worse, there is no air isolation either. The air quality in downtown LA was really bad while we were staying there. I‚Äôm not sure if this was standard LA air quality or perhaps it was fueled by the nearby wildfires. But, at night I could smell the pollution in our room and feel it in my throat. Inspection of the windows shows that there are actually gaps in each window frame that cannot be closed. From a sound and air isolation perspective, you might as well be camping out on Wilshire Blvd. It‚Äôs really bad, and I‚Äôd encourage you to really look elsewhere to stay until the hotel does a renovation of all their windows.

All of that being said, there are some good things: cool shop (Poketo) in the lobby, great having an Alfred coffee right there as well, location in Koreatown is great if that‚Äôs your scene, and the views are pretty great. Does that make it worth it? No. Stay somewhere else until Line gets their act together.

I stayed here for two nights with my two dogs and enjoyed it. Had worked being done at my home so we needed a place to stay on short notice and  the process was simple with the hotel. Room was nice and didn't even appear to be a dog room only like some place do it.

Just posting a review of the lobby cafe and bar. Came here for a meeting and it was a very nice place to meet. Client was staying in the hotel so we decided to meet at the lobby. A little loud, but it's the only place you can plug in to change your laptop etc. cafe closes super early, and don't have many selection of pastries.
Loved our stay there.  The room was artsy and different from a typical hotel room.  Pricey though. Room service, parking, and staying an extra 4 hours costed more than our one night stay.

I visitied LA last winter with my hubby. We stayed another hotel before we came back to LA. Because I wanted to see the Hollywood view, I decided this hotel for our last night in LA. The view was awesome. The room was clean and modern looking, but it was much smaller than I expected. The good thing for me was this hotel located in center of Korean Town, so I could walk going to some Korean restaurant. I liked the Hollywood view, but price was bit higher. I don't think I would choose this Hotel next my visit in LA.

This was the weirdest hotel I have ever stayed in with the worst customer service I have ever experienced. After I booked the hotel, I never received a confirmation email. I called them, they diconnected me, I called them again, they said they'd send me an email, it never came. When I got there and checked in, it was $150 more than what I was quoted because there was a charge that was not listed anywhere on their website and had never been mentioned anywhere. This was just the beginning of the awfulness- the room was so small that there was nowhere to even put our suitcases, just trying to walk to the bed I smacked my head on the television. Everything in the room was for sale, including a regular rock for $20 which was just really tacky looking. Speaking of tacky, the "art" in the lobby, literally looked like garbage. It was also impossible to sleep here; even from the tenth floor we could hear all the noise from the street and the other rooms. I never would have stayed here if I wasn't on a business trip where I was required by my organization to stay here, and I'd never recommend it to someone else.

Friendly personell at reception.
Nice view with big glass front, our room was located on 12th floor.
Room service was good but always switched on air conditioning to coldest setting.
Close to Metro and located on large Wilshire Blvd: easily accessible but loud traffic noises, also during the night.

One of the worst hotels I have stayed at. It is highly instagramable but totally impractical. Rooms have a gulag vibe, with a plastic pail in the bathroom that floods and impractical furniture in the rooms that don‚Äôt make the experience comfortable. The worst part is that my room was just above their restaurant that happened to have a party with a DJ and more than a hundred people talking really loudly. It was quite unbearable since it sounded almost like they were in my room at 10pm. I called reception and instead of offering a solution they told me that their bar didn‚Äôt close until midnight. So I don‚Äôt recommend this hotel for anyone who needs to actually sleep!
Location is perfect 30 minutes to every major entertainment hub like Santa Monica beach, crypto center, and HOLLYWOOD STRIP....

Great hotel right in the heart of Koreatown. We stayed here for work and it was a convenient location to get to the both WeHo and Downtown. The rooms are nicely decorated and on the smaller side, but the views for the Hollywood Hills are unbeatable. Try to get a room on a higher floor! The Commissary Restaurant has great food and we loved the greenhouse vibe. Overall amazing stay and we will be back - special thanks to Nick for making our stay fantastic!
Awesome rooms, plenty of space. I like the interior design overall. Has a very modern very raw, abd trendy decor. Most walls here left as bare cement which gave an industrial feel to the place.

there were no korean receptionist even though  korean is main customer in this hotel.
i stayed at the fifth floor room. the room is too small and stuffy.  the room is full of bed.

my room(city view) have problem with the terrible traffic noise. i didnt sleep well.
hence, i have to upgrade my room to hollywood view paying expensive extra cash!!!!

the showerhead was so infuriating. controling the temperature and waterpressure was difficult.

the breakfast menu‚Äôs quantity was small but price was expensive.  but, botanical interior decoration was so pretty and the service was kind.

in short, this hotel‚Äôs cost efficient is row.

Really comfy beds and killer views. It is in KTown but pretty safe area. The beds are facing the floor to ceiling windows and you wake up to a view of the Hollywood sign. And who doesn't love a good mini bar?!

Jeremy from front desk hooked it up when I asked to check in early. Great service! Food from Roy Choi? For real? Yes. And the views are awesome. Also, I was told they have a speakeasy open until 2am. On it!

My god. What do you call a place with a night club thing/bar with dj thing going here on the weekends in the lobby, lots of millennials coming in and out for their karaoke lounge on one of the floors, and the most instagram restaurant in LA: the Line hotel. The rooms are so ridiculously artsy to a point where you‚Äôre seriously questioning the validity of certain objects being considered as ‚Äúart‚Äù. The bed was comfortable however. Will I stay here again? Not unless I have other options. It tries too hard to be different by incorporating ‚Äúunique‚Äù motives from what‚Äôs local, but one must ask oneself, at what point do you just say that the exposed concrete walls accented with tilted floor lamps and random rocks around the room as decor ‚Äî its just too much?

Breakfast in K Town üòç‚ù£Ô∏èüòΩüòåüòåüòäüòäüòåüòåüòå.best location I got a parking spot.
Around .
I'm so glad that live is been good
Is terrible in here, is also way expensive! Terrible hotel I ever been too

Ok.
5/28-5/30
Parked my Cayman S, and one of the Valet broke my car. I was very mad at the moment, but the manager Hamed Jami took care of us very well. He did help us with kindness and offered many options that he could make for us even it was Memorial Day. I came here because of the view, but next time I will be coming here because of their credible and reliable management to customers. I really enjoyed the trip.
Actually we went to Open Air to have dinner. Food was delicious and servers are friendly. Pricey but the ambiance was on point.

This place has really small rooms but it is a very upscale place and has beautiful bars and restraunts. I was shocked to learn hat guests don't have priorty at their private bar and when I was told that I have to wait on the long line like everyone else I just gave up

This is my Mecca. My west coast home away from my east coast home. Impeccably-designed rooms framing vistas of K-Town rooftops and the Hollywood Hills. Gilded decor, interesting ceramic pottery, and industrial concrete walls (did you find the 3D wallpaper?) spark my joy.

Now let‚Äôs chat about the grub. In a rush, no problem, grab a matcha latte and panini from the lobby cafe. Feeling lonely, because you were catfished last week, grab brunch upstairs in your finest unisex blouse. Carbs are your bestie, so tell the french toast your naughtiest thoughts. There‚Äôs even a run club, just TRY it or better yet get a mimosa to-go and skip behind the group in your finest spandex.

Beautiful hotel, restaurant and pool. However, the bed was old and full of chunks, and the area was dangerous. A lot of homeless on the streets. All the places around had a sing ‚Äúwe reserve the right of refusing service‚Äù
Really cool place to stay. The room was decorated nice and the staff was really friendly. Had a cool view of the Hollywood Hills.

Pros: relatively clean, contemporary design.

Cons: low price honey trap, $38+tax parking (2017), $10 breakfast sandwich (sandwich only), $5 small bottle of water / $10 large, tiny living space  (about 15'x15'), crime infested neighbourhood, clunky window motorized shades, sinking mattress, flimsy everything.

Bottom line: this converted (from office) building 2.5 star motel is falsely marketed as a "4 star boutique hotel". Stay away if above $100.
One of my go-to LA hotels. Get a room overlooking the hills, not the road though as it can get loud. Great coffee spot in lobby.
As a photographer, obsessed with the beautiful light in these rooms. Beds are spectacularly comfortable and the pool makes for a nice afternoon break. Really a fan.
Very friendly staff. Clean rooms with great views. Great food at Open Aire and the pool bar.
I went here with my friend since she‚Äôs been telling me that the place is cool and relaxing. Indeed, this is perfect and relaxing. The price of the food is reasonable too.
Gorgeous views. Raw walls. Unfinished decor. Gritty vibes. Great hospitality let me checkout at 2pm.

love the train Red Line train Gold Line train blue line and the purple line you always lying get anywhere in the city and take your bike on the train go to the beach Santa Monica get on so anyone of the county hook up onto the Metrolink take us to San Clemente so you can hook up on the Amtrak train and take it to San Diego
Very quirky place, the wall are clear concrete and the entire style of the hotel is very out of the ordinary, great atmosphere when I stayed here I had very nice feeing.
Nice hotel near the city center, restaurants, and train station is a plus. The room is kind of small for the price, but it's clean and neat.
Great service & rooms. Gym has enough cardio & weights for you to get by and the restaurants and bars inside are excellent.
Second time staying at LINE, and will return!

Afternoon wine at #theline
Rooms are cool too, a bit small though...

Another visit to the lobby bar. Service is below par. Not sure about another visit...
Dining @ The Commissary in a makeshift Greenhouse Rooftop, was a delightful experience. While waiting for your table, get drinks from the bar then find a place sit or stand outside the greenhouse.
The magic is sitting in the greenhouse but you will not get a table and even if you wait for 2 hours! But a Good place to have brunch
Stylish and hip, the Line has a premium feel for a decent price. My only point of criticism: obligatory valet parking, which is rude and slow.
Everything was good but I cannot tell it was fantastic. Because of crazy noise, even night is late many guests could not sleep easily.
Great place, very trendy. Small rooms but most have great views. Try the speakeasy!

Worst Hotel ever.
Very loud in Room ‚ö†Ô∏è Street view & noise like u Re living on street. No Room change possible. Worst Seervice. Can't sleep at night ü§¢ü§ïü§íüò†
Fifth floor windows are super thin. Bring earplugs unless you want to listen to crowds and traffic on Wilshire.
The rooms have a very modern feel to them. The greenhouse restaurant on the second floor next to the pool is awesome.
My fave place in Los Angeles - quiet rooms and beds and quite the scene in Koreatown.
Decent place, the location is very convenient as in the heart of K town.
Amazing glasshouse restaurant with great food and outstanding friendly service. located in hotel so great combination.
Marianne is the right person to deal with. Every hotel needs a front office manager like Marianne. This hotel is close to everwhere in downtown LA
Cool vibe, the pool parties are chill! Going through some changes at this moment- but a very cool hangout!
Excellent place views safe clean hidden affordable gem in koreatown ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è
Great customer service.  Rooms has a modern decor
Hate it, so over crowed and everything is dirty all the time. No one picks up after themselves.
Room was great with the exception of the dildo left in the tank of our toilet.
Comfortable place, nice location, interesting rooms with cool automated blinds
It's great traveling on public transportation.
Dope hotel view staff all great here
Easy access to freeway, and a lively night life scene in the lobby and pool.
Great minimalist hotel! Cool vibe and ambiance.
Absolutely breathtaking.  Artistic, service is outstanding.
Nice hotel with Alfred's coffee in lobby.
Views views views. And the pool/greenhouse is such a sanctuary in a busy part of town
Fantastic views from the room. We were on the tenth floor.
Thing to do in La go to Ktown and stay at the Line hotel and forget about everything and just soak in the view of the city!
Hip Place near Korea Town. If you love Korean food...üëçüèª
A bit pretentious, which ironically, given that it's in LA may be the most genuine thing about it.
The suites have amazing soaking tubs.
Best Hotel in K Town...Simply put..
Great location & nice interior design selections.
The Comissary is great for breakfast. Amazing pancakes!
Really good service, clean and comfortable.
Funky boutique hotel with good amenities and staff.

Beautiful place for photos
Drinks is ok
Nice ambiance and great location
Great experience and great service friendly environment...
Amazing place with almost perfect service
Great vibe, location and views!
This is an authentic butique hotel
Very stylish hotel
Another great stay with Marriott. This hotel has some unique St Louis qualities to it that it even nicer and I LOVED the breakfast in the morning.

3 night stay.  Danielle at the front desk was VERY accommodating. Buffet breakfast on the weekend was pretty good especially on New Years day when you don't want to leave.  Worth the money.  Water pressure in the shower...AMAZING!

I chose Marriott West for our staycation because of the outdoor & indoor pool. This hotel did not disappoint. We celebrated my son's birthday poolside and had the best weekend! Room was adequate. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful especially with Covid concerns. Grab and go breakfast was a nice treat. We do staycations often and this is definitely our new go-to local hotel! Lots of great restaurants near by. Only request would be new lounge chairs around the pool as most of them had broken straps.

Better then some hotels but could be better overall.
Checked in easily. But the key card stopped working when we left the room the first time and had to come back twice to get a replacement.
We weren't told to keep our phones away from the card until the third replacement.
We left for 3 hours and turned the AC down while gone.  Came back and the room was so hot we almost threw up packing up our stuff.
They then gave us a different room after we had to carry everything which took us 2 trips the first time down to the lobby back to the 5th floor. They did give us free breakfast for the inconvenience but would of been nice if they could of met us on the floor instead of 2 trips down to get the room and 1 trip with the luggage cart up.
Breakfast was so so half of the buffet was kinda cold. Wouldn't pay for it so for a free breakfast it's decent.
They also didn't explain any charges so I had a mini panic attacks that they charged me an extra 100 for my room only to go down and have the free explained
Overall a little bit mismanaged. But the greeter is super nice and the breakfast servers have great service.

Good location if you need boarding for a loved one with a person in St. Luke's Hospital.
Room was not clean.  Patient IV tubing on floor under desk. Other patient waste like bloody gauze and tape in unemptied trash. White smears on headboard. Long black hair on towels. A housekeeper was sent to clean up.
.i was in the Abyss and it was not coolatall....
Very trendy
Graduation 2019!
Lovely hotel with a fabulous restaurant!The atmosphere was great - young vibe!The parking fee was high!

Hollywood view is better of course. sound proof is not that good. Room is a bit cold. They bring room service with bojagi, Korean wrapping cloth.

There was a man waiting in my room when I opened my room. It was honestly really scary but my husband made sure I was safe. It was a nice room/ little sussy but the walls were a little dated. 6/10.

Its rough.  Let me start by stating that the employees are AWESOME. Super nice and accommodating. Buttttt this hotel just isn't it. I cant even say the the price and location which were also very good can even make up for it.

Food was ok. Very very greasy and the peanut sauce we had with our spring rolls was basically sweet peanut butter and not spicy or vinegar tasting at all.

Roll for my cheesesteak was basically a drippy greasy mess when I was done.
It is a worst hotel I try it in my life, bad smell, nasty and very old
Very nice stay, friendly front desk. Right next to The Park Expo. Love the free parking.
Great place for a horror movie. It's already dark, dank, and unkempt.
Drug deal took place out of the front door. Smoking galore on a non-smoking floor, filthy vents, kids kicking in walls all hours of the evening. General Mgr ZERO help.

The hotel smelled like weed. Every part of it. It also smelled of cigarette smoke. We had a non-smoking room and there were cigarette ashes in the nightstand drawer. The room had just been painted sloppily. There were several things that needed attention and all of the doors were sagging so we had to kind of lift up on them to get them to close. There were water stains in the armoire drawers. The pillows were tiny. We had a suite and there were two televisions and one remote control. I'm glad we only stayed one night.

Pictures don't do it justice. Pretty sure the bed was not changed out sheets not clean and covered in questionable specks. Mice and bug poo in every corner and drawer. And the smell! It smelled like the in room ac filter had never been changed since its install in the 90s. High five for mildew and decay. Pillows are about 1/3 the size of normal pillows.

I knew I wasn't spending enough for amazing accommodations but for what I paid it should have been cleaned and maintained.

I'm taking  this as a get what you pay for. (98-$100 a night before tax)Breakfast was okay. The warmers for the gravy and oatmeal kept them barely warm(not hot), the coffee tasted old both in the lobby and in the breakfast  area. The rooms were old and the locks didn't  work(inside suite doors). I stayed in a suite and although  there were two entrances you could only use the key card for one entrance. The lady at the front desk was very nice the morning we got in but the staff the rest of the time wasn't  very accommodating. I will not stay here again. I'll just travel further  if I have to stay in this area.

We stopped in on a roadtrip with our dog. This was one of the only places we found without a $100/night dog fee. Front desk employees were nice and courteous. Unfortunately the rooms were not in good condition. Door latch was broken. Loud rap music playing in next room until at least midnjght.. Rips in carpet. Would not stay again. Two stars given for low cost of room and dog fee.

This hotel was sketchy from the start. The person at the desk asked what did we want. No customer service skills. The hallways and elevator smelled like cigarette and pot smoke. The bedroom ceiling was sadly patched and very outdated. Found a few hairs in our bed. Very disappointed.
The breakfast buffet was everything. The staff was awesome. The sheets were very clean. I will go back there again.

I visited as a solo traveler for 3 days at the beginning of December. Hosts of the hostel were very nice and helpful. Bathrooms were clean, water was hot, rooms were warm. No issues finding my bunk and locker. No issues with other guests. Breakfast and coffee available every morning. I felt safe in the area and whether or not I actually was, I was out every morning and walking back every evening/night and didn't have any issues. Will definitely come back when I return to explore more!

Stayed here for a night and ended up with the room to myself. I looked around and asked about the activity board. Very nice and cozy place to stay, with an outdoor area and knowledgeable staff. Everything was clean and organized. At a competitive price, I'd consider staying here again to see what it's like in more lively conditions.

Wonderful location. Lincoln Park feels safe, even during the early evening. And the hostel is within the walking distance of the lakeshore. Stayed here in a bunk bed private room for the night two days before the Chicago marathon, felt lucky that I did not stay here the pre-race night, because the walls and doors seemed to be letting in a lot of noise, which made me sleep not very well. Nobody was shouting or talking in the hallway, but there were always door opening and closing noises even late into the night.
Excellent hostel, kind staff, very clean and organized. I really recommend that place if you are looking for something a good price. It is really easy to move around from there.
We really liked it during our stay, it was very clean and all the staff were kind. I suggest you to wake up early for breakfast.

The staffs are nice. The breakfast is good. The location is near Lincoln Park and other shopping places.
Downsides: The room is cold and the blanket is not warm enough. The bathroom is narrow and somewhat far away from the dorm room, and there's no hair dryer.

This place is great. Very clean rooms and bathrooms with many comfortable areas to relax. It's a hostel, so yes the beds are uncomfortable and the towels aren't soft, but it's a good bargain. I've met a few people so far, but the dorm I'm in is mostly empty. Plus, you can't beat the location.

It was my first time staying at a hostel and I'm glad it was at this location, close to the lake in a nice area. Compared to many a 1-star motel or hotel, it's bare bones in room amenities, but the sense of community and the savings are good reasons to consider staying in one. What comes to mind is a boarding house, which I suppose hostels are akin to, but the staff at this place are helpful and responsive to guest needs and concerns. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the nice patio area. Our fellow guests were from various places and the ones we met were friendly.

Nearby are many nice restaurants, cafes, businesses, conveniences, and bars. To the east is the North Pond, and further the lake shore. You can walk, run, or bike to your heart's content (convenient for pet owners too as it's very pet friendly in the area). It's less than 15 minutes away from the conservatory and the zoo (both free). There are are wonderful museums both in the area and a little further away (but in stone's throw).

Tips: 1) bring your own food to store in the plentiful refrigerated cases (they provide bins and labels) to save on dining expenses or if you have specific dietary requirements. 2) Their parking spaces are limited so arrive within 5 minutes of check-in. It's $28 a night to park there. 3) Alternatively, use an app like SpotHero to book affordable longer term spaces in the area (12 hours to a several days). 4) the kitchen is huge and well maintained, but do your part to help keep it that way (same goes for the bathrooms). 5) if you're looking for fun things to do, check out the activities chalkboard in the lobby. 6) Be respectful, kind, and friendly to everyone there. You will get out of the experience what you put into it.

Stayed here twice. Our 2nd stay was for an entire week. We had our 10 year old son with us, so we stayed in a private suite with bathroom attached. The staff was amazing, so accommodating & helpful when we asked questions or needed anything. Definitely recommend this place for singles & families traveling together.

Its price and breakfast are unbeatable! I LOVE its breakfast the most. You can have well-toasted toast or waffles, hot oatmeal, boiled eggs, milk with cereals, hot coffee, and fruits! The public space is comfy and spacious. The kitchen is professionally well-equipped. However, I dislike its "remote" shared restrooms.... You have to walk through doors to get there. The water from the sink faucets is quite slow. The shower rooms have no racks inside to put my stuff. But other than that, I like it, and I would definitely come back again for it's breakfast and its spaciousness. Oh, it takes a relaxing10-min walk from the subway station (Fullerton), and an 8-min walk to Target and all great diners & Starbucks!

Very pleasant stay. The rooms were small, but very clean. Bathrooms are shared, but also very clean. The staff were very accommodating, exceptionally polite, and helpful (thank you, Joaquin!). The hostel is located in a very quiet neighborhood right off Clarke Ave (5 minute walk). There are a ton of different restaurants and food choices. DO NOT miss Bourgeois Pig for coffee and breakfast! Angela's Burrito Style for lunch or late night dinner. And House of Hunan if you're feeling Chinese. There is also a Walgreens for any travel items you might have missed. All the other guests we ran into were polite and we had no issues with anything. Thank you CGH for making this adventure completely amazing!!

*stayed here in August*

First time staying at a hostel and I was a bit disappointed. The room was a lot smaller than I thought it would be, it was for three people and it got a bit cramped. It was the private one and almost costed $400.

The parking was a big issue for us since we didn‚Äôt get a chance to pay for the parking at the hostel. Eventually we found a lot to park in a few minutes away.

The bathrooms were okay, they were clean which was nice.

My sister got the breakfast and did not enjoy it.

The person at the front counter was nice.

Overall I might come stay here again IF I was traveling alone but will probably check out the other hostels in a Chicago first.

A hidden gem!!! Clean rooms, theater room, giant kitchen, game room. I stayed 3 days my tab was $47. I stayed in a 12 bed dorm room that was only occupied by 5 people. There are lockers in every room. I would have liked to see a fitness area but it doesn‚Äôt exist. Laundry room in the basement was a little creepy but I was grateful it was there. They popped free popcorn and had an event board. The hostel gets 5 stars for safety! You have to tap your card to get in many of the doors. They provided dishes to cook on I enjoyed my stay. Oh yeah and I fell in love with the giant mirror
Its a good hostel, the location is great, in a very safe area near to markets and restaurants. I think they can do a better jobs with beeds, they need a renovation.

Great hostel in a great area. We stayed in a premium crash pad with the en suite. It‚Äôs sleeps up to 5 people but it was just 2 of us. It includes a bunk bed with two twins, as well as a bunk bed with a twin on top and a full on bottom. The room was smaller but would work for 5 people, because there is a nice walk in closet to store plenty of suitcases. The en suite was nice, there was a desk, a mini fridge, a bean bag, as well as a window AC unit. The room was clean, cool and comfortable. The only and biggest complaint/warning is the pillows were terrible. BRING YOUR OWN PILLOW! But definitely worth a try.

This was by far one of the best experiences I've ever had with vacationing. I will come here Everytime! Everything was phenomenal. Personality, atmosphere, location, price, and customer service. The rooms are homey and clean, the bathroom was clean also.

This hostel is a 5 minute walk from the shoreline, and one block over from hundreds of different stores, coffee shops, food joints, and so much stuff.

GREAT AREA OF THE CITY!  This is just a perfect place to visit and explore Chicago!!
This is an amazing location. Staff is friendly and the room was super clean, mattress too!

Chicago Getaway is now my go-to. I've had wonderful experiences here. Very affordable to have a private room that could fit 2-3 people and your clean shared bathroom is just down the hall. Very friendly staff who can answer any questions you have about the city. A breakfast is offered in the morning and they also have shared fridges where guests are good about not eating your personal food (just label it.) It's prime location in Lincoln Park is just a very short walk away from tons of restaurants and shops and public transportation. I can't suggest this hostel enough!

Not bad at all. A classic mega hostel with a lot of beds, good breakfast, and tons of walks of life. I think the highlight of this place is the location. It‚Äôs in a great neighborhood with tons to see and do but also accessible to the rest of the city.

The place is in a cool neighborhood. I didn't get a chance to explore, since I was mostly downtown. With that said, this location wasn't centrally located.
The people at the front desk are really nice. The lobby area, movie area, and kitchen are really great.
My room was clean. I even received a room with a 1/2 bath.
The problem? The walls are paper thin. I was woken at 2am by a rowdy bunch, a guy that kept yelling at the top of his lungs that he was drunk and wanted to be taken advantage of. I was woken at 3am with someone in the next room hurling their guts out for what seemed like 20 min.
The bed was squeaky and didn't seem stable.
There was a huge dip in the mattress that I kept falling into. You felt every little spring in your back. Needless my back is killing me.
You essentially get what you pay for here.
Everything else was great. This place just isn't for me

Well, I mostly like it, because it's quite a big building with a lot of different interesting things, that you can do here - watching something on a big screen, play pool and other games, have a fun time on a patio, print documents, use the internet, have quite a good breakfast. What I don't like - creaky bed and cold room in the basement and it's just November,  I don't know, how to stay here in winter.
But it's quite cheap and cozy and staff is quite professional, and also it's not so far from Magnificent mile and Loop (use bus#22).

Sometimes when you hear or read the word ‚Äúhostel‚Äù, you don‚Äôt book. The Chicago Gateway Hostel is the best that I ever been!

Nice location (close to restaurants, pubs), close to downtown (you can use either Uber $15 or metro)
Very good price!
Paid parking but cheap for Chicago!
Good for family (there is an option for private room and bathroom)!
Clean and super friendly staff!

I was pretty  pleased with my stay. Did I sleep amazingly with a room full of strangers? No. :) and, it was a cheap, also, I wouldn't sleep amazingly anywhere that isn't home. it was as pictured. Breakfast used to be waffles... they are no more. Toast, cereal, porage, some fruit. I would stay here again.

It was a good place, the website pictures def are not a good vision of the place as it looks new and pristine but in reality its okay. Nothing amazing but is located in a central area, close to the lake, affordable, etc. What grossed me was 1. The bedding is not given a softner so it was quite rough and made me itchy and 2. The actual bed cover is gross (see pictures).
Super location in quiet neighbourhood; Friendly and helpful staff; large dining area w/nourishing breakfast; excellent for young travellers.
Very large for a hostel.  I stayed in one of the 4 bed dorms and there was plenty of space.  You can have beers on the patio a walk to all kinds of fun places.  Secure bike storage too

This is a very good option for budget travelers to Chicago. The price here seems to be a little lower than other hostels I have stayed at in Chicago. It is located in a good neighborhood in Chicago about a 5 to 10 minute walk to a train station. There are plenty of stores and restaurants nearby within walking distance. The room I stayed at was basic and clean. The bed was comfortable and there was a bathroom in the room itself (not something I see at a lot of hostels) that was a very nice feature. Customer service was very good at the front desk. They have a basic breakfast in the morning with oatmeal, fruit, coffee, cereal (I have seen better breakfasts at other hostels but since the price of the hostel is lower than many others in Chicago that makes sense. Computers with internet and a foosball table and a tv room also were at the hostel. I would definitively stay here again if I returned to Chicago.
Very safe and clean place especially for female travelers. Thank you guys ‚ú®

Located in the Lincoln Park neighborhood the Chicago Getaway Hostel provides a number of amenities and services that make this hostel one of my favorite budget places to stay. I received free breakfast, free Wi-Fi, bed linens and a towel. There's a laundry room, bike rentals, pool and foosball tables, guitars to play, computer terminals and network computers for borrowing. And the place was very clean! I highly recommend staying here!
Clean, sanitary, kind employees and lots of space to stretch out. Breakfast included was nice too. Lots of common space.
my first time in a hostel and it was the best.  the site is amazing, super nice and clean.  I would definitely return to this site
This is in such a convenient location, the staff was kind and the common area was very nice! So glad we booked our night in Chicago at this wonderful little hostel!

Very budget friendly, great location next to public transport and trendy bars, cafes, restaurants, target, walmart, wholefoods and trader joes. Staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Will be back for sure!
Nice place for backpackers. Delkcio5and nutritious breakfast. Distance from downtown is the only drawback, but that is sort od mangeable

Mr. Benny himself, a kind helpful gentleman who works the desk made the stay at the Chicago Getaway Hostel that much better!
Thanks Benny for your help! Come visit Canada sometime.
Great staff, simple clean, comfortable room, close to the zoo and conservatory. I highly recommend the conservatory.
Nice hostel ! The breakfast is simple but nice. The front desk are helpful.
Had an awesome weekend and enjoyed my Luke Bryan concert at Wrigley field and had an awesome night there may God richly bless everyone that works there
Very clean, good rooms, enough space and pleasant service
It's like a dorm room, but for the money you definitely cannot complain.
Wonderful !! Lot of people and great place to make new friends
Paid parking lot is available for $20 as of Sept 2020.
Great location, awesome atmosphere, love it!
Cheap for young kids, may stay for several days
Great Place.

Too much people and. The black man worker with white hat is super rude!  He don‚Äôt let me cook. But others 11PM still can cook!!   This black man is suspected of discriminating against me

Love great place to relax. Nice indoor pool and hot tub. And gym right next door.
Absolutely perfect
Nice sized room. Clean too. Everything is as expected. No complaints.
It is a great facility!

Very clean and tidy accommodation. friendly staff. Calm and quiet. Experience what it's like to sleep in the original Route 66 rooms Recommended to everyone looking for neat and quiet accommodation on route 66.
We had a rough day of driving. Flat tire and a dead battery, this neat room was just what we needed. Loved the Harley/Route 66 theme! Super cool, nice and clean.

We were excited about staying here and were very comfortable. Check in was a breeze, too. It is an old roadside motel but is very clean. Our bathroom was recently updated. This is next door to the Roadkill Cafe where we got a discount!
Nice and comfortable Motel inside of a small western town. The atmosphere was great. The lady working at the front desk was nice also.

Very nice staff, clean, old school Route 66 motel with a great vibe and some neat decor. The kind of parking we like with our bikes right out front. Everything worked well, well stocked soaps and towels etc. and conveniently located to a couple of great restaurants.

A REALLY NICE motel. It's a bit pricey, but well worth it. The rooms are large, similar to small apartment. Beautiful decor and well stocked. There's even a plunger under the bathroom sink. The shower has plenty of space. Parking right outside the room.
Nice, quiet room with an EXCELLENT heater! Definitely would stay here again as it has that old Americana feel you'd want in a small route 66 motel.
Great little motel. Small room comfy bed..no smell of smoke. The only issue is the water presure. We will forsure stay again.
Nicely themed motel with old school food joints within walking distance
Thank y'all so much for the great hospitality.. This was our first visit but will be back!
A iconic trail of American history.
Loved the pool, the hot tub, the fluffy pillows & staff. Highly recommend.
Great stay & experience! The service, room and food were all very good. Centrally located.

This place is an oasis in one of California‚Äôs most beautiful regions. While you‚Äôre 5-10 minutes from the city, shops and restaurants, you feel like you‚Äôre in a remote country getaway. The terraces open up to fresh wooded air, quiet, and beautiful gardens with swans and flowing creek. It‚Äôs something quite magical. The rooms are modern and the staff is off the charts helpful and friendly. I came here to do a stop over from a road Trip and brought my bike with me. There are some great rides along Mulholland Dr, through the canyons, Griffith Park and Santa Monica beachside ride. So if you like the outdoors, this is yet another reason to stay here. It‚Äôs my favorite  destination in California along with the Ritz Carlton in Santa Barbara.

Attempted to attend the holiday market, but they were immediately at capacity. They didn't have the parking capacity or adequate manpower to inform the endless line of cars that they wouldn't be allowed in. Looked like the attendants were selectively allowing cars in. This event should consider  utilizing a shuttle service and partner with a nearby school for additional parking. Was really hoping to enjoy the hotel and this beautiful event.

Hotel Bel-Air is a hidden gem in Los Angeles, which provides small forests, lakes, swans, and ponds. The restroom is so elegant.

The Wolfgang Puck might be the only dining restaurant within the hotel.

I had the best experience ever! I stayed for a few nights.. The staff goes above and beyond to make sure you feel at home. They seem to genuinely be happy to cater to your needs. They treat everyone like they are a movie star. I couldn't complain about absolutely anything.
Amazing food and excellent service. Thank you Ana for a great experience with my family ‚ù§Ô∏è
Great breakfast, great hotel, very friendly and good service. A nice property.
great food and vibe. don‚Äôt forget to visit the swans
Extremely beautiful hotel with a charming vibe. And the restrooms there are huge and pretty!

Love the mystik and history of this place and they let us park our motorcycles in the garage right next to a lot of very famous peoples vehicles.  That was cool!  The food and staff were really cordial and amazing.  An unforgettable experience for brunch!
Amazing hidden place well-known among locals. In a class of its own. Great for both business meetings and luxurious relaxing parties. Great food. Understated non commerical luxury.
Great place to be wondetfull people amazing service loved

Great Hotel but 700$ for one night?! This is sooooooo expensive and not worth it.
It is better to live in an apartment to see how life in la really is.
Good services and a nice n big room
Very extravagant hotel with all the amenities needed for a luxury stay.  The service in the restaurant was strangely pretty poor, however.

The service is outstanding.
The hotel is beautiful.
Beverly Hills üòç

We didn't stay here (stayed at The Chamberlain in West Hollywood) but went here simply to go to the Polo Lounge and say we'd been... I was expecting it to be stuffy and the staff to look down on anyone who wasn't a guest, but, I'm pleased to say, I couldn't have been more wrong
The staff were all attentive and friendly
The prices were reasonable and we had a great time ... loved it... will def visit again when we're in town in October

Amazing Hotel! Great coffe aswell. The staff is really friendly and service minded aswell. Not to expensive place either, not even the valet, rooms, food & drinks. Worth every penny! Big recommendation.
Beautiful hotel. Lots of amenities.
What a beautiful place to stay. Like an oasis in the middle of the sometimes stressful Hollywood area.

Came to the pool bar and cabana. Really a nice place for a midday light meal. Salads are very nice and the poke bowl was excellent. Outside seating is cool and very comfortable. Staff very nice and helpful. Wonderful relaxing time.

We stayed here for four days. Its part of the Dorchester hotels and as expected it was just wonderful staying here. Everything about our room (it was a large bungalow) and locations was fabulous. The kids also loved it, especially the pool.

I love the hotel! Welcoming front desk service! Adalid is an amazing and caring lady at front desk! I love the food in the pool cafe and Polo lounge! The room is amazing and the bed is the most comfortable ever!
Great food and wine choices! Excellent landscape and layout it's gorgeous! We also had a GREAT time! Great time, Great food, Great company!!
Absolutely amazing dining experience. Great food, drinks and stellar service. Brunch is prix fix at the Polo Lounge - $99 a person. So keep that in mind. Well worth it.

The best hotel in the world.
Simply gorgeous and breathtaking.
The finest of everything.
No wonder why this is the hotel of choice for celebrities, royalty and you and me.
Swim in the same pool as Oscar winners and dine to no end.
This is the ultimate experience that will create memories to last.

George Vreeland Hill
Loved it, recently stayed there and used Mobile Pet Spa. Excellent service.

Amazing. Low key elegance. The hotel itself is just incredible, the rooms are large and comfortable. For drinks head over to Nineteen, the bar. For food and drinks, the Polo Lounge is historic. The grounds are just all Palm trees and the tropical foliage is just perfect. I love this place. A true oasis in the city.
Top notch breakfast place! Fantastic vegan options and they never say no!
Beautiful property with a chic bar, lobby lounge and restaurant. Enjoyed afternoon tea on this occasion.
I‚Äôm so rich that I keep a room there just in case.

This hotel is as unique as it's reputation. A wonderful experience. The 1912 bar is great. It doesn't have the Polo Lounge's notoriety but it has a great atmosphere. What can you say about the pool? There is nothing more to say - it is an icon.

There are a handful of high class and historic hotels in Beverly Hills. Then there is the Pink Palace... aka the Hotel California.  A magical place full of old lore and legend. It was here two years before BH even became a city. When it comes to reliving the past glory days of Old Hollywood, this is as close as you will come. The staff here is impeccable and do not put on any airs. They even parked our Cadillac and Camaro right up front with the Rolls and Bentleys. When you stay or visit THE Beverly Hills you too become part of the story and the tradition. And as the song goes, "You can check out any time you like but you can never leave!"
I didn't stay there but its a must visit while you are in BH. Stop for a drink and visit the gift shop!

Yes, you really can drop by for a cup of coffee, just hop into a cab and go there. Truly amazing atmosphere, photos of film stars all over the place - you might even get to see a real one - a piece of living history!

I have stayed at luxury hotels all over the world, in terms of service and hospitality, nothing comes anywhere close to the Beverly Hills Hotel. I would go back to LA just to stay there. I highly recommend the bungalow experience - grab a bottle of champagne, light the wood burning fireplace, put your feet up and stay in for the night.  Thank you to all of the fantastic crew that make this hotel great!!
Great food. Beautiful holiday decorations
The polo lounge is inside the hotel. Took a little walk inside though. Beautiful and very clean especially the bathroom.
The afternoon tea is wonderful! The view, the impression, the service all are perfect!
This place is so beautiful and relaxing.
My favorite hotel in the world! Elegant rooms, superb restaurants especially The Polo Lounge, lush landscaping. Stayed in Bungalow 5 a favorite of Elizabeth Taylor.
Must be seen place in Beverly Hills. Need I say anymore.......
The Cheeseburger on the terrace was delish. The staff was amazing as well
The best of the best! How can a hotel get any better? Well, this is as good as it gets. You can even walk on the ceiling...
Retro Vibes.  This hotel is classic. üëåüòé
I always love staying at the Beverly Hills Hotel!
The Service and guest appreciation is second to none!
Lovely staff, made my delivery super easy!
Lovely afternoon in Beverly Hills with Lauren Alexandre Lasseur

The Beverly Hills Hotel is Iconic, you have to go and have a drink in the Polo Lounge or the other club upstairs which I prefer. If you Valet Park and get a drink valet parking is taken care of. There's just something about this place that's pretty great to go and have a drink, even dinner.
Go back in time when people and places were real.
A 'pink pearl' in the heart of Beverley Hills. It's iconic reputation with sophisticated service delivers on every expectation.
Tell Amanda to join me by the pool...my name is Roger
Fancy...but expensive!
Beautiful and cozy Hotel! Def want to come back.
Lovely hotel!
Thanks for the memories! Xoxo
One of the best and peaceful hotels in LA!! üëçüôèüëç
Excellent as always
What an iconic place!
Helping my family member with garden work on this beautiful home
You can see swans
Beautiful property and attentive staff!
Hotel Perfection
Everything Exellent
Everything stay as it was.
Just nice
Absolutely gorgeous!!!
I love Hotel Bel Air - everything about it is magical. I had the most beautiful wedding here many years ago. The restaurant is always fabulous, I love the bar and music.

Hidden treasure just 2 km south of Onanole and within a few minutes you are in Riding Mountain National Park.  Uniquely decorated Bed and Breakfast - lots of interesting antiques in this house.  They have 11 rooms available for rent.  Very reasonable rates for the area.  The hot breakfasts we had were well prepared - the hostess would offer different choices and took into account allergies or preferences.  We enjoyed the cheese omelette.  Nice selection of teas.
