The hostess offered a cheese platter as well - extra cost - for an evening snack or appetizer.  Fresh ingredients.  The bed was very comfortable.  Some rooms have the west facing view for great sunset views.  Clean bathroom.  There are no TVs in the individual rooms - not a problem - just be conscious of this.  There is a common room with a TV down the hall for all the guests.  Wifi was decent for the area.
Super clean, very helpful staff!  We used the BBQ hut, it had all the accessories ready to go.  Probably the cleanest place on our trip

Awesome place to go for a winter getaway for kids indoor waterpark adults to unwind & relax or winter sports in the summer definitly something for the whole family to have fun love waverunners & boating camping exc.

One of our rooms was supposed to have a full over queen bunk but it was full over full...made it kinda inconvenient. But we had lots of couch space for people to sleep. We had a 4 bedroom condo and a 2 bedroom hospitality suite but only got 10 water park passes...they tried only giving me 8. It should have been 12 (2 per room...6x2=12) we had to buy 6 additional. No frying pans in the hospitality suite...we were done cooking breakfast by the time they brought us some. No extra toiletries, not enough for 17 people between the 5 units. Water park closed down a few times but we brought enough games to keep ourselves busy. We REALLY appreciated that they kept on top of keeping kids out of the hot tub! Fun arcade, friendly desk staff. Resort is kept up pretty well. Loved the layout of the hospitality suite, plenty of room for all of our guests to gather together, loved having the lawn outside the room to use as well.

Wonderful dog friendly rooms with hard to find water view balconies! We stayed in the more recently built building that is further from the outdoor pool. Clean, comfortable, spacious. The room does not provide seating (chairs, benches) inside the room other than the bed. However 2 patio chairs and small side table can be found on balcony. Quiet, relaxing, with an incredible television. Large king size bed was extremely easy to snuggle in and get awesome sleep. Water park passes (located in the other resort building) were included with our room price, but we did not have a need for those. There is no price adjustment if you do not need or use water park passes.  Also be aware: the water views are most definitely disappointing due to the building structures built between the hotel and the lake, obstructing the quality of the vacationer's view (and the roof air conditioning units constantly running in front of our rooms) but we adjusted.  Just not your standard open air, full Lakeshore experience we look for when vacationing by water. Certainly a top notch dog friendly stop when in the area! Highly recommend!

Family of 4 ~ kids age 7 and 3.
Stayed 3 nights over the Fourth of July 2022.
Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and laidback.
We spent most of the time at the outdoor pool/water park. I was able to keep an eye on my 7 year old as he went down the huge slides and played water basketball. He was able to play freely and had a great time. Kids under 48 inches are not allowed on the big slides. There is an area that has a smaller slide that kids of all ages can use and it was a big hit.
We didn‚Äôt explore the indoor water park much because the weather was so nice. However periodically there would be a 30 min break for the lifeguards and the swimmers outside. By the last day we learned the breaks were not at the same time.
Also,  adult beverages were available and prices were reasonable.  Despite a bar on site it was still family friendly.
The rule of No outside food or drinks was not enforced. Lots of families brought their own snacks and drinks down to the pool. Which I think worked out because the food concessions was overwhelmed and understaffed. The resort appeared to be understaffed in general - likely true for many places in the area right now. But like I said everyone was friendly, and pretty chill.
Lifeguards did not enforce much either and at times arguably may have been a sleep. Life jackets are allowed, and I would highly encourage them for kids who cannot swim well. My 3 year old wore a puddle jumper and it was perfect. Nearby restaurants were amazing and had a great time at Arnold‚Äôs park. We will go again!

We booked thru VRBO. We had the most gorgeous Condo with beautiful views. Pricey for sure. Waterpark was so busy we waited til end of their day to try to enjoy it. Should have been there at open as well. Kids enjoyed the arcade. Zip lining was fun. Gym was perfectly usable.  Service at the resort had a few hitches. Had to give me 3 gym cards because they kept not working and we were informed how to obtain our Waterpark passes but staff needed alot more. Of course internet was poor connection there so couldn't get the information they needed. Located a block from Triggs to rent water toys is convenient

Really enjoyed my stay there. Any help I needed the staff at the front desk was more than accommodating.  The indoor water park was a blast for all and the lifeguards kept up with the busy crowds and cleanliness of the pool and surrounding areas.
Great views. Our food was good, just not great. Most friends that go regularly say we must‚Äôve caught them on a bad day because it‚Äôs usually great.

The whole complex seems pretty nice. The staff is friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the water park is not open yet. There is a large game room with electronic type fun games that I'm pretty sure we won't be taking little girls too? A workout room with treadmill etc.
Our room has an issue, a little leakage around a window air conditioner not sealed properly, a slow tub drain and the door to the deck would not close and latch during the rain storm. (Seems fine now) The room is very nice though, beds are comfortable, fridge, tv. All in all very nice I would come back here again someday.

Very nice and up to date. we had 3 room condo. Was very nice and roomy for the 8 kids and 4 adults we had with. The water park was great, but was pretty packed. And they're adding more condos! They'll need to expand their water park next.
Great location, facility & access to water park. And the view from our balcony stunning!

Brides and Grooms!!!  We have been playing in Okoboji, Spirit Lake & Arnold's Park since 2005. This is definitely the new hot place to have your reception and ceremony!  They have the perfect ceremony area outside with an altar ready to go.  A perfect view of the lake right from the ballroom caps off the evening.  The staff is excellent, friendly, and very attentive.  A special thanks to Nicole who took care of us all night and made sure we had everything we needed from load in to load out.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS NEW AWESOME VENUE!

TECH TIPS FOR ENTERTAINERS... Make sure you leave extra time for a load in... There is some distance from the front door to the ballroom.  Also bring extension cords in case you need to split your power requirements between two breakers.  There is only one main outlet behind the staging area.  I ran the other cord outside to the outlet where I set up to do the ceremony.  You're going to need a 100-footer to get you back to the main setup inside.  The acoustics in the room are great, and they have full control over dimming the can lights in the ceiling and also the chandeliers over each section.   - Joey

Very fun resort for the whole family! Kids love the waterpark, and adults can enjoy the outside pool. We shot hoops for hours. Highly recommended the lakefront suites. The views are amazing from the balcony.

great place to take a family vacation. We got a pontoon for a day, $500 and well worth it. We also went to Arnold's park for a great evening of fun.  We ate at a local restaurant on the Bay too! tummy food, friendly staff and the prices were fair
Great place to stay with family and kids!
Absolutely the best resort on Okiboji.   The rooms are incredible, free water park, east to rent jet skis from the near by place.     The zipline looks dumb but is actually a great deal of fun.
My family loved the hot tub, all of the slides (little kid and adult), and just relaxing on the lazy River. Will definitely go back if we visit again.
Great times, shallow pool and water park for the kids. Oddly everything closes early. But the property is close to everything and provides some really nice views.
Nice rooms with good accommodations; Easy parking and plenty of entertainment at the attached water park.
Loved sitting on the lake while eating dinner. The flatbread pizza was delicious.
Very nice place....loved the family suite....We will be back!
Outstanding hotel complete with water park for the kids!
Another great weekend at Bridges Bay!
Great place for the kiddos!

Staff was friendly, it was clean - but they are doing decorations in the lobby area. That was fine. The pool was advertised as heated. It was not and it felt cold in there too - like the a/c was on. Just watching my kids I was cold! Hot tub not working. Bummer.

We arrived late at night, so we didn't inspect the room very well before crawling in bed and falling asleep. When we woke up, I could see oily fingerprints on the headboard, something sneezed or splashed onto the TV, someone's grocery store card they accidentally left behind, and some rather dirty looking blood stains on one of the pillow cases.

The tiles and grout near the tub were a bit in disrepair, but overall things appeared tolerably clean and satisfactory unless you looked closely. I feel like the cleaning job is one of the biggest customer services a hotel can offer, because you don't want to feel like you're constantly touching other people's left behind germs, lube residue, etc. It was a major detraction.

The breakfast was okay but the lady behind the counter (responsible for cooking the eggs and everything) seemed spread very thin in her duties.

I would have preferred paying a little more at this hotel for it to be a place with a better cleaning service. If it wasn't for the room  cleanliness the experience would have been more like 3¬Ω stars for me.

Overall the hotel was very nice. Clean rooms, friendly staff, and comfortable beds. My one complaint however is that the indoor pool area smelled very bad. I'm not sure if this was a result of the chlorine type being used or what, but I had to swim outside because it just smelled too much. I booked this hotel specifically because of the unique pool area with palm trees, a waterfall, rock structure and a hot tub, but ended up not even being able to utilize it because of the unpleasant smell.

I would count this as a great quality medium-priced Hotel.  They had a great entryway and the elevator has a security code so the guests are safe.  They have a great atrium with a pool and a hot tub which is open until late including an adult swim from 11 p.m. to 2 a.m. They have a full breakfast bar in the morning until 10:30 which is nice.  The rooms are modern and well-stocked with coffee maker and frigerator.  All of this was only $96 for the night.  There's also a restaurant in the hotel and a full bar.  so once you park you can really stay put for the night and not have to leave.  Definitely hang the do not disturb sign on your door or they will knock on your door in the morning before check out to clean the rooms.

This is a clean nicely staffed hotel. Comfortable beds, free WI Fi, a swimming pool and fitness are in the building. I think the main reason to stay, unless you were traveling through, is that it is across the road from the local casino, and the rates and amenities here aren't very different, but the price of a room is less than half.

Probably the cleanest hotel I've been to in ages.
The shower head, in particular & bathroom very well maintained.
The attention to detail, really surprised me.

Thank you!  it's what customers like myself keep coming back for.

Staff was wonderful during check-in, but that was it. Odd smell through the hotel even with mask on and had to sign so many documents just to stay it was uncomfortable.  Once to the room was spacious but a felt dirty.  Bathroom was tiny compared to other king rooms I have stayed in for the same price for a night.  No hot breakfast and was not offered any substitute during checkout.  Bed was a bit stiff but head board kept hitting the wall every time I would move, and no extra person I was alone traveling for business üôÉ üôÇ üòí üòÖ üò™ üòë üôÉ
Had a cleaning issue when we first arrived but the management came and cleaned it asap! They discounted our room rate and we were happy! Recommended A+
Nice place with a unique and fun pool area with a hot tub, sauna, and workout room. Good complimentary breakfast, clean rooms and friendly staff.
Pool was amazing people where friendly rooms where nice.
First off we were over charged and it was dirty!!
Great location. Watch out for bugs.
Comfortable. Pretty secure.

Was a quick 3 day getaway.  Everyone was so pleasant.  Food was delicious.  Only down side was I expected different menus at the 3 onsight restaurants. Room service menu is limited but still really good. I must stay if you are visiting Hilton Head. Beach access was so appreciated.

We were able to book this fun hotel during an ‚Äúoff week‚Äù. We spent 2/5 days without leaving. They truly offer everything.

Not long after we checked in, they sent us 2 free app coupons & a bottle of champagne with a thoughtful note for our anniversary.

Our king room was clean & spacious. The bed was SO fluffy, which I loved. We had a partial ocean view which was nice bc that wasn‚Äôt what I booked. Most reviews say rooms are outdated, I guess they kind of are but it‚Äôs not terrible. Every day we walked past rooms being cleaned, like furniture flipped over & scrubbing. (I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs easier for them to do in down time.) I was seriously impressed. The room had complementary water & coffee, a fridge, iron, hair dryer..etc Our only inconvenience was no microwave for leftovers.

All of the staff was so welcoming and kind! Someone said they were short handed, like everywhere, but we didn‚Äôt really notice until our last day when a lot more people started coming in. Even then, it wasn‚Äôt a problem for us.

The Spa! I wish we would‚Äôve thought to book services sooner. It‚Äôs pricey but worth it!

The pools are nice & grounds well manicured. Pools close at 9 which was disappointing. We wanted to use the hot tub at night but couldn‚Äôt seem to get there before then.

The walk to the beach is easy with a nice path. We took advantage of the lifeguards umbrella & chair rentals. I believe it was $40 a day. The beach was a little crowded the 2 days we were able to go. I just thought, I couldn‚Äôt imagine how busy it would be in the summer.

Last, find the breakfast buffet! They have everything. It was wild. Lol

Overall, we would stay here again if it was in our budget & low crowds. This place is expensive along with every extra thing to go with it. It was our anniversary so we splurged. We enjoyed every day!!!

This resort has all what you need for an amazing vacation. Nice location, close to the beach, spa, nice pool, restaurants and bars with decent food, professional and kind stuff, gym, nice rooms. I had the change of seeing  dolphins swimming close to the beach at sunrise. Definitely we would come back. I recommend it!

I would give my stay a C. For a resort, lots of things that were subpar. Check in took me 20 minutes (on a Sunday in February). I was given an "upgrade" - to a room directly outside the gym. Every time someone came in/out, the door slammed. That went on until 10:30p and started at 6:40a. The sheets barely covered the bed. Rhe pillows were not traditional Marriott pillows. And the bath mat was at the point that I would have donated it to the local animal shelter. Also, parking was difficult- i had no idea that there was underground parking. The pros were the cleanliness of the room, the TV in the room, and the location (right on the beach). Would I go back? Possibly; it's not off my list completely.

We took a trip to Hilton Head for a long weekend and decided we would stay here at the Westin based on their reputation and reliable reviews. Wow were we wrong. Outside of the friendly helpful staff and exterior grounds, this place is in horrendous condition. No notice that they are in the midst of a long overdue renovation. Our full ocean view room was truly deplorable. Truly filthy from the carpet to the headboard behind our pillows. Save yourself a major disappointment and stay in one of the other well known hotels.
We had a very nice nights stay, with an easy check in process, and even a free upgrade with our Marriott reward membership. Nice amenities, and super comfortable stay.

The resort is a nice place to stay for a vacation or quick getaway. This place is beautiful. The staff was polite and helpful. For the price the resort is charging people and I would have thought the hallway walls and the walls in the room would be cleaner or in better condition. The beds are comfortable and cozy. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious. I had to reclean the bathroom. There was still hair from someone else in the tub, in the sink, on the bathroom walls and on the toilet. I have not been able to find a hotel or resort with the entire room being clean including the bathroom.

This is our first time staying at this location. I hope to give some thorough information as I read many mixed reviews before staying here ....
The hotel itself is slightly outdated. This can be seen on many reviews. Now, even though it is outdated, it is still VERY well kept overall. The rooms were very clean, the food areas were great and the common areas inside the hotel were beautiful. The pool areas did need attention. There were frequently plastic cups floating in one of the pools. A waterfall feature of the pool was not in use anymore and instead had many trash pieces and was starting to grow fungus looking things.
The restaurants were very yummy and service there was great. Drinks were tasty and priced well.
The biggest frustration of the hotel was the communication and activity calendar. They hand you an activity calendar and I spent much time preparing my kids for the great activities. However, most workers didn't know what was going on, some events didn't even occur. Kids crafts were free one day and then the next they were $17 to paint a canvas and make a pinwheel. The movie stated on the calendar was not the movie playing one night. It was just sad to see so many great events planned but yet, no communication and no great follow through.
Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel many times again. I do hope that somehow they can get better communication between the workers and the events calendar. They set themselves apart having fun activities, now they just need to follow through!

We came to Hilton Head Island for Memorial Day because we never get away for the holidays. It was such a pleasurable experience. The resort was not very busy for being a holiday weekend. There was lots of activities and there is immediate beach access.

The rooms were a little humid even with the air conditioning at 65 which made for some sticky night sleeps but still very cold for the hot weather we experienced.

The food at View 32 was excellent. We highly recommend the Grilled Cheese BLT Panini! I wish they still had the lobster roll from a few years ago when we visited but I was able to find that at a nearby local restaurant. The servers we had were also amazing!

I also had delightful experiences with Clive from the Front Desk and Madison from Guest Services. They had exceptional customer service skills which is the reason I choose Marriott!

We will definitely be visiting again! Thank you to the Westin staff for your hospitality!

You pick the Westin for location location location. They are right on the beach and many of their rooms face the ocean with small porches. Some (like ours) are on the ocean, which was a great choice.

Beach access is really convenient. So convenient in fact we didn't use the pool once. The beach might be one of the best I've seen, easily beating Maui, HI. Make sure to take advantage of the chair / umbrella rental service with beach patrol. They don't ask for tips or have a tip jar, but I encourage you to tip generously. They are fantastic and work extremely hard.

The service at the hotel was extremely responsive and friendly, although the front desk was often overwhelmed with lack of concierge support, so I'd STRONGLY encourage you to submit any service requests through the Bonvoy (Marriott loyalty) app. They even found an item I left in the room last checkout, and held it for me. That rarely happens and is a sign of great training.

We used the on-property restaurant for apps and drinks, but it wasn't our thing. If you're a Applebee's or Chili's fan you will probably enjoy it, albeit they do charge resort prices. If you're a fan of Chefs that use seasonal ingredients, win notable awards, and obsess about details, you may not enjoy it.

The property was very clean, the service was extremely friendly, but the rooms themselves are really showing their age as are the furnishings. Worn furniture with slight staining and spotting is expected when staying here. To be clear, we did our best not to track sand in our room, but when we did, it would magically disappear when housekeeping tidying up the room. They were very thorough, even cleaning our windows when they got too much ocean salt on them. Well done!

The pool was always chaotic and guests reserve chairs early in the morning and don't come back until much later. There supposedly is a rule that doesn't allow this but it wasn't enforced. First come first serve. Like I said, we didn't care because the beach was breathtaking.
Room is a little bit outdated but still nice. Pool is great. Beachfront is a walk. If you have a dog, there is a dog park.

This is my favorite hotel to stay in Hilton Head. It‚Äôs beautiful and the service is outstanding. The restaurants in the resort are very nice and offer great experiences. My favorite is splash. It‚Äôs casual and right on the pool. Great for a quick bite. The location of the hotel is wonderful. You‚Äôre 15 minutes from all the landmarks of Hilton Head. The rooms are spacious and have balconies. I totally recommend!

The hotel is not cleaning rooms. They claim that it's to address covid that they aren't doing any room cleaning during stays. But our room was still dirty even when we first checked in! So, they just aren't cleaning enough in between, either. The tub was downright grimy, there was sand everywhere, and the place doesn't smell fresh. Had very mixed service experience, some front desk staff are trying hard but some on the phone line are actually rude.

The location is great with two paths to a wonderful beach, both paths have freshwater spray to get sand off. There are also multiple pools with options that please all the family -- including a shaded pool if you want to enjoy a swim even after a sunburn. So if the service were better this would be a great stay.

Love staying at The Westin every time we make a quick HHI weekend trip.  All of The staff, from front desk, valet to room attendants and servers are super friendly and attentive.  The beach is fantastic and clean and doesn‚Äôt get too crowded like the pool area can.  The outdoor attendants do a great job keeping chairs open and the pool area clean.  Love this resort, plan on making a weeklong stay here soon.  Katie the front desk manager is super friendly as well, reaching out before my stay to ensure I had everything I need.  This will always be my go to spot when staying at HHI.  PS - don‚Äôt forget to check out the sunrise every morning.

Nice place to stop in for lunch or dinner on the patio. My wife enjoy's the fish tacos and I enjoy the selection of local brews. Just a relaxing place to have a relaxing dinner. Staff are very helpful

We attended a marriage retreat here in February. The weather was a little on the cold side but it was beautiful. The pools are beautiful and the whole courtyard leading up to the ocean are amazing. The beach was very clean and soft sand. Our room had a great room of the courtyard, pools, and ocean. The room itself was very nice and the beds were super comfy. The staff was incredible the whole time we were there too.

Family Friendly.  This was not my usual overnight.  I live local and decided that I didn't want to clean my house between nights.  So I stayed on the island.  I'm so glad I did.  The weather was perfect.  Thank you God.  The rooms were nice and clean.  Not sure if the bedding was a weighted blanket or not but kinda felt like it.  Onsite amenities galore from dining, many pools, beach access and rental options for beach and trail.  If you golf, well it's Hilton Head Island.  Enough said.  Lots of pool side activities for the kids like ping pong and Cornhole.  Even the coi seemed to entertain them for a while.  We had a lovely overall experience here.
Everthing about was fatastic. Food was great. Chili lime hotwings, grouper tacos and an overstuffed lobster roll

We attended a wedding here and it was absolutely amazing. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are spacious, the beach access is perfect, and the staff was especially friendly and helpful. A manager there named Reid went above and beyond to make the wedding party and the bride and the groom feel special. Would love to attend another wedding there. Will be going back for sure!

Overall the hotel was nice. The front desk staff was very helpful and accommodated all of our needs. The views were amazing. The rooms were spacious and clean. Where our visit fell VERY short was our dining experience. The first restaurant we went to told us there was a 55 minute wait, even though more than half of the restaurant was empty. They told us to try the outside area so we wnt out there only to be told "we have nothing to offer you" even though they had empty seats as well. We went back inside and the bartender told us we could sit at a hightop table in the bar. It did take us about
30 minutes to get any service at all but we definitely didn't need to wait 55 minutes. The server was nice and the apps were very good especially the Mason jar appetizer. The mains were okay. My crab and shrimp fettuccine was SMOTHERED in sauce almost making it inedible. My husband's burger was overdone but it was still good. The one thing that was a hit was my son's NY strip and fries..that was delicious and cooked and seasoned perfectly.....the drinks were very good too! Overall I would have gone somewhere else for food if we hadn't got in so late. There are so many great places in the area to try....however the hotel was a nice place to stay.

We had initially booked at the Marriott down the road and that was a huge mistake. It was super old, outdated and felt like a Motel 6 inside. Luckily we were able to book a reservation here and it was a drastic difference. The whole Westin property had a way better vibe, was actually nice inside and outside, the pool area was awesome and the beach was amazing. This location in Hilton Head Island is amazing if you want to be right on the beach and have an amazing experience. I highly recommend renting out the beach chairs and umbrella on the beach. Book here and you won't be disappointed, it's awesome and we'll be back.

This was our second stay at the property, so we had expectations that it would match our previous one. That was not the case at all.

Our room was somewhat clean on arrival even though there were sunflower seed shells scattered at the entrance that remained during our stay even with multiple housekeeping visits. On our first morning, we noticed that we had not been given washcloths. Instead, there was a wet one hanging from the shower rod. Disgusting. I contacted the front desk three times and it took an hour to receive them. That‚Äôs a bit extreme. Not to mention they seemed to be surprised/bothered by the request. I know I was by the third call. There was also trash underneath the bed that we were in no way going to retrieve and neither did the housekeeping staff feel it necessary.

What happened next will go in my book of the most disgusting hotel experiences ever. While completing some emails, I noticed there was a weird yellow stain on the partially exposed mattress pad. I didn‚Äôt want to think it was what I immediately thought it was, but then I took a whiff. It was unmistakably urine. I immediately called the front desk and asked for the manager after telling them what I found. I received a call about ten minutes later saying that the manager was unavailable and that a supervisor from housekeeping would be up to check out the situation. After the call, I did a little more inspecting and actually lifted the mattress pad. That when I discovered a large urine stain directly on the mattress. Took pictures as well. I called back and informed the front desk, and while they were surprised, communicated no sense of urgency as I demanded to see the manager again to have the mattress replaced. I became tired of waiting and went to the beach for the last few hours that our rented space was available. It was my expectation that the mattress would be replaced by the time I returned. Nope! So, I called again demanding the manager and a fresh mattress. Instead, I was offered to switch rooms, to which I replied, ‚ÄúYou want us to pack up the entire room to go to another room with a potential whole different set of problems?‚Äù Needless to say, that didn‚Äôt sit well. So, I waited some more until about 30 minutes later someone from housekeeping finally showed up to assess the situation. Again, she offered to move us and again I declined and expressly told them to change the mattress and replace the linens. After some huffing and puffing of disbelief by the housekeeping representative, a new mattress finally arrived. Then she proceeded to put the same linens that were on the soiled mattress back on the new mattress to which we had to emphatically correct that behavior, to which also was accompanied by disbelief on her part. The rest of our time in the room we just felt dirty and never really clean. Not to mention a daily vacuuming of a hotel room beachfront would have been a nice touch. Plus, I couldn‚Äôt believe that an oceanfront room was smaller than the suite we had on the previous stay, but I digress.

There were a few occasions that we ate in the Carolina Room and while the service was excellent, the space wasn‚Äôt maintained well at all. During a breakfast visit, we were seated at a table where it appeared that the remnants of the previous diner‚Äôs meal was scattered all over the floor. I‚Äôm not sure why the hostess thought that was appropriate and we were hoping that someone would notice and it at least clean up the debris. That didn‚Äôt happen. The breakfast buffet was underwhelming and we about got severely burned by the chafing dish containing the grits. The food was edible, but needless to say, we didn‚Äôt return for breakfast going forward. Dinner on the other hand was pretty good and we had particularly attentive service.

In the end, we won‚Äôt be back and will advise our friends of the same. Perhaps assuming that our expectations would be met based on our previous stay was a mistake. We definitely didn‚Äôt get what we paid for.

I went to the Westin to celebrate my divorce. The irony was they had a marriage retreat! But, the staff was very accommodating. The room was exceptionally clean and the dinner and wine was delicious! I look forward to going back!
This was a beautiful hotel on well kept grounds, a resort style pool and breathtaking views

This place was AMAZING!! Celebrated my birthday with my boyfriend here and it was perfect. Our view was fabulous, especially at night under the moon. We enjoyed the restaurants on the resort. The crab cakes, shrimp and grits, warm peel and eat shrimp, and wings were great. The drinks were good too. We spent a lot of time at the pools, there were three and the set up was beautiful. The beach was a favorite. Also I received a massage from the heavenly spa which was spectacular. The staff was really nice at all places as well.

This was a great place to stay with our small baby girl.

Lyndsay at the front was so wonderful in helping us book a room according to what we needed. They provided a clean crib for our baby. We‚Äôll be back!

A+ food and service. The property is nice, the building is a bit dated, but well taken care of. The pool area is not to large; main pool, and two small pools with cabanas for rent. There is an outdoor restaurant with a bar. The burgers and salmon sandwich are superb.

Parking is available, but limited. Valet is $17 a day.

Very kid friendly with an awesome beach very close to the resort.

Overall, strongly recommend.

The Westin Hilton Head Island Resort & Spa has become one of my favorite resorts. I was visiting friends and wasn't able to check-in online. After calling the staff, they ensured I was checked in and would be fine. Upon my arrival, Linda handled my check-in and placed me on the 4th floor out of 5 floors with a view of the ocean overseeing the resort. When I tell you the view was amazing I'm mean this in every way. The sunrises and sunsets were priceless! The resort was extremely clean and had staff constantly attending to any issues with cleanliness. Te onsite restaurant & bar The View 32 staff was attentive and they were amazing memorizing the food and drinks we had the day before.Drew has been working for The Westin for 19 years and he without question is one of the Top Bartenders in the country. The rooms was clean and the view was amazing throughout the property. I looked everywhere  from the hallways, walkways, around the property and everything was on point. The landscaping  was well manicured and maintained. There's a Koi Pond on the resort that had several Koi being active in the clean pond for everyone to see. Daily and continuously the staff cleaned the pool and decks around the different pools on the property. There's a heated pool, hot tube, children's pool, splash pool and plenty of beach to see. On Mother's Day the staff worked with the guest with flower arrangements for the guest. Ashley Powley was head of this project and knowing her from the Washington, DC properties. I knew things would be on point with the resort. She and the staff took time to ensure everyone was offered Mother's Day flowers  as a gift from The Westin. Marriott is doing great things to ensure a welcome on this Resort. One thing that I noticed that really had me look a few times. There were numerous weeding on this weekend and the staff was handling numerous wedding request. Attention was maintained to both the weddings and the regular guest without failure. I'm not sure if  we are working our way out of the Covid-19 pandemic has motivated everyone to get back to some normalcy or this was just that feeling of being around people created an amazing few days during my stay.The Westin impressed me and I've traveled around the world and honestly can say that this is one of my favorite places to visit. I visited a few restaurants in the area and was able to get some shopping in at the Tanger Outlets. Savannah, Ga are really close to visit if you're looking to go somewhere close by. The only challenge during my stay was Uber and Lyft who were totally unavailable the whole trip. Resort staff assisted with alternative modes of transportation. So, if you are looking for 5 Star Quality, Great Views and Good Food, The Westin Hilton Head Island Resort & Spa is an A-List and Bucket List destination!

This was a great stay.  We got a room that had a great view of the ocean with nothing blocking.   Amazing view of sunrise everyday! I would recommend this hotel for ease of beach access and it was very clean with Starbucks coffee in the room to boot.  If we return to Hilton Head we would stay here again.
Nice hotel with a private beach. Good food overall but service was lacking for a premium brand like Westin.

The room, the view and the beach were amazing! Our family and furry friend loved every bit of it. The heated pool and jacuzzi were perfect on a rainy day and the restaurant was delicious. What a great weekend getaway!

My kids call this hotel the ‚Äúdream house,‚Äù and it really is a dream. We loved staying here. The kids club is great, and the amenities of the hotel are fantastic. The breakfast buffet is a solid B-grade. The covered pool is nicely heated for year round use. The hot tub is huge and great for groups. The gym is decent. We are Platinum members with Marriott/SPG, and this hotel really goes out of their way to acknowledge and reward that loyalty. Kudos to the hotel for sending up some chocolate chip cookies and milk for my kids. A very appreciated and magical touch that further solidified their title of the ‚Äúdream house.‚Äù

Stayed here for a few nights at the very end of the summer season. Was happy to see all the pools and amenities were still open even though the hotel was fairly quiet.

Had a terrific Queen Suite on the 4th floor with a balcony overlooking the pools and out to the ocean and it looks like every room has at least a decent view too.

Hotel was clean and every member of the staff were extremely friendly and efficient. Special shout out to Sophie from the front desk who made check-in an absolute delight.

Only point dropped was because the pools could use more maintenance than a clean each morning. Someone going around with a skimmer net a few times a day to clear bugs and foam from spilled drinks. Other than that this place is perfect for a family break.

Beautiful resort! Friendly & helpful staff. You don't have to leave the resort if you don't want to because they have everything you need in the hotel. The outdoor restaurants have gorgeous views of the ocean as well as excellent drinks & food. You don't even need to bring your wallet, they can charge your drinks & food to your room or Villa. So convenient! They have 3 pools, a spa, gym, tennis courts, and a golf course, as well as a beautiful walking path & pond near the pools and of course, beach access with a ramp. The lagoons are perfect for bird watching! Whether you're looking for a hotel for a one-time vacation or a timeshare to enjoy year round, the Westin Resort is the perfect place for your family! They also have a kid's club in the summer!

Super nice hotel for a meeting. The only thing that I didn‚Äôt like was how far the elevator was from the lobby. Definitely walk through the pool area to get to it and avoid The Shining hallway. Rooms were spectacular and bathrooms were big. Beds and pillows were comfy and great tv, limited channels though

From the gents at the door (Kenneth and Chris) to the folks at the desk (Katie and Mim) to the sweet people who serve breakfast in the am! I literally am trying to figure out how I can always stay at Westin HHI Resort and Spa!

The room was clean. I brought my 2 pups. We had a beach front and ocean view room! The dog park is awesome! There is a heated pool that the kids absolutely love! (Not my kids... my kids have fur ;)

You should stay here!

A decent hotel that is dog friendly.  Expect to pay $375+ for hotel, taxes, and resort fee. The resort staff are nice, the resort grounds just need some serious TLC. We enjoyed our stay at The Westin Hilton Head Island although we hope next time the resort is updated. The elevators are always a sign of when and how much a facility is maintained, we took the stairs.

I suspect the hotel is likely understaffed. Having said, some major deficiencies: called/texted/asked in person 7 times for a dog bowl and dog bed, which still has not materialized. The entry light is broken, the ice bucket was not emptied from prior guest, missing bathrobe, etc.
Very nice resort. Clean, friendly staff. Rooms were very up to date. Beautiful views from the balcony. Food was excellent. Many choices. Large pool area and outdoor bar.

The staff here are beyond helpful, they are kind, and will help with any request. The hotel is rather large but laid out simply. If you‚Äôre having an event here all of the event rooms are easily labeled and simple to find. The restaurant inside the hotel is fantastic, and the pool is breathtaking with a simple walk directly to the beach attached to the hotel. You owe it to yourself to get the chicken sandwich if you‚Äôre in the restaurant.

Disgusting rooms. Mold and water dripping from the ceiling. Manager in front is inept or can‚Äôt grasp the significance of this. Promised multiple times to come up and see, 24 hours later I am still waiting for Nicole Drake‚Äôs arrival. Do yourself a favor, come down to Hilton head but do no stay at this place. The Marriott next door is the real prize. This is is the last place finisher by all accounts.

This resort was absolutely beautiful and the beach views were breathtaking. Very clean with hand sanitizer stations throughout. Great friendly staff. Masks were required which was a plus for me. I travel a lot and this was one of the best places I have stayed.

The resort was so nice! Beautiful pools and outside area. We usually go on the beach but we literally just stayed poolside since it was so nice. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Gym was really nice with 3 Peletons, free weights, ellipticals, treadmills, and weight machines. Very clean. Room was nice although couldn't get a room with 1 king bed so we had 2 queens which were not comfortable. Would definitely go again.

A wonderful getaway to relax & rejuvenate!!  The visit started with a few reservation challenges that were communicated by phone & promptly resolved by Julio and the Executive Team prior to arrival. They truly made guest satisfaction the top priority!!  Check-in with Bilal could not have been any smoother. The property staff were consistent with their high regard for guest satisfaction and the restaurants were great!!  The beach was awesome!!

Disappointing for a Westin.  Patio was dirty, leftover food smashed into the concreate, leftover from the previous guest or two?  View mostly obstructed by side walls, felt like looking out a picture window while on the patio.  Room in just OK condition, had a musty somewhat dirty smell.  Staff at the bar and restaurant was sub-par.  Maybe understaffed, however the experience was rather negative.  Did have good access to the beach.
We got there early and they upgraded our room and even assisted our friends with an upgrade to be able to have a room across the hall from us. Amazing view of the pool and ocean.

Huge hotel with a large inside activities area. Three different swimming pools, afternoon Dj or live music. Rooms are clean with minor maintenance issues, perhaps a little worn out carpet. The location of the elevators made every trip a workout. Thanks for the room near the beach access elevators. The fact that a former near Sam's club was relocated further inland was a loss.  Very comparable to the Marriott down the road, with it's own plusses and minuses. Beautiful beaches. A bit of a wait line at the front desk. So so parking. Maybe add another ping pong table?

I had a great culinary experience in the Carolina Room; one of the places that food is served on this resort.  There were many pools on the property and a relaxing hot tub. The resort rests on a beautiful beach with warmer water than you‚Äôd expect in October.

Pretty quiet rooms. Good variety of pools, even a slightly heated one in the shade with a lot of deck room and chairs. Good amount of free self parking.
The wifi is terrible. It took me days to get an email and if you have Sprint or ATT you pretty much will not have access to email, social media, FaceTime, etc. Some text will go through. I was at a conference- this was the case with majority of people. I would give them 4 stars if the internet were better.
The service was good and the staff was friendly. Conference food was good.

The most beautiful resort - very easy beach access and luxury amenities. The king ocean view suite was amazing... can‚Äôt beat the views. Clean hotel, friendly staff, and great food options on site, also!

I always love walking into a Marriott property! We checked in on Valentine's night and the location was full but there was only 1 person at the front desk. The room is always top notch and the lavender sachet was an extra plus!

If you select ocean front, go for floor 3 or up center of floor.  The end rooms have a smaller cut out on the balcony.  If ocean view,  take the shared view with the pool.  The other view is the giant AC unit and the building next door.  If you have the energy,  leave for your meals.  Their food is adequate.  Not the superior quality of some other Westins.  And surprisingly you might want your own sheets.  Their sheets are at the end of their life.
Really nice place romantic plenty of space for  everyone.

Ashlyn at the front desk did us proud when we came back for our 2nd 3 night stay in the last week. We love Hilton head and all that it offers the golf is fantastic.
Great resort wonderful staff facilities and beach in a great part of SC.
Loved the pool bikes jogging on the beach and pool services. Wonderful room and view. Thank you Ashlyn you did the resort proud.

When you stay at the Westin, come ready to play. Beautiful pools, fountains. Dining inside & out. Every room commands a view of the ocean.

Wonderful dinner tonight at the View 32 outside bar.

Actually shocked a hotel would sell a room with a lounge chair and no couch. Especially at this price.

Luckily I was staying alone but couldn‚Äôt imagine if I was a family traveling and intended to use the pullout sofa.

I am writing this review while currently staying at this property. My family has stayed here every year for almost 15 years, except for last year when we opted for a private residence through Marriott‚Äôs Home & Villas because of Covid.

When I stayed with my parents as a kid, we stayed under my father who is a Lifetime Platinum Elite Status. I, myself, am a Titanium Elite Status.

I had read the recent unfavorable reviews and thought they couldn‚Äôt be true. This has been our favorite continental U.S. property for over a decade. But after experiencing it myself, I can confirm that this hotel has in fact fallen from grace. It‚Äôs amazing how the quality has decreased so much in just two years. I really wish they would have used the pandemic as an opportunity to improve the property. Each room could use a 128-point inspection similar to what mechanics do with cars.

I‚Äôll break down the issues by category.

ROOMS

- The furniture is showing it‚Äôs age with rips, tears and stains.
- The room we stayed in the first night had a shower that didn‚Äôt drain properly. After have engineering come up to snake the tub for 20 minutes and tell us it was fixed, I proceeded to take a 5-minute shower in which I was standing in at least 6-inches of water.
- The tub also had tons of mold in the caulking. In the room we moved into the second night after they were unable to reassign the first night because the A/C went out in an entire wing of the hotel, there was black mold in the handheld shower sprayer and rust buildup on the shower head.
- We had to have the filter changed out in our first room because it was so filthy and when the engineer came up to change it, he was very snarky by saying, ‚ÄúSee, clean filter!‚Äù as he showed me both sides of the new filter he brought up.
- The rooftop outside our balcony obviously doesn‚Äôt drain properly as there was water accumulation and rust visible.
- The room we were reassigned to had some type of markings all over the inside of the curtain.

STAFF

- I have probably had one positive interaction with a staff member (the male bartender at the poolside cafe) during the entirety of our stay, including managers. I have tried to exchange pleasantries with the housekeeping staff and received no response in reply.

FOOD

- The Carolina Room (restaurant on property) used to have one of the best breakfast buffets. Now it has been reduced to a continental breakfast in which much of the time, they are out of items. I never saw the pastries or bread containers more than half full.

GROUNDS

- The ground level of the stairwell was entirely flooded on the north end despite there not being any rain.
- The whole building could use a pressure wash.
- The pools and the beach access is the real draw of this property. However, plan to bring your own beach chairs and umbrellas unless you want to pay $40/day for them - they are not included in the $28 resort fee.

I‚Äôm so disappointed in this stay and sad to see a property I once loved become so dissipated. I sincerely hope that Marriott is taking note of all these negative reviews and will make it a priority to return this resort to its former glory. It‚Äôs obvious that staff morale is down and it shows in the condition of the property and level of customer service. In its current state, it is definitely not worth the 60k points/night it is requiring for a stay or its Category 6 designation.

Update: on our last night here, we got security called on us to our room. Why? Because the sliding tracks on the balcony doors are so difficult to open and close that the people below complained that they kept hearing something rolling. When you have to put all your weight into just sliding the door, that‚Äôs going to happen.

Update #2: Went to check-out and had three restaurant charges to our room that were not ours. Took thirty minutes to get resolved. Front desk individual was unimpressive, but the Supervisor (Miriam) that I spoke with was magnificent. She explained that the hotel was set to undergo a renovation when the pandemic struck. Promote this girl! She was empathic and compassionate.

Lovely upscale hotel in Hilton Head. The grounds are lushly appointed and the decor is understated.
We were on the 2nd floor and there was an entire stretch of hallway devoted to the historical and archeological studies of the island and local early African American settlements, complete with artifacts and pictograms. Cool stuff.
Attractive hotel, friendly staff, beautiful pool area, and great access to the beach. It would have been nice to have a microwave in the room. Saw a roach in the room on our last day.

Everything about this place is legit. Relaxing. Crowd was low. Access to the beach was good. The food was good although due to the pandemic the choices  of the food was minimum. She crab soup was the best here. The staff over the phone is somewhat...unprofessional. however in person it's like completely different people. Very nice and accommodating. Perfect spot for the family and alone or with your spouse. Access to activities directly on the property for an extra...low cost.
The room was very nice as always. We enjoyed the friendly staff and the delicious food from the carolina room. The resort is beautiful and always offers a very relaxing enviroment.
This is a Very nice place. 3 pools, 1 gigantic hot tub, View 32 bar/restaurant right by the pool. Short walking distance to the beach. And, the guest room  is nice.
Great place to stay or stop over and enjoy the amenities. They have a great coffee shop serving Starbucks coffee, fresh pastries and driest. The Hawaiian muffin is a good choice.

They always have such elegant and professional wedding ambience and staff, and we are lucky enough to play for some ceremonies, cocktail hours, and receptions on the lovely patio sometimes!
#gregoryguaymusic
Great place to stay on Hilton Head Island. The ocean view room we had was very clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and  there are a lot of things to do.
Great place to stay , heated pool. Only down side is a bit of a walk to the rooms and from the rooms to the beech.

Absolutely beautiful resort ... private beach access ... excellent price for lounge chair and umbrella.... great bar service .... just love everything about this place .... when we travel to Hilton Head we stay at the Westin... it's a must!!!
Room 5059. Clean, comfortable room. King bed. It's not a water facing room. Private balcony. Mini fridge, iron and board, single serve coffee pot. Enjoyed the stay.
Pet friendly with clean rooms. Close to the beach (our room had a partial view) . Multiple pools. Nice family time.
Nice beach for guests at the Westin hotel. The beach and pool area were packed. It was refreshing to see people getting back to life as it was prior to COVID.
Very nice rooms, the property is right on the beach and it has wonderful amenities. The ocean view is beautiful too.
Serene atmosphere.very friendly people.Met Daniel the cook and all the nice people working with him.Will surely be back for a longer visit.
Very friendly staff. Good service. I stayed at the Westin while attending a conference at the Marriott and I can say the pools are nicer at the Westin.
We have stayed here several years in a row. Clean updated rooms, great pool, and right on the beach. Hard to beat it!
Amazing place to enjoy the beach with family. Great food, activities, and staff. Plan ahead to grab seats and umbrella on the beach and sit back to enjoy your time the most.
It‚Äôs a nice place but the room listing is deceiving. I booked a king grand with ocean view and below is what I got. We won‚Äôt be back.
Not very busy the last week in August. Taking the necessary COVID-19 precautions. Used mobile üì± check-in and mobile key to reduce points of contacts. Worked great.

30 years ago Jacqueline I came to Hilton Head and stayed at the Westin for the first time with my parents Marvin and Mattie Williams we really enjoyed it then, we've been back to Hilton Head several times but this time we stayed at the Westin where we stay 30 years ago and we're celebrating 30 years of marital bliss I really love Jacqueline she's the most beautifulest and kindest woman I've ever known here's to another 30 years and we will be attending Westin Resort in Hilton Head again it a fabulous place..
Beautiful event space. Amazing location - Friendly staff and service
Great service and views of of the beach.  Rooms have been recently renovated.  Free parking is a big plus.
Resort is beautiful. Water fountains, ponds, pools, palm trees. Very relaxing. Aside from the sleep in sunday confusion everything was great.
Really nice resort!  Had a great time.üôÇ! We did not have a microwaveüòï.  Very friendly staffüôÇ!
Very nice beachfront resorts and it's really new and clean. Family can sure enjoyed  there is something to do for everyone.
The place just OK. Very pricey for no reason. Of it was for some of the staff friendliness I'd rate lower. Nothing special. Should costs a lot less than it does per night for what you get.
Great service.  From a super quick check in, to polite grounds staff.   I highly recommend going in the ‚Äúoff season ‚Äú ( winter), rather than ‚Äúpeak season‚Äù ( summer).
Absolutely amazing resort. Friendly staff and a beautiful beach view. I'll definitely be returning.
Great location, right on the beach access. Awesome breakfast. Dinner was really good, seafood pasta and mussels for apps.

Best customer service I've received in a long time. I had accidentally booked us at a different hotel and casino resort that was another 90 minutes away. Becky helped us by calling and getting it switched over last minute. Completely saved our night. She went above and beyond to make it as stress free as possible.

The casino itself is small compared to others that I've been to, but everything is clean, new, and it was an overall great experience. Would definitely come again if in the area.

Can't believe how this place has grown. Huge complex with 2 pools and a great spa. I finally tried Gordon Ramsey's food court. Not a fan of pub food but he has changed my mind. BEST   PIZZA EVER!! Yes that's correct.  PIZZA. Wish I had eaten more food  items  there. Shopping was great. Not a lot of shopping but loved the mid priced items. There are lots of games for sure. Haven't won but a great experience.

What an absolutely awful experience. We go to a 10 cent slot machine and end up spinning 3 times. We cashed out after 3 spins just to go and play a little bit in other areas and got $2.50 back. We asked for help because we assumed machine error as we had only spun 3 times. It‚Äôs advertised on the machine that it is a 10 cent machine but somehow we had made the first two spins cost 37$ and the 3rd another $22. We were pointed to the credits area on the screen and told that credits were stacks of 10 cents and that we had selected it on our own‚Ä¶. Wildly unethical and very specifically designed to trick people and steal their money. No attempt to resolve or regain confidence once all was explained. I will never visit any Harrahs again.
I was greeted and felt welcomed when I entered the hotel lobby. The room was really nice and clean. The bed was super comfortable. Super chill hotel and casino.

We had a really great time. Everyone was so nice and friendly. Even the dealers at the table games were very helpful. We left with more money than we took. It is a very clean and very nicely laid out place. We will go back soon!
Update--- We went back for Super Bowl Sunday. This time was a lot different on the hotel side. It took us an hour of standing in line to check in. And there wasn't an hours worth of work that should have caused the issue. What caused the issue is the front desk clerks not being efficient and noticing that there was a line of about 30 people. They were also just utilizing one front desk clerk for regular guest check ins for about the first 15 minutes.
The rest of the trip was 5 stars. The casino and staff were great as always. Casino staff were very helpful and polite again. We will go back. Just someone needs to address the check in process. Maybe install a check in kiosk like the larger Cherokee property has.

A must stop and do so gambling.
Has a lot of food options.
Very clean .
So go win some money üí∞.

The hotel is very clean so are the rooms. The Food Court was very unexpected. It felt like dining at the mall instead of a hotel/casino. TVs are not app enabled.No housekeeping in occupied rooms due to covid that's understandable.  Lost $5 bucks on a penny slot after 1 game. Staying for additional  nights will update about other amenities offered.

Everyone is friendly and very helpful.  One extraordinary feature is the pesticide-free, pollinator garden outside the hotel.  I've taken beautiful photos of flowers and pollinators on my trips to Harrah's these past two years.

Great experience!!! Everyone nice!!! Big beautiful,  clean establishment!!!  Lots of fun!!  One of the best times I've had in a long time!!! Didn't win but had a great time loosing!!! Can't wait to go back!!!

This was my 1st experience, I believe first impressions are lasting impressions..Upon arrival I noticed 3 lines Diamond members, Seven star members and regular guests..I was a regular guest who had a reservation...but if they were ever trying to get me to be a diamond member I would have liked a nice check-in experience and it wasn't pleasant at ALL...they kept looking for Diamond and Star guests first I get it, I am a delta skymiles member and I get priority everything but I have never witnessed delta just ignore other customers who weren't skymiles members they are also accommodated along with priority customers..this was NOT the case at this Casino. The ladies at the front desk kept calling for these priority members while ignoring all the other guests and my daughter said "We've be standing here for quite some time do you just plan on calling for diamond and seven star members only because people are literally just walking in and you're ignoring us and are we ever getting checked in?" Well ANN was nasty in her response and once she was cleared of customers she did not bother helping us but the young lady next to her called us up while her customer had not yet cleared the counter. ANN is not a good look for this establishment when u are dealing with customers and your rooms are 458.00 a night on the weekend, things need to be DIFFERENT make guests feel welcome...ALL GUESTS...I guess I will see if the BIGGER resort wants my money and appreciate me next time. I will NOT return here...clean nice AVERAGE rooms...casino floor staff were pleasant..

We stopped at Harrah's Cherokee Valley River on the way back from Harrah's Cherokee Resort.  We didn't know anything about it until we passed it on the way up. It's smaller, but still a very nice casino. Craps tables were a $15 minimum, which is good. I won a little on the quarter slot machines. And I'd say the food court here is better than the one at the resort. We will be going back and staying here the next time. There's really no use in driving an hour more (from the Atlanta metro area) to the resort when this casino offers the same thing.

It's a great place. Really love that they are now non smoking. Only thing I didn't like was that they charge you for drinks üò© other than that everything was sweet. They had a little arcade, bowling alley and pool tables for families with children to stay entertained. My room was neat and cozy, not as good as some of the other Harrah's locations I've been to but it was still nice. Staff was always helpful, courteous and very attentive. I left happy with heavier pockets üòÅ

Food is great and has great eats from places that I'm mostly familiar with. 95% staff is friendly, very enthusiastic, and takes pride in their jobs. I will say the security had issues reading my newer Georgia state ID upon entry. It could've been just me since I was upset I had problems accessing the casino area a few times, but it just didn't make sense that my Georgia ID didn't work, but my former NY state ID did. One security guard outside was very hostile to me where she intervened my sidetalk with my partner and told me that I can try to enter through the other side, but they wont allow me back in by any circumstances. I gave it a try and behold, my NY state ID works! If this casino can fix the issue with newer Georgia IDs, it would no longer be a hassle, but thank goodness I had ID from a different state. The casino otherwise had numerous slots to play from, and the atmosphere was very welcoming to all. I will have numerous visits, and if you're reading this as a Georgia resident, if your ID was issued 2020 or later, you might be told to leave.

Sooooo, I call this casino my fun ATM.    Never too crowded, you can always find a game to play, and have hit plenty of jackpots.  Food court is decent.  However, don't waste your money @ the Landing... it's mediocre at best.  But hey, who comes to the casino to eat??  Rooms are very comfy.     Staff is great, always very friendly, never have to wait very long to get paid, even on busy nights!! Have even met a few good new gambling buddies while here!!  Have never had any issues.   I haven't visited the larger casino in Cherokee once since this one opened!!  Good luck ya'll!!!

Went there to see the Ghost Hunters!
The casino staff were nice and professional.

The hotel is clean & very professionally serviced. Check-in was a breeze, even though I was early and with a service dog. My room was cleaner than any room I've seen in years. There is adequate security in the parking lot. Amenities include a full service Starbucks, Panda Express, Arthur Treachers, a full service sit down bar & lounge, a full table service restaurant, an arcade & bowling alley. The grounds outside are very well kept. Plenty of parking and covered parking at the front doors of hotel for checking in and out. There is bell hop service at the door for larger loads to the room. Elevators are fast & clean and usually quickly available. Room cleaning service is nice and accommodating. Coffee and fridge in room. Great views of the beautiful WNC mountains from the rooms. Large flatscreen television in room. Nice size bathroom & shower.
Great experience. Met great people too. ALSO WON SOME MONEY

A huge Indian casino in Murphy,NC. Very clean and orderly with friendly employees. My son in law and I went there for the newly installed sports book and he walked right up to the counter- no waiting.  The have a separate area for children with games as well as bowling alleys and pool tables for adults.

2nd time there and the sports book was busy!  8 big screen TVs with any game you wanted to watch.

This was a nice stop for the night. The floor is limited due to covid but you can play every other machine. Staff is friendly, room was clean and comfortable.   The steak salad had cold roast beef from the landing restaurant. It didnt make sense? Steak vs roast beef?? Other than that its a spot for a nights activity and worth the off prime rates experience. Non weekend.

My fiance and I had a blast, played blackjack most of the time we were there we won quite a bit of money. Highly recommend going, if you do look for Matt hes the dealer at one of the blackjack tables made the game fun for us. We plan on going back again soon! Hopefully we will get to stay at the hotel this time!
Beautiful Hotel and Casino. We had a wonderful vacation here! The mountain flowers are blooming. Scenic drive. Great variety in the food court. Easy to get to. Lots to see and do in the area.

Great, serene & ambiance relaxing, courteous staff. I really need spa time, but COVID closed. Plenty restaurant nearby, but there's Nathan's, Panda Express, Moe's and 2 other restaurants inside, but closed. Pool, 18 lane bowling alley & arcade are other activities there. Casino smoke free with slots, tables and many game options. Overall excellent for a short getaway and will be returning.

Let's be honest about the hotel i have never stayed in the casino hotel so I guess go there to gamble on the üé∞ machine eat their but if the price of the hotel would drop I would tell you to go there so IDK about it .   It's kid firendly please to go to they play the arcade and üé≥  wild the grow up go and win big money from the slot machine ps kid not a loud on the casino floor other wize they will be checking for ID or drive license if the 4&5 year old or anything goes The parents will be ask to leave or take them in to the arcade and blowing Alie so parents keep kids away from casino floor or else.

Nice Casino. It‚Äôs very clean and well lite. Don‚Äôt go expecting free alcoholic drinks. It‚Äôs not the casino doing it, it‚Äôs North Carolina‚Äôs alcohol law. Other than that the restaurants towards the back of the gaming floor are great. The staff is exceptionally nice, welcoming, and attentive.

The table games are nice but a little high on the minimum side. Slots are hit or miss in terms of payouts. Word of advice go during the week if you can, otherwise it‚Äôs crowded and tables are hard to find.

Overall it‚Äôs a nice casino with good eating options and great staff.

Sure everything is nice but it's overpriced. Customer service is either non-existent or slow.  My boyfriend is a senior citizen and I'm obviously disabled. We lugged our own bags through the lobby and down a long hallway.  And that is every time we go...... The girls on the floor with the drinks are pretty good but there aren't enough of them. They run around like a chicken with their head cut off so, it's not their fault that you have to wait a bit for a drink. They need to hire a couple more. My boyfriend got bit by something in the middle of the night in several places. we still had fun so yeah we come back. LOL not sure why we don't look for a another casino I think this one is just so close. Nice bowling alley in the back of the casino and the prices at the bowling alley aren't too bad.  Overall everything is beautiful and you will get the casino experience but they just need to tweak a few things to make it a more relaxing and enjoyable experience.

We haven't stayed at the hotel but we love coming up for a weekend getaway and hiding out at the tables all weekend. The dealers are always super energetic, polite, and super helpful if you're not sure what you're doing.

I sat at an empty blackjack table and there was a wonderful older woman with purple hair as the dealer. She explained the process since it's been a few years for me and we had great conversation.

The atmosphere is already great here, its never super smoky since they have awesome ventilation and the cocktail waitresses are always keeping your drinks filled.

We didn't come home with anything other than a souvenir $1 chip but that's ok, we had a blast anyways!

It was ok but they need more chairs for us older folks that just want to sit and watch their husband play or a corner for ppl to sit while their spouse plays a while.  Plus I feel they let to many ppl inside. There's hardly any available machines or tables available.  Maybe during the weekday it would be better.
Absolutely love this place. My fianc√© and I try to visit several times a year. Very clean. Food is amazing. Staff is always polite and helpful. We will be back soon!

Rooms were clean and front desk personnel were friendly. Casino floor was huge with many updated machines. I gave four stars because I lost this time although I have won in the past. My wife and I will be going back soon.

Nice little casino.  Drive through temperature checks by EMTs before being allowed to park.  Only 3 people per table due to social distancing, so getting on a table took some patience.  We broke even on the slots, so no complaints.

Kinda small gaming floor but has card tables and familiar slots plus a nice escalator and even a killer food court. 10/10 I'd smash. Disclaimer--  Did not make money but that's kinda just how casinos work.

The staff makes this place 5 stars. There is nothing wrong with the casino itself, but it is just a normal casino. However, the staff were just incredible. Every single person we talked to was very friendly. Fantastic at making a little small talk while you are waiting that doesn't feel forced.

People would go to famous Las Vegas or Atlantic city but never really experienced a casino in the country where it has beautiful view lots of machines and table game and the hotels is nice and comfy pillow top and sourrounding area filled with countryside restaurants, ribs and buffets so delicious and I recommend anyone who hasn't been in the countryside style food casino and party at the nice scenic view

Quick drive from Atlanta. Fun place with table games and slots which pay out well!

Update- returned and absolutely did not enjoy. After visiting many random casinos around the country and then returning I realized that the slots are outdated as well as very tight. I never expect to win however I do expect to be entertained and have fun. Additionally, all the tables had minimum $25 bets with some at $100 min. I'll happily bet $25-$100 when I'm feeling it however mandatory on every bet can drain your stack fairly quick.

The atmosphere is also dull. I enjoy the other location in cherokee a lot more.

Back to slots. Many make you hit max bet for chance to get progressive. 90% don't have any cool bonus features. The few which  have features like spin wheel or free games rarely hit. Even if a bonus feature only wins $1 at at least gives some excitement.  This place is supposed to be fun and exciting. Additionally, most times the slots are full so very few options to even pick from to play.
Why do random casinos like in Iowa, wendover- NV, FL, CT, etc  all have new fun exciting games with bonuses, freeplay, bonus side games, etc and not here. Why do all these other places allow to hit progressives on any bet? Why do they have better music, comps, atmosphere, etc?
I never disliked a casino before but do now. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
I didn't win big, but it was a fun day trip. Everyone was wearing masks and it was really clean. As always, the drinks were free!

First time visit. Beautiful area of WNC! Valley River and the drive there was amazing. Loved the hotel!! Fabulous bedroom with a fantastic stand up oversized tile & glass shower. The casino experience is always great, win or lose!!! Highly recommended!! Don't for get to make time to stop along side the Nantahala River, just because.  So much nature and scenery to enjoy that's absolutely free, and the memories will be life lasting.

Great luxurious rooms with walk in showers. The restaurant has fantastic food at reasonable prices. Wish I could dine there every day. Servers were great, working way to hard. I'd definitely be a guest here again.
It‚Äôs a nice place but it‚Äôs a little smaller than Cherokees location. The food court was good.

Great stay! We have visited 5 different Harrah's locations in the past 6 months. This was the nicest and cleanest location (second to Atlantic City which by far is our favorite location). All of the employees were polite, professional and friendly. The gaming floor isn't large but has a nice variety of machines. The room we had was clean and comfortable. It had a mini fridge and coffee maker (many other locations do not have those in their standard rooms). We will return to this location again. These are photos from room 733.

Nice hotel. Very clean. Newer games in the casino. If you go to Harrahs Cherokee a lot and you want to try it here know that you can‚Äôt use the free play from Harrah‚Äôs Cherokee at this location. You can still use your total rewards. The staff are very friendly here. They do not have a buffet if you are looking for that. But a nice and quiet place.
staff was very helpful and treated us like we were the most important people there. Made my 3 year olds birthday...

What a fun place . My first time and we had a blast. The food is even great . The prices are very fair . There is plenty of slots for everyone.  They have a smoking area and a non smoking area . The staff is very polite.  Thank you for a good time . Just a suggestion when you come to this place . Come have alot of fun but know when to stop.

Nice facility with lots of gaming space. Be prepared with your identification each time you enter the gaming floor they do 100% checks each time. There are several restaurants, Moe's, Earl of Sandwich, Starbucks, Panda Express, to name a few. They do have a game area for kids, or adults I guess. Also 16 lanes of bowling in the attached bowling alley. Parking is free and plenty of it even though you may have to park out a bit.

Nice first experience, but not a smoke free environment. Attendants were friendly and helpful. Nice variety of games but rather small food court although the options in the food court were good for both Vegetarians and Meat eaters.

Really nice hotel for the price. Casino is mostly slots with a few live dealer tables. $75 minimum on Texas hold em so don't come broke. Unlimited bowling and arcade for like 16 bucks. Starbucks, üêº express, moes, several other restaurants all in the same building. Checked in and never went outside until I checked out.
Great casino, food court has lots of variety, and a Starbucks.  Slots are a little tight.
Very nice never been here before good customer service nice hotel and it was an hour and 20 minutes away from New Orleans worth the drive it's like two vacations in one

My wife and I had a great time at Harrah's Valley River. Our 7th floor room was clean and ready for us and customer service was outstanding

Absolutely wonderful time.  All the employees were super sweet.  No complaints small, gaming floor rooms for a little bit small but very clean.  All in all it was a really good time!

They stop selling alcohol at 2 a.m oh yeah and they sell alcohol where most places I have been give you free drinks if your at a machine but not here. Apparently they can't give alcohol away on an Indian reservation.

Always a great time here! Most times I do win however even when I don't, I still have fun. Great staff that are very accommodating.

Just know your always being watched.its a very nice hotel and casino
Love this place!! Large gaming floor with slots and tables.

Great Casino I am someone who is hard to please but I really couldn't find anything wrong to complain about the casino was very well done and the rooms are really nice availability was great had no problem getting a room at the last minute should I travel to Baton Rouge Louisiana and visit my sister from Philadelphia I stop there on the halfway point home and stop at Harrah's Cherokee on the way out

Perfectly situated for me, my hotel of choice in this area. Very closely linked with The Woodlands without the added premium. Johnny's restaurant in the lobby is great for some hearty Italian style cuisine and the staff are friendly and welcoming. Good sized bar to sit at when travelling alone.

Got an upgraded room once we requested to be on the top floor as my son enjoys the views!  The upgraded room on the 9th floor was clean but could have used a little maintenance/repairs. The views from the balcony was beautiful!  The breakfast was delicious!  We were running late to get to breakfast but the workers assured us to take out time and get what we needed.

A lot to like about this beachfront hampton inn - great location, small pool and beautiful lobby.  But the rooms were pretty average for size and amenities, the hotel ‚Äústore‚Äù had very few options for a quick snack or drink and the fitness center was small and the equipment was old and in need of replacement.  If none of those things matter then this place is great

Absolutely LOVE IT! Paradise! My stayed was PERFECT! The hotel was so clean and they welcome you with some fresh cookies! Outstanding Customer Service! You are right on front of the ocean‚Ä¶.just heaven! Very convenient from restaurants, Walmart, Publix and many other stores‚Ä¶walking distance A-plus‚úÖ. My room was so clean and fresh‚Ä¶it smell so good!!! I was in the 8th floor with a fantastic view to the ocean. They offer breakfast‚Ä¶the only thing I was missing is vanilla creamer for my coffee..This is an excellent Hotel. I was really impressed! Also, they are 5 miles from Gulf State Park üíï; you have to visit! For people that have dogs there is a dog pond park ‚Äúbrand new‚Äù and other amazing amenities. To the manager of this facility I had wrote this review a month ago, but I have put the wrong address (Gulf Shores)‚Ä¶this review is for you guys! I thank the entire staff Liz and the other team‚Äôs members‚Ä¶all of you are doing a wonderful and amazing JOB! Thank you so much for always receiving with welcome hands and big smile!

We had a great stay! The room was clean, cozy and the view was great. Right on the main stretch of orange beach, breakfast was great. My only complaint would be the tiki bar closes too early and it would be nice if the pool had adult hours after 10. But nothing to bat an eye at. We will definitely be returning.

Our first room the carpet was wet. Changed to another room. The beds were so worn couldn‚Äôt hardly stay in bed they were broken down at the edges. Sink didn‚Äôt drain, drawers were broken, shower handle wouldn‚Äôt stay in place for the temperature control. Changed to another room.  The toilet tank has a large crack. Air conditioner leaked so bad we laid towels down to soak up the water and it was so bad the towels could be wrung out.  Very moldy.  Found a dead cockroach the 3 night.  The morning we checked out a 4 inch cockroach came out from under the sofa. The floor was saturated for about 8 feet.  3 of us have acute sinus infections and sore throats from living in this roach and mold infested room.
