The problem is they don‚Äôt have other rooms to move you to because of being fully booked. They say they will send maintenance to check the problem but they don‚Äôt show up. The place needs a major remodel. The breakfast was meh. They had a hard time keeping up with filling the empty items and rarely wiped off the tables.  I have been a Hilton Honors member for many years and have stayed many times in the Hilton family hotels. This was the worse hotel I have ever stayed in.  I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.     I also don‚Äôt understand why when I checked my review I attached photos of the wet towels and the large cockroach  they are not showing the photos on my post.  This hotel needs to be completely transparent in letting customers show the conditions of your hotel.

The pros were the location, the view and the walk to the beach. We paid for an oceanfront view, and the view was gorgeous. Breakfast was also great. Most of the staff we interacted with were lovely.

I don‚Äôt usually nitpick, but I was paying $400 a night and find some things just not excusable at that price.
They don‚Äôt have daily maid service, and you have to go down to get towels/toilet paper and take out your own trash. Again, for the price I was paying, I think daily service would be expected. You can only get a full service every 5 days.
They are dog friendly, which is amazing‚Ä¶but there was no place to take them to the bathroom. The abandoned lot next door was what we opted for, but it was filled with thorny and burred plants. They are not allowed on the beach (city law) so there are really no options. At one point we tried to use a tiny patch of grass outside the fence, but the bartender from the pool told us it was gross to have them within eyesight and we needed to take our dogs off property to use the bathroom.

The place is perfect for us. Walking distance going to the beach. The room is clean when we coming in but after few days they never clean even we request in the front desk. That's the bad part. The breakfast is great.
Nice budget friendly hotel on the beach. Nothing special, but no complaints!
Rooms were mediocre but the view of the beach is amazing. They didn't have a restaurant but the people are friendly. Loved the pool area and hot tub. Never even saw the Tiki bar.

Can‚Äôt go wrong with Hampton! One star off because they would not make coffee at 6pm. I know that‚Äôs late for coffee but my fianc√© drinks coffee all day every day, also when your spending 250.00 a night. Make your guests coffee.

For nearly $500/night, I was expecting more than the standard hotel however, it was nothing more than average.  The front desk was nice but I had to walk by an overly full garbage can when walking in, so that set the tone. I wouldn‚Äôt mind really, but it was that way every day that I was there. The can in the pool area was also overflowing by lunch and never changed until the end of the day.
This place has a smaller than average pool with very little seating. Approx 20 lounge chairs and there was room for many more. There were no umbrellas or tables In the pool area and very little shade.  There is a small bar outside that had some shaded seating. Prices for cocktails was $12+ .  Bring your ant spray, as there was an abundance of ants around the pool.  The breakfast seating area is a decent size but it doesn‚Äôt accommodate the amount of people that can stay at that hotel. I know it‚Äôs not reasonable to plan for every patron to eat breakfast at the same time however, when it‚Äôs 15-20 min wait to make a waffle or wait on some other item to come out so you can have something before they close the doors on you, then it‚Äôs a problem.
Our room had a rusted, I mean RUSTED, like throw it away it‚Äôs so rusty, lamp.

Room was very clean, gulf view, great AC, and it was quiet. Across the street are a few restaurants, walking distance to Starbucks. Publix and Walmart very close by.

Construction is starting next door on new giant condos so the peace and quiet May be gone soon‚Ä¶. That‚Äôs also the same side as the bar.
Great breakfast. Close to beach beautiful ocean view. Wonderful costumer service. Very nice employees.

Stayed 3 nights at the Hampton.üåô
In the room we had a microwave, refrigerator, coffee pot and hairdryer.  The white sheets/white comforters and room were clean & comphy. I especially appreciate having had full use of the heated indoor pool, hot tub and gym that close at 10pm.  Also, the ice machines worküßä and the breakfast included fresh fruit, juices, coffee, muffins... Being able to walk out of the back door to the beautifully kept beach with no animals, jet ski's, etc. was wonderful.  Would definitely stay there again!

First of all, the few employees they had working were friendly and helpful but there were not many.   I had to go down to the desk to pick up fresh towels daily and I emptied our trash myself.   It was entirely self catering with no maid service at all.  We were there four days and nobody swept our room or even the hallway.

The room seemed clean but there were small things like the old coffee pods were left in the pots from the former visitors and one bedspread had a nasty looking stain. I took the spread down and asked for a replacement but they did not have any.

On the positive side, the breakfasts were very plentiful and tasty.  We would have liked it if the hotel had kept the coffee available all day like other Hampton Inns do but they did give us coffee packets so we could make it in our room.

We stayed in one of the suites and it was a nice room.  It's getting a little dated but not too bad.   The view from the 9th floor was wonderful.  We enjoyed sitting on the balcony, though one of the chairs was missing a leg.  Requests for an additional chair were ignored.  Luckily we had brought some beach chairs.

Best hotel for a weekend stay! Always worth the money, good location and right on the beach. Good breakfast and staff is always so nice. Amazing tiki bar and beautiful view. This is my 3rd or 4th time staying and I will continue to come back to this hotel anytime I visit orange beach! This photo is only yards away from the hotel after walking out over the short bridge!

This is the PERFECT place for families with kids who want to getaway to the beach! In the morning breakfast is made for you (eggs/omelettes, fruit, cereal, waffles, yogurt) then just head out to the beach. It's literally just a few steps out there, then spend the day between there and the pool and hot tub. They have a bar open just a few days a week, the gym is huge and BEAUTIFUL ocean view while you work out! The gym has quite a few treadmills, ellipticals, weights and thoughtful extras like a private bathroom and cold filtered water dispenser. We get a balcony room with a studio (basically a divided room with a couch and chair on one side, beds on the other) and they do have adjoining rooms for larger families. The gulf view is amazing. The whole place is just so relaxed and chill! Our rooms have included mini fridge and microwave which comes in handy. The rooms are very clean and seem well-maintained. All front desk and breakfast staff have been so nice and helpful. They do have laundry, 2nd floor (across from the gym) and it's $1.50 in quarters per wash or dry cycle. Definitely recommend, we will be back!
One word..... Awesome...hada wait a coupla hours for a room so we hung out at the bar with Bryan Jett. He was amazing...

üíôüíú‚õ±Ô∏èWhat a wonderful stay here! Employees are firendly at the front desk and the cleaning team.

Rooms are pretty plain and simple, but that doesnt matter. I cant imagine many people will spend much time in their room, except to sleep.üõå The hotelüè¢ is directly on the beach! üèñüëêüôåüëè

A lounge chair rental service w is available for rent at $35 a day. You can walk directly from the hotel to the beach via a wooden  boardwalk w a few stairs. The white sand is so soft and the sound of the waves just took our stress away. ‚õ±Ô∏è

Outside pool and hottub also face the beach.

Parking permit for the garage at check in. Easily elevator access frlm the garage too.

Most rooms with balconies facing the ocean are double bedsüõå instead of kings, which could be good for families.

üßΩVery clean, did I mention clean!!!üßº Absolutely will return to this Hampton when we are in town again. Very satisfied multi year diamond member here.

There is an outside tiki bar for drinks and the full beach affect too! üç∏üç∑üçπ

During the stay a üåÄstorm blew in and it was very cold, so we hit the hot tub. I saw alot of kiddos playing in the pool and a few adults. It is a heated pool, but not as warm as the hot tubüèü, so the hot tub it was for me.
Great location and prices. Helped shape my first ocean experience splendidly.

Excellent views of the ocean.  Free breakfast and free parking.  The lobby is updated and the staff maintains a daily activity board each morning.  The furniture in our room had some staining and the ceiling had remnants of water damage.  Those things didn't hamper our fun though.  Overall, it was a great stay especially when you can use points to cover the price of the room.

We stayed here for several nights. It was our first visit to the Gulf Shores/Orange Beach area. This inn was a nice little place to stay.
The hotel itself is in decent condition with updated modern designs and comfort. The doors going into the room and balcony could have used a little maintenence. The room had a spectacular view of the Gulf and we enjoy the balcony alot. The pool/hottub was clean enough and a had great temps every time. Their beach area was always kept nice and we spent alot of time just enjoying the waves.
The breakfast was always served hot and there was always plenty even though we often ate towards the end of the meal time. They serve you instead of you picking what you want - Covid19 restrictions.
The only reason they are losing a star - we had to ask for everything. Since they are not cleaning the rooms and restocking supplies and clean towels each day, we were left to ask for toilet paper, new paper cups, coffee, etc. Several times it seemed as though they didn't want to get anything for us and that we were imposing on them to ask for a trash bags or whatever. I would suggest having a time frame each morning that the guests could get what they need without "disturbing" the front desk staff. Other than that the staff was pleasant.
One of the elevators was out of service the entire time we were there. Apparently it has been out for several weeks.. while most of time it wasn't too long of a wait, during the weekends it got a little crazy.
The Tiki bartender (Oscar) is funny! Enjoy as few beers with him.

Very clean and keep well. There is a parking deck which makes parking somewhat difficult when u have a larger vehicle. We had pizza delivered and the staff offered us plates & napkins. The beach is clean. No building on one side so plenty of room to spread out. Heated pool and hot tub. Nice balcony to enjoy the view. Bad side: the walls are PAPER THIN! We heard every conversation in the hallways and could hear when the room next door flushed the toilet.
Was there for a conference. Rooms nice, great free breakfast, close to beach, pool, and staff great.

The staff was amazing. I've never met a hotel staff so nice, helpful and fun. They are obviously treated well by their employer. The room was always cleaned well. We had 5 girls in one room and they were able to meet our needs. That's a miracle. Pool side movies and other things for children and adults.

Very clean. Everyone in masks. Breakfast served from a room in the lobby, hot, √Ä la cart so I could take it out on the beach and eat it while listening to the waves crashing. We stayed on the ninth floor. The views from the room and the balcony were just absolutely stunning.

View from 5th floor. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room is clean. Shower has great water pressure. Pool is heated but not hot tub warm. Hot tub was nice. Close walk to the beach. Would give it 5 stars but the bar was still out of commission due to the hurricane last year. If you don't have a car, finding a cab, Lyft, or Uber are very scarce. Would recommend staying here for all

My husband stayed here three nights with your five year old granddaughter. We loved the hotel. It was clean and very nice. My husband did have to clean the air filter to the AC unit, and he got a bit tired of having smoked sausage for breakfast every morning, but other than that, it was terrific! (And neither of those things bothered me at all.) We had a great view from our room, and the pool area was great. We would definitely stay there again.

First I have to say the service at this hotel is excellent and mix that with the beach property I'm giving it 5 stars. You literally walk out their back door and end up on the beach. I will say that they are in need of some room updates as some of the lamp posts and bathroom rails were rusted and the box spring was pretty old. The hotel was really clean nonetheless.

Had to change fall break plans with my family and chose this property.  Despite a few minor challenges, we had a wonderful time.  Foremost, the staff here is incredibly friendly and helpful.  Everyone we engaged was willing and capable of fullfilling our every request.  The pool was perfect for our five year old.  We stayed on the west side next to an ongoing construction project next door and weren't bothered at all.  The only negative I can think of was that Beach Services charges $30 per day for the beach chairs shown on the website.  Please don't think those are for hotel guest.  No worries, the sand is soft and white and fine for setting on.

I absolutely loved our Hotel! It's so inviting, open, friendly staff, continental breakfast, and ocean views. There is so much to love about the Hotel! We stayed 5 nights and we did not have one single issue with our stay. It was perfect. Everything was ocean chic and a modern appeal to it but it was still plenty inviting!
The newly renovated rooms are lovely.

Hotel is nice.  The best thing about it is it's in a area within walking distance to a lot of restaurants, stores and markets.

Update: Hampton upgraded our room when we asked, they are very accomodating
We loved our stay but the key quit working 4-5 times during a 2 day stay. I highly recommend asking for digital key during check in.

This place was awesome..
I really enjoyed my stay the room was really nice. The hotel was really nice the beach was great. The breakfast was good. I did not get a chance to use the pool but it looked really fun. I wish I would have a gotten a room to face the gulf. I would stay there again it is a really nice area

First the positive: Very friendly staff, above average breakfast, good location. The downside: Their attention to details is lacking. They try to keep up with cleaning, but this is a very high traffic hotel. Our room needs a good deep cleaning. Room 423. The hotel has no king rooms with gulf views. Construction noise is annoying. The pool was always cloudy. It was cleaned every morning but not well enough. The pool is to small for the number of people using it. Great to be on the beach but they charge to much for the level of service you get. Over 300.00/night for this view. 400.00 if you want to see the gulf. If the management wishes to contact me please feal free to. You have my information.

Bob Abell

Overall I give this hotel 5 stars for easy convenience to the beach, room size and cost, but most importantly staff like Mariah at the front desk made my families trip truest memorable. She found out it was my wife's birthday- we came up to our room after a long day relaxing on the beach and found a pack of chocolate cupcakes and a birthday card on our bed. It's people like her that make trips special- went above and beyond what she gets paid to do. Will come back for sure.

Only thing that could improve is the pool- its tiny and it's shaded by the new hotel being built next door.

Great location, walking distance to a number restaurants, stores and the Publix grocery store. The hotel appears to be newer and rooms are still in good condition. The hotel has a heated swimming pool and a outdoor bar (a bit pricey). Breakfast was good, similar to other Hampton inn locations i have stayed in the past. I recommend booking a room overlooking the gulf.

Great Family Oriented Establishment.The kids had a blast.My coworkers had a blast.So it makes no difference if you are A little one or A retired one or Disabled or Physically Challenged Hampton Inn Suites will have something for you that will make you want to come back and visit.Located close  to everything and anything you might need. This hotel totally rocks.....üòòüòòüòòüíú

Wife and I stayed a couple days. COVID has all the hotels changing the way things are done to keep everyone safe. Pool closed much of the time we were here. Nowhere really for people to sit outside and relax. Breakfast is cafeteria style.

This is a budget Hampton. One thing I've always said if I go to Hampton Inn I could never go wrong. However I feel like I stayed at a Holiday Inn. The curtains  in my room was filthy.  The only chair in the room was filthy. The door on the small refrigerator, filthy. The night stand was musty. Very dusty in the room. I was not at all impressed.
I'm not going to dwell on these things because  my family had a great time. The breakfast was delicious. The hotel is in a great spot, directly on the beach, with a pool. The staff was great.
We've decided this will be our annual trip so I will try a different hotel next time.

The non-balcony rooms leave a lot to be desired. Overlooking the parking garage was quite disappointing. The coffee maker was dirty on the inside. The bathroom could‚Äôve been cleaner. The sheets were stained. For the price we paid the room was to small and left a lot to be desired. With that said, the pool and beach experiences were amazing. The breakfast impressed us. There was a huge selection of foods. The staff was all very friendly. I might stay again if we had a balcony room.

Friendly and accommodating staff, clean and comfortable room, multi-level covered parking garage, good breakfast buffet or can grab a brown bag to go, coffee/tea/cocoa station day and night, nice pool and outdoor area with plenty of seating and small bar, walkway to beach... and the beach front balcony room is worth the extra expense. Of course, the beautiful white sand beach and relaxing ocean waves are the reason we all come, but will definitely stay here again and recommend to family and friends!
The People were great and no complaints about anything. My family had a great time.

The beach access was good, but the rooms need work. Pictures are worth a thousand words. Rust was present on all lamps in the room and there was a hole in the wall of the bathroom. Also, there was a bug or two hanging ten on the wall.
We loved this hotel! So clean! The pool and hot tub were highlights with my family also crab hunting on the beach at night! Breakfast was amazing each morning! Best room service too!

I will come back over and over here. The view s were amazing.  It's my 2nd stay there will be many more! The staff here is better than any hotel I have ever stayed!!!! I mean that! The breakfast is great! If u rent the umbrellas and lounge chairs they are 30.00. If the weather is bad the umbrellas will be closed and the kid that rents them may take the cusions. Doesn't matter what time of day it is the price is the same. And when it's 4 or 5. He will start putting them up even if ur in them! I do not believe he is associated with the hotel!

What a retreat from everyday life!  The staff is amazing.  The view of the beach from the room patio is dreamy.  Comfy pillows.  Location of hotel is like a central hub for FUN.  Thank you Terry, Kollin, Liz, Julius, Lang and guys in maintenance (who inflated our mini pool paradise on the sand for our babydoll's first trip to the beach).  We, girls have decided this will be a yearly event adding 2 other families.  Thank you!!

Recently graduated from Columbia Southern University and here is where my girlfriend and I stayed.  They have friendly staff.  The hotel is right on the beach!  We had a room with a balcony,  it was beautiful.
Completely impressed.  The facility was accommodating, the rooms and entire hotel was clean. Kudos to the managment and staff for providing us the best vacation.

This place is beautiful, even though it rained the whole time. We had a top floor, oceanfront room, and it was an amazing view! The staff was friendly and accommodating, and the breakfast was great ! We will definitely be back.

Wonderful! Great location!
I was celebrating my 50th Birthday weekend while staying there. Everyone was so nice! And they gave me this wonderful wine mug to help me celebrate üòç
Great place. Nice rooms. Staff is awesome.  Oh it's on the beach.  Pool and bar outside.  Cookies at 5pm.  How could you say no
Very nice hotel. Clean and friendly. The breakfast, as far as free breakfast go was excellent. It was nice the beach excellent we had a wonderful time.
Nice staff and comfortable rooms. The breakfast was good too. Although we were thier during the recent cold spell
Very clean, big rooms,nice sized balconies, great breakfast, tiki bar, nice beach that wasn't crowded. We had a great time and will be staying at more Hampton inns
So nice lady that helped us in the front. I hope she is there when we can go back again. The room and the beach scene all worth the go price 500+ is alot of money tho.

Another #LegendsryStreetSoccer Thumbs Up! Usual Hilton Hampton experience...add on awesome view of the Gulf, beach side pool and jacuzzi...covered, and steps directly to the beach.   Ok, more than than the usual setup, but the Hampton and Home2 are my Go2 4 the comforts and accommodations I enjoy.
It was alright, the first room was very questionable.  But after we moved it was a lot better. Some of the staff was very nice and friendly, they helped us with whatever was needed.

Great views and the friendliest staff of any hotel.
Update: We came back! Again, extremely courteous staff, love this place!
Room had a amazing view. Beach was a super close walk. Pool was perfect. Very Family friendly hotel.

its 400 a night we got there an the room smelled like it had flooded an just dried out eventually the room temp was 87 degrees when we left 3 days later it got to 81 on the thermostat there was mold on the ceiling in the shower
Great stay,  staff was very Friendly  and helpful. Lovely view from our room.
Great atmosphere!! Balcony overlooking the Gulf.  Nice beds.
Superior location and staff!!   The view from the fitness center is amazing
DIRTY, and you would expect it to be pristine for the $400 a night. I will never stay here again, and I would never suggest someone stay here.
Had a great time! Hotel is very nice and clean. Great staff

Nice courtesy staff great views
And some souvenir sand to take home ‚õ±
Nice rooms great Beach location beautiful pool
Great place to stay right on the beach. Wonderful breakfast.
It's a bit rough but on the gulf and beautiful sugar sand beach, so.......
The family had a great time here. They even had free activities for kids like scavenger hunt and crafts.
Beautiful!! Staff was amazing, Liz was very helpful and so sweet :)
LOVED! Hotel very nice, staff very friendly and helpful :))
Place was clean. Easy access to the beach.
Wonderful staff. Beautiful view to the ocean, from my balcony.
Great view, heated pool and hot tub!
Friendly staff, clean facility, overall great place to stay
Great location friendly staff located right on the beach family friendly atmosphere
The staff was extremely helpful, room with balcony was great!!!!
Our favorite spot & hotel! Celebrated several occasions here:)
Awesome time with great service and the breakfast wad really good!!!
Very nice people. Clean place. Nice Beach. 5 $tar!!!!!
2nd year in a row here... was fantastic again! Set you next year!
Wonderful Staff very CLEAN! Beach~Life!
Staff, rooms and prices are awesome!
Lovely beach and great service!
Not the most modern, but nice overall
I'll keep this place on my go to weekend at the beach place to stay.
Nice listening to waves crash inward.
Nice beach
Amazing in every way!
You will not be disappointed- absolutely wonderful stay. I am particular and I loved our night here

A section of the beach is dedicated to hotel guests, and there are large beach umbrellas and sturdy beach chairs with wooden frames available for rental. Though nothing else compares to the emerald green waters and the sugar sand, there is also an indoor and an outdoor swimming pool. Our stay was short, just a couple of nights and one full day, but we enjoyed it very much. We particularly enjoyed our meal at the open-air restaurant by the outdoor pool. We also enjoyed our first floor room with quick access to the beach, and the room was very clean and well-maintained. The gift shop was open until ten and had candy and soft drinks to satisfy my late night craving for chocolate. The staff was great. October was a great time for a visit to The Emerald Coast.

We decided to stay there because for the  beach location which is so awesome.  Our room was fine until we found out that the roof in the bathroom was with mold we called the reception and the answered was the could chance to another room but it will complete different which mean that we paid for beach view and we will get something not good for us.  The room service that we supposedly  get daily it wasn't true. We stay for 5 days and we only got 2 days. We have to request for it. And the shower wasn't eaither clean Not everything was bad, the pool, the restaurants services and the valet parking did an amazing job.

Had a good experience here in February.  Gulf water was only about 63 degrees but you can go in for some quick dips.  Huge pool deck with multiple food shops and pools.  One of the outdoor pools was heated.  Would stay here again!

Stayed here athe end of October and beginning of November.  It was their off season and the place was quite.  Perfect for those who want to feel the place is theirs alone with several outdoor pools and a hot tub, along with an indoor pool and hot tub if it gets too cold.  The staff are very accommodating and friendly.  One of the best things is to have both the sunrise and sunset visable right on the beach.
Very nice view and lovely beach. Rooms were a little outdated and could use some love. The staff was kind of iffy... One of my servers was really rude for no reason. Overall a nice place to vacation.

All the staff we interacted with were wonderful! Rooms were clean and very nice, if you stay definitely take advantage of the shuttle service it saves a ton on parking!! This is a wonderful resort for families to relax and spend time together! Hilton, GREAT JOB!!!

I loved this resort up until today. I have visited several times since last year, and have never had 1 problem. My previous visits, the rooms were dated, with a musty, moldy odor. We were on the 7th floor where the toilets were way too small.  They were very low to the floor. But, Crystal Haire, the AWESOME Front Office Supervisor, was very nice and professional. She upgraded both my rooms to the newly renovated rooms, with a perfect beachview! Both my rooms are junior deluxe suits, with two queen beds with pull out lamps on both sides of the bed, one sofa bed, and two junior beds. Each junior bed has their very own tv. The bathroom has the barnyard sliding door, and the rooms are cooling much better than before, as the vent was in the corner, blocked by the curtain, and in an area where is was impossible to cool the room properly. Now there are 2 vents located in a proper area to cool the room properly. Estelle is also very nice, friendly, and personable. She works the food and beverage area. She has a great personality. It goes a long way with me. This is a great resort, in a very nice location. I have 6 of my family members here for the very 1st time. They wanted to the beautiful water. The tides were up, so We couldn't get into the water. The water was barely touching our feet, as so many others. Hilton's beach police/security drove up to us us specifically, and told us that we couldn't allow the water to touch our feet. We were all stunned, because there were so many others doing the exact same thing. Even further into the water. He drove off, and some non-blacks asked what did he say to us, and we told her. This one in particular was saddened! She said look at all these other doing the same, and some are practically swimming, and nothing has been said to them. I actually wanted to leave, and go home. We hadn't been there for 5 minutes when he came up to us. This occurred around 10 a.m., so you'll know who was on duty.  But, I'm yet here with my family. Please see pictures of others walking through the water. Prejudice is very much alive. Other than this, you all would get 5 plus stars. Hayden Edelman and Kimberly Arnold at PICNIX, the ice cream parlour were very nice, friendly, and professional.

Amazing place. 2 outdoor pool with one 8ft deep, an indoor pool, couple of hot tub. I haven't seen it but there's suppose to be a whirlpool in the sauna area accessible to Diamond members.  There's 2 restaurants and bar. Excellent service.
Update: nth visit üòÅ
Tried the hot tub in the Spa area this time, and it was amazing and tranquil (no phone calls allowed).

The rooms are warmly decorated, comfortable and a delight for our stay of four days for a conference.  The balcony is a great place to soak in the ocean air, delight in the surf sounds and beautiful view.

Beautiful hotel with all the possible amenities.   If you want a big hotel with nice rooms, friendly staff, many restaurant choices at the hotel and near by this hotel is a great choice.   The pools were very nice and the location is perfect on the beach.   The Gulf coast is gorgeous.   Sandestin is a very congested area with so many people on the beach and at all the restaurants but they do a wonderful job at managing it all.   If you are looking for a hotel that goes all out for the 4th of July this is your place.

From the awesome spa to the food everything was super exoens7ve but well worth every penny!   Also I cannot say enough about the view from my room the pictures say it all.  3 pools a great, steakhouse, cabanas, jet ski rental right on beach, golf, a gym, a staff that in my opinion very likely to be unmatched on their professionalism amd friendliness, and I could go on.   I went for the weekend but stays 5 days instead.  To be noted I went alone on this trip.

The Hilton Sandestin Beach Golf Resort and Spa has my vote. I booked this place because I wanted to be on the beach surrounded by gorgeous views. This is my 4th trip to Destin, and I wanted a no worries vacation. I was able to walk right on the beach from the hotel. One can rent chairs and umbrellas from 9-5 or bring their own. The beach is super clean with powdery sand perfect for strolling, building sand castles, playing volleyball, etc. Additionally, jet ski and banana boats are available within a short few paces. I‚Äôve been satisfied with the hotel/room amenities, restaurants, indoor/outdoor pools and hot tubs. I‚Äôm ready to rebook this hotel for another vacation in the near future. The property is enjoyable for families, couples, and solo travelers!

The beach was lovely, they have an indoor pool and outdoor pool and spa.  The people who work here pleasant. The downside for the Hilton name these rooms did not live up. One air conditioning vent for the whole room, in Florida, in the middle of the night my husband and I had to kick off the covers we were sweating and we had the room set to 60. Couldn‚Äôt find the TV remote control anywhere in the room but we didn‚Äôt come to watch TV that‚Äôs just a point. When it comes to our view everyone else has an open balcony view of the ocean we have wood and the roof of the building behind us.   The dj and pool patrons where right under our room and exquisitely loud.   This is where the tv remote would have come in handy.   If we stay here again it will not be in room 228

Rooms: Okay... 2-queen, 2-bunk, 1-pull out (sleep 8), coffee, small fridge, safe, 2-tvs
Pic: One view from 1006, better views from rooms on end (next to ocean, w/wrap around deck)
View: Stayed on the 10th floor, ocean facing view (pic attached)
Restaurants: Good
Transportation: Shuttle to several local areas (nothing to/from airports)
Great place and property! Everything you need is right there.

This resort is wonderful. The staff was a dream. I messed up making my reservation and they fixed it right up for me before I got there so when I checked in, they had everything ready for me. My room was amazing with a full beach view. The restaurants and gift shop on the resort were so good. The beach was perfect. I had a wonderful time and can't wait to plan my next visit here.

First vacation in two years and soooooo worth the wait! Hotel property is well kept and clean. Staff are friendly and eager to help when needed.

How about the beaches‚Ä¶absolutely incredible with the best sand ever! Water is clean and not freezing cold.

Highly recommend!!

The good: location, pools, beach, food, restaurant staff, and pool staff.

The bad: housekeeping shows up occasionally, rooms are showing signs of wear. We had a collapsing ceiling in the shower and a musty smelling room.

All and all a good trip but could have been better. I typically expect a bit more from this hotel. We will be back in October. Hopefully things turn up from there.

Had never been to Destin before, but this was a lovely surprise.  The hotel is gorgeous, the staff were nice and my very favorites were the folks who brought drinks out to those of us occupying the beach chairs.  It's an enormous resort with golfing etc, but my friend and I are all about beach sitting.
Beautiful, modern hotel with friendly staff, spacious rooms, and amazing beach access!

My husband and I just came back from our small vacation, it was a really nice and beautiful experience with this hotel!!
Nice atmosphere, clean and great service!!  Even the food was so good and delicious.. we enjoyed our trip a lot and we will come back soon.. really highly recommend it

Absolutely LOVED my stay and can't wait to come back again! Great service and even though we came at a spring chilly season the pools and hot tub were AMAZING! Breakfast was definitely a highlight for the mornings before walking on the beach!
Always a wonderful place to stay. Can't wait to come back every year! The service is excellent and the staff are wonderful.

The resort is beautiful.  There are several properties on the resort. Villas, condo towers, and Hilton hotel. Beachside Tower 1 an 2 have direct access to the beach from the back door. I stayed in tower 1 in a two bedroom condo with king beds. Condo had view of the beach. Also there's a shuttle on the property that runs every 30 minutes and goes in town. Some villas also have golf carts included in the rental.

I had a fantastic vacation here! This resort is beautiful. We had originally booked our stay for 3 nights but we loved it so much we decided to cancel our trip to gulf shores and just extend our stay here the whole week. I loved the beach set up you could get with the umbrella and chairs and the beach was so beautiful and clean. The spa is wonderful and the dining options and cocktails in the resort were great. The golf course seems nice but I never went golfing. We got an ocean view room and had a beautiful view of the ocean, we even got to spot some dolphins swimming close to shore some of the mornings! It is on the expensive side but we felt it was worth it to indulge while on vacation. I would come back here and highly recommend it to others.
Loved our time here. Kids loved bunk beds and the pool. Parents enjoyed the views.

Amazing place and helpful staff. I'm in a wheelchair and everything is accessible. The beach view and pools are amazing and it was nice to unplug from daily routines. We even got to enjoy an awesome fireworks show on Friday too!

The Grand Boulevard is less than a mile from the resort with great restaurants with additional choices for food, entertainment and apparel.

I felt refreshed.

Nice get away... I believe this is an older resort, but very well kept. We enjoyed this area during the winter, and there it was lively, that is restaurants still opened, staffed, although slim, still well kept. Maturer crowd and property. We would come again... Views from the resort

Thanks to all the friendly staff at Hilton Sandestin for making our family spring break a relaxing and fun trip. This hotel is full of great amenities and we will definitely stay again. There are two different dinner menus, American and sushi, one place for a breakfast buffet and 2 lunch places. Also a cute caf√© serving Starbucks coffee. There are two outdoor pools and one indoor pool, one hot tub inside and one outside. Because it‚Äôs beachside you can also get chairs and an umbrella for $45 per day, $30 for a half day after 1 pm. We enjoyed the spa as well and the fitness center was clean and well laid out.
The property attracts a lot of families with small children so be aware when booking if you want something more adult and romantic- probably not a match.

Enjoyed our overnight stay despite the cold weekend. The lobby restaurant was delicious & customer service was good. We all wanted steaks but did not realize the strict formal rules at their steak restaurant downstairs.

The sign read no open toe shoes, etc and kids basically had to sit at table at all times and could not use ipads etc and had to stay in table. When my daughter was reading sign, a gentleman in a suit started questioning her. So we definitely felt like it was NOT kid friendly at all. Hopefully we can return to try it without all the super strict rules.

This place is exquisite. Only problem is i paid full price for a beach view room, walk to my balcony and am looking at the back of a pink "condo". I call down and ask about this and get the "sorry well move you tomorrow, no rooms tonight. I should only be paying the partial beach view price.

Honestly I expected more out of a Hilton resort.

I had issues with the bathroom tub. When turning it on it spewed brown water with black particles in it. Once showering it was a race to finish and shut off the water before the tub filled up. There must have been a huge clog in the drain. After removing the drain plug myself it was absolutely disgusting.

The breakfast was not great. The service was so-so. It was difficult to get our server to the table for anything. We were flagging down other servers for help. We paid $20 for the full breakfast option and I think it was equal if not worse than a complimentary breakfast that you'd pay a fraction for at other hotels. It was disgusting and pathetic. The only thing that saved breakfast for me was the custom made  omelette bar, which also made waffles. I didn't think it was possible to screw up bacon, but somehow they figured out a way. Save the $20 and go out for a real breakfast someplace else.

Birthday shout out to my homegirl Juanita.. I had a great time hanging with her in Destin, FL the last week ... I've never been before, but she has been telling me for years that I must go.. And I am so glad I did..

We stayed at the Hilton Sandestin Beach Golf Resort and Spa. It was beautifully decorated for the holiday season and our beach view room had the most incredible view.

We weren't that enchanted with the service at first, but we spoke about our issues to the front desk and it all got better as the stay progressed. We even added on an extra night stay.

Please note: We found room service to be exceptionally on point and very hospitable. However, it was the other services such as the indoor bar, restaurant and spa we found extremely lacking in hospitality.  Thank goodness the food was great, but the drinks left a lot to be desired.

Also, we felt that the spa services were too pricey for what was being offered and no one could or would confirm if it was worth the bother.. So we didn't.

The beach was everything...Green water and white sand..‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§

Inspite of those few mentioned hiccups we had a wonderful time and would return again.

#DestinFl
#Destiny
#Serenity
#MyNewHappyPlace

The BEST place to stay anywhere in the Destin area.  We have been staying there since 1990 and now go several times a year.  The employees are very nice, the amenities are every where at this resort and the two heated pools in addition to beachfront are big benefits.
Beautiful hotel with everything you need nearby.  My family and i had a great experience and will be back again next year.
Beautiful sunset that does not fail to amaze visitors.
10 stars! Amazing overall experience, pools are nice. Elevators are nice, I'm a diamond member so we got free drinks! Room 739!

Location: Great location

Price: fair price for a 4 Star in the off season (End of Jan)

Staff: Nice Friendly, use the Hilton App makes requests easier

Rooms: Beach facing. Roma's extremely nice clean. I do wish it had better showers and or a tub but that could just be room dependent.

Would definitely come back. Extremely pleased with everything on the trip

Friendly staff. Great sushi and raw bar! Breakfast buffet is amazing including an omelet station. The room.... The deluxe junior suite is a family's dream including a separate area for kids with bunk beds and a tv

We have been coming here since 2010 and the hotel has become more crowded, more expensive, more generic, and more of a disappointment.

Honestly, the excuse of staffing or product shortages is understandable but when you‚Äôre charging $600+ per night, you need to figure out how to workaround that excuse.

The rooms leave much to be desired. Dated, you can hear your neighbors, bedding is uncomfortable, our couch had gross stains on it and had a broken armrest. Balcony clearly had not been cleaned, it was covered in bird droppings.

Horrendous service at the bar/restaurant in the lobby - it took over 30 minutes to have our server approach our table. While waiting the televisions were out of service so we were lucky enough to stare at a blank/error screen from directv. A few people asked our server if she could turn on the Stanley Cup - that request took 25 minutes to complete.

We asked the concierge to call Seagar‚Äôs and schedule a reservation for us, she did right in front of me. Once the restaurant opened I called them to verify the reservations - the host stated she had no voicemail and she couldn‚Äôt fit us in now but we were welcome to eat at the bar. So we went to the restaurant and noticed there was a dress code posted on the door - we were not in dress code and told we would need to conform to the dress code or we would not be served. Men, you must have dress slacks, closed toed shoes, collard shirt, (and a jacket is preferred) according to the host. So we left the resort and went to another restaurant. I‚Äôm fine with a dress code but educate your employees to inform guests there is a dress code, Hilton, come on. The concierge and the host (when I called) could have communicated the dress code.

The location on the beach is obviously nice, but the rest of the resort is overrated at this point. Far from impressive, very overpriced, and it just disappoints on almost every level.
Fantastic resort. Great beaches and amenities. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
This is a great hotel with excellent amenities and amazing service.

We‚Äôve stayed here 4 times.  Great location for golf & shopping.  Super nice beach & pool/deck facility. The rooms and lobby restaurant are in need of big update.  Cigars restaurant is very good, and expensive!

Meet Christie. She is a master of her craft and drink coercion. She points and you drink. Have no worries though, whatever she suggests will be blissful. Almost as blissful as her sweet personality. Thank you Christie for the awesome drinks and great conversation.

This hotel is absolutely amazing! The staff is awesome too. The only real issue was the lack of understanding when it came to the room service attendant on the phone not understanding what I was saying both days I ordered.
If you can manage get a corner suite with a wrap around balcony. It is amazing! We will miss you Hilton Sandestin Beach!

Love this resort. My second time here. My first time in a suite and it is very nice. Resort staff is very friendly and won't hesitate to answer any questions. There was a light bulb that went out and staff quickly replaced all the bulbs in that fixture. Very very very happy and love the amenities!

Very nice hotel, okay fitness center, decent conference rooms, multiple pools indoor and out.

Good beach front rooms, and helpful staff.

Would definitely come again.

Love the resort. Stayed in Tivoli, which is a short walk or quick golf cart ride to the beach. Tivoli is a quieter area which we love. You can still ride the golf cart to the Village, Grand Blvd. and Publix. So many things to do especially for families. If your rental offers the shuttle, that's a bonus. You can take the shuttle to the Village, no worries about having too much fun!  Beach is absolutely BEAUTIFUL.

We had a great stay. The facility is highly aware of covid, which is great!

Though we did not need them, families should be aware that there are rooms with a main room and bunk beds in a cubby hole.

The staff was fantastic.  Use the concierge as they really are knowledgeable and can make arrangements.

The Front desk staff was also top notch.

There are wonderful facilities including heated pools indoor and out. Hot tubs are also both inside and outside.

There are two ramps for beach access and though it's a long walk, we walked to the state park just east of the property.

There are several restaurants on property and scores more nearby. Including a coffee bar and a sushi bar.

Wheelchair accessibility is easy,  though calling ahead would be smart.

Very Clean and Accommodating... we're there a couple of issues, yes a guest chain smoking on the balcony and an overworked waitress packing a bad attitude.  Both cases were squashed immediately by hospitable management.  My job on vacation, is to run traps and assure that my Bride of 35 years and Grandson have the best time possible so, I'm  on point... kicking the tires... to head of any issues before they become a problem!  Well, the Hilton Personnel made my job a cake walk.  Weather, Restaurants... including a Spectacular evening at Seagars Steakhouse üí•, Pools, Spa, Beach Umbrella/Chair Facilitators, and Beach Bar Waitresses simply complimented the perfect weather , clean White Beaches our entire stay.  Very orderly crowd, but never felt "policed". I wouldn't hesitate in returning and look forward to our next stay... Oh, never ran out of things to do and see, including a day at the Big Kahuna Waterpark, just 9 miles down the road.
Enough Said... Finally!!  ü§£

World class!! I'd give it 10/10 if i could. Clean,friendly,kid friendly. The pictures online do this place no justice. The beach is never crowded. Staff goes above and beyond to ensure you have an amazing stay.

Great hotel. Right along the beach with nice rooms, and at least three pools. Nice staff as well.

We had a junior suite which had a king bed and bunk beds for the kids. (Plus a pull out.)

The bathroom was spacious and had two shower heads for a luxurious experience.

Solid beach-side hotel.  Nice grounds.  Hotel staff are extremely friendly/kind.  I was there for a conference - and the conference amenities were good as well.  An attempted video-feed welcome from one of our senior execs was terminally choppy.  That was unfortunate.  In general - things went well at the hotel.  The only personal incident was a minor one... when they cleaned the room, they failed to replace the shampoo/ bodywash/ conditioner.  In the sad little moment, I actually contacted the desk 3 times in 12 hours to see if they would replace the items before my final morning.  They never materialized.
Overall - experience was good.  The lack of follow-through on a minor item makes me wonder what other gaps may be present.  Probably a great spot, particularly in the spring, summer, fall months.  Pretty darn chilly in February.

Travel we family excellent customer service through the stay check-in and check out very fast  helpful and knowledgeable staff. Room very  clean the view fantastic it was very convenient  to be  by the beach. The  food at the breakfast  buffet great we dine in my husband and daughter love the lobster bisket.

The water in Destin has been great this week. However, I can say without a doubt my family will never book at San Destin again. The hotel is fine, but they put out about 300 chairs on the beach everyday, half of which never get used. So unless you‚Äôre looking to spend $45 a day on a chair and umbrella rental, you‚Äôre confined to approximately 10 yards of sand between the chairs and the ocean. Judging by how crowded this small space is, it tells me there are plenty of sensible people here that aren‚Äôt about to pay what they want for an umbrella and chair rental. If you want to go to the beach to get away from crowds this ain‚Äôt the place.

I had a wonderful experience at Hilton , every staff member I encountered from valet to the check in to the cleaning staff were delightful.. thank you for great service
Desk staff MIHIR is pleasant and helpful..
Overall incredibly helpful
Room was just wonderful and sea view was perfect ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è
Perfect place our for anniversary celebration .

We stayed the weekend for our marriage retreat. Over 400 couples and everything went smooth. The hotel was excellent. Our room was beautiful. The balcony view was simply breath taking. The room was clean and the hospital was spotless. The food was also good. We plan on booking again for my son's birthday. There was also a fireworks show that was planned by the church,  and it went off perfectly.

Nice hotel with nice accommodations. Everyone was very friendly. Rooms spacious and clean. Multiple pools and restaurants. Great access to the beach. Great views from the rooms. A couple of down sides - random $30 per day "resort fee"in addition to nightly rate. Also, $40/day for 2 chairs and an umbrella on the beach. You would think paying more than $250/night would cover beach chairs at a beach resort.

Beautiful hotel. Amazing views of the water over a sparkling white sand beach. The perfect vacation picture. The rooms are very nice and up to date. My room even has an almost suite-like feel with an extra nook with bunk bed and tv for kiddos. I'm traveling alone and for business, so the dank roof-top balcony view with peek-a-boo sights of the shore are not too disappointing. If I were here for pleasure I'd request a different room. Just fine for work though. The lobby is spacious and friendly. The conference rooms are clean and well equipped. I'd be happy to come back for another "business meeting" someday!

My wife and I had a wonderful stay. It started with being able to check in early our first day. Our room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom spotless:). There are a number of out door and indoor pools. Restaurants out on the main deck. Food there was also tasty. Great ocean frontage. Seems to be an excellent place for families and couples. Thank you, there is a Starbucks in the building! We will look forward to returning here.

You enter the lobby and feel like you are on vacation, the moment you walk through the door.  The restaurants were great but the service was slow.  The ambiance makes up for it.  Expect resort prices on everything.  The pools were good but the beach is stellar.  The rooms were big, comfortable and we had an amazing ocean view.  The kids loved the bunk beds.  This is resort living, you never really have to leave but if you do there is plenty to do.
Our family enjoyed our family vacation in Destin, Florida. We were in the Osprey Pointe with plenty of rooms and fantastic service.
This resort was so relaxing from the time we walked inside so many amenities  and the staff  was top notch.

INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE!! Beautiful beaches, amazing sunset views, great restaurants and spa inside the resort and enough socially distancing to make everyone comfortable! We loved our time here and would definitely come back to play more golf, tennis, and relax!

This is one of the nicest hotels in SanDestin.  The views are extravagant! The rooms are amazing,  with plenty of room.   The beds are super comfortable.   The food is delicious. The hotel staff is so friendly and helpful.  From the time we arrived,  until the time we left,  we were made to feel at home.  This is definitely the place to stay!!!

Very nice and large hotel with great beach views,  indoor and outdoor pools that stay open late. They have two jacuzzis but they were always full. There is a Starbucks and a few restaurants inside.  However,  there are tons of places to eat in Destin also. Beds were comfy, but the pillows were wimpy.  Good balcony and showers.

Very nice beach.  Grounds well maintained.  Friendly & helpful staff.  Indoor and outdoor pools. Outdoor bar has a large selection of frozen drinks.  Indoor pool open past midnight.  Drinks and food were great but slightly pricey.
Junior suite roomy.  Only complaint-A/C was working hard and room had slight musty odor.
Beautiful place on the beach...     we always love going here for our union class trip...

Stayed at the Hilton Sandestin for a work conference. The room and the hotel were really nice and relaxing. The conference center could use some work. I was disappointed the bars closed so early but it's understandable. The billing is what frustrated me but it is what it is. I would recommend this hotel to anyone the view was amazing.

Wonderful stay at the Beautiful Hilton Sandestin Resort! This was a great area especially for Families!

We visited for 5 days of spring break and really enjoyed this beautiful hotel! From the start it was a great experience! The front desk attendant Mihir that checked us in was friendly and helpful and gave us the run down of what to expect at the hotel and where things were located.

We stayed in room 605. This was a King bed deluxe 1 bedroom family suite which fit our family of 4 comfortably.

This room was a great size with 2 bathrooms, bunk beds for the kids, a large living room with a pull out couch, balcony with seating, and the best part, a separate large king bedroom with private bathroom for the grown ups. This room could also be adjoined with an additional room with the connecting door in the living room for larger parties.

The 2 bathrooms were very convenient when returning from the pool or beach. There was also a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker bar in the living room as well as a table with chairs. There were 3 televisions in the room as well.

The room had a partial view of the beach from the king bedroom and the balcony. If you are able to get a higher floor it would be ideal since the pink condos do block a bit of the view. But it wasn‚Äôt a deal breaker for us since you are really here for the beach experience and amenities on property and not just hanging in the room.

This stretch of Miramar beach is beautiful and Hilton keeps their area very clean! The sand is soft, white, and a fine powder. The water is super clear and has a sandy bottom with minimal to no seaweed.

They do have umbrella and chair rentals that you can reserve online or at the counter. We booked 2 umbrellas and chairs the day of at the counter since we weren‚Äôt sure which day we would spend at the beach. We were on the second row to be side by side but if a water view matters to you, reserve online in advance. We were in and out of the water so much it didn‚Äôt matter to our family.

The water is gorgeous at this beach and filled with lots of families! Although it was spring break, we didn‚Äôt see any of the usual college crowd and later found out from some locals that this is more of a family friendly area and the hotel doesn‚Äôt rent to people under 25.

We spent a lot of time at the outdoor pool which was heated. There are 2 outdoor pools and one indoor pool. We frequented the pool near the larger tower and it was a very good size with a range of depths from 3 ft to 8 ft. There were plenty of loungers available around the pool and deck. The snack shop was steps away and had ice cream which we enjoyed as well as a the beach bar that had fun fruity drinks! We ordered a few food items with our credit as a honors benefit (shrimp quesadilla, hotdogs, fries etc) and even had drink and food service on the beach under the umbrellas which was nice! Mary at the indoor bar was also very friendly and provided great service!

We did receive daily housekeeping which was a pleasant surprise since I had read previous reviews that it wasn‚Äôt offered due to covid restrictions. We were very happy since we had lots of showers and went through a lot of towels from our beach and pool days. I am so glad housekeeping is back. It is really nice to come back to fresh towels, empty trash cans, and a nicely made bed. It makes it feel like a real vacation!

There was a slight musty smell in the room when the air was running but it didn‚Äôt bother us very much. We had great water pressure and the water temperature for showers was good.

Overall, Our whole family enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Sandestin Resort! We can‚Äôt wait to come back again for a beach break!

We have visited this resort many times. Our family loves coming to this resort because it has great amenities.... beautiful beach, plenty of places to eat, nice large rooms and friendly staff. Our partial view room (151) this time wasn't great though. They were completely booked and we couldn't get a better location.

Wonderful rooms, wonderful staff, this hotel was incredible all around. The sushi joint inside is priced fairly, and I was surprised the prices weren't through the roof. Excellent bar, the pools were fantastic, our ocean view was a dream. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel and our visit. I absolutely loved every part of it.

Beautiful hotel. Right on the beach with great amenities. Rooms are very nice, and the on-site restaurants are delicious. probably the best feature of this hotel is how close it is to the beach, and the fact that it has several different pools that you can choose from if you don't feel like swimming in the ocean.

We reserved two large suites for our party of six.  We only had 2 nights and 2 days at the resort and wanted to spare no expense.  This was a trip that my father wanted to take his grandchildren and great grandson on after my brother‚Äôs recent passing.  He needed this to re-center himself and the family while celebrating my brother‚Äôs memory.  We had high hopes of enjoying our time together and showing my brother‚Äôs grandson his first beach and ocean.
The first night my father's shower door shattered and as a result, he received cuts on his hands, feet and torso.  Nothing serious, but since my father is 71, his skin is thin and the smallest cut will bleed forever, which he continued to do the whole weekend from multiple places.  We were down to one bathroom for 6 people for most of the trip.  They didn't have any other rooms to move us to.  Room service took 90 minutes which was unfortunate because the 3-year old in our party really needed his grilled cheese.  EVERY time we took a shower, the smoke alarm went off, either waking the 3-year old (if he was sleeping) or scaring him to death (if he was awake).  Every time I called the front desk to share the issue, the staff responded with "yes, the smoke alarms do that because of the steam."  Great.  If you know they "do that," why not fix the problem with appropriate ventilation?
Maintenance, security/first aid team and wait staff were all very kind, but the management team was unwilling to compensate us for the terrible situation we found ourselves in at the hotel.  After everything that happened, they were only willing to credit one night of ONE of the rooms back to us.
Such a shame that customers/clients are treated so poorly. It's not like we were being cheap.  We never left the resort because we had such a short time there.  We continued to spend like crazy at the gift shop and restaurants.  We tipped generously at every turn.  Why would management treat people this way? YOU DIDN'T HOLD UP YOUR END OF THE DEAL, HILTON.  ~$700 a night per room for complete insanity . . . Scratching my head . . .
All that being said, while we were on the beach, watching my brother‚Äôs grandson play on the beautiful sand and in the gorgeous blue waters of the ocean, we were able to celebrate our family, and for that, we are grateful.

My family and I were visiting there easter weekend (3-4 April) and It was as nice of an experience this past weekend as it was back when we first visited back in October 2018. The rooms were clean and the staff's response to the COVID protocols were exceptional. Room service was top notch as well! Hopefully, we will come back down for another visit to the beautiful beaches of my home state very soon.
Had a great time. Place was clean and well kept. Staff were friendly and responsive.  Housekeeping did a great job. The beach was beautiful!! We'll be back

Long story...the view of sunset from room was amazing...front desk young guy when we checked in after driving 8 hrs told us that the room we booked just on our way that night wasn't a room they had...after him telling us we could pay $40 more a night r find another hotel.,we ask to see his manager lady came out and said the email we had was not a room they had .she didn't know how we could have booked a room like that ..finally she decided to let us she could up grade us for no cost ..they didn't give us a parking pass and every time I went out of resort guard would stop me and ask questions and I would show him my room key..very stressful time..I  finally went to front desk the day we were leaving and ask her if they could take resort fee off..and she said yes and that young guy would get more training...

Stayed here for almost a week while doing some work for the Hilton. My room was a King size deluxe with a partial view. The room was large and spacious. Plenty of room. Mini fridge and microwave. Private balcony. The view wasn't horrible only being a partial. Room was clean. Would def bring the family in busy season when its warm lol.
We had a great mini family vacation here. Lots of activities in one place and food so you don‚Äôt have to leave the the hotel. The staff is accommodating and it‚Äôs very clean.

We are locals in the area and absolutely love the Hilton. we decided to stop in for a spa treatment. My husband had an excellent massage and really enjoyed the Spa. Come an hour early before your spa you'll enjoy the amenities. Plus we had lunch by the pool deck with stunning views of the beach.

We stayed in a suite with a balcony beach view. It was a free upgrade so we were thrilled! In late August, the weather was quite hot and humid so we didn't spend as much time on the balcony as I wanted but it was still lovely in the evenings. There was a lot of options (expensive) to eat within the resort as well as a free tram that can bring you to other parts of town with more options. I highly recommend taking the (free) tram to explore the neighboring village.

My husband booked this hotel for my birthday and it was amazing! The room was so nice with the BEST view I've ever had in a hotel! And the spa...amazing! I wish I could remember the name of the lady that did my body wrap because I loved talking with her as much as I loved having my treatment!

This place is absolutely beautiful! Lots to do on the resort for all. Our room was nice and clean. I have 2 complaints.... One is how HORRIBLY uncomfortable the couch/pullout bed is. It was awful as both! Two is they need more signs posted around the property showing how to get to areas of the resort.

Perfect place to spend a night before checking into our house in Seaside for the week. A resort day put us perfectly in the mood to relax and transition to vacation life on 30a. Heated pool, pool side dining and beach drink service were all fabulous!

The resort is well run with some great amenities. However, the rooms (at least the room we stayed in) need to be updated and remodeled.  All rooms were booked so we couldnt move to a new one.
The AC was leaking and the floor was soaking wet. The staff said it was from a previous occupant's cooler but it was directly below the AC supply vent and stayed wet the whole time. The room smelled like mildew. The toilet kept running and would not fill unless you removed the tank cap and jiggled the handle. The tub had been resurfaced and was peeling in large sections the edges of which would have cut you if you slipped on them. When you pushed the button to divert the water from the tub spout to the shower head the button would fly out and hit you in the leg or land on your foot...everytime.
Beyond all that things were clean and the staff was pleasant. Still at 300+ a night I expected much better.  3 stars for the staff and the over all resort.

Great price, location and room service. Definitely make sure they don't charge for an extra meal... Had it happen. The reviews are correct on that one little annoyance lol but over all good. Yes... Sandestin has a separate charge and tax even though it's not Hilton.

As a loyal hilton customer i booked this hotel putting good faith in the Hilton brand. In destin/sandestin/miramar beach area this is by far one of the best options out there if you can afford the price tag. This hotel is impressive, right on the beach with all amenities you could want including beach services from 9am-5pm like chairs/umbrellas ($39 fee plus reservation recommend ed) plus bar service. Pools are excellent even indoor pool with jacuzzi. All common spaces seem to be renovated and include restaurants, bars, sushi, gifts shops, ice cream parlor and coffee shops. Essentially if you wish to remain on resort you have everything there. Staff overall was friendly and helpful at front desk. Rooms are spectacular if you get ocean view junior suite. Only thing i was disappointed in during my 5 night stay was i attributed to lack of quality leadership of the hotel management team for not following up and enforcing nonsmoking rules. I fully enjoyed my vacation until 3rd night when more people checked in and decided to smoke cigars all day out on balcony and including marijuana at night which just filled my room up with unpleasant smell. I could not even enjoy being outside my room without smelling distasteful cigars/weed. After several complaints to staff the problem just persisted without resolution. This is the only negative of my entire stay at Hilton Sandestin Resort and I out that on leadership team for not enforcing rules and following up when issues occur.  Aside from that i would still highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for great beach getaway. I give this hotel overall 4.0 out of 5.

Phenomenal hotel and resort!!  The customer service begins the second you drive through the entrance gate to walking into your room!  World class customer service abounds in every corner of this hotel. Rooms are super clean as well as the remainder of the hotel.  Located right on the beach, it takes ministers to get from your room to the beach.  Food was amazing as well.  I‚Äôve pasted a picture of the omelet made by Jarrell.  Over the years, I have tried to perfect the perfect omelet but Jarrell took it to another level.  I watched him as he took order after order remembering each and every customer and serving them with a smile!  This chef was AMAZING and I wanted to highlight him on this post.  Only complaint I would have would be the rude people who go to these places and think that the people who serve them are subservient to them.  You‚Äôd be surprised (if you only took the time) to learn about them.  Many served in the military, or were professionals in their previous lives. Take the time to THANK them for cleaning your rooms, or taking your luggage to your room, or pouring you a drink.  A THANK YOU can go along way to people who provide a service to you!!!!!

Great place and as always, kudos to the hotel leadership and the Hilton brand!

The hotel was nice.  The staff were friendly and ready to accommodate.   Our door lock was broken,  and maintenance came at 10pm to fix it.  That was just a bit late!ü§îü§î  Many of the amenities that you would expect to be included, with paying so much for a room, had an extra cost to them.

I ordered the Philadelphia roll and I have had sushi before at other places but here when you bit into it, the cream cheese just melts on your tongue and you can taste the freshness in the salmon and each individual ingredient down to the rice everything of such quality. Great atmosphere, also got to watch the game on a huge screen and now my wife is soaking in a hot bath in some scented bath salts from the gift shop. Sit on the balcony as long as you want and hear the waves crash.

It has been an excellent stay!  All of the employees have been very friendly and helpful.  The room is nice, and the view is good.
There are a lot of services, so many that I didn't get around to all of them!
Seagar‚Äôs Prime Steaks and Seafood- AMAZING! Entire experience-5 ++ stars (dining within the beautiful Hilton Sandestin Beach Golf Resort)

I had a fantastic stay. My room was clean and spontaneous. The bathroom were super clean fun part too is there are a few indoor and outdoor pools aswell. Food is delicious also the restaurant is on the main deck, Ocean view is beautiful and family oriented I love it here at the Hilton also let me not forget how all the staff I interact with had an exceptional customer service and we're very friendly and greet me warm. Definitely will be visiting again soon üîú thanks for your service

Every year for our anniversary we visit Sandestin and it is absolutely beautiful. The atmosphere, the staff, everything about this property it's just an absolute delight. The activities, bicycle rides, walking, enjoying the sunrise, sunset, the amusement park , the shopping, the eateries, it's just absolutely wonderful. I highly recommend this resort especially for those lazy days you sometimes need while on vacation.

This place was really nice. The staff was very friendly. Everyone was there to help us. No one seemed to have a bad day and everyone acted the way you would want. The FOOD is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G.. the view is incredible. They have a nice gym, inside and outside pool. Inside and out side hot tub, Restaraunt, meeting rooms. The best place to stay in destin look no further.

The master bedroom closet was used as a broom closet, urine on the toilet seat, trash was left in the garbage can from the last guests, the shower was ice cold on the first night of our stay, the sink was clogged (day 2). Upon addressing concerns we were told to wait until the am to call when management would be available. When the call was placed management sent out staff that did not have the courtesy to knock on the door prior to clean the toilet (same day). The resolve was 40% off next stay. That is unsatisfactory. After an experience like that in a place like the "Hilton" is not worth circulating another investment at this location. In the future staff should not tell guest the water is hot due to small water heater. Just fix and keep the explanations.

We stayed here and number of times and I finally decided to write a review. Even though Destin could be very busy with a lot of traffic, once you go through the gate and the guard shack, everything changes on property and a hectic life is left behind the gate. The Hotel lobby is newly renovated and done very upscale. We stayed in a Junior suite couple of times and really enjoyed it, the room is a very large size with two bunkbeds as you come into the room, There‚Äôs a nicely remodeled bathroom with a tub and shower plus another staying outside the bathroom. Our room had a king size bed with the large sofa and a beautiful nice balcony overlooking the pool and the gulf. The room also includes a mini fridge and a microwave. Definitely will stay here again.

My family and I Loved this place! Always fun to stay at this hotel!Easy access to the beach! The pool is great, and has a great view! Unfortunately the jacuzzi is too small for this place! We loved out junior suite! The view was excellent!

Great location and beach. Hurricane Nate hit while we were here but cleared up in a couple of days. The Beach was back to normal and all was well. Great beach service! We paid $39 for a beach set up that was well worth it. (2 chairs, umbrella and towels). You can buy them cheap at Alvins Island but didn't want to bother carrying them back and forth through the hotel. Drinks and food at beach were very good.

Arrived to the welcome center and was greeted by two friendly receptionists, was given key cards and the information needed for the grounds. The room was clean upon arrival, was wanting a room with a full ocean view but go a partial view, all in all it was a nice room great ac the tub drained slowly but i think thats the only problem i had.

This beach has lifeguards.  Clean sand and there waves were about 2 feet swells.  Somewhat crowded with family and kids.  Great time with plenty of fun.  Very nice facilities and a foot wash plus bath house.

It was wonderful! Staff was great. Everything was immaculate. Best vacation I've had. Going back next year. Beautiful place and grounds and the beach was so clean and the sand so white and pure  it squeaks when u walk on it.

My wife and I went to this hotel for our 20th Anniversary this last week.  I was really worried about picking a new hotel since I wanted everything to be perfect for us, and it was!  From the moment we pulled up, the staff was very attentive, and quickly got us checked in.  We splurged and went with the Ambassador Suite, which was by far one of the best hotel rooms I have ever stayed in.

I cannot say enough about the Sandestin Beaches, they are absolutely gorgeous!  Even with the temperature being a little chilly, the water was still fairly warm, and walking on the soft white powder sand was a dream.

While we were there we partook in many of the hotel's amenities.  The spa was amazing, and to my surprise we had free access since I am diamond.  We also got the side by side 80 minute  aroma therapy and Swedish massage, which was probably the best massage we had ever had!  We rented a beach site for the day, and the young man who helped us out was very friendly and got us all setup very quickly.

If, I have one complaint it is that the steakhouse, Seagars, was a huge let down.  The meal was priced at what I would expect from fine dinning, but the steaks were awful, and the staff spent the entire time up-selling us and telling us how great they were, that I couldn't even get a word in edgewise.  Meanwhile the steaks were so gristly that we couldn't even chew them.

All in all an amazing place to spend a romantic get away!  Skip the Seagars restaurant while you are there and spend your money on the other amazing amenities.
Beautiful property. Very nice rooms. Good food from room service. Great meeting facilities.

We reserved a Front Ocean view and got an obstructed view by palm trees. Called down to complain and spoke to a Jill, very rude lady
Management: Jill, one of the managers asked me to come down to the front desk area to pick up my breakfast certificates so I stopped by on our way to the beach. I guess she was busy so a nice gentleman assisted me and retrieved them for me, I counted the certificates just to confirm and noticed I was missing 2 for each day. I should have received 16 certificates (4 days x 4 guests), I only had enough for 2 guests, not 4. I pointed this out to the gentleman but he was not aware of the details and called Jill to speak with me. Jill came up to the front right side of the check in area and advised her I only received 8 certificates. She stated she offered me 2 free breakfasts each day for the inconvenience of the room type error but that our 7-year-old was free each day for breakfast (kids 10 and under are free). I said OK...but what about our 4th person? This is not what we agreed on. She lied right to my face because there was no way I would have agreed to such an offer and leave the 4th person out. I registered 4 guests for our room, why would I only accept 2 breakfast vouchers? Jill very rudely kept repeating to me, that is what we agreed on when I called downstairs. I took the vouchers and said I‚Äôd be right back with my wife and she will talk to you. My wife was PO, we waited about 10 minutes for the main manager to come out and after all that, Jill comes back out. My wife was not having it and told her we were not speaking to Jill and needed the hotel manager. After a few more minutes, we meet and start speaking with Kelcie Faulk-she seemed a lot nicer and more friendly than her co-worker Jill. We explained the entire situation to Kelcie and she said to give her a minute to sort things out and she would try and make it right (their slogan by the way). After a few minutes, Kelcie came back and apologized for everything but that she could only do 12 vouchers this time which would now cover our 12-year-old but would only now cover 3 days instead of 4. We are still livid at this point because they did not put us in the correct room type to begin with and were now going back on their promise to offer breakfast for all 4 of us for our entire stay. After a few more minutes of explaining ourselves and how we drove all this way and chose to stay at this property based on what family and friends said about it, bottom line‚Ä¶that was our final offer. We were tired of arguing and just wanted to get on the beach and finally start enjoying our vacation. Kelcie was very nice and showed compassion towards our situation unlike Jill but I guess her hands were tied after that final offer. We took our vouchers but did let Kelcie know we intended to make a formal complaint against Hilton and Jill. *There is more to these vouchers in the breakfast section.
Breakfast: All you hear from this hotel staff is ‚ÄúI am sorry about this and sorry about that‚Äù Everywhere you go, they are constantly apologizing for something-not a good sign. Therefore, I am assuming they give everyone who complains and has issues, breakfast vouchers. I‚Äôd say about 90% of the breakfast guests pay with these vouchers-you can‚Äôt miss them, they are bright blue and say ‚Äúcompliments‚Äù on them. So, in the end, we didn‚Äôt feel valued or received the accurate value for the room discrepancy since seems everyone got these vouchers. Get down there very early or right as they are about to stop serving breakfast because they get slammed. On our last breakfast there, we waited about 45 minutes but that was because the host screwed up and skipped over our name. I had to go up there and point out that 2 parties of 4 had gone before us when we were there before them. Our waitress was also nonexistent and not very friendly. She brought our drink orders and never saw her again until we asked for a manager about our drink refills, suddenly, she appears from nowhere. Aside from the beach, the breakfast food was the only good thing here. NEVER EVER coming back here
