Was here for 8 days stayed in hotel . Was great food, very clean ,great staff and very accommodating.  Will definitely return

My signature resort.  It's always been my most favorite experience.  The Sandestin will exceed your expectations of vacation luxury.  Truly you've arrived if you're considering a stay here.  Great for kids..conventions and the most excellent food...room service..yes please.

This place is great! They have many different restaurants to satisfy everyone's taste buds. Access to the beach is very easy and the different pools they have also satisfy everyone's needs. Breakfast buffet is a must and delicious. Highly recommend and it's worth the price!
Great option. Price was reasonable and the staff was very helpful. Great view of the beach and close to shopping

Wonderful hotel right on the beach and so beautiful!! Indoor pool as well as indoor hot tub.. Also outdoor pool and hot tub. Our room was a double but as soon you walk in there is bulk beds for the kids. Loved the hotel!!

So far the stay has been nice. Room, view, beach and water are amazing! Jennifer Simms was able to get my room taken care of via booking ‚ò∫Ô∏è.  We arrived a little early and the receptionist had us wait 2 hrs.  After those long hours Darryl Smith took care of getting our room together ‚ù§ and apologized for the wait.  We went to get ice cream from Picnik's and I watched a young lady by the name of Savannah scratch her head, wipe her hand on her apron and reach for an ice cream cone (no gloves) and serve food ü§¢, so we left.  I went over to Starbucks (they had ice cream) and a young lady by the name of Shavel was there - I watched her put on gloves to serve the customers ahead of us so that made me feel better (no one asked her to put on gloves, she did it on her own).  I'd like to send a thank you to the 3 of them and will be turning in a review to the hotel as well.
This is a great resort! So close to the beach has nice restaurants inside and great staff that are quick and available.
Very nice!  Will go again.  Do not order the shrimp tacos. Like dude? Really?! But the BLT was slamming.
We enjoyed to play golf 3 days on rounds me . My father and my brother

Guest service was excellent at this Hilton.  They checked on us via text several times during our stay.  Check in and check out was seamless.  The only complaint I have is that Picnix Market and The Coffee Shop should have been open until 9pm.

Beautiful beachfront hotel in the very nice Sandestin Resort. The Hilton sits between the ocean beach and a wide grassy lake-lined boulevard that is thoroughly beautiful and relaxing. The Hilton has all of the major amenities you could need, including both indoor and outdoor pools, restaurants, water sport rentals, a fitness center and so forth.

The Sandestin Resort itself features golf, tennis and the fun Baytown Village area that has a ton of carnival type activities for kids (as well as restaurants and bars for adults).

The market area at the entrance to the resort has a pizza place, ice cream, a juice shop and a fun "escape room" called Escapology.
Beautiful place ...beaches are the best ...Hilton has nice eateries...upscale indeed.. beautiful people, excellent service
Had an amazing time! I wish we could have stayed longer. That staff was wonderful and the amenities are great.
Rooms were large and comfortable. Plenty of good places to eat on-site. Staff were very pleasant and nice. Great views and location on the beach.
Always a great visit. Friendly front desk staff, hard working valet and baggage carriers. We usually go three times a year for conferences and we've always had wonderful service from everyone there.
Amazing! The trees and water are absolutely gorgeous! Also, you MUST go to Black Bear. They have the most AMAZING cinnamon rolls.
Amazing place to stay at when you are in the Sandestin Miramar Beach Destin location

The Sandestin Hilton has been a beautiful home away from home since it was built 35 years ago, so it is a place of many memories and firsts for the children in our family through the years of celebrations. It has only increased in its beauty with time and improvements, the grounds, privacy, amenities, pools, indoors, and out, spa, tennis courts, restaurants, gift shop, bars, children's activities, pet facilities, and proximity and free shuttles to Sandestin's Baytowne, entertainment center restaurants, shops, marina, golfing, give this area a relaxed, yet, simultaneously adventurous staycation feel, with a unique wide range of day and night time activities to explore, all while being on the beautiful sugar white sands of the Gulf of Mexico of Beautiful North West Florida's Emerald Coast. The rooms are well designed, and decorated, modern, with all the expected amenities and more, ample storage, and room, to spread out and relax. A stay at the Sandestin Hilton, with it's friendly accommodating staff, is a good place, for a good time.

The truth is that this will always be my destination in Florida, wow, I loved it, we left a gold chain in the room and after all day I called and in a matter of 20 minutes maximum I had my object on my way to Houston, which is where I live 5 stars, the service in the hotel it's really good love it. Thank you.

The resort is nice and very clean.  But apparently hotel policy doesn‚Äôt allow you to set up canopies and umbrellas because they spread Covid.

First time I‚Äôve been to a Hilton in a long time.  Maybe it‚Äôll be another 10+ years before we go back to one.  Marriott for the win.

Booked trough Expedia for Labor Day weekend 2020 and some how had two rooms booked under my name even though one was canceled.   I tried to explain, that one room was cancelled ahead of time, to the terrible night supervisor on duty 9/4, but she was not helpful.   I waisted almost three hours of my vacation to get this corrected.  Finally,  it was corrected only because of the front desk manager working on 9/5. Besides the rudeness, the hotel had, sub-par cleaning...we had hair in our bed, toilet, and bathroom floor when we checked in.  Best part of the stay was the view.  Keep in mind this hotel is old and dated.  Book early to get something nicer.  This resort is not worth the money.

Overall is good, but Hilton needs to clarify about breakfast lines price. I enjoyed the 15th-floor room. This picture is the view from Hilton Sandestin Beach Gold Resort & Spa on the 15th floor.

This was an amazing resort! We loved it because it was very family friendly and it's right on the beach. We had a beach view balcony with the children's bunk beds and two double beds and a sofa bed. It was plenty of room for our family of 5. We wanted the one with the king bed and sofa bed but they were booked. The rooms are very very very clean. The minute we arrived it was top notch service. The indoor po was great seeing our last 2 days we had bad weather. The kids were still able to enjoy the day in the pool and when things cleared up we went back out to the beach. The bellmen were amazing.    However the restaurant in the main lobby needs to find some better help. Most of the servers just didn't seem to have the care that you would expect to find in a resort like the Hilton especially when you're pretty much dropping $25 on a some eggs and bacon.The servers were missing in action allot and I had to end up going to find one on several occasions. Dinner was the worst. It's like the servers knew they were getting a big tip no matter what due to the menu pricing so they really never came around. The other negative thing that was our balcony. It must have just been painted not too long before we got there because we walked onto the balcony forgetting our sandals and we ended up with paint on our feet.. Looks like it was just peeling and not fresh. Other than that I had no complaints.We usually Uber out to explore nearby things to do but we saved on Uber and the hassle of taking the car in and out and waiting for valet. There's plenty of shops around if you're into shopping. They have complimentary transportation available to the different resorts, golf courses, outlets, and to the village of baytowne. I recommend the village for everyone. They have lots to do for the kiddos and different restaurants to grab alcoholic beverages for the adults lol. And the best part is you can enjoy your adult beverages knowing no one is driving back. My kids are 12, 7, and 5 and they all enjoyed it. It's kind of like a mini version of disney springs (when I say mini I mean real mini version but fun for all). They have zip lining, wall climbing, a rope course, a small arcade, trampoline bungee jump, and shopping. Over the stay was great. We ended up extending our stay and have booked another week in July!
One of the best beaches I've seen anywhere in US. The resort is fantastic! My family of six rented bikes and had a fantastic, safe, vacation!

What a special and memorable experience!  Newly redecorated room with new carpet and furniture.  Great views from every room, nice pool area, spa and restaurants!  Secluded and secure property with excellent beach access just 20 steps from the patio.  Gated access to the expansive resort property with private homes, villas, lakes, and lots of green space.   This place feels like home the minute you drive in, and is has a very exclusive country club type of feel.  You will love it!  Close to lots of shopping and restaurants if you have a car, or take the shuttle which runs every 15 minutes around the property.   Be sure and take in the baytown warf area with tons of fun restaurants and bars on property, just across the road into the other half of the private resort!!
Great stay, good outdoor and indoor pool, lots of beach chairs and pool chairs, very busy but to be expected during Spring Break.

Nice, clean and expansive hotel. We booked a basic room with 2 queen beds. The room was extremely spacious and could have fit 2 king beds with room to spare in the sleeping area. Rooms are not super-up-to-date-trendy. They also don't feel dated or old fashioned. Honestly, good aesthetic that fits the hotel. The 1st floor pool area is well kept and relaxing. The restaurants are great and the staff is super warm and friendly. Definitely worth the price and would definitely stay here again!

Amazing staff.  Felt very welcomed.  Valet / Bellman in both areas superb at their job, thank you for taking care of our vehicle and luggage. Guest services / night audit April was very informative and helpful upon arrival and when we needed assistance with our  settings for the A/C. Don Ricos restaurant superb food and beverage staff. Thank you to the whole team.
I enjoyed all the guest areas .  I enjoyed the ocean view room for the view and very spacious.  Dated lamps are worn  and little things around the room. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was the musty smell of water, wet carpet.  The bathroom could of been cleaned better. Behind the toilet where there‚Äôs caulking is mildew.  My room was on the fourth floor ocean view so we had the ultimate view.  I really enjoyed it here. I hope the hotel will be updated soon. I work in hospitality and I understand that this industry was very much affected by the pandemic and not mention storms that haven‚Äôt helped and it‚Äôs slowly getting more people hired and getting the experience staff hired and trying make revenue as well.   Keeping guests feeling comfortable and welcomed is always number one.  I will be a repeat guest.

Well opening the curtains to the ocean couldn't get better, watching the üåÖ sunrise and üåÑ sunset just amazing. Now, the size of the room for the price and the pictures could be better adding that the room did not have a balcony and the bathroom was perfect for my 5 feet even but not for a taller longer leg person. I was hoping pet friendly meant everywhere but we har to leave my emotional support mini golden doodle in the room several times. The valet parking system needs more employees poor guys/gals they are overworked and same for bellmen. Keep updating and working on the AC working in the halls. And make the entire hotel pet friendly or make areas for guests with pets. Overall, we liked it.

For being a Hilton I was expecting way more. I understand that usually beach hotels are a little rusty, but again, this is a Hilton. Rooms are ok but outdated. Service was always great! All staff very helpful and nice. The view is great! Loved watching the sun rise and all activity at the beach. Location is great.

My family and I enjoyed the brief time we spent here. The amenities were a plus, the views were amazing, and the location was convenient. If you book through a third-party beware. If your room type isn‚Äôt available you‚Äôll have to pay extra per day to get the amount of beds you need. Also, all the staff was nice from the valet to bellhops EXCEPT for the West Indian woman in the front. After two interactions with her I can confidently say her attitude is terrible. It‚Äôs like it pains her to smile. Only reason why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because she ruined not only the aesthetic but also my overall experience.

This hotel is mismanaged and full of hidden fees. Two of the elevators in the south tower have been out of operation for at least a month. It can take up to 20 minutes to get an elevator and there is a line for the elevator at peak times. McDonald's are managed better. The entrance is so small that we had to sit in line out in the road waiting for the hotel. This is a hazard for guests and a liability for the hotel. I do not understand why this is a Hilton when it I haven't experienced this mismanagement at extended stay. The pool was nice but not very deep. The hot tub was small. The parking was extremely expensive. The food in the hotel is also expensive. There are no proper heaters in the rooms so if it is cold, you will suffer. We called the engineer and he said they have toaster ovens for heaters in the rooms. His quote. Too many hidden fees and too high of a cost for having half elevators working and being forced to wait out in the street to get to the hotel.

We Stayed Here almost a week during the Rolex 24 and opted for the Ocean View.

Really enjoyed this hotel.  The beds were just right for our extended stay.  Close to lots of food options.  We ate and drank at Don Rico‚Äôs in the lobby quite a few times and enjoyed that.

The rooms are nothing spectacular but are decently clean with no signs of bed bugs.  Showers work ok, sinks don‚Äôt back up on you and the view was awesome.

We slept with our sliding door open every night so we could feel the cool ocean breeze and hear the waves all night.

Accommodations are clean. Pool and hot tub clean. No room microwave. Cable TV üëçüèª. Comfortable bed. Clean bathroom. A/C loud on and off. Room walls a little thin/ hear neighbors and their TV. Nice beach view. Easy in and out. Food on site $$$. Starbucks on site $$. Resort fee and valet $$$. Hotel needs some renovations/updating. Expensive for the accommodations.

Best location! Has everything. Staff is super!! Hotel though is older, needs a cleaning on small things and a renovation. But still the best place on the beach to stay. Remember, it‚Äôs an older hotel in today‚Äôs world and needs a renovation. Best place to stay on the beach.

The room that we got on the north tower was in need of repair. My family's expectations of a Hilton Hotel were not met to say the least for the high price we paid. The floor tile was broken and the closet door was off the railing. The common areas were very nice and the staff were friendly but the room itself was a shame especially the bathroom.

This place was way below our expectations we decided to spend a little more and stay at a known hotel line rather than risking it with an unknown place just to enjoy our weekend away. And we were WRONG, the picture attached of the rusted bathroom equipment was just 1 of many unacceptable issues.

Service: the worse, upon arrival they were very flat not very welcoming this place is huge with different things going on and no one even told me anything I had to figure out where and what everything was. But that‚Äôs not even the issue. House keeping is almost impossible to get I‚Äôve never been to a hotel where you have to call a specific number to request it within a restricted time frame. Zero small bathroom/shower supplies. We were charged 40 dollars a night for valet parking and no one even answered the phone when we had a dinner date to get our car so we had to walk to the actual place then wait for the car.

The restaurants and bars mind you that are already over priced have awful service because they are SOOOO understaffed this one poor man was literally running the entire Resturant and bar while getting yelled at. The one pool bar they had, there were like 10-12 people wrapped around in a line just to get one drink by the pool in the hot heat so we said forget it the second time üò© The first night on arrival when I tried to take a quick rinse/shower  the water stopped draining.

But other than that the room wasn‚Äôt dirty the sheets were clean that‚Äôs all I gave you guys sadly. And I‚Äôm not one to leave reviewed but I HAD to give the next people a heads up.

Also i mentioned it to the manager and she didn‚Äôt even offer anything she said ‚ÄúI‚Äôll talk to house keeping ‚Äú. Most other places would at the very least try to make up for the bad service to protect their standards .. not at all.

If I could do it again I would reserve at the other ocean front hotels. My partner and I checked out the other ones and they actually looked really nice and inviting like they wanted to earn guests. I guess these big name hotels feel like because they have the name they don‚Äôt have to try as hard now? Not sure.

My oceanfront view was breathtaking. My sister surprised me with this hotel stay for my birthday and I was overwhelmed. I stayed on the 11th floor and everything was above exceptional, from the very clean room and wonderful breakfast staff.

Leaves a lot to expect, this has been a worse experience than other Hilton hotels, at first we booked a room on the city side part of the hotel but instead they placed us in a practically subterranean room, which smelt moist and had dead bugs on the bed. We later came to find out it had flooded during a recent hurricane. We got moved to a room on the 7th floor which is even more outdated and gross than the first, muggy, and seems to be a remnant of the late 1990s. To make matters worse after having been given the run around at this hotel for about an hour late at night.... The shower is disgusting to shower in. Stay away from this Hilton hotel. It's in serious need of actual attention.

Edit: my wife found bed bug bites all over herself....

Edit: it seems an apology has been issued for the incident but sorry doesn't fix how horrible the stay was. If you're reading this In hopes of booking a night here please reconsider, before spending a horrible night there yourself.

We are very disappointed with our stay at this location. Notification of damages from the hurricane should have been made known. Missing furniture from room as well as mediocre air conditioning and no fan in bathroom , water damage throughout hotel , outrageous parking fees and, unsatisfactory valet communication/parking situation , and staff was not friendly. Front desk did not even bother to ask how our stay was during check out.

First off.....we decided to stay AFTER spending $300 on a time share tour that we are not going to do because after calling to book it over the last 3 months theres no availability every time we call. So.... Being Diamond members who decided to spend over 400,000 points on our room. We asked to extend our stay when we first got here and was declined. But as Diamond members we are guaranteed a room if requested within 48 hrs. Secondly, in our suite since we arrived the A/C has not worked. It has gotten up to 75-76 and has been set at 64-60 respectively our poor little one is all sweaty during her nap, it took having engineers come to our room 3 times over 2 days without an offer to switch rooms until they fixed it towards the end of our trip. At night it got a little chilly so I asked for 2 more blankets and they were out! So they gave us some bed sheets?!?!The Wi-Fi is absolutely garbage! It cuts out like every 10 minutes, then you have to re-sign in. The beds were absolutely horrible and honestly as a Diamond member it didn't feel much different than a regular member. I will say the employees from the valet to the room engineers/maintenence and in between were kind. But, overall I'm pretty upset about spending over 400,000 points as a Diamond member. And I am seriously considering switching credit cards with a different hotel chain! I will be following up with Hilton corporate if no refund of points are offered. I will update if/when I hear word.

I'm adopted and my husband and myself me my biological sister here in Daytona 49 yrs later...needless to say, it was a fabulous experience. A bellman, Alen was stellar, all employees should follow by his example. The front desk staff was awesome, tiki bar tender Jadd(sp) spectacular. 100% will stay again.

Btw 2/6-2/8 no room service...but we'll still go back!!

My family of 6 just finished a 5 night stay, to say we were underwhelmed is an understatement. We happen to be a hardworking blue-collar family, so when paying $629.00 a night for a suite at the Hilton, we were really excited to experience a stay that's above average to our typical Redroof or Days Inn stay. At arrival I was declined a military discount, not absolutely a deal breaker as I was told I was already receiving good deal by the front desk. Of course we were in town for a work conference and were also denied the block rate supposedly due to the fact that we had a suite (the only Accessible room available at the time of our reservation). Next, we arrived in our suite and had to use the restroom after our 16 hours of travel, only to find that housekeeping has definitely not done a very thorough job cleaning the toilet. Ok, fine. I pulled out some Clorox wipes and took care of it myself. At the same time, we noticed the room was excessively hot, so after settling in we called the front desk and notified them that the ac was not working, she said she would send an engineer up to check it out. At 230am when we still hadn't seen the engineer, we went to bed leaving the door open for a breeze to cool the room off. (The ac automatically turns off when the patio door is open, this was not the reason our ac was not working as we had complied with troubleshooting from the front desk) It wasn't until 2 more calls to the front desk and almost 2 days into our stay that the ac was worked on and worked at least enough to make the room bearable. Next up....showers, nothing like stepping out of a nice warm steamy shower to briefly look up when drying off and seeing black mold.......gross. Room service was not an option during our stay, a bit of a bummer as the kids were looking forward experiencing that. On the flip side we ended up dining down in the Don Ricos. It was a bit pricey at $14.00 for a pb&j sandwich with fries for the kids, needless to say there are lots of other options outside the Hilton for food choices and we made that choice for the remainder of our stay. The kid zone was non existent, the kids were really bummed about that as it was one of the reasons we had chosen to stay at the Hilton. The elevators were in a state of broken or in repair a couple times during our stay leading to extra long wait times to get to the lobby. We made our reservation for 6, had a suite for 6, paid the additional fee to have breakfast included but were informed it only included 4 so we didn't dine as a family for breakfast.

The good: At check in the kids were all given a fun craft to do, which they did and thoroughly enjoyed. Our request for extra towels and blankets was met quickly and our interactions with the staff were pleasant. The location was great as it's was very central for the things we needed to do. The beach was fantastic even though access was very limited due to damaged walk ways.  Last but most important, the unobstructed view of the ocean from our suite was fantastic.

Lesson learned, we won't be returning.

UPDATE: I called the number provided by the Hiltons response to my review. I was quickly forwarded to the manager on duty without any prolonged holding. Brooke I think, (I hope that's how her name is spelled) spoke with me for about 20 min as I recounted our stay with them and the reasons for my review. She was open to hearing what I had to say and did not discount or deny the experience we had, which was refreshing! At the end of the conversation, she let me know I would receive a partial refund (which I have received). She handled my call with complete professionalism and kindness.

The room looked quite old, a bit shabby, had damaged and worn furniture, the WiFi was not  working well (you have to log in about 10-20 times per day. The WiFi at the conference hall was so sluggish that you couldn't use it. And now I learned that there are hidden costs when you check out.
No recommendation.

The owner contacted me in this forum and expressed their disappointment that they had no chance to talk to me because of the WiFi issues - however, I will stay for another 3 days (and nobody contacted me) . WiFi Update: In the last hour, I had to reconnect 10 times. Unbearable.

Nice hotel with a great oceanside location. The rooms are clean with open layouts and have great views and the amenities are solid. The boardwalk location puts numerous restaurants and shops within walking distance as well.

I had a great time. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I wish they had microwaves in the room but I was able to find one on the main floor near the pool entrance. The view from my room was very beautiful. The hotel restaurant food was very good. Valet parking was very convenient and excellent service! The hotel has aged, but compared to other places this Hilton is a dream.

AWESOME!  All employees were great!  The bartender was courteous and quick.  The service at breakfast was great.  The view from my room was the absolute best.  The valet Art, was checking to make sure all cars were on their way.  He was excellent.

Beautiful location on the worlds most famous beach. Rooms were average. Our ocean front room had a view of a roof and a little ocean. If you are going for the view, get as high a room as possible. We had little interaction with the staff but everyone was nice.
Everything costs extra and only a tiny fridge and coffee maker are provided in the room. A few restaurants in the resort and outside of within walking distance.
The doors on the higher floors open to a "juliet balcony". The ocean front rooms on the 3rd floor shared a large patio area.
Overall it was great but expensive!

A disappointment. This used to be the premier hotel beachside, but the rooms (specifically in the North Tower) have been neglected. As my photos depict, furniture coming apart, dirty bathroom tiles, dirty floors, damp & dirty feeling carpet (didn't want to walk barefoot on it). The sink would make the most annoying "unclogging bubbling" sound as it drained. AC was loud & not efficient; musty smelling. Bed was comfortable enough & the toilet seemed new, but otherwise the room felt generally dingy & unwelcoming. The view was great, but paying for a room upgrade to be oceanfront & this is the quality of the room I paid MORE for, I would have rather not had the view but had a nicer room.

4 elevators and only 2 in operation
Bed in our room doesn‚Äôt have a fitted sheet
Rust on the bathroom wall that‚Äôs been painted over several times.
The bed is terrible to sleep in it‚Äôs like sleeping in a bowl. I would not recommend this place to anyone
Got a balcony with a bunch of busted furniture

Like many have said, the location is perfect, staff is nice, lobby area is nice‚Ä¶ but the rooms are lacking.

We had an oceanview room with a king in the south tower. It was spacious and we had no problem with the air temp or water, but it felt very outdated and the bed was not great. It felt very short and the mattress wasn‚Äôt very comfy. It wasn‚Äôt horrible by any means, but not what you might expect from a Hilton resort.

Overall it‚Äôs great if your main concern is beach access and amenities (rentals, vouchers, discounts at the shop, etc.).

Its the quality of customer service their employees have are by far the benchmark for me to say our stay went very well. From Bea from deli/caf√© who knows how to work her magic to little kids who constantly hangry, to Keanno from the bar who welcomed us & assisted us to dinner, to Preeti from frontdesk who offered a room upgrade & ensured that it is ready - turned out amazing views btw. We took the Valet parking option since it was convenient & safe for me with a little kid. The valet people had the best customer service skills too! I got what I paid for!  Rooms may be outdated & showing signs of age but as long as it works & service is relayed when you need it, I don't mind. Plus we are always out & about to enjoy DB so why be picky? Thank you Hilton, keep up the good work & regard your employees, they are your gem!

They probably need to change their name to motel6. Rooms were outdated. The bed is very uncomfortable the air conditioner doesn't even get cold. The bathroom were dirty. Please people don't waste your money staying here. Go somewhere else.

Liked everything about my stay at the Hilton hotel on Daytona beach front. Room on level 11 has a lovely sea view. Bike'tober Fest on main street was just a 5 mins walk away. Partying continued in the hotel's bar disco past midnight where all had fun dancing. Highly recommended.
this hotel has everything u need great location. parking is a lil high but it is what it is I would go back again

The overall hotel was very nice and it's on the strip and has lots of amenities on site. All rooms are oceanfront. What I didn't like is that there are no fridges or microwaves in the room, you cannot go out on the balcony, and the rooms were very outdated.

Visited this hotel a last week and they have did some updates so I‚Äôm changing it to 4 stars. The pool and gym are very nice but if you are staying you now have request cleaning 24 hours in advance.

My Sister and I had a wonderful time. We needed a little relaxation and beautiful views and that is exactly what Teena helped us accomplish. She was very accommodating with exemplary service. Please make sure she is acknowledged as an amazing asset to your team.
We stayed in room 1429. I highly recommend this room to anyone who wants to see the surf, boardwalk, pier And the beautiful lights of the city at night. You literally can see for miles.
Please enjoy the attached pics.
Thank You Hilton staff. Everyone, and I do mean everyone made our stay a true vacation even if for one day.

Excellent day trip for us to the beach and to use the facilities.  The staff was mostly nice (besides one waitress in the steakhouse).  The hotel can get pricey quickly, and although the parking is closeby, it is a pain to have to drive there to park.  Valet is $27 for the day, and I believe $40 for the night.  Otherwise, our rooms were clean and we are happy with the stay.

Great staff amazing hotel with restaurants, bars and a shop conveniently located within the hotel. The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. The view from the terrace was absolutely gorgeous and perfect for watching Dolphins at sunrise, noon and evening.

I've been to better Hiltons. I'm a Hilton Honors member; however, I came with a large group for a special conference.

Check in was lengthy. I understand a conference puts a lot of strain on the staff, but waiting an hour in line is a bit much.

The room was so-so. Quite a bit dated and the shower/tub was tricky to navigate. The sides of the tub were high and there were no grab bars. I am not physically challenged, but grab bars would have helped me a great deal. I loved the fact that they had an extra sink outside the bathroom, though.

Time to buy new towels. These had seen their day.

One of the elevators in the north tower did not work, which slowed down the long lines of people waiting to get upstairs. Thankfully, one evening, they had an employee directing "traffic."

I was pleased to see a coffee machine in the room as the last Hilton property I stayed at didn't have one.

I was disappointed to see that room service was by request only. Hilton's rationale (by their signage) was that people could customize their experience according to their comfort level; however, I believe that it is simply to save money.

You have to give them 24 hours in advance to request housekeeping services, so I tried calling housekeeping immediately after checking in only to be greeted by a ringing phone. After the phone rang 30 times, it transferred to a real person. When I explained that no one was answering the phone, I was told that housekeeping would be contacted.

We never had housekeeping for the rest of our stay. I was so caught up with my convention that I didn't have time to contact a department for a service I believed I should automatically been getting anyway.

The room was clean but the windows were not and the oceanside area (I can't call it a terrace because you can only stand) looked like it could use a good scrubbing. The refrigerator was banged up and looked like it was brought in from a college dorm after it had been well used.

Also, more outlets are needed.

The downstairs area is quite nice, and I loved the gift shop. Most of the items were reasonably priced and they had a large variety.

This hotel is pet friendly. A fabulous idea!
Great place to stay. The staff is nice and friendly.

My wife and I are Hilton Diamond members, the service from the booking of the room for a week to the valet upon arrival and the food at Don Rico restaurant has been excellent.
No matter what hotel we stay in there are issues with the lack of help and hotels are suffering in ways just like other business‚Äôs are in the United States.
However, the amenities at this resort are to numerous to mention and you will find spending a week at this beach Front resort is very relaxing If you are in need of a vacation.
We are on the 14th floor with an awesome view and with the patio does open at night the sound of the ocean waves is calming and very relaxing.
Daytona Beach has been a much needed vacation at the Hilton Daytona Beach Oceanfront Resort.

All i can say to this grand experience  " Loved It". Spring Break and a break in the Weather were the two contributing factors for the success of my trip. The Hilton was great, I had great view of the ocean and the beach. Words can't describe the true essence of the great time we had. I took some awesome pictures of the sunrise.

The area around the hotel has changed thru the years safety and security wise. The last few months it became unsafe to walk outside the hotel but it is safer to walk by the beach side areas. The hotel is right on the water with a beautiful view. Some of the rooms needs renovations but in general you will have a great time on the beach.

The rooms were disgusting. Smelled old and musty. The floors were not clean and the bathroom had dirt and hair on the floor. When we said we would like a refund they did it quickly but lady on phone was extremely rude.

The views of the ocean but even of the city are spectacular from here‚Ä¶ Everyone was very nice and it is a fantastic location‚Ä¶ We were there for a convention across the street and it was the perfect spot for the conference and also for beach walks.

The service was great. The comped me an upgrade just for waiting in line for longer than they‚Äôd like. I never even asked. The only downside is the self parking is a bit of a walk when traveling with little ones. Great view, great room, and great resort amenities.
Great location, clean hotel, friendly staff. I will definitely go back again.

This is a sincere review. If you seriously want to stay here read this. For many reasons i have to give this place 1 star. I'm just going to list them below. If you're like me and plan to be on the beach during the day, have fun at night and supply your own food for all but dinner, this isn't the place for you. If you want to just show up with clothes and a wallet full of money than have at it. Because this place is pretty aggressive at gouging prices.

1. Advertised parking $20, real self parking was $30 per night(not garunteed  parking spots after purchase, and it's 2 blocks away) valet $40.

2. If you get valet, check is super early. A line stretched past the hotel for at least 1.5 miles waiting for parking.

3. It took an hour to check in, (kind of my fault since it was right at 4p.m)

4. No microwave in the room (to make you use the resturaunts)

5. This place is super scammy. Plan to spend at a minimum an extra $45 a night for parking + a $15 charge for using amenities like the pool or gym.

6. Resturaunts they have are super pricey

7. The beach in front of the Hilton is taken up by a predatory beach rental company that charges $30 for 2 hours to use 2 chairs and an umbrella. With barely any room for people who don't want to buy.

If you LOVE Hilton, THIS is not the one for you! Other than the view of the Ocean front room, nothing about this hotel says Hilton! This place is in desperate need of an upgrade! I've had a larger fridge in my college dorm room and I had a microwave! Decaf coffee ONLY was offered in the room. The sink drain would not open. The furnishings were dated. Again, other than the view, not worth the money.

Room was ok. Cleanliness wasn‚Äôt a priority as furniture was stained, surfaces had grime, walls in bathroom was stained. Sheets dirty. View was nice. Paying for parking is very clearly capitalist behavior by Hilton. Uncovered lock a block away‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm already paying 200+ per room, why doesn‚Äôt that cover parking. It‚Äôs not like my room is being cleaned during my stay anyway. And the resort fee - what does that even include that makes sense?? The pool, which was closed for cleaning? It covers one bicycle rental per room ( not per guest). Stayed multiple days and couldn‚Äôt get two bicycles for one hour at the same time. A joke.

While the view out the windows was exceptional, there were several "hidden costs", which come as a bit of a shock, when checking out.
Valet parking is not described on the website,  and is "mandatory" unless you are able to easily walk 3 blocks from your car to the hotel.  While the on site restaurants are very nice, the menu prices are astronomical! To be honest, I don't know of any buffet meal worth $45/person, plus beverage.

Yeah. This place is pretty stunning. Kind of what you expect from a Hilton on Daytona Beach. Jorika checked me in. She was full of personality. The room views are breathtaking. Be prepared to spend some money - it is a Hilton on the beach, for goodness sake. I don't like the hefty room daily deposit? What is that about? I paid for 3 rooms. Whatever.

Very nice hotel with a great location. It's across the street from the Ocean Center and coffee and restaurants. Right on the beach with a great pool and hot tub, too. My room was a good size and clean. My only issue was that the bathroom needed some updates/maintenance. My toilet handle was bent down and had to be held in place for a few seconds or it wouldn't flush. My tub had some rust issues and the tile floor had some holes/pock marks in it that I thought were dirt at first. I got a good rate since I was attending for a function that had negotiated a very favorable rate, otherwise this hotel would probably have been priced out of my usual range.

It was a good experience, the kids had a good time. Loved the window to the ocean front, we slept with it open and watched a really great display of fireworks. The rooms aren't very big and we didn't have much of a balcony but, we didn't mind. The complementary breakfast was awesome and so was our server. It's a very classy breakfast buffet.

Ok... Hotel is nice, decently kept. Location, epic. Staff overall are also nice. Outside of that, the beds, not the most comfortable, furniture and furnishings are dated. Lamps have a hard time working. Being next to the ocean doesn't help the metal. Plugs.. There's hardly any. The way they are located in the lamps makes most chargers lift them to fit. Also very loose. Otherwise, it's a nice stay but it lacks in a lot of basics,

Good hotel with helpful staff, and an excellent view if you take the sea facing rooms. The stay was very comfortable. Only downside is, you can feel the age of the hotel. You can feel how some parts are quite old he outdated.

TL:DR   Extremely nice hotel but you will pay extra for ABSOLUTELY everything.

Long review: I cannot leave a rating higher than 3 stars. I debated going either 1 star higher or 1 star lower but I am trying to be fair. We stayed at 3 different hotels in a one week period in the Ormond Beach/Daytona beach area. If you just want to kick back and go to the beach and sightsee, your money is much better spent elsewhere. Here you will pay $25 a night for the privilege to park 2 blocks away or 35 for on-site valet parking. Use of the 2 pools and hot tubs, another $25 a night. Breakfast is not free but I assume it is excellent depending how much you are willing to spend. If you do plan on spending significant time on the beach, I recommend the beach level cabana rooms because the only way back to your room is through the very nice lobby and you will feel like a Philistine, dragging 3 kids with their dripping bathing suits and sand toys behind you. The rooms are no nicer than a moderately priced hotel with free parking and breakfast.

We had a great time at the Hilton Daytona Beach Oceanfront Resort! Our room was super clean with a beautiful view. All of the staff was so friendly and helpful, especially Stan at the Front Desk and Jaime, our server at Don Rico's. The food at Don Rico's was excellent as well. I had the Crab Cake with Florida Bread and it was beyond delicious!! Full of crab meat and wonderful flavor! We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back!!

The view from our room was absolutely beautiful!!! The beach was stunning nice and clean. Well worth it! Here‚Äôs the only issue, no microwave in the room and the $25 per night self parking is across the street. Please note that you will be charge an additional $50 per night for the resort fee and parking. Just FYI If the Hampton Inn has microwaves in every room why not an Hilton Resort!
I enjoyed my stay. The only thing I would do is add microwaves to the rooms

Beautiful view! Allen at bellhop was super nice and helpful, wonderful customer service. Ice machine broken/ no ice on multiple floors, room service did bring us a bag , after we had gone to 4 floors looking for ice, so they did make it right. Super busy hotel. Great location if you like staying in the heart of things. Loved the boardwalk. Rooms are a little outdated but clean. Room seemed to not be cooled as much as we like, we were staying on the 12th floor and it is Florida in July so there's that. Overall a good experience

Not really impressed for the amount of money it costs. You have to pay, per day, to park your vehicle either via valet or in the lot across the street..$25-$35/day! Depending on the size of your vehicle, you may obly be able to park across the street because they said our truck was too big for the parking garage. Parking across the street is fun when lugging things from hotel throughout your stay. It also was not very well kept. Lights were out, drug baggies on floor, food in hallways and when you look out the windows, you'll see lead cords everywhere that operate the lights outside the hotel. I waited until about 4 pm before I took pictures so the hotel had a chance to do their daily cleaning and all garbage was still in exact same places at the end of the day and into the next. We checked out the next day so not sure how long til it was cleaned up.

Absolutely love this hotel. Well built with a beautiful ocean see front and cabana style rooms on the first floor.

A lot of stores and restaurants on the property and I found it to be very kid friendly. Some of its best features include the daily room service and discounts on activities you can enjoy during your visit.

The price is also reasonable for what you get and valet parking is immediately available upon arrival to the hotel. I definitely recommend to anyone!! üôåüèæ

We stayed here for 4 days while we were in Daytona for Passion Camp 2021. Overall the stay was pleasant. However, the bathroom wasn't as clean as it could have been. It may have just been old age, but it didn't seem like the bathroom floor had been really well cleaned in a while. The area around the bottom of the tub, especially on the end with the water spigot, was dirty, as well as the area around the legs of the bathroom counter in the toilet/shower area.

It was nice to have two separate sink areas- one in the room with the shower/tub and toilet, and another just outside the bathroom.

All the staff I encountered were very nice and willing to help with whatever I needed from them.

I did see what appeared to be a tiny roach or two in the bathroom.

The trashcans in the bedroom and bathroom were extremely small, considering there were 4 of us in the room, and we spent 4 nights there. Housekeeping didn't come every day, so our trash was overflowing at some points. I'm not sure if Covid guidelines require housekeeping to come less, or if that's a regular procedure.

The pool area is nice and spacious. There was an employee on duty, handing out towels.

The location to the beach is almost perfect.

The convenience store/Starbucks needed more registers, because the line was extremely backed up in the mornings.

Overall, we were pleased, and we will probably stay there again. I would recommend it to others, too.

Parking not free,!!! cost $40,so 5days extra 150...room service need call every day or no body cleaning for you, refrigerator very small only for some water, pool is not clean ,need more attention because so many people used it every day! Location is good but for $$$  thanks

My son and I were upgraded to ocean front room being a diamond member family and boy was it a great view, breathtaking! The only negative thing was the room needs a little tlc. There was a hole in the floor under carpet and the floor felt sticky. The bathroom needs repair and upgrades. Other then that it was a comfortable stay with the view!

Great location on the beach with great ocean views! However, be prepared to wait forever to check in. We noticed lines were long at the front desk during our stay. Rooms are dated and not up to Hilton standards. Furniture is old and beat up, light fixtures in the bathroom were rusty, the pipe holding the shower head was moveable and coming out of the wall, and the bathroom itself is a very tight space. Windows/sliding door were covered in ocean spray (which is understandable) and the balcony is not really a balcony. However, it was nice to open the door and get a fresh breeze in and hear the waves!

The pool is way too small for a property this size and there was black algae all over the pool tiles. It is in serious need of repair. The hot tub was closed during our stay. The loungers are dirty with cigarette holes in some of them. There was food and cigarette butts on the ground in the pool area first thing in the morning so it appears no one cleaned the deck before the next day.

All of these negatives aside, the common areas of the hotel including the lobby were fine, and like I said, you can‚Äôt beat the location! They just need to invest in the pool facility and room updates.
We had a wonderful time celebrating my 65th birthday üéÇ ü•≥ with my three sisters ‚ù§Ô∏è
Great place right on the beach. The ocean view from our room was great,  but I would have loved to have been higher up than the 6th floor. The staff and services were absolutely amazing.

at first there was a problem with the fact that I paid for ocean front, they gave me a room with a view of the roof. for this money, they provided me with a tiny room. I lost an hour and a half to clarify the relationship. + after another half an hour, they just brought me my luggage. huge prices and this hotel is crowded and it is not worth the money I do not advise anyone. dirty room. the bed also looks terrible. terrible manager.

The worst Hilton experience we have ever had. We got to the room to find a vape left behind, skittles on the floor and the toilet seat broken. The dresser was also broken. After waiting over an hour we had someone come up to repair the broken items, but guest services didn‚Äôt realize we wanted someone to come clean the room and remove the items that didn‚Äôt belong to us until after I went down to complain. The hotel itself was dirty and we notice how a glass was put behind a plant in the lobby was still there when we checked out a few days after arriving. There was also tons of water in the elevator the day we arrived causing a guest to slip and fall. The views were nice, but the staff and grounds made the $700 price tag hard to swallow. We won‚Äôt be going back and plan on filing a complaint with corporate Hilton.  I spoke with Tiffany at the front desk numerous times and she assured me things would be fixed. We asked for a new room several times as well and she just kept telling me that the hotel was sold out. No real resolutions.

Not up to Hilton Resorts standards for sure. Rooms are outdated , musty and humid. The furniture is straight out of a thrift store( Stains on sofa, busted dresser, rusted desk lamp, no pen or notepad or flyers about amenities). The bathroom had a urine smell to it , so we had to ask a housekeeping lady to give the toilet seat a real cleaning. The air conditioning is inadequate at best, I had the thermostat at 64 and barely any cold air was blowing out of the vent ( I had to check the filter and it was CAKED!!!!). It seems like the whole hotel is so warm that it seems that HVAC system is not operational. That‚Äôs unacceptable for a Hilton resort hotel! Ice machines are all out of order so  I have to call the front desk every time I need some ice. The vending machines are all sold out. I have always been given vouchers for coffee or breakfast, ‚Äú not here‚Äù  I was told.  From the minute you show up, you get assaulted by your valet service, I did not have time to even check in for crying out loud!!!!! I will not recommend this establishment to my friends or colleagues.

I've stayed at various places and this is the worst. They're just trying to get as much as they can while not providing anything. I expected this to be a good hotel, it looks more like a motel. No housekeeping even after requesting it twice. Dirty furniture and bathtub. Only stayed since they make it very clear nothing will be refunded. Also valet parking takes 20 to 40 mins to get your car.

One line: Very nice hotel where you will pay extra for ABSOLUTELY everything.

Full review: Let's call this the "Death by a thousand cuts." If you want a nice vacation by the beach with some sightseeing, your money is better spent elsewhere. The rooms are no nicer than a Country Inn and Suites. Here you will pay $25 for the privilege to park 2 blocks away or $35 for on-site valet parking. You will pay another $25 PER NIGHT to use the 2 pools and hot tubs. Breakfast is in the hotel restaurant and it's not free. Room service charges $25 for a chicken breast entree. If you want to spend time at the beach, the only way back to your room is through the very nice lobby. Try dragging 3 kids in dripping bathing suits and sand toys through there everyday, you Philistine. Finally, WIFI is on a two tier system, good WIFI is $6, 1995 wants it's WiFi back is free. When, we arrived on a Thursday night, there was some problem with the bellhops (not really a problem), but we were informed by the valet that, because of prior lawsuits, there were no luggage carts available for guest use either. Really? Lawsuits?  There is a Starbucks in the hotel, so if by this point in your stay, you have 5 dollars left, yeah, it's gone now.
This an amazing hotel! My son and I had an amazing two night stay here. I can‚Äôt recognize enough the value of the people experience we had here. Everyone one was amazing, friendly, and welcoming!

I gave 4 stars because they do not have free parking on or off site. The valet parking was very slow, with quite a build up of cars. I will say it was " was very nice, very clean. The front desk staff were friendly, helpful. Check-in was quick. The room was very clean. Bed comfortable. View was awesome. Close to everything.
Very nice hotel, spectacular ocean view, great steak house Hyde Park and Mexican restaurant Don Rico, nice pool with splash fountain for the kids and more. I recommend the Hilton Daytona.

Customer service ranged from 2 stars to 5 stars. Easy beach access. Valet for your car is $40\night. Seems a bit steep. Self parking (was told self parking is "across the street" but never saw it) is $30\night. That's pretty expensive as well.

Very disappointed gold member,location and view were excellent.
The price was outrageous for a room that is furnished with old nasty beat up furniture, and I can go on but there no reason.
Hilton should be ashamed, and remove their name off this property.
Beautiful hotel. Good rooms, great view. Great location and very nice people. They had mistakes in my bill, but fixed it. Check your receipt.

The staff were super nice.. The rooms could use some updating for the price, but i can say we had a great time during our stay.. Don Rico's great food and the best Chips and Salsa i have ever tasted!!

We used the hotel for travel to Miami Beach.
Very clean, friendly staff.
The only negative was $40 to park on premises.
Beds & pillows are fantastic. Views of the beach/water are amazing. Hotel is showing some age but rooms are clean.

The rooms here are just ok, nothing special.  The view from the window was beautiful except for the dirty window that didn't look like it had been cleaned for years. Im surprised I could get a good picture.  Loved the buffet breakfast.  Starbucks Cafe on the first floor is a plus..  Valet parking is $35 per night and I used it because it was late.

Amazing staff!! The resort as a whole is dirty and over priced! This is the worst Hilton property I have stayed at. I am so disappointed. Pool had not been cleaned all three days of my stay. The cabana rooms have absolutely no privacy from the public boardwalk. The bathtub in my room did not drain and the coffee pot was broken. There is absolutely zero standard here. I won't waste my money here ever again there is a Hard Rock Hotel less than a mile north I'll try next month when I'm back in Daytona Beach.
The view and location are great. However the service is not very good, it is the first hotel I know where you have to request room service 24 hours before.

Super friendly and professional staff.
The rooms are dated, but clean.

Definitely 3 stars for a 3-star experience. ‚ÄúDirty Daytona‚Äù lives up to the stereotype. Lobby and common public areas all look great and clean and feel up-scale but the rooms leave some to be desired. Doesn‚Äôt feel like they‚Äôve been remodeled in quite a long time. Some of the bathroom tiles are chipped. The mirror has those brown crusty, faded edges. The carpet is flat and thin, so you really feel the concrete floor. The bar and restaurant have decent options, but all overpriced as you‚Äôd expect. The little market for coffee / pastries was great and the cute older woman with the accent was AWESOME. Loved seeing her every morning for coffee. Valet was unreliable; often wouldn‚Äôt pick up the phone or when they did, would transfer time to the wrong valet station.

Would I go back? Eh. If there was no vacancy anywhere else and I absolutely had to stay in Daytona beach, maybe. But I‚Äôd try to stay somewhere else first.

I visited for a conference for 5 days. The hotel has spectacular ocean views from pretty much all rooms. However, the decor of the hotel and the rooms is dated, and seems like you are being transported in time to the 80s.

I have actually stayed here a few times, just the past ones were for National Championships in College. I have always had a nice stay. We had a minor inconvenience while on this stay, our room stayed pretty warm (we had it on the lowest setting). Everything else was fine though, the bed was nice, the room was clean, the pool was fun, & so was the beach. Another small issue is that they only serve the buffet for breakfast on weekends, but overall it was a good little sidestep to the beach on our way to Disney. Nice hotel for family fun.

Comparing this Hilton to other Hiltons, I'd say this one falls a bit a short. And it's unfortunate because the location is perfect. However, the amenities that are available are short staffed and not open the hours that they should be. They also are never all open at the same time. Also, one has high expectations for Hilton such as cleanliness, and up to date furnishings. This Hilton falls short. It's not what I was expecting at all. Valet was full and self park is a block away. They charge 25.00 a day for parking, 30.00 for valet. They still charge resort fees even though all the amenities aren't even available. No spa open at all, etc. This Hilton has so much potential but cleanliness and updating, especially in the South tower, needs work. Housekeeping is probably short staffed, but things aren't as clean as they state. Hallways need seriously vacuumed and attention to detail as well as the elevator floors. Sliders on balcony are dirty with hand and and finger prints and ocean spray in room. Guests expect these standards from a Hilton given the prices that we pay. This Hilton is just getting worn down and needs some tlc. I've included some pics of my bathroom and my room just as examples. I would stay again if on discount, otherwise I think I'd try elsewhere.

The good:
Location location location
Staff is friendly
Base rate was good (I say base rate because of what will be mentioned below)
Room size was larger than expected and great view (double edged sword because of AC issue detailed below)

The bad:
A/C in our room was horribly sub par.
Rooms are dated.
Hallways are hot and muggy like our room was.
Resort fee $25/day.
Parking fee $30/day - offsite surface lot 2 blocks away.
Check in while well staffed and friendly was worse than a Vegas mega property.
Wi-Fi was practically not usable (Probably due to room location)
Great view was obscured by windows that were last cleaned who knows when.
Valet line was literally 3 blocks long at check in.

I was lured in by a Priceline deal and won‚Äôt ever make that mistake again. Ended up paying $110 over my prepaid rate in parking and fees. This property is dirty, tired, and absolutely not worth what I paid. All in I paid $388 for 2 nights after taxes and fees. I should have stayed at a Hampton and it would have been comparative per night with parking and breakfast included.

I covered the good and the bad‚Ä¶
The ugly? See images of the AC outlet in our room and the windows. It was putting out cool air but blowing so underpowered compared to the room size that we were miserable. Maintenance checked it said sorry nothing we can do we‚Äôll ask housekeeping for a fan. No fan came and no one called. I just gave up at this point. I had high hopes for a flagship property, but this was a sore disappointment.

We spent 45 minutes in line before driving into the front door and  when we‚Äôre finally in front we are told the self parking is across the street so basically we wasted 45 minutes of our time. You get a bunch of emails before arriving but they don‚Äôt tell you how to actually arrive and park. When you finally get to the front desk you need to wait another 20 minutes for check in because they‚Äôre short staff. The hotel overall needs a remodeling. See the pictures attached. I‚Äôm giving it two stars because the restaurant don ricos is really good especially the shrimp tacos
The hotel was nice had a Lil issue when getting in the room some bugs. Call front desk immediately they changed my room the rest was amazing..Bellboy was awesome
Perfect location to stay.  You can walk to anything you need.  Your car can stay parked during you vacation. Save gas ‚õΩÔ∏è plenty of shops and attractions and your fingertips.

I enjoyed the sunrise but it was too ü•∂. The jacuzzi was big enough for six. Enjoy meeting new people during our one day trip. Everything on the walkway was closing.  So we saw this pizza joint that was amazing. Order the White Rabbit üêá awesome! Maybe for Labor Day! I can enjoy more of the entertainment there.

Worst Hilton hotel ever. I‚Äôm surprised this is actual a Hilton hotel. The rooms were very outdated and dirty. They were not dusted, hair on the toilet and a bug found on the wall. The sheets were dirty and had marks on them. I addressed this with the front desk lady Brooke and was informed that the reason the rooms were not clean is because they are older. Excuses and unhelpful. I do not recommend this location and honestly felt my money was wasted. I also spend 45 minutes to an hour waiting to be checked in. Worst experience ever.

I used hotwire to book my stay here. When I was checking they asked if I wanted to upgrade to an ocean view room for am extra $25.

ü§Øü§Øü§Øü§Ø

I'm so glad I upgraded. The room was big and very clean. The customer service was great. And the best part was there was a door that slides open to not only see your view, but I left it open all night and had the best sleep of my life listening to the real ocean waves.

Loved it here! üòäüòç

Hotel is nice. 3 stars because you have to walk very far to park your vehicle. We checked in just after midnight and its very sketchy walking from the parking lot. A lot of homeless people walking around. They wouldn't valet because I had a truck.

Great location. A quick walk to everything on the Daytona Boardwalk. Many dining options & activities to occupy in the resort itself. Staff is super nice, however the valet drivers need to learn how to drive. There was many incidents I saw of the drivers running into cones and sometimes coming close to hitting actual people.
We love staying here.   Location,  beach and the staff are what brings us back.   Preeti at the front desk,  Stephanie and Ron are great bartenders and very personable.

Nice hotel, parking is a bit annoying. $35 for valet or $25 a day for across the street but there other places close by.  Great restaurants, rooms were very nice, staff friendly.  In a great location, right next door to all the shopping and restaurants.  Also arcade and boardwalk are a fee minutes walk.  Pictures are from room on 9th floor.

The staff were excellent! Valet was swamped daily however they didn't miss a beat. We had a wonderful time, our view was impeccable.  The overall structure of the hotel is older however the service is wonderful, they continental breakfast daily and allow you to upgrade for a bigger selection and my over all experience was AMAZING! My family and i really enjoyed ourselves and how you all accommodated us with my special needs daughter thank you!

Stayed a night for my husband's birthday and had an amazing time! Everyone we encountered at the hotel was wonderful and those bucket drinks by the pool will having you feeling no pain! We will be back! Thanks Hilton for always giving top notch service!
Had an amazing time! Would be better if breakfast was cheaper and better coverage wifi.

Employees are very friendly and everything was very clean. The only complaint I have is the room we stayed in the furniture and fixtures needs updating. The location is very convenient to restaurants, the broadwalk and shopping. We would stay again if in that area of Daytona again.

Huge resort. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. There‚Äôs a lot to do/see within walking distance. The valet parking is convenient. They store your car for a daily fee in a secured parking lot. The rooms are a little outdated but the view is incredible. There are plenty of dining options on site as well.

I would have rated this resort as 5 stars because of how pet friendly it is.  We were so impressed with the number of guests that brought their fur babies with them.  It was so nice and our little fur baby also enjoyed making new friends. So we will definitely be back.

One thing that I was not so excited about was how the rooms really need some up dating to them.   The bathroom more importantly.   Three mirrors, and shower time had black stuff and there was rust on some items and the cleaning was not very detailed.   The corners in the bathroom showed this.   Overall, the resort is a great.  The location is just perfect for walking on the beach and Main St. and they have a restaurant that offers a buffet on Friday, Saturday and Sunday's that includes Prime Rib, crab legs, oysters and various side items.   My husband and our friends were very impressed with the spread and after eating all they could,  you could tell they were very happy with dinner that night.

I give this place a three only because of the location. The hotel rooms are dated, and the oceanfront rooms don't have balconies. I believe the lady at the front desk said they only had a few with balconies. What's the point of an oceanfront room if you don't have a balcony. I assumed it did when I booked an oceanfront room. The rate they charge is not worth it without a balcony. Also, the bar downstairs wouldn't serve you alcohol unless you purchased a meal! We already had dinner and wanted to walk downstairs and have a drink to unwind. We were turned away because we refused to buy a meal. I can understand a restaurant making you order food instead of taking up a table for drinking. But a hotel bar?? This place is a money racket.

Thank you for an amazing experience Hilton. The staff upgraded our room to Oceanview at no extra cost to make our 10 year anniversary extra special. We had a great day at the beach and at night we could see and hear a Pink Floyd tribute band followed by a spectacular Fireworks show all from our ocean facing room. Highly recommended.
Nice hotel on the beach.  Great location.  Parking is $35/nite - a bit pricey.  Furniture in rooms needs updating/replacement.  Overall, its clean, comfortable and a good value.
Really an overall terrific 3 night stay.

Service was good and valet was on point... A much needed improvement since our last visit, but the hotel is starting to show it's age, and lack of maintenance and cleaning will keep us from booking here next visit.

Our unwanted visitors were on the 15th floor which means there is a pest issue throughout the hotel.

Finally, despite the "Lysol certification" the windows, siding door, mirrors, multiple surfaces showed signs of not being wiped, little less sanitized. Found "love sauce" on the end table.

Sercurity  is lacking. The  kids pool is the adult smoke lounge . Pretty sure the  homeless  got up to fifth  floor on our last day and was bathing  in the spa  that wasnt working properly. I feel like people  were  being  neglectful and  damaging  the property .  Really  need an attendant  up there.  House  keepers  are overwhelmingly under staffed but they try .  View  is nice  though

Toilet bowl was loose and the room was a nightmare. The service was not worth the price of the room, over charged for parking and then told to go to the front desk and get a refund, by the way the line was long and I will not be back. By the way the cup and cookie was there for the three days we were there. The couch had a tear and a big stain, the carpet was dirty. That is why I will never be back!!!!!!

Nice Hotel in a great location.  Parking situation is terrible though. Highly overpriced. Charged full rate to park in their self service lot that's supposed to be secured but was accessible to anyone all night. They didn't even offer a refund or reduced rate after we reported it. $56 to park a small SUV with a double jet ski trailer.  No breakfast either.  Not enough to ruin our experience here but I wish they could provide a little more assurance for the security of their parking lot, especially since it isnt attached to the property and is located across the street.  Room was clean. Beds were adequate. Image below is of the exit arm that remained open the entire night.  No security at all.

Love this place!
Can you believe a Hilton let me bring my dachshund!  She is 16 1/2 and loved it here!
Everyone was so nice to us.
Everything was clean and pristine!  Loved the large balcony overlooking the ocean!
What a great location so close to everything!
We did not eat at the Hilton but the food did smell amazing!  They conveniently have adult beverages for sale in the lobby.  My husband liked being able to get his favorite beer and bringing up to the room.This is a great place to stay, convenient to the pier and main street and the board walk!

Great view from the room. Only reason it got 2 stars. We paid over $200 a night before taxes and fees. since it was a cheer competition weekend. Way over priced for what you get. Rooms are small, out dated. The shower had mildew in it. Furniture was beat up door had some sort of stains it. Felt like I was staying in a motel 6. At least we got a discounted rate on parking. Oh the WiFi was horrendous using the Hilton rewardsone and the other one offered was useless. I would suggest another hotel than this one. It is centrally located to a lot of restaurants and shops you can walk to.

Dingy ripped furniture nothing matched, looked like they furnished this room from someone's garage sale. Husband surprised me with 2 nights in an Oceanview room.  The ocean was beautiful the room was nasty.  $300 a night for ripped up chairs, I  wouldn't even sit in.

Nice for our two night stay.. eat at Joe's Crab shack on the pier. Food at this hotel is crazy expensive and no one answered the phone when I tried to order room service. Bed was great... room was clean . Be prepared for a lot of walking inside and out. The view from the south tower was beautiful. The location is the best in the area, near the pier and the boardwalk. Be aware that nothing is free and there are fees on top of fees on top of fees.

This hotel was AMAZING pretty pricey but definitely worth the money. For $25 they have valet parking that you can use as much as you want. Beautiful rooms with beautiful views of the ocean. Not one but 2 great pools. I was kind of upset that the balcony wasn't even big enough to fit out on to smoke so I had to go all the way down 6 floors but overall I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Fabulous special Thanksgiving dinner in Coquina room. Wonderful amenities right on the water with spectacular views elevated from high up. Excellent service desk attendants & fitness workout room. Enjoyed the holiday atmosphere & decorations. Even got to see giants walking through the halls as guests included girls Division 1 teams [Clemson, Belmont, Virginia Tech, Ole Miss, etc] participating in a tournament at the Ocean Center across the street. Oh what a sight, all the height.

Problems with no microwave in every room, mini fridge though room capacity for larger, no pad paper, body wash or enough wash cloths when checked in had to ask for some, flimsy closet door kept coming off track, rust/hole behind base of bath door & very limited TV access without paying extra per view. The remote kept freezing up stating it's channel memory full; was recommended to power off TV about 5 min to clear it. That only worked for maybe 30 min. I was frustrated & expect better from a well established brand b/c these are things that 3 star hotels have perfected. Hilton Resorts should be better than that.

Luxurious and comfortable! Cannot wait to return! Great location and wonderful staff going the extra mile.

Enjoyed concerts from the beach Shell. Noise not too bad after .usic ended at a decent time.

Valet service definitely worth the $24 per day since parking in Daytona Beach is a nightmare and it is in a secure location.

Nice place, great view! It's a shame that they don't have complementary breakfast for diamond member. Only $5usd credit per day per person. The hotel is an very central to everything, evrything is a walking distance. Great customer service from all their employees. I hope we can return soon.

The location is great especially if your there for an event at the Oceanside Arena or just to go to the beach. Staff has always been nice. Now the low down. Your staying at the Hilton and depending on when you book your gonna pay between 2 and 4 hundred bucks a night. This place is beat. It needs an overhaul. Beat up furniture, rusted lamps and chipped tubs. If you can over look price and a beat up room for location, than you cant go wrong but for the price I expect better from.Hilton.
Update 3.24.22.  Rooms.still need updated and prices went up.  Booked 2 months out for our event and they wanted $400 a night trough Hilton even with Honors. Found it on Trivago through booking.com for 309 a night.  Hilton wanted to match not beat. (Lame) and it would of been alot of work. Total hassel save yourself some time and just go to trivago. It's truly search 1 and done.

Customer service score :100%. Came here for a wedding . It was a mix up with checking in l, i booked through a third party . However they walked me through the steps of taking care of the issue and explained everything and was very patient . My questions were answered i enjoyed my room my whole stay here . I would book here again. The restaurants and bar were great as well . The beach was beautiful
Clean, quiet rooms (although a little dated and worn) with a great oceanfront view, right across the street from our venue, the Daytona Beach Oceanfront Center. Also close by to very nice eateries.

Celebrating my daughter's 9th birthday! Great service..full breakfast included with hotel pricing..so worth it. Pool is nice..lounging area with plenty of seating, lounge chairs, and towels. Valet parking very convenient. Room's view is great!! We will be
The room could use a face lift, but you can't beat the view. All of the staff was incredibly friendly. It was clean and the pools were nice.

My hubs and I along with a few other couples used this hotel for a weekend getaway. The staff is very friendly...valet, front desk, bartenders, security officers, store/restaurant employees...we have nothing negative to say about any of them. The hotel location is in a fantastic location, close to everything. The boardwalk is behind the hotel, several souvenir shops and quick bites are just steps away, many restaurants are walking distance, movie theater next door, and much more. They have live entertainment every night and the hotel bars and restaurants are excellent but pricey. If you stay at this hotel I insist you pay the extra cost for a beachfront view. It is worth it. The view is amazing! The sunrise is breathtaking, the sound of the ocean is mesmerizing, and if your lucky you can see a fireworks show from your window.  I give a 2 star rating because of what most people mentioned...the parking situation.  You are almost obligated to do valet parking which is $24 a day cause if you pay the $17 a day self parking you are in for a long walk and wondering if your car is safe where it is at. The parking isn't even located on the premises. It is across the street and to the left of the hotel.  A ways walk if it is super hot or raining. Not to mention that you have to carry all your luggage.  Also I think that the hotel is in need of an upgrade. The rooms are very outdated. I wouldn't say that the rooms are very clean. They could be cleaner but it may look this way because of the outdated furniture and decor. The lobby seems as though it has been renovated. And lastly, I can not believe that wifi is an option and has to be paid for.  A hard pill to swallow when the cost of the room is pricey.  We had a great time though.

The rooms were clean and so was the rest of the Hilton hotel. Staff were very helpful. Kids loved the pool and view out the room of the beach. No complaints.next time we will definitely stay longer in Daytona beach.at the Hilton of course.

The view is amazing. The room smelled like the inside of the pool though. Customer service was great. Probably wouldn‚Äôt be my first choice to come back to unless I just wanted to stay for the view of the beach. Room was decent, all of the surfaces were wet for some reason though.

Great views. Loved the heated pool and jacuzzi, but we couldn't find any towels in the banister. Although, the one they gave us earlier was nice and warm at the time. :)

Small restroom, but it has an extra area outside to get ready.

The bad.
Rooms are a bit dated. No microwave. The Balconies are small. Don't expect to walk outside from them. If you are a Diamond member your usually perks are limited due to covid.
The good.
Hotel staff is phenomenal,  the location is pristine,  although the Balconies are small you still can open your door and hear the ocean. The beach is very nice. Great sunrises. Thwre is a wonderful sax player on the weekends who you can hear from your room. All and all I'm looking forward to coming back when things are post Covid.

I like this place specially the ocean front view. Great steakhouse restaurants in the hotel. However, I do not like the service provided in Starbucks. The lady helped us with checking in and checking out is great lady and her smile is enough to give this hotel 5 stars.

Hotel is large and pretty nice. Currently you have to ask and go get  more towels since they are not entering your room not bringing to your room.
Beautiful beachfront location. Pool is not huge but nice. Not all their restaurants are open.

So let me start by saying, if you don't pay for  valet you will have to park across the street.For one night its about$ 230 . Check in at 4pm, everything closes early.Not all bars are open like they said on web site. To get food is impossible no room service ice machine were down. Went to Joe's crab and needed to be a member to eat there like what the heck so we ended up getting pizza. Also the restaurant in Hilton had a different  menu for different times and days that were not accurate. So on second day we were srarving dint know they had a cafe which would of helped .we ate at restaurant down stairs I ordered. Hickenlooper strils for kids and they gave us expired sweet rays bbq .I wonderd why it tasted funny and looked at the date was 2 months old! They said sorry but like really someone should be checking stuff like that. Then as we were getting ready to pack up we seen a roach in the bathroom .The lines were long for check in it was just a unpleasant time for how.much we spent and expected.

What a great experience we had at this hotel. The staff was amazing nice and helpful. We chose the room with the ocean front we were above the bar so no balcony but this did not effect our visit or the beautiful view. We had a great time, will definitely recommend this hotel! Thanks again from Detroit.

PROS:  The location is PRIME!   It is right on the boardwalk and convenient to the amusement park next door and the pier.  The breakfast buffet is TO DIE FOR!

CONS:  (none of which merit giving this resort less than 5 stars).  The resort itself is quite dated, so don't expect fancy rooms, but -especially for a beachfront resort- the common areas are in good shape.
