Expect to pay exorbitant prices for everything within the resort, as goes with any vacation resort.

TIPS:  I definitely recommend spending the money for valet parking because the self-parking is a good distance away and terribly inconvenient (and isn't that much cheaper).  Try and get a room on the upper floors, beachfront, because the view is great!

I would definitely stay here again!

The view from my room was amazing! It's in close proximity to several restaurants and bars. The rooms were comfortable. Only issues that we had is that self parking is up the street and crib availability is minimal. We asked for a handicap accessible room but none were available. We asked for one king bed but again none were available. I would actually give this place 3.5 stars.

Very nice lobby and entrance. Our room was a little out dated, the bathroom tile had a bunch of cracks. Overall it was a very nice overnight stay. The staff was professional and pleasant, we arrived well before check-in, I upgraded my room to one that was ready at that time. The Oceanview room are amazing

The hotel very clean and sanitize.
everyone is nice
easy access to the beach
Pets are welcome for a fee
Pools and jacuzzi
25 resort fee  includes  discounts  at restaurant  and stores adn many more   savings recomended

The people who works there was very nice. The hotel was not worth the money room was very small you find better furniture in a Thrift shop it was mowed in the bathroom and in the air condition and ceiling, no balcony, the room was hot, the outside furniture by the pool was broken and a lot of mood in the pillows they also charge $31 for valley parking and 21 to park ourselves I have stayed in better motels

Hotel room 634 was not worth 137 dollars. The room was dirty as you see. There were stains on the blankets. I was to tired from the drive to complain and we only were going to be in the room a few hours. There was rust in the shower. The carpet looked like it had never been cleaned. It was such a disappointment from the pictures especially when you been driving forever and see something online to get there and just want to cry. Then to get slapped with the valet parking fee of 30 dollars or self parking for 20 made it even more of a never again will I choose a Hilton just because of the name because I have stayed at Best westerns way better than this.

We only stayed one night but enjoyed it so much. Our room was not ready when we arrived. We were early so we knew it would not be; however front desk upgraded us to an ocean view that was ready sooner. Many dining options right on site as well as room service. Gift shop located downstairs as well. We will return!!

Not as well maintained as I've come to expect from  Hilton, but still very much clean and friendly. Parking sucks and cost 30 a day to valet. You can find a garage across the street maybe but it's iffy when bike week or other events happen. Even in a pandemic. Close to Joe's and in the mix of all thing on the beach. We loved our visit and the fact we could sleep with the sliding balcony door open. The ocean put me right to bed. No insomnia. During the "pandemic" it was a little slow for how it normally is in Daytona. But that didn't stop us. No no no.

Edit..... thank you for the apologies but I dont feel you owe it. "what we have come to expect" was poor word choice. Smart rooms are all the rage. Lights on the floor that glows lightly as you approach the bathroom. Mirrors that play music and tells weather and time. Bedside tables that is an entertainment control hub. Think on it. ...üòâ

The hotel has a great location. Nice pools and hot tub. Also two out door bars and restaurants in the hotel. Love that I picked the oceanfront room with balcony.
The room and bathroom especially needs some renovation. Cracked tiles and peeling wallpaper in the bathroom...also beds not very comfortable. But very clean. The amazing beachview and easy access to that beach is why I still gave it 4 stars.

Great location! Great views from ocean side rooms. Staff was very nice and waited on us hand and foot. Rooms a relatively inexpensive for the area and spacious. Bathroom-shower area was a little tight but we made it work. With RFID in place for room keys why not make bracelets for all guest. This way, it is easy for all to use all amenities, get in and out of the room and pool easily and great way to identify kids.

Right on the Ocean and had an amazing view. Went for a conference and meeting space was nice. It has 2 towers so you can have a long walk between your room and the conference. They have a convenience store/Starbucks inside plus 2 bars and a restaurant. There are a few gift shops and beach rentals in lower level plus on a the beach boardwalk. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Stay was during spring break times so there was often spills on floors and some trash left by rude people who couldn‚Äôt walk a few feet more to trashcan. Some areas were a little dated and to do a 5 star rating for a hotel, I think everything has to be perfect and in pristine conditions.

Extra fees galore! They add an extra "resort fee" to your bill. They also charge 20-30 just to park "on site" the "on site" parking is about a 1/4 mile away across Atlantic Ave,, a very busy 4 lane road, unless you pay the extra for valet parking. The room was worn out and the furniture is beat up. The extra you get in an "ocean front" is no balcony just a door with a railing across it. NOT WORTH THE MONEY.  THE STAFF IS INCREDIBLY RUDE! When I had something to say about the extra fees the lady at the desk just threw up her hands and told her supervisor "You deal with him" and walked away leaving me at the counter by myself until the supervisor  could come over and help me 15 minutes later.

We had roaches in our room, the drawers were falling off the dressers and there was red stains on the carpet. Gross, time to revamp here. I'm giving it 2 stars because the salmon at the restaurant was really good.

We had a great time(Bike Week) very clean got great service from the inside facilities bars, etc... Front Desk a bit soso wouldn't answer the phone and couldn't communicate through the app because THE WIFI and CELL PHONE RECEPTION SUCKü§¶üèæü§∑üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

This location is right off the water. There is a great view from many rooms. We were assisted and had no problems.  Some of the professionalism from from the staff during breakfast could benefit from improving. Great location!!! Tons of shops nearby.

We had a great time. It was a little bit chaotic during check-in, the restaurants were closed, but the staff was friendly, the pools were nice and the city view room was refreshing. Close to the boardwalk.

I reserved a room (2-queen beds) for 5-night. one of the matters was sagged and out of shape and the other was super-soft and barely offers any support. Checking the manufacturing, it said "2004" (i.e. 16-year old). When I requested better mattresses, I was told that all mattresses were of the same condition. spending a night on that mattress caused my injured lower back to start hurting. After complaining to the manager the next day and the "house-keeping" confirming the bad condition of the mattresses, I was moved to another room with "updated mattresses". However, that was too late for my already irritated back injury and I had to cut my stay and check out on the 3rd day.

In addition to the mattresses, it was impossible to adjust the water temperature in the shower - either hot or cold.

Although I had to check out earlier than planned due to my back pain (which was a direct result of sleeping on bad/old mattress), Hilton management refused to issue any refund.

This hotel may look nice and appealing on the outside, it is less that 2-stars on the inside. I DON"T RECOMMEND IT TO MY WORSE ENEMIES...

Best thing about this place is the ocean view in the morning.
There are too many fees, on top of paying for room we paid extra $60 Tax and parking. Rooms are going down hill needs carpet etc....

Our experience at The Hilton Dayton Beach Resort was AMAZING!,,it FAR exceeded our expectations! The front desk staff was on POINT! (Miss Jereake at check-in was AMAZING!..and Miss Amanda at check-out was great). Our room was spectacular. The pictures on the website do NOT do these rooms justice!  We had an ocean-view double queen and it was perfect!. Clean, updated, well designed, had all that we needed while staying.  The bathroom had a little separate powder-room which was perfect for me to get ready while HE showered. The mini-fridge was perfect for our snacks and pop and what-not.(pictures below) The hotel itself was breath-taking when we walked in. The reviews often claim the self-parking-lot is far,,,but it was NOT! It's a half-a-block from the south-tower-entrance. IT WAS FINE!!. the restaurants were awesome with great staff (the only point of contention was the cup of ice water given at the whisky bar. it tasted like FL.tap water and though I only had one sip and ONE alcoholic cocktail I was VERY ILL about an hr after getting back to the room. stick to drinking bottled water ANYWHERE in FL,. if its in a cup or glass, pass..but not Hilton's fault!). The Hyde Park restaurant was SO AMAZING!. and at check out there were SEVERAL charges not made by us and it was a very simple and quick fix for them to check that days receipts and adjust (seems as if the SAME gentleman wrote the wrong room number on his receipts; maybe he didn't know his room number, a mistake, maybe one too many cocktails,,either way the manager Miss Maria took care of it swiftly.) The pool was perfect...not to busy and big enough for everyone there. The pool-deck was amazing and had a great selection of chairs and beds to lay on and the towels were clean and SOFT,,not all crispy and old-feeling. We usually go to our FL home on the Gulf-coast in Punta Gorda but were visiting Daytona for a family wedding and we were worried about staying at a hotel but the Hilton made all our worried melt away in the sun.  We could not have had a better stay and we WILL BE going back,,hopefully soon, May Christmas on the beach this year (better than a Chicago Christmas in my opinion)
Fantastic location, rooms were very worn.  Had to wait a hour and half to get checked in. Everything else was good.
Quick check-in and friendly staff. The views are amazing and the restaurants are delicious. We loved the Rum Room, the band and drinks were great. We'll be back soon.

The look is nice driving in is a little awkward and small area, you end up lined up out into the street, they need better organization with the valet crew. Also, not explained right a way that self parking is a little jaunt down across the street in or by the public beach parking.

Young lady that checked Me in was not very thorough with information, she was offered help but she declined, in which resulted in mistakes and misunderstandings.

I called down when it wasn't busy for an extra blanket that never was received.

The housekeeper for where my room was wasn't very good. Prior trash from last guest was left under the desk. Along with their hair in the tub and around the toilet. Kinda not a very clean feel.

Breakfast time, meh was not the greatest experience, I ordered simple off the menu, 2 eggs OM, white toast, avocado slices and hot tea. Took kinda forever and it hadn't gotten busy just yet. The Boys had the breakfast bar didn't care for it thought the food to be less desirable and of cheap quality. Also, the waitress seems to skimp on the change returned. My Son (13), was picking up the tab as a treat so it was important to Him to get all His change. I can see maybe missing 1 or 2 cents but she kinda jipped Him of 9 centsü§¶üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è kinda worse than Chipotle rounding up and keeping your change.

Best part...

Boys thoroughly enjoyed the swimming pool, hot tub and easy access to the Beach.

Evening Seafood buffet was delicious, I didn't need to order the crab legs. I had sufficient amount of succulent Lobster and Shrimp.

The bell hop guys was extremely helpful and nice. Conversated with my Boys as buddies made them feel comfortable. When checking out during the wee hours mine was super helpful and nice, even packed the truck for Me while woke and grabbed the Boys for our departure, gave Him a great tip.

My son and I had a great time. The staff was courteous, the room, wallway, pool areas etc. , were clean, and everything was on point. We did use valet because the public parking is too far and hectic. Hilton Daytona beach is a great place to stay with your family!

These place is amazing. Staff is awesome and the view is unbelievable. If you're gonna go to a bar here I 100% recommend the bar on the beach. The bartender Brad is funny, knowledgeable, polite and most importantly fast at his job. Just because of his service this is the hotel I will be using everytime I go to Daytona. Brad should definitely get a raise or promotion, what a good young man he is.

I usually avoid these corporate giant hotel chains, but with COVID-19 they were one of the only ocean views still open in April, so my lady & I reserved a standard King Bed ocean view. Came to $125 with my FL Resident discount. They did waive the outrageous $25 per day resort fee since no amenities were available, but still charge the daily parking fee. These extra charges are why I avoid such places & stick to quiet low-key motels, but they are closed currently due to no travelers because of COVID-19. Fortunately no crowds at least. Hotel is dated, tho our room was clean. They should have the pool open since FL leaves that decision to the owner, there is no "shut down the pools" order by the state or county. With 4 or 5 guests in the whole hotel and being that chlorine kills viruses, it would have been nice to use the pool. When I reserved the room on the phone they tried to upsell me on "Vacation Ownership" too which I of course turned down, being that I already hated having to pay $100 in parking fees for a 2 day stay (2 vehicles)  They get 3 stars because the room was clean, view was good, no tourists to ruin the chill quiet I wanted & the front desk lady was nice.

I was there with my Church organization United Pentecostal Church International üôå Our Annual  Holiday Youth Convention Hallelujah thank you Jesus ‚ù§
Would have given a better review, if the older valet guy with the mustache would not have said "I'AM SO GLAD THESE CHURCH PEOPLE ARE LEAVING".

Well guy have you thought that these 1500 Church people just made sure you had a JOB for the past 3 days ü§î

Very clean place, right in front of ocean, decent family place.
Few points to note
1. There is paid/ valet parking on premise.
2. Self Parking is paid but is opposite to the premise beside a barbecue place. They might not charge you for self parking make sure you speak with them on that point.
3. Breakfast is Paid but available
4. Clean your sand in shower area located near hot tub area downstairs
5. Kids have a pool and play area on 5th floor.
6. We were playing with our kids in the pool area downstairs and a guest felt annoyed and suggested us to take them upstairs. Well there is no restriction like that , there will always be people like that around.
7. Staff were all friendly and nice
8. Towels are available for guests in pool area.
9.People walk on streets at all times , some of them were drinking too.
10. Walk early morning to Pier near to it . It's cooler in mornings if you plan to hit the ocean.
11. Not all ocean rooms have open Balcony. But still it's a beautiful view, unless you are planning to open windows and sit there, Ocean view rooms are Pricy than normal ones. Save some bucks if you are planning to spend a long time outside.

The staff at the Hilton Daytona Beach Resort is exceptional, therefore you should expect to tip well for great service. The room was clean and of normal size for a hotel room. We had an oceanfront room with a view to die for, right in front of the clock tower (Room # 517). The pool at the south tower offered a shaded area and towels were continuity available. The hot tub is slightly hidden and temperature was always perfect. I'd certainly consider staying here again.

As far as cons... There was almost no water pressure in our room. We even went as far as removing the shower head but that only left a single stream of trickling water. We specifically booked an oceanfront room with a balcony, as it was advertised/described, but were extremely disappointed in what they called a balcony. My 4 year old barely fit on the ledge with railing (aka balcony); fully grown adults can stand in the sliding glass door to enjoy the view. See pics attached for "balcony" and view. The price of parking is quite high ($24 for valet per day, whether you leave or not) plus tipping when you do require your vehicle throughout your stay. With the cost of parking plus resort fees and taxes, expect to pay an additional $40+ per day. If you require a cart for your luggage, expect to tip again as the carts only come with a bellhop (as we were told). Mixed drinks at the pool are $12 each. The pool at the north tower is rooftop with no shade, so we avoided this pool during our stay June 18-22 (too hot and too much sun).

Finally... Location... This hotel is conveniently located to many additional restaurants, the boardwalk, waterpark and more. This also meant a lot of people and noise. We tend to prefer a quieter area of the beach. We also experienced a large amount of local "beggers" on the edge of the property, near the beach entrance. They were quite rowdy and drunk making it difficult to enjoy the view from the boardwalk. Additional, outdoor seating on the Hilton property, separate from the pool and restaurants would be nice.

Overall, nice stay.

ROACHES!
This hotel looks like a Hilton from the outside and lobby but once your in your room it will feel like anything but. Rooms are run down and the South tower has a roach problem.  I had to switch hotel rooms because there were baby roaches on the desk and around the mini fridge. I didn't trust the second room so kept my Suitcases on my bed sealed shut and put open bags back in the car.
This was the worst Hilton experience and I will be writing to the corporate office.

The lobby of this hotel was very nice. Food at the rrestaurans was mediocre. The rooms are a little run down and needs some updates. There was rust on our bathroom fixtures. Also don't let the pictures of the outside of the building fool you, there are no balconies, just doors that open directly to a fence.

It‚Äôs pretty here but the room service could be improved. We left a note asking for more creamer and they threw away the note and decided not to even give us coffee this time and of course did not give us creamer either. The mirror was never cleaned in the bathroom and had a disturbing note written on it. Other than that, it‚Äôs absolutely beautiful and I have no other complaints.

Love this hotel.  Fantastic views.  Wonderful location.  Plenty of places to walk to.  Very nice pool with music playing.  Food and drinks available to order while relaxing at your lounge chair.  Very good variety of restaurants base level within hotel.  Friendly staff.  Beach view rooms are spectacular.

Lack of attention to details, cleanliness, service, and poor guest enjoyment experience. Overall my first experience here was very disappointing.  There is no valet parking, even the hotel knows about my long stay does not have at least one parking lot for guests, they seem sold to the public.  The registration process took so long, even the girl was humble, the process took a long time, it was the need to call the manager.  No explanation or welcome about the hotel and amenities.  After an hour, we have to find the parking lot across the street.  The hotel has many, many, many balconies, and my room was the only one assigned with glass, and the worst thing was it was super dirty, I couldn't enjoy the sea view.  The room was not completely cleaned.  The bathroom has intermittent lighting.  The only good thing was the hot breakfast that we paid extra.  The digital key was not working.  The pool had no control of the hotel staff, it was not known if all those people in addition to filling the pool if they were unregistered people from the hotel.  The gate and access to the pool without security or control.  I do not think I will stay in this hotel again even though it has a good location and view. The hotel management send me an email, I think for protocols, but still having no response back from them. Also, I did not received my hilton honors points, system error.

Just checked in, but so far a 1 star, first time I have ever stayed at a hotel without having guest parking.  I was told to unload my car,  and the guy pointed and said there maybe parking at the lot over there. I search for parking and parked about a quarter mile away.  Unless a miracle happens,  I will never stay here again.

I see I have a reply: from the hotel.  I think you all should know I checked out a day early. And will never stay at this hotel again.

The below picture is what I had to walk through to get to my car.

Had a wonderful stay here. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable, view was beautiful, staff was very friendly and ready to help you with anything you need.  Pools were under renovations but it's winter so I wasn't planning on using them. The beach was clean and clear and awesome for relaxing in the sun. Incredible buffets available for breakfast and dinner.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay! Could not have asked for better service from the entire team. If you go to Doc Bales' Grill, ask for Danielle. She provides superb service and has the most pleasant personality.

Bedbug nightmare for 7nights. Room is smelly and very old. Got a bedbug bites in a room and went to reception at 7am and reception said they will check, but nothing happened and we had to spend one more night  with bed bugs. Went to reception again at 7am next day and had to argue a lot to make them actually come to our room for inspection. Even though hotel saw my bites they didn‚Äôt take it serious and told us they have to check and it turns out there are lots of bed bugs. They also didn‚Äôt treat out cloth properly and lots of cloths are ruined. Also when we moved to new room, they didn‚Äôt follow procedure and bring our suitcase to new room( it has to go to dryer before moving into new room), so we have to change our room again while our luggage went to dry.
The most disappointed part is irresponsibility of their staff. Hotel Manager told us to go to the hospital and he said he will take care of taxi, medicine, and hospital cost. When we came back from the hospital, he disappear and we haven‚Äôt got our reimburse yet. Whenever we went to reception to get reimburse hotel staff said their insurance company will reach out to me within 3-4 days but there is no single contact from insurance company after 10days.
Hotel supervisor Joe also told us that they will arrange meeting with their GM (Jim Berkley) as he is only able to make a decision on reimbursement of our medical/transportation and we scheduled the meeting at 12pm. When we arrived at appointment on time, we only hear meeting is canceled after 20mins of waiting. They said they will rearrange the meeting at 2:30pm, so we waited again but GM eventually didn‚Äôt appear and we had to spend out time just waiting their GM. This is one of the worst experience of customer support and symbol of irresponsibility of employee. Huge disappointment on their behavior and never gonna use again.

Stayed here for our honeymoon and the only reason we enjoyed it was because all we wanted to do was get away and relax. We checked it right after 4 pm. To make everything hassle free I called 3days before to prepay for everything . The morning before we checked in, I filled out 2 authorization forms for the payments. One for the total amount and one for the deposit. That was a waste of time because when we got there, there was issues with our payments. Eventually everything got resolved. But the point of making it hassle free went straight out the window.

Our room package included a celebration romance package which included sparkling wine upon Arrival and breakfast. I asked at the counter to make sure everything was set up correctly ( to have no more issues or delays) and was told that everything is ready for when we get to the room. We were on the north end so it was a good walk to the elevators but that wasn‚Äôt a big deal. We got to the room and NOTHING ! I was a bit disappointed because it‚Äôs my honeymoon and I at-least wanted to enjoy our small simple getaway. I had to call the front desk and after staying on hold I was told they were looking for someone to deliver it . They finally did and it was beautiful and they included chocolate covered strawberries. So again, atleast that was resolved.

THE ROOMS - nothing fancy about it. It literally was just a basic king bed room with an oceanfront view on the 6th floor. The bathroom was basic, with a small tv, a mini mini fridge, a chair and a computer desk. Honestly not what we expected but it had to do. No balcony but very clean. We wanted to just relax so it got the job done.

AMENITIES - didn‚Äôt explore all of them but the pool, gym and business center is quite lovely.

VALET WAS ALSO AMAZING. Be prepared to pay whether you take the valet option or the self parking option. Only about a $7 difference so might as well do the valet.

BREAKFAST WAS COMPLIMENTARY WITH THE PACKAGE WE CHOSE AND IT WAS THE GREATEST THING EVERY! The food was truly phenomenal

CHECKOUT- just as annoying and hassling as the check in. This is honestly where they lost some stars along with the constant small mistakes. Our bill had a mysterious $49 charge added on for room service that we did not order. I got to the counter and asked about this and they lady had to go through a huge stack of receipts to see why we got charged. I explained to her that she won‚Äôt find a receipt because we did not order room service. The only thing we got was the wine and strawberries which was suppose to be included in the price of the package we chose. She apologized and explained that she still had to go through every single receipt to make sure. ANNOYING . This took about 10 mins before she got to the end of the stack and said sorry we humans make mistakes. NO! How many people has left this hotel with charges they were not responsible for?? My advice is please please look over and understand your bill before leaving.

Where do I begin?!
On their website they have certain fees placed where if you aren‚Äôt looking hard you won‚Äôt see them.
$17 to park in an across the street parking lot that does not have a gate to get in or keep people out. The machine doesn‚Äôt work so you can‚Äôt even put a slip in your car to let people know you have paid.
$24 to have someone park your car for you! In a parking deck with all the security you could ask for!
$50 security fee PER NIGHT you stay.
You have to pay for WiFi here as well. Almost $10 PER DAY!
Resort fees and other ‚Äúfees‚Äù they don‚Äôt address.
$24 for breakfast.
Now do not even get me started on their rooms! NOTHING WAS CLEAN! You can slide your finger across the wall and have nothing but dust off. You can see the dust on the bedsheets and lamp shades. If you have allergies do NOT STAY HERE.
The shower handle literally fell off when trying to turn the shower on!
The toilet seat was peeling and cracked.
The carpet was pulled up at spots.
Furniture had stains and scratches on it
(I‚Äôm guess from pets since they are a pet friendly hotel)
If you want an actually balcony not a fake one of course that‚Äôs even more money!
No microwave or fridge either so don‚Äôt take those leftovers back to the hotel with you.
This is the WORST place I have ever stayed! We spent almost $500! You‚Äôd expect for $500 the WiFi would be free!
I have stayed at hotels there are $50 a night that are better than this.
NOT WORTH THE MONEY OR FRUSTRATION!

My family had an amazing time here! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and beds were cozy. Had to request for housekeeping if needed anything or room cleaned. Elevators were slow and big pool was way over crowded (but 5th floor pool was great for us) Valet parking is $30/day and well worth it, if leaving daily. Room was a bit outdated but it was clean and roomy. Overall, we loved it and will be back again!

Great location.. with motel 8 rooms!. Ocean front room with a  shoe size bathroom from the 70's,  no refrigerator, Hotel Starbucks does not accept Starbucks app transaction.  Workout room is outdated.. but the location is phenomenal.   That's why the 3 star rating.

For Daytona, this is a NICE hotel. For a Hilton, it's "tired"  looking. Staff is great, central location on the beach next to entertainment and the convention center. I didn't eat here but they had bunch of options.  The decor is dated, my bathroom needed to be redone (toilet seat cracked and discolored, tears in the shower curtains, windows dirty) Got a beach view. It's been 4 weeks after Hurricane Matthew, the city army beach are still recovering. I would still recommend staying here, it just needs a little more Hilton love

We loved this dog friendly hotel! The a/c wasn't pumping as cold as we'd like, which they blamed on the windows. Also there's no balcony, well it's like 4 inches or something, but we made do.
Besides that, the location is great, beautiful view, pleasant staff,  and obvi being dog-friendly ws a huge bonus.

I had accidentally planned to celebrate my daughter's 13th birthday the weekend of labor day. This incurred my costs of the hotel room to be much higher than normal, even though I booked it more than 2 weeks in advance. That aside, we were told there was $17 self-park or $24 valet. There was no self-park that weekend allowed at all. My older daughter arrived separate as a surprise to her sister. She valeted as well to my room. We were able to check in early at 11am.  I reserved a disabled room, as I'm disabled and unable to walk well or too far comfortably. The room we were given was the furthest room in the North Tower away from everything. Due to the fact that the hotel was completely booked, I did not complain,  however,  my original reservations were completely ignored and to do anything in this resort, it felt as if I had to walk 2 football fields to go anywhere. This feat I was incapable of. So, I spent over $200 on room service. Then there was a fiasco with not being able to find my daughter's car. The hotel worked that situation out to my satisfaction.  My original room was supposed to have a mini-fridge in it and a microwave. It had neither of these amenities.  The dinner I ordered for room service was botched,  too. I had called hours ahead to have a birthday cake added to our meal. The first trip, part of the meal was forgotten and so was the cake. Overall,  I wasn't too pleased with our stay, but glad to have time with my kids.

Hotel is nice and staff is great, but the rooms could use work.  Sliding glass doors open to the ocean, but there is no balcony.  Some rooms open up to the "carnival" which can take away from the ocean-relaxation.  The valet experience can be miserable if you're arriving/departing at high volume times (it took an hour to get to the valet from 2 blocks away due to traffic into the valet).  There are several option to eat/drink in the hotel and even more nearby.  Overall, for the options you have in Daytona, this is a good choice.

The manager was very attentive, the hotel was clean I loved the room and the hospitality. I wish they didn‚Äôt charge for my emotional support animal, it is what it is though. I‚Äôll still come back here

We are Hilton rewards members and stay at a lot of Hilton's. This one has a fabulous location and view. It is also at the end of its life cycle. The metal finishes are peeling and rusted. Wall paper is tatty. Curtains are frayed. Furniture us showing obvious signs of wear. They had Mobil blowers running outside the conference rooms to deal with the humid air. Thus tells me their HVAC system is not working at capacity either. It's time - past time to take it down and start over.

Great hotel, right on the beach. Clean rooms, friendly staff, nice mix of restaurants and close to a lot more. Wonderful views from the rooms. Comfortable bed with great pillows! Good water pressure in the showers. Can‚Äôt ask for much more than this!

Okay hotel, nothing much around to do, I rather  to stay in st augeaten next time.
Easy access to the beach.
Over priced parking; $25 for valet parking and $16 if you will do it yourself! There is couple of street parking around with meter.
Breakfast buffet is ~$23 per person, we got confused as the receptionist mentioned that the breakfast is included when we checked in, then we figured out it‚Äôs not. Sunday Branch is worth it.
Definitely to get ocean view room. However there is no balcony.

By far the worst experience I have ever had at a Hilton Bar (Don Rico‚Äôs). The female bar tender took our drinks and served them. My girlfriends was delicious and mine was a tequila, grand marnier, Oj, lime juice and soda. I got tequila and sour mix. When we looked at the ticket it was a different drink rang up. Ok no problem mistakes happen. When we told her, she said I made the right drink and just don‚Äôt have the button. Then we realized the drink she rang up was more expensive. I‚Äôm not worried about money but the drink was wrong and she wants to charge more for it. We brought up that there was no oj and it was made with sour mix and she goes I was out of oj sorry with an attitude. I said well you should have told me that first and I could have picked a different drink. She snaps back and tells us to leave. We are the most understanding people and if they were busy or had a bad day then that happens but she came sideways from the start for no reason. We asked to be charged for the right drink and get treated like we are dirt.
Also, someone is smoking on the 4th floor and there‚Äôs cigarette butts in the hallway. Really?? Non smoking hotel seems to be relaxed on that.

Nice hotel right on Daytona beach but the front desk was not helpful at all
I had to pay to upgrade to an ocean front room and they gave us 2 bed instead of king room so we had to go back down to change because front desk NEVER answers the phone.
Room service food was excellent! And the view was nice.

Excellent hotel beach front property. Few things look a bit dated. Excellent staff and service. Nice rooms and ample spaces. Especially common areas, hallways had plenty of sitting area.
This is a convention hotel too so it is expected to have great common areas. Good restaurant is in place with excellent service.
Self parking for a charge and valet for a charge too. Somewhat standard at certain hotels.
Location is amazing next to a plaza with shops theaters and parking. Quick marts are 1 or 2 blocks away. Very nice walking area beach side or street side.
Nice pool and gym too. There is a steak house inside the hotel. I did not dine there but seems to be good. Starbuck on premises too.
I'll stay here again for sure.

Beautiful resort! Nice rooms and great amenities! Right on the beach and right on the boardwalk, what else could you need? Oh yeah, 2 pools, jacuzzi, fitness center, any type of food you could want right in the hotel! Definitely another visit is in order!

A group of 8 of us girls went to the wine tasting in the Rum Room. The wine was fantastic and the food pairings prepared by Chef Scott were amazing!  Jim, the manager, and all of the staff were very attentive! What a fun night! We will be back!

Tops as far as getting a clean place to stay with the best view. You will easily spend more on food alone than for the room. For my taste I expected a little more modern room. The odd pastel yellow & brown wall paper seemed kinda 70s to me. We booked an Oceanfront room with a balcony, however the so called balcony is just 6 inches from sliding glass door to railing. But other than decor, it was just like any other bargain hotel as far as mattress and furniture. I kinda expected more from Hilton. Very little water pressure in the shower head. The 5th floor roof top pool is really small and during the day is an oven due to high walls surrounding it blocking any expected rooftop breeze. The D-Dawgs kids area was very cool for the kids providing foozeball table, air hockey table, board games, video games, and the giant Connect Four game. There are also crafts the kids can build & decorate for a couple dollars each. The main pool is where most people hang out. There is a lot of seating and tables. Pool towels are provided and constantly being resupplied. There is a hot tub tucked away in a semi private corner. During my stay it seemed to be where teens were sneaking away to. Every single staff member I came in to contact with were really friendly and helpful. Service was definitely what I expected with a name like Hilton. The location was absolutely beautiful with an incredible view. At night the location had its shortcomings though. There is so much noise coming from the public boardwalk from beggars, street evangelists, and unsupervised kids digging coins out of the fountain.
We stay here every year, love it. They have some funky shower setup though. If you're taller than 4'10", you'll need to relocate the shower handle like I did in the pic shown here. You're welcomeüòÑ
What an amazing view of the ocean.  Love this place  and the room rate is affordable offering inhouse dining, pool and much more.  2 minutes from my room to the ocean was my favorite.

Honestly the best place to stay when in Daytona Beach. We come here once a year for the FCC Color Guard Competitions and it never disappoints. The location, the staff, the building, the rooms; everything is always pleasant.

Stayed four AWESOME nights. BEAUTIFUL sunrises, AWESOME - TERRIFIC - MOST HOSPITABLE staff we've ever encountered.  Valet was on it, Check-in was a breeze, janitorial service was awesome, kids play area had plenty of great stuff. Wonderful sunrise and moonrise.

Great location in reference to the event I was attending. Right across the street from the convention center. I stayed in the cabana rooms, which although I couldn't adjust the temperature to save my life, was a beautiful place to wake up. The soft ocean breeze, and wave sounds were a delight, as well as sitting in front of the room and hearing the sounds of Fleetwood Mac playing a concert at the adjoined amphitheater.  The staff was extremely friendly in every area, front desk, valet, pool attendant, spa, and the bartender, Leah at McCoy's Rum makes an awesome Painkiller and Coconut Mojito.

Nice big Oceanfront rooms with an awesome view. 2 pools, hot tubs, a bar, starbucks, all kinds of little shops to check out. I liked staying here alot ~ super cool staff. While checking out I let them know the coffee maker stopped working halfway through the first cup & they gave me a free coffee card to their on-site starbucks. My husband and I stayed for bar hopping. The unique shape of the building made it easy to find our way back to our room.

Went with the family after American Airlines ruined our trip to Columbia- the Hilton made up for it- with kindness and service- it‚Äôs a one stop shop resort- walking distance to the beach- like 39 feet walking distance- we will be back

We loved pur stay here. Its right on the beach, so if you can please take room with a view.
We used our AAA card while booking, and there wasone offer going on about free 1 hour cycle rental, we enjoyed a lot our free beach cycling

We like the receptionist positive attitude namely Tiffany and Jerusha and we appreciate their willingness to work with us during special circumstances. We got a suite room and overlooking ocean views. We will probably come back next time.

Let's start from the beginning. For parking I would suggest parking yourself instead of Valet, since it isnt that far. (Literally across the street) Reception was wonderful. They check you in and inform you of the luxuries and incentives, and give you your key card for your room. This keycard is needed for the elevator AND your room. It might seem cumbersome but it is for your safety and security. Also since you can't go any higher than your keycard allows, you dont have to worry about others idlly loitering on floor they do not belong. Room service was wonderful. None of my items were stolen, not even cash. I should also mention the floor through out the room levels of thw hotel, it is extremely soft, almost as if you were walking on pillows. Now, to the showers. There is no tub, which is nice for sanitation purposes, and it has two heads, with there own individual knobs. One is a handheld and the other is mounted. There was also a patio door, tv and nice soft bed, freshly as much as you please. The hotel it self has much to offer. Fedex, starbuck, breakfast lunch and dinner. For business personnel it even has mac and windows computers available for hotel guest use. They also has an extravagant restaurant inside call "Hyde Park Prime Steakhouse". They waiters and waitresses are taught proper etiquette and it is magnificent. It may seem pricy but it is well worth it. They have a wide selection of wine, liquor and beer, whatever you please. Also, food from filet mignon to a regular burger, which I was told is amazing. I purchased the Salmon Caesar with a carribean cocktail. The salmon couldn't have been any better, as well as for the salad. They were both made just right. It was amazing. The food the hotel, and the view and access to the beach was nice. One thing I will warn you about for the beach is TO BRING YOUR OWN CHAIRS! The beach chairs that are there already are for rentals only, and they will wait until you look comfortable to ask you if you want to rent it. If you say no, you have to get up, and they take away the chair.
It‚Äôs was very nice to wake up and have such an amazing view, get dress and go out to enjoy the warm and beautiful beach, also the pool and jacuzzi of hotel were great!

Awesome, awesome experience. My only regret was booking through Priceline. I will never make that mistake again. Priceline falsely advertised and led me to select a room that was much different from the one they actually gave me. After speaking to Priceline for 4 hours to no avail, I called Hilton directly and the lady that I spoke to, Brooke, honored my selection within minutes!!! When I arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with a team of friendly and courteous staff members who were willing to help every step of the way. As soon as we got up to the room we received a call from the hotel staff asking us if the room was up to our standards, which it definitely was! Thank you so much Hilton staff for making my stay so wonderful! Because of you, I will definitely be back!

What a let down. This place is a super run down property and has hardly any staff. One restaurant, one bar open. Still charge you a ‚Äúresort‚Äù fee. I‚Äôve yet to find this to be a resort. 30 minutes for check in, long wait for valet, bar drinks, food. The surrounding area is run down as well. Definitely not what I expected from Hilton. We stay with Hilton often and are Diamond Members. I‚Äôm surprised they maintain a 4 star status on here. I came for 2 nights with my husband and grandparents. So many children that the pool was not enjoyable to relax and the water was cloudy.
We always love this hotel. The views can‚Äôt be beat and the staff is always friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed the pool and the food and drinks from the thirsty turtle. Very relaxing stay.

Not only was the Hilton Daytona Beach beautiful, it was also comfortable. Located right on the boardwalk on the beach, it's in proximity to Joe's Crab Shack and many other activities.
The bar was recently redone.  There were many restaurants to accommodate almost any budget.  There is a high end steak house, an American grill, and a Mexican restaurant.  We ate at the Mexican restaurant and it was fantastic!
There is also a market like at a Grand Vacation place with sandwiches and coffee.  There is a kids area on fifth floor of the north tower with games and a person to monitor them.
There is an outdoor pool near the kids area.  There is another pool and hot tub on the ground floor.  We will definitely go back.

Nice hotel. Little pricey depending on the time of year. Good food and drinks In the hotel and plenty more within walking distance. Right on the beach. About five miles from the speedway. Easy to catch a taxi or use mass transit. Hit the Ocean Deck and Bubba Gumps!
Love this place..view was amazing! Rooms could use some upgrades but service was great. It was an all around great place to stay. We Will be back!

Very old but we had a view of the pool on. 5th floor and the view of the Ocean awesome!!! And the bathroom were even dirty! We changed room for 8th floor to the 9th much cleaner! Better  view lol! Now the place to go for breakfast is in the hilton  21.00 each it is a buffet have alot of fun

I LOVE THIS HOTEL. The staff is super friendly bell boy Mike is our favorite he remembers us every year is friendly with the kids! My kids always look for mike when we get there!
P.S. only part I dont like is 3rd floor its horrible out dated etc. Everthing else is fantastic!
Here to celebrate an anniversary. They comp'd our buffet breakfast, saving us $40/day. They also give you a $5 or $10 off for dinner.  Our room faced the ocean.   And the staff was more than helpful.

The hotel was under construction when we stayed. It made things a little annoying. We didn't get the room that we originally reserved but we did get a room with a beautiful ocean view. Also, if you have young kids and aren't prepared to see young women in thong bikinis walking around the hotel, this isn't the place for you.

Covid getaway ?...NOT HERE...7 bars & restaurants... only one open very expensive steakhouse for dinner...grab and go breakfast sandwich...snotty staff except for Hisa...truly one of the worst Hiltons ever been to... stay home

Martin is awesome!!!!  He was nice and brought up my luggage and offered to go down to the market to get me a soda and Benadryl because I started feeling bad...they left feathers in my room but he immediately and sincerely came to the rescue. That is five star!!! Thank you!!
I recommend this young man.

One of the worst hotels i have ever stayed at. Not only was our room dirty and i mean dusty and dirty. Our other room we got for the kids that was next to ours has a rusty nail sticking out of the carpet which my son stepped on and went thru his foot, there is dried blood on our bathroom wall above mirror and beside it, our bed was broken in the middle and i have to admit one of the worst night sleeps of my life, roaches in both bathrooms, the toilet sounds like its going to explode when you flush it, and then i wake up to my card being charged an additional $120 when i go up to front desk the supervisor first tells me the extra charges are for valet and taxes, when i inform him i did not use valet that i did self parking for $20 he then changes it to oh it was for the resort fee and taxes so i pull up my receipt for my reservation to show the resort fee and taxes were already included in my booking. Now there are no explanations to why my card has been charged so much. Make matters worse while upfront at the desk another couple comes to speak to manager for finding drugs and needle in their room and had pictures of what they found. Honestly so disappointing for staying at the Hilton and not worth the money spent.
Expensive but worth every penny‚Ä¶
My little sister just got married there this past weekend and it was beautiful. The rooms were big and amazing. Everything was so wonderful!!
Great Hotel , Very Clean , The Staff was super Nice , FRONT DESK JOREKA  AND ERRONE WAS VERY PROFESSIONAL AND THEY WENT FAR AND BEYOND WITH US üëå THANKS GUYS FOR EVERYTHING!!!
We had a wonderdul stay in this hotel with my husband. The oceanfront view is spectacular.  We also had a great experience with the buffet breakfast. Awesome service! We will definitely come back.

We really enjoyed our stay what a wonderful view of the ocean and activities below our room.
I used to road race years ago so it as a nice surprise to find the Daytona walk of fame out near the beach.
The location on the beach is perfect. They have made improvements since we visited last year. The Cabana on the first floor is super awesome but the rooms not very clean.

Rooms are a bit outdated, especially for the price.  Had to change rooms twice due to maintenance issues. Biggest problem I had was that the rooms are not equipped with a fridge or microwave. The view from the room was nice as was the location of the hotel.

The hotel was great! The only issue we had with it was the room we got didn‚Äôt have a mini fridge üòï but the location was awesome - right in the middle of the boardwalk about 5 minutes away from all the bars
Nice hotel good view of the ocean that's about all I can say is good no  Microwave in the room The fridge was small And they charge 4 days to park and I was just there 2 days
Great hotel! Staff are very polite and accommodating. Beds are comfortable. Clean rooms. Get a balcony room.. The view is amazing.

Hilton Daytona is oceanfront and on the boardwalk.  Great place to take the family.  There are a few pools and they supply you with beach towels.  It is centrally located with shopping, dining and casinos within steps of the entrance.  There is also the boardwalk rides next to the resort.  If you don't like noise make sure you request a room on the opposite side!  Rooms are clean and maintained daily for an extra fee.  You can ride bikes along the beach ...they have rentals, eat at Joe's Crabshack, jetski and partake in many other activities.

The best hotel to stay at in Daytona hands down. Good pricing for the best stay. It is right near the historical part of Daytona Beach which includes the clock tower and amplitheatre. They have a Starbucks inside of the hotel (although it is crazy over-priced compared to normal Starbucks pricing). They host many interesting events there, such as conferences. If you are looking to make a trip to Daytona Beach stay here.
This was the BEST hotel I've ever stayed in. Very pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for!! Oceanfront, pool and boardwalk view was amazing!!!
Staff members looked happy to be there and were very polite and professional. We loved the ocean front and the beautiful sunrises were a big plus. The room was priced right.
I felt like a princess. The room was nice, the staff was very nice, especially the ballet in concierge. Beautiful place to stay.
Location, Location, Location! Busy hotel, but very friendly staff does their best. We enjoyed breakfast and of course, the beach was a favorite!!!
Brunch with family very tasty. One suggestion - omelet station needs to be rearranged.....you have to get out of line to choose ingredients. On a Sunday it would be helpful to have more staff.
Oh yes.... I have fell in love with this beach .....Florida is a just a great time any day or night....beautiful beaches and great people...
Really good BBQ baby ribs... I had the half rack and regretted that didn't ask for the full rack. The coleslaw salad was good good, and crunchy fries. Nice staff and clean restaurant. Good prices
Wonderful place to stay. Little older hilton but didn't spend much time in the room. Perfect spot as it's close to main street within waking distance.
My visit was awesome, the beachfront view was beautiful, I loved it, I would highly recommend,  the staff were pleasant as well

This is one of the best hotels in Daytona by far. In fact the only two places that I will stay at the Hilton or at the Shores hotel. One of the things that makes the Hilton so nice is that they have recently renovated the property and it has a clean and beachy feel as old as you walk in. Ciara at the front desk if super awesome and friendly. One of the best things about the hotel is the location. It is located right next to the boardwalk so you can walk over and play video games and do a little budget shopping as well and go to the movie or go get ice cream. There are also several different vendors doors as well as a movie theater. Joe‚Äôs crabshack as well as bubblegum are both walking distance in addition to marble ice cream company. The hotel also have a Starbucks inside as well as a nice steakhouse called Hyde Park which is fancy and serves premium steaks,chops and cocktails. There is also another restaurant on site that serves breakfast lunch and dinner. It‚Äôs nice that once you park your car you don‚Äôt have to take it out until you‚Äôre ready to leave the hotel. The bellman staff here is also extremely friendly.

Would you like a side of dirty diaper with your Covid? Just some of the many reasons I will no longer stay at a Hilton.

1. When we checked in and got into our hotel room there were two diapers on the floor. One was used and the other was not. The pic shows the unused one. I found the used one behind the curtain. So much for Hilton and their 9 page write up on their commitment to cleanliness.

2. Half the people in the lobby and throughout the hotel were mask-less even though there is a mandatory requirement for the hotel. No enforcement at all, especially for the elevator where we were sharing with people who were blatantly disregarding the rules. We ended up using the stairs.

3. Speaking of the stairs. It seemed to be the place to go to smoke pot. I don't really care that people do this but I wondered if my son was getting a contact buzz as we walked up and down. Still better than covid.

4. In the middle of the night a domestic violence situation blew up so badly i almost called the cops. A man and woman were screaming f bombs at each other and banging on the walls and doors after locking each other out. My son asked if we were safe...

In the end, I expect these sort of things at motels. I have stayed in my fair share of them growing up. I don't expect this from a Hilton and it was too much to ever trust them again. Their word doesn't mean much anymore.
Nice Ocean front property. Beautiful views of Daytona Beach and Atlantic Ocean. Difficult to find parking, good luck. Lots of walking to restrooms. Wish you would visit Daytona Beach.
Everything was good, excellent steakhouse! Tip: if you want a quiet room ask for North side of hotel. And if you get an end room there's a huge private patio for your room!

This is a really nice hotel. Right on the beach and next tothe Daytona Boardwalk. Very nice beds and very clean rooms. Wonderful veiws! Staff was very helpful and friendly! Would definitely stay here again.

Pretty good service. Slow at our room being ready. View was not what I expected for ocean front view still nice. Kid friendly.the carnival next door needs a all new updated new look and rides. Love the free concert and fireworks. Rooms need a little better scrubbing in the shower. Over all was happy. Love the joining room's.
Not quite as premium as expected, the quality of the items I side the room was so so, lose shower handles and things like that, however great service and killer views. Walls paper thin.

The Hilton in Daytona Beach is one of my favorite places to stay!  The room views are of the ocean waves and the pier.  Sunrise creates the opportunity for some of the best photos out of all the Florida beaches. Multiple times per year we visit this hotel for the volleyball tournaments run by JVC tournaments.

The views were great and it's nice being close to the beach...but our sink clogged and they came to fix it and left this mess, and it still wasn't fixed after 2 hours. I often stay at Hilton (I'm a diamond member) and will not be staying here again

Greatest experience of total relaxation I needed me time after my father passed so my good friend invited me while she attended a conference.  I woke at the beach and slept at the beach, loved the food and bar.  When the air didn't work maintenance came asap #lovelovelove
Need some updates in the rooms due to age but they are still nice, clean and a perfect location.

The hotel is below average not as clean.
******There‚Äôs no patio****
and they put the thermostat below the AC so it doesn‚Äôt work the whole time.
Fridge is old and small and the TV from the 90s.
Room was too small and they charge you $20 for barking however they charge public cars for $15. They charge $30 for valet.
Nobody‚Äôs wearing a mask in the middle of COVID. I can‚Äôt believe I paid $300/night for this.
Great resort, right on the beach. Had an oceanside view room, friendly helpful staff, decent restaurant options even with COVID-19 going on. Would come back.
The room was nice and clean staff were extremely nice and helpful. The view was amazing  but the AC didn't blow hard enough to cool the room off

Great stay. The hotel staff was friendly. Its a shame the bar wasn't open because of COVID.
Loved the view though.
Great hosts! Great rooms and ocean front views! Breakfast and the cooks and servers were amazing! Absolutely loved it.

It‚Äôs all about the location! Just passed the intersection of International Speedway directly on the beach. Has several onsite restaurants, one serves the complimentary breakfast. 1 Br King Oceanview room shown.
We could heard ocean sound to sleep and see the view all day. The only downside is that wait too long for elevators. Either pack or out of service.
I love this place,  it's the only place I'll stay when in Daytona Beach.
The room doors to the sweets would not close but overall it was a really good stay

The daytona breeders expo was awsome. Really there are no words that can explaine how amazing it was to be able to attend this expo will deffentily be coming back. We got some wounderful and amazing reptiles. Some that ive always wanted.

Rooms are good
Location excellent
Service excellent

Management of all the on site amenities gets a thumbs down üëé

They had to close most places early, not open up at all or open at minimal capacity due to what we were told was lack of staffing
Wednesday they had to close the pool bar at 2pm to give that bartender a brake to open up the indoor grill that he also had to bartend at

Seemed poorly organized and resulted in unhappy guests and tons of lost revenue
Beautiful hotel, perfect location and delicious food. The only complaint that i have is that the bed was uncomfortable, my husband and i woke up with back pain.

Stayed for 4 nights  and loved every minute.
Room was cleaned every day. Beautiful view of ocean  with a foot wide balcony.
Food was great and the Bales Grill and the  entertainment at the Rum room was pretty dang good. Had my old a$$ up and dancing all night. Well up to 11. lol

Booked an Oceanview room and got a Poolview...not happy, as the Oceanview has a higher cost.

And how are you going to earn my confidence back?

I attached 3 pictures below. One is not like the others, can you guess which? I‚Äôll give ya a hint, it‚Äôs the room I reserved, but didn‚Äôt get.
Love this hotel. Always excellent service. These pics were outside our widow. What a view. Pleasant stay!
I had a great time in the hotel very beautiful, clean,good food and friendly staff.

Couldnt give a no star!  Over priced, dirty, no refrigerator or microwave,  arrogant counter people, bellmen were the friendliest of the staff.  Pay to park in an unsecure parking lot, valets are rude.  Never again!
We enjoyed our stay very much.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  Variety of restaurants and of course right on the beach.
Nice property fronting Daytona beach.  Good COVID 19 protocols.  They could use all available elevators but otherwise it's good.

I usually don't stay at Hilton because of my loyalty rewards with Marriott and Ritz-Carlton. My date was staying here so I joined her after Daytona 500 racing.. actually I think she's a little better looking than Paris Hilton about the same age toü§£
Great location and the room was good but didn't have a balcony you could set on just the view from your room
Clean & comfortable! Great view!  Excellent customer service! Had a awesome time!  Would recommend highly!
Best location in daytona beach, within walking distance  to pier and main street as well as eateries on the strip.

Their outside bar is so amazeingggg . I was out their on the deck every morning getting one of their smoothies and just chilling on the side of the beach watching the waves go by getting a nice tan ü§§ü§§ it was so amazing and I would love to go back their again my experience was above expectations for this hotel ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è so good .
Bad hotel for the brand  and is old and dirty i pay almost 700 for 2 nights not good the addres is  100 North Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118, United States
We had great ocean views from the 11th floor, clean & tidy rooms, Don Ricos restaurant inside the hotel was delicious üí™üí™
Enjoyed our stay right on the beach!  My only downside was no microwave in the room.

Pros: Close to the beach

Cons: The rooms are definitely dated and not very well cleaned. The surrounding area is sketchy at best. Self parking is pricey and a bit far.

It's one of the better hotels with clean rooms in great security in a always know when I go to the parking lot I will find my motorcycle there because there is no crime here in this hotel due to the high security

So you pay 17.00 a day to park your own vehicle..then you gotta carry your luggage across the street to hotel and the room was not great for the rate we paid...only good thing is that it was near Bubba Gump Shrimp Restaurant
Great hotel on beach. Rooms are a little dated with older tvs, but who is spending their time watching TV anyway?

Rust on the inside of the microwave door rest on the fire sprinklers rust on the door hinges rust on the light fixtures furniture that was falling apart drawers that would not close absolutely needs a total redo I would never stay again never ever it doesn't even deserve one star
I am now Hilton loyal. Just signed up for the honors points. I‚Äôve never had a bad stay at a Hilton. They know luxury and comfort!!
Centrally located, close to everything. Pool. Free off site parking. Lots of amenities. Could use some updating.
Nice hotel on the beachfront. Gentle staff, rooms are good, service is good. Breakfast is not included, and costs around $23
Killer view of the beach. Very nice staff from the concierge to the front desk and the waitresses.  Clean, comfortable room with very appealing decor.
Our experience was almost 5 star. The traffic pattern on front of the hotel makes it difficult to travel to and from from the hotel easily.
Little bit old but overall good. valet parking was very helpful
Great customer service from Taylor, the front desk at check in who went above and beyond to ensure we were comfortable  to our valet who gave us travel advice for our school tour in the morning.
The rooms are clean, the staff is great, and you can't beat being right on the beach!
The hotel itself is a little bit outdated, but the rooms is still spacious and clean, front desk staff are welcoming and helpful.
Very, very expensive hotel, nickel and dime you to death, check your bill. Great amenities, gift store is ridiculously expensive
Great place to stay! Beautiful views, great staff, excellent pool bar! They participate in Day Use as well! Love it!
Prefect spot for a long or short stay. Prefect location to all the Daytona fun! Dog friendly too.
This is the best of the best _this is the best Time in my life... Beautiful beach beautiful view from the hotel cost a little bit more but is what they get the Oceanview
Awesome weekend, beautiful hotel, center of everything, great staff. Very clean and inviting.
It was wonderful.  They take care in cleaning rooms, your needs.... Valet Parking..... YALL ROCK!!!

Pretty nice place got a great deal off priceline or hotwite lighting deals room was small with no microwave or kitchenette but room was very clean pretty nice view but beware almost all of Daytona Beach you must pay for parking plan on spending about twenty dollars a day for parking especially at this hotel there are cheaper options but it's not much cheaper and you must walk further....
Great hotel with easy beach access. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfy.
The hotel has everything, great location and views, the hotel looks top notch in the common spaces but the rooms in North Tower could use a refresh to match the rest of the hotel
This is my go to place to stay at anytime I‚Äôm in Daytona beach. The resort is located on the beach and is close to multiple restaurants and shops. I would definitely recommend staying here.
Totally amazing one of the best places I had the luxury of staying check out the view check out my pictures it was on the ocean it is a must-see and it is very economically book online
Amazing view and ambiance. Great hot tub.

We had a wonderful time with our Hilton Honors!!
Super comfortable mattress, beautiful view, friendly, helpful staff. Minus 1 star for $20 self parking
Very nice hotel, great staff !! Rooms were very clean and comfortable and the view of beach is outstanding!
Had a fantastic time with our family. We stayed during the color guard FCC State Competitions, best decision we made!
City light views were great out balcony door...only wished it was an actual walk out balcony instead of door that was like a window with a rail.
Beautiful Hotel all you would expect from a Hilton perfect for our 25th anniversary second honeymoon loved it and the staff was awesome as well
Fantastic views from the 16th floor. Great environment and relaxation. Will visit again.
Nice hotel, i loved it. On the better side of town. Walking distance from some good restaurants.
Really nice hotel. In a great location on Daytona beach right by the main pier. Nice restaurants and great staff.
My husband and I went to this hotel for 11th anniversary. They had great views but unhelpful staff.
Location, location! Great hotel to enjoy the beach with lots of food options.
It's good but not like hiliton in Orlando or Miami but good so far like any local hotel nothing special
The hotel is past its prime, and not well-maintained enough to cover for it. That said, it is well-located on the beach and provides ocean views and beach access.
Beautiful hotel. Wonderful accommodation, centered perfectly between the beach and shopping, restaurants, night life and everything in between.
Friendly staff...rooms were nice, although could use some updating. Can't beat the view!
I enjoyed the sound of the waves with the balcony doors open and was amazed by the beautiful sunrise coating the sky with outstanding colors!
When your daughter thinks she runs into a princess. ..that was priceless. .thanks for the pic this lady let me take to make her day..
Great room, comfy bedding, location, location. Our room completely updated, great size, reasonable prices.
Nice ocean front resort!
Amazing place , clean, good customer service .
Love this place, in the heart of Daytona Beach. Very clean, up to date, friendly staff.
Overall a very nice Hilton property. The location is excellent for everything.
It's the Hilton Daytona Beach w/ Ocean Front need I say more... Nice place to unwind and meditate.
Great views and comfortable  rooms. üëè
My family and I had a wonderful time. So family friendly.  I highly recommend to stay here.
People were very kind, even with us locals. Room was SUPERIOR.
ALWAYS a beautiful stay! Our favorite place while in Daytona Beach!
Great location. Helpful and friendly staff. Clean rooms with some great views
Only wish I could have been there longer. We really enjoyed it and the Hilton was on point
Amazing ocean front hotel. Very clean, very nice staff. The views are amazing
Love the location,  good food ellexcent service friendly staff.   Loved my view of the ocean front from my window.
Doc Bales all u can eat Seafood & Prime Rib. Thank u for bringing back our favorite, all u can eat crab legsüíï

We had a wonderful time, hope to be back soon!

Celebrating David Stewart birthday üéÇüéâ
Little late with the room being cleaned but overall very nice hotel on the ocean.
What a great place to spend the day a weekend or forever. We love it here.
It was a great time.  It was clean and everyone was so friendly and helpful!
The city view is not impressive. Great location, close to boardwalk, ocean center, and restaurant/ shopping area.
Very convenient, great staff that was very helpful....has valet parking
Great service and beautiful view . Rooms are almost ready for a update.
Always a great place to watch new year's eve fireworks off of the pier right from your room.
Oceanfront view is the only way to go. I would have given a five if the room had a fridge.
Great hotel! Very nice staff, lovely hotel with plenty to do
Very enjoyable brunch. Staff exceptional and always smiling.  I will be back.
Full service...room was great. We had ocean view
Best brunch in town. Excellent service and the food was fresh and delicious.
Beautiful view and very centric from restaurants and the city. Very relaxing and refreshing look.
